¶ prohemye grete thankynges lawde honoure merytoryously ben bounde yelde offre vnto wryters hystoryes whiche gretely haue prouffyted oure mortal lyf shewe vnto reders herers ensamples thynges passyd thynge desyred eschewed thynges whiche oure progenytours taste bytternes experyment grete ieopardyes haue enseygned admonested enformed v excluded fro suche peryllys knowe prouffytable oure lyf acceptable vnprouffytable refused euer hath ben reputed wysest whiche experyence aduerse fortune hath byholden seen noble cytees maners variaūt condycions people many dyuerse regyons hym presupposed lore wysedome polycye experyment ieopardyes peryllys whiche haue growen folye dyuerse partyes contrayes yet fortunat may reputed wyse yf gyue attendaunce withoute tastynge stormes aduersyte may redyng historyes conteynyng dyuerse customes condycyons lawes actes sondry nacions come vnto knowleche vnderstandynge wysedom polycye whiche hystoryes wreton large aourned volume syttynge chambre studye maye rede knowe vnderstande polytyke noble actes alle worlde one cyte conflyctes errours trouble vexacions done sayd vnyuersal worlde suche wyse ben seen propre place done certayne greete beneurte vnto man reformed straunge mennes hurtes scathe knowe requysyte prouffytable lyf eschewe suche errours inconuenytys whiche men haue ben hurte lost theyr felycyte therfore coūseylles auncyent whyte heeryd men whome olde age hath engendryd wysedome ben gretely preysed yonger men yet hystoryes soo moche excelle dyuturnyte length tyme includeth moo ensamples thynges laudable actes thage one man may suffyse see ¶historyes ought iuged moost proffytable yonge men whiche lecture redyng vnderstandyng make semblable equale men greter age old men whome longe lyf hath mynystred experymentes dyuerse thynges also thystoryes able make ryght pryuate men digne worthy haue gouernaūce em • yte • • noble royammes historyes moeue withdrawe emperours kynges fro vycious tyrannye fro vecordyous slouthe vnto tryumphe vyctorye puyssaunt bataylles historyes also haue moeued ryght noble knyghtes deserue eternal laude whiche foloweth vyctoryous merytes cause valyantly entre ieopardyes batayles defence tuicion countrey publyke wele hystorye also affrayeth cruel tyrauntys drede infamye shame infynyte cause detestable actes suche cruel personnes ben oftymes plantyd regystred cronykes vnto theyr perpetuel obprobrye dyuulgacion theyr infamye thactes new suche truly many hye couragyous men grete empryse desyryng theyr fame perpetuelly conseruyd lyberal monumentis whiche ben permanente recordes euery vyrtuouse noble acte haue buylded edefyed ryall noble cytees conseruacion wele publycke haue mynystred establysshed dyscrete prouffytable lawes thus pryncipal laude cause delectable amyable thynges whiche mannes felycyte stondeth resteth ought maye wel attributed hystoryes whiche worde historye may descryued thus historye perpetuel conseruatryce thoos thynges haue doone presente tyme also cotydyan wytnesse bienfayttes malefaytes grete actes tryumphal vyctoryes maner peple also yf terryble feyned fable poetes haue moche styred moeued men pyte conseruynge iustyce moche supposed historye assertryce veryte moder alle philosophye moeuynge maners vertue reformeth reconcyleth ner hande alle thoos men whiche thurgh infyrmyte oure mortal nature hath ledde mooste parte theyr lyf ocyosyte myspended theyr tyme passed ryght soone oute remembraunce whiche lyf deth egal oblyuyon fruytes vertue ben inmortall specyally wh • nne ben wrapped benefyce hystoryes thenne muste folowe mooste fayre men mortalle suffre labour payne glorye fame inmortalle hercules whan lyued suffryd greete laboures peryllys wylfully puttyng hym self many terryble ferdful ieop • rdyes obteyne peple benefaytes inmortal laude renommee ¶ rede noble men somme lordes somme lower astates reputed goddes dyuerse regyons who famous actes excellent vertues hystorye hath preseruyd fro perysshyng eternal memorye monymentes distributed dyuerse chaunges enduren short tyme season vertu historye dyffused spr • dd vnyuersal worlde hath tyme whiche consumeth oth • r thynges conseruatryce kepar werke ferthermore eloquence soo precious noble al mooste noo thyng founden precious eloquence grekes ben preferryd contynu • l honour fore rude barbares oratours lerned clerkes like wise excelle vnl • rn • brutyssh peple syth eloquence suche causeth men emonge self somme texcelle qualyte • e vertue eloquence seyn val • w somme iuge good men digne laude whiche shewe v waye vertue haue taken another waye tenflamm • courage men fable poesye prouffy • e lawes institute punysshe teche soo thyse thynges vtylyte myxt harme somme sothly techyth lye historye representynge thynges lyke vnto wordes enbraceth al vtylyte prouff ••• sheweth honeste maketh vyces detestable enhaunce • h noble men depresseth wicked men fooles also thynges historye deseryueth experyence moche prouffyten vnto ryghtful lif thenne syth historye precious also prouffytable haue delybered wryte twoo bookes notable retenyng many noble historyes lyues myracles passyons deth dyuerse hooly sayntes whiche shal comprysed thayde suffraunce almyghty god one whiche named legenda aurea golden legende book named polycronycon whiche book ben comprised briefly many wonderful historyees fyrst descripcion vniuersal world w • l lengthe brede diuisiōs coūtrees royāmes empyres noble cytees hye moūtayns famous ryuers merueylles wondres also historial • ctes wōderful dedes syth fyrst makyng heuen erth vnto begynnyng regne kyng edward fourth vnto yere lord cccclx thayde almyghty god shal folowe al longe composynge gaderynge dan ranulph monke chestre fyrste auctour book afterward englisshed one treuisa vycarye barkley atte request one sir thomas lord barkley translated sayd book byble bartylmew de proprietatibus rerū latyn englyssh tyme symply emprynted sette forme william caxton lytel embelysshed fro tholde makyng also haue added suche storyes coude fynde fro thende said ranulph fynysshed book yere lord mccclvij vnto yere mcccclx whiche ben honderd thre yere whiche werke haue finysshed vnder noble protection dr • naturel souerayne lord moost cristen kynge kyng edward fourth humbly besechyng moost noble grace pardone yf ony thynge sayd therynne ignoraūce wyse ought be· also requyryng al amende wher ther defaute wherin may deserue thank meryte shal praye soo doo knowleche myn ignoraunce also symplenes yf ther thyng may plese prouffite ony man glad haue achieued folowynge prohemye shal set table shortly towchyd moost parte book sayd auctor hath alle werke seuen bookes haue sette whiche haue added • ter parte haue marked laste booke haue made chapytres acordyng werke whiche accomplysshyng thanke almyghty god whome zorastes fyndar wytchecraft 2 9 zorobabel duke 3 5 zorobabel solatyels sonne 3 10 zeno emperour 5 3 york buylded 2 29 yeres dyuersly accompted 4 • yate closed ageynst kynge 5 11 yef • e yeuen dane • 1 • york brente 7 1 yeftes made wale 7 • 8 syth tyme grete high tour babilone bylded • en haue spoken dyuerse tonges wise dyuerse men strange 〈◊〉 vnderstōde others speche speche knowen yf lerned comyn lernyng speche hering· alway deef alway dombe may speche lerne men fer countrees londes haue dyuerse speches yef neyther hem haue lerned others langage nether hem wote meneth though mete haue gret nede informacion loor talkyng speche nede neuer grete neyther hem vnderstondeth others speche gaglinge gee iangle one neuer fast neuer wyser though shrewe hym stede good morow· ¶ grete meschyef folo • eth mankynde god mercy grace hath ordeyned double remedye one somme mā lerneth knoweth many dyuerse speches ¶and bytwene strange men whiche neyther vnderstandeth others speche· ¶ suche man may mene • telle eyther wole mene· ot • er remedye one langage lerned vsed knowen many nacions londes latyn lerned knowen vsed specially half grece alle nacions londes europe therfor clerkes godnes curtosye make wryten bokes latyn· wryting bookes sholde vnderstande dyuerse nacions londes ¶ ranulphus monke c • estre wrote latyn bookes cronykes descryueth world aboute lengthe bre • de maketh mencion mynde doynges dedes meruaylles wondres· rekeneth yeres last dayes fro first makyng heuen erthe therinne grete noble informacion loore hem therinne rede vnderstande ¶therfor wolde haue bookes cronykes translated latyn englysshe moo men shold hem vnderstande haue therof con̄yng informacion loore clerke bookes cronykes ben wryten latyn latyn vsed vnderstanden half grece alle nacions londes europa ¶and comynly englysshe wyde vnderstonde vsed ne knowen thenglysshe transl • cion shold noman vnderstande englyssh men allone thenne shold moo men vnderstonde cronykes though translated • f latyn wyde vsed knowen englysshe 〈◊〉 knowen englyssh men allone lord ¶this question doubte easy assaylle ¶ yf cronykes translated latyn englyssh thenne many moo men shold vnderstande hem vnderstonde englysshe latyn clerk ye cunne speke rede vnderstande latyn thenne nedeth haue suche englyssh translacion lord ¶i denye argument though speke rede vnderstande latyn· ther moche latyn bookes cronykes vnderstonde nether thou without studyeng auisement lokyng bookes also though nedeful nedeful men vnderstonde latyn clerke men vnderstonde latyn may lerne vnderstande ¶ lord ¶ alle somme may manere besynesse somme elde somme defaute wytte somme defaute catell frendes fynde hem scole somme dyuerse defautes lettes ¶the clerke hit nedeth alle suche knowe cronykes ¶the lord ¶speke straytly thynge nedeth straytly speke thynge nedeth thynge may faylle nedeth nedeth god god maye faylle speke noman nedeth knowe cronykes ffor myght may noman hem knoweth· otherwise speke thynge nedeth· somwhat nedeth susteyne haue thynges therby mete drynke nedeth kepyng susteynaunce lyf speke man nedeth knowe cronykes· thyrdd maner speke thynge nedeth alle prouffytable nedeth speke alle men nede knowe cronykes ¶ tle clerke thenne vnderstande latyn may axe enformed taught hem vnderstande latyn ¶the lord· thou spekest wonderly lewde man wote shold axe namely loore dedes come neuer mynde ner wote comynly shold axe also men vnderstāde latyn haue bokes tēforme leude men also som connen somme may haue nedeth haue englysshe translacion ¶the clerke ¶the latyn good fayr therfor nedeth haue englyssh translacion ¶the lord reson worthy plunged pludde lede powder lewdnes shame ¶it myght wel thou makest myrthe game clerke ¶the reason muste stande assoylled· ¶the lord ¶a bleere eyed man al blynde wytt myght see solucion reason though blynde myght grope solucion yf feelyng hym faylled· yf reason ought worth suche manere arguyng myght preue thre score ten interpretours aquila symachus theodocion origenes lewdly occupyed whan translated holy wrytte oute hebrewe grue also saynt iherome lewdly occupyed whan translated holy wrytte oute hebrewe latyn ebrewe bothe good fayr wrytte inspyracion holy gost alle translacions ben hyely preysed al holy chirche ¶thenne forsayde lewde reason worthy powdred· leyed water soused also holy wrytte latyn boothe good fayr yet make sermone holy wrytte al latyn men englysshe latyn lewd dede neuer wyser latyn told hem englysshe mene ¶and maye be· told englyssh latyn mene without translacion latyn englysshe thenne nedeth haue englysshe translacion kepe mynde foryeten it▪ better suche translacion made wryten sayd wryten forsayd lewd reason shold meue • hath ony wytte leue makynge englysshe translacion ¶the clerke ¶a greeet dele bookes stondeth moche holy wrytte holy doctours philosophye· thenne bookes shold translated englysshe ¶the lord ¶ wonder thou makest febel argumentes hast goon longe scole aristotle bookes bookes also logyk philosophye translated oute grue latyn ¶also atte prayeng kynge charles iohan scot translated denys bookes grue latyn then̄e latyn ffrensshe thenne hath englysshe trespaced myght translated englysshe ¶also kynge alurede founded vnyuersyte oxenford translated best lawes englysshe tonge greet dele sawter latyn englysshe caused wyrefrith bisshop wyrcetre trāslate seynt gregoryes bookes dialogue latyn saxon also cedmon whythy enspyred holy goste made wonder poysyes englisshe nyghe alle storyes holy wrytte ¶ also holy man beda translated seynt iohns gospel latyn englisshe also thou wotest apocalips wryten walles roof chappel bothe latyn frensshe also gospel prophecye right feyth holy chirche must taught prechd englisshe men conne latyn thenne gospel prophecye right feyth holy chirche must told hem englysshe englissh trālsacōn englissh prechyng trāslacōn englisshe prechyng good nedefull thēne englissh trāslacion good nedefull clerke yf translacion made myght amended ony poynt somme men wold blame lord yf men blame worthy blamed thenne ben blame clerkes knowe wel ynowgh synfull man doth well ne myght doo better ne make good translacion ne myght better· therfore origenes made two translacions ierome translated thryes sawter desire translacion best myght ydle desire ony man nowe alyue wold haue skylfull translacion myght knowe vnderstonden clerk ¶whether leuer haue translacion cro • ykrs ryme prose ¶ lord ¶ prose communly prose moore cleere ryme easy playne knowe vnderstande ¶the clerke ¶thenne god gran̄ce v grace grathly gynne witte wysedome wysely worche myghte mynde ryght menynge make translacion trusty trewe plesyng trynyte thre persones one god mageste· euer euer shall made heuen erthe light shyne departed light derknes callid light daye derknes nyght made euetyde morow tyde one day morowtyde ¶ seconde day made firmament bytwene water departed water vnder firmamente· fro wat •• aboue firmamente called firmament heuen thyrd day gadred watres ben vnder firmamente one pl̄ace made erthe vnheled· named gadryng water see drye erthe londe made tree gras fourthe daye made sonne mone st • rres sette hem firmament heuene shyne tokenes signes departe time yeres nyght daye fyfthe day he· made fowles birdes thayer fysshes water sixth day made beestes londe man erthe put hem paradys shulde wyrche wonne therinne man brake goddes heste fylle synne put paradys wo sorow worthy dampned peyne helle without ony ende holy trynyte mercy man fader sente sone holy gost light mayde sone toke fflesshe blood blysful mayde deyde rode saue mankynde aroos thyrd day gloryous blysful taught disciplis ascended heuen whan tyme shal come atte day dome deme quycke dede thenne alle tho ben writon book lyf shall wende hym blysse heuen ben bodye sowle see knowe godhede manhede ioye without ony ende· ¶ thus endeth dyalogue ¶ epystle sir iohan treuisa chapelayn vnto lord thomas barkley vpon translacion polycronycon englysshe tongue welthe worship worthy worshipful lord sir thomas lord barkley· iohan treuisa youre preest ledeman obedyent • nxom werke wylle holde herte thenke thought meen mynde youre nedefful menyng speche ye spak sayde ye wold haue englysshe translacion ranulphus chestres bookes cronykes therfor wole fonde take trauayll make englysshe translacion bookes god graunteth grace blame 〈…〉 blynue· enuye enemyes 〈…〉 euyl spekers wol • leue doo 〈◊〉 trauayll wil spare comforte haue medeful makyng plesyng god knowyng wote will· make translacion clere playn knowen vnderstonden somme place shall sette word worde actyf actyf passyf passif arowe right stondeth withoute chaungynge ordre wordes somme place muste chaunge ordre wordes sette actyf passyf ayenward somme place muste sette reson worde telle meneth al suche chaungyng menyng shal stande chaunged somme wordes name countreyes londes cytees water ryuers montaynes hilles person place muste sette stonde hem self owne kyndr asia europa affryca syrya mount athlas syna oreb marach iordan arnon· bethleem· nazareth iherusalem damascus· hanybal rasyn assuerus cyrus many suche wordes name yf ony man make bookes cronykes better englissh translacion moore prouffytable god hym mede cause ye make doo medeful dede quiteth alle good dedes quyte youre mede blysse heuen welthe lykyng alle holy saintes mankynde nyne ordres angelis angel archangel pryncipates potestates virtutes dominaciones trones cherubyn seraphyn see god blysful face ioye without ony ende amen ¶ thus endeth epistle ¶ prolicionycion ¶ prefacio prima ad historiam ¶ capitulum primum solempne wyse wryters arte scyence swetenes lykyng al lif tyme studye ro trauaille aboute connyng knowleche kyndly thynges sobrenes redynes thewes ben worthy ben hyely prey sed though puttynge medlyng gyder prouffyt swetenes· wrote lefte v wryten meruaylles wondres grete berynge oute dedes oure forn faders stalworth wight wyse worthy dyuerse maner men old tyme ¶for makynge bookes storyes ben v sente byquethen grete besynesse wryters cronykes blasen shynen clerly ryght rewle thewes ensample lyuynge knowyng goodnes metyng thre wayes vertues dyuynyte metynge four wayes four pryncipal vertues thewes ryal clothyng ¶ whiche thynges lytil cunnyng myght take knowleche ne folowe fourth besynes wryters oure vncunnynge hadde shadde stremed mynde auncyent olde dedes ¶ short lyf dul wytte slowe vnderstandyng ydle occupacions lete v knowe many thynges foryetyngnes alway kythyng craft stepdame enemye mynde· ¶ also nowe oure tyme arte science lawe loste ensample noble dedes knowen nobylyte fayre manere spekyng alle loste mercy god almyghty hadde ordeyned lettres wrytynge remedye vnperfyghtnesse mankynde· ¶i praye yow shold knowe emperours wonder philosopher ellys folowe thappostles· theyr noble dedes theyr wonder werkes wreton hystoryes kepte mynde sholde knowe lucillum seneca in· epistle hadde wryten dedes wrytynge poetes worth praysyng emperours alle welthe world rychesses welded whyle lyue storye wytnesse tyme mynde lyf messagyer oldenesse storye weldeth passyng doynges story putteth forth professoures· dedes wolde loste story reneweth dedes wold flee oute mynde· storye callith agayne dedes wolde deye storye kepeth hem euermore wherfore amonge noble trauayllours thre pathes arne mooste worthy ben praysed fayre flourysshers embelysshers wordes metre haue theyr trauaylle goten grete pry lawde maye 〈◊〉 prayse hem historyes meten descryuen alle worlde wyde ¶ withoute ony drede shall resseyue theyr mede hym rewardeth· quyteth alle wel werke ¶ worthynes ensample noble wryters herto fore haue wreton boostynge myne owne dedes ner scornynge ne blamynge mennys dedes haue caste ordeyned maye make wryte treaty haue gadred oute dyuerce bookes estate ilonde brytayne otherwyse callyd englond vnto knowleche hem shal come v thenne specyall lordes knewe myne entente desyre knowe greete mennes dedes prayd bysyly shold also wryte famous hystoryes· acounte yeres begynnynge worlde vnto oure tyme ¶ tho toke heede matier labo •• ntus dedalus howse hath many halkes hurues wonderfull wayes wyndynge wrynklynges wylle lyghtly opened shewed shamed drede take graunte ferdful aboone ydlenes slowthe lette greete werkes men wolde wyrche ¶ wytte full lytil to▪ vnwynde· wrappynges wonderful werkes matiere large wryters therinne ben many greete ¶ fulnesse therof men ben al sadde take lasse heede lyghtly wolde fynde fawte symple werke· enemyes whette theyr tonges bende theyr browes suche men speketh gregorius nazauzenus wole lyghtly blame defawtes men folowe lyghtly goodnes alle hadde mynde also knewe myn owne pouerte shamed dredde noble spekars sowned trompes put forth barayne speche hoose snochyng recheth vp mulberyes serueth lychorous men lyueth lykynge soure grap • ¶ yf laboure hercules firste tourneyes stryfe ioustes olympye pygmeye busketh hym bataylle arayeth hym fyghte myght thenne leue lawhe ¶ also wolde shonte scorne yf pipe ooten reed vnhighte noble matier mowyng gruntynge whystlynge noble spekars sowned atte beste hem fayre facounde renable speche flowed stremed alle lyf tyme· ¶ haue wel mynde booz seyde ruth shamefast leese vp eres ryp men sayde noman shal wrathe the· • rypmen sayde yf wylle rype forbede leese gleyne noman shal lette ¶ poete also mantuanus marro virgilius sayth eth libro decimo oracins sayth hugucio pisanus dininaciouibus suis capitulo peruiso ¶ whan enemyes despysed oracius bare hym honde hadde taken somme homeres versis· medled amonge called hym gader •• olde wrytynges • answerde sayde right greete strength • wreste maas oute hercules honde ¶ therfore praye noman blame though fare sonde asshes though dym foule hem self clense thynges make shyne ful bryght many thynges haue hem self yet yeuen ¶ seyth poete satiricus fare whestone maketh yron sharpe kene ¶ item gregorius suo pastorale sayth haue peynted well fayre man self foul • peyntoure therfore truste charyte gregory speketh omelye wytte vertues strengthe vncunnyng de nyeth auntre repyng fulle trauaylle wakynge caas despysed enuyous men proude yet hope shal prouffytable good studyers meke· ¶ • shall entre feldes oure fornfaders folowe rypmen yf maye ony wyse leese gadre somwhat crommes fallen lordes bordes somtyme fulfylled lefte theyr releef childeren ¶ also yf myghte gadre ony scrappes releef xij kipes lepes· som putto encre • e wrytyng auctours dwerf sitting geants neck wherthurgh yonglynges mowe brought loore ¶ gretter men vse besynes sette mowe enformed taught shorte treaty haue seen grete volume large ben storyes • reton subtylte sentence ne fayr flourysshynge wordes sw • tenes deuocion mater regne booke ¶ whiche booke tretyse wele nyghe alle problemes question wysest men ben planted ¶ also many thynges ben wreton bookes haue gadred comyne though storye wreton th •• treaty cause men sholde knowe hem oure tyme· somdele malyce enemyes somdele slouthe wrytars knowleche grete dedes nyghe loste foryeten scarsely bare name place haue mynde though feynyng sawes mysbyleuyd lawles men wondres meruaylles dyuerse countreyes l •• de ben planted booke suche seruen good 〈◊〉 knowen crysten men ¶ virgyle sought gold wytte • wysedome fenne ennij poete ¶ child israel goynge unto londe biheste spoylled egypcyans bookes wreton wele wyde par celmele planted put geder myrthe sadnes hethen cristen people eueryche amonge straunge storyes ben •• egged shorted lengthed historye hoole sothnes chaunged ¶ neuerthelesse certayne somme holden ¶for augustinus de ciuitate dei sayth sholde trowe worshippe myraclee god· hem dispreue disputicion· wondres ben alle vntro wed ¶for somme telle many· wondres whiche thou shalt fynde thou woldest bileue ¶ yet ben ful sothe kynde maye doo ayenste god lord kynde also many thynges semen ful sothe netheles skylfully doubted ¶y • dorus eth̄ quintodecimo seyth yf reson vncertayne buyldynge rome wonder though men vncerteyne buyldyng cytees townes wherfore shal blame maker wryters historyes dyuersly spe • en wryten longe passyng tyme elde dedes make hem vnknowen writer erre therfor iherome sayth semely byleue theyr sawes gaynsaye bileue ne sothnes knowē· wherfor wrytyng historye take vpon afferme trouthe alle wryte suche haue seen • de dyuerse bookes gadre wryte without enuye comyn men thappostel sayth al wryten soth sayth alle wreton wreton oure doctryne loore though take mennes calle story myn wryte whyles myn owne wordes sētence old men auctours first begynnyng booke take shelde· defence saue kepe ayenst enemyes wold despyse strangely blame first self myn owne name write lettre ¶r wryte reherce name auctours cronyke special gadred drawen ¶ iosephus iudeorum historicus signis qui ab inicio seculi v que ad ·xiiij 〈◊〉 domiciani libros antiquitatum viginti nec non et de subuerstone ciuitatis iherosolime gentis que sue captiuitate septem conscripsit egesippus de excidio vrbis quem transtulit ambrosius plinius xxxvij· libris de naturali historia· trogus pompeius xliiij libris de cuuetis pene orbis historijs quem abreu • auit discipulis suis iustinus eusebius historia ecclesiastica cuius v • decim sunt libri historia ecclesiastica triꝑtita sum secutus ¶ prefacio secunda ad historiam moche cronyke conteyneth berynges dedes many tymes therfor clepe policronicon cronyke many tymes • werk ensample first wercher wrought alle werkes six dayes rested seuenth doynge oure doctryne werke departe dele seuen bookes firste booke descryueth place contreyes londes alle wyde world ¶ six bookes nombre sixe age conteyneth beryng dedes begynnyng world vnto tyme ¶netheles firste book werke descryueth general comyn special mappa mū di portrayed peynted therinne· whiche cloth shappe wyde world paynted inne ¶ thenne chyef partyes world deled ¶and story trauaylled cause brytayne euery prouynce londe descryued vntil come brytayne laste alle moost speciall therin ben conteyned fyften chapytres nedeful knouleche ilonde brytayne though inbryngynge gretter knowleche bookes foloweth may come fulle knowleche ful storye maye suche forledynge haue lykynge leue shrewdnes synne ¶ second booke auentureth telle beryng dedes destripcion lasse world ¶ age world al euene beryng dedes eueery book euen conteynth lyke ¶ therfore second booke conteyneth berynge dedes foure age fro makyng oure formest fader thebrennyng temple iewes thyrdde book transmygracion pepole comyng criste fourthe fro criste comyng saxones fyfthe saxones dane sixth dane norman seuenth norman tyme vnder regne kynge edward thyrdde conquest prophecie ysaye thys grete story departed seuen stremes bothe hosed shooed goddes peple may passe therby ¶prefacio tercia ad historiam ¶ capitulum· tercium hem wole haue ful knowleche historyes· nedeth eygthe thynges knowe descrypcions place state thynges distynction tymes folowyng kyngdomes dyuersyte lyuyng passyng age maner doyng alle acountyng yeres fyrste shal remembryd fyrst book· bookes shal openly wreton touchyng seconde take hede two estate one fro begynnyng world criste· called state mysgoyng second state fro criste worldes ende named state grace mercy thyrdde take hede thre tymes one fore lawe wreton· second tyme lawe wreton· thyrdde vnder newe lawe criste whiche lawe vnder grace mercy ffor fourthe take hede somtyme ther four pryncipal kyngdomes wete assyryens perces grekes romayns netheles touchyng cours world processe holy wrytte fyrste kyngdom vnder oure forfaders fro adam moyses second fro moyses saul thyrdde vnder kynges fro saul zorobabel fourthe vnder bisshoppes fro zorobabel criste fyfthe take hede fyue maners lyuyng fyrst fyrst age vnder lawe kynde comyn alle men seconde seconde age lyuyng mysbyleuyd men whan mawmetrye began nynus tyme kyng nynyue thyrdde thyrdde age vnder lawe wreton whan circūsicōn lawe departed child israel fro lawes mysbyleued men fourth lyuyng cristen men bigan vnder criste whan bileue grace sacrament halowed self fyfte lyuyng sarasyns began vnder macho mete shal sayd fyfte book tyme heraclius themperour openly shewed ffor sixthe take hede sex age one fro adam noe second fro noe abraham thyrdde fro abrahain dauid fourth fro dauid transmygracion whan israhel brought thraldom babilone fyfthe fro transmygracion crist sixthe fro crist worldes ende take hede age world ben delid euennesse yeres merueylles byfelle begynnyng first age began fro begynnyng worlde seconde no flood thyrdde fro circumsicion fourth fro begynnyng kynges fyfte transmygracion· sixthe fro thyncarnacion crist seuenth take hede seuen persones· who dedes ben wreton storyes· kynge royamme knyght bataylle iuge plee bisshop clergye lauful men peple husbonde hows relygyous man chirche whiche spryngeth seuen famous doynges buyldyng cytees· vyctorye enemyes makyng lawes· correction ef trespas helpe comyn prouffyt· gouernyng meyne houshold getyng blifful mede· whiche blaseth shyneth rewardyng good men punysshyng euyl men eyghte take hede echt dyuerse manere acountyng yeres thre iewes vse thre grekes one romayns cristen men oue ffor iewes tretys· couenauntes haue yere vsual· begynneth ianyuer· deuocion sacryfyce haue yere lawful begynneth marche also haue yere apperyng vse calculyng cronyke begynneth maye whan passed oute egypte also grekes thre maner wyse acount • n theyr yeres fyrste ioye vyctorye acounte yeres fro takyng troye afterward acounte olympiades ben tymes theyr ioustes tournementes regned acounted theyr yere • regnyng manere anno regni grecorum quinto vel tercio talus vel talus sicut patet libro machabeorum whan romayns waxed flowres acounted yeres fro buyldyng cyte ab vrbe condita· cristen men fro incarnacion criste acoūten yeres whan cometh place men muste take hede calculyng denys englond f • aunce folowen hath lasse xxij yere calculyng iherome foloweth gospel willelmus malmesburyensis bbro 4· de pont sayth marianus scotus monke prysoned maguncia toun almayn aboute yere grace thre score xvj loked bysyly bookes acounted fonde dyonisyus exiguus acordeth gospel acountyng yeres· ffor scot marianus acoū ted alle yeres begynnynge world put xxii yere lacked denys acountes wrote grete cronyke huge whiche book robert bisshop herforde deflored comyn cronikes foloweden denys faylled al daye· ffor • erome translatyng cronyke eusebij say • h yeres lacke bytwene cristes passion vaspasianus tyme· also xij yeres lacke decius cezars tyme shewed vj· age errour bifalleth dayes monethes vnrekened kynges regned ouer ful yeres also dayes monethes voyded bytwene two kynges forgoten wherfore booke shal marke maye yeres suche defawtes fylle shal hyghte margyns hedes historyes somme wych double somme treble rowes yeres ffrom abraham cyte buyld· sette geders yere age world ledare ffro cyte buyld criste sette gyder yere age cyte ledare fro crist • forthward wryte geder yere grace prynce regned ¶ cronica ranulphi cistrensis monachi de orbis dimensione prescianus cosmagraphia ¶ capitulum quintum ivlius cezar counseyl senatours alderman rome sought serched historyes bokes yeres doyng dedes ordeyned wysemen redy mesure descryue alle world aboute thenne fro iulius tyme saturmus tyme xxxij yere messagers wyse men wel taught practyke geometrye cunnyng prouffytable mesure g • sse hygnes lownes· lengthe brede depnes also redyly sente euery londe aboute iugges capytayns gouernours londes ffor shold mesure descryue londe water woodes laundes valeys playnes montaynes downes see stronde euery place ony man myght goo ryde shippe sayle· wryte certefye senatours wondres founden r witnesseth iherome translatyng hystorye eusebi libro secundo cao secundo sayth pylate iuge iurye certefyed tiberyus cezar merueylles wonder criste wrought iewrye tiberius certefyed senatours· senatours byleued not· ffor herd fore wonder werkes prescianus warnyng certefyeng capytayns londes founden knowen alle world aboute hath see dyuerse name ·xxx· ilondes lxxij famous montaynes xl prouynces lxxviij noble cytees iijc lxx grete ryuers lvij· dyuerse nacions c fyfe twenty ¶the roundenes world aboute thre honderd sythes fyften sythes honderd thousand paas lengthe erthe men dwelle inne fro eeste weste fro inde pylers hercules see gadytan iiij score sythes v sythes an· c lxxviij myle waye one ende moche lasse waterthan londe brede erthe fro southe north clyf occean ethyopia londe blak men mouthe ryuer thany wel nyghe haluen dele lasse lengthe conteyneth liiijc lxij myle also fonde deppest place see myddel erthe conteyneth doun right fyften furlonge depe r tholomeus sayth roundenes cercle conteyneth thryes moch brede seuendele brede proporcion two twenty seuen· acounted roundenes erthe aboute conteyneth twenty thousand fourty myle yf departe somme thre seuenth part thyrde thycknes erthe thurghout almost sex thousand fyue honderd four score enleuen myle thenne half thyknes erthe inward doun right thre thousand two c· fyue fourty myle· somwhat ouer half myle yf helle myddel erthe doun right may knowen many myle helle ¶ de orbis diuisione augustinus de cinitate dei libro sexto capitulo octauo ¶ capitulum sextum departyng world take hede grete see occean beclyppeth alle erthe aboute erthe departed thre grete partyes asia one parte· europa affryca thyrdde thre partyes ben alle euen lyke moche ffor asia one thre conteyneth half erthe stretcheth fro southe eeste vnto north closed aboute see occean endeth wes • ward atte grete see beda de naturis endes ben mouthe ryuer nylus south ryuer thanays northe ysidorus libro quarto decimo capitulo quarto parte europa stretcheth dounward fro ryuer thanays northe occean costes spayne ioyneth grete see eeste southe endeth ilonde gades ¶ item ysidorus capitulo quinto affryca thyrdde parte stretcheth fro west southe vnto coost egypte two partyes affryca europa ben departed sounder arme see plenius libro 3o co po mouthes arme conteynen ffyften thousand paas lengthe fyue thousand paas breed thylke mouthes see myddel erthe begynneth dyuerse armes spredeth wexeth inward londes de parcium orbis descripcione· plenius liliro sexto· prescianus cosmagraphia ¶ capitulum septimum asia mooste quantite europa lasse lyke nombre peple affrica lest alle iij partyes bothe place nombre people· therfore somme men knewe men londes acounted two partyes therthe only· asia europa acounted affryca narowe brede euyl doer croupt ayer· wylde beestes venemoꝰ dwellen therin therfore acounte affryca thyrde part acounte space mesure lengthe brede dyuerse disposicions better worse departe affryca fro europa asya sore membre fro membrys ben hoole sounde good poynt beste also affryca kynde hath lasse space sturenes heuen hath wyldernes though affryca lytil hath wyldernes waste londe ffor grete brennyng hete sonne thenne europa al chele grete colde therinne ffor alle lyueth groweth maye better endure cold hete· mesure ruleth bothe plenius libro sexto therfore europa nouryssheth bryngeth forth fayr men larger gretter body myghtyer strengthe· hardyer bolder herte fayrer shappe affryca ffor sonne beme alwaye abydeth vpon men affryca draweth oute humour maketh hem short bodyes· black skyn crypse beer drawyng oute spyrytes maketh hem coward herte con ••• rye northeren men cold without stoppeth smal • hooles porus holdeth hete withinne· maketh hem fatter gretter whyter withinne hardyer bolder herte ¶ de mari magno medio siue mediterraneo plenius libro 3o capitulo primo· ¶ capitulum octauuin thenne grete see myddel erthe begynneth weste hercules pylers see occean athlant breketh maketh see gadytan· lengthe see xv m· paas brede v paas hath right side affrica lyft syde europa therof spryngen inner see endes therof water thanayan northsyde nylus south side ysid libo 14 〈◊〉 see flowynge oute occean turneth southe thenne north balearis fyrst grete hauene passage see shedeth sp •• ne· thenne mouthe gallycus passeth prouynce narbon thenne lygustyus ianua cyte thenne tyrenus ytalye archeth thenne hauen scicilia passeth creta thenne passage creta stretcheth pamphilia egypte fro then streme grete hauen mouthe elespontus breketh oute brode grete wawes stremes· torneth northward besydes grece boforn wexeth narow streyght narow space vij furlonges· exerses kynge made ouer brydge shippes passe grece warre therin· plenius libro sexto see narowe bytwene europa asia men may eyther syde houndes berke fowles synge yf weder wynde lette· giraldus de po co xo narow place named seynt george arme stretcheth forth constantynople bytwene europa asia· see ilond abydes ysid libro nono thenne see shede • h northward maketh see propontydes thenne naroweth narownes vjc paas see trach̄ thenne see ponticus passeth north trasia misia stretcheth water mareys meotydes receyueth ryuer thanays thenne stretcheth estward passeth lasse asia vnto endes yberya armeny see named eusinum ysid libo nono see swetter shorter mysty ffresshe ryuers al aboute renne fallen therto ¶ grete mouthe baye ben ylondes chachos pathmos plenius libo 6o see ponticus floweth ne torneth agayn euer renneth see propontydem ebespontum r cause therof myght strengthe ryuers bakwaters rennen therto dryue forth see eusinum alway one cours strength flood see elesponticus fer fro occ •• n may withstōde cours strēgth strong stremes renne cours ysid libo nono erthe one hath dyuerse name bycause dyuerse pla ••• grete see cause dyuerse kyngdomes ilondes peple cytees townes passeth happes falle therin dyuersly named hath dyuerse name ¶ de occeano ysidorus libro 13o ¶ capituluin nouum see occean byclyppeth alle therthe aboute garlond tymes cometh goth ebbyng flowyng floweth see casteth hem vp wyndes blowen therin plenius libro secundo capitulo 99 hyghe flood occean aryseth vpon costes brytayn four score cubites high rysynge depnes better knowen clyues hyghe see ffor betynge veynes better knowen vtter partyes body ward myddel within eueryche flood aryseth occean grete see hoole gyder myghtyer stronger ony party hym self hool occean grete large receyueth workyng mone ony partye hym self smaller lasse· therfore lake ryuers pondes ffresshe wuters ne ebbe ne flowe occean doth plenius libro secundo· capitulo 7 occean spredeth shedeth dyueerse mowthes costes toward londe many place wel nyghe toucheth inner see neyghe mouthe called· arabicus mouth coste reede see fro see egypte fyfty thousand paas also mouth see called caspius thre honderd lxxv myle fro grete see called eusinus beda de naturis amonge alle mowthes see cometh toward lond occean thre ben holden mooste famous mouth see hath two name called gadytanus athlantycus also second called caspius entreth • heest departeth bitwene northsyde inde sicia lond • stretcheth toward grete mouthe see named eusmus thyrdde mouthe see reed see cometh northeest departeth south syde ynde fro ethiopia egypte ffro thylke two londes thenne reed see stretcheth forth departeth ij mouthes see one named persicus stretcheth northward named arabicus stretcheth westward toward grete see rede see reed kynde flassheth wasseth reede cleues stone dyhed reed roose therfor clyues stronde reede see gadred vermylon rede precious stonessolmus see called caspius ben hylles ben called 〈◊〉 hilles caspij haue length • 〈◊〉 thousand paas brede vn • ethe space cartwaye sydes hylles caspij salt veynes melte wose 〈◊〉 humour moysture dreyed clongen heete 〈…〉 ne ioyneth cleueth gyder yse glas men 〈◊〉 clymme hylles weye slyther also euery draught ful drawe space xxviij thousand paas· londe drye withoute socoure· addres serpentes fallen therto· wynter ther maye man come therinne· r marcianus sayth yates caspij ben faste shette wi • h yron barris spryngyng tyme faste barred serpentes adder mayster historyes sayth atte prayer kyng alexander hilles caspij closed ioyned gyders paulus historia long lio po ther ben many swole wyngys whirlyngys water see brynkes tweyne ben see myddel erthe bytwene italye ilonde scicilia thylke two swolowes ben called scylla carybdys whiche speketh vyrgyle seyth scilla perillous rightsyde carybdys lyft syde swolewys perylles water ben occean one west • clyue brytayn called nauel see bytwene brytayn gallycia· seyd swolewes twyes nyght daye swole wyth stremes flodes caste hem vp agayn· also draweth shippes casted hem agayn swyftly arowe man sight ¶ de prouyncijs orbis et primo de paradiso ¶ capitulum decimum knowleche erthly paradyse thre poyntes muste knowen wherfor thre question must axed· fyrst question axeth yf ony suche place erthe seconde axeth whytherward· paradyse erthe thyrde axeth countrey place paradyse erthe· ffor fyrst four maner witnessis haue paradyse erthe ffyrst storyes lykened sodome er ouertourned paradyse· seconde witnes hem assayed· wrote sayde seen place thyrdde wytnes ben foure ryuers rennen paradise ffor heed thylke ryuers ben founden see ne ffresshe water ner londe men dwelle inne though kynges egypte many trauaylled wel ofte sought ther therfor ysid ·xiij eth· sayth iherom toke hede vnderstondyng byhoueth ryuers paradyse auctours wryten also basilius exam • ron ysid eth̄ libro xiiij iosephus libro primo sayen water fallyng hyghest hylle paradyse maken grete ponde ponde welle four ryuers spryngen petrus capitulo 14 whiche four ryuers fyrst physon menyng ful wexynge plente ryuer physon passeth inde draweth hym golden grauel· phison hath another name· called ganges kynge inde whiche named gangarius ganges saye felawship companye receyueth • n grete ryuers rennen therto seconde called gyon nylus also goth aboute ethiopia egypte thyrdde tygris iosephus sayth dyglath also saye sharpe ffor swyfte tygris whiche ryght swyft beeste tygris passeth toward assyria londe ysidorus libro tercis decimo· mooste certayne auctour salustius sayth ther cometh welle oute cerannes hilles armenye spryngeth oute foote hylle called cancasus welle heed tweyne ryuers· tygris eufrates whiche two ryuers somtyme ben· departed sonder somtyme medlid gyders • e tyme ben swolowed erthe spryngen vp agayn longe goon aboute mesopotonya londe dounward reed se • e r though men rede bokes nylus cometh oute paradyse yet somme men affermen saye nylus spryngeth weste side londe ethiopia fe • fro hylle named athlas gooth aboute ethiopia dounward egypte seche proprete nylus chapytre egiptus· ¶ fourth witnes proof suche place erthe called paradyse· old fame longe durynge· ffor men shal bileue olde fame withseyde· fame paradyse hath endured withoute gaynsayeng sixe thousand yere fro begynnynge world vnto oure dayes hath endured fame fals endureth longe ffor falleth oute mynde dispreuyd sothnes knowen ¶ seconde question axeth whiche syde world place paradyse shold be· though shorte wytted men lytil assaye saye paradyse longe sayllyng erthe men dwelle inn • · also departed erthe hyghe mone bileued· ffor nature reason bothe withsaye ffor yf paradys departed atwynne fro erthe men dwelle inne· ne water ne eyer myght bere burthen also fuyer occupyeth alle myddel space bytwene thayer mone thenne paradyse there· ffor thenne nothyng myght lyue therinne also yf paradyse hyghe· somtyme shold take waye lyght make eclypse mone suche eclypse herde neuer also yf paradyse hygh departed sonder euery londe erthe shulde four ryuers spryngen oute paradyse passe ayer wyde see come londes men dwelle inne yf men saye paradyse hyghe one place contynueth erthe men dwelle iune thenne erthe enlong round al wyse men descryuen hit· may stonde· knowe experyence assaye euery eclypse mone erthe maketh round shelde therfor erthe alle partyes muste nedes rounde· wyse men conclude paradyse vttermest endes eest grete contrey erthe lasse inde egypte large place couenable al mankynde dwelle inne· yf mankynde synned thyrdde axeth paradyse maner place shold ysid sayth libro 14 ca 3o name paradis tourned oute grue latyn moch say orchard paradise ebrew called edē saye lykynge· whiche tweyne put gyder maketh orchard lykyng r wonder· ffor place thyng acordeth lyf· ysid libro quarto decimo helthe eyer attemperat neyther hote ne colde nothyng lyueth maye deye therinne withnessith enok hely yet ben lyue· iohannes damascenus place hath fayr weder myrthe ffor celer place alle fairenes maner tree leseth leues ne flowres ther fade ther • myrthe swetenes fruyt tree growe genesis secundo capitulo wryton euery tree therinne swete ete fayr sight therinne sykernes sewrte place hyghe r petrus ca· 13o sayth water grete flood cometh paradyse though somme men saye paradyse hyghe mone soth wordes dede speche saued excusacion spekyng called yperbolyca speken wolde mene paradyse heyght passeth alle londes treuisa prayse erthly man iordan iohan· saye best man euer yet neuer good criste· wordes subtil men wel dyuyne menyng trewe good ala ysidorus sayth libro nono capitulo primo oure waye paradyse faste stopped cause synne forn fader hit closed al brennyng wal brennyng therof arecheth heuen somme men wolde wene paradyse closed wal holde mankynde angel stonden wal kepe wel paradys none euil goostes mowe come therin ¶ de asia prouincijs eius ysidorus libo 14 ¶ capitulum vndecimum ysydorus sayth asia hath name called woman dwellyd therinne whiche named asia asia ben many prouynces londes whiche shal descryue rekene al along begynne ynde ynde hath est syde sonne rysyng south see occean weste ryuer ynde north hylle called cancasus ynde ende ynde ben men coloure hewe dyed ynde byrd named phytacus elephantis peper· tre called hebanus yuory precious stone beryl crisopassis carbunclis· adamantis golden hylles whiche ful harde come dragon grypes dyuerse maner men grysly wonderly shapen· amonge alle londes world ynde grettest mooste ryche strengest mooste ful peple wonder meruaylles moost wonderful inde croppe fyghe tree grete wyde sprad· many companyes men may sytte atte mete wel ynough vnder causeth goodnes londe temperure weder plente water· plenius libro sexto capitulo 19 ynde ben many kynges people somme hem tylleth londe somme vseth chaffare marchandyse somme knygthode chyualrye somme ben grete clerkes ¶ ynde ben treees haue toppes hyghe men shal shote arowe also gobet bytwene tweyne knottes reed ynde men make boot bereth thre men attones ouer depe water ynde ben men fyue cubyte longe wexe seke n • r yelde vp breth also ther ben satiri dyuerse men grysly wonderly shapen ther inne ben men cubyte long ben named pygmey pygmey geten childeren engenderen fourth yere· wexe hore ·v· gadre grete hoost ryden vpon weders rammes fyghte crane destroyen theyr nestes egges crane ben theyr enemyes shold encrece wexe many ben bi • phylosophers biholde sonne al day long also somme haue heedes houndes voys make lyker berkynge houndes mannes voys ben clothed wylde beestes skynnys armed owen teth nayles lyuen huntyng hawkyng ther ben haue mouth lyuen odour smellis ben clothed mosse heery toftes growe tree wexe hoer yongthe wexen black elde hylles ynde ben men haue sooles foot ouertorned viij fyngers one hand tull de tust 9o one contrey ynde euery man hath many wyues whan husbonde deede wyues shal goo gyders loke whiche hem best byloued husbonde shal buryed hym put erthe quyck lyue countrey fayrest happe fortune acounted also worship ony wyf myght haue petrus 19 6· ynde hen tree ben called tree sonne mone prestes ete apple thylke tree lyuen v c yere called tree sonne ffor eueryche quaked shook sone sonne beme touched toppe answerd men stode doyng tree mone· tree grete kyng alysaundre forboden shold neuer come babylone ysydorus libro 15 offyr ilond inde ther inne grete plente gold passage therto grece reed see ¶ capitulum duodecimum ¶ de parchia ysid libro 14 ysydorus sheweth parchia kyngdom mygh • 〈◊〉 strengthe men londe name spradd 〈…〉 londes assiria medium woonte cont ••• 〈◊〉 londe four contreyes· assiria· medium persida 〈◊〉 mania whiche londe· perchia stretcheth lengthe fro se • called caspius vnto reede see brede ryuer inde ryuer called tigris bygynnyng londe named mesopotonya trogus libro decimo capitulo quynto perchij men perchia langage countrey scicia outlawes· whan kyngdom taken men medium men persidia thenne perchi praye vyctours vnknowen emonge men eeste l • ndes vnto tyme men macedonia bycam kynges lordes londes thenne afterward serued macedoyns whan macedoyns vyctours eeste londes atte laste parteners romayns deled lordship hem· perchij vseden maners men scicia▪ put hem somtyme therfor armes wepen ben fethery swellyng wyttes gyleful espyes ¶men acounte violente· wynmen mylde euer ben vnesy owen neyghbours straunge men ben comynly stylle lytil speche redy doo speke· therfore holden pryue good happes bonchyef wel euyl happes meschyef ben obedyent theyr lordes drede shame ben alle disposed lecherye theyr owne wyues eueryche hath many wyues trespaas amonge punysshed greuously aduoultrye lawe therfore forbeden theyr wyues open sight festes companye men· lyuen scarcely lytil mete· ete fflessh veneson giraldus 17 thylke men lefte kyng • lencus dwelleden vnder kyng arsaces· therfor called arsacide kynge arsaces taught hem fyrst lawes gadred knyghtes buylded castellys cytees stronge walled townes atte laste arsaces kyng ioyned kyngdom hircania empyre men hircania longed empyre emonge whiche afterward among kynges come metridates metridates soone deth crassus consul rome regned helde kyngdom xliij yere· whiche tyme dyde many viages many fair vyctoryes declared within forth place trogus libro 14 parchij men parchia ben myddel bytwene scitas men scicia medes men medium londe parchij haue many bondman emonge ben neuer made free theyr fre men ryden alway horsbak· theyr bondman goon foote· batayll fyghten hors goo • pryue offyce comyn festes· teche bysyly theyr childeren ryde shote eueryche hem rychesse power fynde theyr kynde horsmen bataylle fygthe· conne fyght comyn maner ner conne bisege castels stronge walled townes fygthe hors rennyng ful cours tornyng agayn ofte strengest hardyest fight feyne flee sodenly torne fyght aagayn mowe slylyer wynne slee theyr enemyes batayll vse tabour trompe mowe endure longe fyghte men shold hem awelde withstonde yf stronge stalworth endure· ben angry hasty fighte· buryeng wonderful ffor beestes teeren· eten al halen theyr flessh burye bone ¶de assiri • ysid libro 14 ¶ capitulum 13 take hede assiria hath name assur· sēmes sone fyrst dwellyd therinne no flode londe assiria hath eest side inde south medium weste riuer tigris north hylle called cancasus ben yates caspye· hilles ben longe narowe trogus libro 42 egeus kyng athene medus egeus sone folowed dedes iason owne stepfader· buylt cyte medium called cyte medium also worship moder named medea londe medea hath north side see eest inde· west caldea south persida ysid libro 14· persida named hath name perseus conquered londe· made hit worthy lande fore vnworthy· persida hath est inde west reed see north medium south carmania persida began first wicchecraft nembroth geants tyme spredyng many langages tonges wente persida taught men londe worshippe th • •• sonne called langage el ch • ef 〈◊〉 londe named elam elam semmes sone cyte called afterward elamayda callyd persipolis cyte speketh holy wryt libro macha ••• orum cyte name 〈◊〉 callyd • lamyte actibus apostol • rum mesopotanea 〈◊〉 bytwene tigris eest syde eufrates weste 〈◊〉 begynneth north bitwene two hylles 〈◊〉 cancasus hath babylone south syde ¶ ysido ••• libro quinto decimo· though baby •• nia afterward called partye caldea fyrst solempne conteyneth assiria caldea mesopotanea thre londes· chyef cyte babylolonia babylon cyte nemproth grant buylded· semeramis quene afterward made cyte petrus capitulo 37 cyte called babylon londe babilonia though one wel ofte take tour called named babel ocac̄ libro secunde babylon buylded ca • tel walled four walles square al aboute euery walle fyfty cubytes brede four tyme moche heygthe· ¶ leng • euery walle one corner another sixtene myle· walles al aboute foure honderd four score forlonge foure fourty myles walles made brende tile glue stede morter nether water ne fuyre myghte hem shyfte ne depar te ¶ cyte honderd yates diche withoute seen· ¶ ryuer eufrates ranne myddel cyte thurghoute netheles cyrus kynge persida toke cyte afterward destroyed afterward w • eton ¶ iherome sayth releef cyte buylded two g • ete cytees persyda place babilone nowe wyldernes fulle wylde beestes· caldea cassydea hath name casseth nachors sone· nachor abraham brother caldea gre • e kyngdom besides eufrates semaar felde kyngdom toure babel buyld iosephus libro p tour babel buylded two honderd lxxij paas highe lengthe somdele lasse hem b • helde hit neyghe brede moche ¶ r· somme men saye tour thre myle highe ¶but iuo carnotensis seyth cronyke towr fyue myle almoost two honderd paas high four myle broode arabia sette south caldea hath eest syde persida west reed see arabia stoor myrre canel byrde called pheny • northeest porcion arabia named saba called saba saba chus sone saba byclypped • • hre sydes reed see ¶iosephus libro primo arabia contrey madyan is· mount syna mount oreb partye mount syna highe hath grete plente gras leese harde come therto high rokkes scarres ¶moyses fyrst man ladde thyder beestes· hit named also mount couenaunt drede· god almygthy therupon made thondryng lyghtnyng gaf lawe folke israel hille foote noman durste approche puryfyed made clene ¶ treuisa fenyx wonder birde alle kynde one lyue ¶ r contre arabie toward circyus hylle called mon •• bani· hille departeth thre londes sonder· arabia· iude fenys hille ful high snowe lyeth alway somme side hylle certeyn marke token ship men sayllen grete see ledeth hem dyuerse mowthes hauens hit hille helthe plente cypresse cedre tree herbes growen theron droppen gōme smelle swete whiche tree gomme swetnes seke men ben led· venym destroyed· siria hath name cyrus abraham neuew lyeth bytwene water eufrates eest syde grete see weste syde hath north syde armenia capadocia southe syde see named arabicus conteyneth many prouynces ben comagena palestina fenys canaan idumea iudea· iurye damascus somtyme chyef cyte prouynce· eleaser abraham seruaunt buylded made cyte damascus· raysyn kynge damaske helpe awaye ten· lygnages israel ayenst kynges iuda damascus moche saye shedyng blood caym slowe abel hydde hym sonde ¶de regione iudee ¶ capitulum 14 ivdea kyngdom siria partye palestina hath name iudas iacobs sone somtyme called cananea cham no sone eyther ten maner peple iewes put londe· petrus iudea taken many manere otherwhile londe biheste thenne hath name iewes iudas t taken speche grete pompeus made iudea trybutaryes otherwhyle taken royamme iuda· wreton ioseph whan herde archelaus regned iudea· drad goo thyder somtyme taken lotte lygnage iudas· speketh holy wrytte sayth· iudea iherusalem drede ye ¶ gir· tercia iudea lond bihest lengthe therof fro dan bersabee· iherome sayth epistola ad dardanum scarcely hunderd sixty myle lengthe· brede fro ioppen bethlehem scarcely six fourty myle londe ¶ secundum librum numerorum iudea byclypped manere aboute hath southe dede see ¶and thenne stretchith forth sina cades berne vnto streme egypte renneth westward grete see· northsyde hille named moūt taurus est hille moūt libani begynnyng see tyberyadis streme iordan spryngen atte foote mount libany bothe tiberyadis iordan thenne iordan renneth dede see departeth iudea arabie ¶this londe iudea byhoote forn faders· alle paule sayth ad hebreos ¶ alle ben dede receyueden bihestes ¶and muste ther ben two londes biheeste erthly goostly one heuenly iherusalem· erthely iherusalem· whiche erthly iherusalem· heuenly iherusalem bitokened ¶this londe iudea ryche fruyteful hath plente wyn spycerye cedres cypresse bame olyues pomegarnet· palmes fygges mylke▪ hony ¶ bath myddel nauel erthe cyte iherusalem ¶ ysydorus libro quinto capitulo primo iewes seyn sem no sone named melchisedech also made buylded cyte iherusalem no flood called salem afterward people called iebusey dwellyd therinne named iebus thylke two name iebus salem made one name iherusalem afterward salamon called cyte iherosolyma poetes speken shortly callen cyte solyma short • peche helyus adryan emperour callyd cyte helya walled made aboute oure lordes sepulcre somtyme withoute cyte nowe closed withynne· r ¶ netheles semeth iheronimus epistola ad euangelistā presbitum wole saye salem saliin mechisedech made dwellyd inne another cyte iherusalem sayth salem toun besyde sicolim yet called salem • seen palays melchisedech· therof speketh holy wrytte· genesis sayth iacob wente salem cyte sychem • onde canaan de libro primo welle within iherusalem water ben gadred kepte cisternes ffor cyte sette hath north syde mount syon disposed water falleth dounward southward dependaunt toward iherusalem taketh fylthe clene ynowgh renneth cyte maketh fylthe renneth cysternes though lake welle stremes somme therof renneth brook called torrens cedron· maketh brook torrentem cedron wexe wel ¶ toppe sommet mount syon ryal tour made fayrenes defence ¶ the· syde mount syon temple myddel bytwene tour cyte cyte lower tour· therfore ofte holy wrytte clepeth ihrlm doughter syon dougther mayntened defended moder subgette moder cyte lower subgette temple towre also ¶the grete constantynus • ed somtyme chirche holy sepulcre mysbyleued men mysdyde neuer chirche ¶and men suppose· euery yere eester euen· cometh fyre fro heuene tendeth lighteth lampes therin whan myracle began first vncerteyn vnknowen salamō kyng walled cyte somtyme thre walles al aboute netheles strengthe distinction dyuerce maner men dwellden therin prestes clerkes serued temple· ¶ also kyn ge meyne dwelleden within fyrste walle mount syon· seconde walle dwellden prophetes myghty men stalworth speketh holy wrytte olda prophetisse dwellyd iherusalem second distinction within thyrd dwellyd comyn peple men crafte· r fast iherusalem north side temple moūt olyuere plente olyues· seynt augustin super iohannem calleth hylle crisme vnction lyght fatnes hille medecyn fedyng fruyt olyue ful lyght lykyng vnctuous specially hylle mount lyght bischyne lyght sonne alday lyght temple al nyght· hylle salomon whan wexr mad al shrewd loue woman buylde temple highe place maumetrye seyth holy wrytte romanos 2o1o capitulo oute mount ascended criste heuen mount shal deme world atte laste atte foote mount spryngeth brook torrens cedron renneth valeyr iosaphat bytwene brynk torrens cedron mount orchard criste wente ofte bydde praye· orchard criste taken whiche thorpe heet gethsamany mount lytil street preestes heyght bethphage ¶ syde ofthe hylle towne lazar martha marie mawdeleyn· town named bethania hug ¶in north syde mount syon mount caluarye criste deyde rode called golgatha langage siria golgatha moche saye bare sculle whan theuys mysdoers byheded heedes lefte atte laste skulles wexen al bare ¶other wonder temple loke libro regum ysidorus lio decimo quinto capitulo primo also royamme iuda see wyldernes dede see iherusalem two honderd furlonges make fyue twenty myle departeth iudeam palestinam arabiam ysidorus eth̄ libro terc • odecimo lake stretcheth ende iudea fer fro ierico vnto zores arabia seuen honderd forlonges foure score whiche maken foure score fourten myle lake brede 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 honderd fyfthy furlonges· stretcheth nygh contre sodoma lake called lacus salinarum salte made there· also ther moche glu • countrey therfore moeueth notwith wyndes glue withstondeth alway water hath glue stondeth stylle lake susteyneth shippe ne none mater glewed ¶ petrus capitulo quinto nothyng may vndo glue place blood called sanguis menstruus ysidorus libro terciodecimo hit also cleped deed see· see bryngeth forth nothyng quyck lyue receyueth neyther water fowles ne ffysshes quyck thyng dippeth therin· anon leepeth vp agayn alle deede thynges swoloweth fer forth lantern light fletyth swymmeth· lyght queynt dippeth doun deenchith iosephus libro primo assayed knowen grete prynces tyme vaspasianus two men londen hondes byhynde caste anon caste vp agayn· ysidorus libro nono cao tercio royame called pentapolis also fyue wycked cytees dr • int brent asshes somtyme ryche plenteous iherusalem ffor saphirs many precious stone gold also fonde emonge claye londe iob wytnesseth visesimo quarto capitulo ¶ ther semeth somer shadowe lykenes fyre herbis tree appels growen semen fayr ripe hem seeth wylleth hem eten thylke appels fallen anon asshes· ben handled smoken fyre· r ¶ another pentapolis affryca ¶ capitulum 15 canaan royamme siria named canaan canaan childeren fyrste dwellyd therinne no flood conteyned b • nacions alle acursyd herytage cham no sone treuisa cham no sone faders eurs· lowhe fader scorn whan sawe pryue membrys albare vnheled whyle laye sleep r palestina prouynce syria hight somtyme philistea· chyef cyte therof hight philistini· nowe named ascalon cyte prouynce called palestina philistea· men contrey ben called palestini phylystei also speche hebrew no· p· stede p vse ph therfor philistei palestini ben al one· also called allofily saye alyens straunge men· ffor alway alyens straūge folke israel prouynce hath southe syde egypte west tirus north iudea e • ste ydumea ydumea hath name edom· edom ezau alle one iacobs broder ydumea strong londe hylly hote stretcheth reed see· ysidorus libro nono ydumea iacobs welle· welle chaungeth hewe colour four sythes yere thre monethes pale asshes thre monethes reede blood thrid thre monethes grene gras· fourth thre monethes clere water palestina conteyne samaria chyef cyte londe somtyme called samaria called named sebaste samaria hath name hylle called· somer samaria lieth bytwene iudea galilea men dwellyd samaria dryuen oute assirij brought inne assirij holden moyses lawe somme thynges discorde fro iewes also ben called samaryte· saye kepers ffor whan men londe taken ordeyned wardeyns hem sychem hyght sichima also lytil lond samaria hath name sichem emors sone fyrste dwellyd therinne also cyte hight sychem called neopolis cyte iacob bought somtyme moneye grete trauayll· yaf ioseph sone aboue lotte seyth iherome genesis octo decimo capitulo cyte refuge socoure wreton iosue visesimo capitulo londe de tribu lygnage ephraym· th • iosephs bone buryed brought oute egypte wytnes holy wrty •• iosue vltimo capitulo place iosephs bretheren fedden kepte droues flockes bestes afterward abymelech̄ ierobabels sone destroyed place slowe men dwelled therinne sewe salt therinne londe shold nomore bere fruyte corn wittnes· iosue capitulo nono iacobs welle criste rested whan wery weye goyng galylea lond bitwene iudea· palestina double ouer galylea nether galylea ioynen gyders also siria fenicia eyther galylea good lond grete plente corn fruyt grete lake huge prouffytable helthful somme lake grete ful ffysshe men chepe see lake tiberiadis called see tiberiadis genosar lake called also· also weste syde nether galilea toward grete see faste cyte ptholomayda called acre also welle torneth glas alle metal caste therinne· cedar londe ouer syde palestina hath name cedar dwellyd therin cedar ismael oldest sone· ofspryng cedar ismael afterward named ismaelyte also agreani rightfully saraceni come agar ismaels moder serued sara· afterward pryde toke wrongfully name sara called hem self saraceni methodius men haue none hows walke wyldernes dwelle tabernacle tentes· lyue praye veneson men shal somtyme gader gyders goo wyldernes occupye londes aboute eygthe wykes yeres eygthe sithes seuen yere shal ouertorne cytees townes slee preestes defowle clerkes holy place teye beestes tombes holy sayntes shal bifall wyckednes euyl lyuyng cristen men r doyng semeth fulfylled last tyme eraclius themperour whan false prophete machometus occupyed persida· made egypt affryca subgette· wrote brought fals lawe secte sarasyns innermore playn wreton heraclius tyme fenicia londe whiche conteyned two londis tirus sidon hath est syde arabia· south syde reed see north mount libani west grete see· ysid libro 2 ca· 5 phenyx· agenoris sone bitoke reede lettres phenyces ben men fenicia therfor colour called phenyceus· afterward lettre chaunged called punyceus reed huḡ c fenix ffor phenyces fyrst fynders lettres yet▪ wryte capitael lettres reed colour token mynde phenyces fyrste fynders lettres ¶ capitulum 16 egipte hath name egypte danays broder highte somtyme aeria hath eest syde reed se • · south ryuer nylus blac men north grete see ouer partye siria west libia egypte zelde beraynd hath water moysture ryuer nylus ryche corn fruyt marchandyse· petrꝰ capitulo· 94¶ egypte ayenst kynde londes whan hath plente corn bareyn pasture· grasse groweth afterward tyme ben cocodrylly ypotamy also ben water horse egipt hath ceste side grete wyldernesse dyuerce maner beestes wonderly shape· west canopea whiche ilond ende egipt begynnyng libia ther mouth nylus ffor nylus falleth grete see r· though men rede bookes nylus named gyon renneth paradyse yet sayd nylus spryngeth vp west ende ethiopia fer hylle named mon athlas thenne nylus goth • h aboute ethiopia doun egypte ouerfloweth playn countrees egypt cause slyme renneth therwi • h maketh londe fatte good corn fruyt seyth ierome vpon prophete amos goddes owen ordenaunce· nylus ouerfloweth watreth alle londe egypte heepes grauel stoppe cours may lyg • tly falle grete see· hath biflowe watred londe heepes grauel departe falle thenne water falleth chanel agayn renneth grete see netheles ysid seyth libro 13 nylus dryuen agayn let • e cours northeren wynde· water swelleth floweth wexeth grete· beda libro de naturis seyth northeren wynde blowith maye stopped cours water nylus heepes grauel water aryseth ouerfloweth londe whan wynde ceseth grauel shedeth water falleth chanel renneth dounward grete see ¶ capitulum 17 tere take hede two londes eche hem named scicia ouer asia nether europa ouer scicia grete londe north hath moche wildernes cause grete colde chele stretcheth somtyme estward vnto inde northward toward oecean southward hylle caucasus westward vnto germania made lasse endeth west syde hircania whiche londe ben hilles iperborey grete gripes· gold smaragdes precious stones· trogus libro secundo thylke men destyngeth nether marke feldes boundes ne dyches haue none hows dwelle in· wyues childeren lede cartes· ben clothed wyld beestes skynnes wollen clothes vse none· lyue mylk hony recche gold ne syluer make nothynge drede leese accompte trespaas gretter robbery men warre vyctours desire nothyng worship· neuer subget yet ony man ouercame vesor kyng egypte warre bataylle chaced fered darius kynge perce made hym flee sloughe cyrus kynge also destroyed zephirona ryches zephirona grete alysaunders capytayn thryes cōquerd asia· asia afterward hem thousand fyue honderd yere men peple hem self wymmen self· also made kyngdoms dyuerce londes men made perchia bactria· wymmen amasonia kyngdoms myghty strong emonge hem vncerteyn vnknowe whether worthy noble nature kynde· men wymmen first iourney asia dryuen chaced poursewed vasor kynge egypt tornyng agayn abode xv yere make pee asia wyues made grete pleyntes sorow husbondes long home men sente fore torned home dwellyd theyr wyues second iourney men treson slayn wyues toke grete wreche enemyes thyrde iourney men oute absent four yeres geder wyues wedded owne seruauntes bonde men lefte home kepyng beestes whan lordes husbondes vyctorye torned home agayn wyues newe husbondes gadred hem geders arrayed hem grete bataylle fyghte agayn old lordes husbondes coming homeward whan mette gyders fortune vnstable vnstedfaste one one syde efte lordes bithought hem concluded fyghte wyse theyr owne londe men theyr enemyes straunge londes caste away owen armour wepen knygthes bare whippes hondes feered chorles fals wyues broken theyr wedlock shameful deth ffor somme slayn yron somme hanged ful highe iourney pea scicia vnto tyme darius kyng persida thenne darius ouercome scytes men scicia· tornyng homeward ouercome macedones ben men macedonia lond warred vpon athenienses men athene bactria lond cham no sone dwellyd first stretcheth fro see caspius vnto ryuer inde· hath west side mount cancasus south perchia hille cancasus lengest alle eest hilles mooste famous stretcheth fro endes inde vnto hille named mount taurus mount taurus cancasus conteyned al one hylle somme men saye weste syde cancasus toward armenia heyte mount taurus mount cancasus hath north syde see named caspius hircania lond south syde perchia assiria babilon hille cause stretcheth dyuerse contreys londes hath many dyuerse names· hylle highest eest syde whytnes snowe lyeth alway theron· called mon cancasus saye whyte hille ¶ albertus sayth hille highe men dwelle therby seen sonne beme weste syde thre houres within nyght many houres fore day eest syde hille· hircania lond hath eest syde see caspius south armenia north albania west iberia lond· lyeth syde moūt cancasus hath name woode called hircania lond ben dyuerse wyld beestes fowles tigris beeste pantera also londe wyde large hath xliiij maner men somme tyllen londe somme lyuen huntyng· somme eten man flesshe· ben birdes ben called hircane fethers shynen nyght· ¶iberia lond lyeth vnder moūt taurus lyeth westward fast pontus ioyneth armenie albania lond hath est syde see caspius stretcheth dounward mouthes north occean vnto water ben named meotydes men londe ben born whyte heer yelowe eyen peynted seen better nyght daye houndes londe ben grete grym stronge throwe doun bulles sleen lyon one thylke houndes sent kynge alysaunder faught lystes with· lyon olyphaunt wylde boor maystrye gotha nether partye scicia toward circiū· londe gotha lyeth ilonde goclandia ilond hath plente alle maner marchandise hath north syde dacia southe syde occean cleped gothia go iaphets sone men countrey ben redylyer called gothy gogy ben right stronge men grete grym sturne hem come dacies europa setuly affryca amazones asya armenia called also ararath ararath hath name armenyus iasons knyght whiche armenius whan lost iason kynge thessalia gadred knygthes royled aboute toke armenia dwellyd therin· londe stretcheth mount taurus cancasus see caspius vnto capadocia hath lengthe xj· c thousand paas brede vij c· myle ther hille mount ararath no shippe abode no floode ther two armenyes lasse ouerer nether ben two panonyes also ¶ capitulum· 18 capadocia londe nouryssheth fedeth many horse hath eest syde armenya west asia lasse north amazonya south mount taurus ther lyeth scicilia isauria vnto see sylycus stretcheth toward ilond cyprus lasse asia ioyneth capadocia eest syde byclypped closed sydes grete see· hath north syde mouth see called ensinus west mouthe see propontydes southe see egypte· lasse asia conteyneth many prouynces londes fyrste northe side conteyneth bythinia begynnyng vpon see ayenst tracia named also ffrigia· chyef cyte bythinia named nychomedia thenne galathia hath name men gally come atte prayer kyng bithinia helpe hym warris dwellyd londe galathia· tho londe called gallogrecia ¶ men londe gallogreci men medlyd gallys grecis ben called galathe hem poule wryteth epystle ad galathas· ¶ thyrdde lasse ffrigia· hath name frigia europaes dougther agenors dougther frigia named dardania also dardaniꝰ iupyters sone londe cyte troye named ilium also troye named troos erictonius sone dardanius sone iupyters sone ¶ londe hath eest syde lidia west mowth see elespontus fourthe lidia eest syde eeste ffrigia ¶ lidia regned somtyme ryche kyng cresus whan londe lytil two bretheren kynges highte lyddus tirenus hit happened lotte tirenus wente oute many men gate hym lond ouer partye galya called londe tirea semeth see tyrenus hath name kyng tirenus lond lidia hath name broder liddus chyef cyte lidia callyd smyrma cyte seynt iohan euangelyst wryteth thapocalipsis chyef ryuer lidia named pactolus bryngeth forth golden grauel poetes tellen fythe prouynce lasse asia called pamphilia isauria also· chyef cyte londe namod selencia cyte selencus anthyochus buylded arered· thenne scilicia· conteyneth licia called licaonia therin noble cytres lystris derben wreton actibus apostolorum thylke cytees men saylle siria italya chyef cyte alle tharsis dounward toward see amasonia lond somme asia somme eur • pa neygh albania· fyrst amazones wyues gothes toke wrecche husbondes deth traytourly slayne toke prayes slowe men saued wymmen lyued long without husbondes· afterward made hem two quenes one lad ooste mayntened warre· warred faste▪ quene home reuled londe gouerned peple home wymmen helde vnder hand grete dele asia honderd yere atte laste wymmen wold haue childeren· toke husbondes nexte contreys aboute· certayn tymes lete theyr husbondes lye them· certayn tymes absteyned ¶ slewe alle men childeren saued mayde childeren taught hem shote· dedes armes chyualrye grete brestes shold lette hem shote euery mayde seuen yere old brente right breste therfor called vrimamme saye brente brestes named amazones saye withoute breste hercules fyrste chastysed ylle disposicion wommen thenne achilles atte laste grete alysaunder though ysid eth· 14 seyth grete alysander destroyed amazones netheles storye ¶ alysaundre sayth whan kyng alysaunder axed hem trybute thalestrys quene amasones wrote kyng alysander maner· ¶ thi wytte wonder thou desyrest fygthe wymmen yf fortune fauoure v thou ouercome shal grete shame vylonye whan thou art ouercome wymmen yf goddes wroth v thou ouercome v wynne maystrye wymmen thou getest lytil worship ¶kyng alysander plesyd graunted hem fredom sayd wymmen muste ouercome fayrenes loue steornes drede ¶trogus bbro 2 quene thalestrys ben kyng alysaunders lemman fourty dayes torned agayn owen londe afterward short tyme fyl wyth owen peple ¶de affryca et eius prouyncijs ysid libro 14 capitulum 19 alle auctores historyes witnesse affryca hath name affer madians sone abraham sone goten cethura affryca stretcheth forth endes egypt south nether ethiopia vnto hylle athlas closed grete see bothe eeste syde north side also hath west syde weste occean r iosephus libro primo capitulo octauo· ysidorus libro nono sayn affer lad ooste toward libia· ouercome enemyes helpe hercules named men lond owne name affryca hercules wedded ethea affers doughter gate dederym dederym cam pharon· affryca conteyneth many prouynces londes fyrst conteneth west dele ethiopia· thenne libia tripoli getula· numidia two maritania alle nowe ordre speche ethiopia hath thre partyes fyrst hylly mō tuous stretcheth fro mount athlas vnto egypte myddel partye ful grauel thyrdde eest partye almoost al wyldernes partye bytwene south occean ryuer nylus hath reed see eest syde heyte ethiopia colour hewe men lond len blac men grete brennynng heet sonne whiche hem ful nygh ethiopia ben many dyuerse peple wonderly grysly shapen ar named goromantes somme trogodyte whiche ben swyftyer hertes somme curse soune grete heete somme ete serpentes addres somme hunte lyon panters somme dygge caues dennes dwelle vnder erthe make noyse gruntyng chirkyng teth· voys throte ¶ somme goo naked doo werke somme withoute heedes haue mouth eyen breest among somme hem ben foure footed beestes without eeres olyfantes also somme hem haue hound kyng dyuyneth meuyng styryng hym· somme lyue honysoukles dreyd smoke sonne· ther ben also cameleons basylyscus· vnycornes camels· pardes dragon haue brayn heedes many precious stone camelion flekked beste colour lyke lupaerd pardus panthera also somdele kynde pantera frende alle maner beestes sauf dragon alone hym hateth deth· ¶ basylyscus kyng serpentes smel sight sleeth beestes fowles· ysid libro terciodecimo affryca among peple ben called trogodyte welle maketh hem drynke therof haue good voys shry •• clere also emong peple garamantes welle al day cold noman may drynke therof· al night hote noman may touche ¶ libia cirenensis londe hath eeste syde egypte· south ethiopia west perylloꝰ place see call • cirtes tragoditas also north grete see 〈◊〉 libro quinto seyth libia hath name 〈…〉 named lib • wynde bloweth affryca 〈◊〉 libia hath name libia epaphies doughter epaphye iupytres sone ¶ woman libia regned londe libia peple londe heyghte phutey phut chames sone tripolitana regyon hath eest syde ara philenorn antres wyndes peple ben sette bytwene peple trogodyte syrtes syrthes maiores ben perylous place fast grauelly see named mare arenosum ¶ tripolitana hath southe syde getulos garamantes stretcheth vnto occean egypt hath west syde bisancium vnto lake called lacus salmarum north side hath see myddel erthe· peryllous place called sirtes minores lasse sirtes· getula myddel londe affryca hath name gethes folke gothes· omely seynt gregory seyth thylke men haue ffysshers ¶ capitulum 20· nvmidia hath eeste syde sirtes minores lasse sirtes peryllous place see south ethiopia weste mauritania· north see siculus ruscida cartago grete cyte maner arered buyld auctours tellen ysidorus libro quinto decimo capitulo tercio decimo fenyces men fenycia londe wente fro reed see buylded cytees first siria buyld sydon· tirus affryca vtyca· boecia thebe· mouth west occean gades ffor olde tyme fenyces greet marcha • ntes passed dyuerse londes marchaundyse brought resseyued therfor lond place buylde cytees townes ¶ trogus libro octo decimo dido whiche named elissa al wente fenycea wtth grete companye yonglynges chosen sayled fyrste cipris womman dido toke four •• maydens brynge forth childeren come affryca ese reste men wery sayllyng bought moche londe myght beclyppe ox hyde· kytte hyde vnto 〈…〉 ful longe smal beelypte ther 〈…〉 cleped birsa thwonge ¶ysidorus libro quintodecimo ¶ cartada newe toun name chaunged place callid cartago thus cartago buyld lxxij yere fore cyte rome ¶ r papias seyth historyes telle rome buyld fourth yere achas kynge iuda thenne acounte redyly put gyder four yere achas xvj yere ionathas lij yere ozias regned fore achas foleweth cartago founded fyrse yere ozias kyng netheles ysid li 5 eth· magister historia scolastica sayen semeth cartago founded aboute xxxiiij yere kyng dauid marianus sayth cartago buyld iiij yer amazias kyng iuda thenne may stonde virgilius frigius dare histori bataylle troye seyn eneas sawe woman dido eneas deede thre honderd yere er cartago founded dido founded ther another dido older cartago rather buylde therfor seynt austyn libro ·p· confessionū sayth wyse men denyen eneas sawe cartago dido womman therfore orosius li quarto sayth cartago al aboute xxij paas • euery walle xl· cubites highe xxx foote broode cyte byclypped see wel nyghe al aboute oute take faucibus iij·m opend mauritana name two londes fyrste cezarencis hath est side numidia south grauel occean· west ryuer malua north gewys grete see tyngytina laste prouynce affryca hath eeste syde ryuer malua northe see gadytanus west hylle athlas see occean mauritania· hath name mauron blac countrey blak men affryca hylle athlas west syde ende fer occean athlas highe ouer hilles lewde men wenen retcheth mone ther ofte nyght seen fyre fami saturi whiche ben spyrytes thaye • dyuersly shewed also ther ofte herd tymbres pipe trompes augustinus de ciuitate dei l • 18 athlas astronomyen promotheus broder therfore feynen athlas bereth heuen man athlas hille hath name called athlas also· highe lewed men wene bereth heuen ¶ take hede pumpe ni punici punyces also bē called ffenices affri cartaginēses men fenycea affryca cartago woman dido founded cartago comelyng come fro fenycea ¶de europa et eius partibus ¶ capitulum 21 ysidorus libro quarto seyth europa hath name europa agenors doughter kynge libia iupiter kyng creta rauesshed europa agenors doughter europa thyrdde dele wyde world begynneth fro ryuer thanay water meotydes stretcheth dounward north occean vnto endes spayne atte ylond gades byclypped eest also south grete see europa ben many prouynces ilondes shal descryued first take hede north side world water meotydes ryuer thanays departe sonder asia europa ryuer thanays hath name thanas first kynge scicia ryuer thanays begynneth fro hylles ripheis goth doun see myddelerthe ysidorus libro quartodecimo lower scicia londe ful cold· begynneth ryuer thanays stretcheth bytwene ryuer danubius northe occean vnto germania coūtre alama partye lower scicia stretcheth somdele fro water meotydes toward dacian misia londe closed northeest mouth danubius ioyneth southeest tracia southe macedonia weste histria southe weste dalmacia misia good lond corne whete therfor old cereris called berne· sclauia partye misia ¶ ther ben also two londes eyther named sclauia· named properlych sclauonia conteyneth somme ofdalmacia sarmatas hath wylde men see theues ¶ lasse sclauia stretcheth fro wandalia bohemia vnto saxone therinne ben myld men people pannonia hath name penninis alpibus ben hilles ar called alpes thylke hilles departe pannonia ytalia ther another pannonia beyonde water meotydes yonder scicia pānonia hinny wēt hontyng passed long marreys water folowed trace hertes erodotus seyth atte laste fonde lasse pannonia torned home agayn toke with· hem grete strengthe cam agayn lasse pannonia putte oute men therinne called londe hongaria partye therof named bulgaria hath eest side misia southe eeste histria weste alpes hilles named ¶ weste gallia belgyca fraunce northe ryuer danubius germania londe londe bulgaria hath vaynes gold hilles whiche men dygge marble salt good atte beste ¶ degrecia et eius prouincijs ¶ capitulum 22 avctours tellen grece prouynces therof lady kyngdomes noryce knyghthode chyualrye moder philosophie fyndar mayster arte science hath name one grecus regned somtyme netheles londe called comynly ilyricus ¶ men therof ben called greci graij· achei achim argini· acciti ioues ionij ellenes ¶ whan grete constantin made constātinopolim chyef cyte thempyre rome thenne grekes called romanij men newe rome seyth rabanus ¶ vnto • aye grekes romayses somtyme stalworth orped best men armes natheles subget lawes ¶ ysidorus capitulo 17 ¶ londe
