somtyme studye scole pallas minerua· grettese arte seyence knyghthode chyualrye ¶ clergye chyualrye helde geders comyn prouffyte alwaye good • peed ¶ old graij auentured gate many thynges clergye dedes armes vertue keled withdrowhe hem cam afterward passed grekes latyns fore welles ben lake veryly drye chanels without water holde synonys feynyng vlyxes gyle atrenis cruelnes fyghte sleyghte 〈1 page〉 〈1 page〉 cawtelis armure wepen londe grecia fast grete see· conteyneth many prouynces ben tracia lacedimonia macedonia achaia archadia· thessalia elladia boecia tracia called epyrus also epyrote dwel lyd therin hath south syde see egyus west macedonia macedonia dwellyd somtyme dyuerse men hyghte massagete sarinate gothy ysid libo 15 londe welle quenchyth brennyng brondes· tendeth brondes acquenchyd chyef cyte londe constantinopolis est syde openly seen bytwene two see ponticus propontydes openly seen water londe somtyme chyef cyte eeste right rome weste higthe somtyme bisanciū cyt • w libro quarto regum speketh maner grete constantinus bylded made cyte euen pere rome demed emperour shold chyef apostlis chyef namely crowned brought also many relyquyes holy seyntes myght helpe ayenst theyr enemyes ymages false goddes tripodes delphycos appollynes ymages brought scorned spyght behelde hem sawe emperour vouched sauf bylde· chyef cyte thempyre good corne countree· good temprure heuen weder beside londe misia hath grete plente corn fruyte cyte seen shewed alle shipmen sayllen thyderward oute londe come asia europa· wel nygh byclypped al aboute grete see cornerd within clyppyng wally fast see sydr byclypped walle twenty thousand paas therwith heepes huppels stone grauel caste see besydes cyte londe eched made more· also ryuer danubius callid hister also lete lad dyuerce place cyte goters vndrr erthe ¶ maner whan water shal renne cyte men take oute barre water stopped lete water renne stoppen whan hem lyken danubius fyndeth water ynough hunderd stretes· cyte constantinus arered bylded two famous chirches iustinianꝰ emperour buylded afterward thyrd chirche worship diuina sophia oure lord criste agia calleth diuina sophya· englysshe wysedom god men telle werke passeth al buyldyng world noble men telle· ¶ thyder brought seynt helene holy crosse lord criste deyde resten thappostles andrewe iames called frater domini englysshe oure lordes broder resteth mathias prophetes also helyseus samuel daniel also luke euangelist marters ful many also confessours iohan golden mowth vasyleus gregorius nasasenus vyrgyns agatha lucia lacedomonia heyghte spartanya also· prouynce grecia fast besides tracia men prouynce ben called lacedomones lacedomon semelis sone ben callyd spartani also· trogus libro 3 ¶ men somtyme beseged cyte mesena ten yere gyder wery agreued pleyntes grucchyng wyues dradd also longe abydyng home warre bataylle shuld make hem childeren home ordeyned therfor maydens londe shold take yonglynges eueryche other· hoped haue serenger childeren yf euery womman assayed many men ¶ shameful doyng moders childeren goten brought forth maner called spartani· whan xxx· yere old dred de sore nede meschyef· none wyst owne fader therfore take hem leder capytayne one phalantis aracius sone toke leue mode • s· wente forth cast • hether theder dyuerse fortune atte laste cam ytalya droof oute men dwellyd made chyef cyte artarentum macedonia hath name macedo deucalyons neuew called somtyme emathya emathyus kynge hath ee • side see egeus south achaia west dalmacia north misia prouynce hylle mon olimpus departeth two londes tracia· macedonia petrus ca 3· hille passeth cloudes vpprist hylle come clowdes reine ne wynde vpon hille lettres wreton powdrr founden withoute hurtynge wemme atte yeris ende fowles maye lyue ayer clere ¶ philosopher maye dwelle lerne cours sterres withoute sponge watred holden nose thirles make thycker ayer drawe cole wyth herte· ¶ also mon athos retcheth cloude • shadowe hylle arecheth ilond lempnum ilond hylle lxx myle· ¶ dalmacia lond hath eest syde macedonia west histria north misia south see adryaticus achia hath name acheus kynge wel neyghe ylond closed see· hath eeste syde see tirenus· north see creticus southe see ionius • west ioyneth macedonia attica· chyef cyte londe named corinthus kynge alysaunder gadred hoost wynne al world thyder paule wrote pistel ad corintheos archadia heygte scicionia also hath name archas iupiters sone angle corner achaia lyeth bttwene two see ionius egens shapen playn leef· albeston • wole neuer quenche one sette fyre· ben also whyte ousel though ousel black emonge v ther ben whyte ¶ thessalia ioyneth southsyde macedonia somtyme achylles countrey began laphyte thylke men chastysed tamed horse firste brydles satte backes therfore lewde pepple supposed al one body man horse satte vpon ¶ therfore hunderd horseman thessalia called centauri· name gadred tweyne centum honderd aura wynde· name hem gyuen centauri honderd wynde waggers wagged wynde faste redyng ¶ trogus li 14 ¶ prouynce hille pernasus poetes acounte hille noble famous hangeth two copped stone toppe therof temple delphicus appollyn wendyng myddel playn pytte oute pytte philosopher euspired dyuerse answer yeuen oute pytte therfor yf noyse men trompes sownen valeye stone answere eueryche ¶ diuerse ecco sowned ¶ ecco reboundyng noyse ysidorus libro tercio decimo prouynce ben two ryuers sheep drynke one shal wexe blac sheep drynke shal wexe whyte yf drynke bothe shal wexe splekked dyuerse colour also prouynce ben thylk likyng place walke philosophres poetes callē tempore florida· lykyng place floures place wryten theodolus ouidius ¶ also prouynce thyrdd particuler flood fylle deucalyons tyme prynce londe prynce saued men fledde hym shippes bootes therfore poetes feyned wyf pirra caste stone made men ¶ elladia londe hath name ellena kyng deuo • lyon sone pirras also ellena grekes called ellenes· londe named attyca also athys grauius dougther· lyeth bytwene macedonia achaya ioyneth northe side archadia· londe grecia hath two partyes boecia y one peloponensis chyef cyte londe called athene somtyme grete studye lecture clergye men alle nacions londes come theder lerne athene cyte buyld maner aug de ci li 18 ¶ tyme egypte sme • god almyghtyes wretthe vnder moyses hande somme egypciens dradde beste egypte shold loste fledde egypte londes cicrops fledde oute egypte grecia buylded cyte attenes called afterward athenes· maner barr • seyth· olyu • sodenly seen cyte attenes· water braake oute sodenly another place ¶thenne cycrops axed counseyl appolyn· delphycus maumete mount pernasus axed shold mene answerd sayde olyue bitokened goddesse min • rua water betokened neptunus sayde power choyse cyteseyns whether ·ij goddes cyte shold named therfor cytezeyns men wommen gadred hem gyders manere tyme· bothe men wymmen shold come comyn counseil thenne counseyl men yaf dome neptunus wymmen minerua ther one womman moo men mynerua maistrye cyte called name athene ffor mynerua speche grue called athena then̄e neptunus wroth wode made flode • see tarise ouerflowe hele londes athene • uels maye lyghtly doo suche chekkes thenne plese 〈…〉 abate wrath anger wymmen punysshed b • double payne one woman shold afterward come comyn counseyl ¶that payne childe shold afterward bere mod • e name· ¶ prouynce ellaida lyeth ele • pontus grete mouth· grete see hath name· elle ffryxus suster fledde malyce pursiewte stepdame drowned mouth see· happe • hat see londe aboute named elle elespontus ¶varro seyth fast besides place ben men hele smytyng serpentes touche spotyl trogus libro secundo ¶athemensis men athene vsed fyrst crafte wolle wyne oyle taught eere sowe ete acornes florysshed fyrst lore clergye lawe ¶ fyrste kynge londe hight cycrops hym come granus hight granans also· thenne sone athys yaf name londe cleped hym self atheniensis ¶thenne athys regned amphygyonydes tyme wa • grete flood thessalia thenne afterward kyngdom descended erictonius· hym regned egeus hym sone theseus theseus sone demophon helpe grekes ayenst troyans boecia ¶oxe lond name bos oxe· whan cadmꝰ agenores sone faders heste sought suster europa iupiter rauesshed myght fynde dradde faders wratthe coude none rede fledde· outlawe hapned folowed foote oxe fonde place oxe laye called boecia buylded cyte thebe· cyte bella ciuilia debanuerunt appollo born hercules thylk thebanus also ¶in londe lake wonderful wode· drynketh ther shal· brenne wodenes lecherye· ther ben also two wellys londe drynketh one shal foryetful drynketh other· shal haue good mynde ¶ petrus· take hede men thebe egypte ar called thebei men thebe grecia ar called thebani men thebe iudea ben called thebyt • ¶ capitalum 23 ysydorus libro quartodecimo rede storyes grekes dwellyd somtyme italia called londe grete grecia londe hight somtyme hesperya hespera sterre ladde grekes whan saylled theder lodesterre· hespera venus afterward londe hight saturnia saturnus dwellyd saturnus hydde hym self londe drede owne sone iupiter called londe lacium saturnus hydles· londe hyghte ¶eusonia eusonius vlixes sone· ate laste londe called ytalya italus rege siculorum kynge scicilia noblest prouynce al europa closed north side mouth see tirenus· west sydes hylles hight alpes thylke hylles spryngen thre noblest ryuers al europa ben called ryuer danubius· rone· ysid libro tercio decimo ¶in italia cetheroes welle heleth sore eyen ther also lake clitorius drynketh lake wyn shal hym greue ¶plenius libro secundo capitulo • todecimo ¶ faste hilles ben called alpes apennini welle nouacius welleth spryngeth hoote somer drye fordryeth cold wynter wete ¶ treuisa alpes appennini ben penitus hilles hanibal grete duke heygthe penitus also wente alpes rome therfor two name alpes penitus one name shortly made appennini ben many lettres lefte two ¶paulus libro secundo italia ben many prouynces londes ben called calabria apulia campania beneuentana tuscia emilia liguria lumbardia calabria apulia parte italia· lyeth estward vpon see departed ilond scicilia arme see· grekes first buylded therinne chyef therof brondus • um hath name worde grue brunca hertes heede cyte shapen hertes hede fro then men saylle holy londe· ¶ londe apulia ben hote wellys holsom· com • ania lond myddel bytwene demaynes rome apulia chyef cyte therof capna hath name capacitas ablenes receyue take cyte receyueth taketh ynough alle plente· counted thyrdde cyte moost famous cytes rome cartago londe ben famous cytees nothelis puteolis ther ben vyrgyls bathe somtyme grete worship another lasse campania gallia senosenci ffruūce· chyef cyte campania called trecas trecensis also troy champayn r italia somtyme dyuerse lordes eueryche grekes ianus saturnus italus eneas ofsprynge afterward gally senosences ben ffrensshe men vnder duke brenius thenne afterward aboute yere grace four honderd gothy hynny wandaly atte last vnder yere grace fyue honderd echt fourty ¶ prynce tyme iustinus narcencartularius prayde longobardy come italia longobardy yet daye hyther side ytalia alpes wel nyghe rome beyghte lombardia longobardy cam name paulus romanus dyaconus primo libro historye longobard seyth maner wynnyli highte longobardi also haue name longe berdes wente two duke ibor ayon moder gambara ful redy wyse oute scandinauia ilond germania northsyde ¶this scandinania called ylond see playn the· brynkes alway wasshen wawes oute therof wente winnily werryd scormyga ouercome wandales thenne deyed ibor ond aion made hem kyng agelmundus aions sone whiche regned ouer hem xxxiij yere▪in tyme· comyn woman seuen childeren one burthen shal clerely shewed one hem named lauissius second kyng longobardys regned agelmundus ¶ whan agelmundus kyng bolde vpon owen truste bulgaris cam vpon hym nyght slowe hym standyng hym lethen regned thyrdde kyng longebard regned fourty yere hym hyldecoc ¶after hym fyfthe gudehoc regned odocaes tyme italycus ladde men lond rugorum hym sixthe claffo ¶ hym seuenth cato waccho slough cato outlawed sone euermore· waccho cato broders sone whan waccho deed sone waltarycus eygthe kynge longobardys regned seuen yere hym· ix· audoenus ladde first longobardes pannonia hym sone albuynus x kynge longobardes narses patricius prayde kyng albuinus come men take ytalia iustinus thēperours tyme yere oure lord v clxviij longobardes dwellyd pannonia xlij yere albuins conqueste and· wonderful ende· seche within forth place aboute yere lord· v c· lxx ¶de vrbe romana ¶ capitulum xxiiij avctours wryten tellen cyte rome buylded tuscia partye italya fondacion therof gouernynge auctours wryte many dyuerse doynges specially martinus de condicione eius magister vero gregorius wōdres cyte wryteth shortly many thynges ben worthy kept mynde ¶ martinus wryte many kynges regned aboute place rome eustodius sayth toure babel buylt men bigonne speke dyuerse tonges langages ¶ noe certayn men toke ship saylled italia buylded cyte name ended lyf ¶thenne ianus iaphets sone no sone buylded ianiculum yonde ryuer tiberis nowe chirche seynt iohan heyght seynt iohans chirche ad ianiculum tyme nemproth hight saturnus also whiche gelded owne sone iupyter come forseyd ianus kyngdom buylded cyte capitol ¶also italus tyme kyng sciculis men scicil • come ianus saturnus buylt cyte fast ryuer albula ryuer called tyb • r ryuer rome ¶ also hercules italus sone buylded cyte named galeria bynethe capytol· ¶ tiberis kynge come oute este· euander kyng archadia buylded cytees vyrgylius acordeth herto seyth thē ne fader euander rome maker towres thenne afterward come romulus closed within one walle alle thylke cytees aboute made one grete cyte alle closed one brought gentilmen noble oute ytalia theyr wyues dwelle therinne ¶titus ¶whyle cyte poure place holy· ne rycher good ensample afterward ryches gadred encreaced syn haue ben coueytous lecherous· ¶marcus ¶two bretheren born one burthon remus romulus buylden rome hille palatinus buyld xj kalendes maye· tho bigan vij olimpus fyrste yere achaz kynge iuda four honderd liiij yere takyng troye ¶r veryly solynus seyth· four honderd xxxiiij takyng troye marc̄ whiche cyte rome afterward wonderly highte walles toures yates tēples· palays· dyuse wōderful werkes walles thre honderd lxj towres conteyneth two twenty myle without yonde tiber cyte leonina men seyn conteyneth al aboute two fourty myle alle ·xvj pryncipal yates ten thishalf tybre named port capu • na· port apia· port latina port asmaria port matronij port leuycana port numentana port salaria port princiana port colina also yonde tybre ben thre yates· thre cyte leonina gregorius emong wonder cyte yet ben seen seyth grete wō dre many defensable towres many buyldynges palayces whether wycchecraft mannes dede r ben veryfyed versis hildebertus episcopus cenonean made willelmus malmēsb putteth hem book kynges foloweth rome nothyng pere though thou neygh al fallyng be▪ alle thou shewest thy bounde· grete thou whan thou sounde ¶de palacijs rome many palayces ryal noble buylde rome worship emperours noble men also among whiche grettest moost palays alle myddel cyte tokē one principalite world wyde also palays pees· therin romulus dyde sette owne ymage gold sayde hit shal neuer falle til mayde bere child ymage fylle whan criste born dioclisians palays hath pylers highe stone caste grete c men al yere worchyng shold vnneth hewe one thylk pylers also palays sixty emperours· yet stondeth part therof al rome may destroye de templis pantheon temple mawmetrye chirche alle halowen cause lady criste chyef holyest alle mankynde chirche hath name lady called sanctum maria rotunda round chirche lady hath brede space ij c·lx· foote faste temple arche marble arche augustus cesars victoryes grete dedes arche ben alle grete actes descryued ther also scipions arche· ouercome hauibal atte seynt steuen piscina temple olouitreum made cristal gold astronomye grauen peynted sterres signes heuene seynt sebastian destroyed temple· also capitol arayed glas gold myrour alle world aboute consul senatours gouerned rewlid alle world moche power iupyters temple temple iupyters ymage fyn gold syttyng trone r takehedr thre temple rome flamynes bisshops serue fals goddes mametrye highte flamynes filamynes filo threde bonde aboute heede whan myght holy day suffre pylyons cappes hete iupyters temple serued fflamen dialis day bisshop· iupyter cleped diespyter fader day also mar temple flamen marcialis mar bisshop ¶and romulus temple flamen quyrinalis quirinus bisshop· romulus called quyrinus also ¶de domibus ¶in rome hows made wel nyghe al gold lefette • precious stone ¶ men sayde hows worth wel nygh thyrdde part al world hows euery lond prouynce ymage sette nigromancie eueryche thylke ymages bare owne londes name wreton breste cokerbelle syluer honged aboute neck yf ony lond rebelled aroose ayenst rome anon image londe torned bak toward ymage rome belle necke shold rynge preestes kepte hows eueryche cours warned prynces doynge ther also horsman bra highe coppe hous meued also spere hond· tourned poynt spere towarde lond wold arryse· ¶ romayns myght lightly come vpon theyr enemyes vnware hows also fyre man myght quenche men axed craftes man made it· longe shold endure· answerd fayde hit shold endure euermore vnto mayde born child nyght criste born that· hows fylle fyre quenchyd nyght tyme also beaneus appollo man closed confeccion brymstōn blak salt vessel brasse sette fyre candel halewed manere· made bath bathyng place al way hoote also hows ymage yron named bellefrontes ymage whiche weyed fyftene pound hors sat henge ayer poste ne piler bynethe vnder sette ne holde cheyne aboue adamante stone vawte in· arch aboute drowhe euen yron eueryche syde yron ymage myght dounward ne vpward ne toward neyther side henge alway euen mydde ¶de artificijs a· place rome eraclea called theatrum· place stonde sytte inne loke wel aboute wonderly grauen cabans dennes dyuerse outgoynges bench seges al aboute· hoole sound al marbel stone· werk sette vppn vj crabbes hewē hard marbelst one place may noman pryuely speke ne hym self ne another man alle sayth herde al aboute ¶ fast augustus cezars palays awalle made brente tile stretcheth dounward hyghe hilles yate porte asmaria wall made vpon grete arch huge wal stretcheth dayes iourney rome grete conduyte vpan walle watres stremes welles montaynes rennen rome· thenne departed dyuse conduytes pipe bra ran somtyme euery palays rome water tiber hoolsom good hors vnhelsome euyl men therfor old romayns made fresshe water come foure partes cyte weyes craftely made therof men myght take al wold whyle comins rome floures wal bath bianeus made whiche bath spoken fore albisterio place hight mutatorium cezaris made whyte stole emperours also ther candelstyk made stone higthe albeston whan one yteyned sette fyre sette without ther coude noman quenche crafte men coude deuyse r ¶ maner myght geant pallas aboute yere oure lord thousand fourty· yer founde rome geants body buryed hool sound space woūde four foote longe half· lengthe bodye passed heygthe walles hys heede founde lanterne brennyng alwaye noman coude quenche blast ne water ne crafte vnto tyme made lytil hoole vnder lighte bynethe ayer myght entre men seyen turnus slowghe geant pallas whan eneas fought lauina eneas wyf geantes epytaphium wrytyng mynde hym laye thys pallas euanders sone lyeth here· hym turnus knyght spere slowhe manere ¶ de statuis et signis ¶ rome bulle· bra shap iupiter ouercast shape men loked theron bulle semed lowhyng startelyng· ther also ymage venn al naked maner venus shewde self man paris somtyme troye craftely made mouth lippes whyte ony snowe semed fresshe blood newe ther also rome wonder copped pyler romulus piler pyler pylgryms palmer fast can· lye calle hit seynt peter corn hupple sayen whan nero themperour rauisshed hit torned hylle stone grete byfore corne emonge alle pilers iulius cezars pyler moost wonderful hath heyghte two honderd fyfty foot coppe therof round thyng bra ben iulius cezars bone asshes pyler arche ben verse made ben thus menynge namely ouermest stone yf stone one telle craft brought hym vpon yf many stone telle ioynen ones· arche pyler founded sette vpon four lyon pylgryms ful lesynges calle arche pyler seynt peter nelde lye saye thylk man clene synne may crepe vnder stone· ¶ ther ben also rome two grete horse marbel stone tiberius tyme two yonge philosopher praxitellus fibia come rome yeden al naked whan themperour axed hym wherfor wente naked answerd sayde haue forsaken al thynge al thyng v naked bare openly knowen ye sir emperour alle thou spekest counseyl pryuete know atte beste ¶treuisa first poynt doyng answere techeth forsaketh al thynge forsaketh clothes· foloweth ben wel clothed goth aboute beggeth gadreth money corn catel men forsaketh al thyng r themperour assayde fonde soth al sayde owen prayer made mynde hem two grete horse marbel· another signe token byfore pope palays horse bra man sittyng theron holdeth righthonde though spake peple holdeth brydle lyft honde hath cucko bytwene hors heeres seke dwerf vnder feete pylgrymes clepen man theodoricus comyns calle hym constantinus clerkes of· courte calle hym marcus quintus cursius also· signe stoode somtyme fore piters awlter· capitoyl vpon four pilers bra seynt gregory threwe doun hors man sette hym fore pope palays call hym marcus tell reson skylle dwarf kynred mesenis craft nygromancie whan subdewed kynges dwellyd nygh hym made hym subgette hym thenne wente rome warre romaynes crafte· bynam romayns power▪ myght smyte biseged hem long tyme closed within cyte dwerf wente euery daye tofore soune rysyng felde doo crafte whan romayns espyed maner doyng dwarf spak marcus noble knyght bihighte hym lordship cyte memorial mynde euermore yf wolde deffende· hem saue cyte then̄e marcus made hool thurgh wall longer daye abyde craft cache dwerf· whan tyme cucko sange warned hym daye thenne marcus reysed cause myghtnot hitte dwerf wepen caught hym honde bare hym cyte drede leste sholde helpe hym self crafte yf myght speke threwe hym vnder hors foot hors alto trade hym herfore ymage made remembraunce dede calle ymage signe quintus cursius telle skylle reson ther somtyme myddel rome grete clyfte hoole erthe oute hool come smook brymstone slewe many men· thenne quintus cursius toke counseyl phebus armed hym· entred hool· thenne anon fleygh cuckou oute hool· thenne erthe closed gyder hool stopped another signe colloseus ymage called also ymage sonne rome grete wonder myght yoten arered ymage grete lengthe therof six score foot six ymage somtyme ybond herodius fyften foot heygher heyghest place rome ymage bare right honde spere al round shape world· lyft hond swerd bytokeneth myght batayll· token lasse maystrye wynne conquere kepe saue conquerd wonne ymage bra ryally ouergylt shone derknes yaf grete bemes light· also meued aboute sonne suche maner alwaye face toward sonne alle romayns come therby worshipped ymage token subiection thraldome ¶seynt gregory destroyed ymage fyre ffor myght destroye strengthe ¶of ymage left heede right hond holdyng spere roundenes likenes worlde al ymage lefte nomore vnbrente heed honde ben nowe fore pope palays vpon ij pylers marble· wōderly craft milting bra yoten heere semeth softe mannes sight mouth though spekyng ¶ polier •• bro secundo ¶for highte noblete cyte romayns made woman ymage bras· • hat ymage h • ld 〈◊〉 honde spere shape wyde worlde ¶and whan • e ymage ful made hym semed legges feble bere suche ymage hit grete huge craftes man hit made answerd sayde legges shal dure alway • ere ymage beste neuer fayll vnto mayde bere child legges faylled ymage fylle doun whan criste born faste vaspasianus palais stone called parius stone coruen whyte sowe xxx pigges giue water hem wesshe also tabel bra forbedeth synne therin ben wreton chyef poyntes lawe· ther ben wreton reules metre· menyng therof vnderstādē writing neext folowyng· euery nyght cocke waketh som man er dawe al songe flocke· maye lyke noman lawe· whan somer hote· throstle syngeth mery note whan daye goth away birde stylle leueth laye· towne longes osul twiterith mery songes ¶ nyght drede truly songe doth grede whan floure spryngeth rote· nyghtyngale note twiterith wel fawnyng swete songe dawnyng· thral maketh fare mouth thenne chiterith stare morow songe kynde· haue euen mynde ¶ de quibusdam romanorum institutis et obseruancijs ysidorus eth libro octodecimo capitulo de triumphis et hug capitulo tris ¶ capitulum 25 whan duc kynge consul emperour hadde ony grete voyage vyctorye come rome comyng sholde receyued thre manere worship alle people sholde come ayenst hym al solempnyte myrth comforte ioye couthe make alle prysonners shold folowe chare hondes bounden byhynde backes· vyctour shold hem self iupiters cote sitte chare four whyte horse shuld drawe vnto capitoyl ¶therof speketh ouidius four horse al snow whyte thou shalt syre emperour wende yet amonge al worship· sholde foryete hym self one anoye hadde chorle hym chare smote hym alwaye nekke two skylles one sholde proude grete worship· ¶ skylle euery man shold hope come worship made hym self worthy dedes ¶ whyle chorl smote vyctour shold ofte saye hym maner notho solitos saye knowe thy self seyth proud worship also daye euery man leue saye vyctour someuer wolde· blame sholde take therfore many dispyteous wordes saide iulius cezar toke therof maner wreeche· one sayde iulius siche tyme salue calue hayl balard· another sayde hayle kyng quene· r loke within iulius cezar vita iohis elemosinarij whan themperours rome crowned sholde come hym craftes men make tombes axe hem maner stone metal shuld make theyr tombes seyth thou shalt deye gouerne myldely people ¶hug capitulo clarus whan romayns wold warre ony londe one sholde goo thendes lond clerely declare shewe mater· cause warre declaracion called clarigacion thenne spere pyght londe warned romayns wold warre ¶ ysidorus libro 19 capitulo visesimo secundo whyle consul rewled rome· knyghtes rome sholde reed clothes daye fore sholde fyghte shold knowe abasshed whan sawe reed blood renne clothes suche knyghtes named rosati clothed rooses r take hede papie seyth virgyle calleth romayns togati ben men clothed gownes thre maner gownes vsed called pretaaxta palmata candidata first maner gowne pretaxata gentilmēs childeren vsed xiiij· yere old second maner palmata vsed vyctours noble dedes third maner goun candidata vsed· lordes maystres ruler lawe hug ca fastus dayes romayns wel spedde named fasti leueful leeful hem thylk dayes vse dyuerse doyng dedes dayes romayns myspedde called nephasty leeful· heelde thylk dayes wrought loue ne deuocions drede euyl happes hug ca 5 feste thylk dayes called quinquatria fyue black dayes sorow bytternes romayns whan frensshemen hanybal beseged al aboute then̄e romain durst one goo toun·· hug c classis whan romulus ordeyned comyn prouffit • e departed sondre grete mene cleped either partye classis worship hem ordeygned moneth called mayus moneth grete· men· mene men called second classis worship hem ordeygned moneth called iunius moneth yonger men ¶ afterward romayns departed four partyes fyrste partye consul doctours· second classis tribuni men of· lasse dignite third men· fourth bondman tribunꝰ receyueth tribute paieth knyghtes leder or· capitain thousand knyghtes hight tribunus ¶hug c calon romayns vsed somtyme euery monethe make fayre fayr began fyrste daye nonas dured fyrst day idus idus moche saye delyng departyng thenne fayr departed also begynnyng oftyme vnknowe marchauntes chapman therfor first day moneth hight kalende calo calas calle crrye· cryour shold stonde vpon tour· many dayes day begynnyng fayre shodd crye calo therfore somme moneth kalender hath foure nonas somme hath sixe theues hidde wodes aspye chapman shold knowe whan fayr shold bygynne hug ca mereor somtyme knyghtes were· lx yere old compellyd doo dedes armes· men yaf hem feldes townes somwhat ellys comyn tresorye wherby shold lyue thenne suche knyght cleped emeritus emerite milicie knyght sette oute nedeful dedes chyualrye ¶ r therfor anatarn yonde tiber heyght emerytor • suche knyghtes spente fore goten ywonne ¶ hug· ca lita vsage rome cytezeyns shold doo elli fore none dispute comyn prouffyt· therfor comin wymmen rome cleped nonarye shold fore none goon oute comyn place leste shulde lette yonge men comyn prouffyt hug ca nepa ¶somtyme rome fader moder shold norysshe teche owne childer • n supposed wold tendre chastyse bete hem neyther maystres· al straunge oute kynne shold teche childeren rome lest wold recche lytil childeren bete hem sore therfor maystres shold teche childeren rome neygh ne ferre owne kynne hug capitulo· proles¶ somtyme rome serueth nought elles gete childeren dwellyd alway cyte compelled dedes armes suche men cleped proletarij saye geters childeren r netheles hanybals tyme constreyned sor goo scarsenes knyghtes vale libro 2 ¶ honderd yere lx cyte buyld deuorse made bytwene man wyf netheles carbilius bastart first lefte wif womā bareyn though semed meued reason yet al blamels put couetise child foxe feyth wedlok ¶ysidorus li 6 though grekes wryte first waxe poyntels yron romayns ordeyned noman shold wryte poyntels yron poyntels boone ¶ poli libro secundo ¶ wyl loke bookes storyes amonge alle men syth rome fyrste made shal fynde romayns moost couetous proud shal finde also maystrie world gate hit punysshyng peple false wyles gyle ferfoth vnnethe ony prynces lyued lyf kyndely ende· therfor euery romayn ouercometh ouercome flateryng fayr wordes yf wordes faylle yeftes shal hym welde yf yeftes faylle worship maketh hym prysoner pol· libro septimo decimo capitulo 11 whyle cytees ytalia loued pee worshipped right wysenes leued false othes thenne lykyng welthe owen londe· whan yeue hem falsehed strif anon pryde romayns wodenes duche men somme wrecbe god almyghty falleth vpon hem vnto tyme amende penaunce contrition trespaas peple putteth away al pryncipalyte maketh prynce mylde ¶ de germania et eius prouyncijs ysid ech̄ 14 ¶ ca 26 ysidorus sayth germania hath eest syde mouth ryuer danubius south ryn ryuer north west see occean· ther ben two londes eyther called germania· ouer germania stretchith besides alpes mouth· cost grete see called adriaticus· see lake contreys aqu • lia germania lower toward weste aboute ryne· comynly called almania trutonia· eyther germania ben many prouynces londes· ben boemia westfalia bauaria thuringia sueuia saxonia· franconia lothangia frisia selandia ¶paulus libro p north contre fer sonne holsome men dwelle able brynge forth childeren therfore multipli • acion encreace men childeren north contre south ful nygh son̄e · vnholsō seke • ew men dwelle though euery londe contre haue owne proper name ¶netheles alle countrey londe ryuer thanays vnto west called germania hit gendreth bryngeth sorth mo men childeren maye wel sustene· therfore ofte goon dyuerse men syde world londes lotte ayenst wille good wille gete londes dide gothi wandali saxones· wynnily longobardi boemia firste prouynce eeste germania hath eest syde misia alania southe ryuer danubius pannonia west bauaria turingia north northweste saxonia closed almost hilles wodes hath grete plente leese grasse smelleth ful swete dyuerse wylde beestes· emong whiche one beeste called booz langage boemia· deffē deth hym self horne hath large ryuel bagge vnder chynne therinne gadreth water heteth rennyng skaldyng hoote throweth vpon hunter houndes poursiewe hym skaldeth heere hem brenneth hem ful sore ¶ thuringia hath eeste boemia weste franconia northe westfalia southe ryuer danubius ¶ franconia myddel prouynce germania hath eeste thuringia west sueuia north partye westfalia south bauaria ryuer danubius bauaria hath eest ryuer danubius retica westfalia hath est side saxonia west frisia north occeā south partye fraūce sueuia· sueuia hath eeste bauaria weste ryuer called ryne north partye franconia· southe rethica alpes saxonia hath eeste alania west westfalia north occean· men countre ben lighter strenger see scommers theuys see pourfiewe enemy ful hard bothe water lond ben called saxones saxum stone ben hard stone vnesy fare hylles saxonia wel nygh al maner metal founden referued tyn ¶ germania ben saltwelles whiche welles salte made whyte ony snowe ¶ faste hylle copper digged grete hylle whiche hylle stone smelle sweete violet ¶ also faste monasterye seynt michel marble founden fayrest may be· beda c visesimo quinto old saxones haue kyng many knyghtes· owne rule· ¶but tyme batayll cast lott knyghtes shal leder capitain folowe hym chosen lott chyef lord mayster duryng bataylle whan batayll thē ne shal byfore· wete alle lyche grete power myght pleuius libro quinto frisia lond vpon coste west occean begynneth south syde fro ryne endeth atte see denmarke· ¶ men frisia ben highe shauen aboute euer gentilman noble higher shorn men ben fayre bodye cruel bolde herte vse speres stede arowes loue fredom moost ony thynge therfor suffre noman kynght wold lord netheles ben· gouerned ruled dome men iuges euery yere chese hem self owne iuges loue wel chastyte kepe besily childeren suffre hem marie til foure twenty yere old therfor haue stronge stalworth childeren haue wodes therfor make hem fyre turues ¶ • landia lytil londe vpon see whiche renneth thurgh londe causeth xvij ilondes eueryche shippe may saylle hath est holandia north frisia west occean south flandria enuironed water highe bankes bolde oute rysynge see floodes good cornlond scarsete tree rote may take depenes ne farnes saltnes erthe ¶the men ben grete bodye mylde herte ¶paulus libro primo· west syde germania people called scribonius hath snowe al somer tyme eteth rawe flesshe ben clothed ghoot buk skynnes countrey whan nyght short men may see alle nyght sonne bemes after· wynter whan daye shorte though men see light sonne yet sonne seen item fast beside peple scribonius vnder clyf occean denne vnder highe stone· therinne slepen seuen men haue longe slept ben hool sound body clothyng al withouten wēme ffor cause comyn peple haue hem grete worship reuence ar supposed romains clothing ther mā somtime couetise wold stripe one hem· haue clothyng forwith arme waxed al dreye may god list kepe hem hool sound mysbyleued men tyme comyng shuld thurgh hem cō uerted torned good byleue ¶ de gallia et francia r ¶ capitulum 27 • wreton storyes gallia ffrancia hath name gallia whytenes peple ¶ gala w •• de grewe lac latyn mylke englysshe •• rfor sibilla called hem gallos whyte sayth mylky neckes ben wesshen gold ¶hug· capitulo gala dyuersite heuen diuersite •• lours face quantite gretenes bodye maners wytte· therfore rome ben heuy men· grece light· affryca gyleful gallya wytty men wyse r¶ take hede augustinus de ciuitate dei libro secundo capitulo quinto toucheth gally one maner speche preestes temple goddesse hight cibeles· haue name londe gallia ryuer gallus frigia alle dranke ryuer shold wexe wood alle gelded mynde child athis thylk goddesse cibelis loued al myght· child waxe wood gelded hym self fraude gyle goddesse cibeles sayth ouidius de fastis galli ben franci frensshe men entropius libro 2 seyth gally ben wel hasty bodyes passen comyn stature men foūden assaye gally ben hasty stronge fyrste refe bront afterward fyghtyng ben feble wymmen ben like alpes gretenes body somwhat like snowe lyeth vpon alpes breketh oute swote melteth heete fyghtyng snowe doth hete sonne git capitulo septimo decimo thenne gallea partyes al hoole hath northe side germania eest ryne southest alpes west see occean called bothe britā nycus gallycus englysshe frensshe departeth englond fraunce· south see myddel erthe wessheth aboute· prounce narbon ¶ iulius cezars tyme gallia departed thre ¶ dyuerse happes bifelle afterward lond countrey lond stretcheth ryne seyne one ryuer called gallia belgyca fraunce countreye stretcheth then ryuer leyr called· gallia lugdunensis· ¶ ouer partye therof heyghte burgundia nether partye called neustria· countreye stretcheth ryuer leyr water geronde called gallia acquytanyca guyan stretcheth eeste fro ryuer roen vnto west occean ouer partye therof heyght celyca heuenly hye cause hye montaynes ben therinne fro ryuer gerond see myddel erthe montaynes called monte pyrenij grete hilles spayne cleped gallia narbonenses· somme therof called gothia somme vasconya gascoyn· gallya al hoole 〈◊〉 closed thre noble water ryne north • yde rone est bruttyssh occean weste side gallea ben many quareys noble digge stone beside paris grete plente manere stone called gipsus called whyte plastre also ¶ whan stone brente tempred water torned plastre thenne men make therof ymages walles chambres· paments dyuerse manere werkes dure longe ynowgh ther fayre floure cyte paris noryce thewes· boteler lettres shinyng europa athene dyde somtyme grecia ¶ giraldus p frensshe men ben callyd franci also many men strengest europa come troians troye taken· antenor men fled away water hight paludes meotydes ryuer thanays dwellyd pannonia bulde cyte callyd sicambria cyte alle afterward called sicambri· anthenors deth ordeyned hem two leders capytains trogotus franco thylke franco afterward called franci turpinus de gestis karo •• seith whan kyng charles made spayne subgette come home paris agayne· made bonde men gallia free worship seint iames seint denys shuld euery yere offre foure pen chirche werke seint denys called franci sancti dionifij saye seint denys free men· cam aboute gallia called francia cause fredom men tellen valentilianus themperour called hem franco ferancos sterne wyther langage attica grecia· sicambri ben frensshe men tributary rome longe tyme fore valentinianus tyme also whan alani men allania enemyes rome· sicambri tribute foryeuen ten yere warre ayenst men allania whan ten yere alani ouercomen romayns axed tribute sicambri warned wold none paye therfor valentinianus emperour warred vpon hem grete hooste vyctorye thenne myshappe sicambri sore wroth warred londes rome also londes subgett rome also therfor sicambri afterward called franci feranci wyther sterne duc franco called franci francoes men· also fredom kyng charles yaf ben named franci free mē mene treuisa euer come name franci ben frensshe men hight sicambri· gally al one peple sicambri gally franci ffrensshe men ¶r franci made hem kyng called ferramundus marconurus sone made al lond subget fro sicambria vnto ryne ¶willellmus de r· libro primo whan ferramundus deed made sone kynge thre name heyght clodion· clodyus crinicus hym kynges fraunce called crinici clodyus made sone kyng· highte meroneus· hym kynges france called meronyngy vnto pypyns tyme ¶ maner kynges sone englond name name theyr fader edgar sone called edgaryngus edmondue sone named edmondignus comynly cometh kynges blood called adelingus· gir de p meroneus regned sone childericus hym cristned remigius childericus atte prayer romayns put peple gothi arriani guyan whan dede sone childebertus helde kyngdom thre bretheren theodericus clodonurus clotarius tyme grete pope gregory childebertus regned broder clotarius wedded seynt radegunde· hym regned sone childericus thre bretheren carbertus gundianꝰ sigesbertꝰ childericus regned sone clotarius bigate dagobertus suster batildys vnder dagobertus pipinus grettest man kynges hows tyme eraclius themperour dagobertus regned sone clodonius tyme seynt benet body translated born prouynce beneuentana fraunce clodoneus regned sone clotarius hym broder odericus tyme ebronius grettest kynges hous poursiewed seynt leodegarius· dide hym moch woo tene martred hym atte laste theodericus regned clodoneus hym yonger broder childebertus· hym yong sone dagobertus hym kynges lignage faylled ¶for hym regned broder daniel clerk franci chaunged danielis name called hym childericus hym regned one kyn called theodoricus hym broder hildericus put doun grete nycete made clerk lyued monk abbaye thenne faylled lygnage men ferramūdꝰ blood yet lasted dured woman batildis dagobertus suster maner batildis wedded vnto ausebertus hym sone hight arnold thēne arnoldes sone hight arnulphus arnulphus wedded duc pipins doughter pipinus grettest kyng dagobertus hows kynge dagobertus batildis broder· th • arnulphus afterward made bisshop mentensis thenne sone ansegilius gate pupinus two name vetulus breuis· willelmus de r· libro primo pipinus gate charles heyght tutidis marcellus also name tutidis tudere beten bounsed bete oute fraunce alle tyrantes sarasyns warred therin destroubled londe peple charles folowed sentence forfaders helde kynges fraūce retenue hym self called erle helde hym paid content name· giraldus charles gate second pupinus charles grete· afterward monke· second pupinꝰ kynges kynde cam batildis spak bifore therfor made kynge fraunce assente alle chiualrye auctorite pope steuen pope neyt zacharye pupinus gate charles grete· charles made kynge faders deth yere lord vij clxix· noble dedes romayns chose hym afterward seynt peter aduocate afterward patricius thenne emperour augustus fro tyme thempyre constantinople torned fro romayns frensshe men wold helpe chirche rome ayenst longobardes warred agaynst romayns charles gate lowys afterward emperour lowys gate ballid charles emperour also· balled charles gate lowys lowys gate lotharius· lotharius gate lowys last kyng lignage whan lowys dede franci toke hugh duk bergoyn made hym kynge hugh gate robert· robert gate harry harry gate philip philip gate lowys lowys regned harry clerkes tyme conquerours sone grete charles ofspryng regned fraūce vnto hughis tyme called capet surname· hym come kynges fraunce within place openly declared kynges ofspryng regned ytalia almania vnto yere lord ix c xij whan conradus kynge duche men toke thempyre hym self r ¶ longe afterward comyn fame woman quene fraunce heritage wedded bocher fayrenes therrfor reproof dede frensshe men ordeyned euonge hem self woman shold af afterward heyre royame fraūce gir romayns somtyme vyctours alle world· stalworth men wight dwelletd fraūce ouercome hem many batayls atte laste gayus iulius cezars tyme gallia fraunce made subget· occupyed romayns four honderd yere vnto last tyme valentinianus themperour whan dyuerse men straunge londes werred gallia· firste wandaly hinni thenne sueui burgondi ben sueuia lond almania almain· thenne gothi sicambri thenne norway dane made hem self cytees gallia gallia fraunce ben many prouynces londes ben braban flaundres pycardye· normandye lasse brytain ¶ peyto· guyan angeoy· gascoigu burgoyn salina prouyncia campania lasse champayn aluerne also fraunce flaundria fflaundris prouynce gallia belgyca andis vpon coste see occean north frisia eest germania south pycardia· west occean inthe north partye englond· though fflaundres lytil lond hit ful plenteuous many prouffytable thynges ryches pasture beestes marchandyse ryuers hauens see good townes men fflaundres hen fayr stronge ryche brynge forth many childeren ben pesible neyghbours trewe straūgers· noble crafty men grete maker cloth whiche sente aboute wel nyghe al europe ¶the londe pleyn skarse wode therfore stede wode brenne turnes smelleth worse woode· maketh fowler asshes braban bysouth eest fflaundres plentiuous marchandyse makyng cloth wulle haue englond make cloth dyuerse colour sende prouynces londes fflaundres doth though englond haue wolle atte beste hath grete plente good water dyuerse celours hewes fflaundres hath braban· netheles london one well helpeth wel make good scarlett lyncoln one certayn place brook passeth toun ¶ pycardya prouynce gallia hath name toun hete ponticus nowe called phyten seyth erodotus pycardya hath many noble castels townes amyens belgys belnacus tournay many other· lyeth bytwene flaundres north • ide normandye south syde ha • h weste side se • south syde englond ther ben two pycardyes one ner fraunce eyther ioyneth thendes flaunders braban men therof ben boystous men dedes haue gretter speche men fraunce ¶ normandye heet neustria also hath name norwayes sailled oute norway denmarke gate countreye vpon cleues occean· gallea called normandye chyef cyte therof roan vpon mouth ryuer seyne seyne renueth see occean ¶normandye hath south lasse brytayn weste frensshe occean northwest south syde englonde· lasse brytayne hath name breton twyes occupyed lond fyrste brenius kynge bellinus broder eftsones breton poursiewed greued saxones vortigers tyme kyng britons· wreton conteyned story brytons ¶this prouynce hath eest syde andegauia andegoy north normandye south guyan weste occean acquytanicus see side guyan ¶ giraldus toppicis ¶in britayne welle yf water welle take bugle horn poured vpon stone next welle weder neuer fayre ne drye anon shal reyne fraūce welle faste castel pascense water therof right good men nought wymmen noman hete water welle fyre ne ony crafte ony deuyse pyctauia peytow prouynce gallia narbonenses englysshe men scottes pyctes seylled dwelled cleped countrey pictauia chyef cyte pyctauus peyters seyth erodotus prouynce scretcheth ferre vpon occean eest syde turonia therby passeth ryuer leyr southe syde spayne north lasse brytayn see guyan· west see occean men londe ben condicions frensshe men cause medle countrey neyghe them· stronge bodye fayr face hardy hert fel wytte ¶ de aquitania capitulum 28 aquitania guyan· hath name aquitonia aquis ben water water ryuer leyer goth grete dele lōd many perticuler prouince comprehended vnder name lond plenius sayth it· hath north eeste gallia lugdunensis· southe eeste stretcheth prouynce narbon audegauia angeoy prouynce gallia myddel bytwene gyan lytil brytayn· ¶vasconia gascoyn somtyme conteyned vnder guyan hath est side hilles pirenij· west th • west occean· sou • h est playn prouynce tholous • yde neygheth peytow ¶in londe ben many woodes hylles wynes ryuer garonna departeth bytwene londe prouynce tholouse entreth see occean faste bourdeux whiche chyef cyte londe· men lond ben called vascones wacones ¶the grete pompeus put hem doun moūt pireneus gadred hem toun whan spayne ouercome sayth erodotus wryter histroyes men londe ben called nowe basclenses ben swyft hardy vse balles arblestres gladly robbe reue· stronge theues ben clothed slight clothes fowle burgundia partye gallia senosenses stretcheth vnto alpes pirenei hath name burgundya borugh townes austrogoti bylded therin whan purposed destroye ytalia londe ful cold toward alpes pirenei· men dwellen toward side burgoyne haue botch vnder chynne swollen bagged though double chynned cause grete cold water snowe melteth emong hem alway ¶de hispania trogus libro vltimo ysidorus libro auinto decimo ¶ capitulum 29 trogus sayth trigonia spayne al hool· hilles pirenei ioynen spayne north side gallia narbonenses closed side al see occean see tirenus spayne wel nyghe al ylond ¶ byclypped see wel nygh al ther ben two spaines hyther begynneth fro playnes valeys pyreneis stretcheth cantabria endeth cartago spataria yonder spayne conteyneth west party vnto see gadytanus hercules sette pylers beside moūt athlas spayne playn lond hath grete p • ence castels horse metal hony heete somtyme hisperia hespera eue sterre lad grekes thyder lodesterre fterward hit called hiberia· ryuer hiberus atte laste hete hispania ryuer hispalus hispanus hercules ordeyned gouernour kyng there· hispania ben sex prouynces terraconensis lusitania· galicia bethica tingitina astruria arogonia ysidorus libro quinto decimo capitulo secundo cartago spayne called spataria· haue difference bitwene cartago grete cartago affryca scipio consul rome destroyed affri men affryca made cartago spataria atte last gothy destroyed gothy lordes spayne longe tyme specially honorius themperours tyme· afterward sarasyns ouercome charles grete· loste west londes spayn gallicia luscitania helde este londes countreyes spayne ¶de insulis mari magni ¶ capitulum 30 gades co •• nably fyrst sette amonge ilondes grete see stondeth west ende spayne mouth west occean grete see occean breketh inner londes departeth sonder affryca europa· tiries cam seylyng reed see occupyed ylond called gades langage gades saye byclypped byclypped al see lond honderd paas ten hercules sette pilers whiche ben right wonderful vttermest ende world· tho pylers ben called name ilond· gades also· ¶hug capitulo gade gyue knowleche place ne lond ferther westward stronge man hercules sette tho pylers gades· thenne estward pylers ilond gades ben ilondes baleares ben called maiorica minorica thenne ilond sardina ¶and hath south syde affryca north scicilia hath nether addres ne venym ther groweth herbe called apium whiche maketh men lawgh hem self deth· ylond hath hoote welles holsom water maketh theuys men forswere hem self blynde yf theyr eyen touche water thylke welles ilond corsica cornerd many forlondes stretchyng see therinne noble leese pasture beestes therinne stone named aconite corsica hath est side see tirenus south ylond sardima xxx myle then west ylondes baleares north see ligusticus liguria prouynce ytalia eyht score myle lengthe xxvj brede hath name corsica woman heyght corsa corsa bole ofte left company beestes swam ilond cam home moche better poynt wente corsa sawe wayted tyme toke boote folowed bole ylond ¶ sawe ther was· londe bere corne grasse brought theder first men called ligures aradia called aradium also ylond al one cyt • · fer cyte tirus hath many shipmen ben ful stronge fyghtynge ciclades ben liij ylondes gydre ar named cyclon grewe whiche cercle englysshe ben set al round cercle aboute ylond highte delon netheles som men seyn called cause highe rockes ben al first rodes toward eest ylondes ende toward north clyf lasse asia hath south north fyfty myle eest west two honderd myle myddel ylond named delon saye shewed somtyme byschyne sonne fore londes • flood delon called ortigia ortigie ben called conturnices curlewes whiche ben grete plente ¶ place lacona bare appolyn delphycus samos otherwyse called samia ilond whiche pyctagoras iuno sibilla born londe whyce cleye reed· whiche cleye men make erthen vessel beste cyprus lond heyght paphon cichym also beclypped south see phenicia west see pamphilicus northwest scicilia· viij score mile lengthe vj score v brede yle bra craft brasse first foūden wynes lond strē gest wynes creta hath name one cretus dwellyd therin· ylonde heyght centapolis also londe hath c· cytees· therin somtyme c· cytees somtyme saturnus iupiter born· first kynges right longeth grecia old tyme hath south side see libicus north see grecia stretcheth oute eest west first londe parfyght noble crafte rowyng oores armes shotyng arowes yaf lawe wreton taught men ride horsbak ther craft musike syngynge ydeis dactilis founde ¶ creta made yaf knowleche londes aboute ¶that londe called candia ylond ben many sheep g • eet fewe roe hertes· therin fox ne wolues ne addres ne venemoꝰ beestes lond hateth venym yf men brynge ony venemous beestes wormes londes deyen anone· though ther grete venemoꝰ beestes lond yet ben ther attercops venemous ben called spalangya in· londe oroꝰ seith ylōd viij score vij mile lēgthe c myle brede ilonde one foure laborintus shal sayd afterward treuisa late men haue knowleche laborintꝰ is· bous wōderly buylded wrought halkes huyrenes tornynges windynges diuersly wōderful wayes wrynclis gooth hows wold come agayn though retorne hytherward thyder ward ceste west north southward whyther euer drawe alle wayes chese though trauaylle neu er sore shal mased goo yf haue craft serueth therfore scicilia ilond somtyme called trinatria thre square cause thre hilles ben therin hilles ben called pelorū pachinū libeū· afterward called scicilia sciculus ytalus brother· londe hight somtyme scicania scicanus kyng hath northsyde apulia partye ytalie departed fro part grete water arme see· clouen erthskakyng thus seyth salustius see bytwene secilia ytalye thre myle brode· called regium saye broken see ben two grete perylls wonderful wyde knowe one scilla caribdis· men lond calle scillā grete stone seen aboue water shapen as· mā byclypped hoū de heedes feynen saye semeth wawes berketh beteth therupon caribdis perilloꝰ whirlyng see casteth vp water wawes swoloweth hem agayn thryes day ysid li 14 ylond men ered first plowe sowe corne seedes ther comedia songe gestes first foūden beda de naturis· londe scicilia holowe ful caues· moch sulphur brymstone glue ayer fire hath way ynowgh therto fire closed caues chinnes within erthe stryueth ayer thynges ben contrarye fyre causeth ofte smoke brennyng leyte breke many place ¶ somtyme strengthe wynde within maketh breke oute heepes grauel stone suche doynge brennynge hille called mount ethna dureth longe ysid li· 14 hille mount ethna toward southeest hath many chynnes holowe dennes caues within erthe ful brymstone resseyueth moche wynde engendryth fyre smoke r place ben seen dyuerse figure shappes herde ruful voys gronyng ¶ therfore somme men wenen sowles ben payne semeth seynt gregory maketh mynde dyaloge· gir· welle scicilia yf aman cometh therto clothed red anone water welle spryngeth vp high mannes hede ¶ ony colour hewe water meueth ben also • cicades birdes syngen wel best wy • haue pype open vnder throote syngen better whan heed whan better whan ben dede whyle ben lyue· therfor herdes londe bihede haue swetter songe ¶ londe cyte called palarna yeldeth euery yere certayn rente kyng englond hath siker rente englond ¶ ysidorus libro 13 scicilia ben two welles one hem maketh barayn woman bere childeren maketh childyng woman barayn· scicilia salt agrigentinus wonderful contrarye salt ffor melteth fyre lepeth sperclyth water· byside scisilia ilond called eola· hath name eolus· poetes feynen saye eolus god wyndes· whyle ruler ix ilondes eueryche hem heyght eola rysynge moysture myste smoke wolde telle whan shold rayne therfore symple men supposed wynde power myghte ¶ nyne ilon • e hight wl • ane fyry fyre brenneth alwaye· ben ilondes see eusinus see eusinus grete partye see myddel erthe amonge whiche ylondes ylond colchos famous iason fette golden fflyes shal declared bataylle troye ¶and pathmos ilond see seynt iohan euāgelyst whan exyled sute londes ¶de iusulis occeani ysidorus libro quinto ¶capo 31 insule fortunate ben gracious ilondes ben good temprure wynde weder sette west occean men named paradyse cause goodnes londe temperate weder ¶ ben gracious tymes· hylles ben couerd corne ¶ herbes growe grasse ¶therfore cause plente corne fruyte ben called fortunate gracious ¶for ben tree seuen score foote highe ¶ ilonde capria ilonde gheet ¶ ben many gheet· weders also ilond canaria ilond houndes ¶ dacia denmarke ilond ioyneth northsyde germania men denmarke somtyme ful sterne good men armes therfore occupyed somtyme grete countrees brytayne fraunce ben called daci dagy· come gothes ther ben many men dacia ben fayr stature semely face heer though ben sterne ayenste theyr enemyes ben esy mylde good men trewe may forgoten brought grete drynkyng englond ¶ wyntlandia ilond west denmarke· bareyn lond men oute byleue selle wynde shipmen come theyr porte hauenes closed vnder knottes threde knottes vnknytte wynde wexed theyr wille iselond ilond hath este side norwaye north froren see mare congelatū men of· lond ben short speche trewe theyr wordes clothed wylde beeste skynnes ben fysshers haue one man bothe kynge preest ther ben gerfawcons gentil haukes ben whyte beer breken yse drawe fysshe ben sheep lond ne corne ootes grete cold ilond irlond brytayn thre dayes sayllyng solinu • de mirabilibus tyle vttermest ilond occean bytwene northe west coost yonde brytayn fewe men knowe lond ¶ plenius libro secundo· ¶ tyle hath name sonne spryngyng tyme whan day nyght euē vnto heruest tyme alway byschyne son̄e efte tyme spryngyng tyme agayne whan day nyght euē septēber hath light sōne alway derk nyght day therfor lōde couenable mē dwelle somer heete wynter colde derknes cause therof may corne growe also see hard frore bitwene ilōd britain ben ylōdes hight· scādia lingo vergyon netheles tile vj dayes saylling brytain r gir top ffor seint augustyn d· ci de speketh tile· saith ylōd ynde tree tile leese neuer leues ware· thou begyled lykenes name ¶ ylond ynde called tilis nominatif· caas· ylond occean named tile nominatif caas ben lyche other· yf thou canst declyne thylke two name speke latyn seyth ysidore eth libro quinto decimo norwaye stretcheth somdele eest toward denmarke gothia· hath southsyde scotland northsyde iselond ilond brood byclypped aboute see ful sharp cold hath many hilles wodes· wilde beestes whyte beres bawsons brockes scarcete corne men londe lyue fisshyng huntyng brede corn northsyde londe many nyghtes somer tyme aboute stintyng sonne sonne goth doun shyneth al nyghte efte many dayes winter aboute stintynge sonne sonne aryseth yeue hem light· therfore al tyme muste werke candel light werke hem nedeth londe welle tourneth tree lether stone· abyde therinne yeer hool • men londe ben shipmen theuys see treuisa ¶ knowe stintyng sonne •• nyng take heede· sonne styntith twyes yere one atte somer whan goth none higher ¶· eftsones winter whan gooth lower eyther tyme stinting sonne ¶ de hybernia • • ¶ capitulum 32 hybernia irlond old tyme incorperate lordship britain seith giraldus sua topographia descriueth fulle yet worthy semely praise lond larger praysing come clere ful knowleche lōd· tytles folowe opene way therfor shal telle stede place lond grete manere londe wherof londe hath plente wherof hath defawte· ¶also men dwellid therinne firste men maners lond wondris lond worthynes halowes saintes lond ¶de situ hibernie locali ¶irlonde laste alle weste ylondes height hibernia one hiberus spayn hermonius broder two bretheren gate wan lond conqueste ¶ called hibernia riuer hiberus weste ende spayne lond heyghte scotland also scottes dwellyd somtyme er cam scotland longed brytayne therfor wreten martiloge· suche day scotland seynt bryde bore irlond londe hath southest side spayne thre dayes sayllyng thennes sydehalf hath eest syde brytayn· thennes dayes sayllyng weste syde hath endels occean northsyde iselond thre dayes sayllyng then solinus see bytwene britain irlond al yere ful grete wawes vnesy· men maye selde saylle sikerly bytwene see six score myle brood ¶ de eius quanto et quali irlond ilond grettest brytayn stretcheth northward brendans hilles vnto londe columbina conteyneth viij dayes iourneyes euery iourney xl myle deuelyn patriks hilles· see syde brede four iourneyes irlond narower myddel thendes al otherwyse brytayn is· irlond shorter northward brytayn lenger southward lond pleyn ful montaynes· hilles wodes mareys more londe soft rayny· wyndy· lowe see side withyn hilly sondy solynus grete plente noble pasture leese therfor beestes must ofte dryue oute theyr pasture leeste ete ouermoche shold shende hein self yf myght ete theyr wylle· gir· men lond haue comunely theyr helth straungers haue ofte peryllous flux cause moysture mete flessh kyen holsome swynes flesshe vnholsome· men londe haue feuer onely feuer ague right selde therfor holsomnes helthe londe clennes oute venyme worth al boost rychesse tree herbes spycerye ryche clothes precious stone eeste londes ¶the cause helthe holsomnes londe attemperat hete colde therinne ¶ quibus rebus sufficit londe ben moo kyne ox pasture corne gras seed ¶ grete plente samon lamprayes eelis see fysshe egles crane pecokes curlewes sperhaukes goshaukes gentil faucons wolues right shrewd myse ben attercoppes blood soukere eeftes doon none harme ther ben feyres lytil body ful hardy stronge ben bernacles fowles like wylde ghee whiche growen wonderly vpon tree nature wrought agayn kynde men religyon ete bernacles fastyng dayes • ause ben engendryd fflesshe wherin thynketh erre· reson ayenst that· fro yf man eten adam legge· eten flesshe· yet adam engendred fader moder· fflesshe cam wonderly therthe fflesshe cometh wonderly tree londe plente hony mykle wyn vyne yerdes solinus ysidorus wryten irlond hath bee netheles better wryten irlond hath bee vyneyerdes also beda sayth ther grete huntynge robuckes knowe ther ben none wonder beda sawe neuer lond somme men told hym suche tale also ther groweth stone saxogonus called iris also rayne bowe yf stone holde agaynste • e sonne anon shal shape reynbowe· also founden stone called gagates whyte margery perlis auibus rebus deficit· whete cornes ben ful smale vnnethe clensed mannes hond reserued men· alle beestes ben smaller londes lacked wel nygh alle maner ffysshe fresshe water gendred see· ther lacken vnkynde fawcons gerfawcons partrychis fesaunte nyghtyngale pyrs ther lacken also roo bucke ylespyles wontes venemous beestes therfore somme men •• ynen fauorably seynt patrik clensed lond wormes venemous beestes· probable skylful londe begynnynge alway without suche wormes· venemous beestes wormes dyen anone men brynge hem theder oute londes also venyme poyson brought theder oute londes lesen theyr malyce sone passeth themyddel see ¶also powdre erthe londe caste sowen londes dryuen awaye wormes ferforth yf turf londe putte aboute worme sleeth hym maketh hym thrille erthe tescape awaye londe cockes crowe lytil fore day· first crowyng cockes lond thyrdde londes ben like ferre fore day ¶ de incolis prioribus ¶ capitulum 33 gyraldus sayth casera no nece drad flood fledde thre men fyfty wymmen ilond dwellyd therin first last yere fore no floode afterward bartholanus seres sone come iaphet no sone come theder iij sone happe craft thre honderd yere no flood dwellid encreced nōbre ix men afterward stenche kareyns geants kyld deyden al saue one ruanus lyued thousand fyue honderd yere vnto seynt patriks tyme enformed holy man forsayd men al doingisand dedes thenne thyrdde tyme come thyder nymeth sichia four sone dwellyd ij honderd yere sixtene atte last ofsprynge dyuse mishappes warres moreyn clene destroyed lond lefte voyde ij c yere after· fourth tyme fyue duke bretheren gādius genandus sagandius rutheragus sclauius forsayd nimethis successours come grece occuppyed londe deled fyue partyes euery partye conteyned xxij candredes ¶ candrede countraye conteyneth honderd townes sette stone myddel londe nauel begynnynge v kyngdomes atte laste slaniꝰ made kynge al londe· fyfte tyme whan nacion xxx yere gyder wexe feble four noble men myllesiꝰ kyngis sone come spayne many nauye lx shippis two worthiest foure bretheren hite hiberus hermon deled londe bitwene hem tweyn afterward couenaūt broken bytwene hem hiberꝰ slayn thēne hermon kynge londe tyme first patriks tyme kynges nacion sex score euleuen fro comynge hybermensis vnto fyrst patrik thousand yere viij·c name hibermenses hibernici forsayd hiberus ellys hiberos ryuer spayne· called also gaytels scottes one gaytelus phenius neuew gaytelus coude speke many langages langages made nemproths tour wedded one scota pharoes doughter ¶ duke come hibermenses ¶ men saye gaytelus made yryshe langage called gaytelaf langage gadred alle langages tonges atte laste belinus kyng bretayn sone hight gurguncius· gurguncius come oute denmarke atte irlondes orcades fonde men called basclenses come thyder oute spayne men prayde besoughte haue place dwelle inne· kyng sente hem irlond tho voyde waste ordeyned sente hem duke capitayns owne semeth irlond shold longe brytayn right old tyme ffrom first seynt patrik vnto fedlinudius kyngis tyme four honderd yere regned xxxiij kynegs eueryche irlond fedlinudius tyme turgesius duke capytayn norweyes brought thyder men norweye occupyed londe made many place depe dyches castels sengle double treble many wardes strongly walled many therof stonde yet alhoole irysshe men retche castels· take wodes castels mareys more castel dyches ¶but atte laste turgesius deyde gyleful wyles wymmen englysshe men seyn gurmundus wan irlond made thylke dyches make mencion turgesius yrysshe men speke turgesius knowe gurmundus therfor wete gurmundus wō ne brytayn dwellyd therinne sente turgesius grete strengthe yrlond wynne lond cause turgesius capytayn leder viage iourney seen emonge therfor yrysshe men speke moche hym noble man seen lond knowen atte laste whan gurmundus slayn fraunce· turgesius loued kynges doughter meth irlond fader behyghte turgesius wolde sende hym lowe lacherin xv maydens turgesius promysed mete hem xv· noblest men helde couenaunt thought gyle come xv yōg berdles men clothed like wymmen short swordes vnder clothes fylle turgesius slewe hym right traitoursly slain regned xxx yere· long thre bretheren amelanus syracus iourus come irlond men norwaye ben lone pee marchandyse dwellyd see side assente irysshe men alway ydel paules knyghtes norwayes bylded thre cytees· deuelyn waterford lymeryche encreced wexe rebelle ayenst men londe brought first sparthes irlond fro turgesius tyme vnto rotheriks tyme kyng cannaccia laste kynge al londe xvij kynges irlond kynges regned irlond first hermons tyme vnto last rotheriks time al honderd four score one knygis crowned nether enoynted ne lawe heritage myght maystrye strengthe armes· second harry kyng englond made rotherick subgette yere kynge harryes age fourty regne xvij· yere lord xjc lxxij ¶ de incolarum moribus solynus· ¶ capitulum 34 solinus sayth men lond ben straunge nacion houseles grete fyghters acounte right wrong al one thyng ben syngel clothyng scarce mete cruel herte angry speche drynketh first blood dede mē ben slayn thenne wesshen theyr vysages ther holde hem paid fflesshe fruyt stede mete mylke· stede drynke vse moche pleyng idlenes hūtyng trauaylle ful lytil theyr childhode ben hard norysshed hard fedd vnsemely maners clothyng haue breche hosen alle one wolle strayt hodes scretcheth cubyte ouer sholders behynde foldynges stede mantel clokes also vse sadles bootes ne spore whan ryde dryue theyr horse chambred yerd ouer ende· stede byttes trench brydles reest vse brydles lette theyr horse ete theyr mete fyghte vnarmed naked bodye netheles two dartes speres· brood sparthes fight one hande men forsake tylyeng lond kepen pasture beestes vse long berdes lōg locke hanging doun behynde heedes· vse crafte flaxe wolle metal ne marchaundyse yeue hem ydlenes slouthe rekene reste likyng fredom rychesse though scotland doughter irlond vse harpe tymbre tabour netheles irysshe men connyng two manere instrumentis musike harpe tymbre armed wyre strenges brasse whiche instrumentes though playe hastely swyftly make right mery armonye melodye thyck tewnes werbles note begynne bemol • playe secretely vnder dymme sowne grete strenges torne agayn vnto grettest party • craft hideth craft wold seme though cra •• hydde shold ashamed yf take • n ben 〈◊〉 maner lyuyng paye tythes· wedde lawful •• spare theyr alyes broder weddeth brode •• wif ben besy betraye theyr neyghbours 〈◊〉 sparthes hondes stede staues fyghte ayens • truste moost them· men ben variable vnst •• faste trechours gyleful· deleth 〈◊〉 ware gyle crafte pee brennyn • brondes hony galle· malyce knyghthode • haue suche maners ben stronge warres batayll ne· trewe pers become gossibs wil falsely bitraye gossibrede holy kynrede eueryche drynketh others blood whan shed loue somdele • ice • pleyfers whiche souke mylke souked childeren poursiewe bretheren cosins kyn· despisen kyn • lyue auenge deth whan slayn long • hath vsage euille cu • tomme endured emonge 〈◊〉 hath goten maistrye ouer torned treson kynde ferforth ben traitours nature alyens • n straunge londes dwelle amonge folowen maners vnnethe ther none besmitted treson also amonge many men pissen syttyng wymmen standyng ther ben many men londe fowle shapen lymmes bodye lymmes lacke benefi • e· kynde nowher ben none better shapen wel shapen none worse shapen euil shapen skylfully nature hurt defowled w • ckednes lyuyng bryngeth forth suche foule gromes euyl shapen hem vnlawful delyng fowl maners euyl lyuyng wyckedly defowleth kynde nature londe wale olde wyues wymmen woonte ben yet men seyne ofte shape self likenes hare mylke neyghbours kyne stele mylk ofte gerhoundes rennen hem poursiewe wenen hare also somme crafte nygromancye make fat swyne reed colour selle markettis feyres· assone swyne passe ony water tourne owne kynde whether strawe heye gras turues swyne may kept craft tendure likenes swyne ouer thre dayes among wonder take hede vttermost ende world falled ofte new merueylles wondres though kynde playde larger loue secretely fer thendes openly neygh myddel therfore ilonde ben many grysly wonder meruaylles ¶ de locorum prodigijs· giraldusꝰ merueylles irlond ¶ capitulum 35 many men tellen northside irlond lond lyf ilond noman may deye whan ben old vexed grete • kenes· ben born oute next londe deye ¶ ther another ylond irlond woman therin may bere childe· yet may conceyue also ther ilond whiche dede body may roten vltonia vlster ilond lake wonderly departed tweyne one partye grete disturbaunce discomfort fendes partye grete lykyng comforte holy angels· also seynt patriks purgatorye shewd prayer conferme prechyng lore· whan prechyd mysbyleued sorow payne euyl men sholde suffre wicked werkes ioye blysse good men shal resseyue holy dedes telleth suffreth paynes purgatorye· yf enioyed hym penaunce shal neuer suffre paynes hellebut dye fynally without repentaunce synne ensample sette fulle chapytres ende ¶ treuisa truly noman maye saued yf repentaunt sommeuer penaunce doo euery man repentaunt lyues ende shal sikerly saued though neuer seynt patriks purgatorye ilond cannacte salo see conaccia halewed seynt brandan hath myse dede bodyes ben buryed ben kept oute therthe roten mamonia welle wassheth hym water welle shal wexe hore heede ther another welle vltonia someuer wesshen therin shal neuer wexe hore afterward ther welle mownstre momonia yf ony man touche welle anone shal falle grete rayne al prouynce ¶ rayne shal neuer cesse til preest clene mayde singe masse chappel fast blesse water mylke cowe one heer besprynge welle reconcyle welle straunge maner glyndalcan aboute oratorye seynt keywyn withges berith apple apple tree ben holsom sauery holy seynt brought forth apple prayer heele child seek ther lake vlster moche fyssh therin whiche xxx myle lengthe xv brede· ryuer ban renneth oute lake north occean men saye lake began maner men countrey euyl lyuynge coeuntes cum brutis welle londe grete reuerence old tyme alway couerd· yf lefte vncouerd welle wold ryse drowne al londe happed woman wente welle fetche water hied fast childe wepte cradbe lefte welle vncouerd welle sprang fast drowned woman childe made al countre lake ffyssheponde· preue soth grete argument whan weder cleer fysshers water see ground vnder water roūd towris hyghe shapen steples chirches lond northsyde irlond countrey ossiriens euery seuen yere atte prayer holy abbot tweyne ben wedded man woman must nedes exyled forshappen lykenes wolues abyde oute seuen yere thende seuen yere yf lyue come home agayn take agayn theyr owne shappe shal tweyne goo forth theyr stede forshapen seuen yere lake lond yf pool tree pyght stycked therin part shaft pool therthe shal torne yron part abydeth water shal torne stone· part abydeth aboue shal tre owen kynde also ther lake torneth hasell asshe asshe hasell yf therin ¶ also irlond ben thre samon leepes· samons lepee ayenste roche longe speres lengthe also lagenia ponde ther seen colmans birdes birdes ben cleped certelles come homly mannes honde yf men hem wrong harme· gon way come agayne water shal wexe bytter stynke dyde wronge shal asterte withoute wreche meschyef yf doo amendes ¶ r touching patriks purgatorye· ye shal vnderstande second • int patrike abbot bisshop whyle prechyd irlonde laboured studyed torne thylke wycked men lyued beestes euyl lyf drede paynes helle· conferme hem good lyf sayde wold torne somme myght knowe somwhat grete paynes also blysse spak ¶ thenne seynt patrik prayd god almyghty therfore lord ihesu crist appierid seynt patrik toke hym staf ladde hym wylde place shewed hym round pytte derke within sayde yf man repentaunt stable bileue wente pytte walked therinne day nyght sholde see sorowes paynes euyl men ioye blysse good men ¶ thenne crist vanyssyhed patriks sight seynt patrik arered bylded chirche· put therin chanons reguler· closed pytte walle· chirche yerd atte est ende chirche fast shytte stronge dore noman shold goo nycely oute leue bisshop priour place ¶ many men went cam agayn patriks tyme· told paynes ioye seen· merueylles· sawe ben yet wreton couse therof many men torned cōuerted right bileue· also many men went cam neuer agayn ¶in kynge steuēs tyme kyng englond knyght hight oweyn wente seynt patriks purgatorye cam agayn dwellyd euer duryng lyf nedes thabbay ludensis thordre cistews tolde many wōders seen patriks purgatorye place called patriks purgatorye· chirch named reglis ¶ man enioyned goo purgatorye counseylled sholde come therinne take vpon hym penaūce yf man haue auowed stable wole nede goo therinne shal first goo bisshop shal sent lettres prioure place bothe shal counseylle hym leue yf nedes goo therto shal prayer fastyng xv dayes xv dayes shal houseld lad dore purgatorye procession letanye yet shal counceylled leue yf stedfast entre dore shal opened blyssyd goo goddes name holde forth waye dore shall faste shette til next daye whan tyme priour shal come opene dore ¶ yf man comen ledeth hym chirche procession shal xv dayes prayer fastyng ¶de preconijs sanctorum ¶ capitulum 36 hcre graldus maketh mynde men nacion ben angry men hasty take wreche whyles ben alyue seyntes halowes londe ben wrecheful sayn • e londes clerkes lande ben chaste sayen many prayer grete abstynence day drynketh al nyght acounted myracle lecherye regneth wyne regneth· ben euyl ben worst good men amonge though fewe ben good atte beste prelate coūtrey ben ful slowe correction trespaas besym contemplacion prechyng goddes worde· therfore alle sayntes lond ben confessours martir emonge wonder alle prelate londe ben chosen oute abbayes clerg • e ¶ monkes sholde· clerkes prelate shulde doo vnknowen· therfor whan put ayenste bisshop cassil myght many sayntes ben irlond neuer martir amonge hem alle syth men ben shreud angry prelate recheles slowe correction trespaas bisshop answerd frowardly ynowgh sayde men ben shrewd angry ynowgh hem self goddes seruaūtes • eye neuer honde hem grete reuerence worship· englysshe men come londe make martres wont vse craft ¶r bisshop sayd cause kyng harry second tho newe comen irlond fresshly marterdom seynt thomas counterbury ¶gir· lond wale scotland ben belle staues croked heedes thynges relyquyes grete reuerence worship men londe dreden swere vpon ony thylke belle gold staues vpon gospel· chyef suche relyquyes holde ihesus staf· deuelyn staf· saye first seynt patrik droo • wormes oute irlond ¶augustinus de ciuitate • capitulo septimo yf men axe maye dyuerse maner beestes dyuerce kynde ben kyndly goten bitwene male und female come ben ilondes no flood men supposen suche beestes swam ilondes aboute· first nexte forth el men seylly •• ylondes brought hem beestes f • r loue huntynge angel god almyghtyes commaundement brought suche beestes ilondes aboute erthe brought hem forth firste fulfylled tho goddes commaundement commanded erthe brynge forth gras quyck beestes ¶ de scocia ¶ capitulum 37 hyt comyn sawe countrey whiche nowe named scotland stretchyng north partye britayn· departed southside· britain armes see side al byclypped see londe heet somtyme albania· hath name albanactus kynge brutus sone albanactus dwellyd first • nne prouynce albania countrey scicia nygh amasona· therfor scottes ben called scites· cam oute scicia afterward londe heet pyctauia pyctes regned therinne thousand yere lxx somme men telle thousand thre honderd lx· yere atte last heet hibernia irlond heygthe gir top many skylles one skyl affynyte alye bitwene yrysshe men toke wyues yrlond • enly seen bileue· clothyng langage speche wepen maners ¶ another skylle irysshe men dwellyd ther somtyme beda libro primo yrlond propre countraye scottes come yrysshe men duke called renda· loue strengthe made hem chyef see cytees beside pyctes northsyde gir londe shortly called scotland scottes come yrlōd regned therinne ·iij c xv yere vnto rede williams tyme malcolyns broder· r many euydencis haue scotland ofte called heyte hibernia yrlond doth therfor beda libro 2 c· p seyth laurence archibisshop dunbar archibisshop scottes dwellyd ylond heet hibernia next brytayne also beda li 3· c 27 seyth pestelence moreyn bare donn hibernia also libro tercio· capitulo secundo seyth scottes dwellyd south side hibernia also libro 4· capitulo tercio sayth chadde yonglyng lerned rewle monkes hibernia also libro quarto capitulo visesimo secundo egfridus kyng northū berland destroyed hibernia also libro· 4 ca 15 moost dele scottes hibernia chapytre clepeth hibernia proprely named west ylonde honderd myle eueryche brytayne departed see bitwene called hibernia countray callid scotland telleth adanman abbote ylond seyled hibernia teche yryshmen lawful ester daye atte laste cam agayne scotlōd· ysi ethli 14 mē ofthis scotlād ben named scottes lāgage pyctes also· sōtymeher body peinted man wold sōtyme sharp egged tole prycke kerue bodyes· make theron dyuse figure shappes peynte hem inke peynture colour· cause peynted called picti saye peynted ¶erodotus scottes ben light herte straunge wylde ynowgh medlynge englysshe men ben moche amended ben cruel vpon theyr enemyes hateth bondage ony thyng holde foule slouthe yf man deye bed ¶ grete worship yf deye felde ben lytil mete mowe faste longe eten selde whan sonne vp ¶ ete flesshe fysshe mylke fruyte breed though ben fayre shappe ben defowled made vnsemely ynowgh theyr owne clothyng preyse faste vsage theyr owne forfaders· despysen mennes doynge • onde fruytful ynowgh pasture gardyns feeldes gir de p capitulo 18 prynces scottes kynges spayn ben wonte ben enioynted ne crowned scotland solempne grete mynde seynt andrew thappostel seynt andrew north contreys world scytes pyctes lotte preche conuerte peple cristes bileue atte laste martred achaia grecia cyte named patras bone kept two honderd ·lxxij yere vnto constantinus themperours tyme thenne translated constantinoble kepte c ten yere vnto theodosius themperours tyme· thenne vngust kyng pyctes scotland destroyed grete partye brytayn bisette grete hoost briton felde called merk herd seynt andrew speke hym maner vngus vngus thou cristes apostle promyse helpe socour whan thou hast ouercomen thyn enemyes myn helpe thou shalt yeue third dele thyn heritage almes god almyghty worship seynt andrew· signe crosse wente fore hooste thyrdde day vyctorye torned home agayn deled heritage boden vncertayn cyte sholde dele seynt andrew fasted thre dayes men prayd seynt andrew wold shewe hym place wold chese one wardeyns kept body seynt andrew constantynoble warned sweuene shold go place whyder angle wolde lede hym cam scotland seuen felaws toppe hille named ragmund hour lighte heuen bishone byclypped kynge pyctes comyng hooste place called carceuan anon heled many seke men met kynge regulus monke constantynoble relyques seynt andrew ¶ founded chirche worship seynt andrew hede alle chirches londe pyctes scotland chirche comen pylgryms londes regulus first abbot gadred monkes· alle tienthe lond kyng assigned hym departed dyuerse place amonge ab •• yes ¶ de wallia book taketh honde wale fore englond take tale wende wale noble blood priamus blood knowleche wynne grete iupiters kynne haue mynde dardanus kynde thyse four title fonde telle thestate londe cause man shal telle preyse lond welle shal wryte pēne alle maners menne thenne shal fonde telle merueilles londe name named wale wale called wallia somtyme heet cambria camber brute sone prynce dide wone thenne wallia mene gwalaes quene kyng ebrancus child wedded thyder myld lord gwalon withdraweth soun put l· i· thou shalt finde wallia though londe moche lesse englond good glebe one doughter moder commodytees lond wale though lond luyte ful corn fruyte hath grete plente ywys flesshe eke fysshe beestes tame wild horse sheep ox mylde good londe alle seedes corn gras herbes yt spredes ther ben wodes medes herbes floures spredes ther ben riuers welles valeys also hilles valeys brynge forth flood hilles metal good cool groweth vnder londe gras aboue atte honde lyme copious slattes hows hony mylke whyte deynte lyte braket methe ale grete
