plente vale nedeth lyue londe bryngeth forth ryue grete ryches drawe close many short sawe hit corner smal though god first al made londe fele selere al hele wale deled water heet twy northwales southe twy delith place ful couth southe heet demecia venedocia first shoteth arowes beres deleth al speres wale somtyme courtes thre carmarthyn one othir mone thirde powysy pengwern yt shrousbury ther bisshops seuen ben four euen· vnder saxon al atte honde somtyme vnder pinces yt lād ¶ maner rite walssmen maner lyuyng yt londe· wel dyuerse englond mete drynk clothyng many doyng clothed wonder wel shirt mantel crisp breche wel fayn bothe wynde rayne clothyng bolde though weder right colde without shetes alway euermore aray goo fighte pleye lepe stonde sitte lye slepe without surcot goun cote kirtell without iopē tabard cloc bel without lace chaplet yt lappes without hode hatte cappes· thus araid goon ye segges alway bare legges kepe none goyng though mete ye kyng arowes short speres fight yt hē deres fight better neden whan go thā whā ridē stede castel tour take wode mareis whan see doo cour fyghtyng wol go· gildas seyth ben varyable pee stable yf men axe wonder see though men put oute londe put othir wold fonde al nouȝt stonde al many wodes bē grōde vpon see amonge ben castels buylded stronge men maye dure longe vn ete loue wel comune mete ete ben mury withoute grete cury ete breed cold hoot barly ote brode cake round thynne wel semeth grete kynne selde ete breed wheet selde done one ete haue gruel potage lekes kynde companage also butter mylke chese shape enlong corner wese suche mess ete snel maketh hē drynk wel methe ale hath myght theron spende day nyght euer redder wyn holde fyn whan drynke atte ale telle many lewd tale whan drink hōdling ben ful iangling atte mete eke solace salt leke husbond wise telleth grete prise yeue caudron gruele hem sitten mele deleth mete mele yeueth euery man dele alle ouerpluse kepeth owne vse therfor haue woo mishappes also ete hoote samon alway though phisik say nay howses ben lowe al made yerdes smal citres nyhe fer sonder hihe whan al eten home hir neyghbours wil ete may finde see torne home ye rome lyf ydle lede brēning sleping dedes walsshmen vse myght· wesshe ghestes fret nyȝt yf wessh foot al somme· knowe yt wel lyue esily rowte selde bere purs breche home come hong money combe wonder hende hate crak atte nether ende· without ony core· make wardroppe atte dore haue grete mangery harp tabour pipe mīstralcie bere corp sorow gret· blowe lowde horne gheet prayse fast troyan blode therof come al brode neyh kyn wyl though passen ·c degre aboue mē wil hē diȝt worship prestes myȝt angel heuen right worshipe seruaūtes god oft giled thys brood yerned batayl al wode merlin ꝓphecie almyȝt oft sortelegye best maners briton companye saxon ben torned better right knowen clere light tillē gardins felde dounes drawe hem god tounes ride armed wole god goo hosed shood sitten fayr hir mele slepe beddes fair fele· seme mynde englissh walssh kinde yf men axe doo woonte doo lyuen pee bycause theyr ryches catel shold slake yf vsed ofte wrake drede losse good make nowe stylle mode al one brought haue nothyng drede nought poet seyth sawe preef fotemā singeth fore ye thef bolder way horsmen riche gaye marueylles wonder wale ther pool brechnok therin fish many flok oft changeth hewe cop bereth· aboue gardin crop ofte tyme shape hous ther shal thou see whan ye pole frore wōder noyse ther vnder yf prynce londe hoote briddes singe wel mery noot merily singe none man besides carlion two myle fro toun roche wel bright leem ryght ayenst sonne beme goldelyf roche heyghte shyneth gold ful briȝt flour stone nought withowt fruyt yf souȝt men coude craft vndo ye veynes therthe com therto many benefyce kynde ben hid fro mānes minde ben vnknowe· yet defawte mannes wytte grete tresour hid grounde shal founde grete studye besynes hem come v old men grete nede haue besy dede treuisa bokes ye may rede kynde failleth nede whan nomā craft mynde craft halp god kynde whan techer londe men craft goddes honde craft thenne taught forth craft mēne som craft yt yet come place som mā shal haue god grace r· ylond nois strif west walis kerdyf fast seuarn stronde barry hiht ylond hither side chene shal thou wonder dene dyuerse noys also thou put thyn ere noys leues wynde noys metal thou shalt fynde froting yrē whestones thou hetyng ouens fire may wel shalt wawes see breketh thare suche noys fare penbrook stede fendes doo ofte quede throweth foul thyng despyseth also synne neyther craft ne bede may doo then sorow awaye whan greueth soo men bodeth woo· crucinar west wale wonder burial euery man cometh see semeth euen moche 〈◊〉 hool wepen nyght shal broken er day light· nemyn northwalis litil ylond called bardysey monkes dwelle alway men lyue long hurst oldest deyed first mē saye yt merlin ther buryed highte also siluestris merlyns tweyne prophecied beyne one hite ambrose merlyn goten gobelyn demecia carmerthyn vnder kyng vortigerin tolde prophecie euen snowdonye· atte hede wat coneway side mount eriri dynas embreys walsshe ambrose hille englysshe kyng vortigere sate wat er side ful wone ambrose merlin ꝓphecied fore hym right tho treuisa witte wold wene thate fend myght gete child somme men wold mene may werk welde fende goth nyght wymmen ful ofte gile iucubus named right gyleth men otherwhyle succubus wight god graūte v none suche vyle cometh hir gyle wonder happe shal smyle wonder dede bothe men wymmen seed fendes wole kepe· craft bringe heepe fendes wylde may make wymmen bere child yet neuer mynde child fendes kynde withouten eye ther myght suche child deye clergye maketh mynde deth sleeth fendes f • nde deth slowe merlin merlin ergo gobeblin another merlin albin lond named scotland· name two siluestris calidonius also wode calidoni tolde prephecie heet siluestris well whan batel sawe aboue grisly kynde fyll anon minde made nomore abood ran anon vnto wood· treuisa siluestris wood wilde mode elli atte wode duelles r siluestris merlyn tolde prophecie wel fyn prophecied wel sure vnder kyng arthure openly cloos merlyn ambros ther ben hilles snowdonye ben wonderly hye heyght grete waye man may goo day heet eriri walsshe snowy hilles englysshe hilles ther leese ynowe al beestes walis hilles coppe beres two grete fysshe weres conteyned one ponde meueth ye wynde ylōd though dyde swymme neyheth brymme ye heerdes haue grete wonder wene yt world meueth perche fysshe vnder euery one eyed fareth al· wel albania mylwel rutlond tetingel ther lytil welle floweth alway see twyes day somtyme dreye somtyme ful eye· ther norwallia mon heet anglesia stone accordyng wel neyhe mannes thyhe ferre euer stone borne ony mon nyght goth home way fonde assaye hughe therle shrewsbury· tyme first harry wolde soth finde stone anothir gā bīde grete cheynes yron threwe al feren bounden one heepe water depe yet morow stone seene erly mon cherle helde self ful sligh bonde stone thye thygh roten day stone wente away yf men lecherye neyhe stone swote cometh stone childe cometh ther none ther roche right wonderly th • roche heryng countrey though ther crye ony man born blowe also horn noyse ther made though yu abide thou shalt none side ther another ylonde fast mon honde hermytes ther ben ryue yf ony hem stryue alle myse may gete come ete al mete thenne seceth neuer woo tyll strife sece also men lond ben angry yrlond seyntes contrey ben also wrecheful alway also lond yrlond scotland ben belle staues worship men haues ben worshiped thēne clerkes lewed men dreden also sweren ony tho staf eyther belle gospelle basyngwerke welle sacer hete men telle· hit sprīgeth sore mē may see cast throweth ye therof springeth grete stronde ynowgh al ye lond seke place haue bothe hele grace welmes one ben founde reed sperclid stone token blood reed mayde wenefrede shad pytte whan throte kytte dyde dede hath sorow seede child al stoundes berken welpes houndes pray yt mayde grace ryght welle place eyther shrowsbury strete mayde resteth swete ¶de britannia ¶ capitulum 39 ilond occean brytayn shal descryued cause britayn al trauayll storye bygōne first poynt shal told shal name ylōd thenne stede place lengthe brede thyrdd worthynes londe· fourth merueylles wonder ben therinne fyfthe chyef partye londe· sixth ylondes ben bisides londe· seuenth kynges heyhe wayes· viij famous ryuers stremes· ·ix· olde cytees townes· tenthe prouynces shire xj lawes name lawes ·xij kyngedoms boundes merkes bytwene kyngdoms xiij bysshopriches bisshops see xiiij many maner mē haue dwelled ylond fyftenth langage maners vsage men londe ¶ de varia insule nuncupacione fyrst londe heyte albyon whyte lande whyte rokkes clyues see seen fro ferre afterward bruyte conquerd londe called brytain owne name thenne saxon englysshe men conquerd londe called anglia englond called anglia quene owed lond named angela noble duke doughter saxons· ysid seyth eth 15 anglia hath name angle corner world ellys beda sayth libro primo· seynt gregory sawe englysshe child selle rome acorded name londe sayde ben sothly anglis face shyneth angel noblete londe shone child face alfred ¶ brytysshe anglia cleped world grete plente al good grete charles called hit owne chambre solynus edge frēsshe clyf sholde ende worlde yf ylonde brytayn ne not· whiche worthy haue name londe bothe storye • also storyes grekes sette agaynst ge •• man • gallia fraunce spayne bytwene northe west see bytwene· londe fyfty myle clyf men called morini gessorico beda libro primo ylond lyeth vnder north hede world· hit hath light bright nyghtes somer tyme oftyme mydnyght men haue question doubte whether euen tyde dawynge tyme yere· sonne goth fer vnder erthe nyght passeth north side cometh sone eest agayn therfore somer ben ther dayes ful long xviij houres nyghtes six houres wynter ben longe nyghtes xviij houres short dayes vj also armenia macedonia italia londes lyne lengest daye lengest nyght also xv houres shortest daye nyght ix houres plenius meroe ylond chyef black men ther lengest daye ·xij houres allexandria egypte xiij houres· ytalia xv houres brytayn xviij houres ylonde named tile alle six somer monethes day· six wynter monethes nyght ysidorus libro 14 brytain sette within occean withoute world sette agaynst fraunce spayne giraldus ¶britayne endlonge larger myddel thendes oroꝰ· britain stretcheth length south north south eest side hit hath fraunce· south spayn north norway west hiber • ia irlond whan shipmen passen next clyf londe see cyte heet paas ¶ de prerogatiuis huius insule attollendis gir top ¶ capitulum 41 ffraunce passeth britayn brytayn passeth irlond fayre weder noblete helthe ¶ beda libro primo ylond best brynge forth tree fruyte ruthern beestes wyn groweth therinne somme place ¶ londe hath plente fowles beestes dyuerse maner kynde· londe plentiuous see also londe noble copious ryche noble welles ryuers plente fysshe· ther grete plente smal fysshe samō eel w de pō li 3o peple somme place fedeth swyne ffyssh ¶beda libro primo ther ben oftymes taken dolphins· see calues balaynes grete ffysshes whale kynde dyuerse maner shelfysshe ¶ amonge whiche shelfysshe ben muscle haue within hem margery perles alle maner colour hewe· rody reed purpure blewe sp • cially mooste whyte ¶ther also plente shellefysshe men dyen ther fyn reed redenes therof wonder fayr stable steyneth neuer cold ne heete weet ne drye· euer older colour fayrer· ther ben also saltwelles hote welles therof rennen strem • hoote bathe departed dyuerse place acordyng man woman alle maner age old yonge ¶ basilius seyth water renneth passeth vaynes certayn metalle taketh cours grete hete ylond plentiuous veynes metal bra yron lede tyn· syluer also plenius libro 16 capitulo sexto ¶in ylonde vnder turf of· londe good marle founden thryfte fatnes dryeth hem self therinne euer thykker felde marled better corne wole bere ther also another maner whyte marle londe better foure score yere therwith marled ¶solynus ¶in ylond groweth stone called gagates yf ye wil knowe fayrenes t blac gemmes ben yf ye wil knowe kynde 〈◊〉 brenneth water quencheth oyle myght yf stone froted chauffed hit holdeth hym neygheth succuns stone named ysidorus libro 15· ther ben 〈◊〉 berin good wulle ther ben many hertes wylde beestes fewe wolues therfore sheep ben surer withoute kepynge lefte folde r ylond also ben many cytees townes fayr noble ryche many grete ryuers stremes grete plente ffysshe· many fayre woodes grete right many bestes tame wilde erthe londe 〈◊〉 metal oor salt welles quareis marbl • dyuerse maner stones· rede whyte softe hard chalke whyte lyme· also whyte clay rede make pottes crokkes stenes vessel brent tile couere howses chirches samia named samos also flaundres loueth wel wulle lond holand skynnes felles guyan yron lede irlond oor salt alle europa loueth desireth whyte metal londe alf • brytayn hath ynow mater ther nedeth bye selle nedeful mannes vse ther lacketh neyther salt ne yron· therfor vercifiour metre prey •• h londe maner englond good lond fruytfulle wolle corner englond ful pleye fre men wel worthy pleye fre men fre tonges fre herte fre ben alle theyr thynges theyr honde fre better tonge ¶also englond beauteuous lond floure londes al aboute londe ful payd fruyte good owne londe releueth straunge men hath nede therto ¶ whan honger greueth londes londe fedeth hem lond bereth fruyt corne good ynowgh londe • eese long men lyue pee eeste weste eche lond ben knowen wel hauenes englond· shippis fondes ofte helpeth many londes· theyr mete moneye· men haue comyn alway lerne men gladly yeue yeftes lo • de stronde wyde speke men englond londe hony mylke cheese ylond therof shal bere prise ylond hath nede londes alle londes muste seche helpe allone lykyng theyr myght wondre kynge salamon rychesse ther wolde desire octauian ¶de mirabilibus ea stupendis solynus· capitulum 42 brytayn ben hoote welles wel arayed adressyd vse mankynde maystresse thylk welles grete spyrite minerua· hows fyre endureth alwaye neuer chaungeth asshes· fire slaketh· hit changeth stony clottes ¶alf • ¶ britayne ben many wonder netheles four ben moost wonderful first pecton ther bloweth stronge wynde chynes erthe casteth vp agayn clothes men caste seconde stonhenge besides salesbury· ben grete stone wonder huge ben rered heygh yates· ther semen yates sette vpon yates netheles knowen clerly ne apperceyued wherfor ben arrered wonderfully honged thyrdde t atte cherdhoke grete holownes vnder erthe ofte many men haue walked therin haue seen ryuers stremes nowher fynde none ende· fourth rayne seen reysed vpon hilles none spronge aboute feldes· also ther grete ponde conteyneth lx· ylondes couenable men dwelle ponde byclypped vj score roches vpon eueri roche egles nest lx ryuers rennen ponde none hem alle rennen see one ther ponde closed wal tile stone ponde men wasshe bathe wel ofte· euery man feleth water hoote cold right hym self ther ben salt welles f • r see ben salt al weke longe vnto saterday none fresshe fro saterday none vnto monday water welles whan soden torneth smal salt fayr whyte also ther ponde water therof hath wonder wirchyng though al hooste stode ponde torned theyr face thyderward water wold drawe hem violently toward ponde wete al theyr clothes shold horse drawen wyse yf face torned away fro water water noyeth ther welle streme renneth fro neyther therto yet four maner ffysshes taken therin welle xx foote longe xx foote brode depe kne closed high bankes euery side countray wynchestre den caue caue bloweth alway strong wynde· noman may endure stond fore denne caue ther also pond torneth tre yron yf therin yere tree ben shapen whestones also ther toppe hill buryels euery man cometh meteth buryel· shal fynde euen owne lengthe mesure· yf pylgrym knele therto anon shal al fresshe fele grief werynes gir top ¶ faste mynster wynburney fer fro bathe wode bereth moche fruyte yf tree wode falle water ground neyh lye al yere tree tornen stone gir itinere vnder cyte chestre renneth ryuer dee departeth englond wale ryuer chaū geth euery moneth fordes men countray tellen· leueth ofte chanel whether wat • r drawe toward englond toward wale syde yere men side haue werse ende ouersette men otherside shal haue better ende theyr aboue whan water changeth cours hit bodeth suche happes ryuer • e renneth cometh lake heet pymblemere ryuer grete plente samon netheles lake neuer samon founden· w de· r libro secundo ¶ take hede grete light brightnes goddis myldenes hath shewed vpon englysshe men sith torned first right bileue men one prouynce ben founden many hoole bodyes men deth lykenes euerlastyngnes shal day dome wel semeth holy saintes etheldrede edmonde kynge elphege edgar cutberd seynt edward many i· trowe special grace god almyghty nacion sette without world shold take hede duryng bodyes without corupcion roting bold stedfaste truste fynal ary syng dede bodyes laste euermore daye dome ¶de partibus brytannye principalibus ¶ capitulum 34 firste brute tyme thr ilonde brytayn bygan for· haue principal partyes· ben beogria· cambria wale albania scotland· loegria name locrinus brute oldest sone heet loegria locrinus londe loegria called englond boundes merkes therof somtyme frenssh see bothe est southe beda libro primo capitulo visesimo north two armes see breketh fer londe eyther ayenst reche gyders· est arme thylk tweyn begynneth two lytil mile fro mynstre ebburcuring west side penultō arme toun called guydy weste arme thylk tweyne hath rightside strōg cyte heet alcliud langage called clintstone standeth vpon ryuer called clynt also ¶r somme men wold mene loegria endeth humber stretcheth ferther northward second partye brytayn called albania scotland· hath name albanactus bruytes sone stretcheth fro forseyd two armes see northward vnto see norwaye netheles south partye albania pyctes dwellyd somtyme lyeth water twede vnto scottysshe see al longed somtyme kyngdom northumberland brenycorn northside northumberland fro first tyme englysshe kynges tyme whan kynadyus kyng scotland alpinꝰ sone away pyctes ioyned contray kyngdom scotland thyrdde partye brytayn wale wallia heet cambria also hath name cambria camber brute sone prynce wales· est • de seuarn departed somtyme bytwene englond wale northside ryuer dee chestre south ryuer named vaga castel strygelyn departeth englond wales· also kyng offa haue distinction euermore bytwene kynges englond wale made longe dyche stretcheth forth southside briston vnder hilles wale northward passeth ryuers seuarn dee almost heedes vnto mouth ryuer dee yonde chestre fast castel renneth bytwene cobehill mynstre basyngwerke see· dyche yet many place seen seynt edward tyme walsh men shold passe dyche wepen vpon greet payne erle beraldes procuryng shal sayd eyther side bothe ayond half half dyche specially shyres chestre shrousbury herford· many place ben englysshe men walsshmen medled gyders ¶ de insulis britannye adiacentibus ¶ capitulum 44 brytayn hath thre ylondes ben neygh longen therto al withoute ylondes orcades answeryng thre chyef partyes brytayn yle wight • ongeth lieth loegria englond ilond mon called anglesia also longeth wales· ylond eubonia hath two name called menauia man also· longeth scotland· alle thre ylondes wight mon man ben almoste yliche moche lyke quantite whiche thre al arewe nowe foloweth oure speche ¶ beda libro primo capitulo tercio claudyus sente vaspasianus vaspasianus wan wight wight stretcheth oute est west xxx myle long south north xij myle ¶ est side six myle fro south clyf brytayn· thre myle weste side beda libro quarto capitulo quinto mesure ylond englysshe men gesse thousand howsholdes two honderd ¶ gir itinere· mon called anglesia also departed northwales short arme see two myle brood· mon ben thre honderd townes lxiij ben acompted candredes ben thre hondredes ilond xxx myle long xij myle cantredus moche londe conteyned honderd townes name cantedrus made one two langages brytysshe yryssh praysyng ylond walsshe men ben wonte saye prouerbe old sawe· mon main kembry saye englyssh mon moder wale whan othir londes lacken mete londe good semeth wold finde corne ynough̄ alle men wale therfor vyrgyls verse maye acordyng therto· moche guawes· beestes longe inneth dawes moche efte bryngeth cold dewe nyyhte arme see departeth londe northwales swolow draweth shippes saylleth swoloweth hem right doth cilla caribdis ben two peryllous place see mydde • erthe therfor men may saylle swolow slyly atte ful see· r ¶ marueylles wonder ylond mon thou shalt finde tofore chapytre wale gir itinere thyrd ylond called bothe eubonia menauia man stondeth myddel bytwene yrysshe vlster scotyssh gallewaye nauel see beda libro secundo capitulo nono ylond man conteyneth two ilondes first southward countrey better corne londe conteyneth ixc lx husholdes· ¶ second conteyneth space thre honderd moo englisshe men gesse gir top somtyme stryf whether ylond man sholde longe brytayn yrlonde moche venemous wormes brought thyder lyued iugged ylond man shold longe brytayn r ilond sortilege wyccecraft vsed woman selle shipmen wynde closed vnder thre knottes threde wynde wold haue mo knottes must vndo ofte day tyme men lond seen men ben deed fore hond· byheded hoole deth deide alyens setten foot vpō foot men lond see sightes men ¶ beda li 1 scottes dwellid first ylond thanatos tenet· ylond besides kente hath name thanatos deth serpentes ben none erthe therof sleeth serpentes born londes ther noble cornlond fruytful hit supposed ylond halewed blessyd seynt anstyn first doctour englyssh men arryued first ¶ de platris regalibus ganfe ¶ capitulum 45 moliuncius kynge brytons ·xxiij· hem first yaf hem lawe ordeyned plowman solowes goddes temple high weyes leden men cytes townes sholde haue fredom socour euery man wente ony thre socour trespas shold sauf poursuete alle enemyes afterward weyes vncertayn strif therfor belinus kyng forsaid molyuncius sone put away doubte stryf made four highe kynges w • yes priueleged alle priuelegys fredō wayes stretche thurgh ylōd fyrst grettest four wayes called fosse stretcheth south north begynneth corner corne wayle passeth forth deuenshyre somersete forth besides tetbury vpon cotteswold beside couentre vnto leycetre forth wylde pleynes toward newerk endeth lyncoln second chyef kyn • te high way is· named wat • ingstrete stretcheth thwert ouer fosse southest north west· begyneth douer passeth ye middel kēt ouer temse biside lōdō west westmestre· forth seint albō west side donstable stratford toucetre wedō south lylleborn atheriston vnto gilbertus hille called wrekene· forth seuarn passeth besides wrokcetre thē ne forth stratton forth myddel wale vnto cardykan endeth atte yrysshe see thyrdde way called erimyngestrete stretcheth west northwest eeste southeeste begynneth meneuia seynt dauid londe west wale stretcheth forth vnto southampton· fourth called rykenyldestrete stretcheth forth worcetre wycombe birmyngham lychefeld derby chestrefeld york forth vnto tynmouthe ¶ de famosis fluminibus alfr ¶ capitulum 46 thre famous ryuers rennen thurgh brytayn thre riuers marchaūtes yonde see comē shippes brytayn wel nygh al maner nacions londes thre riuers ben temse seuarn humbre see ebbeth floweth atte mouthes thre riuers departeth thre prouinces ylond thre kyngdoms sondre· thre partyes ben loegria cambria northumbria· ben myddel englond wale northumberland r name temse semeth made one name two name two riu er ben tame yse riu er tame renneth besides dorchestre falleth yse therfor al riuer fro first hede vnto eest see named tamyse temse tamise begynneth besides tetbury thre myle north malmesbury temse springeth welle renneth estward passeth fosse departeth gloucetre shyre wylshyre draweth hym many welles stremes wexth grete grecestre passeth forth toward hampton forth oxenford wallynford redyng london w po c atte hauen sandwych falleth est see· holdeth name ·xl mile beyonde london departed som place kente esex westsex mercia grete dele myddel englond r seuarn riuer britain called habern briton hath name habren habren estrildes doughter guedelon quene drenchid habren therin therfore briton called ryuer habren woman drowned thrinne ¶ corrupte latyn called sabrina seuarn englysshe seuarn begynneth myddel wale passith first toward eest vnto shrowesbury then̄e torneth southward vnto brigge northe wyrcetre gloncetre falleth weste see besides bristow departeth somme pla • e englond wales· w de pon li· 4 seuarn swyfte streme· fysshe craft therin wodenes swolewyng whyrlyng water casteth vp gadrith heepe grete hepes grauel seuarn ofte aryseth ouerfloweth bankes r· humbre hath name humber kyng hunes ffor drowned therin· renneth first crookout southside yorke ¶and thenne departeth prouynce lyndeseye longed somtyme merces contrey northumberland trente ouse rennen humber maken riuer ful grete treuisa ¶ merces men myddel englond shal sayd ¶ de antiquis vrbibus beda libro primo capitulo primo ¶ capitulum 47 kyngdō britayn sōtyme made fair ·xxviij noble cytees without right many castels carrey chicestre· saxon called somtyme cissancestre· caercery circetre· caerguent winchestre ca •• graunt cambrygge· caerleyl lug • balia karlyl caerperis porchestre caerdrō dorcestre· caerludcoit marchandyse therfor somtyme whan derth vytaylles al englond comynly london best cheep cause byars sellars ben london ¶ganf • bruyt first kyng briton̄s buylded edefyed cyte london firste cyte brytayn remembraunce cyte troye destroyed calleth troyeneweth trinouantum new troye afterward kynge lud called caerlud owne name· therfor brytons grete indygnation gyldas telleth· afterward englysshmen called cyte london yet norman called loūdres named latyn londonia rudhudibras kyng leyles sone viij kyng brytons bylded caunterbury chyef cyte kente called • caerkent afterward englysshmen called dorobernia douer stondeth vpon clyf frensshe see douer vij englyssh myle afterward dorobernia called caunterbury· kyng rudhudibras bylded wynchestre called caerguent· englyssmen called wente wynchestre name one wyne englyssman bisshop westsaxon subgette hym kynge buylded palodour septon called shaftesbury· brytons tellen egle prophecyed somtyme bladud leyles sone nygromancer ix kyng brytons bylded bathe called caerbadum englyssmen called athamannes cyte atte laste men called bathonia bathe w· de pon libro secundo ¶in cyte welleth vp spryngeth hote bathe men wene iulius cezar made suche bathe r ganf • monemutensis briton book seith bladud made thylke bathes· cause wiliam seen briton booke wrote tellyng men owne ghessyng wrote thynges best aduysedly therfore semeth sothly bladud made hote bathe ne iulius cezar dyde suche dede though bladud bilded made cyte ¶ acordeth better kendly reson water renneth erthe veynes brymstone sulphure· ¶ kendely made hoote cours spryngeth vp diuerse pla • e cyte ¶ ther ben hoote bathe wasshe • h tetres soores skabbis ¶ treuisa ¶ though men myght crafte make hoote bathe dure longe ynowgh acordeth wel reason philosophye treteth hoote welles bathe ben diuerse londes though water bathe troubly henyer sauoure smelle hote bathe ben haue seen akon almayne ¶ egges sauoye whiche ben fayre clere ony cold welle streme haue ben bathed therinne essayed r claudius cezar maried doughter arruiragus kyng briton claudiꝰ cezar bylded gloucestre weddyng doughter briton called cyte first claudiꝰ name afterward called gloucestre one glora duk contrey stondeth vpon seuarn marche englond wale shrowesbury cyte vpon seuarn marche englond wale sette vpon toppe hille called shrowesbury shrobbes fruyte grewe somtyme hille briton cleped somtyme pengwern hede fair tree shrowesbury somtyme hede powesye strethecth forth thwert ouer myddel wale vnto yryssh see notyngham stondeth vpon trente somtyme heet snotyngham wonnyng dennes· dane dwellyd ther somtyme digged dennes caues vnder hard stone rokkes dwellyd r lyncoln chyef • rouynce lyndesaye somtyme callid caerludcoyt afterward lyndecolyn· vncerteyn bylded firste cyte yf kyng lud semeth menyng name· caer bry • ysshe saye cyte coyt wode· semeth caerludcoit saye luddes wode toun· kyng leyr bladuddis sone bylded leycetre myddel englond vpon ryuer so vpon fosse kynges hye waye ¶willelmus de pon libro tercio ¶ capitulum 48 yorke grete cyte eyther side water owse semed fayr rome vnto tyme kynge william conquerour brennyng fuyre defowled countrey aboute pylgrym wold wepe sawe yf knowen fore· gauf • ebrancus fyfth kyng briton bylded yorke called owne name caerbranck· ¶ bylded also two noble cytees one scotland called edenburgh another toward scotland thendes englond called alcliud· r edenburgh cyte londe pyctes bytwene riuer twede scotysshe see· • eete somtyme castel maydens· called afterward edenburgh edan kynge pyct • regned egfridus tyme kynge northumberlond alcliud somtyme noble cyte wel nygh vnknowe alle englysshemen vnder brytons pyctes englyssmen noble cyte vnto comyng dane afterward yere lord viijc·lxx hit destroyed whan dane destroyed countreyes northumberl • nd place brytayn cyte alcliud bilded auetours tellen dyuersly ¶ beda l • p seyth bylde west arme see departeth bytwene briton pyctes somtyme seuerus famoꝰ welle endeth wes • ward semeth hym ferre caerleyl cyte sette atte wryteth elidurus kynge briton lodged atte cyte alcliud cause solace hunting fonde broder agalon maskyng wode neygh beside heyghte calatery wode calatery· whiche caltres englysshe recheth almost york fast right side west arme see· departeth englond scotlond alcliud right strong cyte beda sayth cite stondeth fast ryuer called cliud ther riuer yorkshyre nether westmerlond men contrey telle sōme men saye riuer cliud nowe named sulwach sulwach v myle fro caerleyl r caerleyl cyte contrey northenglond toward northwest hath another name whiche lugubal leyl vij kyng brytons bylded carleyl r ¶in cyte somwhat famous wa •• e passeth northumberlond w de pon· cyte yet thre chambred hows made vawte stone neu er myght destroyed tempest weder ne brennyng fyre also countrey fast westmerlond fronte thre chā bred place wreton maner marij victorye· writing saye doubte somwhat yf sōme combres laye somtyme whan consul marius put hem ytalye· semeth better writen mynde marius kynge brytons aruiragus sone north half ¶r ther diffrence bytwene prouynce lyndeffar chirche lyndefarne ffor prouynce lyndeffar lyndesaye al one lyeth eest lyncoln lyncoln hede therof sayth beda li 4 c 11· sexnulphꝰ fi • st
