thre ylondes one mailros nowe called menros aboue toward th • west lyndeffarn chirche called haly ylond thenne thyrd aboue vpward ylond farne callyd also farny ylond thenne vpward aboue two myle ryal cyte vpon brynke twede somtyme heighte bebenborgh bobbes cyte nowe called bamburgh· hath right stronge castel gir itinere two cytees ben eyther called caerlegyon caerleon· also· one demecia southe wale named caerusk also ¶there ryuer vske falleth seuarne fast glammorgan bellinus kynge brytons somtyme bilded cyte somtyme chyef cyte demecia southwales afterward claudius cezars tyme hit called cyte legyons whan atte prayer genyus quene vaspasianus arinragus acorded legyons rome sent • lond tho carleon noble cyte grete auctorite romayns ryally walled walles brent tile grete nobley old tyme yet many place seen grete palayses gyantes towres noble bathe releef temple place atres place hye riall stonde sitte beholde place rially closed rial walles yet somdele stondeth right nyghe cloos within walles without grete byldyng vnder erthe water condytes weyes vnder erthe stewes also thou shalt see wonderly made strayte side wayes brethynge wonderly cast vp heete cyte somtyme thre noble chirches one seynt iulius martir ther grete company virgyns seynt aaron ordre blac chanons chirche hem nobly adourned· thyrdde chirche chyef moder chirche alle wales· chyef see afterward chyef see torned cyte meneuia seynt dauyes londe west wales· carleon amphibalus borne taught seynt albone· there· messagers rome come grete arthur court yf leeful trowe treuisa yf giraldus doubte whether leefful trowe hit wonder sweuen men wold wene haue euermore mynde euer doubte· yf alle bookes suche lore therinne namely whyle maketh none euydence neyther side telleth moeueth saye ¶r another cyte legyons cronyke bytrauaylled clerly knowen first chapytre book· treuisa vnderstōdyng latyn wrytyng made latyn torned englyssh ne torned englysshe place yt made first latyn vnderstondyng hym made cronyk thus wreton latyn begynnynge book presentem cronycam compylauit frater ranulphus cestrensis monachus· saye englysshe· broder ranulphus monke chestre compiled made present cronyke ¶r cyte legyons chestre stondeth marche englond toward wale bytwene two armes see ben named dee mersee cyte tyme brytons heed chyef cyte alle venedocia northwales founder cyte vnknowe seeth foūdamentes grete stone wolde rather wene romayns werke· werke gyant • made settynge brytons cyte somtyme brytysshe speche heet carthleon legecestria latyn chestrean englyssh cyte legyons also ther lay wynter legyons knyghtes iulius cezar sente wynne yrlond claudyus cezar sente legyons cyte wynne ylondes called orcades euer wiliam malmesbury tellyng men mette cyte ¶this cyte hath plente lyuelode corn fflesshe ffysshe specially pris samon cyte resseyueth grete marchandyse sendeth also· also neygh cyte ben salt· welles metal oore northumbres destroyed cyte somtyme afterward elfleda lady mercia bylded agayne made moche more· cyte ben wayes vnder erthe vowtes stonewerke wōderly wrought thre chambred werkes grete stone graue old mennes name therin also iulius cezars name wonderly stone graue noble mēnes also wrytyng about· cyte ethelfryd kynge northumberland destroyed • ough fast neygh two thousand monkes mynster bangor ¶ cyte kyng edgar cam somtyme seuen kynges subget hym metrer breketh oute maner praysynge cyte chestre castel toun name take castel ¶ vnknowe man byld cyte tho legecestria chees • ete toun legyones ¶now walsshe englysshe holde toun grete pris stone walle semeth werke hercules alle longe myght dure hepe hight· saxon sm • le stone sette vpon grete ben attones ther vnder grounde lotyng double vout founde helpeth sondes many men westren londes fisshe flesshe corne low cyte toun hath ynowgh· shippes chaffre see water bringeth ynowgh thare godestalle emperour er ferth henry kynge erthe righten dwellyng kynge haralde powder ther yet halde bachus marcurius mar venus also lauerna· protheus pluto regnen toun treuisa god wote mene poetes maner speche feynen though euery kynde craft liuyng hath dyuerse god eueryche feyned god batayll fyghtyng called hym mar god couetyse rychesse marchandyse called hym mercurius bachus called god wyn venus goddesse loue beaute lauerna god thefte robberye▪ protheus god falsshede gyle pluto god helle· semeth verse wold mene forsay •• goddis regne ben serued chestre mar fyghtyng ••• kyng mercurius couetise rychesse marchandyse bachus grete drynkyng· venus loue lewdly lauerna theft robberye protheus falshed gyle thenne pluto vnseruyd god helle ¶r ther babilon lore myght hath trouthe ¶ de shiris anglie siue prouyncijs ¶ capitulum 49 take hede englond conteyneth xxxij· shyres prouynces ben called erldomis reserued cornewayl ilondes ¶alfr ben name erldoms shyres· kent southsex sortherey hampshire barokshire hath name bare ook forest wyndesore bare ooke men shyre wonte come gyders make tretis take counseyl aduys also wildshyre heet somtyme prouynce semeran somersete dorsete deuenshire called deuonia latyn ix southshires tamyse departeth frō dele englōd whiche somtyme gouerned rewled westsaxon lawe estsex myddelsex· southe folke north folk hertfordshire huntyndonshyre northamptonshyre cambryggeshyre bedfordshyre buykynghamshyre leycetre shyre derby shyre notynghamshyre lincolnshyre yorkshyre duramsihre· northumberhand caerlelshyre cumberlond appelbisshyre westmerlond lancasshyre conteyneth fiue litil shire fyftene northe eest shyres somtyme gouerned rewled lawe whiche called denelawe oxenforshire warwikshire gloucestreshyre ▪ wircetre shire herdforshire shropshire staffordshire chestresire ¶these viij middel west shire somtyme gouerned rewled lawe called mercia latyn merchene lawe englysshe· wete yorkshyre stretcheth ryuer humbre vnto ryuer teyse yet yorkshyre ben xxij hondredis hundred candred al one candred one word made walsshe prysshe menyng countrey conteyneth honderd townes also englyssh called wepentak· somtyme comyng new lord tenauntes wonte yelde vp wepē stede homage durāshire stretcheth frō ryu er teise vnto ye riu er tine speke proprely northumberlād stretcheth fro ryuer tyne vnto ryuer twede begynnyng scotland thenne yf countray northū berland somtyme humbre vnto twede acompted one shire one erldom somtyme· thenne ben englond xxxij shire yf countray northumberland departed vj shire ben euer wikshire duramshire northumberlond carleylshire appelbyshire lancasshire· thenne ben englond xxxvj shire withoute cornuale also without ylondes kynge william conquerour made alle prouynces shire descryued meten thenne fonden xxxvj shire half shyre townes l ij four score parissh chirches xlv ij knyghtes fee lxxv·m wherof men relygyon haue xxviij thousand xv knyghtes fee wodes ben hewen doun lande newe tylled made moche tyme many townes vyllages buylded ther ben many moo vyllages townes tyme fore wreton cornuayll sette amonge shire englond may stonde amonge wel ynowgh neyther wale ne scotland englond ioyneth deuensshire may ther ben acompted englond xxxvij shire half shire ¶de legibus legum que vocabulis ¶ capitulum 50 dvnwallo heet moliuncius also made first lawes britayne whiche lawes called moliuncius lawes solompnly obserued vnto wiliam conquerours tyme molyuncius ordeyned amonge law cytees temple weyes lede men therto plowman solowes shold haue priuelege fredom saue alle men wold flee ther socour refuge thenne afterward marcya quene briton gwytelynus wyf prouynce name mercia somme men suppose ¶she made lawe ful right wytte reson called merchene lawe gildas wrote historyes brytons torned two lawes briton speche latyn· afterward kyng aluredus torned alle latyn saxon speche called merchene lawe also kyng aluredus w • ote englyssh put another lawe heet westsaxon lawe then̄e afterward dane lordes lond cam forth thyrdde lawe heet dane lawe thre lawes seynt edward cōfessour made one comyn lawe yet called seynt edwardes lawe holde wel wryte expowne many termes lawes· myndebruche hurtyng honour worship· frensshe bleschur dhonour· burchbruch frensshe bleschur de court de cloys gritchbruch brekyng pees· myskennyng chaungyng speche court shewyng settyng forth marchandyse frensshe displeir de marchandyse· hamsokne· hamfare rese made hows forstallyng wronge lete doun kynges hye waye· frythsoken sewrte defence· saka fait soka sute courte therof cometh soken theam sute bondmen· fyghtingtwyte amersement fightyng blodewyte mersement shedyng blode flytwite amendes shedynge blode leyr wyte· amendes lyeng bondewoman gul • ewite amendes trespas· scot gadryng werke bailyes hydage tayllage hydes londes danegheld tayllage yeuen dane euery bonata terre euery oxe londe thre pen weepentack honderd al one ¶for contre c townes woonte gyue vp wepen comyng lord lestage custome chalengyd chepyngys fayres stallage custome stondynge stretes feyre tyme ¶ de regnis regnorum que lymitibus ¶ capitulum 51 kyngdom britayn stode without departyng hool al one kyngdom briton firste bruyte vnto iulius cezars tyme fro iulius cezars tyme vnto seuerus tyme londe vnder trybute romayns netheles kynges lond seuerus vnto laste prynce gracyan successours brytayns faylled romayns regned brytayn afterward romayns lefte regnyng brytayn cause fer rome grete besynesse side ¶thenne scottes pyctes mysledyng maximus tyraunt poursiewed brytayn warred therin grete strengthe men armes long tyme vnto tyme saxon come atte prayeng brytons ayenst pyctes put gurmund yrysshe kynge pyctes brytons also kyng heet carecticus drof hem oute englond wale saxon victours euery prouynce strength made hem kyng departed englōd vij kyngdōs netheles afterward vij kyngeddoms euerych come one kyngdō al hool vnder prince adelstō netheles dane poursued lōd fro athelwulfis tyme luredus fader vnto thyrde seynt edwardes tyme c lxx yere regned therin continuelly xxx yere dane iij seynt edward regned therin xxiij yere lytil hym haralt helde kyngdom ix monethis hem norman haue regned vnto tyme long shal regne wote nothyng vnknowen ¶r said seuen kyngdomes merkes mere boundes whan began long endured shal somwhat shortly telle ¶alf • first kyngdom kyngdom kent stretcheth fro eest occean vnto ryuer tamyse regned first hengistus began regne acompting dyonyse yere lord four c lv· kyngdom dured thre honderd lxviij yere vnder ·xv kynges vnto tyme baldrede put egbert kyng westsaxon̄ ioyned kyngdom second kyngdom southsaxon eest side kent south see yle wight west hampshyre north sothery ther ella regned first thre sone began regne yere comyng angle euen xxx kyngdom within short tyme passed kyngdoms thyrdde kyngdom eestsaxon· est syde see· weste contrey london· southe tamyse north southfolk kynges contreye estsaxon fro first sabertes tyme vnto tyme dane ten kynges whiche subget somdel kynges netheles oftest lengest vnder kynges mercia vnto tyme egbert kyng westsaxon ioyned kyngdom owne fourth kyngdom eest anglis conteyned norfolk suffolk eest side north see· northwest cambrygeshyre· west seynt edmundes dyche hertfordshyre southe est • x kyngdom dured vnder xij kynges vnto tyme kynge edmunde slayn thenne dane toke wrongfully bothe kyngdoms eest angle eestsaxon ¶ afterward dane put dryuen away made subgette elder kyng edward ioyned bothe kyngdoms owne fyfth kyngdom westsaxon dured lengest alle kyngdoms est side southsaxon north tamyse southe weste see oxcean· kyngdom regned cerdrick sone kenrik began regne yere lord v·c·xix comyng anglis lxxj· seyth denys kyngdoms passyd kyngdom sixte kyngdom mercia grettest alle markes mere therof west side ryuer dee fast chestre seuarn fast shrowesbury vnto bristowe eest est see· south tamyse vnto london north ryuer humbre westward dounward vnto riuer mersee vnto corner wirhal ther hū bre falleth west see penda wybbes sone regned firste kyngdom yere lord ·vj c xxvj seyth denys fro comyng angle clxxv yere kyngdom dured vnder xviij kynges two c lxiij yere vnto laste colwulf colwulf dane bitoke kyngdom kepe whan burdred kyng put elder edward kynge put dane ioyned kyngdom mercia kyngdom netheles atte begynnyng kyngdom mercia departed thre west mercia myddel mercia est mercia seue nth kyngdom northamhimbrorum kyngdom northumberlond mere markes therof west est see occean south riuer humbre dounward toward west thendes shire nothyngham derby vnto ryuer mersee northe scottysshe see heete forthe scottysshe werid brytysshe· scotyssh see englysshe ¶ kyngdom northumberlond first deled two prouynces one south side heete deyra north side heet brenicia two kyngdoms· riuer departed two kyngdoms tyme· kyngdom deyra fro ryuer humber vnto riuer tine kyngdom brenycia fro tyne scottysshe see· whan pyctes dwellyd beda seyth libro terci • capitulo secundo ninian holy man conuerted men south side ¶ ida kyng regned first began regne rere oure lord v c xlvij seyth dyonyse deyra regned kyng elle yere lord vcxlix· two kyngdoms whyle sayd departed bytwene two kynges somtyme al hool vnder one kyng ¶and dured xx englysshe kynges thre hondred xxj yere atte laste osbrutus elle slayn ix· yere kyngdome dane slowe hem· northumberlond vode without kyng viij yere ¶ thenne afterward dane regned northumberlond xxxvj yere vnto oonyng kyngdom adelston· made subget kynges dane scotyssh walssh regned first al one englond helde kyngdom englond hoole one kyngdom yere lord viij cxxvij ryuer mersee somtyme marke mere bytwene kyngdom mercia kyngdom northumberlond may shewd two maners • firste proprete mersee moche saye see bound mere departeth one kyngdom another ¶ also wryte cronycks henry alfrede kyng coward elder fastned castel mauncestre northumberlond cyte maūcestre fro riuer mersee scarsely thre myle· ¶de episcopatibus et sedibus alfr ¶ capitulum 52 lvcius first kynge cristend brytons tyme thre archibisshops see brytayn one london· another york thyrdde caruske cyte legyōs glamorgan· cyte called carleon archibisshops see subget xxviij bisshops called flamynes archibisshops see london subgette c •• nual al myddel englond vnto humbre yorke al northumberlond lowe humbre al scotland caerleon alle walles ther wale seuen bisshops ben four· tho seuarne departed englond wale w de pon libro primo saxōs tyme though seynt gregorye graū ted london pryuelege tharchibisshops see· netheles seynt austyn sente englond seynt gregory torned tharchebisshops see london caūterburye seynt gregoryes daye atte prayer kyng athelbert cytezeyns burgesyes caūterbury ther tharchebisshops see hath dured vnto saue mene tyme offa kyng mercia wroth men caunterbury bynam hem worship· worshipped adulph bisshop lichfeld tharchibisshops pal assente adrian pope vpon caas yeftes sente netheles vnder kenulph kynge restored caunterbury agayn worship see york hath dured alway dureth yet though scotland withdrawe fro subiection passyng tyme gir iti li p archibisshops see torned caerleō meneuia inthe west side demecia vpon pryssh see seynt dauids tyme vnder kyng arthur seynt dauids tyme vnto sampsons tyme meneuia archebisshops xxiij aftward fyll pestylence al wale yelow euyl called iaūdis then̄e sāpsō tharchibisshop toke hym palle wente brytayn armonyca lasbritayne bisshop dolensis tyme vnto first harryes tyme kyng englond meneuia called seynt dauids xxj bisshops alle without palle whether vnconnyng pouerte netheles alway fro tyme bisshops wale sacred bisshop meneuia seynt dauyes bisshop meneuia sacred bisshops wale suffrigans made profession ne subiection none chirche ¶ bisshops come afterward sacred caunterbury compellyng heest kyng token sacrynge subiection bone face archibisshop caunterbury legate crosse sōge euery cathedral chirch wale solēpnly· amasse first archebisshop caūterbury dyde wale second harryes tyme· ¶r ben two primate al̄ englond caunterbury york primate caunterbury ben subget xiij bisshops englond foure wale ¶ primate york hath two suffrigans englond ben bisshops caerleyl durham ¶ alle thyse see chaungyng place shal shewe folowyng· ¶ take hede begynnyng holy chirche englond bisshops ordeyned theyr see lowe place symple couenable contemplacion prayer deuocion wiliam conquerours tyme dome lawe canon ordeyned bisshops shold come smale tounes grete cytees· ¶therfore see dorchestre chaū ged lyncoln lychefeld chestre tetford norwiche shirborn salisbury welles bathe· cornwayl ex • tre selesey chicestre bisshop rochestre hath paryssh tharchebisshops chappellayn caunterbury syth see caunterbury first ordeyned seynt austyn chaunged yet neuer place· chicestre hath vnder hym southsex yle wight see first selesey tyme tharchebisshop theodore see dured thre honderd ·xxxiij yere vnder xx bisshops fro first wilfrede vnto last stigande atte commaundement kynge william conquerour chaunged see selesey chicestre ¶ de episcopis occidentalibus willelmus ¶ capitulum 53 haue mynde al prouynce westsaxon alway one bisshop fro begynnyng vnto theodoras tyme graunt kynge islo kynge westsaxon first byrinus ordeyned see dorchestre symple toun southe oxenford beside wallyngford bytwene metynge gyder tems tame whan birinus dede kenwalcus kyng ordeyned see wynchestre fader purposed agilbert frensshe man fyrste bisshop al prouynce westsaxon ¶ fro tyme cyte see dorchestre perteyned longed prouynce mercia ¶for cyte stondeth within temse· temse departeth bitwene mercia westsaxon· agilbert put oute wynchestre tho highte wynton ¶ ther englyssh bisshop called wyn somme men suppose cyte hath name wyne called wynchestre wynes cyte atte last pute hym come lentherius forseyd agelbertes neuew lentherius hedda whyle bisshop whan dede theodorus tharche bisshop ordeynd two bisshops prouynce westsaxon danyel wynchestre hym subgette two contreyes sothery southampshire· adelin shirborn hym subgette six countrees barkshire· wiltshire somersete dorsete shire deuenshire cornuayl ¶ treuisa semeth westsaxon conteyned sothery southampshire barkshire wiltshire somerseteshyre dorsetshire deuenshire cornuayl ¶willelmus afterward elder edwardes tyme two see ordeyned commaundment formosus pope· thre see welles somersete kryton deuenshyre seynt germayn cornuayle ful longe afterward sixth see sette ramesbury wytltshire atte laste commaundement kynge wiliam conquerour alle see saue wynchestre torned chaunged smal townes grete cytees shirborn ramesbury torned salesbury ¶now see subget barkshire wiltshire dorsete see welles torned bathe therto nowe subget al somersete see kyrton cornuayl chaūged exetre therto subget deuenshire cormuayl ¶ de orientalibus episcopis willelmus ¶ capitulum 54 oit knowen eeste saxon alwaye fro begynnyng subget bisshop london prouynce eeste angle conteyneth norfolke suffolke one bisshop donwyck bisshop heete felyx burgoyn bisshop xvij yere hym thomas bisshop fyue yere hym boneface xvij yere thenne bysy afterward ordeyned theodorus rewlid prouynce whyle myght endure hym self alone· hym vnto egbertes tyme kyng westsaxons hondred xliij two bisshops rewled prouynce one donwyck another elyngham netheles ludecans tyme kyng mercia lefte one see elyngham vnto fyfth yere wiliam conquerour whan herfastus xxiij bisshop estrene chaunged see tetford successour herebertus chaunged see fro tetford norwiche leue kyng wiliam rede see ely nygh therto firste kynge harry ordeyned ix yere regne made subget therto cambrigshyre fore parte bissoprich lyncolne quytyng therof yaf bisshop lyncoln good toun callyd spaldyng ¶ de episcopis merciorum· willelmus ¶ capitulum 55 take hede kyngdom mercia alwaye grettest tyme deled moo bisshopryches specially grete herte kynge offa whiche fourty yere kynge mercia chaunged tharchebisshops see fro caunterbury lychefeld assent adryan pope thenne prouynce mercia lyndefar first begynnyng cristendom kyng wulfrans tyme one bisshop lychefeld first bisshop heet dwyna second heet celath bothe scottes hem thyrdde trumpher fourth germuannus ¶ fyfthe chedde edelfredes tyme wulfers broder whan chedde deed theodorus tharchebisshop ordeyned wynfrede cheddes deken netheles apud hyndon vnbuxom som poynt ordeyned sexwulf abbot medamstede named burgh sexwulfs fourth yere theodorus tharchebisshop ordeyned fyue bisshops prouince mercia ordeyned bosel wyrcetre· cud wyn lychefeld forseyd sexwulf chestre· edelwyn lindesey atte cyte sydenia toke eata monke abbay hilde whytby· made hym bisshop dorchestre besides oxenford ¶ tho dorchestre heet dorkyng see longed west saxon seynt byrynes tyme longed mercia theodorus archebisshops tyme also whan ethelred kynge mercia destroyed kent bisshop sexwulf toke pyctas bisshop rochestre come kent made hym first bisshop herford· atte laste whan sexwulf dede hedda bisshop lychefeld hym wylfred flemed oute northumberlond bisshop chestre netheles two yere alfrede kynge northumberlond dyed wilfred torned agayn owne see hagustalden hedda helde bothe bisshopryches lychfeld chestre hym come albyn heet wor also hym come thre bisshops torta chestre wytta lychefeld eata yet dorchestre deth bisshops lyndeseye helde see thre honderd liiij yere vnto remygyus chaunged see lyncoln leue first kyng wiliam· edgar tyme bysshop leofwnus ioined bothe bisshopryches gyder chestre lyndeffar whyle lyf dured de episcopis northūbranis w· de pon li· 4 ca 11· capitulum 56 yorke one see al prouynce northumberlond paulinus helde first see ordeyned bisshop caunterbury helde see yorke seuen yere afterward whan kynge edwyn slayn thynges distroubled paulinus wente then water wey kente· whens come first toke hym palle ¶will libo 3 ¶ bisshopryche york ceesed xxx yere vse palle seced cxxv· yere vnto egbert bisshop kynges broder londe recouerid autoryte pope ¶ r ¶ whan seynt oswold regned aidanus scotte bisshop brenicia northside northumberlond hym ffinianus· hym salmannus ¶w vvi sup atte laste wente scotland grete indignacion wilfride vndertoke helde vnlawfully esterday xxx yere paulinus goon wylfryde made bisshop york beda libro quarto ¶ whyle dwellyd longe fraunce aboute sacryng exityng quartatadecimanorum helde esterday xiiij daye mone chedde take oute abbaye lestynge and· wrongfully putte oute see yorke assente kyng oswy thre yere afterward theodorus tharchebisshop dide hym away assigned hym prouince mercia restored wylfrede see york ¶ wilfrede cause wrath bytwene hym kynge egfryd putte see helpe theodorus tharchebisshop corrupt som maner mede wilfred ben bisshop york x yere then̄e atte instaunce kynge theodorus made bosam bisshop yorke cumbert hagustald chirche • ata lyndeffar chirche called holy ylond ryuer twede aidanus founded firste see theoder • made eadhedus bisshop reponn comen agayn lyndesaye· wylfrede abbot repon theoderus sente trunwynus lond pyctes thendes englond fast scotland place heete candida casa whyterne also· seynt nynyan bryton first foundour doctor see take york fayled lytil lytil see candida casa galewey longed tho englond dured many yeres vnder ten bisshops vnto power destroyng pyctes see hagustald lyndeffar somtyme al one vnder ix bisshops four score yere ten dured vnto comyng dane tyme vnder hyngar hubba ardulph bisshop yede long seynt cutb • r • body vnto kyng aluredes tyme kyng westsaxons· see lyndefar sette kunegestre callyd kunyngysburgh also place called vbbesford vpon twede atte laste xvij yere kyng egbert kyng edgardes sone· see chaunged durham seynt cuthberts hody brought thyder doyng edmond bisshop fro tyme forward see hagustald lyndeffar faylled vtterly· first kynge henry ix· yere regne made newe see caerleyl ¶ capitulum 57 archibisshop caunterbury hath vnder hym ·xiij bisshops englōd· ·iiij wale hath rochestr̄ vnder see hath vnder hym part kent allone london hath vnder hem estsex myddelsex half hertfordshire chichestre hath vnder southstx • yle wight wynchesere hath vnder hym hāpshyre southerye salesbury hath vnder hym barkshire wiltshire dorset· excetre hath vnder hym deuēshire cornuayl· bathe hath vnder hym somerseteshire allone wyrcetre hath vnder hym gloucetreshire wircetreshire half warwyckshire herford hath vnder hym herdfordshire som shropshyre chestre bisshop couē tre lychfeld· hath vnder hym chestreshire staffordshire derbyshyre half warwykshire som shropshire som lancastreshyre· fro riuer mersce vnto ryuer rypyl lyncoln hath vnder hym prouynces ben bytwene tamyse humbre ben shyres lyncoln leycetre northampton huntyngdon bedford bokynham oxenford half hertfordshyre ely hath vnder hym cambregeshire oute take merlond ¶ northwyche hath vnder hym merlond norfolk suffolk also tharchibisshop caūterbury hath four suffrygans wale ben landaf seynt dauyes bangor seynt assaph ¶ archebisshop yorke hath nowe two bisshops vnder hym ben durham caerleyl r ¶and so· ben two prymates englond one hem shal doo poynt shal obedyent vnder hym fully conteyned withinne yere lord thousand lxxij fore first kyng wiliam bisshops englond commaundement pope cause handled treated bytwene forsayd prymates ordeyned demed primate yorke shal subget primate caunterbury thynges longen worship god bileue holy chirche place euer englond primate caunterbury w • l hote constrayne gad • e counseyl clergye prymate yorke holden suffrygans obedyent ordynaunce shall lawfully ordeyned whan prymate caunterbury dede prymate yorke shal come caunterbury bisshops shal sacre hym chosen bisshops shal sacre owne prymate· yf prymate york dede successour shal come bisshop caunterbury shal take ordenaunce hym doo ooth profession lawful obedyence ¶ within aboute yere oure lord xj honderd four score xv tyme kyng rychard ben resons sette right partye eyther prymate one prymate dyde tyme th • rstinus thomas bisshops york conquest vnto kyng harryes tyme thyrdde also said eche starte place forspekyng ful tretis therof· therfore noyeful charge place alle thylke resons ben made da quot quando et quibus inhabita ta • gentibus ¶ capitulum 58 briton dwellyd first ilond xviij yere yere hely prophete xj yere siluius postumus kyng latyns xliij yere aftir takyng troye fore buyldyng rome four honderd xxxij yere ¶ beda libro primo· come hether toke cours armorik brytayn helde long tyme south contreyes ylond ¶ hit befel afterward vaspasianus tyme duke rome pyctes shipped scicia occean dryuen aboute wynde entred north costes irlond fonde scottes prayd haue place dwelle myghte none gete irlond scottes saide myght susteyne bothe peple ¶ scottes sente pyctes northsides brytayn behight hem helpe ayenst brytons theyr enemyes yf wold aryse toke hem wyues doughters vpon suche condicion yf doubte fylle· sholde haue right kynge sholde rather chese hem kyng moder side faders side woman kyn rather men kynde ganfr vaspasiane themperours tyme whan marius aruiragꝰ sone kyng briton one roderik kyng pyctes cam scicia and▪ gan destroye scotland thenne marius kynge slewe roderick yaf northe partye scotland heet cathenesia men come rotherik ouercome hym dwelle inne men none wyues ne none myght haue nacion brytons therfore saylled irlond toke theyr wyues prysshmens doughters couenaunt moder blode sholde put fore succession herytage gir c 17 netheles syrinꝰ suꝑ virgiliū seith pyctes ben agatyrses somme dwellyng place water scicia ben called pyctes peyntyng smytyng woundes ben seen bodyes hadde moche flewme ofte boxed bete blood many woundes seen bodye semed men peynted woundes therfore called pyctes peynted men ¶ men gothes ben al one peple whan maximus tyraunt wente oute brytayn fraūce occupye thempyre· thenne gracianus valentinianus bretheren felaws thempyre brought thyse gothes oute scicia grete yeftes fflaterynge fayre byhestes northe owne name kynge edgards tyme kynadyus alpynus sone duke leder scottes warred pycte londe destroyed pyctes warred six sithes saxon toke al londe bitwene twede scotyssh see wrong strengthe ¶ de incolarum anguis ¶ capitulum 59 knowen many maner peple ben ilond ther ben also many langages tonges netheles walsh men scottes ben medled nacions kepe neygh yet theyr first langage speche· yet tho scottes somtyme confederate dwellyd pyctes drawe somwhat theyr speche flemynges dwelle th • westside wale haue lefte straunge speche speken lyke saxōs also englysshmen though fro begynnyng thre maner speches southern northern myddel speche middel londe come thre maner people germamania netheles commyxtion medlyng first dan afterward norman many thynges countreye langage appayred ffor somme vse straunge wlaffyng chyteryng harryng garryng grisbytyng appayryng langage cometh two thynges one cause child gon scole lerne speke first englysshe ben cōpellid constrew • lesson frenssh haue ben vsed syn norm • n come englond also gentilmens childeren ben lerned taught theyr yongthe speke frenssh vplondyssh men counterfete likene hem self gentilmen arn besy sp • ke frensshe sette wherfor sayd comyn prouerbe· iack wold gentilman coude speke frensshe ¶treuisa maner moche vsed fore grete deth· syth somdele chaunged sir iohan cornuayl mayster gramer chaunged techyng gramer scole construction frenssh englysshe scoolmaysters vse way yere oure lord m·iij c·lx·v ix yere kyng rychard secund leue frenssh scoles vse al construction englissh wher haue auantage one way· lerne sonner theyr gramer another disauauntage nowe lerne ffrenssh ne none whiche hurte shal passe see also gentilmen haue moche lefte teche theyr child speke frenssh ¶r hit semeth grete wonder englyssmen haue grete dyuersyte theyr owne langage sowne spekyng whiche is· one ylond· langage normandye comen oute another lond hath one maner soune among al men speketh englond man kente southern western northern men speken frensshe al lyke sowne speche speke theyr englyssh treuisa netheles ther many dyuerse manere frensshe royamme fraunce dyuerse englysshe royamme englond ¶r also forsayd tong whiche departed thre grete wonder men este men west acorde better sownyng theyr speche men north men south therfor men mercij ben myddel englond partyners ēdes vnderstāde bet • side lāgages northern sothern northern southern vnderstande eyther other· w de p li 3· alle langages northūbres specially york sharp slytyng frotyng vnshape sothern men may vnneth vnderstande langage suppose cause nygh alyens speke straungely also cause kynges englond abyde dwelle south countreye north countrey cause abyde south countrey north countrey cause ther better corn▪ londe peple moo noble cytees moo prouffytable hauenes south contrey north ¶ de gentis huius moribus ¶gir itinere capitulum· 60 maners doyng walssmen scottes ben fore somwhat declared· purpose telle declare maners condicions medlid peple englond b • flemyngys ben weste side wale ben tornyd englysshe cause companye englyssmen myghty strong fighte ben moost enemyes walshmen haue vse marchaundyse clothyng ben ful redy put hem self auentures peril see londe cause grete wynnyng ben somtyme redy goo plowe somtyme dedes armes whan place tyme axeth semeth men grete wōder boon wether right sholder whan fflesshe isw soden away rosted knowe haue shal spyryte prophecye wonderful craft ¶they telle ferre countreyes tokenes pee warre state royamme sleyng men spousebreche suche thynges declare certaynly tokenes signes suche sholdre boone ¶r thenglissmen dwellen englond ben medled ylond ben fer fro place spronge firste tornen contrary dedes lightly withoute entysyng ony men owne assente vnesy also ful vnpacient pee enemy besynes ful slouthe w de pon̄ libro tercio seyth whan haue destroyed enemyes al ground thenne fighte hem self sleeth eche voyde· empty stomak wircheth hit self ¶r netheles men south ben esyer mylde men north vnstable cruel vnesy myddel men ben somdele parteners bothe also vse hem glotony men ben cestlew mete clothyng supposeth toke vyce kynge hardekunt dane heete sette forth twyes doble messe dyner soper also men ben spedeful hors foote able redy alle maner dedes armes ben wonte haue vyctorye maystrye euery fight tr • son walkyng ben curious wel telle dedes woundres haue seen also goo dyuerse londes vnnethe ben ony men rycher owen londe gracious fer straunge londes better wynne gete newe kepe owen herytage ¶therfor spradde wyde wene euery londe owne men ben able al maner sleyght wytte fore dede blondryng hasty wyse dede leueth lyghtly haue begonne pol li 6 therfore eugenius pope sayde englyssmen able doo euer wold sette put fore ne light wytte lettyth hanybal sayde romayns myght ouercome owne countrey ¶ englyssmen· mowe ouercome straunge londes owen countrey lightly ouercome ¶ r men despysen owne prayse mennys vnnethe ben plesyd ner appayd theyr owne astate· befalleth becometh men wyl gladly take hem self· therfor yeman arayeth hym squyr squyer knight knyght duke duke kynge· yet somme goo lyke al maner state ben state ¶ wil take euery degre degre ¶ beryng outward ben mynstrales herowdes talkynge gre • e speke • etyng drynkyng glotons gaderyng catel huckster tauerners araaye tormentours wynnyngys argy trauayl tantaly takynge hede dedaly beddes sardanapaly chirches mamet • s· courtes chonder pryuelege clergy prebendis knowleche hem self clerkys ¶ treuisa ¶as touchyng termes latyn argy tantali dedali sardanapali ye must vnderstande hem poetes feyned hem argus herde kept beestes honderd eyen argus also ship shipman chapman argus myght see behynde euery side therfor wyse ware see deceyued may callyd argus· cronyke seyth plurel numero englyssmen ben argy saye see wynnyng ¶ word tantali poete feyned tantalus slowe owne sone· wherfore dampned perpetuel penaunce· standeth alway water vp neyther lyppe hath alway rype apple noble fruyt hangyng doun ouer lyppe fruyt ner water maye come within mouth· holde standeth bytwene mete drynk may neyther ete ne drynke· euer hongred thyrst wo hym lyue· maner lyknes tantalus right nought moch thynge doo euery side ben callyd tantali semeth saye trauayl tantali doo right nought therto thyrdde worde dedali take hede dedalus subtyl slye man therfore lykenes ben subtyl slye ben called dedali fourth word sardanapali ye shal vnderstande sardanapalus kyng assyryens ful vnchast vsed hym lye softe· manere lykenes hym lyue vnchastly ben cleped sardanapaly r amonge alle englysshe men medled gyders grete chaungyng dyuersyte clothyng aray many manere dyuerse shappes wel nyghe ony man knowen clothynge araye someuer degre therof prophecyed holy anker kyng egelfredes tyme maner henricus libro sexto englyhssmen moch vse dronkelewnes treson rychelesnes goddes hows first dane thenne normans· atte thyrdde tyme scottes holde moost wretch leste worth alle other· shal ouercome· thenne world shal vnstable dyuerse varyable vnstablenes thoughtes shal bitokened many maner dyuersitees clothyng ¶ explicit liber primus ¶ liber secundus ¶cao pio place countrees rekened descryued world wyde ordre tale storye axeth beryng dedes world also descriued· euery thyng somwhat more· treuisa auctoryte philosophre mene al thyng resonable kyndly ordeyned another thyng mene come therto saue ordeynyng better thyng noble thyng ordeynyng therfor eeryng· sowyng dongyng land· ordeyned haue good corne good corne better al deel also medycyne ordeyned heel hele better medycyne also mete drynk thynges ordeyned lyf lyf better noble mete drynk al thynges ordeyned lyf ¶ r syth world made lasse holy wryte seyth shal serue lasse· world descryued foresawes first book skylful somdele descryue lasse world also begynnyng forne dedes· myght knowe maner thynge grete lytel doth greete dedes world soo grete huge also worcher maker al thynges hath hym shaply resons al maner thynges whan made world made lasse thaugh made hym lord grete world yet prynted hym lykenesse grete world man world lyke thre thynges length brede kyndly disposicion vertues worchyng ¶ firste though lengthe mannes bodye soole foote toppe heede· suche six brede one side ribbes side ten moch depnesse rigge wombe ¶netheles plenius libro vij ca 18 seith moch space bitwene cinct poynt firmament euen ayenste hym side erthe moche oute eest west soo body man moche soole foote toppe heed moche bytwene twey longest fyngres endes stretche oute armes handes brood also plenius right capo 17 seyth stature mesure child whan thre yere old euen half mesure stature shal haue whan age yf lyue lo • g second see world see man 〈◊〉 membres partyes helpeth standeth eueryche ste • e bynē meth woo· ouer lymmes gouerneth • yeueth neyther lymmes bereth serueth myddle receyueth deleth lymmes eyther world yf limme owne place entrede another place owne anone grete distourbaunce made whan ayer enclosed within erthe therth quaketh whan within cloudes greet thondryng also body man whan lymmes writhed owne place yf humour apayrede ache sekenesse sorow ¶also whan lymmes wel arayed shulde shappe coloure hewe maner quantite gretenesse smalnesse meuyng place hath man good pee quyete good hele reste ¶ contrary falleth lymmes euyl ryghtly arayed therfor plato yafe dome sayde suche ordenaunces disposicion shap man hath kyndly membres lymmes· suche kyndly maners dedes foloweth· also partyes grete world ordeyned sette highest neyther kynde touche lowest high kynde· oystres shelfysshe lowest beestes kynde passeth litil perfection lyf tree herbes ¶ may meeue hem c • lpes see waggeth water el cleuen erthe may neyther see ne taste ne smelle feele whan towched ¶ laste erthe touchethe lowest water· ouer water toucheth lowest eyer vpward degree anone ouermost heuen also hyghest bodyly kynde may cleped skylfully mannes body kyndly parfytly disposed arecheth lowest nexte ouerkynde mannes soule holdeth lowest degree spyrytes goostes haue knowlege vnderstandyng· therfor cleped oryson next narche kynde betwene bodyly goostly thynges· soule gooth vp lowest kynde degree knowleche connyng anone ouermost knowleche vnderstandyng ¶and whan soule cleene without erthly lykynge recheth otherwhyle holy spirites nothing bodily also man hath somwhat comyn thynges partyes gret world ffor gregory omely saith man hath stone lyuyng tree herbes felyng beestes knowlege vnderstandyng angelis also mēnes body semeth erth flesshe boone water blood humour eyer longes fyre hert called homo latin antropos grue tre torned vpso doū hath heed roote hath armes thyes bowes touchyng thyrd lykenesse vertuous worchynge see gregory sayth omelye aduent world atte begynnyng thryuyng strong bryng forth childer youth ful heele fressh grene grete ryches fatt abated eld dryuen toward deth ofte many disease mannes youthe bodye thryuyng breste stronge nolle bolde armes ful elde stature boweth croketh stonpeth downe bold nolle abateth brest dryuen oft many sighes soore· breth shorteth al body myght strength abateth though none sekenesse old men dele •• le sekenesse also see world two contrarye moeuynges one kyndely· whiche planettes nether welkens meoue oute west est violēt rauesshed ayeinwarde moeuynge ouermooste welken firmamente oute eeste weste ¶ fareth man flesshe coueyteth ayenste spyryte • spyryte ayenst flesshe ¶ nether knowleches wyttes fighte ayenste reason ¶ yet man hath comyn worchyng suffryng like many partyes world slowe heuy erthe fleteth awaye water withdraweth sodenly eyer heteth ffyre▪ chaungeth mone fyghteth sleeth mar coueteth marcurius goth oute kynde iupiter cruel saturnus ¶ also plenius libro septimo· capitulo tricio seyth vtter partyes greet world wellith spryngeth ful myracles wonder meruaylles inde ethiopia blew men lond affryca ¶so mankynd kynde hath slyly craftely made wōderful werkes myrth firste mānes face ther ben • n lym̄es fewe moo ther gret diursyte among many thousand men vnnethe one founde face lyke another affryca many haue wi • chyng tonges thynges preyse shende slee praisynges tree preysen waxen drie childer deye triuallis iliricis men slee sight behold loke longe namely greued wroth whyle loke bihold· haue eyther eye twey blackes ¶also amonge v varro saith kynde hath gendred brought forth venym somme mennes eyen none euyl founde ther ny somwhat lyche founde mankynde somme partyes mannes bodye forbyson bodyng wondres pirrus kyng epyrothes grete right foot touchyng good medecyne ayenst venym ¶ myght brente bodye· whan partyes bodye brente auctours telle also pliꝰ li 7 ca • e 7 seyth somme men geten born gendryng stone clenyng gyders al one somme borne one bone al hool stede teth boon harder sharper ony mannes toth ¶ prusi kynge bithimia sonne abo • n mouth stede teth one boon al hool boon harde whan dele bodye brent boon myght brenne also ibid ca 18 sōme men lyue eueryche hem hath boone bodye cleuyng gyders one bone hoole without mary thes men neuer thirst also swete neuer more· treuisa sōme men telle som man irland hath one boon al hoole oo side stede al ribbes tom hayward barkley hath moold hede polle forheed one boone al hool therfor may wel suffre gret stroke aboue heed without hurt also pliꝰ l 7 c 21 seith som men al body senewes euen strayght thwert ouer crosse wyse • assing wonderful strength som may dure renne without werinesse som passyng clere fighte knyghte highte strabo stode waytes place sawe nauyes shippes puny honderd fyue thirtty myles also pliꝰ li 11 capitulo 44 seyth tiberius cezar sawe clerely derknesse lighte whan waked nyght myght see al thyng clerly also pliꝰ li 7 c 27· somme wonder myghty mynde cyrus kyng perse alle knyghtes hoost yaf certayn name ¶r seneca p li declamacionum seyth hym self myghty mynde rehersed two thousand name arewe hert ordre sayd rehersed moo two honderd versus men yeuen began atte last rehersed anon first withouten ony faylle also sayth cineas pirrus messager kyng epirotes cineas second day cam rome salewed grette senatours spake eueryche peple aboute hym name· another sayth cineas made grete makyng poesye rehersed atte firste heryng swiftly made also pliꝰ li 7 c 27 seith som̄e noble wyse wytte iulius cezar wonte rede wryte men seyde good auisement al attones also vsed wryte quaires endite lettres wryte pistles al attones also pliꝰ li bro 7 c 18 seith somme men haue strengthe right side somme haue lyft side· som like stronge eyther side· also men heuyer woman dede mennes bodyes heuyer quyck slepynge wakyng heuier also· careynes dede men renneth foule moisture humour ligge vpright careynes dede woman yf legge neuelyng dounright thaugh kynde spared shame ¶also li 7 ca 17 rede oo man lough day born put away mānes hande groped handled also c 20 speketh som mē neu er lough som wepe neu er som spytte neu er som bok balked neu er treuisa rogger bagge ful old mā wottō vnder egge gloucestreshire spytte neu er coughed neu er also seneca vbi piꝰ c 4 ¶ as· amonge beestes mankynde somtyme one mankynde man womā suche cleped hermofrodyta somtime cleped androginꝰ englyssh called scrette accompted among meruaylles wondres amōg v deynte selde seen also haue seen herd somme chaūge wonderly shape sawe affryca mayde day shold haue ben wedded transformed torned man anon forthwith berded membred lymmed man wedded wyf short tyme also seynt austinꝰ de c libro tercio c 29 toucheth agellus li· atticar • co noccm̄ seyth woman somtyme tourned men magel tale soth lettres wryten therfor agellus seyth cyte called smyrna sawe mayde tourned man daye shold haue ben wedded also suche one brought rome senatours tyme lasciuius crassus cassius longinus consul rome heste dyuynours tok • hede weder chittryng birdes born wild yland also titus lyuius speketh hennes torned cokkes auicenna libro 8 de animalibus speketh henne ouercome cok fightyng fightyng victorye rered vp tayle cok· anon spore growyng legge crest hede cok also capitulo ·5· trogus seith egypte ·vij· child born one birthen thies dayes yf two twynnes borne selde moder first child lyue longe byrthe namely yf one knauechild mayde· also· cao· 12 somtyme woman conceyueth twey child lytil tyme bitwene childer afterward borne one another parfihte ynowgh hercules broder hispycle ferde happend woman bare two childer· one lyke husbonde cō pyner woman vij moneth birth second moneth aft er bare twey childre somme woman bere alway mayde childrē som alway knaue childrē som alway chaūgen beren somtyme mayde child somtyme mā child som barayne conceyue mā som cōceyue sōme mē som mē cōceyueth also ca 13 sōme bere childre lyke hem self· som lyke fader somme lyke mā somme bere doughters like faders somme lyke hem self· somme bere childer lyke forfaders ensample nyceus noble peyntour sancm̄ borne fayr moder went kynde one hand blew man hugo capitulo malo· ¶ sayth woman kynde suche conceyueth child lyke thynges see peynted shape worchyng soule whyle body geetyng child sēdeth inward likenes shape seeth without rauess • th ymages therof disposicion vsen spayne brynge fayre horse gentel holde hem mare sight whyle conceyue vse also peynt fayre culuers downes place ther culuers wont dwell quintilianus defendeth excuseth woman accused spousebreche born ablue man· leyed suche ymage peynted bedchambre whan conceyued child ypocras wrot woman shold dampned deth borne fayr child like self ne fader ypocras made men assaye founde suche ymage peynted fader moder hedchābre whyle child conceyued moder saued pliꝰ· li 7 c 13 ther man many diuersitees swyftnesse thought chaungyng wytte concepcion emprynteth many dyuers lykenesse shappes· beestes wytte chaungeable therfore amonge hem al brode lyke kynde augustinus de ci de li· 16 ca 7 ¶ capitulum secundum brodes wōderly shapen axeth come adam noe sōme hem hete ciclopes haue eye forheede somme haue shap man woman gēdreth gider geteth cōceyue beren childer cours cometh aboute one shal gete child shal eftsones cō ceyue goo child tyme goth aboute sōme woman conceyue v yere old· lyue ouer eyght yere som haue thies without hammes wonderly swifte hete ciopodes lye neuelyng doun right somer tyme deffenden hem self shadowe feete hete 〈◊〉 sonne wherto answere saye nedeth trowe ther many maner mishappen men men speken of· netheles reson yeuen wondre shappe child amonge v suche reson men may yeuen dyuers manere people wonderly shapen god knoweth nedeth make eny manere thynge knoweth fayrenesse al creature likenesse vnlykenesse partyes medled gyders ¶ certaynly tyme man borne este two bodyes vnto myddel wombe bynethe one ¶ yet al shal trowe come adam therfor suche wonderly shape owther nought· owther men owther yf men withoute doute come adam kynde ¶ touchyng antipode men speketh syngeth men side erthe foot toward oures heed yondward treden hiderward may trowed reson ther story maketh v haue knowlege gessyng mankynde tale founde though erthe round al somdele hangyng within holownesse heuen natheles erthe bare side biclypped closed within water though bare closed· yet foloweth men shuld dwell r wold meene marcianus seyth astrologye signe capricornus grete maketh somer antypodes cancer signe maketh wynter acompted beyonde side ethyopia blewe mennes lande ther men tornen wel nygh fete toward mennes foot dwelle ylond tile vnder north sterre treuisa take hede cercle sonne holdeth cours yere deled twelue partyes euery partye therof cleped signe euery signe hath propre name name signes weder bole twynnes crab lyon mayde balance the▪ scorpion archer goot stewe fysshe also twelue monethes yere euerych moneth entred signe falleth moneth marche entreth weder aprile boole may twinnes iune crabbes forth arewe monethes signes december sonne goote marcianus wol mene whan seeth goot maketh somer antipode whan sonne goote somer hem december midwinter moneth· whan seeth crabbe maketh hem winter meeneth whan sonne crabbe wynter hem iune midsomer moneth thus declared mene goote maketh hem somer crab winter ysid eth ·l 11· sōtyme birthes borne wōdelrly shapen boodyng kennyng wō ders shal befalle liue long· excerses tyme kyng perse mare foled foxe boded kyngdom shold vndo greet kyng alisāder tyme brought forth beest wōderly shapē ouer partyes shapē ꝑties man dede nether partyes shapē partyes dius maner beestes alyue beto • ened sodayn sleing kyng wers ꝑties lyued lenger better treuisa wiliam wayte berkley sawe child twey hedes twey nekkes borne cristened mese loreyn yere lord thousand thre honderd lvj yere kynge fraunce taken atte batayle peyters child twey armes twey legges childer haue thyrdde legge growynge aboue buttokkis behynde thyrdde arme bytwene twey shulders ¶ item isid li 11 capitulo tercio somtyme grisly wonderfully chaungyng shappes men beestes doo wordes wyccecrafte sōme hath receyueth chaungyng kynde somme corrupcion passith chaungeth kynd calues roted cometh bee hors roted cometh thauers· therfor ouide sayth yf thou craft haue take armes holowe crabbe scorpio bryngeth haile stynge kroked· tayle au li 18· c sexto matier wonderful tornyng changyng shapyng men woman holde fendes euyl men mow make kynde neyther chaung made· neuertheles almyghty god suffreth lykenesse thinges dyuersly seme fantasie man gedreth likenesse dyuers thynges thought dreamyng sweuenyng whan wyttes lette take none hede maketh seme likenesse bodyes present also ymages dyuerse lykenesse shappes thynges neuer made· men wakyng semeth see lykenesse shap diuers thynges beestes men seme slepyng metyng wonderful sweuenes seme somtyme bere meny heuy birthōs birthons fendes bere hem god demeth rightfully suffreth mankinde ofte begyled r matier loke within playnly batayl troye ¶ capitulum tercium though man sayde lyke acorde world two thynges conteyned therin· netheles many poyntes mannes condicion prerogatyue worthynesse dyuerse vnlyke world ¶for though mannes bodye made firste erthe yet couenablie acordyng soule mannes bodye euenesse complexion acordynge lymmes rightfulnesse stature fayrenesse shap shuld body afterward buxome soule withouten ony rebellion brynge forth childre without ony synne lyue without ony defaute strengthe translated chaunged blysse heuen withouten deyng deth also shold gete conceyue childre without shame woman shold bere childre withoute sorowe woo haue mete drynk without swete trauayl steryng moeuyng lymmes withouten ony mysfare paradyse yeuen mankynde to· dwel woman mannes felawe paradyse wonyng place tre lyf mete al creature solace • te laste god hym self mannes mede allas noble banyour fell • soone erly brought forth put worship knewe shold like beestes whan dyd forbode fro day forth body corrupt synne greueth soule ¶ flesshe coueyteth ayenste soule mannes wyttes torne assente lightly euyl mannes oune meynal wyttes owne enemyes al mannes lyf temptacion whyle lyueth erthe disposipon soule ruleth meynteneth helpeth conforteth bodye ayeinward wretched disposicion bodye distourbeth soule· also man euer fayllyng wayward may stydfastly abyde falleth lightly • lyghtly aryse profyt byrth sorow care lyuyng man must nedes deye plenius libro septimo decimo capitulo tercio decimo· ¶ thaugh oll made haue shelles ryndes skynnes wolle heer bristels feders wynges owther skals man born withoute ony helyng keueryng nakede bare anone birth gynneth wepe atte begynnyng lyke beest lymmes fayllen hym maye helpe hym self· febler ony beeste noon helpe may nought doo hym self wepe al myght beest hath lyf brutyl vnseker none hath sekenesse greuous • n lykyng otherwyse shuld none cruel ¶ also beestes lone eueryche kynde dwell gyder cruel beestes kynde contrary hem ¶ man torneth maner doyng vp downe contrary hym self cruel men yf may reche greue thenne becometh angry cruel hym self ¶r yet al thees man hath twey myshappes rightfully one self within threwe away pea reste warred within hym lyuyng hath neyther pea ne rest warre strif within another myshap man hath withoute forth wold nought subget god aboue hym feeleth vnderlinges rebell hym· creature yeuē man solace brutelnes susteynyng comfort bere vp feblenesse seruyce subiection myron • shewyng wonder nowe mooste dele flee mannes sighte felawship fro company hateth handlyng wil nought lordship dredeth lyue dwelle hym ¶ capitulum 4 adam made erthe feld damask sixthe day world brought paradyce synned day put mydday fille state innocence welth valey wretchednesse woo· man begynnyng myght take wele swete mete goddes hows desired shold assayed forbode fylle hye lowe light derknesse slyme· owne lād contrey outlawyng hous waylynge trouble oute fruyts w • pyng woo oute praysinge dole sorow· myrthe stryf oute loue hate ioye welth peyne •• ene oute helth grace gilt synne pee peyn homlynesse offence wrath ¶ methos adam xv· yere lyf bigate cayn co • unely callyd caym sister calmana xv yere aftir whan adam was· xxx yere old gate abel syster delbora abel slayne fader moder made dole sorowe hym honderd yere· ¶r· ¶as hebrewes seyth adam begate seeth yere age honderd thryttye lyued afterward viij·c yere adam lyued al nyne honderd yere thyrtty treuisa thre score ten· torned holy wrytte oute hebrew grewe· cleped thre score ten· ¶r ¶adam deyed buryed ebron cleped also caryatharbe meane cyte four patriarch buryed adam abraham· ysac iacob ¶seeth gate enos whan honderd yere old fxue lyued viij c yere thre score ten seyen seth two honderd yere fyue whan begate enos lyued afterward seuen honderd yere fyftene· thre score ten seyen enos nyne score yere ten whan gate caynan lyued afterward seuen honderd yere fyftene seyth specially enos cleped firste goddes name vpon caas fonde firste wordes prayeng· hebrewes tellen first fonde ymages worship god wake slouthe mannes mynde god almyghty caynan thre score yere old ten gate malaleel lyued afterward viij c yere fourtye· thre score ten putteth honderd yere fore seuentye withdraweth honderd afterward malaleel fyue sixty yere old gate iareth lyued afetrward eyght honderd yere thrytty seuentye setteth honderd fore v sixtye withdraweth honderd afterward iareth honderd yere old lxij gate enoche· lyued afterward eyght honderd yere ¶ seuentye acordeth enoch fyue sixty yere old bigate matusale lyued afterward thre hon derd yere helde god almyghtyes way translalated brought paradyse seuentye setteth honderd yere bifore fyue sixtye enoch fynder lettres wrote somme bookes seyth iudas apostel epistle troweth that· adam deyed enokes▪ tyme caymes childer lameth seuenth werste· 〈◊〉 sethes child enoch seuenth adam beste matussale honderd yere old four score seuen gate lameth lyue • afterward seuen honderd yere tweyne vnto no flode lameth honderd yere old four score tweyn gate • lyued afterward fyue honderd yere four score ten ¶ capitulum 5 caym adam first sonne begate enoch gate irad gate manayel· gate matusale gate lameth lameth toke • wey wyues ada ada sella gatte twey sonnes ada iabel fader hem woned tentes pauilons tubal fader organistres harper lameth gate sella tubulcam smyth worchyng hamer sister noema fonde first weuyng crafte iosephꝰ caym gadred ryches violently strengthe made men lechours theues torned sympel lyuynge men fyndyng mesures weyghtes ordeyned markes boundes feldes landes bylde cyte walled ful soore drad greued ysi libro quinto decimo capitulo secundo ¶men first naked vnarmed syker ayenst beestes· nowther ayenste men defende kepe hem fro cold fro heete besynesse kynde witte bethought theim buyldyng· therfor buylde theim smale cootes cabans keuerd hem smale twiggis reede lyf myght sauf ¶petrus capitulo visesimo septimo ¶ lameth seuen adam mooste shrewe firste brought bygamye spousebreche ayenst lawe god kynde ayenst goddes owne dome ¶iosephus iabel ordeyned first flokkes beestes markes knowe one another departed kyddes lambes yong olde ¶petrus tubalcam founde first smytthes crafte tuba grete likyng hamers sowne· fonde proporcion̄ acorde melodye weyght hamers· vsed hem muche thaccorde ef melodye· fynder instrumentes musik fonde longe afterward ¶ r wysemen tellen thaugh tubal vsed first musike plesir whyle herde kept beestes al fonde firstt resōne acord musik wightes pyctagoras fonde therof loke within thyrdde book pytagoras ¶petrus visesimo septimo capitulo lameth archer somdele blynd yonglyng ledde hem whyle hunted play lykyng owther one beestes skynnes men ete flessh no flood happed slough caym loyterd amonge busshes wende ben wyld beest leder warned hym slowe hym also therfore syth caymes synne punysshed seuenfold seuenth generacion lameth seuenth adam lyne lamethes synne punysshed seuen seuentye fold seuen seuentye childer come hym deed no flode outher many generacions btywene lameth criste payed raunsome ¶iosephus ¶no man shal trowe fals redde longe lyuynge men somtyme lyued fayr lyf couenable clene mete drinke also blysful vertues vsed made hem besye aboute astrologye geometrye myght neuer lerne· yf lyued six honderd yere atte leste in· long tyme grete yere sterres fulfylled ¶petrus sethes childer good men vnto seuenth generacion afterward men mysused men woman mysused· woman ¶thenne goddes sonnes take mennis doughters saye sethes sonnes toke caymes douhters begate geantes ¶ petrus 29 myght incubus suche feudes lye woman likenesse men made geantes geten whiche geantes gretenesse herte answereth acordeth hugenesse body no flood geantes born ebron cyte egypt· thylke geantes cleped tythanes hem come enachym child woned ebron hem come golyas ¶iosephus tyme men wyste adam sayd shuld destroyed fyre ellys water ¶ther for· bookes made greet trauayl studye closed hem two grete pilers made marble brente tile ¶ pyler marbel water pyler tyle fyre· ¶for shold saued maner helpe mankynde· ¶ seyth piler stone escaped flode yet siria gen̄ whan noe fyue honderd yere old begate sem cham iapheth seyne whan old hadde thes thre sone geten made ship honderd yere afterward tymbre planed wel smoth glewed within ship thre honderd cubyte long fyfty cubyte brode thrytty cubyte high kele hatch vnder c • ban housing ¶noe made wyndowe ship dore side dounward housing cabans dy uers floryng ¶ wyndowe cubyte high treuisa men maye wondre wyndow made bynethe side ship comyng water ¶doctor de lira moeueth doubte sayth haue fenestra fenestre wyndow lettre hebrew hath lucerna lanterne sommen sayen lanterne carbuncle som precious stone shone gaf lighte clere ynowgh sette somme sey wyndow al hool cristal stone whiche light entred hield water many wyndowes ship soo neded ship ful grete huge ful many beestes petrus 30 ship made somdele lykenesse mannes body lengthe soole foote toppe heed suche six brede myddel side ribbes one side middel side ribbes side also lengthe suche ten depnesse stretcheth rigge wombe ¶ trenisa man ful shappe shuld nouther gret ne smal hugo de ar ship· myght resseyue many beestes thynges greet cubyttes cubyttes geometrye comune cubite vseth conteyneth f • ote half six spannes ¶ span stretcheth end thombe thende myddel fyngre whan hande straught· cubyte geometrye conetyneth sex commune cubittis wol nyne fote longe ¶gen ¶ whan ship made noe yere lyf six honderd entred yede ship· first day second moneth man eyght dayes brought shippe al warned brynge er lord sende rayne vpon erthe flood made occupyed erthe wel nyghe al yere water flood passed xv cubyttes aboue highest hilles werke mā kynde defouled eyer highe troweth worshypyng fyre smoked sprynkeld vp highe yere ended firste age world adam no flode vnder ten generacions spake rather ¶ iosephus libro primo capitulo quarto ¶and also hebrew sey first age worlde conteyneth two thousand yere seuen honderd six fyftye b • seuenty turneers ysidorus libro 5 seyth two thousand yere seuen honderd two fourtye ierome seyth fully two thousand meotodus seith two thousand leueth odde yeres ouer thousandes ¶ calcleth acompteth age world thousandes lette dele abyde ¶ capitulum sextum atte laste whan water flode withdrewe noe wente ship xxvij· day secōd moneth man· lord behete promysed noe noo suche flode shuld that· token couenaunt· sette bowe cloudes rayne bowe ¶ petrus 329 rayne bowe token oute twey dome dome water ¶ shuld drede dome shal fuyre shuld drede therfore bowe hath twey colour vtter wattry dome watir passed ynner fyry dome fyre shal holy sayntes tellen rayne bowe shal seyn xl yere befor day dome also sey neuer appered fro adam no flode ¶also rayne bowe seen al tyme ther flesshe ne fyssh eten ne wyn dronken tyme springyng tyme tho inow plente helthful thynges afterward chaunged thurgh synne flode mankynde leue ete flesshe fyssh rather ete herbes rote noe lyued flood thre honderd yere fyftye lyued al nyne honderd yere fyftye deyed lefte thre sonnes lyue sem cham iapheth whiche thre cam al maner mankynde gen two yere flode sem honderd yere old gate arphaxath̄ lyued afterward fyue honderd yere arphaxath fader caldeis gate· sale whan honderd yere old xxxv· ierom sayth· ¶ ysidorus libro sexto· hebrewes seyn· xxxv yere lyued afterward thre honderd yere thre seuentee luc also foloweth hem arphaxath whan honderd yere fyue thryfty gate caynan lyued thre honderd yere thrytty caynan honderd yere old thrytty gate sale come old samarytanes iudes lyued afterward four honderd eyght yeres thryttye soo seuentye tellen hebrewes sayth sale whan thyrtty yere old gate eber ¶ eber called hebrewes sale lyued gate eber four honderd yere seuentye y • dorus accōpte honderd yere bifor thyrtty thre honderd yere xxx heher hebrewes haue name hebrewes saye heber four thyrtty yere old gate phaleth lyued afterward four honderd thyrtty yere seuentye putteth honderd bifore four thrytty hebrewes saiye phaleth thrytty yere old gate ren heet ragan also lyued afterward two honderd yere nyne seuenty ysidorus putten honderd bifore thyrtty· afterward two honderd nyne heet phaleth rightfully phaleth saye departyng langage departed tyme rather al one buyldyng tour babel ¶and men departed dyuers londes ragan xxxij yere old gate sarug lyued afterward two honderd yere seuen • iye hebrewes seuenty ysidorus set ten honderd bifore two thrytty afterward two honderdseuē brewes saye sarug thrytty yere old gate nachor lyued afterward two honderd yere tweyne seuenty ysidorus put honderd yere bifore thrytty two honderd afterward hebrewes sayye nachor xxix yere old gate thare liued afterward one honderd yere nyne seuenty put honderd yere bifore nyne twenty ¶ ysidre seyth nachor seuenty yere nyne whan gate thare hebrewes ysidorus seyn thare seuentye yere old gate abraham nachor aran lyued afterward honderd yere thyrty seuenty put honderd yere bifore seuentye yere ¶petrus 38 ¶and soo second age world ended fro no flode abraham̄s birth conteyneth ten generacions two honderd yere four score twelue sey hebrewes iosephꝰ ierom seuenty seynt an • yn acounten thousand yere two andseuenty enleuen generacions ysidorus acounteth nyne honderd yere two fourty meotodus thousand ¶the caas dyuersite seuenty seynt augustyn also putten euerych faders age arphaxath nachor honderd yere beda noe tenth adam abraham tenth noe ¶ netheles luc genologye· whan sayth qui fuit sale meene sale sone forth caynans sone arphaxath sone ¶ther luc foloweth seuentye· putten one generacion moo hebrewes put ¶ augustinus de ciuitate dei libro 15 capitulo 13 whan many translacions dy •• ite foū de maye stande first langage tornyng translacion made shal moost bileued beda tornyng translacion seuenty first fully torned redily owther afterward appayred misbileuid men eusebius ¶fro adam abraham story founde grewe nowther straunge langage methodius ¶ noe sonne borne two thousand yere honderd begynnyng world sone called ionytus ¶noe yaue lordship anone see elyochora god almyghtye yafe witte wysedom shold fynde scyences astronomye coude telle bifore· shuld befalle come afterward specially begynnyng endyng foure chyef kyngdoms knewe first cam assiriens shulde regne cham come belus· afterward sem medes perses gre • thenne iapheth romaynes ionytus shewed al disciple nemproth therfor nemproth grete desire regne regned babylon among chames childeren gate hield assiria egypte nynus regned assiria vpon assires iosephus libro primo capitulo quinto ¶after noe dede phalathes tyme· al men world one langage tonge no childer techyng ledyng nemproth trowed bileued good happes good spede god almyghty mannes owne vertues dedes also wende god almyghty wolde departe hem enuye· myght lightly make hem subget also dradde another flood shold come buylded wel high tour brent tyle glue stede morter felde heete sennaar ther babylone afterward buyld god almyghty departed hem shold make dessencion stryfe among hem self nemproth chus sonne chus cam sonne· cham no sonne place cleped babel say shedyng god almyghtyes heest langage tonges buylders shadde skaterd heber holden gyltles conspiracion buyldyng tour therfor spared gyltles shedyng tonges petrus 35 nemproth stronge hunter men tirant vpon men putte assur oute lond began regne among chams childer cyte babylon buyld neth • l •• semyramys quene afterward made cyte wel afterward nemproth wente men perse taught hem worship fuyre founded cyte nynyue afterwad nynus semyramys made cyte augustinus de ciuitate dei libro octodecimo cao primo ¶ capitulum 7 whan men departed shufte skatred dyuerse londes eueryche folowed owne lykyng wille semed desired ynow man mankynde departed ayēst hym self strē ger partye bare doun told pryce fredō sauacion heele greete wonder hem leuer loste spylt vnderlynges seruauntes yet loor kynde better vnderlyng seruaunt put lyf therfore goodes ordenannce doo somme men kynges lordes somme subgettis seruauntis isidorus libro 8 ca 3 men cam seem no first sonne south lande rysynge sonne anone fenyces men heete men come sem occupyed four honderd cuntreys six vnder seuen twenty langages ¶ come cham held londe southe occean vnto se • gadytan thre honderd countreyes four score fourten vnder thrytty langages tonges au li 6 come iapheth held lō de hille heete mon taurus salicia northwarde toward north occean half dele asia al europia vnto brytyssh occean englysshe see· thre honderd contrees vnder fyften langages tonges· lefte eche londe peple name whiche many chaunged kynges landes londes maners men londes ¶ thynges stande were· soo yet seen whome come ¶ as • re come assur hebrewes h • ber somme reason knowen sayth egypcians perteyne me • aym ethyopens chus ¶iosiphus libro· primo capitulo quinto ¶ chus vnto ethyopens cleped chusey egypcians mysrey ¶ men scatred dyuerse londes· somme chaunged name hem lyked grees wther feyrenesse wrytynge owther lykynge reders outher make owne self nobley forfaders ¶ hugo capitulo frisia ¶ ofte name sette manere doynge· whan wylle meene troyans ferful clepe hem frigios ¶ yf • meene gentel noble calle hem dardano ¶ yf wille meene stronge calle hem troyans ¶yf hardy clepe hem hectours ¶ isidorus li 14· ca 2 ¶men eest sownen wordes throte hebrewes syres men myddel londes roof mouth grees asiās ¶men west breketh wordes bitwene teth spaynols romayns ¶ augustinus de ciuitate dei libro sexto decimo capitulo octodecimo ¶ syth men firste skatred dyuerse londes though kyngdoms assyryens eeste egypcians south shite north grece begynne attones augustinus libro octodecimo capitulo primo netheles kyngdoms assiriens medes perses grece romaynes folowed eueryche pryncipally amonge netheles first last noble dured lenger· kyngdoms kynges longed thes kyngdoms also berynge dedes men athene gretter loo fame dede seyth salustiꝰ varro also wryters philosophres athene solempne wytte preysed dedes hugely ouer mesure ¶ r tretice ful general four chyef forsayde kyngdomes begynnyng kyngedome assiryes ende kyngdom romaynes axeth long wrytynge processe· therfore firste kyngdomes age kyngdom assiries first shal wryte ¶ regnum shitarum ¶ capitulum octauum kyngdom shytes north cause af age tyme axeth second place ordre sette kyngdom assiries began saruges tyme vnder thanaus first kyng sarug abraham fader grauntsyre ¶ semeth ryuer thanays hath name kynge thanaus whiche ryuer north side world departeth bitwene asia europa· ¶ kyngdom neuer ouercome thryes conquerd asia ouercome darius kyng perses slowe cyrus kyng awaye zephiron greet alysanders leder ¶ petrus capitulo 60 ¶ also another kyngdom west kyngdom scicions archadia partie grees europa dured vnder agilaus first ix·c yere thre score enleuen· agilaus lord kynge outher emperour afterward kyngdom endured vnder one thrytty kyngis xxiiij yere nachor abraham grantsir vnto zensippus tyme regned yere hely preest seuentene fyftene grete lordshippes cleped hem dynastias first myneus sonnes abraham tyme ¶ afterward thebey men thebe helde sexten greete lorshippes cleped hem dynastias ¶than diapolitani cleped pharaones kynges egypt held echten greet lordshippes cleped hem dinastias dinastia greet lordship power duryng prouynce chose kynge outher emperour soo kyngdom egypt dured vnto tyme cambis cirus sonne cirus kynge perse yaf whyle lyued kyngdom assiria tho torned medes sonne cambis cleped hym nabugodonosor also prynce olofernes subdued egypt egypt vnder seuen kynges perse went perses ten kynges owne othus heet artharexerses also twellue kynges perses put oute nactanabo laste kynge egypt vnto ethyopia wan kyngdom egypt ¶ afterward kyngdom dured vnder thre kynges vnto seuent yere greet alexander kyngdoms egypte perse vnder grekes thre honderd yere vnder thretten kinges cleped lagydes tholomeus vnto iulius cezar tyme outher somme men mene vnder fyften yere augustꝰ cesar ouercome clopatram denys belus nemproth xxv yere sarug abraham fader grauntsire kyngdom lordship al asia take inde petrus 60 dured thousand yere iijc tweyn vnder seuen thritty kynges vnto last sardanapallus kyng deyed vij yere ozias kyng iuda arbaces heet arbactus also kyngys stieward traytre· slough tourned kyngdom assyryes medes vnderstande hope dede r ¶for sardanapallus seuenth yere of· osias kyng iuda manasses kyng iuda aboute honderd yere twelue ¶ assyryes hadde seuen myghty kynges though kyngdome al hoole whiche thes name arbaces phille teglafalasar salmanasar senacherib assaradon sargon ¶ netheles somme wil mene sardanapallus deth seuenth yere ozias kyng yere transmigracion iewes one thyrtty hoole kyngdom eeste stode medes two honderd yere· sixty vnder eghte kynges f • om firste arbaces vnto astrages assiryes vnto yere transmygracion one thyrtty tho began hool kyngdom perse regnum persarum ¶ hole kyngdom perse yere transmygracion one thrytty vnto vij· yere grete al • xāder first cyrus last darius arsanius sone dured ij c yere v thrytty vnder threttene kynge cyrus first· cam bise second fader cirus yaf hym another name cleped hym nabugodonosor yaue hym nynyue kyngdom assiryes whyle self lyue· vnder hym befel storye iudith third ermendes magus iiij darius tapsis sōe· v exerses vj arcarexerses yt hete longimanꝰ also vnder esdras neemyas v excerses· viij fogodia ix dariꝰ nothus nothus bastard outher geten worthy fader born vnworthy moder· x artharexerses heet assuerus also vnder hym hester xj othus xij arsanius xiij darius arsanius sone greete alysander ou er come hym torned slough hym ix yere onyas bisshop heet menelaus also nethles kyngdoms grece eueryche ordeyned whiche first archadia atte scicions· peple torned then peloponenses saide bifore ¶another kyngdom grece viij·c yere four score vnder xxvij kynges xxvij kynges six first latyns fourtene came afterward albanes seuen came cyte buyld wer • romaynes romulus first tarquinus proude last afterward kynges put cyte yere yere twey consul chosin consul trybunes plebe doctours ruled comō • e vnto iulius cezars tyme iiij c yere thre score four afterward left name kynges cleped chyef lordes cezares emperours augustes iulius cezar first consul dytatour made emperour successour neuew octauianus augustus brought al kyngdomes world one kyngdō al hole then̄e philip xxviij emperour first emperour cristened grete constantine made constantynople chyef cite thempyre lefte rome chyef see pope saynt petres successours· whan thempyre translated torned greet charles kynge fraunce pipinus kynges sonne name themperour lefte allone constantinople augustinꝰ de cimitate dei libro 18 ¶ capitulum nonum sarugges tyme belus neinprothis sone kynge babilon went assiria wan aftward within short tyme whan regned· lxv yere deyed sone nynus regned aftir hym began regne yere thare abrahās fader euen thrytty kyng wel nygh asia oute take inde liij yere yere kyngdom xliij· abraham born bifore buyldyng cyte rome nygh thousand yere thre· c oroꝰ li 1 yere bifore buyldyng cyte rome thousand thre hondred nynus kyng assiriens couetise make lordship grete bare oute armure lyued cruel lyf fyfty yere asia warre batayll aroos south reed see destroyed northe vpon see heete eusinū stretcheth fro riuer thanay endes hiberia armenia ¶ soo kyng nynus ouercome men scicia barbaryca yet werrours stille men pesible made hem knowe strengthe taught hem lyue mannee b • ode liued bifore hād mylke beestes atte laste slough zoroastes kynge battryans synder wytche craft atte laste deyde whyle besegied cyte torned hym hitte arowe soo slayne petrus 36 ¶nynus belus sonne whan fader deede assiria cyte nynyue named name made cyte nyniue chyef kyngdom enlarged cyte gretely thre iourneyes· nemproth biforehand founded cyte slowe also cham heete zoroastes also kyng battria wrote seuen science fourten pilers seuen brasse seuen brand tyle saue hem ayenste fyre water nynus brent bookes ysidorus libro 8 aristotle zoroastes wrote made twenty honderd thousand verse wytccherafte democritus made c • aft afterward ypocras tyme petrus 36 nynus mawmetrye began maner ¶whan belus dede sonne nynus haue somme comfort sorow made ymage fader dide ymage gret worship reuerence spared al euyl doer fled ymage ensā ple doyng many men made ymages lyef frendes ensample belus mawmett come forth mawmettis also belꝰ name afterwarde worshipped hem goddes· first worshipped mynde make solempne come feynynges poetes ¶r augustinus de ciuitate dei libro secundo capitulo vndecimo poete lyppe speketh thre maner goddes ¶for somme clepe goddes mar iupiter somme half goddes hercules romulus somme vertuous men men trowed somwhat godhed hector achilles mametrye come many maner euyl doyng ¶suche ierom speketh vpon ysaye 18 seyth egypcians wel nygh al men eeste landes worshipped fortune· god happes mene ymage fortune sette place wel knowen hath right hand horne ful mede al sitteth aboute foundeth taste horne last day nouembre yf fynde horne ful bodeth good corne yere yf fyndr voyd empty make sorow ¶crogus libro primo ¶ whan nynus deed wyf semyramys sonne nynus heet nynyan also regned maner· ¶ woman durst betake kyngdom yong child nowther durst self regne openly therfor disguised self childes lyche moder sonne woman stede childe· eyther smale voyce mene stature ¶therfore hidde armes thyes dyuerse helynges hir heede cap· shuld say ony thyng newe maner clothynge· hight peple shulde go clothed sam̄e araye yet peple vse maner clothing woman many grete dedes whan ouer come enemye al enemyes· knowleched doyng torned right greete worship ouercome ethiopia blew men lande inde also atte last desired sone bade hym ligge hir slowe whan regned two fou ••• yere sonne nynus helde appayed trauai • fader moder· creta hym ylond creta hath name c • eta ¶ somme men say cree one gou • rnours norysshed hidde iupiter sarra dyed whan six score yere old seuen buryed eb • sone therafter elezeer abraham seruaunt sente ceth • ra aga • le • man made wi • deth sarra lest pe • auenter old man shold haue holden reputed lechour yf wedded ony leye bifore ¶ • aac fourty yere old whan wedded rebecca bare child xx yere ¶ augustinus libro octodecimo atte last 54 tryconydes seyn womā • eete trycona grees calle hir minerua heete pallas also pallas ilond tracia nourysshed outher pallas geant slough r take • ede geant pallas another g • ant geant pallas turnus euanders slough • n • tyme augustinꝰ vbi supra maide pallas • te minerua found vp many craftes specially wolle craft lightyer trowed goddesse wist wele lytil whens cam· isaac twey twynnes born rebecca esau iacob ¶augustinus vbi supra kyngdom argyues began grecia vnder inachus isi fader isi heete io also inachus regned fyfty yere kyngdom dured fyue honderd yere foure fourty vnder xiiij kynges vnto last acrisius hym slowe persius though wylle twelfth yere delbora iugge israel· therfore persius drad ful soore lefte argus torned kyngdom mycenes abraham honderd yere old thre score fyftene deyed buryed ebron petrus 66 langage hebrew vsage old latyn accompte lasse nombre countray maner latyn vseth nowe seyn latyn abraham lyued honderd yere iij score fyftene· hebrewes seyn maner abraham lyued fyftene thre score honderd yere ¶ augustinus de ciuitate dei libro octodecimo feroneus inachus sonne second kyng argyues regned sixty yere feroneus argolycus yafe firste lawes grees ordeyned cause shold pleted fore iugges ¶ therfor cleped place dome forum owne name broders name fogons fogons coude moche astrologye ordeyned temple worship fals goddes therfor reputed taken god amonge worshipped suche fals goddes sister called ysis io also saylled egypt taught men lettres tyllynge feldes therfore deth honoured goddesse among theym isidorus libro tercio ¶isis ordeyned first trompes therfor amasones cleped hir oft batayll ward trompes ¶ r ¶ redeth iupiter rauesshed io hit begate epaphus fable feynyng poetes noble fame eyther persone ¶ poetes feyne many noble persones geten iupiter kyn shold holde gentil noble ¶ io tyme isaac iupiter tyme iosue thessallus grecus sonne regned thessalia iacob hadde bought first birthes slyly geten faders blessyng moders counsayle went doun mesopotania petrus 64 ¶the first birthes speciall profytes worship oldest sonne kynrede vnto aaron clothed special clothynge offrynge sacrifice fader blessynge double porcion feestes delyng herytage shuld blesse lasse iacob begate first sonne ruben wyf lya ¶this yere lytil flode achaia heet attica· lond vnder ogiges kyng renued cyte atthen bilde elensis ¶ yere iacob four score yere old enleuen begate ioseph rathel petrus 74 whan fourten yere doo whiche iacob serued wyues laban made couenaunt hym alle spekeld lammes kyddes shuld ewed duryng couenaunt shuld iacobs mede· oo coloure whyte blac shuld laban owne therfore iacob toke gren • yerdes poplers almond tree platan pylled rynde somme place yerdes somme place pylled hem not· soo made yerdes spekeld made hem wattryng place bifore shepes eyen shold conceyue theyshold conceyue lambes like shadowes sawe rāmes myrroure water conceyuyng shold alle specled leste gyle knowen therfor first conceyuyng tyme leyde ye • de later conceyuyng tyme iacob founde newr maner tornyng kynde kyndely craft fighte ayenst kynd r loke matier aboue libro eius capitulo primo ¶ whan iacob come ayene wyues child er cam fader twellue yere bifore deth isaac ioseph sexten yere old sold egypte one • te putephar ennuchus maister pharoes knyghtes ¶treuisa ennuchus gelded suche somtyme made warden ladyes egypt ¶augustinus super genesim ¶this putephar soo ennuchus gelded childhode wyf childer ioseph wedded doughter putephar sawe ioseph fayr boughte mysuse hym therfore god made putephar cold· myghte neuer haue doo flesshely owne wyf moore thaugh ennuchꝰ gelded therfore worshipful made bisshop god heliopoles apis third kyng argiues feroneus sonne regned two twenty yere isaac honderd yere old four score dyed buryed double graue ebron ¶ yere pharao sawe sweuen seuen corn eres seuen kyne ¶ iacob· ¶capitulum duodecimum yere seconde yere fanus iacob honderd yere old thrytty wente childer doū egypte ¶ augustinus libro octodecimo yere apis kyng argolicus sailled egypte dyed cleped serapis varro tellith cleped serapis saith chiste put cleped seron grewe therfor apis named seronapis afterward withdrawyng lettres vseth called serapis whyte spekeld oxe men egypte worshped lyue cleped apis whan oxe deede ordeyned hem another oxe also whyte specled tenderly nourysshed worshipped ¶ hugo capitulo ape bole hete apis wonte come ryuer nylus warne pleyng startlyng comyng ¶petrus somme telle euery yere serapis feste come vp boole oute ryuer nylus whyte marke right shulder shapen newe mone whan egipciens came hym al maner musick myrthe yt bole lyfte vp eyer iolyte meouyng styntyng boole· egipcians moeued stynt vpō erth boole vanysshed theyr sight daye therfor egypcians worshipped boole man apis cowe stede isi woman boole also iupiter therfor grete abhominacion among egypcians slee neet ete ther flesshe ¶argus fourth kynge argyues began regne regned six fourty yere tyme grees hadde sede brought oute landes gan ere sowe haue corne tylled rinne iacob honderd yere old seuen fourty blessid childer yaf euery blessynge dyed enoynted kept thrytty dayes atte last born ebron buryed double graue ¶petrus maner mysbyleued men kepe dede bodye nyne dayes withoute oynement make sorow hem nyne dayes wasshe bodyes nyne dayes wytte whether soule apassed noo ¶afterward kepte bodyes fourty
