dayes enoynted maner iewes kepe dede bodyes seuen dayes without oynement afterward thrytty dayes enoynted augustinus libro octodecimo ¶ seyth promotheus· rapetus sonne athlas astronomer broder made men seyth ouidius magno ¶netheles seyde men vnconnyng boystous beestes made connyng men wyse ysidorus tercio decimo also redeth made ymages men goo walke grounde certeyn crafte ¶also thes fonde firste ring yren closed therinne precious stone cleped nayle ffor nayle closed flessh stone closed metal hugo capitulo annulus annulus ring seid anus er ¶for somtyme theues mansleers whan taken shold bere ape neck holde mouth atte ape er foule vsage ceesed theues manslers whan taken shold bere ringes yron fyngers therfor gentilmen haue dyuersite distinction suche brybours made hem rynges gold syluer ¶ysidorus libro 19 fine gentilmen vsed rynges siluer gold fourth finger cleped leche cause heyghting fayrenesse fynger veyne stretcheth herte romaynes rynges comune tresory gentilmen rynges solidus hool sound ¶free men bloode vsed rynges gold fre men came bonde men vsed rynges syluer bond men vsed rynges yron ¶somtyme greet diffamacion man vse moo rynges one· ¶augustinus de ci promotheus brother heete athlas astronomer therfor men feyned bare heuen ¶ also greete hille affryca heete athlas man athlas name lewde peple wene hille bere vp heuen petrus ¶ seyth trycolomus went tyme ship peynted dragon grece made craft tyllyng feldes also tyme cere woman grees calle demetra without instrumentes fond vp eeryng craft founde also vp mesures whete bifore deled whete huples smal grete r tyme grees began haue tylth corne seyth ysidorus libro 5 ¶ioseph honderd yere old ten deyed egypt enoynted swete oynementis kepte vnto goynge child ysrael egypte honderd yere foure fourty whiche tyme hebreus serued egipcians ¶also iosephes bretheren dyed eueryche buryed ebron ¶netheles afterward bone born sychem iosephes bone place heete nowe neapolis cyte samarytanes tyme iacob come egypte vnto tyme hebrewes childer israel wente egypt two honterd yere fyften ¶ moyses ¶ capitulum 13 amram caath sonne caath leuy sonne amram sixty yere old begate moyses wyf iocabeth petrus ¶ pharao vnder ioseph heete nephres owne propre name eyghte pharao hym heete amonophis tyme moyses born ¶iohannes libro secundo ¶ pharao hated childer israel vertu wytte connyng trauayle plente rychesse fairenesse childer therfor bethought felliche gylefully bere downe childer israel hold hem lowe lest wold multyplye fast aryse ayenst hym ¶ also put vpon theym charge many maner werkes make brent tyle digge •• ches rennyng stremes ryuer salus bere fen cley yaf hem nought mete smal chaffe ¶for wold ouercome hem trauaylle honger sholde haue wille f • r ligge theyr wyues sholde folowe childer shold faylle ¶also one wryter holy lettres w • st come· warned pharao kyng egypte one shold borne hebrewes shold bere doun pryncipate egypte areyse kynde israel make hem ful grete· ¶therfor commaunded men childer israel shold slayne whan born petrus yet peple multiplyed fast pharao cōmāded midwyues egipt shuld sl • e alle men childer hebrewes kepe mayde childer ¶for helde woman kynde wel febel rebel netheles wele likyng lechery egipcians whan pharao myght haue wyl comāded throw men childer ryuer anone borne troweth synne egypcians felle errour worshipe oxe cleped ▪ apis stede god genesis therfor moyses hidde thre monethes whan born atte last scaf asshes shapen lytel boot glued wele aboute throwen ryuer thermuth pharoos doughter fonde hym toke hym vp water made hym owne sonne cleped hym moyses ¶ iosephus libro secundo moyses name made twey name grewe moy water esis saued moyses sayde saued water also child moyses hated al wymens brestes egypcians wold suke woman breste egypcians slyly brought owne moder fedde whan thre yere old god almyghty made hym fayr shap stature· whan born stretes· al aboute hym lefte werke occupacions loke bihold child neuer sterne ne angry day thermuth pharoes doughter brought child pharao· shold see child make hym owne sonne ¶ kyng wonder fayrenesse child toke owne crowne whiche ymage iupiter grauen· sette childes heede child anone threwe downe crowne trade theron spytously foot stode one god eleopoles preeste cryed saide childe oure god bade v slee drede wold anone haue slayne child wyseman sayde childe hadde vnconnyng childhode soo • e saued child ¶petrus libro secundo ¶ euydence excusacion child brennyng cole brought bifore child moyses anone put hem mouth skalded poynt tonge hebrewes trowed cause therof hadde afterward lette tong· child moyses fayre men bihelde hym toke grete hede fayrenes put al angre teene toke hede fayrenesse childe ¶me seyth aboute tyme hercules ouercome antheus wrastlyng iosephus libro secūdo ethyopes blue men warred vpon egypte dyuynours answer sholde take beder hebrewes vnnethe gate moyses made hym leder capitayne moyses cunnyng dedes bataylle forsoke waye water nylus ladde hoost wyldernesse ful serpentes netheles put ciconia nyght ayenst serpentes cicome birdes lande egypt haten destroyen serpentes myld ynow mankynde ¶ came vnwar vpon ethyopes closed theym ryal cite saba afterward cambyses kyng cleped cyte meroen sister name ¶ cyte ful stronge cause wally dyches watres renne aboute cyte sette bytwene ethyopes egypcians vpon ryuer nylus· ¶ tharbys kynges doughter ethyopes sawe fayrenesse moyses delyuerd cyte vpon couenaunt sholde wedde wyf petrus libro secundo ¶ woman ethyopia whiche marye aaron stroof moyse • desert whan moyses wold torne agayn egypt wyf wolde assente ¶ therfore moyses man connyng cours worchynge sterres planettes made twey rynges one mynde another foryetyngnesse kepte rynge mynde hym self toke wyfe ryng oblyuyon soo tourned home agayne genesis tyme whan moyses vysyted bretheren lande iessen slough man egypcians hidde hym sand hadde smyten man hebrewes ¶ morne man hebrewes putte ayenste moyses berde moyses dradde soore auoyded drede lond madyan wedded zephora preestes doughter londe gate hir gersan elieser ¶ petrus libro secundo· ¶ preeste prymat • lande madian aboute reede see propre name raguel hadde twey surname iethero cyneus hadde seuen doughters herdes kept beestes thoffice kepyng beestes tyme ordeyned woman specially lond trogodytes kyngdom athene began vnder cicropis fable telle wyf latona apolyn lord wytte wysedome geten iupiter deucalyon began regne thessalia xij· yere thyrd perticuler flood brennyng vnder pheton ¶ augꝰ li 18 flode destroied gret partye grees· ther many mē fledde shippis deucalyon kynge thessalia saued ¶ deucalyon occupyed tyme mount pernasus happe poetes feyned deucalyon wyf pirra threw downe stone arered men • ysidorus libro terciodecimo capitulo 61 ¶ whan ryuers waxen ouer mesure doo harme arysynge bode bitoken harme shal come afterward ¶ oroꝰ libro secundo ¶ also sonne tyme brent ethyopia blew mennes lande brente also lande scicia greuously men myght endure bycause herof mysbyleued men feyned fable feton ¶ moyses aaron ¶ capitulum 14 moyses four score yere old broder aaron four score yere olde thre spak pharao kynge egypt shold delyuer god almyghtyes peple lete hem doo sacrefice god pharao fast hard malyce wold suffre people goo wherfore egypt smyten ten grete wreeches punysshmentes augustinus libro octodecimo ¶ tyme god toke wreeche egypte somme egypcians dradde lest egypt shold haue fynally destroyed went landes soo one cycrops saylled grece buyld cyte atthen called afterward athene ¶r loke atthen first book capitulo grecia scilicet alladia netheles coryntheus firste named epyra buyld fyue yere bifore atthen ¶ petrus libro secundo ther many wreeches egypt withoute ten grete wreeches therf • r sōme dayes kalendre called dayes egypt cause thoo dayes felle wreeches egypte dayes sette kalendr • euery moneth tweyne mynde wreeches god toke egypte· neu er theles ther many moo wreeches taken egypt· demed ne trowed thaugh egipcians connyng knouleche sterres planetes founde dayes peryollꝰ forbode beginning werkes weyes bloode lettyng whan moyses lxxx yere old ledde folk israel egypt day yere iacob childer entred egypte whan isrl̄ went egypte mone xv· dayes old four honderd yere thrytty abraham went oute carram mesopotania lande bibeste whan israel wente oute egypte vj c men bare hem iosephes boone boone enleuen bretheren callyd patriarch buryed hem sychem seyth ierome israel toke • le floure sprong oyle vsed thrytty dayes pyler clowde went bifore israel ladde hem day pyler nyght whan israel went egypte reede see opened lete hem passe drenched alle egypcians toke way openyng see pursu • ¶ iosephus openyng see shal vntrowed redeth see pamphilicum opened bifore kyng allexander macedo also bifore hoost whan pursewed darius ¶ petrus libro secundo ¶ water see reede kynde· dyed reede clyues erthe lyeth aboute· ¶ therfor also founden reed precious stone founden sharp vermylon· see departed tweyne one parte called see persicus see arabycus ¶iohannes libro tercio ¶ thrytty dayes israel wente oute egypt faylled corne lord yaue hym curlew manna water stone oreb yet place watred rayne god yaue water tyme moyses hande ¶ thre monethes israel went oute egypt· moyses wente vp hille fasted fourty dayes fourty nyghtes receyued lawe seuen monethes made tabernacle ensample shewed hym hille soo tabernacle arrered firste daye aprille second yere outgoynge egypte ¶ tyme buyldyyg temple iherusalem compted foure honderd yere foure score ¶ also tyme somme men telle yo woman wente frō argyues egypte callyd isi wedded thelegon hadde childe callyd epaphus ¶ petrus libro quarto capitulo decimo sexto ¶ seconde yere outgoyng egypte twelue espyes sente londe biheste come agayn grudchyng people despeyr wanhope childer israel forb • den goo forther ¶ therfor torned ayene wyldernesse punysshed fourty yere none entred lande biheste oute take caleph iosue ¶ sixth yere outgoynge egypt eriston buylded temple app • lyn delphycus ¶ also yere cranaus second athene began regne regned nyne yere doughter called athys hir atthica lande hath name ¶ r loke bifore first book capitulo grecia silicet eladia tyme hebrewes receyued lettres grecia vynes ¶also lacedemon semelis sonne buylded lacedomonia cyte ferth erutonius sciciones· archas kyng argyues yaue name lond archadia callyd owne name· ¶but lond archadia hette rather cici • egypte eete rather aerea· hath name egypte one egyptus regned therinne ¶ danau tenth argyues regned fyfty yere ¶ oroꝰ libro primo· ¶ danau egystus twey bretheren ¶ danau fyfty doughters slowe egystus fyfty sonnes one nyghte oute take one sholde regne hym ¶danaus doer many euyl dedes went vp argyues gyle put ou • sceuelus ofte saued hym whyle nedy • lawe regned hym self ¶ troweth tempeste went man called liber pater heete dyonysius bachus also made vp argiues yaue grekes vse vynes· augustinus de ciuitate dei ¶me sayth grete mercurius tyme mercurius maya athlas doughter sonne ¶this mercurius wās connyng many craftes· made amonge hem god grete hercules somdele latter ¶r grete hercules surname de • aneus seyth marianus libro primo capitulo fyue honderd fourty fyue also hercules slough busirus tyraunt seyth ouyde iosephus hercules wedded ethea affers doughter affer madyans sonne therfor hercules went affer wynne libia· land cleped affryca affer conquerours name· fourty yere outgoyng egypt aaron honderd yere old thre twenty dyed oreb also yere moyses whan lyued fourty yere egipt fourty yere madyan fourty yere sauf thrytty dayes desert six score yere old almost dyed hille mount abarim ayenst ierico towne buryrd lord valey moab ¶ sequitur capitulum 15 iosue moyses seruaunt ruled peple six twenty yere seyth iosephus netheles scripture rekened yeres iosue first yere leedynge ladde peple lande biheste ryuer flum iordan opened lette passe iosue offred estre offryng renewed circumsicion forborn̄ fourty yere wyldernesse whan ete fruyt lond manna failled hadde dured fourty wynter ¶ petrus ¶ eusebius cronyke sayth yere iubileus yere grace one fifteth yere grace though ther passed begynnyng world two thousand yere fyue honderd fyfty one fyfty sithes fyfty yere take euery fyfty yere one yere grace • cometh one fyfty yeres grace seuenty ther passed many moo yeres beda foloweth hebrewes proued lacked seuen yere two thousand fyue honderd fyfty firste yere iosue eruthonius fourth kynge athene first brought charyote grece sayth netheles bifore charyottes landes ¶ augustinus libro octodecimo ¶ ordeyned firste pleyes apolyn minerua ¶ also tyme busirus tyrant kynge egypte vsed tyrannye ghestys slough men offred hem goddes sayth neptunus sonne begeten libia epaphus doughter ¶ iosue departed lond palestynes· iewes ¶ also tyme fenyx cadmus twey brethern thebe egypte wente siria regned tyrus sydon twey cytees callyd iupiter kynge creta rauesshyd europa doughter agenor kynge libia afterward astrius kyng creta wedded europa wyf ¶ augustinus libro octodecimo ¶ iupiter europa rauesshyd gate radamantus sarpedon mynoys regned hym creta r netheles marianꝰ li 1· c· 61 seyth astriꝰ europa begate thre sone ysid li 14 agenore kyng libia begate thre sone silex fenyx cadmus one doughter callid europa whan iupiter rauesshyd put hir ship peynted bole therfor poetes feyne iupiter torned boole agenore bad iij sone shold go seche sister rauesshid ladde away forbade hem come agayn yf brought theyr sister hem· cause coude fynde her· • ad wrath fader silex abode countre cleped scilicia owne name fenyx abode fenycia cadinus chose exilyng grecia folowed steppe ox come countrey abode cleped boecia oxlande afterward buylde cyte thebe ¶ r loke herof first beok capitulo grecia ¶augustinus libro octodecimo iupiter regned ilond creta fader saturnus put went italy ¶henricus ¶this wyckedman grete werryour conquerd gree • ¶ deth grekes full lesynges helde hym god heuen· named hym god goddes grete power myght ¶the men cre • buryed amonge hem wolde speke byryels therfor grekes· cleped hem lyers allexandre mith· veray story sayth saturnus fader iupiter sonne twey kyngdoms ioynyng geder creta endes boundes feldes batayll bitwene hem iupiter hadde maystry saturnus chased oute went italye ianus kyng receyued hym part empyre cause couthe skylle vynes reepyng tyllyng feldes called saturnus satu • itas plentee made grete plente londe ¶eutropius ¶ saturnus flemed sonne iupiter grece endes tuscia fer place rome hidde place cleped place saturnia owne name cleped lacium hydyng place taught boystous men bylde ere sowe sette vynes byfore lyued ackornes dwelled vnder bowes twygges wouen geder ¶ also ordeyned pannes brasse therfor vplondysshe men hyeld hym god ¶r ¶and though poetes mene iupiter gelded saturnus shold gete childer supplante hym netheles history rome sayth saturnus gate pycus italie· ¶ allexander mith ¶ myghty geantes foū ded put iupyter iupiter ful cruel destroubled pee fader put ouer come geantes gynne werre feyned lightned geantes ¶ petrus ¶ iosue er dyed hyeld water erth bifore peple token couenaūt made bytwene god peple peple chosen sothfaste god ¶ petrus ¶ mysbyleued men vsed helde shede bloode sowe token couenaunt made hugo capitulo fedus ¶ fedus couenaunt sayd feda sowe slayne mene blood breketh couenaunt shuld maner shadde petrus hebrewes helde water token water shadde nought lefte soo breketh couenaunt shuld deed al kyn· also men old tyme vsed arere enhaunce signes token myght longe dure mynde couenaunt hem come ward somme men arered enhaunced stone huples stone mynde couenauntes ¶ othonyel ¶ capitulum 16 iosues deth israel serued chusan kyng mesopotania eyght yere netheles eyght yere acompted othonyels tyme calephs broder hebrewes ¶ yeres reste thraldome acompted geder vnder iugges israel sothnesse acomptes wold stande historye ¶ augustinus libro octodecimo ¶ tyme woman lathona bare appolyn ilond del • s· r appolyn delphicus longe bifore appolyn serued kynge admetus latter hercules ¶ seyth latona woman •• r isi ¶ othonyel leder israel fourty yere r • ken forseyd eyght yere thraldome neptunus regned fyfth kyng athene cadynus regned th • cyte th • be doughter semela born denys bachus callyd also liber pater· fre fader· tyme lynus thebe egypt grete chaū toure floures ¶ fenyx bylde bythynya heete somtyme mariandyna ysidorus libro secundo capitulo quinto ¶ fenyx yaue fenyces somme rede lettres r therof boke first book capitulo quinto decimo fenicia ysidorus libro secundo ¶ lettres grece cadinꝰ yaf hym speleth wordes stondeth nombres ¶r lettres grece first tenth as· standeth ordre b c stande nombre amōg grekes first standeth one seconde tweyne thyrdde thre soo fourth vnto tenth xj letter standeth twenty twellyfth thrytty xiij fourty· vnto c c standeth xix twenty lettre standeth one twenteth thre honderd ·xxij four honderd forth petrus crafte vse yren foūden egypt dedes telleth demetra dan per •• u moder befell tyme cyte corinthy buyld • tha • tyme· ¶ aioth ¶ capitulum •• aioth leder israel foure score yere acc • ••• eyghtene yere whiche israel serued eglon 〈◊〉 • yng moab· ¶ also rekene one yere sangar· duc leder slouwgh six honderd men plowe share ¶ aioth vsed eyther hande right hand ier • e sonne ihera gemynus sonne ¶ petrus ¶somme tellen gemynus vyle persone lyngnage benyamyn ¶ ofte named reprooue alle ofprynge vyle vnworthy netheles hebrewes meene gemynus benyamyn though named chaungynge owther withdrawyng somwhat begynnynge name set • e gemynum hebrewes sette iamyn rynge· longeth righte side· maye sayd gemynus latyn ¶ rytholomus came longe shippe elensio deled wheete· ortus kynge molos tracia rauesshyd proserpyna hir hounde callyd cerbe • u swolowed vp man named piriton come theseus rauessh proserpyna hound cerberus wold haue eten theseus also hercules came meane tyme saued hym· therfore ••• yned helle ¶athens bylde achaia ¶denys liber pater duc athene born semela somme men saye toke myscerya perseus slowe hoor gorgon fayre astonyed men bihelde fayrenesse also tyme frixus sister elles fled malyce pursuyte theyr stepdame drowned see called elespontus wethir paynted signe ship therfore feyned wether golden flese bare hem forth ayer laomadon eyght kynge scicions regned l yere amphion zebu regned thebe cyte gre • e· put cadinus tros regned dardania frisia warred afterward ayenst tantalꝰ kyng athene rauesshyng gammedes tros troyans haue name ar called troyans r ¶than fable iupiter feyned soo rauesshyng e gle feyned ydel perseus erutheus brother faught ayenst perses smote heed gorgon ¶ pegasus ful swyft hors woman callyd bellerefrontis ship ¶ion stronge man cleped men athene iones owne name denys hete liber pater also werred wyth indes buyld cyte nisan ¶ denys ordeyned first woman hooste men ¶ pelops first kyng poloponens heed olimpies· netheles afterward ayenst troye ouercome dardanus aiothes tyme duc israel latter hercules another spak bifore floures ¶trogus hercules stronge tamed world ouer come amasones passed inde warred ouercome troyans warred libia lord spayne ¶r hercules ouercome antheus geant libia seyth ouyde magno libro octauo slowe gereon geant kynge spayne ladde catall hys beestes thurgh ytalye token maystrye bigate kyng latyn doughter fanus slowe lyon slowe serpent ydra water lerna ran furlong one breth restored tournamentes ioustes mount olimp ouercome centaures pight pilers see atte ilandes gades dyd twelue grete dedes treuisa centaures men thessalia first chastised horse ledde hym bridels rode horsbakkes ¶augustinus libro octodecimo greete dedes felle greet sekenesse payneful soore myght endure therfore threwe hym self fyre brent hym self r ¶claudyanus libro sexto de raptu proserpine· et virgylius eneydis viij eciam ouidius meth libro nono ¶ reken grete dedes hercules whiche dedes first vyctory centaures second sleyng huyldyng lyon wood hight nenia thyrd chasing foules highte arpyes fourth takyng golden apple orchard seuen doughters athlas geant sleyng dragon kept palce fyfth cheynyng tyeng grete hounde cerberus deuoured perytheus rauesshyng proserpina ¶ sixth beryng doun dyomede kyng tracia fedde hors mennes flessh seuenth destroyeng ydra serpent water lerna echt ouercomyng achelous chaunged oftyme dyuerse lykenesse shappes ix throwyng doun antheus geant libia toke ayen myght strength ofte touched erth x sleyng catte cast fyre mouth sayde ¶ xj sleyng boor archadia ·xij· beryng holdyng vp heuen whyle athlas geant reste hym whan wery thyrten dede corsette dianier dyed ¶ take hede twelue dedes acompted hercules sowneth story told soo doth second lyon elleuenth boor owther perteneth coueryng thewes tale fable· menynge full truth sothnesse thyrdde arpyes fourth takyng rauesshynge golden apple owther tokeneth sowneth storye medled fable doth dedes thes twelue also take hede semeth one hercules twelue dedes ascrybed seynt augustyne de ciuitate dei li octodecimo capitulo quarto decimo seyth another hercules dedes aretted vnto· another hercules ouercome antheus geant wrastlynge also boecius fine quarti libri de consolacione telleth antheus among twelue dedes hercules also seynt augustyne vbi supra eciam capitulo 19 seyth many hercules also sampson wonder strengthe acounted hercules frigius dare book batayll troye seyth iason wan golden flees colchos surname callid hercules ¶ therfor ouidius meth terciodecimo sayth menia vnder fur • troyans vnder hercules ouidius octauo meth arretteth sleyng boor archadia meleandrus· also septimo meth ascribeth chasyng arpyes boreas sonnes highten zoas calaius· therfor many wise men tellen hercules surname noble men stalworth passeth men greetely boldenesse strengthe soo semeth alle kyndly menynge name hercules seyd hero man cleos blis though hercules menyng blysful man gloryous ¶eusebius cronyca ¶ aioth ¶ capitulum 18 aioths tyme namely grece fable founden seyth isopus founde firste fable highte enhaunce kyndly sothnesse· pryuyte kynde shold despysed therfor kynde thynges dyuers maner doyng feyned name worchyng goddes ¶alcyn mith soo feyned flood men come stone tree feyned manere dwellynge men old tyme somme went beestes augustinus libro octodecimo capitulo decimo tercio iosues deth vnto batayll troye fable feyned grecia vlcanus gret hete brennyng lechery minerua gate eruconius foted dragon fable poetes feynyng sawe soth meanynge cyte athene temple vlcanus minerua temple child founde byclypped aboute dragon bitokened child shelde grete· child founde bothe temple therfore child cleped bothe sonne ¶also tritholomus born fleyng addres nedy landes atte heste cerreres brought theym whete fable· also mynotaurus beest • closed laborintus ded • lu hows whan men wente howse begyled couth come oute also centaures medled mankynde hors kynde also cerberus hound helle thre heedes also frix • sister elle borne wether eyre flewen fowle▪ also gorgon strompet heered addres turned stone men bihelde hir also bellerefront born fleyng hors fethres wynges hors callyd pegasus also amphion plesed stone drowe hem hym swetnesse harpyng also dedalus carpenter sonne ycarius made hem wynges fethers fley fowles· also antheus hym slowe hercules· antheus sonne erth therfor whan felle roos agayne strengthe ysidorus libro vndecimo ¶also gereon geant kyng spayn slayne hercules descryued thre lykenesses shappes fable ffor thre bretheren wel acordyng gedres semed hadde one soule one wytt one wylle also strōpettes gorgon heered serpentes one eye torned stone men bihelde fable ther thre sistres al one fayrenesse men bihelde theym made hem styll stydfaste stone ¶ also thre syrenes half maydens half fowles hadden wynges talentes hawkes one hem sang pyped • e third harped drowe hem ward shipman saylled see ship wrake fable ther thre hoores brought men vsed hem meschyef therfor sayth brought hem shipbruche· ¶ also feyneth scilla woman byclypped heedes hoū de grete berkyng houndes sayd wawes see siculus flasshith wasshith vpon rok called scilla maketh suche maner noyse men sailleth therby aferd wene wawes berk wasshen rokke fenne serpent ydra nyne heedes· yf one heed smyten grewe vp thre one ¶ sooth tale ydra somtyme place wonderly perilously cast vp water yf oo water stopped water brakevp many place weyes hercules sawe destroyed swolowe closed alle weyes therfor feyneth destroyed ydra serpent ¶ꝑsid libro primo capitulo trisesimo tercio fable sayde fando spekyng sothe dede feyned spekyng poetes brought fable thre skylles· liking 〈1 page〉 〈1 page〉 talkyng fayr spekyng suche fable plantus terencius fable comonly told also helthe enhauncyng kynde seyth vlcanus halteth fyre neuer euen vlcanus feyned god fyre ¶ chymera feyned beeste thre maner shappe • kyndes bitokeneth age mankynde first youth man cruel lyon second age manhode sharp sight goot owther stynketh lechery goot▪ thyrdde age • lde boweth dragon wasteth alway fable ypocentaurus feyned medled af hors kynde mankynde bitokeneth swyft passyng mannes lyf also fable feyned derke fayr mystyal spekyng thewes whan speketh feyneth thynges reason speke hem self tale feyned soth betokenynge remeoued sothly dede· orace speketh mouse wessylle ysopus auenet fox wolf libro iudicum tree lybanus speketh demostenes wolues houndes feyned delyueraunce aduocates lawers ¶r seynt austyn seyth book de mendacio ¶ fable sayth though haue sothnesse hemself· netheles represente enduce mannes mynde sothnesse bitokene signefye ¶ augustinus libro tercio capitulo tercio ¶ auctoryte romaynes affermed goddesse venus eneas moder· god mar romulus fader varro byliue wryter storyes rome sayth pryuely prouffitable cyteseyns stronge men orped trowed bigeten goddes though fals maner mennis hertes shold bolder haue trust lignage goddes auenture • gretter dedes doo myghtly moore boldenesse trust gracioꝰ ende cause hold self kynde goddes ¶allexander mith· macrobius super sompnium scip • oni seyth somme fable feyned cause lykyng· suche menandre terencius suche long • th philosophres somme fable feyned cause prouffyt excitinge comfort whiche fable matier speketh owther ordre tellynge thynge feyned feynyngly told vnderstande fals told another fals fareth esopus fabbes anians fable also thes fable pertynent ne long philosophres also somtyme soth sawe told feyned tale suche feynynges esiodus orpheus whan spak dyuerse dedes kynde goddes suche tale fable tale like fable yf suche tale told lykenesse fowle thynge harlottry lengeth philosophres neyther dyuynes suche told lykenesse fayrenesse honeste perteyneth philosophres plato feyned knyght callyd er aroos deth lyue told many thynges euerlastyng lyf mannes soule ¶r boece feyned philosophye appered hym lykenesse amayde maner maye dyuyne vse ensamples manerly talkyng spekyng ¶pet • u ¶in aiothis tyme latter appollo laton • e sonne grekes telle founde vp • te phisic made harpes ¶r netheles ysidorus libro tercio eth sayth •• rcurius afterward gedeons tyme put seuen strenges ha • p bifore founden put strenges streyned hem manere ryuer nylus vp biflowed lande ebbed chanel agayn lay many beestes deed fe • des· amonge laye dede snayle whan snayle rooted senewes streyn • within skynne snayles hows sowned wy • de blewe theron esyly theron softly mercurius toke hede therto made harp lykenesse therof gaf orpheus harper ¶treuisa ¶i rede amonge wondres inde snayles greete huge man may herbeured snayls hows ¶ petrus ¶also tyme forseyd mercurius fo • nde vp instrument musick· called siringa made reed pipe • eete siringa name woman syrynga cadmus wyf· wente away husbond loue musik melodye vncertayn whiche mercurius was· whether mercurius hermes mercurius trimegystus ph • losopher greet mercurius iosephus speketh thre whiche euery called mercurius ysidorus libro quinto ¶ also tyme grees founde vp instrument musi que heete • horus petrus strabus sayth instrument twey pipe one pipe eyer goth sowne goth oute ¶ augustinus de ciuitate dei libro 18 c 13 ¶ delbora ¶ capitulum 19 delbora woman prophetisse lignage effraym delbora barache lignage neptalim ruled peple israel fourty yere reken xx yere whiche iabyn kyng canaan pursued israel tyme kynges argyues faylede regned v c yere fourty first inachus first pelops tyme kyng peloponensis kyngdom torned mecenes tyme began kyngdom laurentines italye deth ianus saturnus longe regned regned pycus saturnus sonne augustinus de ciuitate dei vbi supra tyme dyed denyse heete also liber pater warred ynde hadde hoost men woman medled geders netheles atte laste perseus slough hym golden buryels yet seen thessalia besides appolyn delphicus mount pernasus myda ryche kynge regned tyme frigia· hym poetes feined many thynges writen mitholog fulgencij et alexandri ilius appolyns sonne bylde ilium troye ¶gedyon ¶ capitulum 20 gedion heet iheroboal leder israel fourty yere reken viij yere israel serued madyanytes amalechites ¶iosephus sayth cyte tirus buyld gedyons tyme two honderd yere fourty salamons temple ¶petrus minos kyng creta iupiters sone occupyed see tyme gafe lawe men creta tyme stronge man theseus egeus kynges sonne athene slough mynotaurus tournamente therfore men athene trybutarye byfore quyttte free trybute mynotaurus grete man stature ther right myghty strong ful delyure wrastlyng kyng mynos bocher therfor cleped mynoys taurus bocher aboute tyme theseu • rauesshyd eleyn hir twey brethere castor pollux fett hir brought hir agayne· toke theseus moder chased theseus contray also sayth dedalus tyme floures dedalus made byrdes metal craft spyryte closed flee about· sayth also made ymages mo • ued hem self first departed foot ymages twynne men ioyned hem gyders ysidorus libro nono dedalus nenew callyd perdix toke hym loer ¶ perdyx subtyll connyng craft bythought hym ymagynacion haue somme spedeful maner clyuynge tymbre toke plate yren fyled made tothed rigge boone fysshe sawe also child bythought hym made first compas wrought therwith therfor maister dedalus toke greet enuye child threwe hym doun highe tour brake neck therfore dedalus sonne ycarus creta fleygh come scicilia made first laborintus otherwyse callyd mase petru • · ffor dedalus flewe away swiftly slayn neuew feyneth flewe wynges bird ayer ¶ysidorus libro quincodecimo ¶laborintus maner buyldynge wonderly buyld daungerous walles· therin minotaurus closed yf ony man went theder withoute clewe threde ful hard finde away oute opene yat • shold drede ful thondryng hugo capitulo labor gooth downe honderd grees steppe ther also derknes wonder many dyuerse wyndynges tournyngys suche foure worlde suche howses one egypte another creta thyrd ylande lempno fourth ytalye soo made vnn • maye destroyed world dureth ¶ hugo capitulo cilleo ¶whan felle pestylence amonges men athene • eth ycarus doughter erigen maydens athene compellyd snarles greues answer appolyn delphycus pestilence myghte ceese yf sought besyly bodyes ycarus doughter erigen soughte besyly whan hadde longe sought myghte nowher fynde shewe deuocion wylle hadde seche sene seche besyly another elemente myghte fynde erthe men athene henge vp roopes eyer men tottred theron moeueth hyder thyder wolde seen seche bodyes eyer aboue erthe whan men felle tottres hurt soore ordeyned amonge hem ymages like bodyes shold sette tottres meeue tottre stede hem fallen game cleped ocillum latyn componed made tweyne cilleo cilles meue o oris mouth tottred soo meneth ayenst mennes mouthes ¶ abymalech thola ¶ capitulum 21 abymalech gedeons sonne born concubine leder sichem fader thre yere slough owne bretheren thre score ten oute take one born diuerse wyues tyme batayll athene bytwene lapehites centaurus palefatus libro de incredibilibus sayth centaures noble hors men thessalia faught ayenste thebees men thebe egypte· thola lygnage isachar iugge israel thre twenty yere fourth yere medea went husbonde egeus kyng athene yland colchos born trogus 43 ¶aboute tyme faunus pycus sonne regned ytalya tyme euandr • came oute archadia receyued toke feldes hill mount palatyn faunus wyf called fatua ofte spyryte prophecye therfore yet ofte haue spyryt prophecye cleped fatui tho hercules hadde slayne gereon geant kynge spayne ladde beestes thurgh ytalye token vyctorye laye faunus doughter vnlawfully begate latinus regned afterward ytalye oroꝰ li p yere vesores kyng egypt warred first ayēst scites yet first sente messagers willed enemyes subget lawe scites answerd dull kyng moost ryche moeueth batayll ayenst pore men nedy namely doute ende batayll shal haue prouffyt cometh therof none gret open harme damage long dede acord thanswer compellyd kyng egipt flee chaced spoylled hoost wolde haue spoyled al egipt lette watres riuer nylus tornyng ayen warred xv yere asia made asia tributarij wiues sente theym worde wold come hoome wolde haue child men contreyes meane tyme amonge scytes twey ryall yonglynges fraude deceyte greet werre putte home toke hem greet multitude peple strengthe werred countrees pontus capadocie whan hadden doo greete destruction· kyld men contrees wyues • xyled wydewes armed hem toke wreche husbandis deth whan made pee strength dedes· armes toke men landes lye hem haue childeren slough owne men childer kepte mayde childer brent ryght brest atte laste tweyne ef thes wymen quenes mersepia lampeto departed hoost kept mayntened hem batel eyther cours whan ouercome gret dele europa many cytees asia sente home better part hoost proyes taken enemyes slough marsepia quene woman lefte kepe asia hir doughter synope regned moder deth gadred singuler ioye vertue euerlastyng chastyte men wondred gretely woman whan hercules hest lord warre ayenst quene gadred al grete strengthe yong men grees ordeyned nyne longe shippes felle vpon woman vnwarned leuer stele vpon hem come vp hem batayll openly whan twey quenes sistres sodenly ouercome hercules yaue menalippa sister anthiopa wedded hir sister ypolyta knyght theseus receyued armure quene price redempcion ¶ atte last orthia quene pentasilia quene batayll troye many greet dedes ayenst grekes· ¶ iair ¶ capitulum 22 iair galaad lignage manasse iugge israel two twenty yere hadde thyrty sone made hem prince vpon xxx cytees cleped cytees owne name anoc iayr saye iayres townes ¶r somme tellith cartage byld third yere iayr loke first boke co affrica scilicet munidia xvj yere iair mynoys egypt amended armure ayenste dedalus scicilia kyld cotalus sonnes· ¶ysidorus libro primo ¶carmentis nympha otherwyse callyd nichostrata kyng latyns moder fonde brought latyn lettres ¶ ysidorus libro nono langage latyn departed four firste vnder ianus saturnus cleped priske· latyn vnder kyng latyn kynges tuskan langage twelue table lawe wreton also romayn began kynges made subget langage vsed plantus tullius virgylius caton myxt langage encreaced thempyre encreased huge ¶ deth iare israel serued philystyns ammonytes xviij yere acompted yeres iepte duc afterward israel iepte ¶ capitulum 23 iepte galaad lygnage gaad comyn woman sonne iugge israel six yere kyng latyn ffamyus sonne began regne ytaly regned two thyrty yere hym kynges ytaly hadden name called kynges latyns ysidorus libro octauo kyng latyns tyme sibille eretrea floures callid erofila borne babilon▪ warned grekes wente troye troye sholde destroyed omerus sholde wryte lesynges afterwarde ¶ ther ten sybyls fyfth nombre put bifore firste sibylla perse second libia thirde delphica appolyns temple bifore batayll troye omerꝰ wrote many versis bookes iiij cimeria italye v critria hir nowe oure speche vj samia born ylād samos vij cumana born campania brought ix bookes torquynꝰ priscus kyng romayns whiche writen dome rome viij elesponsia born felde troy redeth kyng sirus salon tyme ix frigia redeth prophecied anchisa tenth tiburtina otherwise called albunea bookes hem worthy preysyng wrote moche crist also paynes ¶r netheles semeth seynt augustyne· li 18 capitulo 16 meene sibilla eritrea romulus tyme wrote moche criste openly foloweth thes versis hirs token dome erthe shal swete become wete heuen kyng endles shal come syghte flesshe present deme world forth sibilla hath many moo versis· heede lettres versis wryten latyn speketh thus ihesus cristus goddes sonne sauioure ysidorus libro quarto ¶ sibilla name offyce persone seyd syos god beele thought sibille sayd woman hath goddes thought ¶ therfor man prophecyeth cleped prophete soo woman prophecyeth called sybylle vnder dayes kynge latyns tyme sayllyng made called sayllynge argonantes saylynge cause occasion batayll troye began manere trogus libro secundo ¶ neptunus successour erutonius kyngdome athene felle egeus geten sonne theseus firste wyf· atte laste whan wyf deed wedded medea kynges doughter colchos gate hir medus· ¶ atte laste medea dradde stepsone theseꝰ whan come age toke hir hir sonne medus wēte home hir fader colchos▪ egeus sonne theseus regned athene wente somtyme hercules warred ouercome amasones· theseꝰ sonne demephon regned halp assisted grekes ayenst troyans trogꝰ li 42 pelias kyng poloponens thessalia dradde leste iason noble wold warre lond put hym out· iason esons sonne eson pelias owne broder pelias brought iason wytte fetche golden fle • colchos hoped therby yong man shold deed owther f • r long sayllyng see owther batayll ayenst straunge nacions ¶ frigius dares· ¶ therfore pelias made argus ordeyne wel fayr ship couenable sayllyng passage petrus name argon cometh name argonante argonante stalworth yong mē gadred al iasons viage iason saylled forth thes men landed firste frigia tho laomedon regned trogus iason put frigia come colchos ouercome kyng slough sone egealms toke golden flees lad hym medea kinges dought made hir wyf· netheles aftward forsoke hir put hir away afterwarde whan kynge pelyas sonne putte thessalia iason recounseylled toke ayene wyf medium stepsonne medus gadred stronge multitude yonge men went colchos restored orpedly wyues fader put oute kyngdome yaue hym many cytees kyngdome recompensacion amendement olde wronge frigius dare iason whan subduyed colchos hym prayeng hercules castor pollux peleus scicia thelamon salymina come fiue shippes nyght frigia slough laomadon kyng destroyed ilium troye rauesshed hesiona kynges doughter yaue hir knyght thelamon wyue firste entred troye taken grete proy iason torned ayene men whan pricimꝰ laomadons oldest sone herde wyst al strengthed ilium troy yates walles began regne ¶abessa ¶ capitulum 24 abessa bethlem iugge israel seuen yere second yere priamus kyng frigia kyng troy sente anthenor grekes sayd wold gladly yeue trespass doo bifore· yf wold sende ayen sister hesiona rauesshyd grekes wold priamus arayed bataylle made oldest sonne hector leder men alysaunder heet paris also hector brother assenteth herto sayth whan hunted somtyme woode called ida slept dremed mercurius brought bifore hym iuno venus mynerua shold deme whiche hem fairest minerua biheete hym wysedome iuno worship venus behete hym fareyst wyf worlde yf wold deme fayrest helenꝰ broder prophecyed contrary sayd yf alisander heet paris toke wif grece grekes wold come destroye yliū troy· woman cassandra prophecied netheles shippes arayed paris anthenor sente grece th • men came ilande citheria feste iuno helena kynge menelaus wyf came see fayrenes paris paris rauesshyd hir toke hir hym troy priamus glad ynow wenyng therby recouer sister hesiona menelaus kyng lacedomonia made greet greuous playnte brother agamenon kynge mescenes rauesshynge wyf gadred passynge strong men achylle patroclus vlyxes aiax nestor stalworth men seuen fourty hadde shippes redy hauen nombre thousand two honderd hadde answer appolyn delphicus ilium troye shold destroyed tenth yere ¶ grekes toke vp theyr ankres saylled see toke grete proyes torned home ayene ¶in mene tyme agamenon sent messagers vlixes dyomedes kynge pryam wytt yf wolde yelde vp heleyn sende hir home agayne pryam bythought hym hadde anone mynde wronge argonantes deth fader rauesshynge sister despysyng messager anthenor· therfore forsoke pee ordeyned warre ¶ whan hooste gadred eyther side hector slough protheselaus slough felled ground many men til cosyn esiona sonne aiax lamomus knowleched kynrede bytwene hem soo lett hym rees mene tyme trewes taken two yere· might burye men slayn two yere receyued strōg batail batail· hector slough x stalworth dukis achilles side slough iiij stalworth men noble batayll dured four score dayes continuelly hard fyghtyng strong trewes taken thre yere aft er trewes receyued appoynted fyghte slough many men eyther syde andromach hector wyf warned hector hir dreame shold day wende batayll ¶ netheles hector wente bataylle slayne achilles whan hector buryed trewes taken yere whan hector mynd day holden achilles loued right hertely policena kyng priamus doughter axed haue hir wyf withdrewe hym bataylle· said euyll done destrouble al europa rauesshynge eleyne atte laste wente forth atte prayer grekes wounded troylus hadde slayn many grekes therfore angrye wroth slough troylus menon also ¶than hecuba wonder wroth priamus wyf bythought hir gyle sette achylles daye whan sholde come fetche home wyf polixena hir doughter whan day comen alysandre otherwyse callyd paris slough achilles gylefully therfore hadde answer goddes grekes shold haue vyctorye achilles lignage ¶neoptholonius achilles sone wente forth batayll· whiche batayll paris aiax woū ded deth eyther thenne seuenth yere siege came pantasilea quene amosons helpe socour troyans brake siege grekes brent many shippes netheles slayne neoptholomus wounded· ¶ antenor eneas counseilled delyuer heleyne desire pea priamus toke grete indignacion theyr counseylle sayd shold dye yf euer wood counseylle eftsones therfor toke grete indygnacion sente polidamas grekes proferd bitray cyte owne sauacion grekes graunted pea thre anthenor eneas polidamas alle theyr retinue cyte opened nyght grekes pryamus fledde thautres goddes neoptholomus pursued hym slough hym ¶ eneas hidde polixena owne fader anchises atte prayer helene andramach fredom graunted seke polixena long sought atte last founde slayne neoptholomus hir fader tombe eneas hidde polixena hote goo lond left anthenor heleyn went home ayene menelaus siege troye dured ten yere six monethes slayne troyans er cyte bytrayd six honderd thousand thre score sixtene whan cyte bytraid thre score echten thousand slayne eneas wente oute countrey foure twenty shippes hym thre thousand men thre honderd· anthenor thre thousand andromach elenus two thousand ¶ aylon ¶ abdon ¶ capitulum 25 aylon lygnage zabulon iugge israel ten yere· netheles seuenty acounten hym therfore eusebius acounteth yeres yeres iosue samuel saul scrypture spekyth theyr yeres netheles sette moo yeres founden iosephus goyng oute egypte vnto salamons temple four honderd yere four score abdon heet labdon also iugge israel echt yere thyrd yere troye takē echt honderd yere four fourty abraham birth thre honderd yere fourty goyng egypt yere kyng latyn ytaly xxv· byfore byldyng rome four honderd yere two twenty ¶ augustinus ·18 capitulo ·16 ¶ troye destroyed· yet kyng latyn regned ytalye grekes torned agayne hadden way many myshappes varro libro tercio de historia sayth diomedes torned foules dyomedes seen· ¶so holden god temple solempne iland dyomedia fer fro mount gargan apulia saith fowles flee temple serue wonderly sprynge water· yf grekes ony kynde grekes come thyder birddes make hem good semblaunt yf ony come wounde hem theyr greet billes conferme varro tellyth fable lesyng sothnesse story famous dyuyneresse sorceresse wytche cirte transfourmed vlyxes felaws ro beestes archades lo • swam ouer p • ole tourned wolues lyued wylde beestes· yf ete ther mannes flesshe shuld nyne yere swymme home ouer poole tourne ayene shap mankynde sayth also demenetus whan tasted sacrifice archad torned wolf nyne yere restored ayene owne shappe mankynde vsed afterward geantes dedes maystrye tornyng olimpe ¶ plenius libro sextodecimo capitulo vysesimo secundo men transformed wolues oft owne shappe trowe fals netheles auctours grece tellen archades ledde pool lande henge clothes ooke swam ouer poole wildernesse torned wolues dwellyd nyne yere among wolues yf kepte hem tyme ete mannes flessh· shold swymme home ageyne take owne clothes owne shappe nyne yere older whan wēt ther lesing greet may confermed augustinus libro 18 capitulo 16 shall saye alle sayngys certeynly whan ytalye herd ynowe woman hostelers lande vsed yeue chese bywytched men trauaylled way anone men torned beestes bare heuy charge hadden kyndly wytte reason whan done seruyce torned ayene theyr owne shappe also epuleus book seyth happed hym self toke suche venym wytte reason made asse r willelmus de regibꝰ libro secundo tellith tweyn wytches enchāteresses dwellid high wey romeward yf ony gest come allone torned beest soo come aminstrele couth moch mirth transformed hym asse sold hym ryche man greet som money netheles warnyng shold neu er passe water warden kept hem besily long tyme netheles passynge tyme toke lasse hede asse escaped water torned ayene shap mankynde warden asse folowed axed asse euery man mette bene asse tourned man ayene sayde ben asse bycomē aman warden ledde hym lorde lord ledd leon pope old wytches cōuyct bifore pope knowleched dede pope douted thyng petrꝰ damianꝰ cōnyng man letture confermed maner doyng ensample symon magus tourned faustinus owne shappe made owne childer drede hym ful soore ¶ augustinus vbi supra ¶ bileuyd fendes may nought doo goddes suffrance soo may make noo man kynde neyther transforme ne chaungebodyes ¶ netheles semeth semtyme chaunge lykenesse shap thynges god made wrought· fantasye man chaungeth thought metyng dreames dyuerse maner thynges taketh likenes bodyes wonder swyftnesse though body presente· whan wyttes bodye absente lete theyr worchynge ymage lykenes thought fantasie emprynted lykenesse sōme beest semyth mēnes wyttes lykenesse soo man maye seme hym self semeth metyng sweuenes maye seme bereth berthens charge veray berthens charge fendes bere hem men maye begyled one prestācius told suche happe befelle owne fader toke suche venym owne hows lay bedde slepyng man myght hym wake many dayes awoke told sweuen hym bifalle hym thought made hors bare corne among beestes knyghtes rethica founde right told done dede ¶ sayde also sawe philosopher home hows whiche philosopher expowned many secretes platoes bookes whiche thynges boden hym expoune bifore wold whan axed philosophre wold expowne mannys hows hadde denyed owne nay quod dyd mette ¶ maner ymage lykenesse fantasye shewed one wakynge mette sleepe therfor orchades torned wolues wytchecraft cirta semeth myght maner netheles yf soth dyomedes felawes vanysshed sodenly away neuer foūde troweth wycked angel toke wreeche hem torned hem fowles made brought theder crafte men knowen hynde brought stede ephigenia agamenons doughter ladde away fowles dyomedis temple spryngen water flateren grekes exciting deuyl bryng men wytte bileue diomede made god soo begyled worshipyng fals goddes ¶r loke moore mater first book capitulo hibernia ¶ giraldꝰ top ¶fendes wycked men may chaunge kynde suffraunce god maye chaunge lykenesse shappe lette mennes wyttes begyle men thyng • seme strengthe fantasye wytche crafte men haue semyng feyned shappes vnsytting trowe god maketh thynges nought chaungeth one take rightfull wreche owther shewe myghte mercy tourned lothes wyf ymage salt water wyne owther chaunge lykenesse without leue kynde vnchaunged within· ¶ abdon ¶ capitulum 26 destruction troye eneas fader anchises soune ascamꝰ twelue shippes come scicile anchises deyed eneas wold haue sailled italye tempeste droof hym affryca right wel byloued dydo quene soone forsoke lefte dido came italye r ¶yf soth trogus papie wyse men wryten quene dido buylde cartage thre score yere twelue bifore buyldyng cyte rome· buyld fourth yere achaz kynge iuda truth eneas sawe neuer dydo quene cartage eneas bifore dyed thre honderd yere er cartage buyld· meaneth wryteth seynt austyne primo libro confessionum fine seyth wysemen denye eneas sawe cartage hugo capitulo elissa dido callyd elyssa vyrago manly woman hap felle afterward slowe self mā ly trogus libro octodecimo atte laste elyssa pigmalyons doughter whan shold haue compelled peple take husbond went greet fyre made slough self manly long worshipped goddesse mar eneas cam italye confedred sworn kyng euander tho regned seuen hilles two faught warred ayenst latyn kyng latin • rnus kyng tuscan kyng latyns doughter husbonde ¶ batayll pallas euandres sonne turnus slayn ¶r netheles trogus libro 43 wryteth eneas first comynge fonde grete grace kynge latyn entred partye kyngdome wedded lauyn kyng latynes doughter turnus spouse bothe latyn eneas confedered geder· toke katayll ayenst turnꝰ gyleful maryage •• uyn latyn turnus bothe deede bataylle eneas afterward kynge eyther kyngdome latyns tuscan buyld cyte called cyte lauinium name wyf warred afterward ayenst kyng mescene tuscan bataylle eneas slayne lefte hym sonne ascanius goten creusaat troy ysidorus eth iulus eneas sonne heete first ascanius name ryuer •• rigia heet afterward called ilus name ilus kyng troye hugo capitulo iulus afterward whan kynge mesenes slayn singler bataylle stalworth men ascanyus cleped iulus ferst springyng berde tho first seen first spryngynge berde proprely called iulus name twey sillables cause metre r ¶ take hede yeres eneas regnyng acounted within yere kyng latyn acomptyng story shal faile story sayth kyng latyn regned two thyrtty yere specially whyle eneas whan troye taken come ytalye xxv yere kyng latin historyes tellen· ¶ trogus 43 li· ¶ascanius eneas sonne began regne amonge latyns regued xxxviij yere lefte cyte lauinium fader eneas somtyme buyld buyld cyte alban long vpon riuer tiber cyte heede kyngdome thre honderd yere name cyte kynges latyns cleped kynges albanes reges albani ¶ eutrop ascanius nonrysshed vp ful myldly broder siluius posthumius· born stepdame lauina faders deth called posthumus born fader buryed callyd syluius nowrysshed wode wode silua latyn name kynges latyns afterward callyd syluyes ¶ascanius whan regned xxxviij yere lefte kingdome siluius posthumus owne sonne ilus yet tendre age seyth marianus libro primo ¶ ilus meyne cleped familia iliorum name· sampson iugge israel xx yere tyme befelle fable tellith vlyxes grecia· fledde scilla syrenes therof speketh palefatus libro primo incredibilium sayth scilla woman vsed robbe gestes sayd syrenes comyn wymen begyled men saylled see also tyme orestes slough pirrus egypt appolyn delphicus temple ¶also somme saye omerus tyme speke tyme old men discorden somme saye honderd yere somme honderd yere fourty somme honderd yere four score· somme two honderd yere fourty troye destroyed somme trowe bifore troyes destruction hiderto book iuges liber iudicum accompteth thre honderd yere vnder twelue iugges ¶ hely ¶ samuel ¶ capitulum 27 hely preest sampson iugge israel xl yere seyth ysidorus libro quinto iosephus libro sexto seuenty sey hely ouer peple twenty yere tyme felle greet honger lande israel storye ruth moab felle· hector childer toke ilium troye put anthenores ofsprynge helpe helenꝰpriamꝰ sone siluiꝰ posthumꝰ eneas ascaniꝰ broder geten stepdame lauina thyrd kynge latyns began regne regned nyne thyrtty yere whiche yere brutus siluius sonne ascanius sonne occupyed bretayne storyes rehersen semeth historyes discorden telle brutus fader thystorye brytons sayth brute siluius sonne whiche siluius ascanius sonne thystory rome sayth ascanius gate iulius cam th • meyny familia iuliorū maketh menciō siluiꝰ iuliꝰ twey name cleped siluius also one historyes fayllyth sayth brute whan fyften yere old slough fader huntyng alle historyes acorden siluius posthumus eneas sonne ascanius sonne lyued long vnslayne regned also soth siluius posthumꝰ brute fader vpon case thystory rome seyth ascanius eneas deth norysshed vp tendrely siluiꝰ posthumꝰ therfore acompted fader· herto wold assente withonten doubte ner redeth siluius slayne sonne baite ¶ ganfr brute slough moder birth fader afterward huntyng whan fyften yere old therfor put ytaly • went grece helpe troyans ouercome pandrasue kyng grece wedded doughter innoges· delyuerd troyans saylled then answer goddes landed affrica passed auētur • philenes lake callyd lacus salinarum salt lake riuer malue hercules pilers cam see tiren founde corneus went gyan ouercome gopharyus duc peytowe turnus brutus nenewe slayne cyte callyd turon owther turon owne name· brute good wynde saylled brytayn helde britayn atte clyf totenes cornewayle first kyng brytayn hole destroyed geauntes dwellyd cleped ilonde brytayne owne name called felawes briton bitoke cornewayl corneus buyld cyte called trinouantuin new troy cyte called london vpon temse brute bigate thre sonnes lotrinus camber albanactus dyed whan hadde regned four twenty yere yland kynges scicions failled whan regned honderd yere thre score tweyne ¶ samuel hely iugge ysrael twelue yere soo seyth iosephus libro octauo netheles scripture speketh therof tyme began tymes prophetees tempora prophetarum· thyrdde yere dauyd born petrus samuel ordeyned first company clerkes queres singe sayd prophecyed meene worshipt god besyly afterward samuel iugge ysrael vnder saule echten yere lotrinus brutus eldest sonne began regne vpon south see ryuer humbre named partye ylonde loegria englond sayde first book chapytre britayne albanactus slayne camber dyed locrinus regned twenty yere slayne also batayll wyf gwendolena made ayenst cause strompete called estrilda gwendolena regned husband fyften yere ¶ saul ¶ capitulum 28 saul lignage beniamyn firste kyng ebrewes regned tw • nty yere seyth iosephus whiche yeres scripture speketh petrus saul regned xviij yere whyle samuel lyued two yere deth iiij kyng latyns eneas siluius posthumꝰ sone began regne regned xxxj yere r somme historyes posthumus brother latynns siluius sette fourth eneas sette fyfth place eneas sette fourth xvij duc ath • ne codrus melautus sonne began regne regned one twenty yere deth kynges athene faylled ¶ augustinus libro octodecimo capitulo 14 peloponens men thessalia rebelled ayenst athene answer yeuen goddes whether side duc slayne side shold haue maystrye ¶ therfore knyghtes charged ouer thynge take good kepe kyng codrus· netheles codrus toke pore mannes clothyng byrthen fagottes neck entred strength enemyes ther stryf arered amonge peple knyght slough hym· rather wounded hook whan knowen coreus went awaye without bataylle athene delyuerd codrus hadde leuer dye men haue maystrye lyue men oue • come deth comonte gouernyd maystrys lawe lykyng lordship vnto tyme salon noble maker lawes chosen iugge maddan loctinus sonne gwendolena geten regned fourty yere amonge briton bigate mempricius maulus amasons maken warre asia saule childeren ben slayn hill mount gelboe soo endeth thyrd age world byrth abraham kyngdome dauyd ¶ ysidorus libro quinto seyth third age world conteyneth nyne honderd eyght f • urty yere fourtene generacions eyther translacion sayth thyrdde age world conteyneth nyne honderd yere two fourty r¶ dyuersyte befalleth ysidorus sayth samuel saul ruled peple fourty yere ¶ netheles iosephus libro octauo maister storyes acorden samuel reuled peple allone twelue yere hym saul regned ·xx· yere ¶ dauyd ¶ salamon ¶ capitulum 29 dauyd lignage iuda second kynge hebrewes regned fourty yere first seuen yere ebron vpon iuda al one thre thyrtty yere vpon israel ¶latynus siluius fyfth kyng latyns regned fyfty yere second ixyon kyng cormth̄ regned xxxviij yeres andonycus buylde cyte ephesus salamon borne ¶psidorus libro quinto cartage buyld ¶ petrus somme wol meene carthedon tirius bylde cartage wryte doughter dido buylded ¶r yf ther thre score yere ten bytwene byldynge cartage rome trogus papias acorden· semeth cartage buyld first yere ozias king iuda sayd first book prouynce affrica capitulo numidia galf • alf • menpricius fifth kyng kynge brytons regned twenty xere cleped broder acorde slough hym toke kyngdome strength vsede tyrannye peple bigate wyf noble yong man called ebrancus forsoke wyf atte laste vsed zodomye shrew shold atte last huntyng eten wolues ¶ dauid kynge dyed xxix day december tour syon iherusalem buryed therwith grete rychesse whiche rychesse afterward hircanus bisshop yaf antiochꝰ demetriꝰ sone thre thousand talentes goo ierl̄m treuisa talent grete weyght ther thre man talentis lest l poūde middel ·lx score pond twelue moost c poūde twenty sequitur historia dauyd pea made songes ympnes som thre metre som̄e v made also organ dyuerse man instrumētes music dekenes shold say ympnes songes four men maystres ouer ema • myddel asaph right syde ethan lyft syde edythim ouer see symbals also ther xxiiij bisshopps vnder hem four twenty preestes four twentydekens four twenty porters· thyrdde part hem serued temple • ene tyme two partes ordeyned hows salamon regned ysrl̄ somwhat yeres fader dauid lyue whiche yeres ben acompted dauid to· salamon fader deed regned xl yere· also ierom epl̄a ad vitalē presbiterū· sayth salamon whan • e xj yere old gate sone pharoes doughter also redeth achaz kyng yt gate child whan xj yer old also salamō whan yt slayne ioab semey adonyas whan receyued wytte wysedom god hill yeuen dome two strompettes cast hert doo thre thynges· fyrst bylde temple almyghty god kynges palais self walle iherusalem thre wally within first walle dwellyd preestes clerkes serued tēple kyng houshold within second wall woned stalworth men prophetes within thyrdde wall inhabyte comyn peple craftes men salamons mete euerx day xxx chorus ter floure lxxx chorꝰ mele x fatte ox honderd weders withoute veneson pultrye wylde foule chorus conteyneth mesure 30 busshels salamon wrote also thre bookes one called parabole salamonis prouerbia also second heete ecclesiastes· thyrd cantica ticorum disputed also kynde tree herbes cedar groweth woode lybanus vnto ysope groweth oute walles· also told moche philosophye kynde beestes foūde vp also halsyng coniurisons slake sekenesse caste fendes oute men· combred also founde vp figu • e pryntes grauen precious stone shuld rote somme herbes holden nose thrylles men hadden fendes within hem put fendes craft moche vsed among hebrewes bifore comyng crist therfor iosephus libro octauo sayth sawe elyazarus coniurour presence vaspas • prynce helede men hadden fendes hem maner put vessel water mannes nose heet fende sholde ouertorne vessel whan wente oute· done ¶ also salamon fynde spedeful craft clense cleue stone enclosed struction bird glas struction brought worme heete thamyr oute wyldernesse touched glas aboute wyth blood worme brak glas delyuerd bird ¶than first yere salamon outgoing nacion ionica lacedemonea omerus passinge· ionica nacion grekes ¶ fourth yere salamon second moneth four honderd four score yere goyng egypte salamon began buylde temple seuen yere buyldyng signefyed holy chirch viij yere temple halowed length c cubites xx brede thre score heyght xxx ¶ temple moch gold whan romaynes sette fyre ther ran streme gold nayles molten brooc called torrens cedron also yere quene saba come wysedome salamon ¶ petrus ¶ sayth queue sawe tree temple whiche tree one shulde hanged cause deth kyngdome iewes shold destroyed· quene warned salamon anon tre throwen depe pyt vnder erth fleet aftward aboute cristes tyme pond called probatica piscina vncertayne troweth tree· rood tree gaufr ebranc nempricius sonne sixth kyng brytons regned sixty yere man fayre stronge one twenty wyues bigate twenty sonnes thyrttye doughters fayrest doughter alle gwalaes hebranc sende thes doughters albia siluius kynge wolde haue hem maryed bloode troye bycause wymmen sabynes fledde beddes latyns also ebranc leding assaracus occupyed party germania ebranc beyonde humbre bylde cyte york marche northumberlond scotland ordeyned cyte alcluyt ¶ buylde within scotland castel maydens called eden borgh ¶afterward sayled fraunce greet nauye come ayene wonderly ryche alba siluius sixth kyng l • tyns regned nyne thyrtty yere ¶ roboas ¶abdyas ¶ asa capitulum 30 roboas salamons sonne regned vpon twey lygnages iuda benyamyn echten yere seyth iosephus libro octauo capitulo quinto seuenten yere wryten roboas forsoke counseyl old men ruled counseyl yonglynges· tyme ieroboam nabathes sonne regned samarya vpon ten lygnages israel xvij yere iosephus libro octauo capitulo septimo seyth regned two twenty yere ¶ nabath peple shold tourne hert lord roboam whan wente doo sacrifice in· ierl̄m made twey calues gold worshiped peple dan bethel nabath cause maumetrye israel· ¶the varyaunce countynge yeres kynge iuda israel may determyned that· part yere taken hoole yere owther somme kynges regned faders er regned one kingdom otherwhiles without kynges bookes kynges gadred dyuerse wrytynges prophetes therfore begynnynges bothe kynges iuda kynges israel dyuersly sette therfor discorde may lightly determyned trowe happeth defawte wryters oft begyled nombres propre name ¶treuisa ¶for speke kynges iuda kynges israel take hede lyne ofspryng iacobs childer called lignages israel soo lyne ofspryng iudas iacobs sonnewas called lygnage iuda spryng benyamyn called lygnage benyamyn ¶dauid salamon kynges alle lygnages israel roboas salamons sonne hard sterne ten lygnages forsoke hym made hem kynge hym self cleped hym kyng israel kyng parte israel twey lygnages abode roboas lygnage iuda benyamyn lygnage iud • worthyer lygnage kynge thes twey lygnages called kyng iuda criste come kynges iuda iosephꝰ li·8 ca 5 susac kyng egypt spoiled toke away sheldes golde salamon sette iherusalem roboas sette sheldes brasse stede susac went subdued syria ¶abyas roboas sonne fourth kyng iuda regned thre yere say two ful yere thyrd dele thrid yere ¶and trusted god shold ouer come ieroboam faught ayenst hym slough sixty thousand ¶ asa· rightful abyas sonne regned xlj yere destroyed mawmetrye clensed temple slough kyng egypt atte last greuous sekenesse foot dyed put prophetes foot stokkis charged hym doo right nadab ieroboas sone regned isrl̄ two yere one yere som hym slough ba • regned aft hym xxiiij yere slough iehen ꝓphete time ieheia ananias asarias ꝓphecied isrl̄ egippꝰ siluiꝰ vij kyng latyns regned xxiiij yere asa kyng hyred nadab kynge siria lette basa kyng bylded • ama xl furlonges ierl̄m noman myght goo oute brute grenessheld ebrācꝰ eldest son̄e kyng brytons xij· yer capis siluiꝰ viij king latin regned xxviij yer made capna hela base sone regned isrl̄ ij yere one hole yer somwhat yere zamry slough ela regned hym seuen dayes whan deed peple departed one part folowed zamry folowed tebui petrꝰ steyf kyngdome endured thre yere zamry began regne xxj yere asa kyng iuda regned tebui four yere tebui regned al one israel echt yere soo regned al twelue yere leyl brute grenesheldes sonne regned brytayn xxv yere achab zamryes sonne regned israel xxij yere wyf heet iesabel· iosaphath asas sone rightful bifore god regned iuda xxv yere time ꝓphecied helias michias abdias ruthud • bra leiles sone regned britayn xxxix yere build thre noble cytees caūterbury winchestre shaftesbury carpentꝰ siluiꝰ ix kyng latin regned amōg latin xiij yer ochosias achabs sone regned isrl̄ ij yere sone brother ioram regned viij yere vnto second yere ioram kyng regned al one four yere ioram iosephath kyng iudas sonne regned viij yere viij yere edom went way wold ot vnder iuda ordeyned hem kyng oune helyas rauesshid paradyse x· kyng latyns tiberius siluiꝰ carpentus sone regned among la • yns viij yere riuer tiber name tiber heet rather albula achasias otherwyse called asarias ioranis sonne regned iuda one yere mathew rekeneth achasias ne sonne ioas neyther sone amasias genealogye crist cause v • cioꝰ wicked lyuyng iehu enoynted helizeꝰ child vpon isrl̄ slough achasias kyng iuda ioram kyng isrl̄ moder iesabel achabs lxx sone asarias king iuda xlij bretheren baal preestes regned xxviij yere atha • ia kyng asarias moder achabs doughter regned iuda six yere slough alle kynges childeren iorams hows except ioas asarias sone achasias suster ioyade preestes wyf toke away child hidde norysshed hem priuely six yere dekens chambres temple xj king latyns agryppa siluius regned among latyns ioas achasias sonne regned iuda fourty yere renewed temple bladud ruthydibras sonne regned brytayne ·xx yere ganfr alfrid writen craft • nygromancy made cite caerbadō bath made hote bathe r· netheles wiliā malmesburi se • th yt iuliꝰ cezar brought vp thilk bath trow said rather first book capitulo de vrbibus ioathas iehues sonne regned israel xvij yere tyme helyzeus prophete dyed buryed sebasten samaria· whan helyzens born galgalis one goldē calues ierobas made lowed· whan herde sharp wyse preest ierl̄m sayd prophete born shal destroye mawmetrye israel zachary ioiade bisshops sonne stoned deth kynge ioas bytwene aulter temple ¶ oure lord gospel clepeth barachias sonne bycause myldenesse goodnesse barachias moche saye goddes oune blessyd sonne leyth bladudis sonne regned britayne sixty yere buylded leycestre vpon ryuer soray gate thre doughters sayth brytissh booke ioas ioathas kyng israel sonne regned israel seuenten yere xij kyng latyns aremulus siluius regned amonge latyns xix yere ¶ amasias ¶ capitulum 31 amasias ioas sone regned iuda xxix yer aft kingdome iuda without king xiij yere petrꝰ vpō caas sayth yt kyngdom voyde long amasias departed kyngdome lyue sonne child iij yere old yet myght regne semeth whan fader amasias deed sonne ozias xvj yere olde whan began regne ¶ r thes xiij yere whiche sayth kyngdome iuda without kyng somme storyes acompteth hem acompte hem amonge xxix yere amasias kyng el shal many yeres founden ther eutropius acompteth xxv yere kynge latyn whiche yere troye destroyed vnto buyldynge rome four honderd xxxij yere ieroboam ioas sone regned israel xlj yere xiij kyng latyns euentinꝰ siluiꝰ regned among latin xxxiiij yere ozias heet asarias amazias sone regned iuda lij yere kyng loued wele erth tillyng also kyng wold haue taken vpon hym entremeted thoffyce preest smyten lepre meselrye half greet hille claf fell vpon gardins arbaces otherwise called arbactus first kynge medes slough sardanapallus last kyng assyries regned amonge medes xxix yere· tho faylled hool kyngdome assyries hadde continued belus ninus last sardanapallus thousand yere iiij·c nethehes sardanapallus myghty kynges assiria vnto destroyēg nynyue though ful hool kynges trogus li· p sardanapallus man wretche ony woman stuard arbaces fonde hym spynnyng reed silk distaff womās clothyng among company comyn wymmen receyue sōme huyr therfor arbaces toke greet indignacion exited knyghtes ayenst kyng conspyracye atte last kyng ou er come went ryal place brēt hym self moch rychesse r comētator p eth̄ c 14 ¶sayde one wrote sardanapallus tombe man moch ete drāk· seint austyn de ci· de li 2 ca 17 vnderstādeth sardanapallus hym self while liued ordeyned writen tōbe whan deed man tyme kinges ordeined wrytyng shuld writon tombe deth xiiij· kyng latyns procas siluius regned among latyns xxij yere tyme fidon foūde vp yaf argyues mesure w • yghtes trogus libro tercio ligurgus kynge lacedomonies yaue lawe peple· tenor lawes thus peple enformed buxome prynces prince doo people right reason· techeth al men skylfully scar mesurable trauaylle knygthode destroyed greet wastyng spendyng ¶al shal bought sold shal bought sold moneye chaungyng marchandyse dyde away vse moneye matier vyce synne departed gouernaunce comonte degree yaue kynges knyghtes power batayls iugges power dome senatours kepyng· mayntenyng lawes yaue peple power chefe iugges wold· land grounde dealed euen amonge alle men egalyte enherytaunce londes sholde make hem al lyke myghty stronge yonglynges sholde holde hem apayed alle yere one clothe· suffred man gayer ne noo man fare better mete ne drynk· bade childer fourtene yere sholde vse hem chepynge ne feyres feldes vnto come mannes age nothynge shulde sprad vnder theym shold slepe shuld lyuewith delicioꝰ mete maidēs shuld wedded without endowing yeftes constrayne wedlok faster whan noo wedlock bound bridels endowyng ordeyned oldmen shold worshiped ryche ordeyned thyng holden ef men wold hold hem self ¶ cyte good reule good lyuyng shold rather come rule receyue lawe· feyned appolyn fynder lawe wold lawe sholde last euermore bonde peple oth made hem hem swere chaunge lawe til came ayene feyned hym wold goo appolyn delphicus axe counsel hym yf ought sholde withdrawe lawe made moore netheles went creta ylonde till dyed whan shold dye bade throwe body see leste born lacedomonia men sworn lawe wold wene discharged oth cranius first kyng lacedomonia regned echte twenty yere ganfr ¶ cordeylla kyng leyers doughter hir fader regned brytayn fyue yere atte laste sister sonnes morgan cunedagius put hir prison cunedagius regned brytayn cordeylla thre thyrtty yere slough morgan rebelle ayenst hym glammorgā wale cause happe countrey called morgan lande ¶ cunedagius regned ryuallo hym gurgustius siluius hym iago hym kymnarchus gorbodio twey sonnes fferrex porrex· porrex couetyse lordship slough broder ¶ therfor moder ful wroth fylle maydens vpon mansleer whyle slept hakked hem gobbettes ¶ afterward discorde lond greued peple ful soore vnder v kynges vnto molyuncius donwallons tyme ¶the fyftenth latyns amilius procas yonger sonne regned thre fourty yere yeres acompted broders munitors yeres munitor procas sone put kyngdom owne broder amulius lyued owne felde afterward doughter rea otherwyse callyd etilia shold haue noo child chosen mayde temple goddesse vesca seuent yere hir eme amulius bare tway childer oo childyng remus romulus sayd god mar gate hir child therfor buryed quycke childeren leyd woode woluesse loste hir welpis fedde ofte childer made hem souke owne tetes faustulus heord espyed doyng toke away childer wylde beest norysshed hem vp amonge beestes mete wode feldes ¶ whan childer come age hadden wytt strength saued ofte beestes strong theuys atte laste theues toke remus brought hym munitor shold punyssh hym thef stolen beestes whan munitor toke hede shap child aduysed long bythought doughter childer layde somtyme wode mene tyme come fastulus herd brought hym romulus thenne whan munitor knewe childeren doughter sonnes childeren entended slee broder amulius eutr ¶faustulus heorde kept kynges beestes fonde twey lytil bretheren leyde brynke ryuer tyber brought hem wif yt callid acta laurencia hir fayrenes concupyscēce disordinate lust called lupa latyn woluesse englissh therfor hows comyn woman called yet lupanaria latyn thes childer remus romulus waxed strong gadred hem many heerdes theues slough amulus vpon ryuer alba restored grauntsir munitor kyngdome ayene ¶martinus· ¶ netheles whether woman called lupa noo old wrytyng marble stone rome sheweth yet woluesse fedde twey bretheren hir mylk woluesse lupa latyn zacharias ieroboams sonne regnede israel sex monethes hym smote sellum iabes sonne regned oo moneth petrus veray acomptes owther kyngdome israel deth ierobam thre twenty yere without kynge owther zacharyas began regne xv yere ozias regned thylk thre twenty yere acompted al tyme lyued wycked lyf amended lyued • x monethes good lif therfor sex monethes acompted hym xxxviij yere ozias manaen gaddyes sonne regned israel ten yere ¶o • or yaue egypcians lawe tyme lamb spak told redy tale lacedomonies arayed bataylle ayenste mecenes atte laste agreued playntes wyues longe home ordeyned womē lefte home euerych sholde take many men hoped maner haue strenger childern ¶r loke herof firste book capitulo grecia scilicet lacedomonia ¶in corinthy euery yere ordeyned iugges stede kynges ¶ first olimpias began tyme feyth eusebius cronyke yere phaceas manaens sonne began regne israel regned two yere ¶ ioathan ¶ capitulum 32 ioathan iosias sonne regned iuda sexten yere· firste yere phacea romelyas sonne began regne israel regned twenty yere ¶this firste yere ioathan iosephus history affryca beda tellen four honderd yere six destruction troye first olimpias ordeyned iliensis vnder escilis iugge athene whiche olimpias corebus athene first vyctour hugo ¶ olimpus name hill grecia atte clyf named acten hille called olimpus myrth clerenesse weder ther myrth god ther ileens haue theyr tornamētes frō iiij yere iiij yere four yere bytwene tornoyes whiche four yere prince ordeyned chosen space four yere cleped olimpias isichus praxomdys sonne ordeyned first olimpias r olimpias begynneth atte styntyig sonne wynter whan day shertest grekis begynneth yere hugo ca olimpus ¶ olimpiades playes ordeyned vnder hylle olimpus worship iupiter· whiche playes hath maystrye shal haue wold axe holden one fyue yere lest shold foryete lenger forborn shold greue men grete cost yf ofter vsed ¶ theglathphalazar kyng assiria wente vp israel destroyed countrey beyonde iordane toke prisonners twey lygnages israel half ladde hym assiria begynnyng thraldome ten lignages israel ¶pol li octauo ¶ ierom sayth kynge assyria hadde fyue name salmanasar senacherib phulle theglathphalazar sargon therfor wōder though king named dyuse storyes dyuerse name r· somme wol meane name name dyuerse kynges regned assiria sardanapallus euery arbaces phul theglathphasar salmanasar senacherib assaradon sargon hym greet kynges merodac vnto balthazar regned babilonia vnto darius· cirus torned hir kyngdom perses • sardanapallus last hole kyng assiria come kynges euerych warred nacions dwellyd aboute hem rekeuer worship dignyte brought ten lygnages israel seruage regned vnto ezechias tyme kyng iuda whan senacherib fledde oute iuda slayn owne sonnes temple ¶ achas ¶ capitulum 33 achaz ioathās sonne regned israel xvj yere iiij· yere rome ful buyld hille palatynus twey bretheren twynnes remus romulus xxj day apryll begynnynge vij olimpias yere kyngdom romulus acompted xxxix yere martinus ¶me redeth kynges regned longe bifore aboute place ytaly specially ianus saturnus picus faunus latynus regned vnto eneas aboute two honderd yere r ¶than eneas romulus italye vnder fyften rectours four honderd yere two thyrty· cyte buyld last yere tarrquiniꝰ proud regned rome vnder vij kinges abou • two honderd four fourty yere afterward vnder con • suls vnto iulius cesar four honderd foure fourty yere ¶entr romulus regned leder fabius slough remus romulus broder heordes raak marc ¶i yf done broder wylle cause deth thus remus sayd sengle wall strength ynowe new cyte make good lept ouer walle oo lepe f ¶titus ¶ thise bretheren twynnes one age put vpon dyuynyng whether hem shold rule cyte buyld older gretter mayster whan hille auentinus seuen fowles shewed hem remus callyd vulters afterward suche two fourten vulters shewed hem romulus stryued eyther sayd better diuinacion foules remus firste romulus hadde nombre remus slayn strif marc comyn sawe remus slayn f • r lept ouer new walles rome entr ¶than romulus first romaynes name latyns cleped romaynes named cyte owne name gadred peple al aboute chasse honderd eldest wysest thyng counseyll cleped hem senatours cause elde age senex latyn old englysshe named hem faders cause charge kepynge made name wryten lettres gold therfor cleped faders wryten chees thousand werriours called milites nombre mille thousand milites knyghtes englysshe ¶ titus whan romulus gadred cyte gret multitude flemed men mysdoers heordes vnworthy personnes men dwellyd aboute hem helde hem harlottis wold yeue hem doughters wyues vnworthy romulus satte vp game prayd nacions aboute come see· whan comen romaynes rauesshed maydens fairest maide alle yeuen duc thalassus therfore weddynge romaynes cryed thalassus r ¶ austyn de ciuitate dei libro tercio capitulo vndecimo ¶ seyth titus lyuius treateth cause herof werre long duryng bitwene sabine romaynes ¶atte last whan sabynes fyll one tarpenis doughter made couenaunt tacius kyng sabine wold delyuer hym men the· tour torpeya wher fader lord sabynes wolde yeue broches bare lyft armes whiche ouide maketh mynde libro primo de fastie sabyns entred atte yates rome brused ouerlay mayde wylfully sheldes bare theyr lyfte sydes ¶whan romaynes herde arayd hem fight faught till nygh destroyed· romaynes wyues sabynes doughters went herr spradde childer armes wepyng bytwene shiltrons cryed pea made pea kynges shulde regne geders • peple shold putte owne name bifore name felawes name kyngdome sholde leue romaynes eutr therof come euery romayne hadd afterward twey name ¶but sone tacius kyng sabin slayne assent romulus semeth wel made sorowe hym neyther toke wreche graunted hem fedome dede r ¶titus lynius wryten whyle romulus tolde peple atte water capne couerd heled thykke c •• wde ¶ austyn de ciuitate dei libro tercio capitulo 13 ¶ vnderstondeth semeth romulus smyteij lyghtynge al dasshed nothyng body myghte founde sōme romaynes wryte al • haled drawen owne senatours cruelta ¶than one iulius proculus greete worship amonge romaynes sayd romulus appered hym sleep hight hym romaynes shuld worshipe romulus stede god clepe quirinus vsed spere spere 〈◊〉 called quyris langage sabyns therfor knyghtes rome cleped quyrytes • pere men ¶ manere peple rome lette slough senatours deth romulus namely tyme fylle eclypps sonne therfor romaynes wende sonne sory romulus deth ¶augustinus de ciuitate dei li decimo octauo capitulo quartodecimo· romulus time tale millesius floures first seuen wyse men ysidorus libro secundo ¶ tale firste serched naturel philosphye cause worchyng heuen kynd thinges afterward plato departed doyng four arsemetrik geometrye music astronomye ¶pol̄ ¶ naturel philosopher dyuynour serched kynde vertues thynges warned told bifore eclypses sonne mone trowed moisture begynnyng thynges sayth lyued vnto lxviij olimpiad augustinus libro octauo ¶tales disciple anaximander chaunged forseyd oppynyon trowyng mayster • sayde euery thyng hath owne propre begynnyng cause wherof gendred anaximenes herd owne name nummus ysidorus libro sextodecimo capitulo 17 ¶pecunia cometh p • cu beste pecunia mony first made lether beestes skynne • afterward saturnus made money brasse wrytynge • boute ¶atte last numa made money siluer wro • e owne name aboute therfore nummus peny hath name nummus numa ¶ manasses ¶ capitulum •• manasses ezechias sonne began regne· regned lv yere tyme sibill erophila hir flowres yland 〈◊〉 ¶and· nychomedia bythymia buyld called somtyme archacus mida ryche kyng fugia dranck bloode boole dyed manasses euyl kyng god made stretes ierl̄m reed bloode ppephetes made ysayas prophete sawed sawe tree ladde pryson babylon yet atte last manasses repented hym wept penaunce grace amended lyf hebrewes seyen ysaias sawed without iherusalem beside welle siloe axed water men yaue none god heuen sent water mouth yelde vp soul • ¶ siloe moche saye sent isaye hadde prayd graunted god sege iherusalem men cyte wente theder shuld fynde water enemyes myght ther water fynde mynde dede peple buryed hym vnder ook called quercus rogel faste water siloe kynges seaccen athene iugges ordeyned rule people ¶tullius hostilius thyrd kyng romaynes regned two thyrtty yere eutr ¶this first kyng romaynes ware p̄pure maner reed clothyng kynges brouderd ryueld long pee arayd batayls ou er come albans fidenates atte laste smyten lighntyng owne hows soo dyed augustinus libro tercio capitulo vndecimo ascamus tyme r • mulus heede kyngdome lefte albans whan cyte byld greet • ryf long bitwene romaine albans· ende stryfe put vpon thre knightes one side iij knightis ye otherside yt whether side knyghtes ou er come side shold hede kyngdom tha • romaynes side came geder thre knyghtes euery wa • callyd oracius borne one byrthen albans syde cam also geder thre knyghtes euery called curiacius also born one byrthen thre curyacies sabyns side first slough tweyne oracies romaine side thyrd oracies sawe left allone right grete perill feyned flee myght sodenly fall vpon thre whan departed vnware purposyng take auantage done· ran hym vnwysely euery slough euery hym self cam hande eche therfore heede name tourned romaynes kyngdome ¶ oracius sister spoused one curyaces sawe hir broder slayne spoylled hir spouse myssa yde brother angrely sleenge hir spouse therfor brother wroth slough hir also ¶r tullius hostilius bataylle agaynst fydenates prayd metius kyng albans come assiste hym bothe olde kynrede alyance new couenaunt frendship made deth thre curiacies ¶ whan tullius hostilius felle enemyes metius withdrewe hym netheles tullius vyctory
