toke metius kynge drowe hym horse threwe downe cyte alba toke men rychesse sente hem rome ¶archilotus simonides enchaunters tyme floures cyte bysans byld tracia called constantynople amon manasses sonne regned two yere wryte hebrewes seuenty sayen regned twelue yere· ¶this amon lyued euyl lyf slayne owne seruauntes ¶r may happe bycause therof yeres age ben dyuersly acompted amonge dyuerse men yeres buyldynge cyte passen ten yeres whiche ten yeres seuenty put ten iosias amon sonne child echte yere old beganne regne regned inda one thyrtty yere iosias iiij yere regne corrected euyl doer ben old • man gladly herde wordes deutronomij anaximander sayd eyer cause al thynges disciple anaxagoras sayd wytte god maker thynges taught archelaus democritus· archelaus taught socrates socrates platoes mayster ¶augustinus de ciuitate dei libro decimo octauo capitulo visesimo quinto· • x wysemen tyme transmigracion iewes netheles left bookes hem writ • n taught men honeste lyuyng· thes name wisem • n pitacus milytenus salon atheniensis chilon lacedemonius piriadrus corinthius cleobolus lidius byas pien • u ¶val̄ libro quarto capitulo primo tale tyme somme ffisshers sold draught fysshes nett tho drawen golden meteborde appolyn delphicus temple bycause bord ther fylle strif among hem fysshers sayd sold fissh taken myghtier seyd fortune bought bargayne wonder nouelte axed counseyl reede appolyn delphicus demed borde shold yeuen wyseste man bord yeuen salon sente bias bias yaf phitacus fro one til yeuen salon ayen tho salon halowed bord appolyn o • e elaes sonne slough phasee kyng israel regned hym nyne yere whan nyne yere doon folke israel broughte seruage tyme myda ryche kyng regned frigia ¶ ezechias ¶ capitulum 34 ezechias fourtenth kynge iuda seconde yere cyte siracusana thridde yere cyte catina scicilia buylde ¶ kyng babilon worshipped ezechias yeftes· hadde herd telle sonne worshiped stede god· torned ayene atte prayer ezechias vnderstode sonne kyng grete worship therfor sente messagers ryche yeftes desired knowe reason cause wonder· ezechias shewed tresorye ¶ senacherib otherwyse callyd salmanasar kyng caldees ouercome osee kynge israel beseged samarya thre yere gate ¶also toke ten lygnages say seuen lygnages prison hilles medes besides riuer gothan girald beyonde hilles caspy wher alysaunder encluded closed twey foule maner peple gog magog antecrist whan cometh shal delyuer thes people bringe hem also iewes abyden antecrist bileue messias crist petrus first takyng seruage thre lygnages ¶ troweth tobye taken lefte kyng osee prysonner nynyue story fulfylled vnder manasses ezechias sonne· owther atte moost xx yere iosias kyng kynge assyryes brought men dyuerse londes samaria kepe lande israel drede lyon cruel styerne made holder lawe iewes cleped samarite samaritani kepers cleped also chutei iacobites supplanter left maumetrye· romulus dyed whan regned xxxix yere sayd bifore senatours ruled comyns rome space yere half space tyme callyd inttempus tyme bytwene numa pompilus began regne· amonge romaynes regned four fourty yere· numa batayll men dwellyd aboute hym ordeyned romaynes lawes good lyuyng semed rather custome batayls theues tyrauntes lawles deseryued departed yere without redy acomptes ten monethes hugo capitulo ianus ¶for romaynes hebrewes bigan yere fro moneth marche vnto tyme▪ pompilus putte ianuar februare begynnyng yere· yere lefte amonge romaynes incorrecte vnto iulius cezars tyme eutr· numa ordeyned ornamentes serymonyes worshippes goddes bisshoppes dyuynes mar preestes mynystres presthode euery due ordre forboden dayes yaf temple god ianus another fire goddesse vesta maydens worshipped lyght shold warden emperye wake shyne lykenesse sterres heuen numa sayd thes keping noble goddesse tote hilles worship mawmettis foloweth story iosias brent bone fals prophete • fals preestes worshipped serued fals goddes helde esterday mynde passage thurgh reed see atte last faught pharao nechao kyng egypte slayn lefte hym thre sone elyachym otherwyse called ieconias ioathas otherwyse called sellum mathani otherwyse called sedechias ¶ ancus marcius fourth kyng romaynes numaes neuew borne doughter bygan regne regned xxiij yere ¶this ancus grace sawe tarquiniꝰ priscꝰ made hym warden yres quyte ful euyl ieremyas elchias bisshops sonne began prophecye prophecied xlj yere vnto destroyeng cyte withoute tyme prophecied egypte ieremyas sawe thre tokenynges yerde waking crocke brennynge owne bregyrdel roted besides riuer eufrates made lamentacions deth iosias kyng iuda also woman olda sophonias prophete prophecied made mynde book kynges tarquinius priscus fyfthe king romaynes regned seuen thyrtty yere priscus doubled nombre senatours ordeyned game playes made walles vise strong place pryuy atte last ancus sonne precessour slough hym ¶ titus • whan ancus deede sente traytously ancus sonnes huntyng wold hym self ordeyned kyng meene tyme also chees seruius tullius wedde doughter heyr hym therfor ancus sonnes conspyred ayenst hym hiered heerdes slee hym therfor heerdes feyned plee haue rightful dome appeled kyng whiche cause plee whyle kyng toke hede one heerde slough hym ioathas iosias myddel sone whā fader deed elder broder forsakē ordeined peple kynge iuda regned thre monethes first day ianuar first day auerel ¶pharao nechao kyng egypt lad hym bounden egypt made elder brother elyachym kynge trybutarij kyng egypte cleped hym ioachym token subiection elyachym cleped ioachym regned enleuen yere lyued atte worst slough vrias prophete prisoned ieremye brent baruchis book ¶ nabugodonosor ¶ capitulum 36 grete nabugodonosor began regne babyloyne regned xxxiij yere ouercome kyng egypt occupyed londe riuer egypt riuer eufrates lord siria withoute iudea iosephus li 10 ca • sayth nabugodonosor fourth yere regne wēt iudea iewrye wan ierl̄m toke ioach • prisonner made trybutary left hym way netheles toke prysoners noble childer descended kynges anania azarias misael danyel ladde hym babilon vessel temple ¶fro tyme forward kynge nabugodonosor emperour caldea siria egypt iudea iewry petrus vnder tempest teone rachabites ionadab rachabs sonnes childer folowed fader bestes commaundementes dranc wyn ne sette vynes ne sewe sedes went tho ierl̄m saue hem self ioachym kynge herd tr • le kyng egypt wolde efte fyght ayenst nabugodonosor denyed hym trybute promysed hym therfor nabugodonosor wroth went toke ierusalem kylled alle strong men ioachim kyng also threw hem without walles vnburyed crowned ther sonne ieconias kyng ¶r shal yeue credence ierom sayth ther w • twey ieconias one ende forne fourtene generacions another begynnyng fourtene generacions may seme comune lettre mathew ful scar vnlerned men vnderstonde sayth iosias gate ioconias bretheren transmygracion babyloyne shold continued maner meane vnlerned men myght vnderstande ¶ iosias begate iechonias iechonias iochonias gate salatiel· eyther iechonias called ioachym seyth iosephus text must vnderstande maner transmygracion aboute tyme tyme transmygracion treuisa transmigracion babyloyne takyng folke israel bondage babyloyne petrus bodye elder ioachim soo throwen withoute walles founde lettres fygures ayenst lawe god name mawmett codonasia worshipped iosephus li· 10 ca 8 iechonias otherwyse callyd ioachym ioachis sonne made kyng nabugodonosor regned thre monethes vnto moneth iuyl nabugodonosor drad hym· leste wold haue mynde fader deth holde egypciās ayenst hym therfor nabugodonosor torned ayene besieged ierusalem kyng iechonias counseyll ieremye yelde hym wylfully moder al houshold nabugodonosor iechonias taken prysonner two ·m prynces seuen thousand craftes men among mardocheꝰ ezechiel yet child blode preestes soo iechonias otherwyse called ioachym left prison caldea xxxvij yere til nabugodonosor deed sonne nabugodonosor also enylmerodach nabugodonosors sone toke hym pryson petrus 144 ¶from transmygracion made echt yere regnynge nabugodonosor rekeneth thre score ten bondage iewes proprely speke thes yelde hem wylfully cleped transmigracion taken afterward ayenst wyll called prysonners bondage mathanias iosias thyrd sonne ordeyned kynge nabugodonosor sworn shold serue tributary also callyd sedechias regned xj yere· iosephꝰ li 10 ca 9 ezechiel began prophecie prophecied babylon hem bondage aft takē • pl̄e ieremye prophete lāde iuda ezechiel sēte ꝓphecie ierl̄m king sedechias trowed ꝓphecies semed ꝓphecies ieremie ezechiel acordynge al prophecy acorded ierusalem shold taken kyng shold ledde away prisonner babyloyne· semeth discorded ezechiel sayd sedechias sholde see babyloyne ¶ netheles ther sayng true both· whan nabugodonosor toke zedechias put eyen reblatha ladde hym babylon stark· blynde ¶ salon one seuen wyse men away old dragon lawes gaf lawes men athene r salon speketh seint austin de ci li 2 ca 16· agellus spekith openly li 11 trogꝰ pomp li· • maner salon tyme men athene lawe euery lykyng rengnyng stede lawe atte laste sa • man grete rightwysenesse elect chosen wente rightfully bytwene peple senatours thāk either side· val li 8 ca· 7 last ende day whan frendes came aboute talked arered lyfte vp heed bihelde hem one axed hem soo answerd sayde euer ye talke whan haue vnderstanden shal dye danyel prophete expouned nabugodonosor kyngis sweuen ¶ take hede danyel see ten sightes thre vnder nabugodonosor thre vnder balthasar vij viij vnder darius ix tenth vnder cirus· netheles prophetes longe bifore takyng iherusalem peple prophecied takyng soo ysaias osee michias whan takyng toward doyng soo sophonias ieremyas· ezechiel somme durynge takynge bondage danyel abacu • somme afterward aggeus zacharyas yet somme vnderstand danyel sawe sight fyf thyrtty yere nabugodonosors regne nabugodonosor beseged iherusalem trybute werned ¶ kyng egypt arayed hym wente oute though wold haue broken siege ¶therfor nabugodonosor went siege chasede kyng egypt siria ¶ therfor prophetes sone fals prophetes scorned ieremyas sayd babilon shal torne agayn thou seydest prophecidest ieremyas seid contrary therfor first putte prison lake slyme vnto throte ¶ yere tenth moneth nabusardan prynce cheualrye babyloyne· beseged ierl̄m cite closed thre monethes gret honger womē ete childer mesure span yere iiij moneth king takē ye dawing ye way wildernes brought nabugodonosor reblatha ther eyē put boūdē lad babilō ther yeuē laxatif drink presence kyng al fest shame died sone aft also yere xix yer nabugodonosor nabusardā brēt ye tēple hous ierl̄m destroied walles toke away vessel pilers toke men prisonners toke ieremyas oute pryson netheles nabugodonosor lett ieremias dwel godolia let rachabytes goo fre soo temple brente foure honderd four thyrtty yere buyld wryten brues veryly ysidorus seuenty wryten iiij· c four fourty yere byldynge rome honderd yere thre score one ¶ fourth age world endeth begynnyng kyngdome dauid takynge iherūsalem iewes cleped transmygracion transmygracion taking done xj yere sedechias moneth august dured four honderd yere thre score thryt • ene sex monthes ten dayes sextene generacions netheles mathew cause somme priue meanyng setteth fourten generacions ysidorus seuē ty tellen age conteyned four honderd yere four score thre case discordyng yeres happeth comyn translacion sayth amon regned two yere somme seyne regned xij yere therfor yf xiij yere kyngdō iuda without kyng deth amasias put thes yeres yeres fourth age shul iiij c lxxx xvj ¶explicit liber secundus ¶incipit liber tercius fyth age world began transmygracion iewes brennyng temple doone the· xj yere sedechias therfor wol reken seuenty yere prysonnyng bondage iewes xj yere sedechias eusebius dide auctoryte zacharye prophete shal ende seuenty yere second yere dariꝰ itapsis sonne· semeth iosephꝰ ieroms glose reken seuenty yere xiij· yere iosias king yere ieremias began ꝓphecie vnto first yere cirus redyly acompt seuēty yeres enden thirde yere laste yere cirꝰ ꝓprely yeres taking bōdage iewes yeres ende second yere dariꝰ ꝓprely yeres ful transmygracion destroyng temple petrꝰ 154 men iuda drad face nabugodonosor deth godolyas slayn therfore went theyr child cataill egypt ieremias went them· ayenst wylle prophecied alway went egypt tyme sholde destroyed therfor ston • hym deth fourth yere transmygraciō· netheles egypcians worshiped prophete buryed besides buriels kynges prayer dryuen away eddres cocadrilles egypciās treuisa cocadrille four foted beest lyueth water land cominly xx cubet long clawes teeth strongly armed skynne ha • rekketh stroke hard stone rested day water nyght lande cocadrylle allone among beests moeueth ouer iowe seyth ysidore foloweth story also ꝓphete yaf tokē kynges egypt manmettes sholdē falle whan mayde born child· therfore preestes misbileuid mē ordeined hem ymage maide child worshiped piuey place within tēple· also ieremias knew tēple shold destroyed toke shrine testamēt al therin made thurgh prayer swalowed stone bitwen ye hilles wildernes wher moises aarō bē buried marked stone finger wrote therin goddes owne name tyme hidderto worldes ende stone hidde clowde place maye knowen neyther name god maye redde· seyth atte first arysyng atte day 〈◊〉 dome moyses aaron shal brynge shryne 〈◊〉 hille syna ther holy halowes shul gadred 〈◊〉 ayene • goyng god kyng nabugodonosor 〈◊〉 yere kyngdome went doune siria made subge • 〈◊〉 hym • moab ouercome egypt slough kyng egypte ordeyned ther another kyng ¶ also atte laste iewes founde ladde babilon nabugodonosor second yere kingdom mette sweuen ymage iiij maner thynges made ful soore aferd second yere acompted firste begynnyng kyngdome grete kyngdome whan made subget nacions brought relyef israel iuda egypte yere befelle second sight vision daniel angel delyuerd the· childer ouen ¶ yere befelle thyrdde vision cleped kynges pistle whiche telleth hym self bitokened tree seen atte last pryde shold shapen bifore oxe bihynde lyon chaungyng body chaungyng disposicion wytte semyng shold ete hey oxe til seu •• time torned seuen monethes atte prayer daniel ¶petrus 16 ¶after tyme chaūged owne shappe ayene regned more· ordeyned seuen iugges hym self penaunce vnto seuen yeres ende ete breede ne flesshe · ne dranck wyn ete herbes potage counseyl daniel ¶ seruius tullius sixth kyng romaynes come tarquinius priscus wedded doughder regned four twenty yeres ¶ eutr libro primo noble womās sonne taken· yafe thre hilles cyte rome quirinalis equilinus viminalis made diches cyte ordeyned first personale trybute romaynes ¶in tyme founden echt honderd thousand • uen thousand burges rome titus ¶this hadde maryed doughter tullia one tarquiniꝰ superbus made hir husband conspyre comynte rome senatours slee fader therfor tarquinius mette kyng vpon tyme threwe hym doune stayre kyng soore hurt went homeward slayn way men tarquinius hyred doo fals dede tullia kynges doughter herd herof toke hir char went grete husbond made new kyng· waye ladde hir chare ouer hir fader bodye ¶ ezechiel prophete drawen horse • aldea doyng hem lefte lygnages dan gad hadde warned hem shold come ayene iherusalem ¶also yere sawe sigh • e vision newyng temple iosephus libro decimo capitulo vndecimo ¶ capitulum secundum grete nabugodonosor sonne nabugodonosor regned babyloyne ten yere put moche fader royalte ¶ megasten libro iudiciorum sayth strengthe grete dedes passed hercules destroyed libia hiberia pulled drough oute place grete stone hilles sette tree made ther orchard cleped suspensilis wyf myght st •• de orchard see home hir owne countrey born darius doughter· darius astrages sonne astrages heet assuerus also ¶ also kyng beseged tirus thre yere thre monethes r nethehes marcianus speketh second nabugodonosor sayth euil marodoth balthasar bretheren ¶that tyme theyr flowres anaximander anaximines philosophres tale disciple petrus 162 ¶ nabugodonosors brother enylmerodach began regne whan broder dede anon toke ioachiin king iuda prison prison bandes seuen thyrtty yere sette trone aboue kynges trones hym babilon hym grace mercy· ffor broder nabugodonosor tyme fader meschyef doo many euil dedes whan fader restored ayene· owne shap· put broder enylmerodach pryson accused fader ioachim pryson vnto deth second nabugodonosor ¶therfor enylmerodach whan began regne toke ioachym oute pryson drad lest fader wold rise deth lyue somtyme tourned fro shappe beest shap mankynde ¶and counseyle loore ioachim toke erth faders body cutte honderd peces deled peces honderd vulters ete· ioachim sayd fader shold neuer ryse er al vulters come geder ¶ enylmerodach thre sonnes one beyght egessarius regusar hight labo sardachus thyrd heyght nabar balthasar hym fylle kyngdome petrus 169 ¶in enylmerodachs •• suzanna accused danyels booke hebrew cleped fable feynyng therinne somwhat fals rade therinne preestes stoned deth ieromye sayth brent fy • e ¶ also saye wryten danyel natheles writen one grece· semeth wel som̄e maner acordyng wordes hebrew ¶ capitulum 3 balthasar regned caldea babyloyne first yere daniel sawe iiij sighte iiij wyndes see four angel four beestes lyon bere pardus boor four chefe kyngdoms world ten horne ten smal kyngedoms sprang oute fourth beeste· shold subdued lytel horne antecrist petrus 163 ¶this antecriste vnworthy lygnage dan shalbe borne seed fader moder derke place babylone conceyned euyl spyryte shal lyght moders wombe vertu child shal afterward yned born waxen cleped child losse dr lesyng thre firste ten horne smyten face say shal slee first thre kynges thylk ten kyng affrica kyng egypte kyng ethyopia seuen kynges shal yelde fals vyctour antecrist· shal haue wonder wytte connynge wytchecrafte shal worche wonder fynde tresour hidde· shal circumside hym clepe self messias cast iewes shal falle hym shal buylde temple ayene sette trone therinne shal torne men hym drede yeftes wonder werkes shal worche shal slee enoc hely shal greue god almyghties holy people shal bitaken vnto hande vnto tyme tymes halfe tyme vnto yere two yeres half yere· ¶ remigius seyth antecrist shal feyne hym deed aryse agayne atte laste criste shal slee hym owther owne hecst seruyce seynt michael tharchangel ¶and ieronimus super danielem saith antecrist shal slayn owne tente monut olyuete crist ascended heuen remygius sayth crist shal come vnto dome till antecrist slayn men shal saued shal haue fyf fourty dayes doo penaūce· therfor take hede though wryten mathewe marc 13 man knoweth houre fader allone yet goddes sonne knoweth itfor god fader therfor sayde knoweth maketh v knowe lymmes holy chirche erthe ¶ spedeful v knowe day austyn glosa sayth last day vnknowen v sholden bewar soo shulden lyue alway though sholden demed day· morow trogus libro secundo ¶about tyme athene deth salon wise one phisistratus botte self bledde sayd grete maystres hadden beten soo loue peple comyntee ¶ therfor many knyghtes assigned kepe regned athene four thyrtty yere pol̄ libro octauo ¶the wyf egged slee one kysshed doughter high wey answerd sayde yf 〈◊〉 louen v shal doo hem haten v ¶ daniel sawe fyfthe sighte visyon whether sheep horne alle lyke vnderstande kyngdome medes perses goot buck grete alysander drad bytokened buk hym grewe four horne successours one lytel horne anthyochus epyphanus come one four horne come selencus somtyme plegge prysonner rome escaped then wente warred kyngdom defowled temple sixth sight daniel whan balthasar concubynes drank vessel temple oure lord· whiche vessayle grauntsyre gre • e nabugodonosor krought iherusalem· balthasar sawe hand wryte byfore hym walle wordes mane techil phares vnderstonde nōbre wight delyng whiche daniel expouned sayde god hath tolde nombred thy kyngdom fulfilled first thou art weyen balance founden thou hast lasse thou lyuest lasse thou wendest second· thy kyngdom deled yeuen perses ¶ ffor third nyght cirus darius come toke cyte babylon slough balthasar oracius whan cirus wonne eeste landes come toward babyloyn ryuer eufrates let hym bold knyght fayr kyng loued wel auentured hym water drowned kyng sory wroth made auowe wold make grete riuer shalde withoute depnesse water sholde come woman knee wolde wade ouer therfor brode feldes departed ryuer foure honderd thre score chanels destroyed ryuer woonte renne thurgh myddel babyloyne enemyes wente toke cyte wold wene myght buyld ne destroyed mannes dede ¶ petrus 165 somme wryte balthasar moder whome orchard suspensilis made darius doughter balthasar sonne darius cyrus came socyed ioyned cyrus occupyed kyngdom petrus 166 ¶whan balthasar slayne darius torned kyngdome babyloyne caldea perses medes yere befell seuenth vysion danyel danyel sued darius til done putt pyt • e lyon medea worshipped god yere befelle echt auision danyel angel gabryel certefyed fynal takyng bondage comynge romaynes ¶ comyng crist seuenty wekes yeres· gabryel sayd seuenty short wekes vpon thy people wekes sette dayes yeres one weke conteyned seuen yere ¶and sayd shorte wekes sholde vnderstande yeres mone sonne yere mone shorter xj dayes yere sonne treuisa ¶a yere sonne day yere another yere yere mone pryme monethe yere to· firste prime moneth another yere wyl enleuen dayes rather second yere first yere ensample whan pryme goth one fallyth pryme thre twenty day ianuary next yere shal falle xij day ianuary enleuen dayes rather sueth thistory seuenty wekes yeres sonne maketh foure honderd yere four score ten beda rekeneth seuenty wekes yeres mone twenty yere artaxzerses kyng yere neomyas leue bylde temple vnto xviij yere tiberius cezar yere crist suffred deth affrycanns history acordeth bede touchyng begynnyng endeth seuenty wekes xv yere tiberius cesar yere crist baptysed ¶ tercullianus rekene • h yeres firste yere darius yere goddes worde shewed danyel til titus destroyed temple ¶ ix auysyon danyel man clothed lynnen who bodye crisolitus tenth sighte folowyng kynges perse kynge alysaundres successours antecrist ¶danyel sawe thyrd yere cyrus kyng perse r vncertayne long daniel lyued nethles redeth first chapyt • e booke dured vnto firste yere cyrus ¶ capitulum quartum deth darius medium made assuerus ether astiages sonne cirus helde hole kyngdom este sette see percia though kyngdome medium worshipful men percia auaunced hym kyng cyrus darius sister sonne astyages doughter son • ¶ trogus libro primo ¶astiages otherwyse called assuerus one doughter mette he sleepe vyne sprange oute doughters priue chose byspradde al· asia ¶than dreeme reders expowned swe •• sayde doughter shold haue child shold lord asia put hym kyng drad yaue doughter symple knyght pryuely born doughter shold bere noble child also whan doughter child toke hir hym whan child borne betoke one arpagus secretary shold slee child trowed kyngdome shold somtyme falle kynges doughter bitoke child heerd kept kynges beestes comanded hym ley child woode deuoured whan heerde leyde child wood tolde wyf therof whiche lyghter child tyme prayd wold fette child hir wold nowrysshe hym wolde leye owne sonne woode whan herd came chyld founde bytche yeuyng sowke kept beestes fowles ¶ petrus 173 whan child brought herdes wyf made good semblaunt though knowen hir named child spartatus welpe langage perse whan child age strength couth goo aboute play childer play feres called cyrus made hym kynge playes chastysede soore rebell heestes wherfor fader child • e aggreued compleyned kyng astyages heerdes sōne kyng sente childe axed ferd childer answerd boldly sayde kyng shold kyng wondred child bold stydfast toke hede child signes tokenes kyng toke herde syde pryuely lerned soth stode ¶ netheles drede neuew aslaked trowed meanyng dreme reders was· fulfylled kyngdome childer therfore man arpagus· whoome hadde rather bytake childe slee bytoke tho hym nouryssh fede tolde hym child herdes sone· made arpagꝰ priuely ete child broken heeste whan ha eten child told al befel astiages made arpagus leder hoost werre ayenst enemyes perse kyng lefte self medium ¶ arpagus bythought hym hadde mynde euil dede kyng done hym conseyled thoost chese cyrus make hym kynge perses cleped hem cyrus wold meane though astyages stryue shal heyre ¶trogus libro primo mene tyme arpagus sente letter cyrus shold haue mynde sauede hym lost h • owne child loue hym ¶ arpagus myght sende letter openly kyng therfor toke oute bowel hare put letter within hare fraude shold knowen sent daye veneson whan letter redde cirus warned sleep first man mette erly morow shold take hym hym wey erly morow mette one sebar escaped oute pryson borne perse dide gyues ladde hym hym persipol gadred people bade hem hewe doun greete wode made hem greet feest morowe whan sawe mury wel ease mete drynke axed hem whether hem leuer trauayll rather daye· owther feeste day cyrus sayde foloweth medes shal haue trauaylle yist • rdaye folowe shal haue suche feestes anone arayed hem batayll ayenst astyages petrus 173 ¶ astiages drad soore made cosyn darius sonne adoptiuus whan bataylls cam geder began fight cyrus perses began flee wyues moders came fast ayenst hem shewed hem pryuee choses axed hem wol ye crepe moders wombe born ayene men shamed tourned sodenly ayene felle enemyes hadden vyctory cyrus bare hym astiages neuewe vyctory vyctor graunted hym kyngdom hircans lyued graunted kyngedome medes • ame darius moder brother hoped shold torne hym ayene ¶ petrus 174 ¶ cyrus whan herd ysayas prophecye wryton hym honderd yere twenty bifore· maner crist who right hande haue take c delyuerd iewes first yere kyngdome made free nygh fyfty thousand men restored hem holy vessel gold siluer fyue thousand thre honderd yaue hem leue goo ageyne bylde temple iherusalem ¶ aggeus • ued hem moost therto tho yong yet prophete also zacharias prophete meued hym blessyd salatiels sonne cleped hym zorobabel say mayster babylon ¶but many hem caldea hadden possession wyues childre hem lother goo then abyden vnto thyrdde yere cirus ¶ capitulum 5 danyel prayde god delyueranre peple darius kyng medes first yere kyngdome purposed delyuer people dyed sone fulfylled not· therfor cyrus firste yere kyngdome yafe iewes leue peple slowe therfor danyel prayd god yeuen kynge wylle delyuer peple wold yeue peple wyll wende homeward agayn ¶petrus 174 ¶ thyrd yere cyrus iewes wenten vnder zorobobabel duk vnder iohan greete preeste lxx yere bondage takyng seyth iosephus ieroms glose vpon ezechiel tyme xiij yere iosias kynge thyrdde yere cyrus though eusebius crony que auctorite zacharie prophete sayth second yere darius itapsis sonne lxx yere takyng bondage netheles may determyned maner second yere darius lxx yere fyfth age worlde destroyeng temple· thyrdde yere cyrus lxx yere first takyng xiij yere iosias kynge iewes went hoome agayne leyde fundament temple samarytans herd therof came hem asisted hem buylde temple worshipped one god vnderstande moyses bookes iewes answerd seyden though worshipe one god· netheles falleth v byld one hows therfor samaritan wroth let werk suggestion yeftes vnto second yere darius itapsis sonne ¶orosius libro primo kynge cyrus tyme phalaris tyrant scicilia punysshed men ofte rightfully though hym self vnrightfull ¶ one parilius craftes man bra desired plese tyrant made hym brasen boole dore riyhtsyde men damp • shold goo boole tormented whan within dore closed fyre made ther vnder noyse crye hem tormented shold passe dyuerse wyndinges tornynges shold seme grisely roryng boole beestes mannes gronyng phalaris tyrant wele apayed dede • wroth doer made hym first essaye torment wickedly brought vp torment men punysshed craftes man craft founden ¶that yere befelle redeth cresus ryche king liddus whan cyrus werred ayenst babilons cresꝰ kyng lyddes helpe babylon ouercomen fledde whan babylon sessed cyrus toke cresus dide hym grete worship tourned eyther grete profyte ¶for strengthe come grece werre ayenst cyrus torned agayne curtosye done cresus ¶ cresus hadde doughter hight fanatica whiche hadde spyryt prophecie euer counseylled hir fader leue warre wherfor cresus axed counseyll goddes begyled hym vers worde double vnderstandyng cyrus alym passe shall kyngdomes many lese therfor cresus rebel ayenst cyrus taken thyrdde tyme petrus 176 ¶ cyrus smote cresus besides ryuer alim brought lyddes noble men armes sleght wrechednes sleuth whan hadde loste horse theyr armure made hem vse tauernes pleyes iapes nyce craftes comyn woman strompettis euyl lyuyng men manere shewyng loue good wylle ouercome liking lechery hem myghte ouercome bataylle soo kyngdome lyddes faylled stonde two honderd yere one thyrtty ¶ trogus libro primo ¶ ther noble kynges lyddes none gracious candalus louede wyf moche cause hir beautee wolde speke hir preyse hir alle manere men atte laste shewde nakede one gygy owne felawe dede made felawe spouse breker owne enemye therfor lost bothe kyngdome wyf ¶ eutropius ¶ capitulum 6 seuenth last kynge romaynes hadde thre name lucius tarquinus superbus slough wyues fader seruius tullius regned fyue twenty yere· foūde vp first diuse maner tormentes among romains bandes boleyerdes plate battes prysons gyues cheynes lawyng exylyng ouercome vultes gabyes made pee tuscan augustinꝰ de ca li 2 ca 14· atte last bylde temple iupiter hille carpelus foū de mannes heede place they· digged cleped place capitolium wherfore theyr prophetes dyuynes tolde place shold heede world· titus liꝰ augꝰ de ci li· 1 ca 19· somtyme tarquinus superbꝰ besieged cyte ardea rebell rome sonne tarquinus sextus lucrecias husbonde tarquinus collatinus satte soper talkede chastyte wyues lette quod collatinus· lette theyr owne dedes preyse wyues therfor assent came nyght rome founde lucrecia one wakynge aboute wol werke mennes wyues sleepe somme aboute gyglotrye· wherfor sixtus tarquinus wayted tyme lodged lucrecia gestwyse· cam vpon slepte swerde drawen ligge hir maugre teth sayde thou suffre lye shal put naked churle deed withthe bed thou shalt ligge deed hym also whan sextus done dede woman went hir wey sorowfully sente hir fader husband prayed come home hoost enformed mishappe hir bifalle· yaue feyth credence hir messagier toke wreche dede slough hir self bifore hem priue knyf bar • ¶ r wysemen saye lucrecia slough hir self· vertu shame angre neither mā ne womā shold punysshed without gylt neyther gylt without iugge romaynes coueyte moost praysyng men worldly worshipe lucrecia drede yf lyued dede lest peple wold wene assentyng dede therfore token sory therof conseruynge hir good loo name voydyng despyte example good woman wold lenger lyue happe speketh dytour retricion seynt austyn de ci li 1 ca 19 toucheth tweyn ther one brake spousage eutr cause dede people gadred geder putte downe deposed fader· kyngdome exyled hym childer ¶ hooste kynge ardea forsoke tarquinus kinge whan kyng came rome fonde yates closed ayenste hym childre wente away kynges put oute cyte two consul ordeyned gouerne comontee iunius brutus tarquinus collatinus lucrecias husband er yeres ende lucrecias husbād put office cōsul hate name bicause callyd tarquinus romains wold man bare name shold bere offyce cyte • neyther dwel therin despyte spouse brekyng tarquinus sextus done r austyn de ci de li 2 ca 14 15 seyth lucrecias husbond put offyce within yere fraude felawe consul· augustinꝰ li 3 ca 14 titus whan tarquinus soo put sente messagiers cyte messagiers pryue coūseil sonnes brutus consul vicilles bretheren brutus wyf· counseyl tarquinus shold brought estate cyte agayne came seruaunt vycellyes knowen told senatours brutus consul deth euerychone r virgile speketh herof fine sexti libri eneidis ¶euto libro primo ¶ tarquinꝰ gadred help euery syde warred ayenst cyte hoped restored maner encountrynge fyghtyng brutus· conseyll arnus tarquinius slough eyther tarquinus faught thryes thre yere ayenste romaynes onerco men ¶ therfor went tusculus wyf lyued fourtene yere forseyd brutus consul soo poure whan dyed money burye hym gadred among peple ¶ petrus 176 trogus libro primo ¶ capitulum 7 cirus whan wonne asia· entended warre ayenste schites thanurus quene shite messagetes al one nacion came ayenste hym though myght haue withstande entre hir londe hir enemyes haue holden hem atte passage ryuer arexes netheles wylfully suffred entre haue esyer fyghtyng within lande knewe ¶ also ryuer hehynde hir enemyes shold lete escape flyght cyrus sett pauylon within lande grete plente mete drynk feyned hym flee· withdrawe hym drede ¶ quene sent hir yong sonne thriddele hir hoost ayenst cyrus whan come deynteous mete drinke vnconnyng chiualrye men rather ouercomen dronkenesse dedes armes cyrus cam vpon slough hym whan quene herde therof wepte therfore solace comfort desired take wreche begyled cirus suche maner gyle ¶she fleyng hir sonne new wounded drough cyrus narow valeye bytwene highe hilles slough cyrus two honderd thousand mē pers· one escaped bere home tydynges ¶ quene bade smyte cyrus heede throwe fflaket ful mannes bloode despysed hym maner nowe fylle thy self bloode hast euer desyred thus cyrus dede regned nobly ryally thrytty yere alway done grete dedes ¶ petrus 178 ¶capitulum 8 cambyses cyrus sonne regned fader esdras clepeth artarxerses assuerus netheles story iudith called nabugodonosor cambyses tyme bifell redde thystory iudith trogus 189 wonder though soo cleped owne fader cyrus callyd nabugodonosor lyue made cambises owne sonne regne twelue yere amonge assyryes nynyue ¶ atte last whan fader deed· helde hole kyngdom eest eyght yere cambises suffred temple iherusalem buylde durynge tyme also first yere hole kyngdom slough arphaxath wolde haue regned medium wold worshiped stede god israel ouerall iudith wydowe slough olyfernes prynce hooste siege bethulia second yere empyre cambyses fyfth yere kyngdome destroyed egypte forsoke vsages therof destroyed temple buyld babylonia egypt whan torned then dyed damask viij yere kyngdome valerius libro sexto cambyses made stryke skinne iugge yeuen fals iuggement made hem sprede take aboute chayre iugge shold sytt plee deme made iugges sonne iugge place stede fader made suche versus wryton vpon chayre syttynge see iustice looke thou stydfast kepe hande eke eeres yeftes mennes prayer take lanterne lawe lyght vnder skyn drawe thou sittist place yet· thy fornfader sette trogus libro primo et petrus decimo octauo ¶ capitulum 9 cambyses one hermeydes one seuen wyse men rewled kyngdome perses wedded cambises doughter made though wold regne tytle wyf· though wolde haue kepte kyngdome one mergus cambyses brother yet yong childe· netheles cambyses hadde slayne bifore mergꝰ within temple noo man wyst therof wyseman hermeydes· ¶after seuen monethes kyngdome hermeydes lyeng deth bed hadde fayre yonglyng brother ordeyned hym kynge sayd ionglynge mergus cyrus sonne cambyses brother suche hydyng kynges myght lyghtly done perse man goth kynges perse men meyne one wysemen beganne haue suspection doynge hadde doughter amonge kynges concubynes charged doughter pryuely· shold nyght grope kynges heed take heede yf hadde eeres whan knowen wenche kynge none eeres· vij wyse men conspyred geder slough hym two bretheren regned scarsely one yer thā thes vij wise mē treated bitwene hem self hem shold wedde kynges dough • king kingdō al acorded shold erly morowe come place palyce bifore tēple yates who hors neyde first shuld kynge shewyng goddes one hem darius • apsis sone spak pryuely keper hors charged hym shold make hors assaylle mare nyghte place shold come geders morowe done when· wysemen came geders morow anone darius hors began neye mynde mare darius made kyng regned six thyrtty yere ¶ capitulum 10 darius regned ouer honderd seuen twenty prouynces zorobabel salatyels sonne right famylyer hym hadde counseylled hym er kynge shold make auowe god isrl̄ kyng sholde restore temple god yelde holy vessel agayne ¶ therfor zorobabel began boldly bylde temple zacharyas aggeus prophetes comforted hym 〈◊〉 therto sayde god wroth hem cause goddes hows desolate dwellyd howses wel bylde sayden token goddes wrath sewe moche gadred lytil ¶but prynces perse beyonde ryuer letted werke temple ¶ therfor zorobabel wente darius grete worship hym slept owne chambre iosephꝰ lib • vndecimo ¶the kynge putte forth redels erly morowe axed thre warden body quod strengest thes thre· kynge wyne woman· promysed yeftes gaf rediest answer first said king strengest skylle man aboue al beestes kyng aboue men men doth al thyng commaundeth second sayde wyne strengest reson kyng aboue men strength wytte wyne ouercometh strengthe mannys wytte ¶zorobabel sayd woman strenger eyther tweyne woman yeueth lyf fedynge kynges hem sette vynes whan kynges comen strength ieoparde theyr lyf woman tolde sawe kynges concubyne yeue kynge buffettis whan lough kynge lough whan wroth kyng wroth also netheles said truthe strenger thre thes neuer fayr grete strong shal passe fayle sothnes truth shal neuer dye ne chaūge euer dure· sentence plesyd moore alle men kynge graunted vessel temple lycenced hym goo buylde temple yaue hym lettres warrant man shold lette second yere darius ytapsis eicht moneth werk men wrought bylde temple fulfylled seuenth yere sixe fourty yere kyngdom perses firste yere cyrus whan leue buylde temple • sothe sayde gospel six fourty yere temple bylde whan temple byld halowed twelue moneth marche ¶ second halowing temple done marche netheles first halowiyng salamons tyme done heruest thyrdde done wynter iudas machabeꝰ tyme ¶petrus 182 also yere fyre taken awaye aulter first yere takyng bondage hidde pytte founde brennyng shryne testament whan iewes came vncertayn ¶ yf sothe epyphanius shryne sholde come oute den stone ieremyas hidde til day dome ¶ sothe hebrewes made nother lykenes old shryne moyses made ¶ redde among prayes romaynes toke oute iewry toke shryne god delstyk mete boord ¶ soo whan temple ful buyld monethe marche aggeus zacharyas dyed ¶this yere kynges putte oute rome consul began rule comonte sayd byfore ¶ made twey consul yf one wold outrage myght refreyne thes twey consul chosen chaunged yere yere leste wold outrage yf theyr offyce dured long tyme titus ¶ tarquinius put rome romaynes hadden pea among hem self tarquinius warred ayenst hem ¶ fyfthe yere beganne stryfe bytwene greete reu • er comonte manere ¶ vsage customme amonge romaynes w • rriours sholde werre vpon owne coste tho cause warred ofte muste borowe moneye greete maystres reulers cyte dettours myghte paye moneye daye putte prysonne ¶ therfore beganne stryfe comynne people wente thre myle cyte vnto hille moūt sacer atte laste pee made vpon suche condicion peple shold haue grete maistres trybunes shold mayntene defende hem ayenst grete ¶ capitulum 11 pictagoras philosopher dyed tyme trogus li 22 naciō samia rich marchaūtes sone call • 〈◊〉 pictagoras wel richer fader might forsake fader might gete wēt first egipt aft babilō lerne cours sterres knowe beginning world then torned agayn • creta lacedomonia knowe mynoys ligurgus lawe ¶than torned cyte called ciuitas croconiorum rule twenty yere taught vertues thewes taught fader moder childre old woman euery hym self atte laste wente mechapontus dyed th •• sentence wryten hym pol libro septimo capitulo quarto ¶ putto maner pyctagoras ofte disputynge bro •• hte aboute olde moders put away noble aray gold royalte thaugh suche 〈◊〉 instrumnet lecherye therfor dyde hem away offred hem temple iuno pyctagoras sayd chastyte veray • oble aray 〈◊〉 modree • thre honderd yongmen sworn geder lyued felawship hem self company pryuy conspyracy ayēst hym tornned cyte ayenst hem self people cyte gadred hem one hows wold haue brent 〈◊〉 stryf sixty dede exyled pyctagoras greet auctoryte old tyme 〈◊〉 oppynyon passed al mennes sentence also • ow conferme ony sentence yf pyctagoras sayd soo val̄ libro tercio capitulo sep •• mo ¶ herd hym dide hym greete worship sayd lawful make neyther doute ne question loore taught axed hem ony reason sawes sayde yafe none answer pyctagoras sayd isidorus libro primo sayth pyctagoras founde firste letter y· lykenesse mannes lyf agel libro octauo capitulo octauo alle money ony pyctagoras company openly put forth among hem soo company stydfast true ¶ also came loore axed besyly thewes kynde castyng mouth semblaunt aray shape body ¶also ordeyned couenable tyme stylle speke hugo didascolus pyctagoras maner seuen science none scolers shold bifore seuen yere ax •• reason ne skylle besyly herkynge sayde· sholde byleue mayster sayde til said soo myght hym self fynde skylle reason poē libro septimo pyctagoras vsed grete contynence abstynence ete neyther fisshe ne flessh ¶ also deth men wonderd moche hym auctoryte grete men made temple hows worshipped hym stede god caas toke occasion sawe· sayde whyle lyue philosophres hows holy place wytte wysedome veray temple god also taught men byleue mennes sowle shal neuer dye lyue euermore haue mede peyne deseruyng theyr lyf netheles sayth brought wickedly fable thousand yere deth ¶ieronimus contra ruf pyctagoras sayth sowles deth passe frō body body virgilius sexto eueydis sayth ofte begyn wylle torne body tullius de natura deorum libro tercio whan pyctagoras fonde newe conclusion geometrye woloffre • xe mus trowe done wolde offre appolyn delphicus wolde sprynge aucter blood ¶treuisa ¶ 〈◊〉 wonder speke mus som̄e poetes feyne mus 〈◊〉 doughters iupyter mynde somme seyn doughters meno tesbia ¶pol̄ li 5 capitulo quarto men athene brente pyctagoras bookes exyled hem also doubted goddes whether 〈◊〉 soth noo somwhat spak goddes ¶agellus libro quinto whan pyctagoras yong besy gete spedeful man beryng byrthens gete lyuelode bare byrthen many iuy stalkes bounden short roop democritus philosopher mette hym· sawe yonglynge doo spedyly dedes hadde byrthen bounden craft geometrye axed hym bounden fagott sayde pyctagoras· made hym vndoo byrthen bynde agayne sayth syth thou hast wytte doo wel yf thou wold folowe thou shalt doo wel better dedes graunted lerned hym philosophye pol̄ libro quinto one auallius riche yong come pyctagoras lerne parfyght maner spekyng payd hym half moneye er lerned half shuld pay day made plee bifore iugge maystrye ¶atte laste whan connynge speche forsoke facunde connyng bifore pleders troweth wold pay owed mayster pyctagoras toke counseyll sommoned hym bifore iugges began maner lerne thou yong foole axe dette either wey yf ou er come cause right dette yf dome yeuen dette couenaunte thou ouercomest haste maystrye naye sayd auallius lerne wyse mayster nether waye shall pay thou axist· yif demed ayenst shal paye dome yf demed ayenst shal couenaunt haue maystrye ¶than iugges sawe cause brygous insoluble continued sentente iuggement long day ¶so redde amonge men athene woman poysened hir husband hir owne sonne wickedly slayne hir sone heyr hir fyrst husbande ¶the old iugges respyted theyr iuggement till honderd yere ¶ one side grete sorowe assoylle otherside cruel dede dampned ¶ysidorus libro secundo capitulo visesimo quarto ¶though men rede tubal caimes lygnage fynder consonancye music bifore no flode netheles redeth among grekes pyctagoras founde craft musik̄ sowne hamers stretchyng cordes strenges ¶marian̄ libro secundo ¶it happed pyctagoras passed forth openly herd smythes bete hamers hote yron acorde eueryche certayne ordre sowne sharpe sowne acorded grete made smythes chaunge hamers acorde sownyng folowed alway toke hede hamers dyuse weyght bade hym make greter hamers hamers tornede hym examyne strenges streyned guttes· senewes shepe beestes fastned dyuerse weyghtes weyghtes founden hamer hadde suche song acorde rather acordynge hamers made swetnesse kyndly sowne strenges whan connyng gret pryuete began fynde nombres whiche sownes acorde spedde make craft musik r ¶therfor tullius de tusculis questio libro quarto speketh hym sayth pyctagoras scolers couth brynge mynde oute strif thoughte • reste song sowne strenges ¶augustinus ep̄ h contra rut whan yonglynges wyn dronken wold breke yates chast woman pyctagoras bade piper pipe songe made thendytyng spondeus whan soo tho bestyalyte moeuyng lechery cessed slouth maner tewnes· seneca libro tercio de lira pyctagoras harpe strenges cessed distourbance wyttes ¶r wyse men tell pyctagoras passed sōtyme smythes hows herde swete sown acordyng smytyng four hamers vpon anueld therfore lette wey hamers founde one hamers weyed twey moche another another weyed half moche another another weyed moch third dele another· though first hamer vjl • ̄ second twelue thyrd eycht· fourth nyne figure sheweth ¶ whan acordes founden pyctagoras yaf hem name cleped nombre double clepede sownes dyapason clepeth nombre half clepeth sownes dyapente nombre called al thyrd dele hete sownes dyatesseron nombres called al eyghteth dele heete tewnes double dyapason melodye one strenge yf stryng streyned endlonge vpon holownesse tree· departed euen two brydge sette ther vnder eyther party streng sowne shal dyapason yf streng streyned touched▪ strynge departed euen thre brygge sette vnder departe bytwene twey deles thyrdde lenger dele stryng yf touched shal yeue sowne callyd dyatesseron yf departed nyne brigge sette vnder bytwene laste parte dele· lenger dele streng yf touched shal yeue sowne hete tonus nyne conteyneth echt eyght part eyght figure foloweth ¶ ieronimus contra rufū many pyctagoras disciple kept maistres heestes mynde vsede wytte mynde studye bookes taught many suche prouerbes shal kytte departe sorowe body vnconnyng wytte lechery wombe treson oute cyte stryf oute hows incontynence hastynesse oute alle thynges ¶also al frendes haue shal comyn frende tweyne ¶ memot take hede tymes ¶after god sothnesse shal worshiped maketh men next god ¶ysidorus libro octauo capitulo sexto ¶ capitulum 12 name philosophres begynnyng pyctagoras old grekes callyd hym self sophistris wyse pyctagoras whan axed man answerd sayde philosopher louer wytte wysedom clepe self wyseman wold seme grete boost pryde afterward philosophres hadden name auctours ¶and soo held pyctagoras loore called pyctogoraci· helden platoes loore cleped platonici ¶pol̄ libro primo somme philosophres hadden name contrees helden pyctagoras lore cleped italya pyctagoras taught grete contre italye somtyme called grete grecia callyd ionyci hadden name yonder grece theyr auctor prince tale millesius ysidorus libro octauo ¶other name standyng comyng geders stoycy· achademice peripatetici stoyci name porche athene called stoa langage grece ther peynted grete beryng dedes wisemen strong firste hem yeuen synne lyke grete thus meaned grete synne stele strawe gold slee knyght hors beest saide blame mannes wylle ¶ zenon̄ sayd mannes soule shal dye body treuisa wolde wyseman seen water powred throte though galon· ¶ foloweth storye scolers sayde shold dure withouten ende netheles desired lif withouten ende achademici hadden name platoes towne beside thene called achademia poynt falle· plato woont studye ¶ trowed al thyng vncertaynly made archelaus brought vp secte democritꝰ made ¶but must graunted many thynges vnknowen hidde fro mannes knowleche ¶ god wyl many thynges passe knowleche man also many thynges maye knowen mannes kyndly wytte paripatetici haue name wandrynge walkyng▪ aristotle auctour wont dispute wandryng walkyng· augustinus de ciuitate dei libro octauo ther thre maner philosophres kynde taketh hede kynde thynges suche were· tale millesius pyctagoras helde loore somme ethici toke hede taught knowleche connynge gode lyuynge thewes • suche socrates held loore plato specially helde loore therfore amonge preysed parfighte techer philosophi • ¶ ysidorus libro octauo capitulo sexto ¶ therfor veray phisosophre hath knoheleche thynges longeth god man holdeth al maner way rightful lyuyng al manere philosophres cleped dyuynes reputed moost excellent treated god almyghty netheles many hem erred treatyng god world many came knowleche god netheles worshipped hym god vanysshede away thoughtis sayd wyse made fooles errours hem brought afterward many errours holy chirche suche fals errour dede men shal ryse day dome· euery martir euen pere god augustinus de ciuitate dei libro octauo capitulo decimo ¶ right knowleche god profyted moche knowleche truth suche plato sayd god cause beyng reason vnderstandyng ordre good lyuyng therfor god v begynnyng kynde • hnes loore grace lyf· also ther philosophres trauaylled theyr wyttes fynde knowe cause thynges maner lyuyng· netheles mooste preysed knewe god cause al thynges wrought lyghte sothnesse truthe welle grace shal drynke knowleche come maner trauaylled theyr wyttes fynde best god knewe body body maye fordone corrupted made contrary thynges also toke hede god lykenesse may chaunged therfore passed al bodyes al lykenesses ¶the body sene withoute lykenesse bodye thought within thought within body lykenesse bodye lykenesse knowen thyng nowther lykenesse nowther bodye lykenesse seen demed whether fayre owther fowle better thynge soo demed ther fayrenesse body whether state body shap lengthe brede owther moeuynge songe suche inwytte man demeth myght yf ther better lykenesse inwytte without swellyng body cryeng mannes wi without lengthe space place tyme· mannes thought kynde wytte mannes sowle body· syth lykenesse knowen therby body inwytte body shold god make wytte body also inwytte chaungeable moeuable el sholde mannes wytte knowe better other· felyth knoweth neyther wyttyer better duller yet· wytte amendeth profyteth demeth better byfore amended apeyred chaungeable philosophres dyuynes knewen wel thyng chaungeable may hym stydfaste chaungeable· none beyng lyuyng none vnderstanding none beyng wele ¶eutr mariauns ¶ capitulum 13 peple rome made stryfe though mysledde senatours therfore made hym trybunes defendours people ayenste consuls· quintus marcius duc rome taken vultes bifore putte oute cyte wroth wente vultes· rather taken help hem wente warre destroye countre fyue myle rome ouer come efte romaynes forsoke pee profered cessed warre greue cyte till moder wyf came oute cyte prayde cyte ¶ thre honderd noble men called familia fabia faught allone ayenst vegenses smyten deth romaynes biseged mount algyd lucius quincius delyuerd hem taken plough made dictatour wiped awaye swat toke royall gowne ¶ egypte forsoke darius kyng perse wold vnder hym ¶pompilia mayde rome taken lechery buryed quyck lyue pyndarus symonydes poetes tho flowres trogus libro secundo deth pisistratus tyraunt athene one sonnes toke mayde vyolence laye hir therfor maydes brother slough hym ¶that broder named espyas helde kyngdome athene fader made hym taken slayne brother whan mansleer compellyd torment knowlege men assentyng mannes deth accused appelled hispias tyraunces frendes whan slayne hispias axede yf ther ony moo consentynge broder deth answerd sayde man alyue worthy dye thou allone ¶ peple knewe vertue yong man put espyas oute cite hispias wente anone perse darius kyng exited ayenst athene ¶orocius libro secundo darius rekeuerd bataylle assyryes babylon rebelled ayenst hym ordeyned batayll warre ayenst anticirus kyng schites axed mariage doughter wente forth vijc thousande men armes loste seuentythousand sodayne res skarmysshes netheles retornyng chastysed macedoynes iones also ordeyned batayll ayenst men athene helped assistente iones netheles men athene ten thousande mette many thousand glad fight whan ther thousand paas bitwene shiltrons cours sped stroke came bifore enemyes ¶than ther soo strong fyghte· semed men one side beestes trogus libro secundo perses ouercome fledde theyr shippes whiche shippes many dreynt many taken grete vyctorye harde telle gate pryce netheles one cynegyrus knyghte athene many grete dedes slaughter pursued perses fledde shippes shippe laded held right hande til smyten eft lif • hande lost whan lost hādes bote helde ship teth stok man faught teth woode beest ¶ two honderd perses dyed hipius tyraunt sone afterwarde darius dyed yere kyngdome xxxvij lefte many sonnes lyue ¶ amonge sonns artaxerses begeten kyngdome grete cirus moder grauntsir auaunced kyngdom ¶ capitulum 14 artaxerses darius sonne fyfth kyng perses regned twenty yere wanne egypt fader lost put arysted· warred fyue yere ayenste grece fader bigonne ¶ iosephus sayth vnder artaxerses seuenth yere kyngdome esdras wēt downe iewry neemyas butl̄er wente downe fyue twenty yere restored lawes iherusalem space twelue yere esdras self saith went downe artarxerses tyme ¶ trogus one damarachus exiled athene dwellyd kynge artaxerses loued moore owne lande thexilyng kynge done hym moche good wrote alle kynges purpoos table tree waxed table aboue wrytyng sende pryuy messagier grete athene men spartania aduysed hem longe shold meane ffor sawe wrytyng table atte last kyng leonydas sister fonde cōceyte wryter shaued wax lettres seen redde warned warre artaxerses hadde made redy ixcm fyghtyng men semed hoost dryed vp ryuers hem behoued moche water orocius libro 2 artaxerses seuen c· thousand fyghtynge men kyngdome iiijc thousande helpe landes shippes warre yren snowtes ij ijc thre thousand shippes wel arayed soo ryuers semede scar hem goo see semed skars hem sayle ¶ grete rowte habyly arayed fyghte neyther free goo forth renn • neyther redy flee come bytwene place termopyles four thousand sparnates fell vpon hem leyden downe slough hem thre dayes geder ¶valerius libro sexto ¶whan grete rowte gadred geder one perses sayd grekes shal ouercomen shalle alayed multitude perses another spake sayde kynge shal haue enemyes kyth strength yet another spake sayde see skars oure shippes· townes skars knyghtes feldes mē ¶ then̄e damarachꝰ answerd sayde many mē may ruled maye ruled may longe dure· soo befelle ¶ many nought rewled ouercome fewe wele ruled ¶therfor whan kynge ouersette lacedomones sayd begyled soo many men fewe connyng batell fyght ¶ valerius libro tercio ¶ fyghtynge one grekes sayde felawe sonne derked arowes shotte perses thou sayst wele seyd shold better fyght shadowe hete sonne ¶also axed grete despyte one halted came bataylle answerd sayde purpoos abyde flee befalleth wele halt man ¶ trogus libro secundo ¶ atte laste leonyda kynge athene came four thousand men bete downe grete parte hooste perses came vpon remenaunt nyghte whan slepe slough hem chaced hem brake skayled hoost euery fro artaxerses myshapped twyes ouercomen bateylle lande wold essaye fortune happe vpon se • men beten shad skayled euery rather hilled spradde see grete shippes disconfyte fere gladde flee vnnethe escaped away fysshers bote also ther deyde wonder many honger many dede careyns laye feldes afterward ther came moreyn vpon hoost beestes fowles folowed hoost smell dede careyns herodotus wryters historyes euripedes basylydes dya· goras sophocles wryter gestes tyme flowres r ¶ ieronimus epistola ad nepocianum speketh sophocles sayth whan toke lytel heede meyne howshold grete elde sonnes accused wodenesse bifore iugges rehersed sayde fable geste wryten edippus gret age wytte wysedom shold torne cruelte iugges fauour theatre tyme socrates philosopher born stone shapen goot felle downe heuen see egeus artabanus artaxerses kynges steward purposed kyng perse cā euentyde seuen sonnes artaxerses chambre slough kyng many ¶ kyng twey sonnes one hight darius artaxerses artabanus excited artaxerses slee broder darius sayde darius slayne owne fader one vagabaxus knewe kyng slayne told artaxererses stode artabanus slayne fader ¶ ano • e artaxerses gadred peple geder made hem come armed bifore though wold knowe nombre knyghtes ¶ whan artabanus stode bifore armed amonge men kyng sayd haberion short bade artabanus doo haberion chaunge hym whan artabanus vnarmed hym naked anon kyng cōmanded mē sle sonnes soo artaxersts toke wreche fader deth saued fader trone broder lyf hym self gyle trayson marianus ¶ sequitur capitulum 15 artaxerses seuēth kyng pers call • longimanus regned xl yere bigan regne whan artabanus regned seuen monethes somme say thystory h •• ter mardocheus befell artaxerses tyme trowe hesdras writer kingis beginning tellith neemias tourned fro babyloy • e speketh hester· yf hester tyme presuppose wolde somwhat haue spoken hir hester artaxerses tyme enleuenth kyng perses hete assuerus also ¶ aboute time dunwallo moliuncius duke sonne cornewayle began regne amonge brytons ¶and whan kynges slayne englond wale scotland regned allone ilond made hym dyademe crowne gold made certayne lawes callyd molyuncius lawes whiche lawes afterward gyldas torned latyn af • erward kyng aluredus made hem torned oute latyn englysshe whan molyūcius regned fourty yere dyed buryed temple cyte trinouantum london ¶this gafe priuelege fredome temple plowes cytees weyes ledeth therto petrus ¶esdras wryter cam downe kynges lettres whiche shold discharge mynystris temple al maner trybute· putte yn oute chaūge hem doynge punysshe hem rebelle deth exylyng prisonne owther paynge catalle esdras came downe vessayls temple teche peple ierusalem lawe wryten corrected bookes two honderd xx childer israel beyonde hilles caspy cam hym one vij c cam hym oute babyloyne chastysed comyng childer transmygracion specially preestes wyues straunge nacions esdras renewed wrote lawe caldeys brente amēded volume straungers apayred gadred al xxij bookes hebrewes sholde haue many bookes lettres ¶also foūde vp newe maner title prikkes wryte amōg lettres lyghter writō therfor cleped swyfte wryter also put somme tytles psalmes telleth iewes wrote maner bydders lyft side right side efte frō right side lyft syde empedicles permenides zeno philosophres flowres empedycles chees buryed hill mon ethna scicilia brenneth alway ¶ boecede consolacione sayth permenydes satte ten yere roche bythought hym arte logyke plato afterward made art founde therinne many prynciples rule aristotle brought geder art· tho feretides second wryter historyes flowres netheles lytel herodotus wryten thystoryes ¶r titus liuius ¶ capitulum 16 romayns sende messagiers prayd men athene sende hem lawes wryten ¶ salon lawes sent lacedomonia haue ligurgus lawes though lawes best hadde hym suspecte lyer sayde taken lawes appolyn ¶ romaynes gadred salon lawes ten table put afterward twey table therto ¶therof come afterward famous lawe twelue table wryten folio de origine iuris libro secundo glose ¶ ysidorus libro quinto moyses gaf firste lawe hebrues feroneus grekes mercurius trimogestus egypcians salon men athene ligurgus lacedomones numa pompilius romaynes ¶afterward peple rome myghte ne wold suffre stryf maystres iugges ordeyned ten men wryte lawes wryten lawes oute salon bookes tourned lawe twelue table oute grue latyn ¶ fyrst wold make bookes lawe grete pompeus consul drede euyl spekers accomplysshed ne fulfylled iulius cezar began make bookes lawes deyde sone ¶ soo amonge romaynes lytel lytel lawes compyled til constantyne grete ordeygned newe lawes ¶ theodosius minor made booke lawe called theodosius coode ¶ soone iustinianus wele nyghe two thousand bookes thyrtty thousand versus made restored lawes digeste power consul cessed cyte· thēne men ordeyned ruler stede twey· consul second yere seynt austyn toucheth de ci· dei li primo ca 19· one thes ten men highte appiꝰ claudiꝰ hadde grete desire luste enduce meoue knyghtes doughter lygge hir made falsly one seruauntes chalenge hir bonde woman appius demed iugged hir hir owne fader slough hir made pleyn • e peple falsheed peple tho hille algid ten men put offyce trybunes edyles put theyr stede petrus 186 neemias mā hebrues kyng artaxerses butler cam leue lord babylon iewry ladde peple xij yere soo th • v yere begā restore walles yates iherusalem ended werke two yere four monethes grete lette buyldynge half people srode armed withoute cyte defende cyte werke resing slekkyng straunge nacions de • le peple armed bylde wallis leide stone one hande helde eueryche swerde hande ¶ af • terward neemyas toke heede iewes fyre heuen clensed pytte valeye iosephath ieremias hid fyre tyme takyng bondage foū de stokkes aulter brennyng cole fette water cast water faggotte wode therof come fyre ¶ yf thou wolt reken seuenty wekes yeres twenty yere artaxerses whan neemias wente downe buylde ierusalem vnto criste vnto eyghten yere tiberius cezar whiche seuenty wekes yeres danyel prophecyed shorted vpon goddes peple thou myght fynde seuē ty wekes yeres thou acompte weke yeres mone yere mone twelue monethes mone vsede moyses lawe yere sonne ther embolisme· ¶ soo seuenty wekys yeres yere vnto crist maketh four honderd yeres mone foure score ten withoute monethes embolismes maketh four honderd yere sonne thre score fyften ¶ treuisa ¶ yere sonne full yere· men vse nowe englond landes yere mone xij monethes mone moneth mone fro change change soo yere mone lasse enleuen dayes full yere moneth embolis • fallith whan xiij prime one yere ¶r nombre wikes yeres may proued maner ¶for beda libro de temporibus sayth kyngdome perses dured twenty yere artaxerses sixth yere darius· whan darius ouercome alysaunder honderd yere fyftene· kyngdome grece dured vnto iulius cezars tyme two honders four score tweyne yeres begynnynge iulius cezar regned foure yere seuen monethes xviij yere tiberius cezar four score yere eyght alle thes yeres amounte vnto nombre four honderd lxxv yeres sonne ¶orocius libro tercio till grete dele day passed semed nyght dured ¶also hayle stone felle descended clowdes bete erth veray stone ¶ petras 188 ¶esdras dyed good age elde neemias torned ayene artaxerses kyng tourned ayene iherusalem ayenste endynge daye chastysed hem trespaced ayenste lawe dyed buryed wall made iherusalem ¶beda de tempore hiderto thordre holy history taken bookes hebrewes wryten dedes doynges yeres· dedes doynges folowed taken bookes iosephus affrycan bookes machabeis efte consul made rome ¶ ypocras tyme flourysshed ¶ysidorus libro quarto appollo founde first arte phisik • amonge grekes sonne esculapius made moore· smyten lyghtnyng arte lefte fyue honderd yere vnto artaxerses tyme tyme ypocras renewed arte crafte phisik ylande cheo twey first artes vntrusty say methodyca taketh none hede tymes cause elementes neither age euyl vse tellynges old wyues second callyd emperita axeth essay ¶the thyrdde called logyca alowed appreued ¶ capitulum 17 artaxerses· artaxerses eyght kyng pers regned two monethes tyme plato born hym fogodyanus regned nyne monethes darius thus surname tenth kyng perses regned xix yere gaufr alfr time belinus mo •• uncius sone regned brytayn helde hym self loegria myddel englond wale cornewayle toke lande yonde humbre scotland brother brenicius tweyne acorded kyngdome fyue yere wel ynowe • afterward brenicius rebelle belinus belinus ouercome hym • fledde duc alebrog duc lytil brytayne • wedded doughter lorship duke deth· ducherie one yere came brytayn frensshemen brytons lytel brytayne werre ayēst broder theyr moder full old spradde hir heeabrode shewed brestes sowked made pee yere thes bretheren made fraunce subgett ouercome germayns besieged rome atte la • e tyme first denys vsed tyranny scicilia furius canullus made dictatour rome ouercome venetans falystes put cyte enuye surmysyng vpon hym egaly departed • rayes taken titus whan romaynes beseged vegetens hadde many vnhappes furius camillus myned one side cyte made wayes vnder •• whiche weyes knyght went toke tour cyte furius camillus yafe assaute cyte side whan men cyte sawe yelded self cyte furius camillus offended people delynge prayes ¶ callyd iuggemēt • drad condempned outlawed hym self wylfully wente cyte ardea netheles absence condempned ten thousand certayne money bra afterward came brake siege frensshemen ¶ capitulum 18· artaxerses sonne darius ꝑa • itides surname· menuon hebrewes callyd hym assuerus xj kyng pers regned fourty yere inde ethiopia· ouer honderd prouynces xxvij trone cyte susis cyte called susis called egbatanis boke iudith chyef cyte elemytes iosephus sayth danyel made wonder buryel kynges· wonderful semede made day say kynges medium perses perchea wonte buryed buryel artaxerses otherwyse callyd assuerus thyrd yere kyngdome made grete reuel feste prynces dured honderd dayes thre score ten wonderful palais redeth thistory alysaundre pyllers palays siluer keueryng lyke firmament chambred hauyng precious stone dyuerse colour lykenesse sterres ¶after lay peple seuen dayes orchard lykynge vyne yerde vynes seluer braunches gold clustres precious stone pauilons pighte vpon pilers siluer marble iuory roopes whyte sylk reed ¶there vasty quene rebell wold come kyng therfor hester chosen quene stede democritus philosopher dyed tyme agellus speketh hym sayth putt owne eyen thre skylles ¶ first sight lette hym holy thoughtes· second hee myghte see woman withoute grete temptacion thirdde sawe shrewes ofte mysdo deden euyl dedes myght suffre greued hein soore tullius ep 95 democritus wonte say hestes shrewes noyes wombe ben one place haue therwith sayd whether noyse sowne vpward downward ¶ pol̄ libro septimo ¶socrates philosopher four score yere old xix dranke poyson stydfast semblaunt dyed ¶ r leste erroure befall name socrates take hede thre socrates one auctour doyng dedes cassiodorus thistory callyd tripertita preyseth well socrates ¶ selencus theodoricus socrates made story another socrates grece grete philosopher lawer ¶of hym libro primo saturnalium rehersed noble sawe whan prayed felawes putte forth somwhat noble spekyng saide place axeth spareno spech spech spare couenable place nouther tyme▪ ¶ suche tale told ipocras philosofre thyrd socrates platoes maystrer hym speche tyme pol libro quarto capitulo sexto socrates reputed wysest answer appolyn withoute ony withsayenge passed seuen wysemen holden wysemen among grekes acompted bifore hem comparison wytte connynge also maner good lyuing· therfor tullius libro primo de tuscul̄ qō seith socrates prynce philosophye called philosophie heuen vnto erth stuffed cytees philosophie augustinus de ciuitate dei libro octauo capitulo 14 ¶ spyryte folowed socrates taught hym thynges ¶apuliꝰ libro suo 1 de di socrates saith reherseth spiryte vsed warne socrates leue doyng whan doyng shold haue good ende r therfor calcidius super librum thimei sayth spyryte folewed taught socrates first childhode compelle ought forbede doo thynge spedeful· adremes semeth man herith many thynges veray voys somme token folowed thoffyce mannes vois socrates thought waking comforted taught warning clere token spyryte tullius de diō • libro primo haue lerned socrates alway tendaunt spyryt cleped demon neuer moeued hym doo dedes withdrewe hym ofte fro doyng dedes therfor whan sholde dampned deth chees deye moost rightful maner· tho token yeuen hym god ¶ valerius libro primo capitulo septimo ¶ socrates old age vsed harpyng armonye strenges sayd better vse crafte late lerne neuer wold also take hede arte musik art right nedeful sayd ¶and soo hield hym self euer poure lerne ryche teche· ¶ though wyse wytty euer sayde coude noo good therof came comune sawe socrates ieronimus reherseth epistola 35 valeriꝰ li 8 socrates shamed take rehed bytwene thyes· playe smal childer pol̄ libro octauo ¶it homely necessary wyseman pleye putte away vse vertues refresshe hym self make moore stronge doo vertues vertues ¶also socrates profytable vertues maketh men lyke god man good temprure agell sayth libro secundo wele nygh al lyues tyme lyued helth withoute sekenesse also moreyne tyme destroyed cyte athene therfor valerius libro secundo seyth socrates saide many men wold lyue ete drynke wold ete drynke lyue also grete suffraū ce therfore seneca libro tercio de ira sayth socrates walked cyte euyl smyten vpon heed answerd sayde nought ellys sayde euyl men wytte ¶whan shold goo oute salettes heedes whan withoute also whan yong man spytte face whyle disputed wrath answerd sayde wroth doute whether shold wroth noo also somtyme wroth shrewed seruaunt sayde wold bete wroth ¶also wyf lyght hir body sayth comyne childer rebell horelinges moore lyke moder fader seruaunt alway shrewe alwaye wroth grutchyng ¶netheles socrates suffred alway paciente ¶therfor seneca epistola 197 seyth socrates wel nygh alway bataylle owther tyrannyse· owther fredome harder bataylle owther tyrannyse therfore ieronimus contra ionium also epistola 33 seith socrates twey shrewde wyues wolden alway chide stryue hadden ofte stryf hym bitwene hem wynes callyd zantippa altipias tyme blamed hem cause stryuē hym fowle thynge sayde ye stryue man snatted nose balled fort • p •• ery shulders croked thyes atte laste wyues torned ayenst hym chidden alto scarthes one assente· grete chidynge dispytous wordes threwe heede theyr pisse foure nyghtes pissynge oute soler answerd nought ellys wypte heede sayde wyste wele shold rayne thondryng wordes agellus libro secundo et pol libro 5 one axed socrates chastysed wyf· zantippa ful chidynge anger el pute h • r away hyme sayde suffre suche one home haue vse customme maye moore paciently suffre wronges men seneca de ira capitulo tercio token wrath socrates lowe speche fewe wordes true trusty counseylle valerius libro octauo seyth yong man axed counseyll socrates whether shold wedde wyf whether thou thes tweyn seith thou shalt forthynke ful soore yf thou wedde wyf thou shalt haue disauauntages· thou shalt allone thou shalt haue child straunge man shal thyne heyr thou wedde wyf thou shalt haue grete besynesse alwaye many maner playntes plee doyng despysyng chidyng stryf thy wyues dame vnsekernesse drede thy childers ende ¶and seneca epistola 30 pol libro septimo ¶ one axed socrates pilgrimagis stode hym noo prouffyte wonder sayth socrates thou berist thy self alwaye aboute cause greueth maketh goo hoome· profyteth newe lande flyghte fleeth disease thought must putte awaye el shal place plese also poli libro quinto capitulo sexto ¶ one axed hym sholde gete hym best fame ¶ doth beste sayd speketh lytel also poli libro septimo plawes scolers hadden enuye plato socrates scole plato axed socrates myght escape enuye enuyous men moost wretche sayd man shal enuye thyng withoute enuye wrechednesse allone ysidorꝰ eth libro secundo capitulo decimo quarto ¶this socrates ordeyned first morall philosophie rulyng good lyuyng right wysenesse temprure vertues redynesse ¶augustinus de ciuitate dei libro octauo socrates turned first al maner philosophie helpe good lyuynge good maners know whether dyde ouercome greef hardnesse derk vncertayne thynges fynde som̄e certein man lif man myght better owther mannes soule sholde better discharged vnskylful lykynge· borne vp kynde strengthe knowe thynges euer shall laste sowle may· knowe chief cause thynges· whan pured made al cleene socrates whan • e deyde lefte many disciple lyue disputed many wyse last ende hym best alle scolers plato chyef seneca epistola 107 speketh cause maner socrates deth socrates sayd lyef swere creature goddes ¶ leyde ayenst ayenst lawe· appeyred childer therfore dampned prisonne· shold ete venym called fermacum augustinus de vera religione capitulo primo socrates • hardyer sweryng sayth wold swere handes stone wold swere redy mynde trowe vnderstode al werkes kynde god ordeyned wrought worchynge god wele better ony crafty mannes werkes therfore worthy take worshipes longeth god· mawmettes worshipped temple r ¶ therfore expositour vpon boece de disciplina capitulo quarto seyth one socrates dtsciples accused hym made book one god many goddes ¶ therfore compellyd drynke venemous herbe goddes name drank deyde efte compellyd drynke name many goddes drank deyde ¶therfor tullius wryteth dampned men athene sory punysshed hem soore hadde accused hym maden ymage gold resemblyng remembraunce socrates and· sette theyr temple ¶also commentor eth 5 seyth socrates whan accused seyde· men athene maye dampne socrates maye make hym vnrightful athene began vse four twenty lettres vsed bifore sixtene eutr eaufr ¶ capitulum 19 frensshmen otherwyse called senones ledyng brennius ouercome romayns enleuen myle fro rome att • ryuer albia chasede hem vnto cyte toke cyte vnto capitoyl titus liuius frensshmen came nyght wey vnder erth euery romayns slepte mallius torquatus romayns awaked cryenge gandres firste daye iunij put frensshmen ¶therfore longe tyme romayns halowed feste gandres first daye iunij netheles afterward called feste iunoes moneth· trowed iuno warned gandres made hem crye ¶ fightynge senatours arrayed hem ryally araye senatours soo sate theyr howses ¶and whan frensshe men founde hem syttynge soo ryall araye· wende goddes c • eped genij spared hem wente bakward treuisa ¶ god genius say spyryte foloweth man al liues tyme foloweth thistory netheles one frensshemen groped handled berde senatour called papirius vp staf hand smote frenssheman heede therfor al frensshmen wroth slough hym first alle senatours euery one ¶ frenssmen receyued thousand pound gold pee wente theyr way furius camillus rather putte oute cyte pursued frensshemen slough hem· brought gold iewels knyghtes cyte agayne ¶and camillus thyrdde viage wente cyte ayene callyd second romulus besieged somtyme falisces capitayne hem ladde oute childer cyte playe yaue hem camyllus sayd cyte sholde yolden sauyng childre ¶and camyllus forsoke fraude bounde capitains handes behynde hym lete dryue hym yerdes sente hyin childer faders moders courtoys dede cyte yelden desired gete fraude treson trogus libro 24 ¶thre honderderd thousand frenssmen ledyng belgius brennius destroyed ytaly brent rome spoylled pannonie macedon slowe tholomeus kyng macedonia paulus libro secundo seyth cause frēsshmen came italy ¶ frensshmen tasted wyne brought oute ytaly moeued lykynge wyne went italy ¶ leder hem brennius regned amonge frensshmen senones· cam thre honderd thousand sente honderd thousand spoyll grekes netheles fast appolyn delphicus essayed felt grekes hadden ful sharp swerdes kene another honderd thousand wēt galacia lasse asia first called gallogreci galates ¶the thyrdde honderd thousand left italy bylde papie melane pergame brixia ārimi· yaue name ffraū ce syde alpes cleped gallia ¶ treuisa burgoyne countrey called gallia senonensis ¶pol libro sexto capitulo decimo galli frensshmē ytalye bylde veron vincencia ¶also bylde cyte cene olde men sekelew theyr heordes kepte beestes ¶that wytnessith yet lykenesse fayr hewe colour fayr shap peple acorde brytons galles frensshmen though longe passynge tyme place countray world companye men dwelle aboute hem haue chaunged hem many poyntes gaufe ¶belinus torned agayne oute ytaly britayne lyued pee repayred bylde cytees amonge whiche founded cyte caerusk called caerle vpon ryuer vske nygh seuarne ¶ bylde belius gate englysshmen callen byllyngsgate vpon temyse cyte trinouantum london ¶and bylde tour aboue yate therinne askes body done whan body brente made also lawes four highe wayes sayde firse book capitulo brytania ¶ trogus libro 24 efte brennius tourned ayene oute eest countrees efte ouercome macedoyns theyr duc sosten spoylled goddes temple sayd meryly rych goddes must yeue men somwhat rychesse ¶also spoylled appolyn delphicus temple hille mount pernasus pol libro sexto men countray prayde help god sodaynly erthe gan shake grete partye hille felle vpon hoost galles haylestones slough dele ¶ duc brennius soore woundes might endure therfor slough self sharp swerde ¶ man shal wondre though appolyn toke wreche hem spoylled goddes temple god suffred appolyn destroye many nacions cause trespaas euyl lyuyng dedes certayn spirites ayer may vse shrewdnes hem mysbyleuyd euyl dedes grace withdrawe maner men euyl spyrytes haue leue graunted noye hem gre • e hem eutropius ¶ capitulum 20 office dignyte chaunged amonge romaynes stede twey consul made trybunes cheualrye power consul tho began prouffyte rome tencreace dignyte dured longe r· aboute tyme dyogenes philosopher prospered iosephus pol libro suo septimo seyth dyogenes anaximines disciple ieronimus libro suo contra ioninianum seyth tistenes socrates disciple trowe sothly seneca valerius seyne dyogenes grete alysaundres tyme regned long anaxagoras yf ther many dyogenes dyuers tymes ther many socrates ieronimus contra ioninianum dyogenes vsed double mantel colde scrip stede celer· staff lene dwellyd yates outgoyng yates knowleched soth yche side toke heede lyf men passed wey many maners men stanke semed whan punysshed hym self tonne yet game hows moeued ¶ torned mouth tonne toward south cold time toward north somer tyme euer sonne dyogenes hows torned thyderward ¶valerius libro quarto capitulo tercio ¶alysaū der macedo came hym syttyng soo tonne bade axe somwhat hym wolde sayd dyogenes thou woldest lette sonne therof came bysawe alysaunder myght lyghtlyer putte darius trone oute kyngdome dyogenes oute state vertue ¶ r seneca libro quinto de benefycijs seyth dyogenes myghtyer rycher alysaunder· ffor ther moore wold receyue alysaunder myght yeue thēne alysaunder ouercome foūde mā might nought yeue myght take dyogenes right nought ¶seneca epistola 94 et ieronimus contra ¶ dyogenes bare scrippe dysshe tree drynke of· sawe childe drynke pawme hande braake disshe anone sayd long shal foole bere superflue fardel wyste rather kynde crafte drynkynge alway drank water pawme hande neuer abated countenaunce neyther thought euer mishappes befel neuer chaūged semblaūt thought neuer disease neyther fortune chaunged neuer purpoos sorowe neyther meschyef sayde falleth philosophre chaunge wytte happe fortune deth shewed vertuous continent whan old wente tornemente olimpe taken feuer waye laye den theway frendes wold haue caryed then beest chare wold assente wente shadow tree sayd pray go ye hen cesse nyght shal essaye whether shal ouercome ouercomen ouercome feuer shal come tornament yf feuer ouercome shall go downe helle leyde downe heede neck al nyght· shewed wold dye· also wold putte ouer feure deth caas gyled ensample oppynyon noble men wold gladly dye help owne deth trowe cleped helle state sowle deth body ¶ valerius libro 4 capitulo 3 ¶dyogenes weded wortes vpon tyme one aristippus sayde hym yf thou woldest vse flatery denys kyng thou ne shulde nede wede wortes ¶and▪ answerde yf thou woldest ete wortes thou woldest flater denys also dyogenes disputed tyme wrath one spy • ce face sayde wroth doute whether shold wroth noo seneca de ira libro tercio dyogenes pleted one cause one lentulus spetted threwe ropy spotel face wyped face sayd shal say al begyled say thou hast noo mouth ¶ pol libro octauo ¶ one behilde dyogenes sayde thou hast right wanton gygly eyen wherfor disciple wolde haue beten man lyer lete felawes sayde dyogenes suche one kynde refreigne vertue ¶ r iuuenal libro 4 satira prima wryteth dyogenes wolde wepe whan went openly among men demed al sawe wretchednesse woo democritus dide contrary lough vhen went openly oute amonge men helde al sawe ny • sty fooly libro de dictis philosophorum one fowlest al men shewed hows dyogenes hows wonderly plesaunt welbesene dyogenes spytte mannes face men axed dyd soo answerd sayde saw noo soo foule place hows face also axed hym vsed berde ¶a woman sayd berded vnsemely syght ¶ one sayd hym one frendes spoken euyl hym ¶i doute sayd yf fr • nde haue sayde suche wordes openly knowen thou hast thynge sayde ¶treuisa ¶it wonder dyogenes vsed lewed sophistry maketh noo difference bytwene lyer hym accused lyer warned men lesynges ¶it one speke euyl mā warne hym man speke euil hym rehe • ce euyl sayd ¶ seynt iohan gospel sayde deuyl crist iewes sayde deuyl criste crist hym self despysed god reherseth men bere hand despysed god ¶than folo • weth thystory also one sayd al men despysed sayd wytte wysedom must despysed foly whan euyl spekers blame missaye man· sheweth right good hem myssayde tullius libro primo de tusculis questione ¶dyogenes whan shold dye bade sholde buryed throwen lette lygge felde owther vpon hille ¶ frendes sayden shold eten beestes fowles nay quod laye • aff may therwith kepe hem away ¶ wherto sayd frendes thou shalt fele sayd etyng bee • te shal greue whan shal fele ¶ capitulum 21 denys tyraunt kynge scicile dyed yong denys toke kyngdome ¶ valerius libro quarto amon phiceas two frendes denys wolde nedes slee one hem ¶and one axed respyt • e certayne daye myghte meane tyme dispose goodes cataylle toke felawe tyraunt plegge daye came man came therfore denys demed other· vnwyse pledge ¶ nethelesse come atte houre sette· ¶ tirant wondred foryaue hym deth prayde might one felawes ¶tullius de tusculis qō one damocles denys frende praysed denys royalte rich said ther neuer man soo grete welth· ¶wiltow saide denys essay fortune welth graunted denys made
