aray bedde gold ryche table rychely besene grete plente • ynteous mete drynke noble seruā te redy swete songes myrth ynowe amonge bade hang bright swerde sharp euen aboue heede hors heer poynt downward euen heedewarde whan toke none hede alle likyng drede swerd denys sayd suche lyf thou holdest lyf welth ioye ¶ valerius libro sexto ¶whan men siracusanes desired prayd deth denys tyraunt cruelte old wydue hir last elde god prayed denys lyf helth whan wyst therof wondred good wylle woman axed hir moeued soo pray ¶whan seyd yong wenche ouersette tyraunt desired delyuerd hym ¶and whan slayn one wors helde kyngdome whan dede thyrd worst alle· therfor lest wors thou come wolde yeue myne heede lyf saue thy lyf thyne helthe tullius de officijs libro secundo ¶ denys kynge vsed barbour shaue berde drad barbours rasours ful soore sweled heer beerde fyre ¶this denys tyme came temple many ymages clothed gold toke away gold hem sayde besyde clothyng heuy somer cold wynter ¶ efte toke crown oute ymages hande mercurye sayde lo ye see wel take thynge profrith wylle tyme aristotle eyghtenth yere age lerned mayster plato ¶ nectanabus kyng egypte began regne regned nynetene yere ¶ pol libro quinto ¶furius camyllus duc romayns dyed byfore made mynde grete dedes ¶ gaufr alfr ¶ aboute tyme gurgunaus kynge brytons belyns sonne came oute denemarche warned hym trybute· wont payed hym ¶ fonde ilandes orchades xxx shippes ful men basclenses theder dryuen oute spayne side sente hem duc bartholomew irlond tho voyde inhabyte r loke herof first book capitulo hibernia ¶ capitulum 22 othus otherwyse called artaxerses xij kynge pers regned xxv yere tyme whā furiꝰ camyllꝰ dede among romayns ther fell grete pestylence among soo myddel cyte erth opened grete chynne waye helle atte laste dyuynours sayden waye helle abode buryenge quyck man ¶ marcus cursius hors man rome saue cyte armed wente clyffe· soo clyf closed mene tyme romaynes faught ayenst galles ffrensshemen destroied ytalye one galles proferd fyghte one mā body fordy lucius malliꝰ faught hym slough hym toke byce gold neck dyde aboute owne toke surname euermore hym ofsprynge cleped torquatus man byse byse torque latyn· ¶ augꝰ de ci de li 5 ca· 18· seyth torquatus slough owne sone foughten contray wonne vyctory· slough foughten ayēst faders heest lest dede shold haue ensample harme despyte empyre worship shold deth enemye philip kyng macedonia holden alysaunders fader began regne regned xxvj yere tyme demostenes aduocate fairest speker al prospered wente tyme fayr strompet called layes corynth lay axed hym yefte clepeth nūmū quantum demostenes gretely moeued lust sayde wold bye dyer sory forthynk dede pol libro sexto ¶ nummum quantum maketh x pen worth half greter talentum worthy xx thousand pen trogus val li· 8 demostenes aduocate besy putte al maner lette speche noman spake cleere he· though hadde wel smal voyx netheles vsed soo noble sownyng speche axed hym ofte mooste spedefull among wyse men sayd moost spedeful knouleche nought ¶me tellyth hym spake moche longe tyme hadde stone mouthe whan stone oute mouth voyde moore redy speke ¶agellus messagers moloses came athene firste day plee demostenes pleted ayenst hem withstode hem ¶on morow stopped moneye shold speke ayenst hem thyrdde daye whan cause sholde pleted demostenes come forth wolle aboute neck sayd squynacie therfor mighte speke ayenst moloses one cryed sayd squynacy siluery hym ayleth ¶ demostenes afterward told acompted grete worship axed aristodimus mede taken plede hem talentum sayd sayd demostenes wele hold pee valerius libro septimo twey mē taken money woman kepe ordeyned woman shold delyuer money neyther hem self bothe geder long tyme • e came sayd felawe deed begyled woman moneye hir longe felawe came axed moneye woman pursued hard greuously demostenes cam helped hir maner said lette hem come geder axe hir money ordeyned whan money taken hir kept moneye shal payed rather cam neuer geders woman quytte yꝰ li 1 ca 31· kyng philip besieged cyte athene axed x wyse mē cyte deliuer wold goo awaye ye cyte besiege lēger demostenes counseiled nay told fable wolues somtyme proferd frendship shepherdes condiciō shepherdes sholde delyu hoūdes wolues dogges sayd make varyaunce bytwyx v wherupon shepherdes delyuerd hem houndes ¶ wolues whan strength warde houndes away slough deuowred shepe owne wylle ¶so sayd wold philippe destroye cyte yf lacked wyse men counsayle ¶ othus kyng pers torned iewes hircania ¶ grete alysaunder born macedonia denys slayn siracusa ¶ romayns ouercomē galles whiche fyghtynge one galles axed marcus valerius tribune rome fight hym singler bataylle body body ¶ faught rauen sate vpon right shulder valerius alway smote eyen frensshman soo romayn gate vyctorye name afterward cleped coruinus rauen coruus latyn coruinus consul four twenty yere dede pol libro septimo ¶ capitulum 23 plato philosopher died whā lyued lxxxx yere grete reuerence doubted long deth whether shold acompted among goddes owther amōg half goddes ¶ plato moost excellent among socrates disciple callyd plato brode breste brode space bytwene browes ¶ plato grewe latum latyn broode englysshe ¶ plato borne athene ¶ tullius de di libro primo capitulo decimo sexto ¶ plato child laye cradel slepte bee sate lippes dyuynours sayde shold shyne swetnesse eloquence ¶ valerius libro primo capitulo quarto ¶ nyght plato sette socrates loore demed swan lay knee ¶ pol li septimo plato first loore lettrure taught denys wrastling ariston argus dispysed crafte puture feyned self profytable diuinacions gestes trust endytyng tellyngys olde wyues vse wold become fyghtyng man socrates forbade hym valerius li 8 ca· 7· socrates dyed atte laste plato torned loore hem folowed pyctagoras loore worshipped hem connynge also contynent ¶after went theodorus cyrenensis lerned gemetry • wente egypt lerne astronomye pol libro septimo ¶and many wene le lerned prophecyes prophetes· aōcpting tymes suffrith tyme prophetes austyn li 8 de ci ca 11 seyth plato born aboute honderd yere deth ieremye prophete aboute sixty yere deth bookes prophetes cam egypt tyme king tholomeus pylgremage plato· plato myght see ieremias dede long tyme bifore nowther rede bookes prophecye yet translate grue netheles many thynges foūde platoes bookes acordeth sawes prophetis ¶austyn libro 16 ca 20 libro confessionū ante finem sayth seynt iohannes gospel founden platoes bokes vnto place tenebre cam non comprehenderūt say derknes knewe light ¶ thapostle sayd suche philosophres vanysshed awaye thoughtes wold trowt yt wreton bookes holy faders plato departed egypte came ytaly folowed carentinus articus helde pyctagoras loore· ¶ th •• wold haue goon vnto indes medes couth nygromancye wytchecraft werre caldee lette hym passe therfore whan founde ceno permenydes abode hem gadred sawes shrewes remoeued thre connyngys scicilia dyuers oppynyons· sōme meoued came see thystory kynde reason brennyng montayne ethna second sayd came atte prayer denys tyraunt holde cyt • ciracusa teche theyr lawe iij sayd cam reconsile one dyon countray foryeuenesse grace geten denys ¶ieronimuscontra ion plato • iche condiciō tyme ¶and dyogenes foule feete trade bedde wel besene ¶ plato chees lytel towne callyd achademia myle athene towne ofte pestylence erth shakyng therfor chees dredefull place suche dredeful happes sholde withdrawe scolers temptacion lechery scolers shold feele none liking thynges shold lerne ¶marc libro tercio ¶ plato sayd ther twey dethes one deth sowle forsaketh body deth soule body forsaketh despiseth bodyly lykingges wrath angre vnskylful doynges shold philosophres desire ¶ seneca de ira libro tercio ¶ plato one wroth seruaunte heete hym doo kertill make sholders naked bare whan vnderstode wroth helde hand stode wold smyte ¶ one frendes pseusippus axed hym stode soo dyd thought answerd sayde aboute punysshe man wroth worthy punysshed pray sayd bete thou seruaunt lest bete hym nedeth cause wrath noo man power owne power ¶r helmande saide plato vsed title bookes name maystrys shold auctoryte outher name scolers wel loued pol libro septimo seyth men tellen plato dyed shame coude assaylle question shipmen trowe better soth homerus maximus sayth ofte thes twey men ben • ken eyther stede grete wytte wysedome noble spekynge also breede brestes certayn noble men worthy hadden many names· pol li • philosophres cheped zenofontini hadde grete enuye platoes connynge loo feyned suche tale ¶ flamanus philosopher libro de vestygijs philosophorum sayth though many men tellen plato yelde vp goost wylfully derk meanynge nombre whan hadde fulfylled yeres age nine sythes nyne four score one valerius libro nono capitulo decimo tercio ¶ homerus myght assoylle question dyed shame sorowe r ¶gregorius nauzauzenus vpon worde apostle wysedome world foly bifore god sayd plato walked vpon see clyf biheld heuen shipmen saw hym lough hym scorne haue ye sayde ¶ answerd sayde alle haue taken haue nought al haue nought take haue ¶ low • ed theyr clothes slayne al myght take soo nought hadde taken ¶ plato thought fysshe wondred ete nought ne slepte made hym soo besye fynde solucion question soo dyed ¶ valerius libro quarto ¶plato herde telle disciple zenocrates hadde spoken moche euylle hym gretely despysed hym ¶ netheles plato toke none heede complaynte· iugge axed yaf credence tale yeul feyth vnto sayth plato hym haue loued long loued also iugge sware hadde herd suche tale zenocrates mouth plato answerd sayde zenocrates wold neuer telle suche tale semed spedeful suche tale telle valerius libro septimo ¶ plato stede cam sister sonne pseusippus zenocrates platoes scoler loued wele scole callyd achademia therfore came politinus porphirius apuleius affer hadde name scole callyd achademici hadde name plato cleped platonici valerius libro decimo zenocrates redde fayr comyn womā athene receyued mede vndertoke make hym lie came nyght laye hym bedde myghte manere wyse make hym abate chastyte yonglynges scorned hir myght abate philosophres chastyte ¶ made couenaunt sayd ymage man ieronimus contra ioninianum ¶ zenocrates lefte men athene thre hestes tricolinus lawes worship fader moder herie goddes ete flesshe also • dictes philosophres wreton zenocrates sawe one ladde hanged lough sayde gretter theues punysshe lasse ¶ valerius li 6 fine also one pollemo otherwise called pollemius yong mā athene full lecherous lykynge ioye euyl doyng also hadde grete ioye euyl loo mysfame ¶ tyme come feste goynge doun sonne sonne ry • syng went home sawe zenocrates yate open wyne dronken enoynted oynementes aparaild garlandes ryally clothed entred scole maner ful noble doctours sette hym downe scorne▪ fayr speche doctours dronkenesse atte laste euery man indignacion hym zenocrates chaūged semblaūt lefte matier spake torned speche matier sobrenes pacience suffraunce resonable fayr noble speche· polemiꝰ compellid take hede first drough hym arme held stoutly withoute mantell threwe downe garlād heede atte laste forsoke al euyl lykyng soo fowle boller goloton made grete philosopher ¶ pol libro septimo et augustinus de ciuitate de • libro nono capitulo vndecimo ¶ capitulum 27 plato come aristotle noble man fame lore grete wytt· netheles noble speker plato passed many men thoffyce techynge connyng crafte fayr vtteraunce shewyng sey mannes sētences brought vp secte called paripatetica· vsed dispute wandryng walkynge plato lyued aristotle gadred many disciple heresye made bookes al maner philosophie yaue certeyn hestes rule al maner philosophie ¶ netheles passyng al brought logyk right lawe ¶ called philosophre berith price philosophres· rome called cyte· maro poete soo aristotle philosophre ¶ netheles somme men trowed fendes sonne swyper swyfte clere wytte desired grete worship many manere sleyghtes· vsed wynne toke worship bifore alle men alexander de natura ¶aristotle amonge taught eloquence fayr noble speche specially seen comentes homeris dyte troye whiche bytoke alysaunder dyalogus poetes tretice rethori que ¶aristotle xviij yere old sente athene lerned socrates thre yere whan socrates dede plato xx· yere till plato dyed grete fauour plato plato callyd aristotle hows redyng hows wolde ofte say go reders hows ¶ whan aristotle absente plato wolde crye vnderstandyng awaye audience deef lyued platoes deth xxiiij yere ¶somtyme techyng alisaunder somtyme wending aboute hym many landes somtyme makyng bookes somtyme techyng disciple lyued al lxiij yere ¶he made alysaunder buylde ayene cyte stagerik philip destroyed beten doune therfor men cyte haloweth fest daye worship aristotle feste called aristotileya moneth feste halowed in· clepe stagerites aristotle dyed calcide brought stagerik whan alysander wēt ayēst perses aristotle besy aboute philosophye made historye two honderd fyfty lawes aristotle put many thynges philosophye ethyk science thewes put parfyt welthe wordly rychesse ¶ also philosophye put fyfth beynge ¶ treuisa libris de celo et mundo bookes also aristotle clepeth welken firmamente aboue four elementes fyfth body ¶than foloweth storye withdrewe nothyng diuynyte made problemes dycynale phisik kynde four score bookes problemes perspectyue methaphisik ¶treuisa probleme question harde assoylle also hard redels also cleped probleme ¶ perspectyf science specially longeth sighte science techeth howe thynge seen lasse owther semeth owther euen moche semeth euen croked right wyse shapen semeth ¶ foloweth thistorye· made statute iustefie cytees grece whiche statute philip determyned made ende plees bytwene grekes lefte sonne nychomachus doughter pitharda ful many disciple among whiche theofrastus grete name made booke de nupcijs spousayls aristotle made thousand bookes loued folowe truth forsake thing openly knowen auicenna preyseth wel libro tercio methapharo suo raby moyses li· 1 capitulo 4 agellus li 8 capitulo tercio iohan suo policrato li septimo meoued archademia strength resons moeued strong blastes wynde thurgh besynes achademici lefte plato moeued doubtes wele nygh al thynges ¶also plynius libro suo seyth grete alysaundre brente couetyse knowleche kynde beestes sente aristotle many thousandes men grece asia tracia fedde beestes fowles wyld tame al taken haukyng owther huntyng al maner beestes kepyng hyues layes fysshe weres pondes ffor wold know thynge brought forth kynde aristotle examyned al hem besyly made aboute fyfty volume kynde beestes therfor plinius de naturis recū libro secundo seyth sommen tellen aristotle made bookes shortly soo hard enuye veyne glorye ¶ say made bookis maner vse studiētes science axeth science aboute thynge good harde knowe treuisa ¶here take heede al thynge hath lyf felyng cleped beest foloweth thystory aristotle whan shold dye bad subtyll bookes shold buryed hym graue come hym shold haue proufyt therof wote vertue kynde owther crafte saye wondre wytchecraft sepulcre hath soo appropred place aboute noman maye come nowe place somme men say antecrist shal know place loke see bookes hid dar trowe thynges doubte vncertayn deth arystotle gg nauzauzenꝰ tretice vpon worde apostel wysedome foly bifore god sayd grece place callyd black brygge· see ebbith floweth one place aristotle came wold knowe cause bihelde toke heede long tyme coude fynde cause why· grete indignacion spake water sayde maye comprehende take thou shalt take felle water dreint self ¶treuisa wonder gregorius nauze • zenꝰ tellith soo madde magyl tale soo worthy prynce philosophres aristotle telleth aristotle declareth matier ebbynge flowynge see secundo meth tellyth wreton book appel howe aristotle dyed helde appel hande hadde comforte sinelle taughte scolers howe shold lyue come god god withouten ende ¶and atte laste hande began quake apple f • lle downe hande face wax al pale soo aristotle yelde vp goost dyed foloweth thystorye aristotle successour theofrastus hadde name noble spekyng god sayth mayster thistoryes supli math ¶this theofrastus made book de nupcijs wedlok called booke theofrastus aureolus disputeth clerely teene anguysshe wedded men ¶ ieronimus talketh moche book ayenst ioninianus ¶ theofrastus made another booke frendship putteth preferreth frendship al thinges men ¶me sayth theofrastus accused kynde yafe lenger lyf beestes mankynde ¶ ther sayde spedeful frendes loue wele assaye hem loue also wryten louyng men haue blynde dome ¶ eutropius ¶ capitulum 25 romaynes ordeyned bataille ayenst sampnytes bytwene campania apulia haue armoure gold siluer ¶ cause bataylle lande campania best lande moost pleyne ¶the chyef cyte therof capna peer rome cartage gretenesse plente ¶than lucius papirius dictatour oratour rome sent ayenst sampnytes • rnede ayene rome bade quintus fabius mayster horsmen shold fyght way netheles quintus sawe founde occasion faughte spedde wel skomfyte sampnytes cause therof dictator dampned foughten ayenst heest absence ¶ netheles delyuerd saued grete fauour knyghtes peple ¶and soo grete stryf arered ayenst papirius • opardy lyf afterward place callyd furcule cādeꝰ sāpnytes romaynes closed narow wayes streyte ouercome hem grete shame hem leuer kepe hem lyue shame shenship slee hem closed made hem caste armour clothee goo longe rewe vnder hille syde hadde hem condiciō whiche condiciō yf romaynes holden bē deed owther bonde men sampnytes titus liuiꝰ ¶ duc leder sampnytes called poncius hadde ord •• gned hoost besides furcule candynes romaynes shold passe place closed hilles eyther side hath playne myddel bytwene highe landes streyte entre strayte oute goyng poncius sent somme knyghtes b • fore clothed heordes kepen beestes shold answere hoost romaynes wold passe axe sampnytes knyghtes answer sampnytes passed besiege cyte callyd lucrecia comfedred romayns whan romayns herd anon went swyftly valey furcule spede hem socour cyte besieged mene tyme sampnytes knyghtes hewe downe tree stopped entre outegoynge valey wente toppes hilles soo romaynes compellyd meschyef axe pee sampnytes owther batayll knyghtes ¶ poncius duc answerd sayde batayll done graunted pee vpon condicion romaynes sholde yelde vp clothyng armour goo al naked sauf preu • e membres long rewe vnder hille side yelded vp pleggys thre hond • rd horsmen romaynes ¶t entr yere folowed heest senatours dictator •• cius papirius scomfyted sampnytes ¶orocius libro tercio vyctory ther felle grete pestylence rome deth lyghtnyng alle cyte made sorowe dede men seke loked bookes sibylle wyse toke counseylle sente epydauru cyte grece haue mawmette ymage esculapius· feyned god medycyne sheweth worshipper lykenesse serpent item orocius ¶wyues rome brennyng wode loue toward owne husbandes made trowed drynkes loue yet drinkes veray poyson deth wenche knewe doyng warned senatours therof wyues compellid drynke vyolent poyson drynk many felle downe sodenly deed two hondred wyues seuenty may •• doyng dampned deth ¶ aboute tyme guytelynus gurguncius sonne regned brytayn· wyf marcia right connyng coude many maner craftes made lawe callyd marcene lawe r ¶loke herof first booke capitulo de legibus gaufr also marcia regned somwhat tyme hir husbandes deth hir regned sicillius hym kymarus dauius dauius morindus ful cruel atte laste beest deuoured hym ¶ capitulum 26 arsanius otherwyse callyd artaxerses othus sone xiij yere kynge perse regned four yere first yere iadus bisshop iewes prospred ¶philip kyng macedonia dede trayson one pansania trogus libro nono philip moore besy aboute dedes armes feestes yaue hym moore wynne rychesse kepe al robbed alway yet euer nedy loued mercy falseheed bothe lyke wel vntrusty speche wold behote wold perfourme couth feyne hym gracious wel apayed whan wroth wroth whan wel apayed vsed make wrath bytwene partyes gete thank eyther syde ¶ trogus libro septimo whan fyrste ouercomen men athene lette prysonners goo good wylle wedded olimpyada neoptholomeus kynges doughter moloses bigate hir grete alysaunder ¶ thes yaue assaute cyte mathona right eye smyton oute strook arowe wounde neuer slower fyght ne wrother enemy atte laste men yelde vp cyte mylde merciable hem al trogus libro octauo philip enemy mennes fredome nourysshed firyfe cytees helped lasse aiēst brought thraldō victor ou er come made hym ij brether kynges tracia subget putte querele arbytracion deme rightly bitwene hem make final pee ¶ made subget hym bardanes nacions suche maner fraude ¶he made wyues brother alysaunder yonglynge xx yere old vse f • rnicacion alwaye wolde haue hym afterward moore bounde hym seruyce ¶trogus libro 14 philip somtyme werred ayenst shi • e scomfyted hem gyle fraude vertu strength hym tyme twenty thousand childer woman beestes twenty thousande noble mare doo macedoyne haue somme manere newe men dwelle therin tyme torned tebans men thebe grece warned passage woū ded thigh wōderly soore thurgh thye hors slayne rode netheles scomfyted hem solempnely day vyctory semed neuer gladder chere owne men ne stierne hem ouer come sente ayen prysonners restored ayene thre honderd wysemen put oute al thes wyse men whan fyue hem accused trespas sayde al euen peres doyng dede yet philip arrayed hoost two honderd thousand fote men fyften thousand horsmen werre reame pers made one attalus duc leder hooste duke sister olympiada philippes wyf afterward put away forsake ¶ therfor whan philip sate atte feste spousayle without wardcorpses pansania noble yong man slough right ¶ cause therof this· atthalus dispitefully scorned pāsania done hym greete vylenye firste pryuely openly grete feste reuel complayned ofte philip despite atthalus done hym none amēdes· therfor tourned wrath wroth philippe slough hym maner vengeance dede ¶ olimpiada philippes wyf alysaunder philippes sonne hadde suspection holden gyltles dede ¶ olimpiada forsaken· alysaunder despyte done moder specially philip ofte repreued sone alysander moder forsakē oft point rese hym swerde therfor alysander exiled dwellyd vncle epyrus treuisa lande tracia somtyme land epyrotes foloweth thystory hanged afterward pansania crowned olympyada gold brente aftward hir body vpon hir husbandes body treuisa knoweth crony que right knoweth vsed somtyme dyuers landes brenne noble bodyes whan deed kepe askes solēpnely reuerent place foloweth thystory hanged cleopatra atthalus sister ¶ philip somtyme warned saued self vyolence chariot therfor vndid charyottes chares kyngdome also auoyded withdrough place callyd chariot boecia come therinne ¶ netheles escaped pansanias swerde hilt swerde engrauen chariot ¶pol libro sexto capitulo sexto ¶while philip ordeyned hooste forbade al men al maner cariage gooth vpon wheles commaunded euery ten foote men bere aboute hem stone rope somer tyme made men bere meele flour quernes hir neck thyrtty dayes ¶ trogus libro primo ¶ capitulum 27 grete alysaunder whan fader dede· bygan regne fader macedonia xx yere age regned xij yere sex monethes gretter fader vyces vertues netheles fader wyser man counseylle sonne gretter man herte ¶ fader wold ofte kepe secrete ouercome owne wrath· sonne vsed seche loue nowther maner wreche eyther loued wel wine good deynkers fader wold slee enemyes sonne wold slee enemyes frendes ¶ fader wold loued sonne leuer drad one byleue fader yaue skylful largenes yeftes sonne yaue lechery vynceū libro quinto yere othus kynge pers xv philip kyng macedoine xij nectanabus kyng egypt xvij othus occupyed egypte put oute nectanabus· nectanabus drad werre bataylle wold araye gadre hoost· neyther ordeyne gynne werre wold go secretely pryuate place take basine clere water make shippes men wax lykenesse shippe see soo shold seme tho meoued alyue also wold take yerde fyrre holowe within pype wold speke holownesse yerde clepe goddes aboue bynethe soo wold founde drowne ship waxe basen soo shold byfalle drenchyng wax tapres brennynge enemyes sholde drenche see herde telle tyme indes perthes medes arabes nacions also conspyred ryse ayenst brake laughyng went doo craft vsed knew shold ouercome yf flyght might helpe him· anone bade shaue heed toke alle precious rich cam macedonia sayd astronomer philip kyng thoo oute countray occupyed werre nectanabus enchauntement fantastick feynyng gate suche loue quene olimpias laye hir lykenesse iupiter horned bygate grete alysander whan quene childe many foules flowe philip tho occupyed werre amonge fowles henne leyde egge philippes lap whan egge smyten lap grounde dragon lepte oute shelle crept aboute wold haue cropen shelle came oute dyed anone antiphon noble dyuynoure demaunded shold signefye answerd sayde philip shold haue sone borne shold goo world shold dye er came ayene dragon ryall beest egge hath shap world ¶afterward whan olimpias trauelyng child herde seene erth quakynge lyghtnyng thonder quintus curcius al • day sate twey egles vpon coppe hows boded sygnefyed twey grete empyres europa asia vyncen̄ child born named alysaundre fayre heier fayr eyen one yelowe another black ¶ ieronimus epistola 85 ¶ alysaundre might leue maners vyces lechery mayster leonydes whiche enfe • childe vsed hem whan lorde theworld ¶ therfor fader philip put away leonydes made aristotle alysaundres mayster ¶ seneca ¶alysaunder put leonydes afterward lyon deuouted ¶vincen̄ ¶ whan alysaunder twellif yere old hadde grete lykynge ioye hooste amonge men armes lepe hors vsed hym self right knyghtly day whan philip absente alysaundre prayd nectanabus wold teche hym crafte graunted whā cam geder depe water pytte· alysander threw witche pytte whan dede wounded axed alysaundre dide soo ¶ thy craft sayd alysaunder blame warned chaunge thou lyeste neuelyng sholdest telle thynges • heuen answerd sayde ¶ man maye flee owne desteny ¶ treuisa ¶ nectabanus sayde sawe wytche therfor neuir better̄ byleuid vyle shame cristen man byleue fals sawe wytche euery myshap man shape world falle yn god may saue yf wylle foloweth story nectanabus sayde know well craft myne owne sonne shold slee sayde alysaunder art thou fader told alysandre al thyng ordre stode dyed anon alisander ordeyned hym graue told moder al tyme philip toke gret thought shold heyre kyng hym answer appolyn delphicus euer myght ryde hors withoute falle hurtynge sholde heyre lord world alysander herde telle herof philippes hors called bucyfall right perillous bytyng· alwey kept cloos neyed roryng lyon netheles alysaunder toke hors mane ledde hym lept bak rode hym without hurting philip herde therof worshipped alysandre lord world therfor alisander xvj yere faught chariottes vyctorye wan cyte mathona fader loste whan cam hoome ageyne sawe messagers pers fader hows chalenge trybute wont haue land water seid alisaunder chalengith kynge pers elementes commune al men beestes bade darius leue cesse vnskylful gir top· homely special company myrthe alisandre herd swete harp kytte strenges sayde better kytte strenges hertes conceyued swete melodye herte shold moor torned likyng hardynesse ease cheualrye lechery vertu bestly liking manhode netheles historyes saiē antigonus brake harp alysander toke grete delyte saith befalleth thine age regne ashamed suffre woman liking regne kynges body tullius ¶while alysaunder gate fauoure men yeftes moneye fader wroote hym manere erroure hath broughte hope thou troweste haue hem true thou haste ouercome money receyueth wors also moore redy wayte yeftes thereby taketh heede seruāt yeuer yeftes kyng ¶ capitulum 28 xiiij kynge pers darius arsanius sonne began regne second yere alysander regned six yere ¶trogus libro 11 ¶ alysaunder slough stepdames sonne caranus owne kynne semed able kyngdome· matier stryf sholde leue macedoyne whan oute land alayde craftely many stryues bygonne went corinth began restore werre pers fader bygonne made subget lacedomones athenens rebell coū seylle of· demostenes attenens flemes theban yaue self darius kyng pers deled herytage amonge frendes byleued asia allone ynowe him· therfor bade knyghtes spare thinges asia lefte duller men kepe kyngdome macedonya sharpest wytted men ¶olde mē sixty yere trauaylled fader made maystres leders hooste put hope brayne foot trust vyctory flyght alysaundres hoost xxxiij fote men fyue thousand horsmen therfor doute whether wonder alysaunder myght wynne world lytel strēgthe owther durste auntre soo lytel strengthe ¶petrus 196 ¶than alysaunder passed see elespontus ouercome darius duke leders assembled ayenst vpon granicus ¶than passed forth thurgh lidia thurgh • onia thurgh pamp • ilium toke cyte sardes sette bytwene twey frygyes trogus libro vndecimo ¶alysaunder herde comyng darius drad streytnesse place went vp hille mount taurus leyde fyfty furlonges maystrie came tharses full swote pouder dust threw self water spryngeth senewes beganne shrynke soo shold haue dyed anone taken dryncke philip phisicien netheles darius bifore yeuen philip grete somme money slee alysaunder alisaundre lettres therof warned shold noo wyse take drynke ne medycyne philip hand ¶ netheles alisaundre toke trustly dryncke philippes hande toke first lettres rede four dayes alysander hole darius passed ryuer eufrates mount taurus iiij c·m fote men honderd thousand horsmen set forth forward sheltron strong fyghtynge eyther kyng wounded darius fled fast away four score fotemen ten thousand horsmen slayne xxx thousand taken castels walled townes beten ground darius moder wyf twey sistres taken lyf saued new maryage taken alysaunder bigan lyue lecherously loued barsines taken gate hir hercules desired kyng eest went siria ¶petrus 146 one saraballa made subgestion kyng alisaundre iewes wold lasse rebell yf theyr power deled two leue kyng bylde tēple hill mōt gazarim dured destruction done romaynes ordeined abysshop ther manasses wedded doughter iadus bisshops broder ¶ trogus libro 11 whyle alisander siria many kynges est cam ayenst hym lordes crownes dyademes somme hem· toke cōpany som bename kingdōs put newe stede put many gētilmē put vngētilmē stede amōg put gētilmē made vngētilmā lord sidonies lord wont bifore worche hem laue vp wat pyttes wat orchardes garden men shold take hede truste anaunsed ther noble dedes grete blood· trogꝰ li 18· tyme alisāder filled diches toke cyte tirus heng croyses dwellyd take stracons blode trogus li 81· sōtyme many chorles cyte tirus conspyred geder slough lordes vyctours long tyme fre men occupyed howses wedded wyues bygate free childer though hym self bonde ¶ netheles one chorle soo many thousand hidde lord called stracon sauede hym goodly chorles come geder ch • se hem kyng assented whiche hem myght first espye sonne risyng morow shold kyng goode chorle warned lord strakō strakō coūseylled chorle whan al comyn nyght feld loked estward sonne shold loke westward soo shewed wonderly lyghte sonne beames shynyng highest towres cyte hem semede manere doynge come churles wytte axede faste counseylour dede knowleched lord knowen gretely witte lordes passed wit churles old men childer grace stracō chosen kyng man doyng chorles comynly vsed euery lande vnto alysaunders tyme toke cyte slough therinne except stracones blode iose li 11 alysandre wrote iadus prynce preestes iherusalem shold ordeyne hym vytaylle trybute wonte pay darius kyng iadus warned sayde nay sworn darius pay hym trybute therfor alysander displesyd iewes· petrus li 196· alysander wente forth toke cyte gaza whan hadde besieged twey monethes then went toward ierusalem iadus bisshop taught slepe arayed bisshops arraye wēt preestes ayenst kinge alysaunder shewed prophecye danyel· prophecie sayde one grekes sholde destroye power perses goddes doynge soo iadus gate grace kyng relesse trybute seuen yere trogus libro 11· wan roodes· egypt withoute bataylle wente iupiter ammon wytte hym reede coūsayle happes sholde bifalle also owne byrthe moder olimpias beknowen philip· grete serpent hadde geten alysaunder hir philippe therfor philip last tyme lyf tolde openly alysander sonne therfor forsoke olympyada put hir away ¶ alysaunder desired gete lygnage byrth godheed also put sklander moder alysaunder gaue mede bisshops warned hem answer wolde haue wente iupiters temple worshipped goddes sonne ¶ therfore wexe prowde vnesy lost vysage thewes hadde lerned lettres grue torned egypt bylde cyte allexandria passed forth warred vpon cyte samaritanes wanne yaue macedoyns dwelle ¶ samarytes hadde slayne one andromachus alysaunder lefte kepe countray augꝰ de ci dei li 4 ca 4 pol li 3 tyme alisaunder axed one dyonydes theef see taken· robbed see answerd sayde stydfastly skyl thou robbest alle world wyde doo lytel ship therfor called theef thou doost grete nauy thou art cleped emperour towchyng cause therof noo difference bytwene vs· vnfortune vnhap oute take werste stelith moost alysaundre taken al one shold cleped theef yf peple redy dyonydes commaundemente dyonydes emperour ¶ lawes flee thou impugnest withsayst hem lytel fortune pouerte scarsite ryches maketh theef grete pryde couetyse may fulfylled maketh theef· caas yf fortune ryches withdrawe sholde better thou fortune ryches thou hast wors thou shalt alysaundre wondred stydfastnesse· sayde shal essay yf thou wolt better yf thy fortune chaunged soo thou shalt wyte thyne maners fortune thou trespassist doost amysse iustinus li·6 whan siria ouercome alysaunder darius cam efte geders batayll fighte darius sente lettres alysaunder maner darius kyng kynges cosyn goddes sendith seruaūt alysander chargyng commādyng thou retorne seruaūtis thy forfaders yet lyest thy moders lap hote thou lerne mānes offyce til thou come therto sende scourge ball purs gold· scourge bitokeneth take hede thy lore bal acordeth playeng thyne age money maye releue thy wey thou obeyssaūt cōmādemētes hestes cōmāde charge shal sende men shal scourge binde ye bring boūden byfore lordship mageste saynges made lordes alysander sore abasshed aferde alysander answerd hem said ye abasshed thes wordes haue brag boost trust truth maner feblest houndes berke moost euer lasse might haue berke faster alysander wrote darius maner alysander kyng kynges lord lordes cosyn goddes sendith greting darius thou hast sēte scourge ball money gold therbi knoulech thou hast couenablye gran̄ted thyng behoueth vse scourge among subgettis roundenesse balle signefieth shal lord emperour al wyde world gold thou hast sente behoteth lordship al thy rychesse tresour grete boost thou makest rychesse maketh v haue gretter wylle werre ayenst trogus libro vndecimo ¶ atte last darius ouercome fledde babylone prayd alysaunder lettres myght raunson men taken prisoner alysaunder chalenged money hool kyngdome efte darius proferd alysaunder doughter grete par • e kyngdome alysaunder charged deliu hym owne· commanded darius come mekely receyue vyctor wyl ordeyne· darius none hope pea cam ayenst alysaunder iijcm fote men c horsmen· netheles told way wyf deed trauayll child alysaundres warde· alysaunder buryed hir gre • e worship netheles alysander loue māhode hym self therfor dariꝰ wrote thyrd tyme thākyng hym curtoys al dyde hem despyte ne enuye· proferd hym part kyngdom vnto ryuer eufrates doughter xxx talentes dele men taken prysoners· alysaunder answerd thankyng enemyes vanyte nedeth said flater among res werre promysed hym araye sheltron owther yelde hym namely land may suffre twey kinges lyke grete alysaunder went priuely darius tentes mette happely darius sayde alysaunders messager telle thes tydynges hold hym kynge hyeth hym slowly bataylle whether thou alysaunder sayd darius spekest soo boldly nay sayd alysaunder messager ¶ darius brought him· soper alysaunder euery vessell profered hym drynke drank wyne put vessel bosom whan dariꝰ warned herof seruauntes wroth reproued alysander theef maner said alysander vsed alysandris court therfor wende soo vsed •• soo kyng apayed noyse cessed ¶ one atte feste knewe alysaunder therof alysaunder soone war fledde anone slough child perse helde hors atte yate passed ryuer came men darius folowed alysaunder alysander charged none men sholde passe ryuer men shold yeue wey lette perses passe trogus libro vndecimo ther strong fyghtyng atte last darius gan fle alysaunders knyghtes pursued toke grete prayes ful thyrtty dayes ryche cyte persipolis chief cyte pers taken darius fledde many soore woū de owne cosyns put boundes gold atte last darius dyed alisaunder buryed grete solempnyte worship ¶trogus libro 1 • ¶the meane tyme messagers came lettres oute macedonia tolde antipater wardayn kepar countray ouercome cacides kyng spartania lacedomonia also alysaunder kynge epyres tracia antipater also fowle born downe ¶also zephiron alysaunders stuard xxx thousand faught ayenst shytes al destroyed· whan alysaunder hadde herd tydynges made thre dayes greet moone sorowe knyghtes trowed wold retorne owne countray netheles alysaunder comforted knyghtes trauaylle wynne straunge londes eest sayd sought darius body kyngdome londe ¶sone wanne mardes hircanes also talestris quene amazones thre honderd woman mette alysaunder came xxxv iourneyes amonge right cruel men haue childer kynge alysaunder sight comyng hir wōderful al maner mē specially message brought wonderful vsed lyued xiij dayes flesshly lykynge went hir waye ¶r netheles alysaunders storye tellyth alysaunder axed trybute quene amazones wrote hym maner ¶of thy wytte wonder thou woldest fyght woman yf happe fortune fauour v thou ouercome thou art shamed euer yf thou ouercome v thou getest lytel worship vyctory woman ¶trogus libro 12 ¶ capitulum 29 alysaunder toke clothyng dyademe kynge pers thaugh wold passe maner vsage macedonia ¶and shold seme one trespassed doyng· bade frendes also vse longe clothes gold also deled tymes stempnes nyghtes amonge companye strompettes put noble mete drynk lest fastyng destroyed lechery highted meels dyuers playes hadde mynde grete rychesse lost suche maner doyng gete ne wonne therfore men began haue indygnacion hym forsoke vsage maners forfaders lette knyghtes wedde woman taken prysonners shold take suffre easily trauaylle chiualrye thynke lasse theyr owne countrey helde macedonia shold strenger yf yong knightes come old faders vsed dedes knyghtes boundes theyr owne byrth shold stal worth afterward yf pyght tentes owne cradels also alysaunder ordeyned fedyng childre· hers· armour yonglynges hire wage faders yf faders dyed sonnes shold receyue wage faders childhode shold knyghthode cheualrye whan partyes chased alysaunder waye cruel amonge owne men hated moost yf ony men saide ony maner dede· slough one permenion old man next kyng permenyons sonne phil • ta also tolde hym ouertourned destroyed maners vsages countray fornfaders alysaunder drad lest tydynges dede shold come macedonia made wold sende somme frendes macedonia telle tydynges vyctoryes grete dedes doo bade men shold wryte lettres al wold tydynges sende made messagers brynge lettres pryuately wold knowe al mennes wylle wold lettres sende owther wold rewarde hem true owther sende hem fals ferre londes pol· alysander ofte dronken cruel amōg meyny soo happed tyme yaue dome ayenst one grettest palays heed shold appeled anone right· ¶ vsed appele lasse tyraunt wyne dronke torned wodenesse sayde whome appellyst thou appelle sayd alysaunder dronke alysaunder sober answer alysaunder abated wrath put sentence dome fully foryaue hym trespas ¶ trogus subdued peple dwellyd atte fote hille cancasus bylde cyte alexandria vpon ryuer thanays ¶r take hede alysaunder buyld xij· cytees euery hem callyd allexandria dyuers kyngdomes landes ¶atte ryuer thanays pontus shiciā mesagetes egypt troada tigris staurus made wryte walles cytees lettres grue alisander iupiters cosyn ¶ trogus libro duodecimo ¶ men closed watres callyd palludes meotydes sente letter alisander maner· yf goddes wolde hauyng thy body euen coueitese thy sowle world myght receyue the· whether thou knowe tree growe long tyme roted vp litel take hede bewar thou falle tre thou takest bowes ofte lion mete smale beestes fowles rust destroyed yren thyng strong stydfast may brought peryll feble thyng wele litel worth ¶ cyleth v cam neuer thy lond may serue man kepe regne ¶ thou hast ioye pursue theues thou art euery nacions thef nede hastow ryches maketh nedy desire moore rich vyctory cause bataylle man suffreth gladly alien lord yf thou art god thou sholdest yeue men benefyce yeftes take fro man owne thou man thynke thou art thou myght haue frendes hem thou hast greued thou hast ouercome thou myght haue hem euer suspect bitwene bonde man lord maner frendship though pea one day fest amonge alisandres trusty frendes speche dedes philip kyngis fader ther alysaundre began booste make self worthy fader grete dele atte feste helde vp alisandres oyle olitus old man wyse trust kynges frendship praysed fader anone alisandre slough hym grete preysyng afterward whan kynges wodenesse cessed bithought hym persone slayne cause deth fest tyme made soo grete sorowe desired dye teeres brake oute eyen wept ful soore biclypped dede corp gropeth woundes drewe oute shafte profereth stycke self therwith ¶for olitus sister alisandres norse sorowe dured four dayes one calystenes alisaundres scole fere vnder aristotle alayed sorow vnneth grete besynesse ¶trogus libro duodecimo ¶but long afterward calystenes philosopher wold vse maner araye pers alysaunder bare hym hande fals espye heete smyte lymmes threwe stoke body pyt hand hym· one lysimachus gentilman noble made drynke venym remedye sorowe ¶ alysaunder wroth dede put lysimachus lyon eten wrapped cloth aboute hande put lyon mouth whan lyon resed rased tong slough lyon alysaunder sawe loued afterward ¶solinus ¶after alisander cam hilles caspy childer boundage ten lygnages israel closed prayd lycence alisander goo oute closyng whan alysaunder vnderstande closed synne prophecied hem shold goo then alisaunder closed them· faster stopped oute goyng stone glue sawe mannes wytte suffisaunt doo dede prayde god israel wold fulfylle werk dede coppes hilles wente closed geder soo place closed noman myght come therto ¶r shal go oute atte worldes ende slee many men sayth iosephus alisander aboute tenth yere kyngdom wēt inde keuered armour knyghtes siluer wēt vp noble cyte nysa then ledde hooste toward holy hille men heele ther preuy harnays yuy leues· sodayn doyng hill hoost moeued crye god almyghty holy cryes· ¶ went hilles called monte dedaly kyngdome quene cleofilis· myghte withstande hym armour fyghtyng lette kyng lye hir raunsomed kyngdome sonne alisander named alysaunder emperour inde moder ¶but quene cleped kynges harlatte lyue alysaunder cam stone wonder sharpnesse· moche peple fledde theder socoure stone hercules forboden forther passage shold passe noo ferther alysaunder wold passe hercules dedes gate place grete trauaylle perille made peple yelde mageste ¶ alysaunder faught porrus kyng inde slough alisaunders hors hete bucyfall netheles porrus wounded al aboute take prysonner alysaunder restored hym ayene kyngdom netheles porrus sory ouercome wold ete ne suffre men hele woundes ¶ capitulum 30 whan alysaunder goone aboute last clyff occeā arayed werre ilond bragmans sente suche letter kynge haue herd thy bataylles thy vyctoryes shal suffice whō world suffiseth rychesse haue none whiche shuld werre v al good comune v mete ryches vyle clothyng sckars haue stede gold grete araye woman arrayed plese grete aray acompted charge amonge v highnesse fayrenesse woman desire fayrenesse haue kynde ¶ drye dyches dennes standeth v double stede stede oure herberowe lyue stede oure graues whan dede· ¶ yf haue somtyme kynge doo right· honeste kynde haue among v neyther dome ne plee· thing nedeth redresse plee owther dome· desire reson kynde axeth· holde nedefull knowe mesurable moche euenesse pouert maketh v ryche· peple hath one lawe dooth nothynge ayenst lawe kynde vse trauayll slhod make v couetous shone forsake fowle sleuthe lechery doo thynge nedith punysshyng vnlawfull v wounde hilles culture share vse gloteny ne outrage mete drynke therfore seke dwelle drye dyches heuen fyndeth v keueryng erth fyndeth v bedding werriours make pee good liuyng strength also noo fader foloweth thoffyce sonnes deth ¶ committatur exequias ¶ seche playes iapes right lyking v behold firmament sterres heuen men simple speche· commune v lye god al god hath lykyng wordes beedes maner lykenesse loue worde spyryte thought plesid wordly rychesse hooly werkes thankynges grace rn̄o allexandri thou sayst dindimꝰ bragmans allone acompted nombre tale mankynde withoute vyces ryches acompte wrongefull dedes doo· acompte greuous benefyce god hath graunted help mankynde helpe seruice craftes acompte synfull atte laste destroye lawes lyuyng eyther sey goddes· han enuye god bi cause therof blame fayrest creature respōsio dindimi ¶ home world home gestes come dwelle wende hen alayde charge synnes withoute suche maner charge drawe nyghe oure owne hows hye faste homeward say goddes haue none enuye god sey wol mysuse goodnesse god almyghty say al thynge semely lawful god hath putte vse thynges mānes fredome leueth wors foloweth better god made goddes frende· ¶ whan swellynge welth hath bolned vp pryde ye forgete ye men seyn god rekketh mākynde ye bylde temple youre self whiche ye sheden blode therfore calle yow woode ye wytte ye doo yf ye despyse god wyttyngly ye holden synne sacrylege epistola allexandri thou callest thy self man welthe thou dwellest ther noo man may come ye prayse lyuynge youre scarsete skylle welthe perpetuel prysonne haue noo vse ryches oute ryches right ye be· lawe kynde dooth prison doth hem ye tille neyther gardyns ne feldes maketh defawte yre kynd voucheth sauf yeue yet lyue rootes soo ye muste nedes ye maye sayle londes gete lyuelode ¶ somtyme beestes lyued rootes right ye doo therfor good lyue good rule plente strayte skarste meschyef elles blyndenesse pouerte shold noble vertues allone blyndenesse seeth coueyteth pouerte hath desireth woman ben lykyngly arayed graunt ye haue neyther connyng ne wher wyth ye haue grete flesshely lykynge wonder maketh grete nede meschyef fowle sight nakednesse ye haue lawes dome men studye l • ttrure axen neyther grauntmercy therinne ye acorde fysshes vnskylful beestes mannes sowle dyuers time dyuers happes cause able dyuers maner doyng dyuers manere sowles torne chaūge chaū gynge heuen wyttede cl • er day dull wytted heuy whan day dym clowdy also reason wyttes maye many maner wyse soo chaungeable dyuersyte thynges also dyuersite age ¶ therfor childhode myld yong men wylde old men soft wexen feble also al wyttes ben plesed thynges longe owne felyng ¶treuisa ye may knowe wyttes han lykyng thynges longeth owne felynge yf ye take hede sighte hath lykyng fayr hew colour heryng swete voys sowne nose swete odour smelles mouth swete tast sauour gropyng hote cold drye wete nessh hard nesshe knowen many wyttes knowen gropyng sight ¶than foloweth thystorye elementes yeueth v matier wyttes fele stature body mankynde made elementes medled • geder euery shold make good owne partye yeue v special help subsydye owne dispensacion yf thou wolt vse benefyce haue thelementes whiche benefyces ben seedes fysshes fowles many thou shalt accused pryde thou forsakest yeftes eyther enuye yeuen hym better thou responsio dindimi ¶ ye moeue werres bataylles werre outward ayenst men· ye haue ouercomen enemyes within bragmans ouercome ynner bataylles owne membrys reste sikerly haue bataylles outward beholden firmamente sterres heuen foules song heled fedde leues fruyte trees· drynke water sing songes worship god take hede thynke lyf comyng apayed fewe wordes sone stylle hold pee ye say shold doo ye doo wytte wysedome lyppes ye hongry thyrsty gold· nedeth hows seruauntes ye coueyte reuerence worship water quencheth kinde thirst ¶gold heeleth woundes nowther withdraweth ne refreyneth couetise maketh moore ¶ therfor openly knowen thyrste hongre gold cometh kyndely nede whan one wold somtyme quenche suche honger thyrst one calamus fledde v you· despysed hym ye worship hym ¶than alysaunder sente one onesicritus dindimus lay wode vpon leues tree wordes alysaunder grete god iupiters sonne lord worlde chargith commaundeth withoute delaye thou come hym thou comest wold yeue many grete yeftes thou come thou shalt thi hede thy lyf goo ¶dindimus lay styll answerd maner sothfaste god yeueth men lyght doth man wrong auoydeth manslaughter arereth stryf ne werre ¶ alysander shal dye god ¶ promyseth nedeful me· nedeth noo suche thynges· goo frely wheder lyketh· alysaunder smyte heede slee may slee sowle ¶ gronyng hem suffren wronge begynnynge peyne tourmentes hem doth wrong say alysander drede deth yf wol ought myne lette hym come alysaunder lefte pompe boste cam dyndimus fete· dindimus hym sayde distourbest thou pea desirest haue thyng haue nedeful worship god loue men rek gold despyse deth ye loue gold hate men despyse god alysaunder sayd teche thou wytte wysedom thou hast receyued god sayde ¶than dyndimus answerd seyde thou haste wheron doo suche yefte thy sowle ful couetyse howe shal suffyce whome world suffyseth god hath made lytil though thou desire al world nedeth haue atte last lytel londe thou seest lye owther thy self sitte thou lerne wysedome al thou shalt haue though thou desire nought couetise moder pouert god frende haue heuen roof erthe stede bed ryuer fyndeth drynke wode mete borde· flesshe beestys roteth within guttes buryels dede bodyes lyue made knowe goddes pryuytees god wyl pertener werkes ¶than whether seyst thou • ightful mysbede men owther defende hem doo hem right shede shyfte owther kepe saue thou slee goo god thou maist escape hand ¶than destroye thou god hath wrought made ¶than alysaunder sayd thou comest god lyuest place pee reste· liue grete drede effray myne oune wardeyns drede drede mote frendes myn enemyes may leue hem ne trust ¶ day greue men greued nyght drede ful soore yf slee drede sory full woo ¶ yf easy softe despysed yf wold dwelle valeys dennys myght endure· whan tale tolde alysaunder profered dindymus gold syluer clothes breed oyle ¶and dindimus sayde hym may thou make briddes singe better gold siluer yf thou maye wolt thou make wors briddes· make receyue thynge maye stande steede free man make bonde wold greue swyth oyle wolle receyue whan dindimus hadde sayd soo threwe oyle fyre wode sang ympne god almyghty alysaunder sawe went way ¶ capitulum 31 alysaundre aboute enleuenth yere kyngdome passed est occean bisshop tree sonne mone come ayenst bysshop clothed wylde beestes skynnes sayde shold entre place yf clene pollute lykyng woman sholde doo clothes aray thylke tree honderd fote highe alysaunder sayde rone ofte place nay sayd preeste sayde came neuer rayne ne byrd ne wylde beest tree hadde wepte eclyps sonne mone petrus 197 prestes toke apple thes tree lyued fyue honderd yere whan beame sonne touched tree son̄e owther beame mone tree mone anone tree wolde shake yeue answer hem stode aboute vincen̄· alysander wold haue sacrifice tree preest sayd leful sette encense fyre place ne slee bestes alysander felle downe clypped kysshed stokkes tree herd sonne rysynge tree sonne spekyng langage inde euen mone rysinge· herde tree moue spekyng lā gage grece one shold lorde alle worlde aboute shold neuer come home owne countrey therfor coūseylled hym shold come babyloyn yf cam shold slayne egge tole venym second yere after· also herde moder shold wrechedly dye sistres lyue longe tyme grete welth petrus 197· alysander warned mayster aristotle doyng wondres inde ¶ r many storyes tellen whan alysaundres knyghtes wente aboute pryuy place inde one blamed gretely alysaundres couetyse sente hym lytle stone eyē knightes sayd lord withoute deute lyke stone al maner poyntes whan stone brought wō dred longe tyme whiche syde stone likenesse shold atte laste stone laid balaunce weyed vp al myghte layde ther agayns side till layde ly • el clay ayenst stone balance side weyed vp stone lyghtly ynowe ¶ eutropius yere lucius papirius dictator rome noble wereiour chosen amonge romaynes withstonde alysaunder putte hym yf wold come ytaly 〈◊〉 ouercome sampnytes worshipfully beet downe cytees· soo though sought sampnium place sampnium myght fonde petrus 197 ¶whan alysander wonne al este londes went toward contray messagers west landes affryca spayne ytaly come babyloyne yelde hem lordship mageste netheles hoped therby kynge holly alle world grete lykynge ioye forgate answer tree sonne mone went babyloyne speke messagers trogus libro duodecimo ¶also stewardes made wardeynes kepers prouinces landes mette hym greuously accused men landes prouynces hete hem hange hem sight messagers comen oute west londes alysaunder toke darius doughter wyue maryed noble maydens countrey men macedonia lefte old men toke hym yonglynges ¶also receyued moders lettres fraude treson antiparte steward macedonia sawe kyng slayne men hym self rewarded grete trauaylles drad ful soore lest hym shold wors byfalle ordeyned sone cassandrus empoysen kyng venym strength malyce venym soo vyolent tyngynge· bra ne yren ne noo maner metalle myght holde hoof hors fote myght holde ¶ atte soper tessalus phicicien amonge grete seruyce meete drynke alysaunder poysened yaue groone though stykked thurgh body swerde drad handlyng mānes hande as▪ soore harde woūdes· axed toole slee hym self remedye sorow frendes trowed vnholsomme mete hadde eten soper cause sekenesse ¶ petrus 197 ¶ alysaunder lost speche wrote last wylle wolde make one man heyr hoole kyngdome shold rede hym noo man pere made twelue yonge men felawes youthe successours kyngdome ordenaunce dured longe four hem regned forsake soo comprehended danyel trogus li· 12 whan alysandres frendes sawe shuld dye axed hym sholde heyr emperour hym moost worthy sayd stout grete herte though sonne hercules broder arydeus sawe also wyf roxones childe· forgate ofsprynge lygnage ordeyned worthyest shold successour emperoure· sawe also manere spekynge doynge myght come grete stryf enuye whan myght speke toke ringe fynger yaue one perdyca tokē yt shold successour alysander dyed yere kingdome xij yere age xxxiij strange men made sorowe deth though fader next hym made ioye though enemy ouercome darius moder ordeygned deth put enemye byfore hi • sonne founde hym myldenesse myldenesse hir sonne also frendes prayd iupiter answer ordeyned bury hym egyp • e memphis cite alexandria bylde ¶ pol libro quarto grece neuer man gretter alisaunder netheles perdyca tomblestres sonne successour and▪ owne sonne comyn sawe sylde owther neuer emperours childer fadres heyres hadde owne enemyes heyres hem el heyres knewe trogus libro duodecimo whan alysaunder buryed philosophres came geder sayd alysaunder hath made tresour gold contrary another sayd alle world lytle hym yisterday four ellues ynow atte ful another sayd yisterday peple heestes peple hath hym heste· another sayd yisterday hoost day contrary hooste ledeth hym another sayde yisterday bare downe men day born downe vnder erth· petrus 197· grete alysander four partyes world regned iiij kinges philip arydeus alisandres broder regned west macedonia grece antigonus regned north asia pontus selenchus nichanor regned cest siria babyloyne nichanor antiochus sother kynges regned aftir hym name hym named antiochy euery singler nombre cleped antyochus ¶ kyngis succeded hym antiochus theos antiochus galerius antiochus grete· antyochus epyphanes ¶ also south egypte regned tholomeus lagus sonne hym kyngis hadde name cleped tholomei whiche kynges philadelphus euergetes ¶ philopator otherwyse called eupator epiphanes philometor euergetes· sother ¶ iosephus libro 120 ¶capitulum 32 tholemeus lagus sonne regned alysaunder egypt fourty yere cleped sauiour surname sother putto siria kyngdome werred iewes ydel holy day toke prysonners hem sette hem sale ¶ dayes dyed iadus bisshop iewes iadus sonne onias bisshop hym symon rightful hym broder eleazarus tholomeus soo stronge restored pirrus kyng epurtes kyngdome ayene enemyes put oute kyngdome ¶ ouercome demetrius antigonus sone restored som kingdom salencus kyng siria kyngdome bynome selencus byfore ¶ agathocles vsed tyrannye syracusa wonderful begynnyng redeth trogus bookes tholomeus toke iherusalem fraude gyle toke many iewes prysonners sold hem couetyse ¶ theophratus philosophre name theophratus noble spekynge god almyghty ¶ theofratus menandis theyr floures ¶ fro yere historye • hebei acompted kyngdome grece regnum grecorum ¶ tyme selencus kynge siria bylde antyochia leodicia selencia ¶ grete symon onias sonne prosperyte cleped rightful rightful byleue worshipyng god ¶ tarentes dyd grete vyleny messagiers rome therfor toke hem pirrus kyng epyrotes four score thousand fote men vij horsmen twenty olyfauntes ayenst romaynes pirrus ouercome thyrdde fyghtynge torned home ayene owne countrey ¶after tarentines cartagynenses geder werred ayenst romaynes reysed bataylles cleped bella punica eutropius pirrus ouercome romayns first batayll occupyed ytaly vnto cyte prenestes xviij myle fro rome ¶ sente hem prisoner taken lyue without raunsome buryed al slayne ¶and whan beheld lye grisely woundes sterne terrible cruel heef vp hand sayde myghte lorde world yf suche knyghtes ¶ pirrus profered fourth part kyngdom hadde geten one fabricius messagyer rome holde hym syde ¶ fabricius wold assē te· pirrus sente one cin • grete yeftes message romaynes desired pee skylful condicion trogus decimo septimo foūde mannes hows wold receyue yeftes put prysone • sente agayne sklaunderd euermore taken prysonners whyle armed titus cyneas came ayene sayde pirrus hadde sene contreye kynges· sayde nygh al pirrus holden among owne men seconde bataylle pirrus ouercome olyfauntes slayne twenty thousand men· isoder sayth romain • hadde ordeyned swyfte yonglynges sittynge hynde horsmen· whiche yonge men lept downe lyghtly fyghtyng clawed froted olyfauntes forheede hors combes vnto olyfauntes fylle downe dyed right ¶ pirrus ouercome went tarente sayled then grece afterward slayne valerius ¶pirrus fabricius hadde castels nyghe geders pirrus phicicien came fabricius promysede hym wolde take hym lorde yf wolde yeue hym couenable mede ¶ fabricius bounde phicicien sente hym lorde messagyers warne hym treson falseheede kyng wondred sayde ¶ fabricius harder tourned oute honneste sonne tourned oute cours ¶ titus ¶ pirrus praysed tarentines werre ayenste romaynes axede appolyn ynde bataylle shold haue appolyn answerd hym amphibolyce yaue answer double vnderstondyng ¶ may befalle pirrus scomfit romayns pirrus cō fortid answer cam eraclea cyte sampnia romaynes fyrst daye ferd of· horrible gretenesse shappe smelle olyfauntes fledde away drede second batayll pirrus soore woū ded arme went wey then many place ytaly blood sprang ranne oute welles rayne milke cam downe fro henen selencus kyng siria toke many iewes cytees kyngdom graunted hem grete worship grekes eleazarus symons broder bisshop iewes romaynes buylde beneuent sāpmū ¶ gaufr alfr ¶ aboute tyme morindus cruel sonne dauius regned brytayne moder called tangustela dauius concubine morindus many cruel dedes eten atte laste grete beest see· lefte hym fyue sonnes first callyd gorbomanus loued wel rightwysenesse regned dyed second sonne archgallo regned cruelly atte last peple putte thyrd sone elydurus mild man softe made kynge fyue yere kyngedome hunted wode called calcum nowe called caltras besides yorke ¶ gaufr ¶ beside cyte acliut fonde broder archgallo maskyng putte oute kyngdome kepte hym pryuely chambre lay bed feyned hym seke sent lordes land compellyd hem restore broder kyngdom archgallo regned ten yere dyed ¶ elydurus restored efte kyngdome twey bretheren vygenius peridurus werred hym prisonned hym trynouantum london̄ twey regned tymes eyther dyed atte last ¶ elydurus take oute prysonne restored kyngedome thyrdde tyme lyued afterward pee lyues ende ¶ hym two thyrtty kynges regned among brytayns eueryche among kyng bledgaret passed predecessours musicke melodye· soo called god gle men hely regned fourty yere lefte thre noble sonnes lyue lud cassibelanus nemius petrus capitulo 200 tholomeus philadelphus second kyng egypte regned eyght thyrtty yere▪ seyth ouercome fader hoost two honderd thousand fote men xx horsmē two thousand charyottes iiij c olyfantes petrus 200 delyuerd iewes egypte lette goo free six score thousande tale payed lordes eu er pol xx dragmes siluer xxv oure money sent vessaile halowed iewes eleazarus bisshop iewes ¶ also counsayle demetrius warden bookes sent messagers eleazarus bisshop prayeng wold sende hym wyse men iewes shold torne moyses lawe oute hebrew grue eleazarus sente vnto kyng euery lygnage vj men draweth thre score twelue scripture vsith ofte time speke litel nombre yf odde ouer grete thes called seuenti torned holy scripture oute hebrewe grue enformed tholomeus kynge knowleche one god gouernaunce kyngdome translated lawe psalmes ad prophecyes ¶ translacion founde ought trynyte spake therof owther translated redel wyse lest wold wene spak thre goddes ¶ also saye aboute incarnacion criste founde six name god sette one angelus magni consilij angel grete counseylle leste wold wene meaned mankynde manhede shold ky • de god godhede ¶ fulfylled werke thre score dayes ten semeth seynt augustyn de ciuitate dei libro decimo octauo capitulo 42 vnderstandeth seuenty departed euery hym self selle translated lawe withoute discorde wordes sentence ¶ ierom holdeth closed one hows owther came geder saterday examyned correcte werke • x dayes ¶ augustinus de ciuitute dei libro decimo octauo capitulo quadragesimo secundo ¶ seuenty olde men alle lygnages israel euery hym self alexandria egyp • e tourned holy wrytte oute hebrewe grue discorded wordes sentence nowther settynge wordes though ther tyme newe testament torned holy wrytte oute hebrew grue aquila symachus theodocion fyfth translacion· auctor therof vnknowen thes seuenty sette byfore al tyme one ieronimus preeste wyse man connyng thre langages translated holy scripture hebrewe latin· iewes say translacion truest ¶ netheles holy chirche demeth noman putte byfore auctoryte many men somme men wolde amende translacion seuenty bookes hebrew dar withdrawe seuē ty hadden hebrues made strykes lyke vnces wrytton also cleped oboly shewe ther moore hebrewe bookes hebrues seuenty marked markys called astarisces shapen sterres highte defante ysid libro sexto ¶ seyth tholomeus seuenty thousand bookes lybrary ¶ petrus capitulo decimo quinto dyuers translacions ynow speke ones· byfore▪ thyncarnacion lord thre honderd yere fourty one seuenty tornyd holy wrytte hebrewe grue prosperyte also ascēcion oure lorde six score yere four adrian prynces tyme aquila made translacion ¶ thre fyfty▪ yere comodꝰ prynces tyme theodocion prosperyte ¶than thyrtty yere· seuerus prynces tyme symachus made translacion eyght yere fyfth translacion founden ierusalem cleped comune translacion made vnknowen ¶than xviij yere alysaū der prynces tyme origenes made translacion signes cleped astaryches obelus afterward made another translacion siches signes markes alle thes translated oute hebrew grue many translated oute grue latyn atte laste ierom translated oute hebrue latyn translacion holden nyghe euery place oute take sauter eutr ¶the romaynes dyde first batayll cleped bellum punicum cartaginen̄sem ayens affres men affryca treuisa men affrica cleped affri primo peni punici punices cartaginenses therfor batayll ageynst hem cleped bellum punicum cartagmense also bataylle ayenst hem called punici punyces cartaginenses· foloweth story though romayns moued none armour withoute ytaly byfore tyme netheles knowe certainly somme nombre romayns payde certayn acounted founde two honderd thousand four score thousand twelue thousand thre honderd four thyrtty· batayll cessed neuer sith· cite first bylde soo romaynes fyue yere continuely sicillia ayenest iheron kyng sicilia ayenest affers vyctours hadde maystrye romaynes yaue first batayll affryca leder marcus regulus consul rome fyrste toke theyr shippes drenched hem ether chaced hem shippes atte laste toke thre duke affryca beet doun hooste toke many olyfauntes sente xxvij thousand prysoners rome amonge dedes atte ryuer bragada slow grete serpent sent skyn therof rome grete wonder skyn syx score fote long cartagynenses men affryca ouercome axed pee marcus regulus wolde graūte none pee vpon wel harde condicions affers gate hem zansippus king lacedomonia ouercome marcus regulus hoost atte last meschief tweyne romayns escapede fledde ¶thirtty thousand dede slayne marcus regulus fyue honderd prysonners holden longe bondes afterward romayns ouercome affers werre see londe soo slewe theyr enemyes two honderd thousand six score olyfauntes ten take cartagynenses affers sente marcus regulus rome prayde wold chaunge prysonners ¶ augustinus de ciuitate dei libro primo netheles oth swore yf axede sholde nought doo regulus sholde torne ayene cartage wente forth dide awey wyf bedde though • e romayn counseyll senatours gadred geder counseylled contrary owne message· sayde prouffitable· comonte rome chaunge soo many noble prysoners suche olde man romayns dide counsayle ¶ netheles compellyd goo ayene romaynes counseylled specially abyde rome· cause sware cartage come ayene yf myghte haue auctoryte honneste bourges cyte rome prisonner chese goo agayne went ayene affres closed hym strayte tree ful pykes within forth sharpe nayles pared lyddes eyen made hym stand soo ther wake lyues ende petrus 168 ¶ tholomeus faught ayenst antyochus theos kyng siria afterward confedered gyder antyochus wedded beronica tholomeus doughter forsoke rather wyf laodyces atte laste laodyces hadde grace hir husbond came hym agayne punysshed hym sonne begeten beronica made hir owne sonne antyochus kyng siria ¶ peny siluer first shapen rome ¶ capitulum 33 tholomeus euergetes philadelphius broder thyrd kyng egypt regned xxvj yere wreche sister beronica hir husbonde hir sonne slayn venym destroyed siria silicia party asia greued antyochus galerychus whan herde prynces egypt conspyred ayenst hym absence torned agayne egypt lad hym grete good two thousand sex· honderd mawmettes ¶ antiochus galerychus left twey sonnes hym selenchus grete antyochus atte last selenchus slayne broder antiochus regned siria six thyrtty yere faught afterward philopater king egypte fledde wel nygh taken ennius poete born tarent· cato questor brought hym rome treuisa ¶ questor gadred trybute rome domesman somtyme cleped questor also wardeyns tresour cleped questores churles pardoner cleped questores foloweth history ennu • pocte dwellyd hille auentinus lytel coste content seruice wenche ¶ tyme bonde man lay mayde temple goddes vesta mayde slough hir self sorowe ¶eutropius libro secundo aboute tyme fourty thousand galles passed hilles alpes slayne romayns ¶these galles leder callyd brytom • r • made theyr auowe swar wold neuer doo theyr gurdels knyghthode till come capitoyl rome soo befell whan ouercome enulus consul putte deth capytoyle yere grete antyochus bygan regne siria ¶ tholomeus eupator wyse callyd philopator euergetes sonne regned egypte seuenten yere tyme dedes doo redde fyrst machabeis trogus libro 30 tholomeus euyl lyuynge called philopator· lefte dedes knyghthode yaue hym sleuth lecherye childrens nicete man slaughter slee peeres spende nyghte hoerdome day festes atte laste slough erudyces sister wyf yaue hym al strompettes harlattes ¶ therfor grete antiochus wroth wold han wonne egypte nadde lette hoost huyred oute grece ¶ atte last tholomeus deed lefte child of· fyue yere of▪ age kepe kyngdome bygoten erudyces strompettis hanged euerychone eutropius libro tercio yere began second bataylle called bellum punicum dured seuenten yere ¶ batayll romayns ouercome vyctors harme quytte hanybal auul caris sonne child nyne yere olde sworn owne fader atte auters goddes wold yeue romayns bataylle sone myght hanybal twenty yere age eyght monethes sieged saguntin fayrest cyte spayne moost frende romaine romayne sente messager hanybal prayenge wolde leue siege bycause couenaunte bytwene bem rather prayer despysed messager went forth affryca playne couenaunte broken sawe nought torned hoome ayene rome ¶than meene tyme saguntin destroyed maner saguntin gretely greued siege grete honger one hanybals knyghtes frende cyte wente cyte counseylled men cyte yelde vp al gold siluer ryches therinne shold escape self lyue aduysed hem toke counseylle made grete fire threw therinne al gold siluer hem self atte last whan cyte destroyed hanybal lefte broder astrubal spayne hym self honderd thousand fotemen ten thousande horsmen fourty olyfauntes passed hilles alpes spryngyng tyme man passed byfore went ytaly ¶ mene tyme cornelius scipio consul rome werred spayne ¶ orocius ¶ hanybal passed hilles pyrene made hym weye yren amonge cruel peple galles cam xix daye hilles pirenes alpes harde sette four dayes galles· made weye yren fyre netheles highest hille appenuinus hanybal closed twey dayes snow· loste many men olyfauntes beestis ¶ treuisa pirenus highe hille spayne many hyghe hilles side cleped monte pireni alpes hyghe hilles side ytaly therforth hanybal went rome hanybal heete penitus also therfore alpes cleped appenuini though penitus hilles eutropius ¶ tho wonderfull meruaylles feered romaynes· amonge alpes semed sonne faught mone ¶among capenes semed twey mones risen among falistes semed heuen clouen ¶than whan herd comyng hanybal cornelius scipio sente forth spayne hanybal mette hym ouercome hym first ticinum beet dewne hooste rome ouercome hym efte atte riuer crema atte thyrdde tyme scomfyt sempronus hooste come oute scicilia atte fourthe tyme slough flameus consul fyue twenty thousand hooste toke six thousand prysonners titus soo harde fyghtynge fyghtynge men wyst erthe shakyng faught threwe downe cytees claf hilles ¶eutropius libro tercio ¶atte fyfth tyme fabius maximu • sent ayenst hanybal pyght pauilons hyest hilles pryuate place wodes scorned hanybals strength wayted tyme ouercome hym· ¶ syxth tyme consul rome lucius emilus paulus publius terencius varro sent ayenst hanibal fabius maximus warned hem hanybal soo froward cruel fyghtyng yt shold neuer ou er come hym taryeng bataylle fyghtyng· theywere feruent dide ayenst coūseyl ouercome canna streyte apulea wynde grauel reered winde halpe wel hanybal slayne xl knightes romayns fyue thousand peeres consul senatours deed owther take doubte tho last daye state rome yf hanybal couth wele haue vsed vyctorye couth wynne fyghtynge· r· hadde gone anone vyctorye take cyte ¶titus soo grete slaughter romayns· hanybal bad men spare romaynes· ¶ eutropius varro consul torned rome fyfty horsmen moo ¶ senatours preysed hem wel nought disparagyde commente rome shaued neuer berde heede ete neuer lyggyng wold haue worship til sawe· wreche hanybal tho neuer seen byfore bonde men mē werre made free· theues mansleers prysonners made knyghtes orocius ¶also poletarij ordeyned gete childer made knyghtes sawe cheualrye rome myght wele soore ashamed knyghtes ne senatours wyse ne couth craft ¶eutropius ¶and hanybal profered hem prysoners raū som romaynes answerd sayd bourges myght taken armed nedeful cyte therfor hanybal slough somme prysonners sold somme dyuers londes· sente thre busshel gold rynges taken handes knyghtes rome cartage tokē vyctorye titus ¶than comons rome soo born soo bare spoylled temple bra yren make hem armoure therof ¶for armour offred temple halowed goddes vsed doo theyr vyctories taken ayene oute templis soo grete nede meschyef yn also hem lakked shipmen gouerne shipes theyr tresour suffysed wage werrours therfor consul senatours bade euery man shold • ryng rich tresory ¶therfor bygan grete stryf bytwene comō te senatours one consul alayed strif maner sayd grete passith comons worship dygnyte soo shold passe theym coste beryng charge helpe cyte soo ordeyned euery degre shold offre gold comyn tresorye take one ring hym self another wyf sholde offre camprenol golde sonne euery doughter vnce grettest shold begynne first soo done ther moche money brought offred wardeyns myght wryte name hem brought money gold nowther brynge tresorye al brought orocius libro quarto tyme meschyef rome sette many myshappes senatours toke hem reede flee oute ytalye gete hem place dwelle dyuynes axed counseyl appolyn answerd romaynes sayde· ther shold saued yf myght gete god highte numen matris pessimite· therfor messagiers sente frigia fetche goddesse hight sibyle messagyer wey axed counseyl appolyn appolyn counseyled hym gete helpe attalus kyng lasse asia gete ymage also appolyn counseyled hym whan ymage comme rome sholde firste brought beste mannes hows cyte ¶ whan alle doo one scipio nasica chose best man rome· mette ymage grete multitude wyues ymage hight numen matris pessimite sibyle also vnderstande moder goddess hight bretnicia moder hilles hight holy frygya worshipped specially wode frigia whiche woode callid idea r· ouidius de fastis seyth happe come vp amonge romayns euery yere fourth day aueril helde feste bathynge goddesse lretnicia ¶ whan ymage brought frigia hit wasche ryuer al • water falleth tiber ¶than ydo fowle songes gestes iapes ny • e mynstraley euery suche geste cleped amen ¶hanybal tenth yere comyng moeued hooste oute campania anone ryuer amen atte thyrd stone thre myle oute rome hanybal hym self noble hors men swyfte wente anone yate rome hight porta collma ¶the consul withdrewe fyghtynge whan sheltrous arayed eyther side· felle grete reyne medled hayle stone hoostes shent vnnethe mighte holde theyr wepen· fyghte theyr tentes ¶and whan clered fayre weder wente ofte felde ofte fell wel grete tempeste efte compellyd fle eutropius· mene tyme tweyn sent spaine either hight scipio ouercome astrubal· hooste affryca lost fyue thyrtty thousande philip kyng macedonia behighte hannybal helpe ayenst romaynes ilond sardonia forsaketh romayns wherfor duke leders sente iiij place macedonia ayēst philip spaine aiēst astrubal sardonia ayenst sardens ytaly ayenst hanybal therfor leninus consul rome maketh pee attalus kyng asia werrith macedonia ouercome philip kynge toke scicilia thre score cytees also beete downe six twenty cytees come rome grete ioye worship drede hym hanybal four myle rome fledde campania also yere spayne eyther scipio vyctor long tyme slayne astrubal broder hooste left al hoole sounde therfor scipions sonne hight publius cornelius scipio noblest mā wel nygh al romayn sent spayne xxiiij yere age ¶whome senatours romaynes take rede forsake ytaly drede scipio drewe swerde forbede theym sayde soo hardy behighte wold defende cyte countray ¶ scipio went forth toke cartage spayne therinne grete plente money grete araye men armes ¶ yelde vp pledge spayne theyr frendes sente mago hanybals broder prysonner rome wel fayr maide prysoner amonge myld fader delyuerd toke hirto owne spouse weddyng foryaue hir raunsomme dower ¶for whiche doynge assente spouse mayde wel nygh al spayne torned scipio mene tyme fabius maximus wanne tarente slewe cartagylo ytaly sold fyue twenty thousand prysonners hanybal triste spayne myght lenger beholden ayenst scipio sente broder astrubal shold come hym oute spayne hadde consul rome sette enbuschementes defended nobely slewe hym atte last eyght fyfty thousand hoost deed fyue thousand take four fourty thousand bourgeys rome foūde clypped geders also astrubals hede throwen byfore broder yate whan hanybal sawe made grete sorow fledde brucia grete scipio sent oute spayne iosephus libro duodecimo ¶ capitulum 34 tholomeus epyphanes fyfth kynge egypte eupaters sonne regned four twenty yere ¶ trogus libro tercio ¶ began regne whan fyue yere old· messares allexandria prayde romaynes wold take warde childe defende kyngdome egypte philip kyng macedonia antyochus kynge siria cast couenaunt dele kyngdome egipte bytwene tweyn ¶ romayns glad message anone sente messagers kinges chargyng shold holde theym oute egypte iosephus libro duodecimo thanne ptholomeus wext strong yonglynge sent one scopa duke siria made siria subgette hym· longe antyochus ouercome scopa better frende iewes eutropius libro tercio ¶ grete antyochus bycome ptholomeus frende wedded doughter cleopatra wyf graunted stede dower siria inde fenicia therfor eyther kynge iewes onias rightfull symons sonne bisshop warnid trybute counseyled none shold payed f • r loue lawe ¶ netheles couetyse wold goo speke kynge· sister sonne iosephus went ptholomeus kynge grace kyng foryeuenesse trybute seuen yeres made leder kyngdome tresorer trybutes lyues ende two twenty yere ¶iosephus libro duodecimo capitulo quarto ¶this iosephus wold essaye wytte yonger sonne hilcanus twelue xere old gete hym broders doughter bytoke hym thre honderd yoke ox ere sowe wyldernesse home two iourneyes hidde reynes ox shold • yed ¶ whan come place ther sholde crye plowman ra •• e somme hem shold wente hoome fader fetche reynes childe sayde nay· lete • e somme ox lete greythe flesshe plowman mete kytte reynes skynnes teye ox fader wondred therof sente hym stede worship feste kynge ptholomeus hadde yong sonne newely bore fader profered sonne hircanus grete ryches coste weye yeftes yeue kynges sonne childe seyde nay· saide coude lyue soberly lesse coste wolde doo nede· sende lettres sayd child arion procuratour allexandria praye hym lene moche byhoueth fader hoped ten talentes ynough worshipe kynge sone prayd aryon lettres wold take talentes sonne· ¶ hircanus cam lettres aryon • aryon asked moche behoued thousand talentes sayd aryon wolde graunte ten· hircanus cast hym boundes aryons wyf wente anone complayned kynge kynge axed hircanus dyde soo ¶for suche seruauntes sayd shal punysshyd knowe· ne make difference bytwene smal grete ¶ aryon herde kynge alowed hircanus answer dede· delyuerd hym thousand talentes ¶and anone bought marchauntes honderd chyldren lettred honderd maydens eueryche talente whan day feste come hircanus cause yonge sette last wyse men bare bone men lefte skorne sette fore hircanus ¶ one tryphon iaper sawe sayde openly fore kynge loo lord kynge howe childe hath eten flessh soo many bone soo fader thy receyuer tresorer siria spoylle • h moneye men siria ¶ kynge loughe axed childe soo many bone fore hym ¶skylfully lord kynge sayd childe houndes eten boone flesshe thy ghestes done daye men ben norysshed taught spare boone ye see spare ¶on morne hircanus axed euerych kynges frendes howe moche eche wolde yeue kynges sonne ¶and wolde yeue mooste answerde sayde scarcely ten talentes ¶ thenne hircanus feynede hym soory • thoughe myghte yeue fyue whanne daye natyuyte· come ¶ hircanus childe gaue kynge honderde child ¶ eueryche hem bare talent honde yaue quene honderd mayde child eche talent hond ¶ euery man preysed hym wel therfore kynge dide hym grete worship made hym ryche sente fader lettres commendacōn preysynge netheles fader wrothe grete yeftes yeuen ¶ also elder brether gre • e enuye hym grete worship f • rforth werred ayenst hym tweyne hem dede fyghtyng· treuisa take hede talent grete weighte gold syluer metal ther thre maner talentes lest weyeth fy • ty pounde myddel two seuenty pounde th • moost six score pounde ¶ foloweth historye hircanus passed flome iordan gadred kynges trybute straunge nacions many yere gyder bylded wonder tour oute therof pursued ofte arabyes men arabia alle tyme selencus regned siria whan selencus dede hircanus drad cruelte antyochus epyphanes slowe self owne hand aboute firste yere tholomeus grete sapio whiche nobly born hym many grete dedes spayne made consul sente affryca made subgett ammorus duc thaffres syphaces kynge numydya whan herd wel nyghe al ytaly forsoke hanybal hanybal xvij yere comyng ytaly boden men cartage retorne home· soo retorned oute ytaly soore weping whan hanybal comē destroyid pee thaffres made scipio· condicion pee suche thaffres shold haue thyrtty shippes sholde • ue fyue honderd thousand pound siluer pondo pounde· sholde also sende home alle prysoners banysshed men taken hanybal sente thre spyes espye scipions tentes ¶ spyes taken ladde aboute tentes· made wel • ase mete drynk thēne scipio sent home agayn thenne harde fyghtynge bytwene two dukesbut scipio vyctorye· hanybal nygh taken pee graunted men cartage scipio tourned agayne rome callyd affrycanus maner second batayll punicum ended
