tyme· yere plantus deyed rome grande atte querne bakar hyre hongre scarsete corne whanne myght haue whyle wrote fable sayd whan second bataylle punicum come batell macedonicum ayenst philip kynge titus quincius ouercome ladde twey kynges sonnes macedonia lacedomonia plegges charyot lad home romains hanybal take sold grecia lete shaue heedes token shauyng away boundage romaine werrid ayenst grete antyochus kyng siria destroyed kyngdoms nyghe aboute hym also held hym hanybal wente oute affryca· eut li 4 antyochus saw hanybal spake ofte messagers rome suspect forsoke haue hym counseyll yf cleped otherwhiles conseyll cause shold wene suspecte forsake coūseyl hanybal counseylled alway warre aiēst romayns abyde sayd romaynes might ou er come contray cōtrey quoth may ouercome home ben brutel lyghtly ouercome· nedith wrastle wysely ayenste ben ouercome speke not· ayenst openly withstondith· though̄ counseyll oft good spedeful alowed kyng hym suspect also makyng bagbyters wold alowed kyng therfor kyngis hoost ouercome bothe see londe antyochus kyng forthought dydde hanybals coūseyl made hanybal pryuy coūseil eutropius libro quarto ¶for philip kynge macedonia halpe romaynes ayenst antyochus sonne demetrius prysoner plegge sente hoome ayene scipio nasica grete scipio hight affrycanus nenew ouercome hanybal batayll see londe hadde surname cleped asiagenus asia ouercome antyochus kyng yaue yonger sonne antyochus epyphanes romaynes pledge euermore elder sone selencus hadde pee vpon couenaunte sholde leue europa lasse asia holde hym within hille moūt taurus ¶ also sholde bytake hanybal romayns eggyde counseylde werre ayenst rome· ¶ therfore hanybal dradde tournede prusia kynge bythynya ¶ trogus libro trisesimo secundo mene tyme whan emnenes attalus kyngis broder siria shold ouercome prusia hanybal helped prusia newe sleght batayll diuers maner addres serpentes closed erthen stenes threwe hem shippes enemyes myddel batayll thā enemyes aferd withdrewe hem anone ¶ romaynes herde herof sent messagers made kynge one axed haue hanybal theyr owne hande hanybal lykked venym owne rynge dyed nychomedia certayne sate neuer soper withoute bataylles· amonge many wonder fayr maydens lefte neuer chastyte· neuer bytrayed ymagynaciō owne men nouther enemyes ¶r orocius libro 4 sayth ylonde called insula vulcani whiche ylond neuer byfore seen sprange vp see scicilia yere hanybal dyed yet alway vnto day pol libro sexto hanybal redde whan antiochus kynge shewed hoost royally arayed gold siluer ryche aray axed hym yf suffysed romayns trow sayde hanybal ynowgh though romayns couetoꝰ mē liue vnderstode easyly shortly frowardly vnderstode praye strengthe hoost plenius libro octauo capitulo octauo· hanybal ofte whan maystrye compellid prisonners rome fyghte vpon grauel stronge beestes promysed one wold delyuer hym yf threwe downe olyfaunt whan beest cast hanybal sente horsmen slee man anone right ¶pol libro primo hanybal sayd worthy lyf· myghte compellyd fyghte beestes troweth sothly hanybal slough man grete enuye wold romayne shold haue soo grete name worship greter dede hadde herd byfore ¶ also wolde diffame beestes strength whiche hadde ofte ferde enemyes ¶ eutropius libro quarto ¶ yere scipio affrycanus dyed auntern hadde longe exyled oute rome vnkynde cyte ¶ valerius libro whan scipio accused money amonge senatours answerd sayde whan wan al affryca made subgette vnder power· toke thynge therof name affrycanus also rychesse affryca made couetous neyther rychesse asia made broder scipio couetous eyther v rycher enuye money ¶salustius scipio sawe one child gayly arayed sayd wonder arayeth wel childe helpith hym doth swerde ¶valerius emila scipions wyf goodly though wyst hyr husband loued one hir bonde woman wold diffame lord conquerour affryca woman reese anger absteyned hir soo vengeaunce wreche made hir bond woman fre maryed hir right wele whan hir lorde deede pol ¶scipio deyed ordeyned suche wrytyng tombe • te cyte palustres thou vnkynde contrey receyue thou bone ¶augustinus de ci de li 1 scipio nasica byfore thyrdde batayll punicum forbade settynge vp enhauncyng theatre cyte rome twey iugges arayed forto arere scipio sayd grete enemye werriours norysshe slouthe lechery· therfor pleded soo strongly people aray therof sold bench stole formes al maner subtylytees done then soo brought men sholde stande si • te see playes myrthes saue manheed maner vsed amonge romayns vcxlviij yere r auctours seyn theatrum place shapē half cercle myddel therof lytel hows called see na hows poetes gestours vp pulpyt rehersed poisies gestes songes without mynystrals coū trefayted doynge dedes spake gestes songes bendyng wyndynge settynge styntynge ly • me body ¶ augustinus libro primo capitulo trisesimo primo thes playes called ludi scenici firste ordeyned excytinge deuyl· men shulde exyted suche dedes whan myghte theatre goddes done suche maner dedes ¶augustinus libro quarto capitulo 25 ¶ passyng tyme· chorle called titus latinus warned dreame shold telle senatours sholde restore renewe playes callyd ludi scenici playes teatre warned twyes dyd nought therto loste owne sone warned thyrdde tyme dyd noughte therto felle greuous sekenes till warned senatours hoole wonder sodenly whan wonder seen senatours spende foure suche moneye •• wonte pleyes theatre make good churles trespas four sythes recheles warne senatours warned petrus 204 grete selencus sother grete antiochus sonne regned siria asia twelue yere fader slayne pers temple god naneas throwen oute gobet • le traytorly preestes bygyled hym temple promysed tresour hid vnder erthe ¶ capitulum 35 tholomeus philometor regned egypt xxxv yere symon onyas sonne preest temple bisshop bought presthode appolynus duc fenicia selenchus herd therof sente elyodorus vndoo dede whan entred spoylle temple twey yonglynges aroos oute preuy place slough semeth iosephus meaneth angel lykenesse men netheles secundo machabeorum wryten dredeful horsman shewed • h trade slough hym ¶ ioseph li 12 aboute tyme ihus siraks sonne wrote book callyd ecclesiasticus called panerethon thyrdde yere philometor one aristobus iewe paripaticus aristotle loore wrote tholomeus declaracion exposicion moyses bookes eutropius libro quārto yere dyed philip kynge macedonia sone perseus rebel aienst romains emilius paulus consul rome ouercome hym wel stronge batay • le slewe thyrtty thousande grekes dyde worship though ouercome whan wolde falle downe feete wolde suffre hym sette hym beside vpon seete rel • esed half trybute wonte payed promysed macedones sholde free shold seme romaynes warrydde ryghtwysenesse moneye trogus libro trisesimo tercio· fightyng one mēninus catō aduocates sone fought mightely fil doū hors fawght foot wold haue smiten grete man swerd fel doune hond defended sheld gadred swerde amonge swerdes enemyes sight bothe hoostes many woūdes torned oune sidde men toke ensample hardynesse faught orpedly the· hardynesse cause vyctorye perseus take afterward macedonia fyll romains first craneus anone perseus londe fyue thyrtty kynges eyght honderd yere four twenty ysid libro sexto emilius paulus brought firste bookes rome oute grece afterward iulius cezar chargith marcus varro doynge make lybrarye amonge cristen men pamphilius martir gadred lybrary bokes eusebius wryteth thyrtty volume bokes lybrary thā orygenes passyde byfore hym ierom sayth radde six thousande volume orygenes bookes austyn passyde trauaylle alle vnnethe may man rede bookes antyochus epyphanes regned enleuen yere siria asia· pledge rome owne fader herde speke broder nycete hoped kynge sciria went pryuely rome though somme men tellyth escaped assente senatours fyrst godely peple yaf another name callyd epyphanes worthy noble seemly aboue ¶ regned broder selencus whan broder deed ¶ yaue sister gyle tholomeus wyf wolde reioyse egypte whan sawe tyme ¶ thanne wente egypte vpon tyme though see sister neuewes ¶ made tholomeus slaine sate mete egypcians put awey shold kynge ouer hem ¶ came ayene two yere besyeged alexandr • ¶ trogus trisesimo quarto lo messagyers rome sente delyuer egypcians mette antyochus wandryng see stronde dyd message manere senatours peple rome chargeth commaundeth thou goo awaye theyr frendes egypcians ¶than antyochus axed respyte day yeue answer marcus publius made yerde cercle sande aboute antyochus sayde senatours peple rome chargith commaunde thou neuer passe cercle er thou haue yeuen thyne answer peple rome wol haue soo sayd antiochus lo goo r torned iewry many euyl tornes ¶therfor bisshop onias symons sonne wēt egypte gate frendship kynge buylde ther temple • leopoleos like temple iewes sayd dede fulfylled isayes prophecye sayde aulter oure lord shalbe egypte mynde hym shal endes therof temple dured soo two honderd yere fyfty vnto vaspasianus tyme destroyed temple cyte also ¶than bisshop onyas dyed sayde twey bretheren ihs iohan stryuen byfore antiochus bisshopriche please antyochus torned vsage doyng mysbyleued men soo ferforth toke name mysbyleued men soo iesus callad iason iohan named menelaus ensample hem many iewes brought doynge dedes vsages mysbyleuyd men made ierusalem harlattes howses place yonglyngys vse theyr nicete yn lefte hem vncircumcided cleped hem self antyochenes ¶ antyochus made iason bisshop putte hym oute afterward made menelaus bisshop counseyled andronicus wt slee brother iason folowed kyng antiochia make hym chaū ge purpoos soo done ¶therfor kynge wroth slough andronicus· ¶petrus 206 tyme antyochus sold iason bissopryche prystehode fyre sacryfyce acquenchid dured byfore vnder water lxx yere antyochus toke ierusalem treson cytezeins toke then ten thousand cytezeyns compellyd iewes maumetrye slough hem wolde offred swynes flessh toke away holy vessel· mete bord stone lanternes temple clothes sette iupiter olimpicus ymage euen temple forbade sacryfyce moyses lawe tour sion put men macedonia hated iewes antyochus tyme seuen brether slayne owne moder ¶that tyme mathatias preest cyte modyn helpe fyue sonnes awreked lawes forfaders iudas eleped machabeus pris maystrye capteyne amonge leder ¶ petrus 207 ¶ machatias taught iewes fyght saturday lawe people shold loste ruled peple one yere dyed afterward made sone symon fader counseylour iudas machabeus leder hoost ennyus poete dyed euyl articularis buryed scipions tombe iudas machabeus kept lawes forfaders full thre yere slough appolinus duc samaria faught afterward swerde antioohus went pers trybute vnpayed iudas machabeus ouercome antiochus leders lisia norysshed yong antiochus tholomeus gorgias nycanor clensed temple renewed it· gras breres busshes growen soo thyrdde halowynge temple done iudas tyme moneth december halowynge named eucennia dured afterward petrus 211 ¶antiochus shamely chaced pers herde prince ouercome iewry manaced iewes anone taken antar • u ache sorowe bowel felle doun chare hurte ful soore wormes sprange oute bodye stenche hym greued allthe hooste bythought knowleched hym byfalle sorowe defowled temple ierusalem therfor made auowe wold iewe delyuerd iewes make peer men athene sayd also man sholde subgette god make hym self peer euen god soo dyed montaynes antyochus e • pater forsayd antyochus epyphanes sonne regned fader gadred ayenst iewes honderd thousand fote men twenty thousand horsmen two thyrtty olyfauntes shewed hem iuse grape beryes sharp hem batayl ¶ petrus 213 ¶ capitulum 36 demetrius sother selencus sone wēt cyte rome occupyed citees see side bygā regne regned asia· siria twelue yere come rome childhode accuse vncle antiochus epyphanes put hym • kyngdome therfor whan herd vncle deede went ayene many receyued lord kynge soo hoost siria wold slee licia yong antyochus aboute reygne alchimius made preest arons ordre accused machabeus demetrius many manere thynges dedes therfor sente bachides destroye iewry iudas withstode hem soo spedde therfore alchimius torned ayene kynge nychanor sente kynge ayenste ¶iudas slayne hede right hande hanged toward ierusalem hadde prowdly spoken iudas connexed frendship romayns couenaunt wryten table bra iudas machabeus slayne bachides alchimius broder ionathas roos stede leder iewes nyneten yere ¶ alchimius bygan destroye goddes hows werkes prophetes smyten palesye dyed· bachides torned efte kynge two yere lande quiete pee alysaundre antiochus epyphanes sonne occupyed tholomayda achon confedred ionathas slough demetrius kyng regned nyne yere siria asia wedded cleopatra tholomeus doughter demetrius· demetrius sonne fledde creta moder kyn whan fader slayne cam ayene gadred strengthe occupyed landes see side tholomeus gaf doughter cleopatra wyf whiche byfore yeuen alysander soo tholomeus traytrely occupyed alysanders cytees entred antiochia toke hym twey dyademes egypte asia alysander ouercome hym fledde arabia sone antiochus moders cosyns kyng arabia drad tholomeus strength sente hym alysaundres hede tholomeus dyed thyrd day demetrius regned ¶ petrus 219 ionathas accused demetrius wonne tour ierusalem sente grete yeftes demetrius gate grace hym soo renewed pryncipate presthode thenne demetrius assured londe shold pee owne honde lette hoost go home euery mā owne place heelde hym straunge hooste therfor peple hadde indignacion kyng ionathas sente kyng thre thousand chosen men chacede traytours atte last one tryphon somtyme one alysaundres frendes arabia brought then yong antyochus alisanders sonne crowned kyng faught ayenst demetrius ouercome hym chased hym antiochus made frendship ionathas sent hym vessel purpre lace sylke made broder symon duk leder· ionathas renewed frendship romayns sparciates eutropius libro quarto ¶ thyrdde batayll punicum aroos whan men cartage hadde away theyr shippes armoure· hem thought dede hem laked bothe bra yren made hem armour gold siluer made hem twey duke leders eyther heet astrubal yonge scipio grete scipions neuewe ouercom • hem toke cyte destroyed fyre soo brēt six • ene dayes geders soo stone bren • e asshes powder soo cartage destroyed aboute seuen honderd yere first bylde· r soth acoū te kyng danidris tyme w • maystre storyes loke herof first book capitulo de affryca ¶ orocius libro quarto kynge asdrubals wyf manly sorowe womanly wodenesse threwe self twey sonnes myddel fyre soo last lady cartage right suche maner ende dydo fyrst lady ¶ augustinus primo libro capitulo visesimo nono whan thyrd batayl punycum ended marcus cato counseylled cartage shold destroyed scipio nasica counseylled contrarye wolde assente shold destroyed sikernesse sholde enemy brutel wyttes romayns wardeyn keper nedeful childe soo drede nedeful cytezeins pr • ued dede whan cartage destroyed fylle many myshappes cruel stryf tresone thefte robberye sleyng cytezeyns exylyng moche sorowe soo romaynes loste honneste vertues thewes suffred cruelnesse sorowe theyr owne neyghbours cytezeyns strange enemyes knew wel scipio wolde assente cartage shold destroyed wold outrage sholde chasede drede ¶ capitulum 37 tholomeus euergetes regned egypte nyne twenty yere yonge scipio twyes made consul ouercome numantanes made hem subget wel strong batayll spayn romaynes sayd escaped maystrye scipio axed knyght called tiresus cyte somtyme strong myghte ouercome cause aftward ou er come destroyed petrus 22 tryphon desired regne caste slee antyochus drad ionathas hym wolde defende antyochus therfor begyled ionathas slew traytorly twey sonnes also afterward slewe yong antiochus regned asia ¶ symon aroos stede broder ionathas made frendship demetrius kyng wreth tryphon demetrius passed medes gete helpe warre ayenste tryphon take afterward slayne one arsaces kynge pers· hym sonne antyochus regned nyne yere siria made firste frendship symon pursued tryphon flygh see side antyochia laste brake couenaunt frendship made bytw • ne hym symon made one cendebeus duc leder see ¶ shold werre iewry put abak ouercome symon renewyd frendship sparciates ben lacedomones sent romaynes shelde gold thousād mnas treuisa mua maner maner money weyeth sixty cicles ¶ciclus ful vnce among hebrewes amonge grekes latyns· ¶ cyclus quarter vnce holy bokes hebrewe ciclus take vnce hethen menu bookes ciclus take quarter vnce foloweth storye suche frendship made bitwene iewes romains lucius consul rome wrote kyngdoms est londes chargyng shold greue iewes attalus kynge asia made peple rome cyres kyngdom ¶petrus 2 • 5 yere one tholomeus duc iheryco wedded symons doughter bede feste slewe symon twey sonnes iohan symons sonne ouercome hircanes cleped hircanus herde herof occupied ierusalem pursuede tholomeus besieged hym tho seuenth yere tholomeus hadde sette iohannes moder twey sonnes vpon walles cyte made hem blede byfore iohannes eyen iohan left cyte siege went wey antiochus ponticus kyng siria besieged ierusalem therfor iohan hircanus opened tweyne eighte tresor place standith aboute dauithis sepulcre toke then thre thousand talentes yaf antiochus thre honderd talentes go away dele made place socours poure men ceese soo peple grutchyde openyng sepulcre iohan bisshop ouercome hircanes confedered romaynes orocius libro quinto ¶that tyme soo grete multitude grete flyes affryca ▪ ete destroyede corne gras ryndes tree adreynt atte last see affryca afterward throwe grete heepis therof alond clyffes stank foule soo greuously smel therof slewe bothe beestes fowles munidia slayne four score thousand men cartage two honderd thousand men cyte vtica dede thyrtty thousand knyghtes rome lefte kepe contray cartage affryca bylde ayene beste senatours rome twelue yere destroyed· theder brought burgeys rome ¶ antiochus regned thre yere asia twelue yere iohan hircanus destroyed samaria herodes bylde afterward cleped sebasten duke galles wente ayenst romaynes honderd thousand four score thousand men armes ouercome brygge shippes made ouer water rome marcus terencius varro philosophre poete wryter storyes bore rome ¶ orocius libro quinto augustinus libro tercio ¶ hill mount ethna brent passynge wonte doo· soo sette cyte cathenens fyre vndede lordes shippes come ther nyghe brente bowel men ther nygh choked hem hote eyer therfor romains relesshed cathenens trybute ten yere ¶ sequitul capitulum 38 tholomeus sother sonne cleopatra regned egipt seuenten yere marcus tullius cithero born vulcene kynde valerius kepte beestes youth ruled thempyre rome elde ¶it wonder despysed lettres hym self plentuous welle lettres ¶ noble speker al maner tonges wytte wysedom chyef speker tonge assoylled al doutes clerely· wyll clensed enorned al rethoryke axed somtyme come fayr spekyng noble facunde sayd grete gifte god almyghty· knew shold haue fayr maner spekyng wrote gestes troye subtylly myghte closed note sha • e pol libro quinto capitulo sexto cithero wold somtyme bye hows palays money borowed one scilla wryed er bargayne made· cythero moeued denyed al receyued sayde • e wolde bye none hows yf bye hows sayd shal knowleche sothe ye putte afterward whan bought hows putt ayenst ye vnwyse seyde yf ye knowe byers forsake yf wole ought bye make though wold thynge haue b • tter chepe soo myght denye turned bourde laughyng blame trespasse· hadde alway maner doynge ofte ony fowle dede put ayenst hym myght denye wold put mery answer ¶ieronimus ad nepoc said somtyme one tullius maner demostenes nam thou fyrste pleder thou hast bynom hym pleder allone tullius made many bookes sayth libro secundo de diuinacione ¶liber hortensibus four archademicis fyue tusculanis six annunciandi de diuinaciōe de senectute de amicicia de rethorica de officijs de publica ¶ titus six honderd yere fyue fourty byldyng rome bataylle bytwene sertorius pompeiꝰ ¶ batayll dede six honderd knyghtes one syde six honderd side fyrst bataylle endured vnto nyght morowe knyght pompe • u came amonge dede bodyes shold buryed perceyued slain owne broder despysed bataylle· slough self sorowe dede fylle downe deede vpon broders body petrūs capitulo tercio ¶ iohan hircanus dyed thre thyrtty yere ducherye lefte hym wyf noble speker fyue sonnes rule iewry· eldest called aristobolus myght suffre moder regne ouer therfor prysonned moder thre yong bretheren slough hem honger therfore lyued afterward one yere kyng bisshop made broder antygonus lete slee hym whan come armes oute iewry made sister wold lye hir soo kyngdome iuda restored ayene withdrawe fro sedechias tyme vnto aristobolus iiijclxxv yere petrus capitulo quinto ¶ whan aristobolus deed wyf child toke elder broder alysaundre iammeus oute bandes made kyng ful euil man slough owne second broder kepte thyrdde brother lyue pryuely space fyue yere slough fyfty thousande old men withsayde vice euyl doyng axed tyme shold plese iewes answerd shold plese hem yf dede henge foure score wedded men wyues childre ¶ iosephus seyth dyed atte last xxvij yere kyngdome lefte twey sonnes lyue· hircanus arystobolus wyste odyous iewes made wyf alexandria lady iewes ofte bifore wonne loue peple abated ofte malyce tyrannye hir husband lyue marius duc rome six sithes consul ouercome iugurta munidia slew two honderd thousand cunbres come ayenst romaynes toke four score thousand prysoners eft one catulus dede four score thousand ¶ tholomeus alexander • egned egypte ten yere tholomeus sother put oute moder cleopatra chasid cyprys lucrecius poete born dranke afterward loue drynkes werth wode netheles wrote somme bookes bytwene res wodenesse slough hym self owne honde yere lyf four fourty cythero amended bookes eutropius libro quinto the▪ kyngdom siria faylyd fyl lordship romaynes batayll cleped sociale bellum began ytaly pyteus mars pelignes werred strongly foure yere ayenste romayns dede twey consul porans 〈◊〉 ouercome last scylla marius pompeius ¶ capitulum 39 tholomeus sother put owne moder • ekeuerd kyngdome egypte whan moder slayn tholomeus alexander regned egypte eyght yere ffor cytezeyns put oute tholomeus alexander slaughter moder· ¶salustius crispus wryter storyes bore sabyn hym yet moche thynge wryte ¶ tyme seen many grete wondres hard dredeful vnder arysynge sonne seen dredeful clustre fyre feste among aritines bloode ranne oute loues oute newe woundes erthe bete seuen dayes gyder grete hayl stone medled scherdes amōg sampnytes beneuentanes erth opened leyhe fyre • en breke oute stretche vp heuen also beestes wonte lyue amonge men forsoke stabels • esow fledde hilles montaynes lowynge bletynge also houndes forsoke company mankynde ¶ orocius libro quinto playne campania seen shiltrons hoostes fyghtyng men many dayes geder noyse hurlyng geder armour herde seen aftwarde forows steppe men horse ¶ longe bataylle called bellum sociale began bataylle called bellum ciuile· twey bretheren germains bygan batail eyther named grac • u bataylle bygonne lawe called agaria lawe old tyme senatours sholde entremete dede mennes feldes hadde lyuynge feldes withoute ony plee shold falle next bloode gentilmen dyde wyse helde occupyed feldes many men ¶ therfor one graccus day prayer whan thynge shold axed shold restored axed openly feldes soo ••• den shold delyuerd restored ayene peple therfore gentilmen moeued wroth slough two honderd people fete gobettes chayres fourmes stole threwe hem tiber graccus slayne vnburyed long tyme also silla consul went campania destroy alle releef batayll called bellum sociale marius consul six sithes desired nowe consul seuenth tyme profered vndertake bataill • ayenst metridas ¶whan silla wyste therof tourned agayne cyte four legyons entred cyte slough marius messager axed brondes sette cyte fyre besieged marius within capytoyl ¶atte last marius ymagyned fynde meane meoue comonte horsmen helpe tyme atte laste egged bondemen dedes armes hope pray fredome durst withstande marius went vp capytoyl many men slayne vnneth escaped hym self ¶than marius fled tourned marryes wattry places· herodes fonde amonge mory flagges sprayes sente hym silla silla sente cunbres worst enemyes emprisoned hym ¶there semed goddes come hym hym lyghte 〈◊〉 pryson whan tormentour sente sle tormentor hande fayled shoke drede voys herde eyer wherwith cunbres astonyed drede felle grounde betten marius goo wey ¶ r lucanus speketh hap libro secundo ¶ marius flemed hidde busshes fennye titus ¶ marius soo delyuerd help goddesse marica worshiped put hym self hir auow toke felawe cynna greued romaine many maner wyse gate thoffyce consul occupyed seuenth tyme occupyed offyce thyrten dayes tyme first day ianuar whan consul receiuen aray fyrst consul xiij day moneth marius come oute prison passed affrica gadred helpe euery side cam agayne destroye comonte rome made hoost four partyes· one party thre legion toke hym self carbo second party sertorius thyrd cinna fourth sertorius fought strongly pompeus· marius cinna entred cite slough many 〈◊〉 consul senatours ¶ augustinus de ciuitate dei· also marius made octauius consul heede smyten lette sette heede prorostris comune place rome thynges sette vp sight men loke wondre bourgeys wonte stande loke aboute telle myry tale r ¶ lucanus sayth felde called marcius atte grete feeste made sette heedes ge • til men slayne stede mess vpon mete bordee ¶ titus marius cruel many men leuer slee self come marius hande therfore catulus consul dranke venym merula iupiters owne bisshop kytte veynes bled deth ¶ also marius bade noman shold spared though axed mercy owne presence yf self put forth right hande token mercy therfor senatours left gentelmen rome passed grece prayd silla consul helpe comynte rome nygh loste eutropius ¶ tyme silla athene ouercome one archelaus metridas duc slayn honderd thousand men soo archelaus hidde self naked thre dayes depe wattry more whan knowen metridas prayd pee silla assented graunted haue lesse perylle byhynde hym goo sauely surer ciuile bataill ayenst marius silla cam ayene rome slough exyled many thousandes men quintus catulus sayde hym openly whome shal lyue yf slee armed men bataylle vnarmed men pee ¶augustinus libro tercio capitulo visesimo 4· silla gafe l • ue stryf men slee whome wold wey opened take wreche old wrath therfor scilla right wers comonte rome marius wekednesse though vnpunysshed mo men slayne one ¶ eutropius ciuile bataylle dured ten yere destroyed moo honderde thousande men fyfty thousande withoute senatours consul pretoryes edylicies men dygnyte r ¶therfore take hede six batayls amonge romaynes euery batayll called bellum ciuile· ¶ first bataill marius fought ayēst cyte second batayll silla fought ayenst marius ayenst fauctours ¶in thyrdde batayll sertocius fought ayenst pompeus fourth batayll catelina fought aiēst comente v batayl lepidus fought ayenst catulus ¶ sixth batayll bytwene iulius pompeus eutropius sylla torned ayene worshipfully maystry metridas trogus libro 37 metridas metridas sonne kynge pontus rebell romaynes six fourty yere semed somtyme ouercome wold aryse ayene myghte strengthe ¶ delyuerd kynnesmen oute awaytes owne moder slayne owne fyue sone yonglynge taken warden kepe· sette hym vpon wylde hors compellyd hym play ryde ruled hors ouer myght elde wardeyns arayed venym yeue drynke wyse childe drad therof dranke ofte medycynes treacle whiche remedyes put peryl venym yougth myght dye venym whan wold haue dyed venym elde ¶ venym drad ire feyned wolde goo huntynge soo seuen yere cam neuer cyte ne smal towne al tyme neuer hows ouer hede walked lay nyght hilles montaynes trauaylled ofte wylde beestes toke hem swyfte rennynge fought hem· somtyme make body stydfast vse trauayl tendure ¶also whan come rulyng kyngdome chastysed scites myght ouercome byfore sleyght wyt ¶he occupyed pontus macedonia ¶also wente pryuely oute kyngdome toke somme frendes· passed asia wente aboute asia espyed place countrees londe came agayn owne kyngdome founde lytel sone laodyce bothe wyf owne sister brought forch copyner absente landes ¶ therfor wyf ordeygned venym metridas whan come home· warned wenche serued wyf toke wreche doer fals dede ¶ whan wynter comen wold festes felde stryuynge hors rennyng grete dedes strengthe made hoost vse suche trauaylle dedes make hem connynge vse stalworth stydfaste eftsones whan shold fyght ¶ werred galacia despysed manase romaynes ¶ metridas seconde wyf shaar hir heede loue hir husband vsed ride helpe myght yf hir husband fell ony peryll alway hir husband ouercome pompeus fledde sewed alway among ful cruel nacions ¶ giraldus ofte highest consul sylla pompeus ouercome metridas· soo ofte semed myghty stronge occupyed babyloyne asia peased scites made subget capadocia armenia made owne kyngdome stretche streyht vnto inde come ephesus slough al romayns one daye asia sente archelaus duc byfore grece honderd thousād fyghtyng men gate hym al grece atte last holden owne sonne farnaces dranke venym good wylle wold haue dyed greued hym therfor knyght galles greued prayd slee hym slough hym anone ¶ deth pompeus made tigranes kynge siria brente fyre temple ierusalem ¶ capitulum 40 ptholomeus denys regned thyrtty yere egypte tyme plantus latinus grete pompeus endytour rethoricien libertus doctor prosperyte rome sylla consul dyed rome vyctorye metridas nichomedes kynge bythinia made peple rome beires whan dyed whan dede metridas brake pea werred bythynia lytel asia twey consul rome sente ayenst hym· ouercome one hem ouercomen come byhynde folowed slough honderd thousand fyghtynge men 〈◊〉 began newe batayll lxxiiij comune fyghters cokkers robbed brente slough brake spousage • lechery ouercome consul rome gadred hem lx tho • sande men armes thre yere marcus consul ouercome hem apulea naples ¶alexandra otherwyse called sabina alexandres wyf regned nyne yere among iewes slough outlawed many iewes counseyll thephareseys secte bygā tyme eutr libro 6 virgyl marco born nyghe mantua scomers see theues greued robbed alle see soo romayns vyctors alle worlde aboute sure saylyng oute socour ¶but pompeus consul chastysed thes theues atte last pompeus toke batayl ayēst metridas ayenste tygranes kyng armenye socoured fauoured metridas ayenst romayns receiued saued whan fledde romayns ¶ therfore pompeus ouercome metridas bataylle nyghte destroyed castels ande tentes slough fourty thousand men made tigranes yelde self· toke f • om armeny asia made hym bere trybute six thousand talentes syluer moeued werre withoute cause ayenst romaynes therfor pompeus ouercome metridas metridas fledde wyf longe afterward cruel owne men slough twey sonnes far • ace thyrd sonne toke ensample bretheren· soore ferd made hoost torne hym sente pursue besieged owne fader gofforn fader cryed mercy sone wolde metridas prayed goddes sone farnaces myghte somtyme vois owne sonnes ¶ yaue wyf doughters venym drynke slough hem manere myghte dye venym prayd knyghte galles slee hym slough hym anone soo metridas dyed yere age lxx yere kyngdome lx euen pompeus ouercome albans men hiberia siria arabia marc libro 1 ¶ yere ptholomeus sixtene· oracius poete satiricus liricus born venacia cyte ytaly ¶ treuisa ¶here take hede poete called liricus somme poete cleped satiricꝰ hath name satis ynowe matier speketh toucheth atte fulle ¶and thre poetes specially called satirici· oracius percius iuuenalis petrus· whan alexandre dede ordeyned eldest sonne hircanus kyng bisshop ¶afterward twey sonnes lyue hircanus aristobolus stryuen thempire yaue romaynes occasion werre iudea iewry ¶therfor pompeius cam toke ierusalem vnnethe thyrd moneth▪ slough· xiij iewes toke vpon theyr othes· threwe downe walles ierusalem euen grounde yaue hircanus prysthode ledde aristobolus bounde twey sonnes rome lefte staurus lord siria pompeius byfore strengeste bataylles stabuled horse porch place temple neuer grace afterwarde wele spede soo hee foughte neuer ouercome eutropius· libro sexto ¶whan al done pompeius foughten ryally two twenty kynges wente asia made ende old bataylle est landes ¶ metridas sonnes wente fore chare tigraues sonnes also oracius flactus borne venusye sergius catelina noble man blode euyl shrewde wytt wylle conspyred somme grete men right stronge destroye countray ¶ though iulius gayus pleted hym defended partye netheles tullins cythero consul tyme marcus caton pleted ayenst hym put oute cyte sone afterward slayne bataylle also felawes taken one antonius another consul prysonned ther lyues ende salustius made book hem booke named book catelinus conspyracy titus liuius wryter storyes born vyrgyle lerneth cremona gaius iulius cesar made consul gallia iugged iliricus grece x begyōs iulius fought ten yere ayenste germayns galles many harde batayls treuisa galles ben cleped men gallia gallia closed thre noble watres rine rone see occean though gallia ffraūce ofte acompted alone lande countray netheles speke comonly fraunce • gallia gallia conteyned al reame fraūce many countrees londes vnto ryne northward rone estward see brytayne engl • nd westwarde ¶ thanne foloweth storye iulius ix yere made hard batails ayēst germayns galles destroyed foure honderd thousande • fourty thousand germaynes passed ryne wynne gallia made brygge passed ryne wanne sueuia wan al gallia toke pledgis brytons made hem trybutary amonge al grete dedes fought euil thryes moo ¶beda acounteth yere sixty byfore incarnacion yere cam iulius cezar wynne brytayn maner iulius consul werryd ayenst germayne galles deled riuer •• ne come morians ordeyned honderd shippes thyrtty sayles oores sayled brytayne fyrst sette right harde fyghtynge afterward • grete tempest fylle ayenst hym loste many shippes horsmen torned gallia sente certeyne legyons knyghtes irland arayed efte shippes fourty shippes broken grete tempeste wente ayenst brytons ouercome atte fyrst batayll labienus consul woūded dyed right vnneth atte second batayll iulius chaced brytons briton pyghte sharp stake ryuer thamys iulius hadde landed stake grete shapen manne • thygh sette aboute lede yet seen whan romains war gyle escape peryll toke cyte trynouantum sleyght one andragius receyued fourty plegges wente then occupyed cyte cassybala stronge cyte ryche sette amonge water ¶ cesar went gallia sette harde batay • euery side lud kyng brytons dede▪ cleped trynouantum ca • rlud owne name bylde west yate called owne mame ludgate broder cassibelanus regned lud lefte hym twey sonnes lyue andragius teamucius yonge gouerne royamme whan come age cassybelanus yaue andragyus cyte trynouantum ducherye kente yaue temancius ducherye cornewayle ty • e iulius cezar sayled brytayne twyes put whyle kynge andragyus grete stryf andragyus neuew wrastlynge andragyus sente iulius cezar cam wanne londe made kynge cassybelanus trybutary cassibelanus lyued seuen yere iulius goo ¶ crassus pompeius felawe consul gabynus deth sente ruler siria chastley parches waxen rebelle ¶ spede iourneye crassus toke two thousande talentes oute temple ierusalem· whiche pompeius spared ¶ therfore crassus fyghtynge ayenste perch ouercome taken parches melt gold powred throte despysed sayde· thou romayne art thyrste gold nowe drynk gold atte ful ¶ capitulum 41 cleopatra doughter tholomeus denys kynge egipte empryce egypte two twenty yere· two yere fore iulius cezar fyue yere vnder iulius fyften yere octauianus augustus batayll cyuyle bygan bytwene iulius wyues fader pompeius maner giraldus iulius whan trauaylled ten yere wonne gallia germania brytayne axed worship dewe soo grete vyctoryes noble dedes pompeius cato marcellus consul withseyden bade hym leue hoos • · come agayn cyte ¶ eutropius libro sexto auctoryte marcellus consul grete pompeius sente commandemēt legyons luceria puttynge iulius cezar hooste •• ayenst countrey ¶suetoniꝰ ¶ther many maner dygnyt • e rome somme therof dured one yere chyef dygnyte alle dictatours dygnyte dured fyue yere first one dictator afterward comente encreased made thre dictator rome ffor yf fylle ony discorde bytwene tweyne thyrdde sholde redresse it· ¶it happed thes thre dictator geder pompeius iulius marcus crassus whiche pompeius old man chiualrye emeryta lefte home gouerne comonte treuisa xxv chapitre fyrste booke wryten somtyme knyghtes rome sixty yere old sholde compellyd dedes armes sholde home haue certayn lyuelode· callyd knyghtes cheualrye emeryta putte dedes armes· foloweth story • ¶ crassus sente werre ayenst parches taken lost gyle trayson ¶iulius sente west londes dwellyd fyue yere make galles allobrogues men burgoyne subget ¶than helde dygnyte fyue yere owne auctory •• whiche fyue yere warryd ayenst brytons efte ayenst galles ¶ comyng rome ward whan came alpes· sente pompeius who doughter wedded shold araye triumphum worship vyctor rome shold haue comynge rome vyctorye iulius holden dygnyte owne auctoryte lenger shold pompeius warned worship called tryumphus assent senatours iulius wroth wēt cyte aienst pompeius ¶eutropius libro sexto ¶ pompeius dradde senatours consul fledde grece arayed bataylle ayenste iulius cezar iulius entred cyte rome cyte beynge voyde brake comon tresory ¶orocius libro sexto ¶iulius toke four thousand poūde gold six score ten syluer toke four thousande ten thousand pounde deled knyghtes ¶ eutropius ¶and lykenesse pee occupyed dygnytees euerychone wente spayne destroyed pompeius strengthe • oostes thre capytains come grece faught pompeius fyrste bataylle iulius ouercomen chaced whan nyght come pompeius wold folowe pursue chace therfore iulius sayd pompeius couth take vyctory day myghte haue ouercomen ¶ faught thessalia ther pompeius sheltron fourty thousand fote men six honderd horsmen lyfte wynge fyue honderd rygt wynge alle helpe est side nobley senatours pretoryes consul cesar shiltron fully thyrtty thousande horsmen atte laste bataylle pompeius hooste fledde tentes destroyed hym self fledde yonge ptholomeus kynge egypte axed helpe as • gned senatours tutor wardeyn ¶netheles king folowed hap fortune frendship lette slee pompeius sente iulius heede ryng ¶ whan iulius sawe heede rynge wepte wel better teeris went forthwith alexandria tholomeus araied busshementes cezar ouersette strengthe enemyes went boote soo heuy laden men folowed hym sank downe dreynte ¶ cesar swam thre honderde paas one hand helde chartres hande· aboue water come ship▪ comforted anone drenched eyther toke kinges nauey batell on· see easely ynow alexandrynes prayd kynges lyf iulius graunted charged sholde rather essay frendship romaynes dedes armes netheles anone free· yaue cesar batayll hoost sone destroyed cesar bytoke kyngdome woman callyd cleopatra dwellyd hir two yere lecherye hugo capitulo ianus tyme iulius amended kalender fonde cause leep yere r ¶the romaynes hebrewes bygan yere marche vnto numa pompilius tyme numa put ianuar februar yere vncertayne manere yere fully amended byfore iulius tyme quintilis fyfth moneth marche afterward callid iulius worship iulius cesar born moneth moneth dyde somme grete dede vyctory· suche • er skyle sextilis six • moneth marche cleped augustus worship augustus cesar eut cesar remeoued egypte ouercome f • rnaces metridas sonne bataylle let • e slee hym meyntened pompeius ayenst iulius thennes wente rome made hym consul thirdde tyme ¶ went affryca ouercome batayl noble duke scipio porcius cato iuba kynge mauritania slough hem self afterward ¶r seneca epistola 26 pol libro septimo capitulo sexto spe • en caton seye dranke venym smote hym self brest • swerde soo • lde vp gooste ffor wold see cesar regne lyue also seneca secundo libro ad seuerum cato lyued fredome nowther fredome aft er cato ¶also anoth • r story rome seyth cato bataylle bytwene iulius pompeius herd pompeus deth redde platoes bookes de inmortalite anime sawe booke sowle maye dye soo wounded self fre ndes counseylled lyue leche dide cure woūdes whan • go opened wounde soo dyed doynge excu • able cato neuer wele l • • red gloryous first frendes counseylled hym c • ntrary wyse men kynde ¶also counseylled sonne doo soo counseylled hym rather lyue vnder iulius cesar victor thyrd skyle slough hym self enuye wold suffre see iulius welth ioye semeth cato slough hym self vnstydfastnesse folye wold suffre anguyssh disease honneste voyde escape foule maner doynge take hede many catons rome amonge romayns one cato questor brought ennius poete oute tarent rome another mennius cato fought wonderly ayēst grekes paul emilins tyme ¶ another marcus porcius cato called vtycensis slough self cyte callyd vtyca affryque speke nowe tyme caas tensorius cato hym speketh ierom epistola ad nepocianum sayth shamed whan olde man lerne lettres grue nowther put oute hope trust spede ¶ philosopher secte heet secta stoycorum· treuisa stoici name porche athene called stoa ther peynted dedes doyng wyse men stronge ¶ fyrst philosopher secte named zenon ¶than foloweth story ¶this cato made grete science vertues maners called ethica catonis therof lytle book metre drawen caton childer lerne scole eutropius yere cesar wente efte rome made consul fourth tyme soone went spayn wher pompeus sone arayed right strōg bataylles laste bataylle cesar nye ouercome men fledde poynte slee hym self lest elde sholde falle childres hande grete worshippe ioy grete dedes cheualrye ¶cesar six fyfty yere age atte last men tourned ayene ouercome enemyes efte wente rome made men callyd hym emp • rour callyd emperour passynge lordship one pryncipate callyd cesar kytte oute moders wombe whan moder dede ¶ cesus latyn cutt • englysshe eutropius ¶ whan iulius owne wylle sholde doo worship peple peple dyde hym byfore· wolde neyther arryse ayenste senator whan come hym dyde many tyrannyes doynges ayenst custommes rome lx horsmen senatours rome specially tweyne eyther called brutus conspyred ayenste soo day· whan senatours shold come geder iulius cam capitoyl stykked thurgh hadd • thre twenty woundes dyed ¶ capitulum 42 ivlius wente towarde capitoyle rec • yued lettres iuggis deth messager broughte lettres sayd sholde dede yf come day amonge gadryng peple shal sayde iulius speke astronomer afterwarde shal see gadrynge lettres callyd hym astronomer sayde iulius shold dye kalendes daye sayd iulius kalendes yet lyue ¶ day kalendes sayde astronomer passed wold wer foūde lyer· iulius wēt capitoyl slayn alles comune contekkers brawler first day marche ther semed woūde body lettres foū de hande deth ¶petrus hondreth daye • bifore iulius deth fylle lyghtnynge vpon iulius ymage chepynge place· toke away letter c name cesar· also nyght byfore deth chambre wyndowes soo gryslye soo sternly opened iulius resed oute bed wende hows falle vpon ¶ also day deth ther semed thre sonnes eest wente lytle lytle geders alle one sonne bytokened lordship thre partyes worlde shold come alle one prynces lordship ¶ owther verely bytokened alle worlde sholde knowe trynyte thre▪ persones one god also oxe spake plowe man subarbes rome sayde prykked dryuen ydel shorte tyme sayd men shal fayle ox owther whete also iulius pyler pylgrymes calle saynt pet • r nylde asshes iulius body brent wryten metre man •• ¶thou grete cesar al world eue art sette closed lytel stone r ¶ also many men wrote many thynges praysyng • iulius eutropius libro sexto seyth nomā punysshed daye entred cyte ¶ also made knyghtes haue costlew armour shold defende manly drede soo grete losse ¶ ther neuer man noble bataylle ledynge slayne enleuen honderd thousand four score xij thousande enemyes withoute batayls called bella ciuilia wold wryte nombre hem slayne ciuile batayles treuisa bellum ciuile batayll amonge romaynes hem self foloweth story ¶ iulius fought fyfty sithes baner displayed also noo man wrote swyfter man redde swyfter ¶also vsed endyte four maner pystles lettres one made subget armes ouercome hem myldenesse also ther day harde werres batayls nold wryte rede owther endyte plenius iulius cesars hande able pen swerde man gouerned comonte better al grete lordship bade neuer slee man one domicius yeuen lyf byfore toke hym one cyuile bataylle yaue hym lyf bade hym forswere armes sawe hym afterward fight ayenst hym bataylle sayde knyghtes ynowh yeue vnkynde man one lyf neuer soo wroth man nold foryeue yf sawe skylful occasion ¶ also iulius grete suffraunce· worship comyng rome grete vyctorye knyghtes rome sayd owne hering neuer wrother lo cesar taketh worship vyctor hath ouercome galles hath nychomedes kynge bithinia noon worship victor ouercome cesar· sayde greete frendship hym therfor sayth tullius sayd iulius hayle kynge quene efte hayle quene bythinia thou somtyme woman alle men nowe thou art made man al woman pol libro tercio ¶ iulius cesar sore agreued ballidnesse heer fayled molde fortop wolde bende heer polle toward forhede· knyght rome wa • • eproued cowardyse byfore iulius sayd iulius iu •• u sayd lyghter make balled make ony thynge cowardly hoost rome also ther famous bokes mury gestes made knowen openly despyte hym suffred paciently ynowh ¶also one despysed moder kynne called hym bakar roughte nothynge therof therfor cythero praysynge hym sayth iulius couth foryete iniurye wronge plenius cesar came tyme iulius scole tullius aroos ayenst hym iulius forbade hym sayde· aryse ayenste wytte wysedome better myghte strength shal aryse sayd tullius ayenste vyctor world thou hast wonne worshipful crowne pryce streche oute boundes empyre rome cause word iulius ordeyned lawe redde owther helde book shold aryse ayenst noo man ¶ valerius acius poete aroos ayenste iulius cesar whan iulius cam college poetes axed hym sate stylle comynge grete lord lasse said shal aryse ayenst greter pere shal come pere wyt wysedome passyth iulius alowed sayenge r man childe ond mayde childe brought byfore iulius moost lyke ony childer lyue iulius helde hem tyme yaue grete yeftes sente hem ayene suche versus sheweth al one chere lyke peeres gon fere lat myskyssyng haue pris lyuynge none yuy sprayes none noyse dounes layes ye lyke chere fere withoute ony gyle ¶ apuleus conspiracy catelin come oute cithero best consul tyme dampned ¶ nowther nobley persone gilt nowther roialle spekinge iulius cesar patrone auowry pletede mildenesse pite tyme mighte helpe marcus cato plete ai • ̄st proued gilty ¶ salustius ¶there twey noble men marcus cato gaius iulius wel • ighe one worthines blode age noble roiall speche like grete hert diuerse ioye worship ¶ cato grete clēnes • f largenesse yeftes mildenes one worship cruelnesse fredom yeftes ¶cesar yeftes cato yeuinge none yeftes praised ¶ cesar socoure refute wretch nedye men caton punisshinge euil dooers ¶ cesar wakinge trauaile gendeinge owne noo thynge werne myght doo araye new batails desirous andragius brother andragius wente iulius cesar rome ¶ capitulum 43 whan iulius cesar slayne octauianus rome xviij yere age sente twey cōsuls pursue marcus antonius demed open enemy comente made insurrection ayenst senatours ayenst hem slough iulius cesar octauianus romayne octauius senatours sone come eneas moder side kynrede called iulia familia iulius cesars neuew sister born owne sonne adoptiuus iulius made heyre testamēt marcus ouercome mutina twey consul dyed wey· octauianus grete hoostes commaundemente ¶octauianꝰ made pee marcus antonius atte desire one lepydus mayster horsmen hym marcus antonius fledde octauianus cam rome xx yere age toke dygnyte made hym self consul strengthe afterward regned emperour lvj yere sex monethes somme dayes moneth marche firste day october whiche tyme regned twelue yere antonius four fourty yere al one soo brought worlde one principate lordship ¶ kynges rome hadden name iulius cesar callyd cesares soo cam octauianus augustus name hym augustus hugo capitulo augeo name augustus augere encreace make made eched comune profyte born moneth augustus· owther th • vyctory moneth antonius cleopatra augustus sone one actia iulius sister doughter eutropius libro septimo augustus first empyre wreche iulius deth exyled senatours chaced brutus cassius toke cithero antonius paleys hope acord cithero lxxij yere ¶augustinus de ciuitate dei libro tercio capitulo tercio ¶tullius fauerd tendrely kepte octauianus yongth ayenste malyce antonius hope sholde helpe moche thempyre comune profyte rome netheles octauianus lete antonius slee tullius cythero maner couenaunte acord whan antonius wold haue kytte tullius tong wryten moche ayenst antonius blame tullius answerd metre sayd nought dost thou antoni wrytynge shal nedes abyde ¶eutropius thanne octouianus antonius slough hem slough iulius cesar bothe brutus cassius grete multitude afterward deled thempyre bytwene hem augustus hield spayne gallia ytaly antonius helde este landes ¶valerius libro quarto ¶porcia grete catons doughter whan herde hir husband brutus slaine none egge tole toke brennynge cole mouth somme say ouidius naso poete born pelgius salustius aduocate wryter storyes dyed rome hadde euer • nuye cythero wedded terencia wyf cythero dyuorse put hym forsaken therfor cythero made gestes reproue salustius ¶ysidorus libro primo salustius mayster playes put fyrste l • ttre k • e latyn lettres haue somme dyuersite sowne bytwene c 9 latyn men vsen letter k· ¶ petrus decimo • ptimo ¶the principate iewes fayled herodes ascolonita regned iewry six thyrtty yere fader antipater idumea moder arabia ¶whan hircanus aristobolus broder antipater herodes fader hadde frendes hadden grace iulius cesar hadden bifore pompeus hircanus confermed kingdome iewes· soo shold callyd kynge antipater idumea accused iulius grete falshede shewed openly wemmes four woundes egypte therfore iulius made hym procuratour iewry afterward second sonne herodes afterward called ascolonyta repayred cyte ascalon made procuratour galylee whan antipater slam malyce venym herodes grete grace antonius procuratours made hym bretheren four prynces petrus 14 atte last herodes folowed antonius rome helpe declared kynge iewry crowned capitoyl presence themperour augustus herodes sente twey duke rome sholde put hym kyngdome ¶ antigonus occupyed kingdom iewry meane tyme helpe perch wounded one duke rome herodes myght regne byfore fourth yere atte last helpe antonius that▪ al athene whan ierusalē besieged fyue monethes vnneth • taken herodes broughte kyngdome fourth yere crownynge therfor somtyme moo yeres redde herodes petrus herodes nyne wyues put hem away wedded one mariammes hircanus ne •• arcumcided hym self hir loue torned sect iewes bygate hir alisander aristobolus desides bygate antipater metheta bygate archelaus cleopatra biga •• philip herodes antipas afterward called tetrarcha one four prynces aristobolus herodes sone bygoten beronica doughter owne aunt called saloma bygate grete agrippa aristobolus herodes smyten aungel redde actibus apostolorum ¶ also forsayd beronica gate twey doughters mariammes herodias afterward philippes wyf aristobolus • ame vncle netheles lyuyng philip herodyas bycame herodes wyfe philippes brother ¶ atte laste ther fylle stryfe bytwene hir mariammes herodes wyf saloma herodes sister ¶ herodes counseyl sister slough first hircanus bisshop afterwarde slough ionathas broder mariammes hadde made bisshop ayenst goddes lawe seuenten yere age slough wyf mariammes husbande sister saloma bare hand layne sister saloma ¶ afterward herodes dethe mariammes fell wodenesse man ofte lunatik mad certayn tymes mone toke agayne wyf dosides hir sone antipater sende alysaunder aristobolus sonnes mariamines rome lerne· slough hem afterwarde also herodes lefte many wyse werkes honoured temple reparayled samaria called sebasten worship cesar bylde temple welle iordan fulfylled byldyng cesarea palestina worship cesar sette egle gold grete heuy vpon yate temple callyd speciosa worship romayns iewes bare ful heuy toke euyl ¶ capitulum 44 antonius putte wyf cleopatra cesars sister wedded quene egypte yaue hir arabia couetyse woman haue desired regne rome hir counseyll comforte antonius moeued ciuile bataylle ayenst octauianus ouercome actia grece ¶petrus visesimo octauo herodes batayll tyme antonius sente hym ageyne kynge arabye atte prayer cleopatra shold haue kyngdome ouercome whether euer ¶ eutropius libro septimo ¶ antonius whan ouercome actiū sledde egypte slough hym self ffor none hope helpe ne socour ¶ cleopatra made hir gay mette augustus entendynge meoue lechery myghte spede put warde escaped away leyd hir self graue hir husband antonius dyed venym naddre toke hir afterward egipte fell thempyre petrus 78 augustus enlarged herodes kingdom wytly prouided hym neded toward egipte r sōme acompte firste yere augustus hole kyngdom place aftward regned al one beda suꝑ danielē seith semeth· tyme marcꝰ terenciꝰ varro dyed lxxx yere olde x virgilius mar • poete mantua dyed brundusium whan aboute fyfty wynter old buryed naples wrytynge vpon tombe made whan dyed owthe • ouidius afterward somme men say mantua broughte forth calabres rauessed holdeth percinope made leefe feldes leders r ¶ wyse connynge philosophye vsed ofte nigromancy therfor al • xandre de naturis cerum tellith wonderly sayth napl • greued pestylence blode soukers virgyl threwe golden blood souker bottom pytte many yere golden blood souker take vp oute pytte anone cyte ful bloode soukers withoute remedye til golden blood souker put pytte agayne also sayd th • one marcellꝰ naples myght kepe fles • long withoute appayryng virgyl wytte ordeyned remedye ayenste meschyef closed flessh sauered vertue herbes soo fyue honderd yere flesshe founde fressh good sauour also sayd vyrgyle closed orcha • al aboute ayer stede wal· made brygge ayer vsed go ouer brydge whan whyder lyked sayde also bylde noble paleys rome· sette al ymages prouinces londes hugo sayth put • et • therto collosens ymage sonne owther rom • loke herof fyrst book chapyter rome pol libro primo sayth poete mantua vyrgyl axed marcellus napl • neuewe augustus wherf • • e slough many byrdes whether hym leuer shapen byrd take byrdes owther flye take slee flyes tolde graūtsi • augustus coūseylle chesse made flye myght dryue al flyes oute naples herby semeth comune profyt shold put bifore euery werk varrus tuctu virgyls felawes commaundement augustus amended vyrgyls booke eneydos· netheles vpon suche condicion shold put grete doctor seneca philosophres felawe slough hym self noy sorowe double quarteyne ¶marianus libro secundo one fourty yere augustus seuenth moneth september enleuēth day mone xxiiij day september thursday iohan baptist conceyued two honderd dayes lxxv fryday born soo went bifore crist conceyuyng byrth baptisinge prechyng dyeng must wane crist must waxe encrease· woman goth childe concepcion byrth two honderd dayes lxxvj soo many dayes crist moders wombe· though alle woman goo longe child seynt austyn meaneth de ciuitate dei libro quarto capitulo quinto iohan twey dayes lasse moders wombe ¶ also iohan born whan day bygan shorten wane crist whan day bigan waxe long also iohan buryed without hede crist bone broken ¶ explicit liber tercius ¶ incipit liber quartus octauianus augustus bygan twelue indiction nazareth galylee crist conceyued virgine marie iosephs spouse treuisa grekes vsed somtyme turnemences dedes myghte strengthe atte fote h • lmons olimpus one fyue yere named suche dedes playes olimpias also first fiue yere suche playes named first olimpias second fyue yere suche dedes playes second olimpias third fiue yere thyrdde olimpias soo forth al crist conceyued twelfthe indiction menyng twelue yere indiction therfor take hede indiction tyme fyften yere whan romaynes wonne many prouinces londes eueryche londe wonne thre maner trybute fyften yere clepyd xv yere indiction fyrst v yere indiction romaynes brasse trybute make armour second v yere hadde siluer pay knyghtes thirdde last fyue yere indiccion gold tresory rome petrus criste conceyued ful man soule flesshe soo shappe lymmes body myght seen mānes eye endeth v· age ye world age oft greued care wo transmigraciō iewes vnto crist frō march bifore brēning tēple haruest vnto march ye xlij yere augustꝰ vnder xiiij gnaciōs cōteyneth vc yere xlj seith bede· • seith v c yere xlv elporicius seith· vc four score ix· veryest acoūtes saith v c yere lxxx xj isidre cronike v booke hath one leped ptholomeus filometor bitwene tholomeꝰ epiphanes tholomeus eugetes second ofte ou er lepith tholomeꝰ sother second • ordre regnynge regned moder slayne eyghte yere sixthe age world beginneth crist age certaine generaciōs nowther yeres shal ended deth last age world sōme wol mene sixthe age world bigan incarnacion crist incarnaciō criste vysyted v cam doune heuen somme acounten sixth age world byrth crist auctoryte apostle whan plente tyme come god sende sone born woman somme acounte cristnyng crist vertu yeuē vnto water bryng forth child goostly whan circumsicion bygan cease sōme acoūte cristes passion thanne opened yate paradyse yeres begynnyng world xiiij daye apryl whiche daye world began vnto incarnacion crist fyue thousand two honderd yere soo seith orocius comyn calculyng seyth fyue thousand c yere four score sixtene marcius seyth fyue thousasand c yere nyne fyrste adam synned friday dyed fryday nyne honderd yere xxx suche fryday second adam crist toke flesshe bloode ended fastynge suffred dethe mankynde houre fryday adam put oute paradyse right houre theef brought paradise marianus libro secundo· nought ayenst holy chirche holdeth fyrste adam made erthe ix daye byfore apryl crist conceyuid vij day fore apryl ffor nyght ix day bifore first day apryl come day adā made ynne made cristes passion nyght viij day april goth byfore day ffor viij day bifore april first partye made ix daye byfore april last partye nyght whiche crist holden buffeted scorned made vij day fore apryll foloweth crist suffred ix day viij day vij· day afore apryl maye shewed another reson euery yere letter day chaungeth kalender ther one lettre lij wekys ¶it wonder though fryday begynnynge worlde nynethe day afore apryll whan adam made fylle many yeres seuenth day afore apryl whan criste suffryd dethe holdeth approueth loore greete men auctoryte hooly chirche certayne essaye calcalers 3 ¶ seynt austyne sayth aboue ayenst reson sobre man demeth noo cristen man demeth ayenste holy wrytte noo possible man demeth ayenst holy chirche also take hede seynt austyn sayth criste laye herte erthe thre dayes thre nyghtes fulle hoole thre dayes thre nyghtes criste laye graue· fourty houres laye graue laste ende fyrste day acounte first daye four twenty houres nyght ffrydaye criste deyd ynne crist laye graue hooly seconde daye first partye thyrdde day seynt austyn sayth yche thre dayes nyght soe nyght passed fore daye therby semeth mayster storyes sholde folewyde sayth nyght bitwene saterday sonday resurection come bothe saterday also sonday ¶lucas beda thanne marie aroos conceyued come zacharyes cyte four myle oute ierusalem thre monthes serued cosyn elyzabeth tyl childe mary wente ayene owne hows nazareth ¶lucas wold spouse ioseph̄ take sekerly wyf founde child til aungel charged hym slepe shold take withoute drede ¶lucas tyme come maundement cesar augustus descryue worlde petrus cesar wold wete nōbre londes world subvet rome also cytees euery londe nombre pollys euery cite bad subarbes cit • e smal tounes grete oute euery countray kyth euery man shold departe home owne cyte come byrth euery man shold take penny siluer valewe ten pen tho vsed styward prouynce knowliche self subget themperour rome· lucas therfor ioseph̄ went oute nazareth bethlehem cite wyfe mary childe knowleche mary deliud childe petrus ende xlij yere augustꝰ saterday nyght folowyd day xiiij yere age mary ye vij day afore ianiuere crist born bethlem viij day circumcided sonday xij day byrth epyphany fell friday vj day ianiuere come kinges worshipped crist xl dayes natiuite thursday second day feuerere crist presented tēple inmind therof candelmasse day warnyng angel warned ioseph sleep fledde egypte moder ioseph six yere vnto herodes deth herodes cast slee alle child cause crist wold seker hym amonge ¶ whan criste entred egypte mawmettes ouerthrew fille doun r ¶ seuēth day afore apryll fryday whiche criste conceyued nyght sondaye whiche crist borne honderd dayes thre score sixtene whiche nombre dayes maketh nyne monethes mone six dayes euery moneth thyrtty dayes men acounted old tyme nyne monethes six dayes ben assigned woman goth childe yet ten monethes though woman goo child sixte day yet sothe seynt iohan baptiste seynt mary one daye lasse crist moder wombe r ¶and comyng gyders yeres criste kynges begynnyngys endes ben vncerteyn ful oft falle grete doutes acountynge yeres also yeres lord yere baptysed· yere crist suffred deth ¶ auctors speken dyuersly therfor put away al maner doute take hede beda loore libro de temporibus romaynes byfore numa pompilius tyme bygan yere marche hebrewes numaes tyme put two monethes yere ianyuere feueryere romaynes bygynne yere begynnyng ianyuere holy chirche west londes folowith comyn kalender yere moost vsed grekes brought vp olimpias begynnen yere shortest day wynter ¶but hebrewes beginnē yere marche whan day nyght ben lyke long tyme world firste made ¶ egypcians bygynnen yere heruest ¶ men eeste londes arabes caldeis begynnen yere gadrynge wyne corne fruyte whan tethenges ben brought temple begynnynge october whan day nyght ben lyke longe heruest tyme yet semeth • zechielis vision theer speketh fourth moneth fyfthe day moneth amonge october firste moneth ianyuere fourth r ¶it sayd dyuerse men haue dyuerse begynnynge yeres yet ouer cometh dyuerse yeres happe ther falleth begynneth dyuerse tymes yere moost vse yet yeres kingis begynnen regne dyuerse tyme yere vse yet acounte yeres oure lord twey maner wyse byrthe age ¶ also crist born ende yere vse sonne first yere byrthe seuen dayes natyuy • e yeres daye fyrst yere age twelue monethes cours fyue twenty day december day twelue monethes fulfilled second yere birth soo fyrst yere age fulfylled almoste two yere byrth second yere byrth fyrste yere age therfor yet yeres byrth lorde cours sonne nygh four thyrtty yere half yeres age nyghe thre thyrtty yere half baptysed xxx yere age xxxj yere byrthe acounte yere last partye almoost half yere sothe criste prechid four yere specially thre yere half gospel seynt iohan· crist suffred deth xxxiij yere age xxxiiij yere byrth ¶ r two fourty yere octauianus yere crist born bygan marche endeth marche therfor yere bygan thirdde yere olimpias nyne score fourten endeth fourthe yere olimpias moneth marche fo • wysedome lord ordeyned byrth grekes begynnen yere olimpias therfor yeres oure lord bygynne ende • olimpias yeres kynges emperours begynne ende certaynly right selde· therfor hard acounte olimpias owther yeres oure lord begynne ofte one yere olimpias ende another kingdome augustus acounted march ¶and crist beginneth first yere byrthe ende augustus two fourty yere xlij yere augustus bigynneth fyrst yere age criste xliij yere augustus second age crist xliiij yere thyrdde soo forthe ¶sequitur capitulum secundum whanne oure lord born welle oyle sprang yōde tiber oute tauerne emeritoria ranne al day cercle seen aboute sonne ¶treuisa knyghtes rome sixty yere lefte dedes armes callyd knightes cheualrye emerytoria spende tauerne beyonde tiber therfor tauerne called taberna emeritoria marcus ¶ ymage gold felle doune romulus sette paleys seyd hit shal falle til mayde bere childe also temple pee fylle doune rome ierom vpon worde lyght aryse rightful sayth al sodomytes al world destroyed ¶ petrus whyle herodes arayde child deth sompned amandemente cesar come rome answer pointes owne sonnes put vpon alysander aristobolus ther thre herodes grete name euyl dedes· take hede fyrst herodes ascolemta name cyte ascalon fulbylte cite herodes tyme criste born child • ayne ¶the second hete herodes antipas first herodes sonne tyme iohan baptist byheded crist suffred deth thirdde hete herodes agrippa aristobolus sone aristobolus first herodes sonne· ¶ herodes agrippa slowe ¶iames prysonned peter therfor ben versus made ¶ascalonita sleth child antipas • han b • ptist· agrippa slow iames prisonned peter fryste herodes whan sawe sonnes alisandre aristobolus stroof • older fader herytage kingdome cause theyr lettrure indignacion therof fonded put eldest sonne antipater afore bothe treted fader deth put away wente cesar plaine wronge fader meane tyme thre kingis come ierusalem come ageine herodes wey • herodes trowed begiled • orn • ashamed therfore withdrowe slowe child doo hem deth f • r citacion cesar wente rome come tharses brente shippes kingis come ouer see therinne yere somwhat dayes birthe c •• ste come rome acorded sones· therfore bolder helde sure kyngdom slowe alle child bethlem aboute age crist wyste xij moneth olde vnto two yere olde ynne menynge child two yere olde child one nyght old ¶ amonge whiche one owne child slayne parauenture take norysshyng methodius sayth doon goddes owne dome ordenaunce refte soo many men theyr child sholde refte owne child sone aristobolus alysaundre efte suspecte byhote mede faders barbour· kytte faders throte whan ashauyng· sayd shold truste old man died hoore lockis • e wolde seme yongly therfor fader wroth slewe owne sonnes ¶ also boute put sone herodes antipa kyngdome fauered loued herodes agrippa sister herodyas fader shold eldest sonne antipater hadde byfore hand ordeyned kyngdome wroth fonded venym 〈…〉 fader herodes ware therof put hym prysonne sayth cesar herde therof sayd· l • uer herodes swyne sonne whan proselytus 〈◊〉 • ared swyne slewe owne sonnes ¶ treui • take • de proselytus torneth one lawe another specially torneth lawe iewes another herodes soo proselitus somtyme ¶ thanne foloweth story whan herodes thre score yere old ten felle sekenesse stronge feuer tormented ydchyng sesed swellyng foot wormes wellyd sprange oute pryuey harnoys stenche myght suffryd puffynge bloweyng grete hastynge brethe greuous stronge cogh ofte brekyng soore sykyngys phisiciens bathed hym oyle born forth though dede vsed pare appel ete al mete toke knyfe wold haue styked hym self one cosyns let hym rered crye· crye sprange tydynges noyse kynges dethe thanne antipater prysonne herde therof made grete ioye cause therof anone slayne petrus 46 yere iohan euangelist born ¶ herodes sleyng sone • oposye wormes wellyng oute rotyng pryuy stone dyed wrechidly yere kyngdome seuen thyrtty ¶ vngracio • homly thynges happy thynges make iewes make sorowe f • r deth whether wolde noo • ad • ynge slee al noble mennes child iewry eusebius libro primo capitulo septimo ¶ genelogyes hebrewes rekening kynred nacions wryte bookes preuiest library temple herodes bad brenne al suche bookes hoped therby holden noble man gentyl yf alyen gentilman conteyned none suche bookes nethel • many men hoome suche bookes suche genologyes mynde come v r • dy rekenyng kynred ¶ petrus 6 • first herodes sonne archelaus herodes stryue afore cesar herytage kyngdome· cesar counseyl senatours toke archelaus vnder name tetrarcha half iewry idumea halfdele iewry deled tweyne toke galyle herodes antipa ituria dyacomtidis broder philip archelaus made dyarchus neuer monarchus comyn speche owne boost treuisa dyarchus hath twey deles owther half dele kyngdome monarchus hath kyngdome hoole tetrarcha hath fourth dele kyngdome foloweth story yere crist come agayne oute egypte child iesus foūde temple sittynge apposyng doctours archelaus ofte accused iewes put oute vyan royalme ffraunce stede legge outrage kyngdome iewes made foure kyngis callyd trirarche yere cesar augustus dyed campania moneth september whan hadde regned six fyfty yere half yere age thre score sixten slayne treason wyf linia owther venym somme men wolde mene netheles al yere seuen fyfty acounted kyngdome octauianus augustus ¶ eutropius libro septimo ¶ capitulum tercium augustus loued amonge straunge nacions scites iuwes knewe fore honde name romaynes sente hym messagers gyftes many kynges bylde cytees worship hym called cytees cesareas also kynges wente oute hir owne londes clothed lordes rome wolde renne chaare· atte last hatid soo werre stryf wold neuer werre ayenste man withoute rightful cause sayth doyng proude booster lyght wytted man breke surte stryf disease people couetyse worship laureal leues withoute ony fruyte ¶ also sayd werre shold meued withoute cause grete profyt lest grete boost wonnen lytel profyte faire golden fisshoke lesyng therof maye quyt wynnyng takynge fysshe also mylde cytezeyns trewe frendes selde wold receyue frendship holde frendship trewe stydfast kunnyng arte science specially fayre spekyng soo besye noo daye sholde escape wolde rede wryte declare rightwysenesse ¶ysidorus libro primo brought vp first lettir x wrote therfor c r fonde vp skylfully figure therof like crosse crist born tyme ¶ eutropius echid cyte rome fayr howses ioye saye fonde cyte brande tile leeue cyte marbel· fayr al body eyen fayrest al ¶ soo grete soo fayr man al oute vyces synne· angry myght suffre wretheful pryuely enuyous openly disseyuable coueytouse lordship player dyces· though grete eter drynker wyne yet absteyned slepe vsyd lechery name fame coūted therof amonge comyn peple ¶for wonte lye bytwene twelue suche wolde lyghtly assente synne bytwene twelue maiden also dide away wyf scribonia wedded one linia graunt assente husbād sone tiberius drusus though gret • lecherour yet toke grete wrech lechery seneca· romains sawe fayre wolde haue made hym god forsoke hit wold assente axed therof counseylle sibilla tibur • ina fastyng thre dayes answerd hym maner token dome erthe shal waxe wete swote oute heuen shal come kynge last shall euer ¶and forth many versis • ere wreton augustinus libro decimo octauo capitulo 24 ¶ heede lettres versis speketh menynge iesus crist goddes sonne sauyour ¶marc ¶ anone heuen opened cesar sawe faire mad • stond vpon aulter holde child armes herde wy aulter goddes sonne anone cesar fylle doune erthe vpon floore chambre afterward bylte chirche lady callid ara celi aulter heuen gal tercio tiberius told augustus spake moch euyl hym al day ¶ answerd sayde take none indygnacion though men speke euyl v ynow v may doo v none harme pol libro tercio capitulo 13 ¶ antonius despysed augustus kynne moder side callyd hym bakar kynde augustus louwgh lete antonius wedded suster· ¶ also one shortenesse body one callid hym dwarf must quoth vse wyde ho • n shoon marc satur ¶augustus passed wye one callyd hym tyraunt tyraunt sayde thou woldest calle sayd rome noo mā sholde doo dethe· nowther p • yne ofte augustus entred cyte ¶also somtyme one come rome moost lyke augustus al maner poyntes broughte byfore augustus augustus aresoned sayd say yonge man thy moder euer rome nay quoth he· fader ful ofte ¶ emperour wroth therfore made ryche sent hym agayn seneca de clemencia whan cynnas •• son knowe cesar wakyd nyghte thanne wyf linia spake maner take counseyll woman doo woman • counseill doo phisicians vse do· comyn medycynes vse may helpe essay ofte medycynes contrary cinnas treson knowe may greue foryeue hym trespas may profyte thy loo thy fame ¶c • sar glad counseyll rede bad brynge cynna afore morow spake hym maner ¶ cynna fonde myne enemye pauilons tentes saued thy lyf graunted rente rychesses made homly nowe efte gyue thy lyf first myne enemy· nowe traytour mansleer· day forthward bytwene v frendship shal bygynne nowe stryue whether haue gyue thy lyf better feyth thou owest me▪ thou owest better fayth thy lyf saued afterward made consul helde hym trusty frende atte last cesar made heyr marc • tur olde man peryll dome came augustus prayd hym help stonde hem augstus ordeyned hym anone noble aduocate old man cryed seid • esar whan thou peryll batail actia soughte mā put stede self fought shewed hym woundes seen bodye cesar ashamed come ānon pleted wold holden proude also wold holden vnkynde ¶ also cesar came vyctory actia one met hym popeniay hāde taught saye heyl cesar victor emperour emperour wondred bought myry byrde twenty thousand pen also pye • grette hym maner· wondred bought hym also ¶ soo dyde stare wondred bought stare pour souter fonde teche chough speke saye salutacion whan spente wha • chough answerd vsed say allas al lost trauayl c • ste· • e laste chough bygan speke sayde salutacion cesar passed herde sayd haue home suche salutacions ynow ala quoth chough fylle mynde al lost trauail cost thanne cesar lough bought chough derrer ony al also greke grete maker vsed make noble dytees preysyng cesar wrote gaue hem cesar whan ofte doo without ony mede cesar made suche endytynge praysyng gaue greke hadde preysed hym greeke radde dyte semblaūt voys profered gyue cesar money al men lough good game cesar badde spenser gyue greeke grete dele money ¶eutropius libro septimo· atte laste cesar deyde nola campania al men cryede sayd wold god neuer born neuer shold dye man lyke god bataylle noman gracious nowther skylful pee ¶ pol libro sexto augustus wolde saye counseyll ayenste enemye ayenst sekenesse ben ouercome hongre iren also made sonnes vse renne lepe vse castyng made doughters vse wolle crafte spynne distaf make brede shold yf neded lyue crafte ¶ capitulum quartum tiberius augustus stepsone wedded doughter bigā regne moneth september moneth augustus dede tiberius regned thre twē ty yere somwhat dayes eutropius first gouerned empyre grete sobrenesse whan somme men counseylled hym take grete tribute prouynces londes answerde sayd falleth good shepherde shere sheepe swolewe first wyse redy ynow gracious armes ¶a man grete cunnynge letture castyng euer awaytynge aspyeynge nold made hit though wold ¶to loued made though wrothe hated semed goodly wold • ue better answer counseyl sodenly withoute auisemente grete auisement sent • somme kynges made come hym flateryng • sente neuer agayn ¶ called tiberius nere· mynstrals callyd hym faier name tiberius mero ofte wyne dronke ¶ also cause somme lettres pilat sente hym wolde haue worshipped god al myghty senatours sayd nay therfore exyled many elder men chees hym counseyllours lefte vnnethe tweyne good heele eer emperoure wyse redy armes ¶but afterward werryd messagers ¶pol libro te • cio capitulo quarto ¶he gre •• ly blame many dedes ayenst chydyng • ydfaste sayde mennes tonges hertes sholde 〈◊〉 cyte ¶iosephu • stydfast dedes vnnethe wolde chaunge procuratours hadde made one prouynces londes ¶ axed dyde soo· answerd sayd doynge spared peple euer lasse tyme quoth procurator haue lo • dship ouer people ben greuous preued ensample one wounded sette • sonne wold doo awaye flyes sate woundes thanne come one frendes droue away flyes w • n • e seke man myght suffre feble ¶ thou hast doone euil quoth • ke man flyes thou hast dryue away ful therfore ete wel lasse nowe comen hongry flyes wole byte ful soore newe officer greuē wors peple vnder ysid li 6 ca 16 • yth tiberius tyme craftis man fonde vp crafte • mpryng glas make glas towy bende wynde reche stroke hamers emperour brake som glas amended agayne bende bowyd tyn themperour lerned craftes man ther none man alyue coude tempre glas bad smyte craftis mānes hede yf craft knowen gold precious metal shold pry ouidius naso poete dyed ylond pontus besides sarmat • gothes fourth yere exylynge ¶ made fyrste booke crafte loue made romaynes wroth made yonglynges loue wyues moche therfor sayd boo • de ponto naso wyse ynow techith sleyght • loue crafte ylle pryse loore therfore mayster sayth atte last ouidius laye empryce therfor exyled yere pilatus made iugge iewry byrth lyuyng redeth many wondres ffor kyng hete tirus gate sone one pila milwardes douht hete atus sone name made name moder pila name graūt • ir atus called pylatus pylat sente fader iiij yere age· fader sone yt rightful wif yt sone pilat one age lauful sone maistrye pilatus euery place▪ stryf therfor pilatus wroth slew broder therfor king fader 〈◊〉 p •• atus rome lye plegge tribute yt shold euy yere pay ye romains also time ye kinges sone f • aū • e lay plegge rome pilatꝰ slewe hym ofte 〈◊〉 playes stryf▪ ¶ therfor romaynes demed pylatus profitable empyre hastyse frowarde men sterne sente hym ylond pontus iugge chastyse men wold good wylle ouer iugge receyue nother suffre amonge shrew pylatus chastysed punysshyng manaces fayer byhestes therfor name ylond callyd poncius pilatus herodes antippas ioye wykkednesse sente messagers giftes drowe hym made prynce vnderr hym iewry pilatus atte last gadred moche money wente rome vnwetyng herodes receyue offyce tiberius helde herodes cause therof enemyes herodes pilatus tyme cristes passion whan pilatus sente ihesus clothyd whyte herodes tyme tiberius cesar emperour harde sekenesse herde telle ierusalem leche heled seke men wor • e ther tiberius sente one volucianus herodes sholde sende hym leche pilatus xiij dayes auisement geue answer ihs afore honde nayled crosse forseid volucianus toke queyntaūce knowlech̄ nobel womā heet veronica brought rome emperour lynen clothe whiche clothe printe lykenes lordes face ¶ emperour beheelde clothe hool anone whan themperour wyst pylatus dampned crist pylatus take amaundement empe • brought rome byfore thēperour cristes owne kyrtel withoute semes callid tunica īcōsutilis pilatus brought aray afore thēperour one efte iij tyme worde might said yt shold greue cloth atte last goddes wyll coūseyl sōme cristē mē kyrtill take hym put prison there· slow self hāde pylatus deth loke within gayus last yere· petrꝰ tyme thre sectes iewes iewry seuered departed frō comyn lyuyng men ¶ sectes phariseis saduceyes essayes heete assideyes also phariseies wered vsid hard clothing scarsite mete drinke determined moyses lawe ordenaunce statute bare scrowes forheede lyfte armes callyd scrowes philaterna scrowes teen commaundementes wrete mynde lawe also large hē me bounde thornes prycked w • nte theyr weye withsayd neuer theyr souereyns also hoped rysynge bodyes deth lyue saduceyes denyed arysing bodyes dethe lyfe sayd noon aungels trowyd soules dyed bodyes· heelde moyses fyue bookes cruel compeynable amonge self callyd self saduceyes rightful esseyes lyued wel nygh al poyntes men relygyon forsoke wedlok fulselde· trowyd noo woman trewe husbond· clothis clene alwey certayne cyte afore sonne rysyng spak thyng vnlauful worshipped sonne whan dyde aryse spak theyr mete hated othes swerynge toke noman theyr secte essay one yere toke ony cyte synne putte hym awaye ete gras beestes doen penaunce lyues ende though ten sate geders none wold speke worde withoute l • ue nyne wolde spete myddel company • nother right side ¶they helde saturday soo holy wold day dresse mete nother tende fire nother sette vessel oute one place another ¶ also wolde cacke saturday iosephus libro secundo ¶other dayes wolde dygge erthe withoute thwytel make hem pytt let fal clothis hele al whan wold cacke sholde wene dyde wrong sonne beme whan cacked wold fyl pytte agayne erthe digged vp pyt leued longest al men lyued starsly dede noo surfeet mete drynke trowyd al soules made atte begynnynge put bodyes whan tyme somme wolde telle come forsoke flesshely lykyn ge euyl doyng despysed ryches ¶here lond comyn amonge alle ¶ bargayned among but· euery frely hym neded rought none oynementes chaunged neuer hosen shoon nother clothyng whā tore spente helde hospytalyte hadde one maner mete prayd afore mete hous neuer herde crye nother noyse none shold geue withoute ordenaunce comyn spencis helde al theyr lawes strenger thā ony sholde receyued abyde among yere essaye shold swere kepe faith god rightwysenesse men obedyence prince yf happed hym somtyme aboue ouer shold mysuse power myght damage wrong subgettes shold chastyse lyers al myght dome sholde come lasse honderd persones dome hem shold stonde stydfast chaunged ¶ capitulum quintum fyften yere tiberius fyrste yere adam acoun • e bakwarde fyue thousande yeres seith eusebeus many yeres make lx▪ yere grace tale sixtene yere tiberius begynnyng yere grace sixty one seuenty say adam xv yere tiberius • ere fyue thousande two honderd xxv bu • hebrewes tellen fyue thousande therfore somme men wol mene yere began sixth thousande circumsicion seesid cristendom bygan ¶ begynne thincarnacion crist also yere iohan began preche baptise baptised crist sixth day ianeuere day shewynge lord day twelue moneth torned water wyn petrus ¶ therfore olde bookes day callyd day shewynges plurel nombre day fyll many diuerse shewynges dyuerse name day diuerse yeres thre grete shewinges first hete epyphania name made epy booue phanos shewynge •• shewynge made frō booue ste ••• second hete theophania name made theos god phanos shewynge shewyng made god baptising crist douue· ¶ thyrdde hete
