bethphania made bethe house phanos shewynge shewyng made hows tornyng water wyne ¶r som men meene daye two yere myracle doo fyue loues two fysshes heete fagephania name made fagyn ete phanos shewynge myracle doo fedynge men ¶also seconde yere luke ierom sayth crist bygan thyrtty yere age soo seyth gospel iesus beginnyng xxx yere crisostimus marianus ¶and comyn meenyng hooly chirche eusebius historia ecclesiastica meneth crist bygā one thyrtty yere hool moche natiuite passion tyme thanne crist▪ monday nexte baptym ladde wyldernesse spyryt bygan fastynge fastyd fourty dayes ended fastynge frydaye xv daye feuyre day ouercam deuil temptid hym whiche day deuil ouercome supplanted adam firste man ¶ nexte ester trewe loore telleth drofe chacid seller byers oute temple yere callyd chees disciple andreu petyr philip nathanael ¶the nexte yere torned water wyne xij day beda tellyth crist disciple baptysed iewery next ester iohan enprysonned ¶also hooly feeste crist heled saturday one palsey eyght thyrtty yere yere went vp hil chees twelue apostle sente preche soo semeth thre gospeler telle doyng crist prisonyng iohan baptist leueth vntold almoost doyng one yere afore prisonyng iohan euāgelist speketh lasse thynges telleth doyng dedes ihus torned water wyne nichodemus come ihs night ihs drofe seller temple atte third ester iohn biheded whā prysoned al yere· atte iiij eester crist suffred deth petrus c 11 xj book ecclesiast •• e historie tellith iohan byheded macheronta castel arabia bodye buryed sebasten samaria heede buryed ierusalem bysides herodes howse· dreede leest wold aryse deth • lyue yf hede buryed body mysbyleuyd men deuyded bone threwe abrode iulianus apostatas tyme hadde enuye myraclis wrought gadryd agayn bone gyders brente wynnewyd askes away winde doyng somme men nowe acounteth second martirdome dede man wyst dyde feest natyuyte gadryd bone geders brente ferforth myght ¶ mysbyleuyd men gadryd iohans boone men ierusalem medled amonge toke greete dele bone amonge whiche dele bone fyngre iohan shewyd crist afterward seynt tecla brought fyngre vnto alpes ¶ alpes ben hye hilles lombardy side fynger moris mynyster sayd bone sente athanasius bysshop alysaundre marcianus prynces tyme iohan warnyd two monkys heede tolde laye ¶ monkes londes come ierusalem bydde praye neuertheles heede longe lost vnkunnynge leyde den feniciā till iohan efte told hede laye marc • llus abbot dwellyd den afterwarde feest bihedyng bygā holden cite day yt hede foūdē take vp erth tellith feest decollaciō byhedyng collection gadrynge boone rather brennyng thanne theodosius emperour brought hede constantinople then brought ffraunce ofte shewed pylgryms amyens ¶ capitulum sextum criste suffred dethe seuen dayes afore apryl cassyodorus seyth· daye greete eclips sonne soo none suche fore hond nowther soo ste •• e seen heuē erth schakyng bythinya throw • doun many cytees r also stone cloue therfor semeth veynes clyftes ben seen quareis roches rokkes come erthe shakyng byfore tyme onests hoole withoute clyftes ioseph̄ yere whyte soneday preestes temphe styrynges noyse place ¶ thanne herde voys breke oute sodenly faste temple sayd passe oute seges ¶also yere aboute pentecost whitesonetyde apostle ordeyned lasse iames alpheus sonne bisshop ierusalem songe first masse among reuled bisshoprych ierusalem thyrtty yere ordeyned seuen dekens steuen philip procorus nychamor timor permenas nycholas· nycholas • stode sholde made wyf comyn al wolde haue hir ¶ eusebius historia ecclesiastica libro tercio nycholas fayr wyf blamed apostle though̄ ielous brought forth wyf yf ony man wold lye wold suffre simpel innocent doyng though somme folowyd dyuerse lechery yet nycholas dide yet despysyng vyse ielousy wylle teche men desire flesshely lykyng namely sonnes doughters lyued chaste lyues ende also • e hym self toke none wyf fyrst wyfe r ¶ iames take hede four surname named iacobus alphay alpheus sone • ur lordes broder moost lyke oure lord holynesse face many men bygyled lykenesse two therfor iudas gaf iewes signe cusse leste deceyued takyng crist ¶ also called lasse iames zebedeus sonne though yonger rather callyd crist called iames maner vsed chirche rome many relygyons soo cometh first called called rightfull worthynesse passynge holynesse alway holy clene mayde tyme first born dranke neuer wyne nother sider nother tasted flesshe yren come neuer heede • e vsed neuer oyle nether bathe ffor grete knelyng knee sol fete al one leue entre holyest place temple firste al songe masse good fryday whanne criste▪ dyed made auowe wolde neuer ete er criste aryse peple fonded wel fast touche • emme clothis ¶ yere bytwene assencion hooly thursdaye whytesonedaye mathias choosen made apostel stede iudas traytoure hem· wreton story though auctor therof vnknowen man wa • ierusalem heete ruben ierom sayth lygnage isacar wyf • ete ciborea· nyghte whan payed dette wedlok eyther woman dremed hadde bore ylle sonne shold traytour owne peple child born callyd iudas fader moder grysed sle child norysshe vp sholde destroye owne peple therfor put hym lytel cryb shape bote dide hym see come ilond hete scariot quene ilōd hadde child fonde cryb childe feyned self child laye feyned childe· long quene conceyued yede childe king whan childe born come age· iudas greuyd ful ofte made hym wepe ful ofte al noughte worth atte laste come oute • iudas wa snot kyngis sone ¶ slowe pryuely kinges sone • ad peyne fledde ierusalem men trybutarye put pilatus courte iustyser ¶ thynges lyke acorde geders iudas sone grete fauour pylatus ¶ day pylatus loked oute palays rubens orchard sothely iudas fader pylatus lykyng apples· therfor sent iudas gader apple ruben come mette hym stryf stroke iudas vp stone smote ruben heede slowe owne fader iudas fled pryuely away euil dede ther men trowyd ruben sodenly dede ¶ pilatus gaue iudas al rubens catel gaue cyborea iudas wyf day ciborea made grete mone bifore iudas wrechyd sorowful lyf put yonge sone see stremes lost husbande sodenly maryed agaynst wylle soo knowen iudas hadde slayne owne fader wedde owne moder therfore counseyl ciborea iudas folowed crist trespas forgeue soo iudas criste pro • oure disciple ¶also yere election mathias sendyng holy goste er apostle wold go aboute dyuerse londes come ierusalem geders made crede steuē stoned deth six dayes • ore ianyuere yere peter apostel iones sone prouince galylee strete bethsayda andrew broder bygan holde bisshopes see eeste londes bisshop four yere song mass sayde pater noster ¶ ieronimus de viris illustribus whan peter come antyochia bisshop seuen yere· come rome fyue twenty yere seuen monethes paul conuerted disciple damaske vnto receyued crystendom ananias then wente arabia then agayne to· damaske· made thre yeres hooly wryte callyd many dayes lete doune ouer wall cupe come ierusalem see peter hym fyftene dayes callyd hym gospel ¶ afterward come countrees suria cicilia assia • ourten yere whan xiiij yere doon come appostles ierusalem whan appeled come emperour rome without cyte hured comyn bern taught therinne wordes lyf· amonge whiche seneca neroes mayster visited paule mowth mouth also lettres pistles persius poete born tiberius cesar deyde poysoned venym yere age thre score eyghten fyrst day october ¶petrus capitulo sexto tiberius knewe shold dye called neuews afore noble men gayus owne broders sone tiberius loued mooste sone owne sonne drusus ordeyned wold morwe ordeyne hym successoure prayd fyrst goddes ordeyned hym self putte afore owne neuewes come fyrste hym morowe warned tiberius pryuely shold come fyrst al maner wyse recheles morowe wolde come til ete gayus come fyrst empyre· kymbelinus kynge brytons dyed lefte hym twey sone guyderius aruiragus guiderius kyngdome warned trybute soo made romayns arise ayēst hym ¶ sequitar capitulum septimum gayus tiberius neuew broder germayn callyd galygula born hooste· hadde name knyghtes legge harneysed heete galygula ¶this emperour tiberius regned four yere nyne monethes ydle disposed man clensed al shame tiberius made men calle hym god heuen erth therfor made ymage sette temple ierusalem lay owne sistres gate doughter one laye doughter afterward ¶ atte laste exyled sustres laye ¶this fyrst yere empyre delyuerd herodes agrippa oute prysonne made • im kyng iewry tiberius prisoned herodes agrippa· second yere kyngdome exyled herodes antippa • herodyas lyued spouse brech herodes antipa herodes agrippa accused ¶the erthe swolowyd wenche tombled gayus thyrd yere empyre exyled pilatus iustyce iewry sent hym v • en royalme fraunce despyte kynge born iewes accused pylatus slowe mē gyltles set ymages men straūge nacions temple ayenste wylle iewes ¶also take mony holy tresory made water condyte owne hous ¶ also hadde take stole prysthode owne hows wolde delyuere hit huyre prince preestes holy dayes put prison borewyd knyfe pare appel slewe hym self owne hand bounde grete stone throwen tiber ylle spyrites made ioye hym ylle also made pestylence grete rysynge water grete thondrynge aboute place ¶therfor romaine drowe hym tiber threwe hym rone vien· place tho graunted plase corsinge also hit hete vigenia via waye iehenne valey child depnesse ¶ fyll pestylence also men place buryed hym bosane also men countraye effrayed dyde body pytte byclipped al aboute hilles yet harde grysely bere noyse ¶in historia ecclesiastica redde iuwes accused pilatus tiberyus pilatus bore lugduns fraunce ¶r eyther story may sauede withoute sayenge vnderstonde born lugduns accusacion iewes volusianus come agayn ierusalem callyd hym oute exylynge haue harder dampnacion ¶eusebius beda withness • th pilatus slewe self owne hād ¶capitulum octauum claudius • ame gayus drusus whan gayus slayne made emperour sleyhte helpe herode agrippa bygan regne lammesse moneth regned fyften yere dedes • lde mynde made bryto • subget gaue hym alway mete drynke lechery oute mesure cast hym make lawe excuse behynde let go blaste somtyme spared moch fel grete peryll ¶ iosephus libro visesimo claudius thre wyues firste hete pet • na gate doughter hete antompde petina deyd wedded messalina ¶ gate sone hete britannicus doughter heet octauia thyrd wyf hete agrippa germanicus doughter sone heete nero claudius wedded doughter octauia nero loue claudius agrippina slewe hi • wif messalina whan slayn claudius triclinio sittyng mete vsed speke though mynde axed lady messelina wolde come ¶agrippina drad leste b • tannicus sone messalina shold regne fader therfor poysened claudius sonne nero shold emperour· nero quyt moder triacle whan emperour· poysoned brytannicus slewe moder owne wyf octauia r forseyd messalina speketh iuuenalis satiricus sayth • lecherous firste dyde hir pryuely pryue harlattes place afterward put forth openly went then fulfylde maner doynge wery trauaylle also exyted noble wyues maner doyng beda libro primo capitulo quarto yere grete honger 〈◊〉 agabus prophete prophecyed actibus apostolorum ¶petrus 81 hongre stronge euery place siria iewry moost helene quene adyabenes come ierusalem bought corn al aboute susteyne nedy cristen mē ierusalem atte la • made two vnryels heete burye therinne body sonnes bodye buryels beene yet seen therfor many ben disseyued trowith buryels helene constantyns moder· mē rede come ierusalem highte cyte many thynges also yere powle come ierusalem talke peter gospel ¶also yere fyftene day iuyll apostle departed al world aboute ¶ peter come rome sente marcial lymonica appollinaris rauen marcus egypte marcus leuyes kynde peter sone baptym disciple come rome peter ther atte prayer cristen men wrote gospel peter alowed approued toke rudde chirches ¶thanne marcus sente aquileya conuerted moche folke atte last sente alexandria egypte doo dethe thanne aboute yere lord iiij c thre score seuen translated brought frō alexandria venys kyt thōbe somtyme leste shold made preest bisshop goddis ordenaūce maystry auctoryte peter made bisshop allexandria beda libro primo capitulo quinto ¶ kyng guiderius regned amonge brytons warned romayns trybute therfor claudius cesar come conquered brytayne without bataylle grete noyse grutchyng arered brytayn semeth men fled restored ageyne come ilond iulius cesar durste neuer come nother man hym also ylondes orchades ben beyonde brytayn see occean made subget empyre rome torned agayne rome sixth moneth wente oute gaue sone name brytannicus lelius hamo leder claudius slewe kynge guyderius porchestre hamo deyde afore hamoes hauen soo called name hampton claudius dyuerse happes batayll toke aruiragus guiderius broder grace brought doughter genuyssa rome maryed kynge aruiragus wold make place mariage solempne callyd claudyocestria name ¶r claudyocestra hete caertleon brytyssh speche claudius cyte callyd glocestre glouernia also name duc demecia hete glora sayth claudius cesar gate hym gloucestre claudius sente legyons knyghtes irlond· torned ageyne rome aruiragus withdrowe hym wold vnder romaynes ¶ therfor vaspasianus duc rome sente made kynge kyngdome yle wyghte nexte brytayn south syde subget thempyre rome herodes agrippa whan greued somme holy chirche· come cesarea make pleyes worship cesar lete self callyd god therfor angel smote hym body swal sayd frendes lo callyd god right fully bounden bondes dethe dyed peter ca 60 herodes agrippa aristobolus sone aristobolus sone grete herodes ascolonita suster herodias oldest eam • herodes antipas forsayd aristobolus broder herodes agrippa man grete herte grete w • rriour fre gyftes pour ¶he come rome tiberius cesar liuede geete another tetrarchia fourth deele kyngdome iewes hadde grete frendship drusus tiberius cesars sonne obleged hym self moche dette wynne wyll romayns ¶but drusus hastly dede therfor tiberius cesar sory dide al drusus seruauntes oute presence leste drusus dethe come mynde syghte seruauntes ¶ therfore hi • happyd herodes agrippa wente ageyne iewry man withoute comforte shame nede meschyef closed hym self toure myghte dye hongre prayer suster herodyas releued herodes antippa herodes antippa repreued hym tyme good doo hym herodes agrippa hadde indignacion therof wente tiberius cesar gate grace hym atte laste leefte gayus germanicus sone tyme sate gayus chaar wyssched tiberius oldman vnnesy dede gayus myghte emperour charyoter herde warned emperour therfor agrippa prysoned six monethes vnto deth tiberius cesar agrippa prisonne one prysonners kunnynge dyuynynge warned hym· sholde sone delyuerd oute prysonne kyng soo frendes sholde haue enuye welthe dyuynour dyuyned soo sawe owle sitte vpon tree agrippa lened sayd sone sawe efte maner byrde sitte aboue hym shold dye fyfthe day ¶whan tiberius dede gayus delyuerd agrippa gaue two tetrarchyes philip lisania crowned called hym kynge ¶ therfor suster herodyas wrothe grete indignacion husbonde herodes antippas retrarcha gete hym nāme kynge excited husbond herodes antippa shold goo gayus beye name kynge gayus warned afore honde lettres agrippa put herodes lugduns fraunce herodyas agrippaes suster choes wolde goo agayne folow husbond chees exyled husbonde said wolde leue husbonde meschyef folowed bonechefe soo thyrd tetrarchia take herodes antippa geue herodes agripp • ¶ atte last gayus slayne whan stryf bytwene senatours knyghtes peple rome· senatours drad cruelte emperour disauauntage comynte peple dradde couetyse consul thanne sleyght agrippa claudius made emperour anone gaue herodes agrippa fourth tetrarchia iudea ¶and herodes agrippa made grete wente agayne iewry ¶ afterwarde slowe iames prysonned peter made playes cesarea sayd afore hande swal ete wormes deyde lefte hym two lygnages halfe beyonde flume iordan sone herodes agrippa callid herodes agrippa ¶ hym cristen men fled afterward oute iewry whan cyte sholde take destroyed seynt mary lordes moder deyd yrre age thre score thre byrth sone fourtene yere olde leued sone thre thyrtty yere afterward sixtene yere somme men wol mene take hennes whan sixty wynter olde men say apostle prechyd crist iewry countreyes aboute ful twelue yere ¶ philip apostel nayled cro cyte iherapolis yere age thre score eyghten· lasarus first bisshop cipris deyde second deth four twenty yere bytwene two dethis felix procurator iewry sente claudiꝰ afore felix powle accused appeled offence emperour tyme many fals prophetes egesippus libro secundo also tyme many shrewyd swerd men ierusalem medled amonge peple slewe many men subtily pryuely man coude aspye soo drede liued greuous meschief dede ¶therfor many men wente wildernesse haue refute socour ¶ claudius died rome owne pali yere age thre score four moneth marche wyfe agrippina slewe hym venym put sone brytannicus make owne sonne nero emperour ¶ capitulum 9 nero sone domicius agrippina gayus suster wedded claudius doughter bygan regne regned almoost fourten yere moost curyous crafty werke iustrumentes musick soo ioye likyng openly callyd prynce harper also grete likynge swetnesse voys absteyned hym spared al manere mete drynke goode voys dyde also vsed ofte c • isteryes vomytes whan nero bigan singe man soo hardy goo oute theatre er made ende songe al ruled lad ledyng counseyll mynstrals moost couetous al emperours vsed saye aboue alle hath nede yet greued hym geue mynstrals al gaue al worshippes • f cite rome suetoniu • wered cloth twyes vsed shosoles siluer fysshed nettis gold nettis drawe ropis reede silke also wolde see lykenesse troye whan sette fyre sette grete dele rome fire brente seuen nyghtes seuen dayes began crye singe gestes troye orocius ¶ also lecherous wolde w • sshe hote oynementes colde ¶also wedded man wyf bycame another mannes wyfe also lete kerue owne moders wombe wolde see place conceyued ynne martinus phisiciens blamed defowled owne moder ¶and answerd sayde ye make goo childe ye shal deede euerychone thā made swelle drynkes made hym vnwytyng drynke frogge ¶and atte last moch wo sorowe delyuerd caste vp frogge ¶ phisicians sayde childe born afore tyme therfore vnthryuyngly euel schape nero made frogge kepte tour owne lyues ende ¶therfor somme men wenen lateran hath name frogge loted latere latyn lotye hidde vnknowe englysshe rana latyn frogge englysshe ¶ also nero made hym heuen honderd fote hye bored thyrlyd many smale hooles born vp four score pylers ten marbel stone leete fall water therupon dropyd doune rayne falleth heuen made also lampe brennyng drawē heuē day yede doune westward sonne ¶and made myrrour sette precious stone shone nyght mone ¶ al goddes ordenaunce sodenly distroied rusched broke therof neuer gobet founde nother cromme ¶also made carre iiij whelis drawe vpon heuen soo noyse herde noyse grete thonder god almyghty sente grete wynde threwe cart ryuer ¶ eutropius nero slewe many noble men linia octauians wif moder agrippina fader suster wyf seneca philosopher cordij bē lucanꝰ came neroes mayster axed couenable reward neroes mayster hadde choys whiche bowe tree wolde hanged seneca axed • e deserued maner deth ¶ nero made one scarmuch aboute seneca • heede bryghte swerde sawe wonder sore aferd sayd sore thou art aferd swerde sore aferd yet sore aferd somtyme childe therfor thou art thou alyue may withoute drede euer grete drede· therfore seneca chees man deth wold take chees late blode bath dye man forbedinge name seneca seneca latyn sleeth self englyssh seneca two bretheren one hete iuliꝰ gallo best declamator al slow self oun hāde broder hete mela lucanꝰ poetes fader also lucanꝰ whan made booke harme damage strif discord bitwene cyteseins therby brought nero acorde mildenes yet heest nero slayn bleding kittyng veynes sayd· pol li 8· som ben bolde hardy despise seneca grounde vpon auctorite quintilianꝰ semeth doute worthy homely poul ierom rekeneth amōg holy seintes seneca noble wit lerne teche grete studiyng grete knowlech thinges wel nye al mat studye wyt science wrote resons poetry nye al maner philosophy euy good trewe keper vertues enemy vice synnes· semed made worldes gold goddes acorde mākinde also made bokes de beneficijs de clemēcia declamacōes tragedias de nālibꝰ q̄stiōibꝰ de tusculāis de casibꝰ fortuitis ieroꝰ de viris illustribꝰ paul appeled thēperour sēt boūdē rome ther • e ij· yere freward disputed ayēst iewes aft er ward lete go fre peter yere ordeined rome ij bisshops • elpers tech feith holy chirch linꝰ one cletꝰ fulfil thoffice pisthod peple yt come thoffice bisshops peter self occupied bede preching martinꝰ cletꝰ writē wrote first lettres sl̄in apl̄i cam benedcōnē greting apostle blissing praised moch pilgremage holy seintes specialy apostl • peter paul seid one visiting apostle help • mānes soule ij yeres fasting also yere lucas paul cite rome wrote boke hete actꝰ apostolorum write gospel afore· yere died longius knight opened criste spere toke syhte bloode ranne vpon spere oute crytes syde ¶ soo trowyd cryste taughte apostle wente cesarea capadocia lyued • holy lyf xxviij yere torned many men fayth holy chirche dyed martir atte last percius satiricus poete dyed r mo poetes satirices poeta hath name feynyng one virgyl specially encidis dius satiricus sayd saturitas fulnes mat repreuingis spak ayenst yl mē euil liuing spake therof atte ful ther iij ꝑsiꝰ oraciꝰ iuuenalis isid li 8 ca 7 office poete telle thyngis ben sothe dede lykenes chaungyng florysshyng fair maner spekyng therfor poetes isye temple fayrer howses maumettes heyer bodyes trowid goddes sholde worshiped fayr noble speking therfor som poetes ben callid diuines made dites goddes r therby semeth lucanꝰ poete whan made iij storyes stryf cyteseins· maner medlyng poise lasse iames bisshop ierl̄m slain vij dayes afore april estern tyme xxx yere passiō lord· firste iewes stoned iames anger might sle paul afterward smite braine walker staf r eusebiꝰ historia eccāstica • li 1 ca 1 seyth iames sone ioseph lady spouse gete wif therfore called oure lordes broder ierom meneth sothly sone mari lady suster fader hete alpheꝰ marke gospeler paules disciple meuer dyed alexādria egipte gospel wretē rome peter appued alowyd toke rad chirches linꝰ bisshop suffred deth rome vij dayes afore decēber cletus successour xij· yere peter wēt rome withstōde put simon magus come samaritanes peter ouer come afore cesar • chaced iewry· simō magus gad • ed peple gider rome seid peter paul mē galyle greued sore therfor wold forsake rome yt defēded long tyme set day whan wold stye vp heuē whan day come torned kydde might witchecraftthan side seid crist neuer dede atte prayer peter • fil doū flyght al broke brused nero 〈◊〉 •• st helper putte peter ward peter knewe • nde day nye made clement bisshop stede· also • instaūce bretheren wold finde escape neroes tirānie met crist gate cite seid lord whether gost thou go seid crist rome nayled crosse agein· • eter vnderstode sayd owne passion torned ageyn cite taken wardeyns honged crosse hede dounward disciple marcellus abode mannes sentence nother leue toke peter doune crosse hondes buryed hym place hete vaticanus xxv yere bissopriche rome neroes last yere nero dyd peter crosse made paule slayn swerde al one day sente duc vaspasianus iewry make iewes subgette wold suffre couetyfe florus iustice eutropius whan herde galba spain made emperour loste al comforte harmes hadde doon bythought comynte senatours demed hym enmye fled four myle cyte slowe self subarbe bonde man hadde made free yere owne age two thyrtty yere al meyne augustus cesar consumpte whan peter hadde suffred deth clement come hym clement gouerned holy chirche nyne yere vnder peter alyue bisshop xxij yere xij yere linus cletus ix yere self aloon tho exyled· clement wyseman war ware meschyef myght falle afterward yf euery wold make hym successour ensample peter soo holy dignyte might falle possession herytage therfor resigned dignyte linus afterward cletus· also clement wrote many lookes cristen lawe made linus cletus bisshoppes afore hym· clemēt fyrst electiō peter third degre ordre linꝰ cletus bitwene peter bodi throwe • e cerson many yeres one cirillus apostel sclaues fonde brought rome first nycholas tyme gaufr aboute tyme marius sone aruiragus regned britain tyme one rodicus kyng pictes come sicia occupyed north party britain party hete albania hete scotlād atte last marius slough rodicus mynde vyctorye kynge marius rered stone place countray called name westmaria westmerlonde yet wreton stone marij vyctory r wyllelmus malmesbury disseyued troweth stone reerde mynde marius co • sul rome wonder radde bryttysshe book hit wreten marius kynge ¶ afterwarde marius kyng graunted rodycus men ouercome londe catenesy last endes scotland dwelle ther • ynne sayd last chapyter fyrst booke ¶ capitulum 10 galba seruius regned nero vij monethes chosen spaynerdys galles yere age thre score thyrten senatour old nobley pryuy lyf ful noble ofte consul ofte proconsul ofte duk leder grete bataylles harde made one pysonne noble yong man sone adoptiuus heir wayte one otho bothe deede myddel chepynge place ¶ otho lucius regned thre monethes whan herde emperour made gallia relygyons germania arayed batayls ben callyd bella ciuilia hadde vyctory thre fyrst bataylles fourth batayl whan sawe men ouer set •• falle grounde • e sayd soo worthy cyuyle bataylle sholde hym aryse slew hym self vytellus regned otho seuen monethes stronge noble soo grete gloton ete somday thries som daye four sithis somday fyue sithis ¶at one soper sette afore hym two thousand fysshes seuen thousande fowles soo wryte ¶ drad vaspasianus shold regne slewe brother sabynus • ede hid hym closed hym celle ¶ duke vaspasianus drowe hym oute openly naked drawe thurgh cyte heelde vp hede hye sharp swerde set vnder chy nne alle men threwe dirte du ste throwe tiber vaspasianus regned eyght yere coueytoꝰ money toke wrongfully ¶ wolde forgete wronges lyghtly take chydinges mē lawe philosophres sōtyme sēt nero iewry chaste iewes herde neroes deth left sonne titus wente agayn rome fought two thyrtty tymes manly agaynst enemyes germania ellys ¶ pol libro tercio capitulo 14 one buculus old man cryed despy •• vaspasianus sayd foxe maye chaung skynne wylle ffor vaspasianus couetyse neuer lasse ffor passynge age saith answerd maner suche men owe lawghyng silf correction payne euil doer • also playne chastysyng peple nacions londes wonne made prouynces kyngdoms archaia licia rhodus samus tracia silicia ordeyned stywardes gouerne londes rather vnder kynges frendes subgettis romaynes ¶r laketh ten yere comyn cronykkes bytwene passion oure lord vaspasianus tyme sayd afore prologe ¶ ierusalem take titus temple brente throwe adowne euen groūde ¶iosephus libro septimo ¶the monethe day fyrst brente calendres eyghtene day september yere salamon buylde hit fyrst enleuen honderd thyrtty second byldyng aggeus tyme seuen honderd yere nyneand thyrtty ¶ martinus tellen taken estern tyme ¶egesippus ¶ brennynge destruction enleuen tymes honderd thousand iewes slayn swerde honger ¶an honderd thousand take prysoners sold al way thyrtty peny nyne honderd thousand fledde shifte departed ¶ieronimus ¶that tyme moche folke ierusalem estern tyme come temple oute al ieury ¶ iosephus libro septimo wonder soo greete peple iewes dede take nero somtyme wold wete tale nombre iewes ierusalem despysed temple al myghte· cestius styward lerned bisshopes wrote nero founde ierusalem one holy day twenty c seuen honderde thousande withoute pollute persones wemmes hadde leue offir ¶ bisshopes acountyd nombre nombre hoostes offryd whiche nombre two honderd thousand six fyfty thousande fyue honderd euery ten persones offryd one hooste fyghting romaynes kunnynge strengthe ¶ iewes hadde wodenesse folye ¶ tyme drye vaspasianus wente cyte iotapaten· stopped al water conduytes ¶ iosephus withynne founde vp connynge crafte henge wete clothis vpon toun walles ¶ clothis dropped withoute wende trowed ynne lacke water drynke plente water wasshe clothis ¶than vaspasianus distourbed wal stroke engyne iosephus heng sakkis ful strawe ayenst stroke engyne soo stroke lette walles saued harde thynges ben better withstōde nesche thinges thā hard ye romains boū de hokes long pole kytte ropis sackis iosephꝰ threwe brenning oyle vpon smote al engynes vaspasianꝰ wold amēde hem sore woūded heel· fyl grete strengthe castynge shote titus side nolle one iosephus felaws smyte stone flewe ou er third furlong also woman yt childe smyte childe smyte oute wombe flewe ouer half furlong whan titus broke second wall iosephus founden hid among osers hid thre dayes· founde hym despised maner wherto wolt thou lyue couenable nother leeful nether semely thy lyf shal made peryschyng lost shal payne seruage bondage haue mynde moyses hym leuer scraped oute booke lyf lyue lenger peple also dauid leuer take se ipso wreche lyue see peple perysshe desired nought quoth iosephus yf lawful delyuerd vnboūde soo grete wo sorowe bonde hath leue vnbynde none yf ony vnbyndeth doth lord wrong ¶than lordes trewe seruauntes kepe hath bytake v whyle wylle ¶ thanne vnkynde wil rather goe longer abyde wylle whoome bounde ¶ soo hit sothe abraham iacob moyses dauid prayde delyuered prysonne oft lyf none slowe hym self al holy sayntes ¶ yf good lyue sacrylege forsake vnrighlfully yf glorious dye batayll withsey hit yf good fyghte countray peple cyteseyns dye batayll put forth heede smyte yf enemy axeth lawe bataylle nother flater self yf sparyng borowe hadde leuer dye thefte myne owne yf ye saye sweete dye fredome say swete dey ••• dome feerful wyl dye whanne nedith woman stalworthnesse ony slee hym self ¶beestes conne doo soo defende self ayenste beestes tethe clawes amonge self vse c • ss likkyng strokynge god hath take v lyfe kepe whether doo ben blame yf throwe hit awaye withoute axyng gaue v owther yf warne take axyng whan wordes sayd iosephus sawe one stode stroue faster iosephus sayd cast lotte shal dye fyrst laste soo forth v al soo shal dye fyrst shal slayne hym shal dye nexte soo euery one condicion plesyd al happed deede al saue iosephus one other· ¶ io sephus counceyled felawe forsake lot therby e scaped peryl home soo brought vaspasianus ¶ iosephus libro 6 atte laste vaspasianus callyd emperour sone titus lefte siege ierusalem went daye six honderde horsmen withoute haberions aboute see cyte iewes come oute closed bihinde whette hert hardines rode māly thorough cōpany iewes come mē grete drede aledged oft grete wrethe yt wāhope cite cōforted giders mene ty • e many iewes prayed pee titus titus drad gyle treson seid mē· ben bineth vsith waityng aspiyng nedeth bem yt strēger ware waiting espiēg leste strengthe bytrayd fraude gyle thanne firste wal broke engyne titus counseyled men fyghte wa • ly yf lacked coūseyll strēgth sholde seme foly also victory moost drede· yf strenger dyeth ye feble • 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 vyctory hym ouercome thanne second wal quasched titus proferid pees· iewes side simon iohan withsayde· thanne fyl grete cruelnes honger cyte byeng sellyng seesid dyde rostyng sethyng dressyng mete men ete skynnes sheldes caste herbes cleued walles fylthe men spued cast vp men soughte old dyrte skynnes addres careyn horse haue mete ¶it lyghter gete mercy amonge enemyes among • wne men· galowes gybetes sette vpon walles man shold flee takyng deth prysonynge withoute honger withynne drede euery side titus made newe walle closed fourty furlonges aboute cyte tentes pauilons closed ten furlonges wardes watch sette man shold escape atte last hongre encreced soo ofte bare dede man buryeng buryed rather he· grete stenche dede men grounde cyte suffysed beryels· careyns throwe th • sondes ouer wallis whanne titus sye sayd ofte profered mercy· many fled romayns whan mē gaue thē mete strengthe ete outher defye theyr meete ete somme fl • whan clensed theyr wombe deliuerd • iuels gold· swolowed afore •• ed enemyes sholde openly suche iuels fynde one asiries aspyed doyng one hadde cacked gold trowyd al iewes gold within iewes fled romayns opened agaynst titus heest wombes bowel slitte c • ruen seche gold withyn ¶titus made iosephus wete yf myghte make iewes yelde withoute harme yf myght wrytyng ensamples fayr byheestes teres al nought iosephus libro sexto symon iohan fautors stopped weyes al aboute soo iewes waye outward nother romayns ynward house bysily serched yf ought mighte founde yf ony man warned ought anone slayne atte laste wyues caught mete theyr husbondes mouthe fader moder owne child mouthe yf ony dore hytste anone trowyd somme man ete therinne therfore anone hows broken pore men robbed ryche accused money though wold flee bytray cyte slayne egesippus libro sexto iosephus libro septi • byfell grisely dethe straū ge woman heete mary ouercome honger spake owne lytell sone maner ¶ sone thou art set aboute al thynge grisely dredeful bataylle hongre fire brennynge theues quyte one thy moder paye thou hast tourne agayne thy pryuey place thou come somtyme dede mildenesse wolde honger constreyneth thus sethed rosted owne sone ete somme kept somme men made stryf come theder smel ef brente flesshe woman stylled spake maner styll coueytous vnkinde haue kepte parte spak part lefte maner myne owne son thou art kynde thou lengest lyf thou cesest wold smyte come sle ben made frendes gestes • han tasteth ye knowe childes moder hath tasted ellys ye shal ete al yfere ¶ shame folowe woman ye haue made manere anone cy •• full clamour grisely dede titus soo meued therwith gaf vp hondes heuen ward sayd co • e bataylle men· nowe see fyghte ayenste beestes yet beestes rampaunt spare theyr owne kynde neuer soo nedy helpith owne child men deuoure theyr chidren destroye al dedes stynken iosephus libro septimo amonge romaynes one ciria hete sabinus orped man stalworth honde herte worthy praysed withoute ende black hewe· lytel stature noble soule shone vertues lytel bodye enleuen felawes wente vpon walle first drofe awey iewes atte last af •• lyd stone despysed towhte arowes stone defended hym shelde faughte vpon knee wounded many men alway ful arowes shot thorough shote euery side dyed place egesippus· atte last engynes remeued toward temple halp lytil atte last brent walles tēple heled gold r ¶ iosephus tellith meschyef destroyeng cyte peple fil deth sleyng iames rightfull veryly fil sleyng crist gospel sayth shulle leeue one stone vpon stone thou knoweste tyme visitacion lord wol deth synful man wol synful • n amende hym torne good lyfe iewes sholde haue none excusacion nowther chalenge nother cause saye god almyghty toke wreche vnwarned therfore god almyghty abode fourty yere yf wolde amende warned ofte prechyng apostle dredeful signes tokyns egesippus iosephus libro septimo ¶ aboute yere byfore destruction cyte lykenesse fyre swerde seen honge air aboue temple estern tyme heffre shold offryd temple ewed lombe· also est gate tēple soo heuy sound brasse twenty men bysy ynow lyfte yet many nyghtes yren barres broken yate opened hit self wylfully vnneth hit myght closed afterward ¶ also hoostes armed men seen cloudes charyottes fled eier sontyde preestes wente temple nyghte herde voys sayd go hen passe oute seges also iesus ananias sonne vplondisch man four yere afore destruction cyte come sacrifice dedicaciō temple bygan crye langage countraye sayd voys oute est voys oute west voys oute four wyndes wo wo wo ierusalem temple cryed day nyghte cessed for· betynge fayer prayenge yet broughte afore albinus iustyce rome hard cruelly bylad ¶ rought wronge • owne meschyef cryed coū tray shuld destroyed cessed er last day destruction day wente vpon wall reherced crye put therto sayde wo also anone smyte stone slynge deyde ¶ r marianus libro primo sayth whan temple brente floore therof ered plowes wreche despyte iewes ¶ieronimus prologo super iosephum whan cyte destroyed titus wente rome ladde hym iosephus iewe wrote anone g • ue seuen bo • kes takynge iewes titus dyde th • se bookes comyn lybrary iosephus deth ymage rome made noble wytte also iosephus wrote doyng dedes begynnynge world domicianus twenty bookes ben callyd libri antiquitatum bokes olde▪ • eyghten book therof graunteth knowlegeth iohan baptist profyte ierusalem destroyed cause sklaūder iames rightful also sayth crist wyseman dyd many wonderful werkes dedes doctor techer iewes men slayne atte last enuy shewyd ▪ hym disciple thyrd day ¶ cristendom name cristen men failed neuer tyme vaspasianus dyed flux aboute owne toune aboute sabin yere age thre score ten ¶ sayth stode vp whan sholde dye sayde ¶it falleth emperour passe stondynge oute erthe giral top appolinaris peter disciple somtime sente rauenna suffred deth euery yere feest day rauenes crowes chowes comen theder gyders oute euery side couenaunt made day customme gyuen careyn dede horse ¶ therfor somme men wol mene cause therof cyte callyd duche speche rauenesburgh eutropius ¶ capitulum 12 titus regned fader thre yere ¶this moost noble speker g •• e latyn wrote cause latyn poesyes gestes grue· conuicte conspyraciō agaynst homely afterward hym fore ¶ pol libro tercio capitulo 14 ¶this fre herte purgyd clensed couetyse fader soo callyd loue lykynge mankynde· also alwaye maner man c • hym yede hym withoute spede hope spede therfor men hows axyd hym wolde byhote myghte performe ¶there shulde man sayde go • lynge sory answer prynce one soper bythought hym sawe bithought hym also day gaue gyfte helpe ony man sory sayd ala frendes day haue lost ¶in tyme deth born lyter loked vp heuen sayd nedid thynke none al dedes one dede noman wyste aboute tyme dyed iulyanus bisshop cenomannens sayth symon leprosus mesel crist heeled receyued crist hows lodged assenciō lordr bisshop cenomannens ordeyned apostle disciple noble man vertues· rered thre men deth lyf somme men wold mene men trauayleth waye prayeth good lodgynge crist herberuhd hows semeth sothely iulianus vnwyttynge slewe bothe owne fader moder hym certayne wreten manere iulianus yonge man wente huntyng chaced herte herte tourned face hym sayd thou chacest thou shalt slee bothe thyn fader moder ¶than iulian drad sore beware meschyef sholde befalle iulian forsoke lefte al put hym self grete prynce fer londe bare hym wel nobly vnder prynce batayll home palais bare hym soo made knyghte wedded one castellana wydowe lord gaue hym wyf fader moder sought iulian euery londe happed atte laste came iulians owne castel whan iulians wyf talked knewe wel husbandes fader moder receyued goodly leyd reste husbondes bed went self chirche morowe erly lefte bothe bed ¶ iulian cam erly home fonde slepe bothe gyders owne bed trowyd another man laye wyf stikked bothe thorugh went met wyf▪ ¶and knewe slaine owne fader moder hert sayde sholde ¶fare well leue suster quoth shal neuer reste er wete yf god wole take penaunce forgeue synne god forbede sayd shold forsake maner wo sorowe haue pertinet ioye welthe went forth gyders made hospytal ryuer whe • e men passed oft grete peryl halpe men passed socoured pour men long frost tyme iulyan w • ry reste hym aboute mydnyght herde voys cryeng pray • ng helpe ouer passage iulian aroos fette ouer pour man ney deede colde brought hym hows made fyre sette hym therby al fyer man neuer h • tter iulian dyde hym owne bedde hilled hym clothis withynne lytel whyle th • man semed soo colde vyle mesel whyte fayr styed vp ayer spak hoost iulian sayd iulian iulian lord ihesu crist sente worde hath receyued thy penaunce ¶ sone afterward bothe iulian wyf wente al lord endels reste ¶ capitulum 12 domicianus vaspasianus sone regned fyften yere fiue monethes wyf hete fyrste augusta fyrste hyte calle self god lord forbade geldynge men plantynge vynes cyte rome exyled many senatours put mathematicos philosophres cyte rome bylde temple rome wythoute ony tymber temple hete pantheon bylde worship alle goddes chirche lady hete sanctum maria rotunda seynt mary rounde· somtyme hadde vyctorye german dane soo proude therfor wold suffre none ymage sette worship hym clene gold treuisa ¶ thematic • hath science tretith lengthe brede telle thurugh suche lengthe brede none body • men may grope fele fareth ofte arsmetrike geometrye pol ¶ man vnprofitable euery dede dyde thynge manly man shold bare name empyre wolde hyde lewydnesse witte body vnder name prince ordeyned hym euery day pryuy ydelnesse vsed hym catche flyes stykked sharp poyntel soo tyme one axed yf ony man ynne emperour nay sayd chāberlyn metellꝰth • flye left emperour gaue two monethes yere newe name • nd callid september germanicus october • micianus anacletus nacion athene pope nyne yere clementes stede whan clement exyl • eusebius called hym cletus ouerlepe hym cronyke damasus pepe wryteth ierom cronyke bisshopes rome withsayd sawe sayd cletus romayne anacletus greke also many thynges eusebius cronik varyeth cronycles men anacletus ordeyned preestes shold worshiped afore men trauayled ne greued eutropius cornelia cheef mayde temple goddesse vesta conuicte lechery buryed • quyck lyue anaristus cletus pope ten yere ordeyned seuen dekens sholde k • pe bisshop prechyd lest enemyes trowth wolde bere hym wronge hande saye err • also sholde lyghtly herde despysed whan • micianus slayne owne men dispytously born forth amonge theues ¶nerua mylde prynce regne • hym one yere· vndyde dedes domicianus alle exyled reconsiled come home agayn iohan euangelist come home agayne ephesym yle pathmos ¶ coiyllus marius sone norysshed rome childehode regned brytayn payd trybute romayns ladde lyf pee r sōme men suppose buylde cyte colchestre whiche chyef cyte estsaxon ¶ capitulum 13 vvlpius crinitus traianus born spayne emperour nyneten yere· among frendes free herte besy dedes armes esy gouernynge cyteseyns myghty reuelyng cytees townes chastysed dane scytes sarmates hiberes colches arabes ordeyned nau • reede see werre inde made hym self euery mannes felawe vysyted ofte frendes wold salewed hem wete ferde greued man dyde thyng wrongfully haue esche • e made seruauntes ryche neded greu • man frendes blamed soo comyn • le maner men answerd sayde wyl suche emperour • men wold emperour • ¶ r helymandus sayth tyme traianus lepte hors goo batayl comynte come wydowe wepynge toke hym foote prayd hym wolde doo hir ryght iustice hem hadde slayne sonne shal doo right sayde themperour whan come ageyne sayd yf thou neuer comest ageyne thanne sayd • themperour successours shal doo right pro • yt sayd shal yf another man doo good· thou art dettour thou shalt resseyue thou deseruest thin dedes ¶and fraude yelde du • · whan may yolden ¶ thy successour shal fare wel yf bere hym wel doo sholde traianus meued wordes lyght doun hors dyde wydowe right iustyce therfor worthy haue ymage rome also tyme traianus sone rode wylde hors slough wydowes sonne therfor traianus yaue owne sonne wydowe sonne ¶and cause gre • e right wysenes semeth seynt gregory wan soule helle ¶ creuisa myght man wene wors wode oute right byleue ¶ whan euariscus martrid alexander come hym pope ten yere ordeygned holy water blessyd salt spryngt cristen menni • house put masse qui pridie quam pa • eretur forth vnto wordes hoc est c ¶ also ordeyned water sholde medled wyn chalyce bytokene onyng crist holy chir • ordeyned oost shold therf brede • f lytel quantite seyde scarser oost better symon hete symeon also cleo • sone lasse iames successour nayled crosse chirche ierusalem alle men 〈◊〉 olde man six score yere myght suffre passio • ignacius bisshop antyochia iohans disciple broughte rome throwen wylde beestes· tormented cryed alwey besyly iesus ¶ thenne deth herte hewen smal gobeites ¶and euery gobbet foūden iesus wreton lettres golde second pliniꝰ nonocomensis pleter wryter storyes flowres· mayster traianus themperour refreyned hym many thynges especial shold persecute ne greue cristen men ¶ also withstondynge knyghthode chiualrye vsede alway· yet wrote seuen thyrtty bookes storye kynde descryueth clerly world al therinne· ¶atte laste wente serche enquere cause grauel see stronde whiche alayed heepes grauel sayde· ¶after passion alysaundre pope sixtus pope almoost enleuen yere ordeyned trisagium sanctus sanctus sanctus shold songe atte masse corporas shold sylke nether sendel clene lynen clothe dyed woman shold handle towelles auter though men rede alysander suffred deth adrian tyme • yet thenne adrian emperour perauentur consul prefect trayanus tyme placidas mayster knightes went huntyng mette herte hauynge bitwene horne crucifix sayd hym wyf child shold suffre moche wo sorowe ¶and crystend wyf child newe name named eustace cassiodorus ¶ traianus deyde flux selencia yere age lxiij bone golden vrne potte buryed market place vnder piler made honderd four fourty foote high· loo mynde hym soo spronge yet tyme men praye plesyng prynces gracious mo • e thou 〈◊〉 augustus better traianus▪ ¶ capitulum 14 adrianus helius traianus cosyn emperour one twenty yere ten monethes connyng langage grue latyn made athene lybrarye wonder maner werke· connynge musique phisick payntyng grauyng meltyng castyng brasse metal· whan bookes oure byleue wreton one quadratus disciple thappostlis one 〈◊〉 athenes· adrianus bad commaunded lettres 〈◊〉 cristen men shold dampned without trespas put hem proued made many lawes hadde grete enuye noble loo renomme traianus· forsoke prouynces traianus wōne· siria mesopotania armenia purposed haue left dacia· frendes caused chaunge thought also adrianus ouercome iewes eftsones yet rebell chaced hem oute ierl̄m put therinne men nacions • nd sith tyme place crist suffred passion within northe walles cyte ierl̄m whiche fore tyme withoute walles adrianus tyme philosopher secundus flouryng whiche put hym self silence wold speke lyues ende cause scilence 〈◊〉 study • atte scole athene herde vnstydfastnes woman therfore tyme whan come home vnknowen frendes thought tassaye proue vnstydfastnes owne moder· yaue wenche • er seruaunt yeft • brought hym pryuel •• nyght vnto moders bedde thenne moder bygan 〈◊〉 hym comforte haue doo nay moder sayd sitting defowle place whiche cam sayd art thou sayd secundus thy sonne whan moder herd deyde forthwith shame sorowe thenne sawe vnderstode moder deede defaul • e spekynge • llynge vnto made grete doole sorowe auowed neuer speke soo neuer spak lyued • mbe man lyues ende helde auowe v • lyues ende· wold sp • ke fo • man • ce ne fayre bihe • te yet brought fore adrian th • mperour· speke wolde neuer wreton • question wrote scylence tyme lefforꝰ pope greke sixtus passion pope xj yere ordeyned lente 〈◊〉 fasted fore cester noman sholde synge masse fore hour vndern men shold singe thre mass gloria excelsis crystemas day yere eustace fore callyd placidas martred wyf child ¶ tyme thre maydens fides spes caritas moder sapiencia martred rome • adrian themperour deyde campania dropecye • tyme aquila ylond pontus flourysshynge· second seuenty torned holy wryt oute hebrue grue ¶ passion thelefferus igynus greke philosopher athene pope four yere· ordeyned clergye rewled ordre degree ¶also ordeyned archibisshop shold condempne suffrygan sight heeryng othe • suffrigans bisshops prouynce ¶ capitulum 15 antonius pius sonnes aurelius lucius emperour two twenty yere suche name al kyngdome withhelde caucions dettour foryaue dettis therfor callyd fader countreye • sayd wolde saye ofte maner leuer ensample scipion saue one cyteseyn ouercome thousand enemyes • doughter faustina sawe swerde men fyghte cast soo grete loue one seke loue· tolde owne husbond marcus antonius thenne counseyll phisiciens caldea swerde man slayne faustynas bodye enoynted bloode soo sorow cesed· also many men straunge nacions dyde armure putte cause stryf vpon antonius redy stonde ordenaunce dome ieronimus de viris tyme policarpus bisshop ephesim disciple iohan theuangelyst come rome conuerted many men oute theyr heresye afterward brente chirche iginus pius pope fyften yere prayer hermes wrote booke cleped pastor therinne wreton esterday shold holde sondaye byddynge aungele shewed clothynge fyssher ¶ aboute • yme tro • tus pompeus nacion spayne floure • wrote storyes al world nynus tyme kynge assiria vnto tyme hoole lordshippe emperours xliiij bookes disciple iustinus abredged bookes iustinus pleder wryter historyes also iustinus wrote book de cristiana religione antoniꝰ piꝰ therby made hym goodly pius anitetus pope ten yere badde clerkes sholde shauen rounde aboute haue longe locke ¶ galyen phisicien born pergamus floures rome· expowned ypocras bookes made many volume owne sayth resonable abstinence vsed lyued honderd fourty yere ete neu er ne drank fylle nether ete rawe fruyt ¶ hadde alway swete smellyng breth deyde age non • euyl tyme hirmeus episcopus lugdium flourynge expowned many bookes holy wryt ¶ ptholomeus connyng man science mathematyke flowres made astronomye made fore tyme man straunge wacche lytel mete swete breth made many b • okes ben named almagestus perspectiua iudicijs quadripertitum centilogum ¶amonge prouerbis tweyne ben famous noble heyghest amōg men retcheth neuer hath world honde men ben amended hym amended men ¶ capitulum 16 marcus antonius verus lucius comodus sone antonius pius regneden thryr fader eyghten yere tweyne bothe ioyned kynred • affynyte though bothe born one wombe marcus antonius wedded antonius pius doughter lucius comodus wedded marcus antonius doughter· soo tweyne romaynes begonne haue twey emperours marcus neuer proude none happe myght befalle stydfast sad childhode chaunged neuer semblaunt sorow ne ioye· also bataill dyde ayenst german sclaues sar •• te hadde spent al tresory nought yeue vnto knyghtes yet hym leuer leye wedde vessel siluer gold tharaye wyf greue prouynces londes senatours ¶ therfor whan vyctorye wonne recouerd al moche payd pryse valewe hem wolde yelde ayene bought receyued wedde wroth hem wold yelde agayne bought receyued wedde relesed many ••• butes prouynces londes table dettes men wyd hym brente myddel cyte cruel lawes attemperid newe ordenaunces constitucions· tyme egesippus flouryd wryter storyes destroyenge ierl̄m booke wreton grue ambrose torned latyn • tho mayde praxedis flouryng hadde buryed many martires prayde oure lord myght passe hem boone herd emperours tyme wa • 〈◊〉 grete pestylence deth hoost rome nygh destroyed tyme themperour fought ayēst quades men fayleden wele nygh drynke god almyghty sente hem rayne fro heuē· contrary befyl whā lightnynge fered german sarmates gaufr aboute firste yere marcus lucius coyllus sonne bygan regne brytayne gaufr alfr sente lettres elentherius pope resseyue crystendome bone graunted· briton helde kept hoolly fayth byleue vnto dyoclysian themperours tyme anitetus sother pope nyne yere ordeyned menchon nonne shold handle towayllis auter neyther ensence sence • shal bere veyle heede also ordeyned wyf shold holden lawful blessyd preest sother elenthe •• u • pope xv yere· ordeyned crysten men shold forsake ne forbere mete skylful resonable mankynde man shold degraded ne put state degre lawfully accused fore hond sayde saueour wyste wel iudas theef traytoure· accused put downe al dyde meane tyme among thappostlis state dygnyte alowed stode ferme stable also pope atte prayeng lucius kyng brytons sente forganus damianꝰ crystned kynge peple made bisshopes archebisshops stede flamynes • cheflamynes mysbyleuyd men hadden steede archibisshops bisshops crystendome dured brytayne ij·c yere sixtene vnto dyoclisians tyme whan seynt albon martred ¶ capitulum 17 marcus lucius comodus emperour thyrten yere comodus vnprofytable thynges yaue al lechery harlotrye made slee many senatours cristen men cleped monethe septembre name also deffamed shrewdnes wif fought amphiteatre short swerd men hows goddes vesta strangled atte laste dyede soo grete wrath de • pyte demed enemy mankynde tre uisa amphiteatrum hygh round place se aboute thenne foloweth sto •• sente philip noble burgeys rome egypte philippes doughter eugenia twry sonnes prothus iacinc • u went way mannys wede vnwetyng fader byleue cristned called eugenius made monk whan abbot dede eugenius made abbot stede· atte last woman hete melencia cast lecherous eye vpon eugenius wold haue eugenius lye her· cause eugenius wolde assente melencia diffamed eugenius sayde eugenius wolde haue leyn strength ayenst wylle wherfor eugenius take brought fader philip thenne kytte slytte clothes shewed owne doughter eugenia shewede prothus iacinctus gelded whan fader sawe cristned al meyne melencia hadde deffamed sodenly brente stroke lightnynge elentherius victor pope ten yere anone sente lettres theophilus allexandria alle bretheren sholde gadre counseyl ordeyne holding esterday marianus li • 1 ca 2 ffor apostle dede vnto tyme cristemas daye holde vij day fore • anyuer vpon • hat day euer felle men gallia helde esterday vij day fore april vpon day weke someuer felle fyrst bygonne take holde ¶ eusebius storye tellith men eest londes helde esterdaye fourten daye mone vpon day euer fylle moneth marche ¶ counseyl sinode pope victor narcisus patriarch ierusalem hireneus bisshop lugdium ordeyned esterday sholde holden fyrst sondaye xiiij day mone first moneth marche 〈…〉 esterweke sholde dure vnto xxj day mone 〈◊〉 thylk day acompted ester weke theophilus cesarea halpe moche ordenaunce theodocius ephesym tyme holden noble man thyrdde tourned holy wryt hebrew grue comodꝰ hiliꝰ pertinax emperour six monethes hym sl • iulian connyng man lawe toke thempyre strengthe slayne one seuerus anone seuen moneth ¶ capitulum 18 iulianus seuerus affryca countray heyghte tripoli emperour sixten yere made emperour mo affryca fyrst eschetour steygh vp dyuerse office dygnytees vnto emperour right skars sterne kynde ouercome parthes arabes therfor callyd perthicus arabicus made wall brytayne stretcheth six score myle tweyne vnto see deyde york ¶ beda libro 1 seuerus gouerned comynte myghtly grete trauayl· atte last wente brytayne made wall turues stone somme men wene departed brytayne wal dalf vp turnes grounde made vp high wal soo fore wal dyche turues doluen oute therupon ben pyght stronge pole stake tree strengthed ofte wal many toures deyde afterwarde york lefte hym twey sone basianus geta geta iuged comyn enemy put deth basianꝰ callid antoniꝰ kyngdō gaufr luciꝰ kyng britōs dei • e without childrē buried gloucetre thēne fyl stryf among briton power romayns· therfor seuerꝰ senatour two legion sēte brytayn made wall atte coste comynte bytwene deira albania ben north side englond scotland made wal ayenst fulgencius kynge pyctes fought afterward york slayn buryed lefte hym two sone one hete geta moder rome heet bassianus moder brytayne therfor grete fyghtyng bytwene two bretheren geta slayne bassianus kyngdome gaufr brytons chose bassianus moder bryton romains chese geta cause moder romayn fought geta slayn r ¶ eutropius sayth story rome geta slayn atte cyte edessa whan fought ayenst parthes ¶but gaufr story brytons sayth geta slayn one caransius tyraunt frayed hym symachus tho floures· • e fourth translated holy wrytte oute hebrue grue samarytes torned vnto iewes lawe was· made proselitus whan torned fro another lawe iewes lawe eusebius libro sexto tyme narcisus flowryng bisshop ierl̄m wreton right trewe iugge stydfast wold bende alway holde trouth yeue true sentence therfor thre men culpable hem self feyned blame accused bisshop brought forth hem self wytnes fyrste prayd fyre helle must brenne hym sothe sayde second prayd kynges euil muste de • troye hym yf sothe sayde thyrdde prayde muste lose bothe eyen sothe sayde grete eye goddes ordenaunce brent first witnes prayde hows therto· destroyed second wytnes kynges euyl thyrdde sawe felawes sped dr • ful sore knowleched h • trespas sore th • peple wept many teres ofte synne trespas lost eyen passion vyctor zephirinus pope ix yere ordeyned euery cristen man xii yere olde aboue sholde euery yer one receyue sacramēt hoseled esterday made many omelyes epistle makinge legende childermasse day beginneth zelus quotendat forth also decollacioon seint iohn ¶ eusebius libro sexto ¶ seynt leonydes • gn • fader martrid alexandria first day march sonne origenes child xviij yere hight adamanciꝰ also cast folowe thensample fader thordenaūce god besynes moder child kepte ful grete prouffyt many men hidde childes clothes night wolde haue goon oute morow therfor childe wrote letter fader howe holden hoome sleyht moder prayde fader wold stydfaste holde forth hadde bygonne whyle lytel childe axed ofte question fader axyd howe holy wryte yeue v thinspiracion holy gost· goddes counseyll hid holy wryt symplenes spekyng wordes ¶ hit sayd ofte whan childe slepe fader wolde vnhele childes breste worshipe • goddes temple kysse ful swetely saye wel gate euer suche childe ¶ thenne whan fader martryd child eyghten yere age fore sayde whan fadris catel taken thescheters moder wydowe eyght bretheren lefte grete pouert meschyef ¶ alexandria helde gramer scole haue lyuelode hym ¶ euer amonge tourned men cristen feyth halpe socoured hem poursiewed brought meschyef conforted hem lad deth fayth holy chirche· vsid moche wakynge fastynge· folowed sayng gospel counseylleth shold haue two kyrtels ne care day cometh morowe soo yf le knewe ony kepte catell lyue refused hem wold haue hem loore wente many yere withoute hosen shoe • alwey spared wyn yf helpynge stomak yougth dyde one dede semed vnparfight wytte token ful byleue parfyght chastite gospel sayth somme ben ghelded ghelde hem self kyngdome god therfor cause chastyte also shold preche men woman pryuely mame • alysander themperours moder desired orygenes speke stute hym shold come oute alexandria vnto antiochia ¶ orygenes withoute hadde seuen yong men seuen maydens wrote dyuers bookes mater yaue hem 〈◊〉 owne mouth wrot • • moch ierom knowlechyd hadde red orygenes bokes four thousand volume withoute epistle hadde wryten hit prouerbe hym suche loore suche lyf slepte vpon bedde tasted nether flessh ne wyn giraldus orygenes neygh grettest holy wryt ••• yf erred moche speche alle latyn 〈◊〉 folowen ennius alle expositours folowen orygenes also hi • maner translated byble grue also fonded amende translacions doctours· aquila symachꝰ theodocion hebrue made signe heyght • belus shappn endlong lyke rodde • e lasse hebrue spak derkly· made signe called asteristus shape lyke ••• ieronimus epistola 41 orygenes sayde wel noma • sayd better sayd euyl man sayde werse ¶ whan passyd wele nygh doctours bookes passyd hym self super cantica canticorum spake thousande tretys chirche made exposicions withoute nombre called hem themos yf ony folowe hym put errour ayenste v may take hede grete homerus slepte somtyme longe werke lawfu • l slepe somtyme shall folowe vytes yf may folowe vertues ¶ therfor yf one bookes defowled whiche book heyg • te peryarchon whe •• nne vnderstondeth euyll fader worse sone worst holy goost· sayd cast somtyme thurgh̄ grete mercy saue angel fyll doune fro heuen leyth hym verse saw •• r god shall wroth euermore nether manace withoute ende shall bookes destroyed hym self orygenes pystle wrote fabyan pope rome maketh sorow wreton suche thynges put cause fo • e vpon one ambrose put forth bookes wreton priueli made hym comyn er hadde corrected amended frendes sayd haue done this· yf holde pee shall holden gylty yf answer shall holden enemy eyther condicion harde tweyne shall chese lighter aboute tyme fyfth translacion founden toun ierycho translacion callid vulgata auctor 〈◊〉 vnknowe ¶it semeth̄ comyn sauter vse taken translacion though folowe ieroms translacians bookes holy wryt damasus pope made chirche rome folowe ierom also sawter sequitur capitulum 19 bassianus antonius seuerus sonne regned fader seuen yere callid marcus aurelius carakalla also maner clothyng gaue rome therfor bathe made rome ben called caracalane right euil man sharper maners fader vnsuffrable lechery r ¶ toke owne stepdame iuliana wedded wyf ¶ place maner dyeng auctours discorden sayd fore honde gaufr alfr bassianus regned one caransius come • h lowest blode brytons noble man coūceyl honde • gate senatours kepyng costes brytayne· tyme frensshemen saxon werryd therupon whan 〈◊〉 goten axyng dyde harme damage proff • comynte byhete briton wolde 〈◊〉 chace romayns oute ylond yf wold make hym kyng ¶ thenne slough bassianus 〈◊〉 kyngdome seuen yere pyctes fulgencius • nc bassianus moders broder brought oute sacia oute londes fors •• e bassianus bataill carancius hadde hyred hem soo carancius hadde vyctorye yaue pyctes dwellyng place albania scotland medled brytons dwellid afterwarde longe tyme senatours rome herde herof sente one allectus thre legyons brytayn slee tiraunt carancius slayne allectus regned thre yere restored brytayne agayne power rome gir· allectus greued poursiewed brytons holde caransius one asclepiodotus duk cornewayle made kynge thre yeere slough allectus london many thousandes romayns ¶ gauredus london lon ge besieged venodotes men north wale fylle vpon gallus allectus felawe slough hym within london broke hath name hym callyd gallebro •• walbrooke ¶and asclepiodotus regned somwhat yeres ylond vnto dioclisianus tyme thenne coelus duc colchesire slough asclepiodotus ¶ r giraldus gaufredus calle aslepiodotꝰ duc cornewaile beda libro 1 ca 6 foloweth eutropius story rome called asclepiodotus prefecte pretorye eutropius opilius macrinus prefect pretorye emperour bassianus one yere thenne atte archelaydes slayne sone also ¶ zephirinus calixtus pope fyue yere· ordeyned fastyng four tyme yere plente ol corne fruyte made chirche yerde rome place callyd via apia burye bodyes holy martris place callyd cimitoriū calixti marcꝰ aureliꝰ antoniꝰ holden sone carcalla emperour two yere forbare maner lechery atte last slayne stryuyng knyghtes ¶ capitulum 20 avrelius alexander emperour thyrten yere soo cruel correction lawe chyualrye vndyde hool legyons made grutchyng stryf assessour one vulpianus connyng man lawe ¶ slayne magounce almayne stryuyng knyghtes tyme sixth translacion founden holy wrytte nycapolis palestina ¶marcus ¶ calixtus pope martred alexander tyme ¶ fyrst vrban pope hym eyght yere ordeyned offryng cristen men shold none otherwyse spente vse holy chirche helpe nedy cristen men ben vowes cristen men pry synne tyme chirche rome began fyrst haue londes rente prouffyt therof· fonde notaryes clerkes wryte lyuynge dedes holy sayntes fore tyme holy cirche lyued apostle receyued money vse • f nedy cristen men vrban cristned valerianus spouse seint cecile atte last martred hym aurelius tyme poncianus pope fyue yere atte last 〈…〉 brought martred sardinia ¶ afterward 〈◊〉 brought body rome buryed sayth siriacus pope poncianus one yere cause resigned papacye ayenst wyll clergye one antherus made pope wente agrippina whiche nowe called coleyn enleuen thousand maydens crystend wel nygh al· sette booke rekenyng pope cardynalys trowyd lefte poperych fo • • euocion lykyng maydens netheles clene mayde martred sayde maydens aurelius slayne magounce maximinus iulius made emperour hoost withoute auctoryte senatours emperour thre yere poursiewed holy chirche specially orygenes slayne atte last aquila· gordyanus emperour six yere slayne one phelip prefect pretory fer rome gordianus hadde ouercome parthes fabian pope antherus fyften yere whan pope deede passed way talked frendes • chesyng newe pope ¶ thenne downe came sodenly sat heede sayde thou shalt crowned bisshop rome ¶ soo chosen goddes ordenaunce ordeyyed seuen 〈…〉 wryte dedes holy martres ordeyned 〈◊〉 yere crysme oyle sholde halowed holy chirches 〈◊〉 martred atte last decius tyme· pope tyme one nanacius prest rome desired pope bycam heretyke denyed synful man myghte saued therfor made counseyll sixty bisshops· tyme affricanus wrytar flouryng· h •• ac • ydes bisshop sayth wrote lyues holy fadres booke callyd paradysu • · affrycanus prayd wente alexandria occupyed mayster chayr orygenes also tyme co • lu duc colchestre slough asclepiodotus regned brytain thyrtty yere vnto ecomyng constancius ¶ capitulum 21 philippus sonne philip emperour seuen yere fyrst • risten man al themperours •• istend seynt poncius martir· soo stydfaste fayth holy chirche knowleched frely synne houseled fore al peple esterday sone cristen man sterne herte man myght meue lawghe ¶ one tok • heede fader made mowe torned away face alwey withstode vyces fonded styghe vp parfyghtnesse vertues eutropius iiij yere emperour ended thousand yere rome bylded solempnyte therof philip slough beestes withoute nombre round place called grete cirtꝰ made playes theatre mars felde thre dayes thre nyghtes peple woke besyly fabian pope martred decius consul tyme cornelius pope thre yere ordeygned none othe sholde chalengyd pope right fayth holy chirche preest sholde committe cause another mānes dome appeled court rome ¶also atte prayer seynt lucina made bodyes thappostles take ou •• place hght catacumb charnel brought powles bodye place callyd via hostiensis petres body place called vaticanus faste place put crosse ¶in pope tyme grekes stolen bodyes apostlis brynge hem grece· fendes closed dwellyd mawmettes compellyd vertue god cryde help ye men rome goddes ben take away thenne crysten men vnderstode sayd thappostles mysbyleuyd· men vnderstode sayd theyr goddes ¶ mysbyl • uyd men cristen men gadred hem geders alle one rowte one assente poursiewed grekes· thenne grekes aferde threwe bodyes thappostlis pytte atte place heyght catacumbe whan bodyes take oute place hit doute whether bone peter whether pawles ¶thē ne crysten men bygonne praye faste reuelacion shewyng god gretter bone fyssher bones· fyssher peter phelip older slayne verona philip 〈◊〉 slayne rome gyle fraude decius ¶r redde legenda sanctorum philip olde • • ad sente noble knight decius chastyse gallia decius spedde wel cam agayne themperour cam ayenste oute rome slayne verona fraude gyle thenne yonger philip herde therof sleygh toke fader tresour sixtus pope laurence dekene dele pour men ¶then •• decius made emperour men sholdwene hadde slayne lord loue maumetry trayterly ¶this decius poursiewed cristen men emperour thre yere ¶he wolde haue crowned sone decius emperour sone wold sayde drede shal foryete sone yef made emp • rour leuer sayd emperour meke sonne emperour stoute sone vnkynde· fader shal emperour ¶my empyre shal subgette buxom emperour capitulum 22 orosius sayth decius emperoroure thre yere • ud thre monethes eusebius beda cassiodorus tellen bygan regne yere buyldynge rom • thousend yere four eusebius cronyque semeth decius regned eyght yere martilogye semeth regned sixten yere semeth • llys myght stō de many pop •• fabian cornelius lucius stephen sixtꝰ martred decius tyme wreton radde therfor somme men wold suppose sixtene yere two yere galerius shal restore eyghten yere lacken cronikes eusebius beda fro fyften yere tiberius cesar vnto tyme among take hede elder decius slough philip emperour hym emperour sayde decius yonger cesar emperour· bytwene two decius bothe emperours pope gallus volusianus hem regned valerius sone galyenus fyften yere tyme martryd fyue pope laurencius dekene ypolitus al hows semeth galyenus two name callyd decius also 〈◊〉 men suppose al one decius made cesa • philip thylke decius vnder whome laurence martred ¶ therfor nowther redde laurence legende decius emperour decius cesar happeth oftyme somme cesars augustes ne emperours somme fyrst cesars thenne augustus· thenne emperours thenne fyrst yere decius themperour seuen slepers bygonne sleepe mount celius slepe two honderd yere roose aboute last tyme theodocius aboute tyme antonius famoꝰ monke born egypte· cornelius pope martrid hym lucius pope thre yere abdon sennen martred also seynt agatha cathyna also yer • decius sonne w • slayne gothes tracia red ypolytus passion decius valerianus trauailed fende laurences passion deyde meschyef gallus sone volusianus regned two yere wente oute rome emilianus slough hem toke thempyre wronge slayne moneth tyme fyl pestylence al world orygenes deyde buryed tirus yere age lxx ¶ capitulum 23 ualeryanus sonne galyenus regned fyften yere· fyrst· worshiped soo holy sayntes trowyd hows hadde goddes owne chirch afterward apeyred one wytche bygan hate fayth crystē men thenne biganne poursue cristen men· goddes helpe soo mone hym taken sapor kyng perce eyen putte oute· holden dispytous bondage lyues ende· soo sholde stoupe grounde kyng sholde sette fote bak whan shold lepe hors aboute yere decius hyghte galyenꝰ wax cruel sterne paule fyrst heremyte wente wyldernes lyued vnknowen lx yere geder ierom wryteth vitas patrum ¶after lucius stephen pope thre yere ordeygned mynystres holy chirche sholde holy vestymentes comyn vse euery daye stephen slayne whyle saide masse second ciprianus fyrst man lawe pletar • afterward preeste atte last bisshop cartage martred daye cornelius pope martred yere aft • r stephen martred sixtus p • pe two yere • edeygned men sholde synge masse vpon aulter afterward martred felicissimus agapitus deciꝰ tyme sayth martiloge better byleue cronykes auctours ben knowen galyenus themperour hete decius also ¶this sixtus went spayne time fonde two yonglynges vyncent laurence owne cosyns wel thewed manerd toke hede hem brought hem • hym rome· laurence abode hym rome vyncent went agayne spayne martred afterward dacianus iuges tyme sixtus martred denys monk pope six yere· departed paryshes chirche yerdes assygned eueryche parysshe preeste denys felix pope foure yete eugenia prothus iacinctus thenne martred rome tyme gregorius nazauzenus flour • bisshop constantinople grece two bretheren germayns strofe ponde plente fysshe prayer ponde waxed drye bere corn • fruyte ¶ also chirche shold buylded place place scarce narowe eest side grete roche grete ryuer weste side gregory prayde nyghte morn founden roche withdrawen • fer neded place large ynough make bylde chirche also another tyme wynter passed alpes must wende appolyns temple whan goon fro temple preest tēple wōt gete moche good answer maumett gaf gate mawmet gaf none answer preest offred sacryfyce bysyly sayd sl • pe appollo delphicꝰ put oute comyng gregory myght come ageyne withoute leue gregory ¶ whan preest herde anone wente gregory purchaced letter hym wordes gregory sendeth gretynge appolyn suffre torne agayne thy place doo thou wont doo letter set vp appolyns temple appolyn yaue answer wonte· whan preest sawe wente gregory prayd hym wolde make hym crysten man atte last whan gregory dede bisshoppe hym ¶ claudius seconde regned one yere somwhat monethes ¶ one ouercome gothes deyde broder quintilius r • gned as • nte knyghtes slayn xv day aquila ¶ felyx pope martred euticianus pope six yere ordeyned first fruytes shold blessyd vpon aucter also buryed thre honderd sixty martres owne honde ¶ capitulum 24 avrelianus denmark born emperour fyue yere somwhat monethes lyke grete alysaunder iulius alysaunder xij yere w •• te inde iulius ten yere ouercome galles german fought foure yere ayenst cyteseyns▪ martred many holy men called cyte genalium name aurelyan slayne fast constantinople ¶after hym tacitus regned six monethes whiche slayne pontus ¶ thenne tha • ••• rianus regned thre monethes slayn tharsis •• ter passion euticianus gaius pope nyntē yere ordeyned degree ordres holy chirch ¶ hostiariu • lector exorcista acolytus mo man shold accuse mynystrys holy chirche fore seculer iugge manychyes haue tha • name him▪ • • • ther ben tweyne fyrst werchers maker • thynge • one good another euil one l • ght another derknes· giraldus alfredus ¶aleu •• tyme •• mayns sent one constan •• u monethes wan gallia oute theyr hondes restored agayne lete galles pannonyes haue vse vynes whan wele nyghe sette al pee sayd short tyme sholde haue nede knyghtes atte last slayn 〈◊〉 stryuyng knyght • ¶ carus sone carinus 〈◊〉 numerianus emperour two yere drowned 〈◊〉 ryuer tigris ¶ also numerianus lad lytter sore eyen owne wyues fader apru • satte way • e hym slough hym ¶thenne many daye • wa • vnnethe founde stenche carayn ¶ carinus ouercome slayn margus ¶ capitulum 25 dioclysianus sonne dalmata wryter fyrste consul thenne made emperour emperour twenty yere anone smote aprus gadryng knyghtes swore withoute tresonne gyle numerianus slayne man ful ofte • esy subtyl wytte soo couthe fulfylle cruelnes enuye badde commaunded men sholde worshipe god almyghty 〈◊〉 vsed clothes ho • en shoen ryally araied precious stones· though emperours fore hym salewed iuges • e mantel men none dyuersite fro comyn clothyng men suche reede mantell ¶ also werre b ataylles toward toke one herculius maxmianus made hym felawe kyngdome ¶ herculius wa • openly grym sterne wold vnder • awe▪ sterne sone knowen grysly countenaūce semblaunt ¶ dyoclysianu • made fyrste cesar afterward augustus ¶he bare doune greete multitude chorles yelded 〈◊〉 galles ¶ iourneye legyon • pe • heete legy • thebea seynt • ury •• one •• gyon ¶atte laste dyoclysianus made constanciu • galerius cesars soo thempyre gouerned two augustus dioclysianus maximianus two cesars constancius galeriꝰ augustus gre • er cesar wolde haue gretter affynyte dyoclysianus made constancius forsake wyf wedde theodora stepdoughter herculiꝰ max • mianus constancius gate six children· made galerius wedde doughter forsake wyf atte last dyoclysianus maximianus lefte thempyre fre wyll begonne philosophres thenne constancius galerius deled thempyre bytwene tweyne iliricum est londes fill galerius west bondes fille constancius helde content fraunce spayne graunted londes galerius therfore galerius ordeyned two cesars maximinus est seuerus ytalye helde hym content iliricum al one grece mene tyme dyoclysianus fonde sle constantinus sone helene constantinus ware gile fledde fader ¶ yere seynt george capadocia tribunus perce cyte heyte dyospolis besides ioppen martryd vnder dacianꝰ iugge doome counseyll nycene legende acompted wryting callyd apocryfa treuisa ¶apocrifa wrytyng none auctoryte cause thauctor therof vnknowen thenne foloweth thystory ¶aftre gain martred marcellinus pope eight yere ¶dioclysianus compe • lyd somtyme assented sacrifice mawmettes af • erward counseyll made campania knouleched trespaas fo • e nyne score bisshops clothed self heer threwe powder duste owen hede submytted hym stonde dome iugement bisshops ¶thenne bisshops sayde thou hast forsake peter forsoke demed none man wente oute wepte bytterly soore therfore deme thou thy self ¶and sayde deme deposed sette doune acoorse alle burye body holy buryels ¶afterward knowleched byfore dyoclysianus cristen man soo beheded bodye lay thirtty dayes strete vnburyed seint peter appered night marcellus preest pope marcellinus saide manere ¶ marcelle buriest thou bodye whiche vnderstode marcellinus bodye haste thou redde euery man loweth meketh hym shal made hye ¶ thenne burye hym thou fast buryels departe v one grace hath made v rightful beside lyngons constancius augustus slough sixty thousand almains· closed within cyte late oute roope ouer wal vnwetynge hoost galerius ouercome narsus flye dyoclysianus sayth receyued hym waye soo grete booste triumphe dyoclysianus ranne galerius chare many long myle clothed emperour marc ¶ passion marcellinus pope· see voyde many dayes thenne marcellus pope fyue yere ordeyned cyte fyften cardynals seruyse crystnyng buriyng maximianus themperour made pope kepe beestes wold doo sacryfice mawmettes thenne night clerkes lad hym oute stable broode way halowed hows made therof chirche maximianus made chirche stable closed marcellus comyn warde shold efte kepe beestes marcellus deyd • clothed heer hym eusebius phisician pope eyght monethes r ¶ cronyk eusebius beda eyghten yere dyoclysianus fyrst yere grete persecucion vnder dyoclysianus eest maximianꝰ west ¶that persecucion grettest lengest duryng dured ten yere continuelly· though dyoclysianus maximianus left yelde vp thempyre thyrdde yere persecucion sayd fore hond yet persecucion bygonne seced fore seuenth yere grete constantin sayth persecucion greuoꝰ grete yt chirches bookes goddes lawe brēt within one moneth dyuerse place world xvij thousand • oly mē woman crowned martirdom man shold bye ne selle ne take vp water ony place yf dyd sacryfyce maumetrie tyme martred many noble martres pancraciꝰ first felicianꝰ sebastianꝰ felix audaciꝰ vij bretheren moder grysogonꝰ iiij ben callyd quatuor coronati also vyncent george pantaleon vitus modestꝰ ciprianꝰ iustina cosmas damianus childe barala fidis eufenna lucia anastasia· agne • gorgonius alle one cyte frigia beda libro· capitulo sexto ¶ tyme seynt albon martred brytayne· hym fortunatus pree • st libro quē de laude virginum intitulauit speketh manere plentynous • rytayne bryngeth forth noble albon whan albon paynym l • dged cristen man couertyd loore toke vpon hym habyte clerk cam fore iugge dampned deth couertyd moche folk fast broke dreyed prayer 〈◊〉 afterward toppe hil deyde made prayer welle sprynge oute erthe tourned tormentours shold slee hym feyth holy chirch martred fast cyte verolanium hete englysshe verlamchestre watlyngchestre beda ¶that tyme come vp arrians heresye enfected grete londes world also ilondes world ben alwey redy newe thynges holde thynge certayne ¶dioclisianus maximianus forsoke thempyre ladde pryuate lyf one nychomedia melan ¶ melchiades pope four yere forbade fastynge sonday thursday paynems worshipen thylke dayes ¶ galerius emperour one yere ordeyned tweyne cesars ••• ius seuerus· ¶beda libro primo tyme con • tancius deyde yorke brytayne yere pryncipate x • ij ¶and left hym oldest sonne goten helene constantyn kynge brytayne fraunce ¶ capitulum 26 constantyn dyde nobly bare hym myghtly strongly knyghtes pretory rome toke maxē cius herculius sone callyd hym augustus thenne galerius augustꝰ sente seuerꝰ made cesar al hoost ayenst rome seuerꝰ besieged cyte bytrayed falshede owne knyghtes fled rauenna ther slayn herculius maxencius fader herde therof brake oute hudels wold empepour dyde best pryue maxencius myght power therfor galerius comforted dyoclisianus take 〈◊〉 dygnytees hadde lefte setted therby answerd sayde wold god ye myght see wortes myn honde salon sikerly thēne wold ye deme shold take agayne ¶ thenne herculius stryf knyghtes openly sory aferd· wente fraunce reue byneme take thempyre treson constantyn wedded doughter· bewreyed doughter fausta constantinus wyf fled marselle slayne thenne galerius 〈◊〉 licinius emperour tarent worst men couetyse sharpest lecherye moost enemy lettred men called lettres comyn pestelence meyne palays called spadones saye ghelded men also called hem mowhthes rattes palays whan galierius pursiewed 〈◊〉 greued men ten yere thenne brest roted withyn cause phisiciens myght endure stenche hym slough hem ful ofte tyme phisician sayd hym th •• meschyef goddes wratthe wreche thenne sente maundementes reconseyled cristen men exy •• d· thenne deyde melchiad • siluestre pope four twenty yere crystned grete constantyn 〈◊〉 clensed hym meselrye crystnynge ¶also delyuerd cyte rome pestelence dragon prayer reysed dede boole lyf ouercome iewes disputision made firste gre •• counseylle nycen ther four honderd bisshops eyghten ¶ name poure men wydowes faderles moderles child wryten booke fonde hem neded ordeyned faste wednesday fryday saterday ¶ also ordeyned thyrsday shold worshiped sonday day cryst ordeyned sacrament body thursdaye ascended vp 〈◊〉 nene holy crysme oyle halowed thursday 〈◊〉 ¶gir p thenne constantyn seuenth yere wente toward batayle ayenste maxencius sawe slepe signe crosse shynynge heuene brennynge layte fyre angel stode beside sayde constantyn· thoycanata saye thi • tokene thou shalt haue vyctorye ¶ thenne awoke made peynte signe token hadde seen baners penons knyghtes ¶ atte laste maxencius ouercome atte brydge pount milinum constantyn went rome made peynte signe tokene crosse right hondes ymages senatours areysed worship triū phi vyctory made wryte vndernethe signe tokene god lyf may ouercome gaufr alfrd constantyn wente oute brytayn thempyre rome ¶ thenne octauius duc iewesses werryd brytayne toke kyngdome ¶constantyn herde therof sente trahern came moder helene thre legyons knyghtes ayenst octauius hem byfell diuerse happes soo dyuerse tymes one maistrye efte • soo trahern slayne fraude gyle soo octauius regned vnto tyme gracianus valentinianus themperours gir de p ¶after maxenaus ouercome constantyn smeton stronge lepre meselrye ¶r wreton legenda sanctorum siluestris lif somme suppose constantyn smeton meselrye wreche persecucion tarauntrye vsed poursiewed
