greued cristen men· durynge persecucion siluester amonge fledde cyte withoute ony doubte cause euer smeten meselrye sothe siluestre led gir vbi supra coūseyl senatours bisshops mysbyleuyd men brought iij m· smal child sholde haue slayne costantyn sholde haue ben wasshen warme bloode child hele hym lepre whan kynge sawe moders childeren wepe make grete sorow· thenne sayde dygnyte thempyre cometh welle myldenes demed shold dyȝ sleeth childe batayll ¶ de legenda sancti siluestri thenne c • uel dede owne forboden doo straungers prouffyte ouercome straung • men self ouercome cruelnes hit vertue strengthe ouercome straunge men· vertue thewes ouercome vyces synne bat •• l w •• strenger batayll ben strenger oure self· thenne late myldenes haue maystrye •• yng mowe better haue maystrye eaemyes better v deye saue childrens lyf gete greete cruel lyf dethe innocent child ¶ yet certayne shal saue lyf certayne yf soo saued cruel lyf thenne next nyght peter paule appiered hym sayde thou agrysed agast sparedest shede child bloode take coūseyl heele sauacion ¶ sende siluestre hydeth hym mount sarapt make hym come whan brought shewed kynge ymages thappostles peter paule appiered hym sleepe thenne fasted eyghte dayes made hym cathecuminus crystned atte laste knowleched seen crist ¶ treuisa cathecuminus lerneth fayth holy chirche wylle crystned r ¶ ambrose ierome cronyque tellen constantyn abode bapteme last dayes myght crrystned iordane ¶thenne whan constantyn crystned made prison opened lete prysoners goo oute temple mawmettes destroyed chirche dores opened olde chirches amended newe chirches buyldedand graunted chirches fredome pryueleges ordeyned bisshop rome shold hyest al bisshopes yaue tenthe deele al possession chirches atte reparaylynge • int peter chirch wente mattok opened fyrst erthe bare cleye werke sholders ¶ giraldus vbi supra tyme forwarde cause grete rychesse chirch rome made seculer seculer besynes spirituel deuocion pompe boost outward holynesse within forth supposed therfor wreton whan constantyn hadde made yefte ch • rches olde enemy cryed openly thayer· day venym heled shedde holy chirche therfore ierome vitas patrum seyth· syth holy chirche encreaced possession decreced vertues ¶ also themperour palays laterane bylded chirche th • worship seynt iohn made therinne fonte stone maner stone hete porphiriticus arayed within siluer ¶and myddel therof pyler bare vy • l gold bawme brenning alwey ¶in legenda siluestri ¶siluester halowed chirche ix day nouembre ¶that day ymage sanyoury peynted wal goddes oune werk mannes dede ymage • en al men yet vnto tyme siluestre ordeyned arere alle chirches auters stone chirche stāblysshed auter tre therinne afore ¶ men saye peter successours songe mass vpon auter holy chirch soo strongly poursued tyme yt bisshop certayn abydynge cyte rome songe mass holowe caues dennes myghte beste vpon holow auter tree whiche born aboute helene brytayne herde sonne spedde sente hym lettres praysed hym moche cause hadde forsake mawmetrye praysed hym worshiped byleued man nayled crosse· themperour wrote ageyne moder shold brynge maystres iewes sooth myght knowen disputacion ¶thenne helene brought forth seuen score wysemen iewes syluester come ayenst hem ¶and two wysemen iewes ne crysten men ordeyned comyn assent deme sothe thenne iewes ouercome· longe disputed one iewes spake certayne wordes wylde boole eere boole dyed anone thenne anone men repreued siluestre sayde goddes name nempned god sleeth yeueth lyf wreton shal slee shal make thynges lyue lyue hath named deuyls name maye slee· yet •• suffraunce god lyon wylde beestes maye slee maye make thynges slee lyue ag •• ne thenne yf wole byleue hym late hym areyse boole fro deth lyf hath slayne cause myght areyse boole hadde slayne iewes promysed w •• byleue criste yf siluestre myght areyse boole deth lyf then̄e praiers siluestre boole reysed deth lyf helene que iewes iugges byleueden al crist thenne constantyn sente moder helene ierusalem bryng thēs • holy crosse ambrose sayth helene hosteler treuere fraunce constantinus cezar wedded beaute storye brytons telleth 〈◊〉 coelus doughter kyng brytayne sayde fore honde ¶ helene cam ierusalem fonde holy crosse departed lefte one part ierusalem brought sone deele foure nayles dyde do▪ putte tweyne sone brydel thirdde ymage rode threwe fourth nayl see adriaticus fore honde sw • lo •• ful peryllous seyle syth tyme fest inuencion hooly crosse hath ben holden· thenne themperour wente rome bysanus callyd owne name constantinople made fayr cyte feir howses chirches • gnyte patriarke brought theder noblest rome gir vbi supra begynnyng holy chirche thre patriarkes stede abraham ysaac iacob one antiochia asia another allexandria affryca thyrdde rome europa thre peter halowed owne sittynge tweyne th • rof bisshop hym self disciple marcus helde thyrdde al ••• ndria peter name 〈◊〉 synodus nycena hadde yeuen pryuelege bisshop rome sholde aboue al bisshops perour aboue kynges· sholde callyd pope chyef fader right patriarke torned constantinople second rome oth • r se • patriarkes chaunged· see antiochia ierusalem see alexandria aqu •• ia supposed cause therof wycked cristen men shold take lond mysbyleuyd men soo sholde folowe shold lese hooly place ¶ eusebius historia ecclesiastica libro decimo constantynus dyde god almyghtyes p •• estes grete reuerence worshipe ¶ therfor whan bisshops assembled synode nycena commaundement constantyn counseylle siluestre declare fayth holy chirche ¶ many hem playned eche vpon put vp bylles themperour shold hem right themperour sawe holy chirche whiche bisshoppis comen myght lyghtly l • tte suche playntes strif therfore set • e hem certayne day sinode counseil make ende al thylke cause playntes· brente priuely alle thylke bylles hem made playntes sayde ¶god hath ordeyned yow goddes owne • gges ¶therfore holde vnsittynge sholde demed shold deme ben goddes holy chirche among self trete ye youre errours defawtes soo thyng knowen outward v • semely holynes yf ye wyl nedes stryue abyde ye dome god almyghty psalme sayth god stode sinagoga goddes certaynly yf saw • ony ordre sinne woman wolde couere hym my· mantel cause none men sholde haue occasion speke euil relygyon ¶ therfor bretheren trete ye fayth holy chirche therfo • ye ben comen whan sayde threwe billes fyre brente· hem yere saynt martin bore thenne twellyfth yere made cathecuminus lerneth fayth holy chirche· ¶ xvj yere made knyght xviij yere made crystned knyght two yere vnder iuliānus ¶ synode nycena thre honderd eyghten bisshops ¶ sinode made sixtene dayes fore moneth iuill cyte nycene bythinia made ayenst arrians fotmos sabellian seynt nycholas synode tho ordeyned fastyng lente tho fo • hond dured fro six • h day ianyuer xv day feuerer sholde bygynne dure nowe vsed thre cause fyrste cause fastynge sholde coupled tyme crystes passion seconde sholde thende oure fastynge • esseyue crystes body clene lyf thyrdde oure lord shold fynde v fastyng ¶ hyderto eusebius pamphilius wryten storye ecclesias • ica callyd historia tripertita thenne ierome wryteth forth storye vnto yonge theodosius tyme th ••• erus bisshop wryteth story al oute ¶arnobius • horicus flouryng tyme affrica dryuen 〈◊〉 fayth holy chirche sueuenes bisshop place wolde receyue er made cleere bookes fayth delyuere plegge trewe fayth ¶ iuuencus preest wrote gospel chirche rome verse six feete siluester marcus pope viij monethes ¶he ordeyned bisshop hostiensis shold vse palle also sacre pope marcus athanasius bisshop alexandria bisshopes egypte w • iten seuenty chapitres publisshed synode nycena ¶in epystle athanasius knowleched bookes shold brente heretick • arrians marcus iulius pope sixten yere exyled second constantinꝰ tyme· bone seynt andrew thappostle seynt luke theuangelyste translated constantinople grete constantyn deyde nychomedia ierom borne ierome historia tripertita seyth constantin last dayes crystned agayne one eusebius bisshop nychomedia arrians ¶and soo constantyn fylle euil loore arrians vnderstanden second constantyn constantine sone namely seynt gregory regyster wryteth maurice emperour callyth constantyn emperour good mynde story tripertita • nde approued ambrose vpon fourten salme sayth man grete meryte mede· alowed afore god ysidre cronyke sayth made gracious ende· also grekes maketh feste hym enleuenth day may ¶ capitulum 27 constancius grete constantyns sonne regned faders deth bretheren constantyn constant six twenty yere byspronge arrius heresie dyspysed chirches chaced crysten men exyled iulius pope fourten yere chaced athanasius bisshop alexandria al world yere arrius heretik helpe themperour 〈◊〉 constantinople chirche stryue agaynste crysten men tourned constancius place clense bely ¶ voyded oute bowel dyed mescheuously ¶ yere iulius pope bygan come agayne oute countrey cerso • hadde ben destroye arrius heresye ¶ thenne warned aungel sholde translate clements body dyde angel bad see withdrewe hym wa • wonte seynt clementis day 〈◊〉 body sette vpon brink see bylded chirche anone buriels lef • see erthe aboute aroos vp cam ylond sith men come ylonde shippes botes bylded chirche yere paule fyrst heremyte deyde egypte yere age honderd xiij ¶ eusebius historia eccl ••• astica libro 21 ¶ yere stronge persecucion ayenste athanasius hadde scoler hete arsemus hadde trespaced •• chastysyng mayster fledde hidde hym hydynge place athanasius enemy • tolde athanasius bare hym thi • scoler arm vse wytchecraft ther ¶ atte • aste tydynges cam arsenius ther hid daye fore mayster sholde come answer arsenius come mayster hid hym efte mayster bad strengthe 〈◊〉 vnwylful corrupcion resseyued therby thenne athanasius mad • signe preest tymotheus shold answere· thenne preest axyd besyly yf man woman spak of· affermed stydfastly soo thenne sone knowen thaccusacion fals trewe athanasius exyled al world aboute soo seker place dwelle ynne therfor two yere geders dwellyd ponde withoute water soo vnethe sawe sonne al bewreyed yong woman thenne coude fynde syker place al constancius kyngdome thenne went constant cesars londes ther • oured one maximus bisshop treuerent made simbolum quicumque vult salus esse ¶atte last constant cesar sēt lettres broder constanci • athanasius restored agayne bisshoprych constant cesar deyde thenne athanasius fyl agayn grete hate wrath moche grete rewardis promysed hem wolde brynge hi • slee brynge forth heede ¶thenne iulius āpostatas tyme athana •••• 〈◊〉 efte rowed ryuer nylus thenne one sette take poursiewed athanasius waar therof tourned bote toward clyf agayne • mete enemye enemye coude byleue fledde fro hym wolde mete hym therfor axed athanasius sat bote yf hadde seen athanasius passith fer fore sayd athanasius enemy begyled passed forth dayles sapor king perce besiege cite nisibm two moneth • prayer saynt iame bisshop cyte snowtes oly •• untes hors eresw •• e soo ful gnattes grete • yes threwe doune al vpon hem disparcled al thoost ¶ seynt nycholas deyde •• mbe sprange oute welle oyle atte heede welle water atte feete atte laste bone translated larrus yere oure lord thousand four score seuen ¶ iulius liberius pope 〈◊〉 yere· outlawed thre yere wolde fauoure arriaus ¶ mene tyme counseyll clergye rome ordeyned felix pope felix made counseyl eyght fourty bisshops condempned putte two preestes arrians vrsacius val • nt ¶constancius emperour h • rd therof reconciled liberius semed esyer arrians thenne liberius ouercome griefe exylynge gladed pope agayne assented heresye put doune f • lix heelde chirches pe • er paule laurence vyolently wi • h stre • g • soo clerkes preestes fauoured fel • x slayne chirche liberius forbade felix martred • vyctorinus rethour donatus gramaryen holde grete men rome ¶antonius monke deyde egypte yere age honderd fyue seynt hillarye bisshop peytres conspyracy bisshop arelatē si arrian exyl • thre yere frigia wrote noble boo •• relygyon selencia isauria made counseyl ¶ther put vp bylle themperour hillarye made hillarye lene come agayne home peytow marc ¶me vseth saye hillarye leon p • pe • k sayd hym counseyll bisshops· th •• art gallus gallina ¶ treuisa gallus 〈…〉 frenssheman· thenne mē te hillarye frenssheman thenne foloweth storye▪hillarye shold saye thou art lyon lygnage iuda ¶also counseyll bisshops noman aroose ayenst • illarie hillarye sayde erth lordes thenne erthe aroos maner tote resseyue hillary • founden cronyke auctentik cause noo pope w • called leon hillares tyme yf liberius pope fauoured heretyks somme fals pope wa • callyd l • ¶ capitulum 28 whan constancius dede iulianus apostata wa • cesar made emperour· emperour two yere tyme martred pygmeus preeste ben fore iulianus mayster iohan paule quiriacus hete iudas bisshop ierusalem· fonde crosse r iulianus redde vndecimo libro historye tripertite constancius grete constantinus brother two sone one gallus iulianus· ¶ whan grete constātyn dede sone constancius emperour made eme gallus cesar ¶but afterward suspection grete wytte made hym slayne histria ¶ therfor iulianus gallus broder dr • lest shold slayn bycame monke made ful pop holy vnder monkis habyte therfor woman brought hym kepe thre st • n • ful gold couerid aboue asshes iulianus toke gold delyuerd woman stenes ful asshes ¶ whan gold taken way iulianus coude conuict wytnesses present atte rece • uyng sawe thyng asshes soo iulianus toke golde went rome· dyde moche consul atte laste gate hym thempyre emperour iulianus childhode lerned nygrom • ncy wytchecraft tyme mayster oute radde bookes craft cam byfore hym grete multitude fendes • e dradde soore made signe crosse· anone alle fendes vanysshed away soo tolde mayster whan cam home· may • ter sayde fendes hated moost signe crosse iulianus cam rome fende shewed hym hym th • doyng wytche promised hym thempyre yf wold forsake cristen fayth soo ¶ thenne constancius made hym cesar sente hym fraunce dyde many vyctoryes gate crowne laureal henge bytwene two pylers brake rope crowne henge ryally crowned crowen· sawe tolde token shold emperour whanne constācius dede iulianus made emperour fonded plese al men ¶therfor begynnyng empyre graunted euery man sholde holde fayth wolde destroyed signe crosse al b • myghte supposed therby gete hym moost grace fendes thenne opened temple dyde sacrifice mawm ••• one dyde dew fyll vpon clothes vpon 〈◊〉 mannes clothes likenes crosse another tyme bowel berest slayne sacrifice founde shap crosse byclypped crowne· mynystres sawe sayde vyctorye cristes crosse lasteth outen ende iulianus sykeled hem sayde tokene constraynynge cristes loore shold neuer passe wydenes 〈◊〉 ¶also dyde somtyme sacrifice constantinople calcedonius bisshop blynde age repreued iulianꝰ sharply ¶thy man galyle sayd iulianus myght saue fro blyndenes therof thanke hym sayde bisshop hath bynome syght shold see pryued al mildenes ¶also antiochia gadryd geders holy vessel w • yls auter defowled hem fylthe ars· anone wromes sprange oute therof frate soo iulianus nether ende myght neuer delyuerd therof lyue ¶also styward pyssed vpon vessel chirche sayde lo vessel mary sone seruyd anone mouth bycame ar • seruyd afterward stede nether ende ¶ also iulianus hate crysten men bygan buylde temple ierusalem vpon owne coste al bylde day erth shakynge threwe doune nyght also fyre come oute temple destroyed moche folke nyght signe crosse seen vpon al mennes clothes ¶also iulianus put oute court ennuches ghelded men barbours cooke ennuches wyf dede hadde wedded none dyde awey cooke vsed symple mete barbours one myght serue many men made many bookes blamed therinne • redecessours dide awey cooke barbours dyde philosopher prynce blamed prince dyde philisopher n • r prince thenne iulianus wente doun perse redde vitas patrum sente fende weste londes shold bringe hym wor thēnes fendes ten dayes lette iourneye one publius monke alwey bede soo fende brought none answer agayne whan fendes promysed hym vyctorye perses sophistris axed maner crysten man supposest thou doth god carpenter sone cristen man answerd sayd maketh buryels thy mayster iulianus ¶ iulianus wente perse come vnto cheysisont besieged kynge countre forsoke somme knigdome profered hym ¶ trowed grete alysandres soule putte body meuyng pyctagoras plato sayde soules af mankynde passyd bodyes bodyes darte cam sodenly stycked side therwith ended lyf ¶r eutropius orocius libro sexto tellen iulianus wente perse ladde wylde place gyle fraude one outlawed one roome trauaylle grauel with▪ thyrste hete sonne· soo horsman enemyes smote hym spere deyde also •• dde basilius lyf whan iulianus wente perse ward basileus cesarea capadocia sent hym present barley loues iulianus behelde loues sente hym heye agayn hit sayd basyleus sayd thenne sende suche ete thou sendest v beestes eten thenne iulianꝰ sayde whan come agayne vyctour oute perse shal destroye cyte shal bere heye corn thenne basilius prayd sauacion cyte saw night middel chirch grete multitude aungels middel hem woman sittyng trone sayde clepe mercuriꝰ knyght shal take wrech sone· iulianꝰ yt despiseth god mercuriꝰ cristē knight yt iulianꝰ slain feith holy chirch late buried chirch sight seen anō mercuriꝰ toke wepē yet hēge chirch wēt forth ayenst iulianꝰ stikked middel body· vanisshed weye anō iulianꝰ drewe blode side threw abrode seyd thou galile mā thou hast ou er come shal forsake fulfil thy silf basiliꝰ awoke fonde mercurius spere al blody chirche armure sette place· fore iulianꝰ ioninianꝰ emperour viij monethes strōg nobl̄ cristē māiulianus cōmaūded cristē knightes shold sacrefyce mawmettes forsake knighthode anone fordyde bonde whan knightes •• ough hym emperour strengthe· cryede sayde crysten man wold emperour paynyms whan herde al knyghtes made crysten men ¶ also dryuen grete nede yaf grete dele mesopotania sapor king perse thenne deade whether euil smel chambre made newe lyme heuy reste therin· many cooles made sette fyre grete cold ¶ capitulum 29 ualentinianus broder valent regned enleuen yere· gentil curtoys whan hoost laboured gyue hym felowe thempyre answerd sayde ¶ knyghtes youres yeu • kyngdome haue receyued it· hit myn thynke comyn prouffyte made broder felaw thempyre ¶ ouercome saxon sarmates fader gracian • called funarius roper· bare roope selle fyue knyghtes myght wreste roope oute honde therfor worthy take knyhthode tyme valentinianus wyf preysed feyrnes iustina therfor valentinianus wedded iustina yaue lawe euery man wold shold wedde two wyues emperours tyme erthe quoke al worlde see aroose passed clyues destroyed many cytees liberius damasus rope nyneten yere fair maker metre· wrote verse vpon tombes fonde holy sayntes ordeyned also day▪ nyght psalmes shold sayd queor· one verse shold sayde one side verse side gloria patri shold sayde eche psalmes ende ¶and comfort pope ierom translated byble oute hebrew latin amēded also psauter lxx interpretes thēne vsed moost part al chirches sauter efte apeyred translated new agayne damasus pope ordeyned songe cyte rome chirches fraūce therfor sauter called frenssh sauter psatelriū gallicanū yet made thyrdde translacion sawter word forword yere deyde seynt hillarye bisshop peytow vnto songe aungel songe gloria excelsis· put laudamus te benedicimus te· adoramus te soo forth ¶ seynt dydimus alexandria lost eyen fyfth yere age herde one redde chirche word gospell man maye doo god may doo ¶ thenne soo besy aboute lyght sowle parfyght knowlech seuen artes made doctor made expowned many bokes notaryes wryters seynt martin made bisshop turone yere age lxj bisshop xxvj yere grete basile bisshop cesarea capadocia dede among grete dedes vertue reconciled yongling god almyghty oblyged hym self deuyl loue wenche· gate agayne chartre oblygacion also ioseph iewe connyngest alle phisicians basyle lengthed iosephs lyf one day tourned hym fayth holy chirche made instituted rule monkes many holy tretys ¶ seynt ambrose man dignyte consul spak pepl̄e· made bisshop melane voys child cryede shold ¶ seynt patrik tyme born fader hete calprun whiche preest dekens sone heyte fo dun patrikes moder hete conch martyns suster gallia fraunce crystnyng called sucat seint germā called hym magonius celestinus pope callyd hym patrik saye fader cyteseyns ¶ valentinianus augustus strongly meued agaynst messagers sarma • e deyde maner outbrekyng veynes euil grekes clepe apoplexia tyme egypte noble faders floures pastor pambo tweyne either hete macharius arsenius· paphinisius agatho moyses ioseph enagrius theodorus pambo wold lerne sawter one verse herd er fulfylled verse· verse▪ dixi custodiam vias meas vt non delinquam lingua mea saye· ¶i haue sayd shal kepe wayes trespace tonge pambo sayde vnnethe fulfylled verse nyne fourty yere ¶ two macharyes one egypte allexandria bothe noble men abstynence· loore woman childe defamed falsely one sayde hadde brought child myght neuer delyuerd child er tolde trouth ¶arsenius senatour rome parfyght langages latyn grue made hym self monk ¶ tyme herde voys sayde hym arsenius flee fro men kepe scylence thou shalt saued ¶ also • alwey sudary bosome wype away teeres ranne oft fro eyen ¶therfor heer eyen lyddes fyl al grete wepyng ester euen whan sonne wente reste torned face toward west woke al nyghte prayer vnto tyme sawe sonne aryse erly morowe thenne wery wakynge called hym slepe sayde come forth euil seruaunt rested lytell syttyng wold saye ynowgh monke fyghteth ayenst temptacions sleepe one houre nyght day ¶in tyme faders testament brought hym testament made faders heyer thenne answerd sayde drede fore fader myght thenne shold dye make heyr dede afore ¶also wold lyghtly mete ne speke gladly ony man ne sende lettres comynly fledde theyr company sayde myght one god men· neyther meued lyghtly question holy wryt sterynges soule temptacions wolde gladly speke yet noble clerke connyng question holy wrytte therfore tyme wente doune speke old man egypte appose hym thoughtes thenne somme men seyden hym mayst thou arsenius • connynge loore ax • lerne olde chorle haue sayd lerned latyn grue yet coude neuer b c chorle arsenius dwellyd palays rome man vsed better clothes soo monke none fowler couerd longe berde henge myddel lyued older theodocius palays fourty yere wyldernes lv yere paphinicius thabbot toke seculer clothyng habyt cōuerted comyn womā hete tharsis prayed thryes lord wolde shewe hym lyke erthe thabbot pastor wold see moder erthe hym l • uer see heuen thabbot agatho bare stone thre yere mouth wold lerne styl kepe sylence wold nyght slepe yf ony quarel ayenst ony man ony man ayenst hym ¶ thabbot moyses one prayd come deme broder trespaced toke bare panyer ful grauel • bak sayde synnes renne goo deme mennes synnes take none heede myn owne ¶ fader musius wente vysyte broder seke made prayer sonne stonde styl vnto tyme doon al offyce atte ful also ofte blessyd grauel brought hym whiche sowe feldes feldes bade corne fruyte ¶ abbesse sara thyrten yere geder inpugned tempted fende wolde assente· sara prayd temptacion shold passe god wolde yeue grace withstonde ¶ thenne spyryt fornicacion shewed hym sighte sayde sara thou hast ouercome naye sayde haue ouercome the· lord iesus saueth hem trust hym hath ouercome enemyes brought forth arme axed athanasius vse hadde cut arme brought forth arsenius bothe armes shewed hem bothe hoo • e sounde axed men arme shewed ¶also enemyes hyred woman sholde saye ofte lodged athanasius r ¶ thabbot euarius macharius disciple wrote vitas patrum egypte genadius sayth booke de viris illustribus valens broder sone gracianus valentinianus emperour four yere broder hete valentinianus also valens crystned agayne arrians poursiewed cristen men yaue lawe monkes shold doo dedes armes beten staues· thenne monkes martred nitria egypte tyme gothes sente valens haue crysten bisshops teche hem rightful byleue sente hem bisshops arrians therfor alle gothes infecte gleymed therfore goddes rightful dome knyghtes rome ouercome gothes valens chaced oute antiochia wounded arow fledde hows brente al hows buryels ¶capitulum 30 oracianus whan hadde regned fader valentinianus older eme valens thenne deth eme regned broder valentinianus yonger theodosius spayne six yere beda libro primo capitulo 19 gracianus whan sawe sta •• thē pire almost fallen made theodosius spayn gouernour thempyre • est anone theodocius ouersette sythes alanes hunes gothes grete batails stronge made p • e athanarius kynge gothes tyme one pristyllianus galles made heresye loore manychyes gnostyces heresye hath name hym· tho theophilus bisshop alexandria floures damasus tyme 〈◊〉 made counceyll constantinople seuen score bisshops ten ayenst macedonus heretyk· sayde holy goost noo godthere made credo songe sondayes chirche damasus siricins pope fyften yere made counseyl constantinople thre honderd fyfty bisshops declare fayth holy chirche ayenst heretykes gaufredus alur octauius kyng brytons • e old prayde one maximus neuewe helene sen ••• ur come rome take kyngdome brytayne doughter hadde mo child ¶ conanus kynges neuew cast kynge wroth therfore • fte atte debate stryf maximus atte l • st ful acorded lad hem alle armed knyghtes warre prouynce armorica lytel brytayne maximus fought conanus ouercome hym put oute thyrd dele thempyre eutr b • da li 1 maximꝰ noble man stalworth saue dyde ayenste oth▪ treson knyghtes made emperour brytayne wente anō fraūce made fraūce germania subget cruel batayls slough graci • nu augustus sod • nly aferd fled lug • uu chaced gracianus broder valentinianus oute ytalye anone valentinianus fledde theodosius eest mildly restored agayn kyngdom sone sleyght theodocius maximus besieged aquilia putte deth gaufredus alfred mene tyme conanꝰ duc lytel brytayne wyl wedde frensshmens doughters sente dynotus kyng cornewayle haue wyues people anone sente doughter vrsula xj vyrgyns somme drowned see tē peste stormes somme caste straunge londes cursed duke gwanius melga slowe many wold consente theyr lechery guanius kyng hunes melga kyng pyctes ¶gracianus valentinianus sente see costes slee fauctours maximꝰ tyraunt ther two cursed duke gwanius melga aspyed maximus ladde al chiualrye oute brytayne brytayne voyde helpeles without strength chyualrye thenne gadred hem side ylondes occupyed albania scotlande maximus tyraunt herde therof sente anone two legyōs knyghtes gracianus knyght longed rome went forth chaced forsaid cursed duke irl̄ond ¶but gracianus herd maximus slayne made hym self kyng brytayne· cause vsed grete tyrantrye slayne owne peple stede one constantinus lowest chyualrye chosen worthynes vertue hope name only· wente anone fraunce dyd grete harme thempyre therfor commaū dement honorius augustꝰ constanciꝰ erle sente fraunce slough constantinus arelate sone constancius therle geroncius monk made cesar ¶ capitulum 31 theodocius gracianus sone whan fader slayn regned eam • valentinianus enleuen yere fader moder warned sle • pe shold yeue hym name theodocius • theodocius yeuen god almyghty made neuer batayle good wylle euery batayl yaue vyctorye historia tripertita odociꝰ vsed dedes armes day rightful dome cause subgettes occupyed wel nyghe al nyght bookes therfor rad candelstyk made craft honde oyle shold r • nne crysler withoute trauayle theod • cius· trauayle shold lette hym soo wythstode slepe made kynde trauayle strength ¶also like traianus al poyntes meke myld softe men subget god wold lyghtly wroth therfor taught philosooher shold whan bygan wexe wroth saye softe ordre foure twenty lett • e • grue er shold ordeyne ought shold greue thought sholde occupyed somwhat elli wrath shold sece passyng tyme tyme wold haue entred queor clerkes melan masse ambrose forbade hym vnto tyme hadde penaunce deth thyrtty knyghtes slayne wrath constantinople ¶ therfor emperour dyde penaunce ordeyned lawe dome prynces vpon thauysemēt deth sholde abyde thyrtty dayes withoute • xecucion tabyde yf myght founde· nede dome shold repelled chaunged victor sonne maximus tyraunt slayne one arbogastes aboute tyme childe bore ca • tel emaus hadde twey bodyes fro nauel vpward two brestes two hedes ten wyttes eyther body fyue soo one myghte ete slepe though dyde nether ete ne slepe whan lyued two yere gyder one deyde thre dayes fore ¶valentinianus augustus sory lyf cruelnes arbogaftes mayst • r knyghtes henge hym self suar vian • fraunce therfor arbogast • made one eugenius emperour gallia ¶therfor theodocius axed counseyl iohan heremyte egypte axed •• de batayll sholde take ayenst eugenius sayd shold haue vy ••• rye ¶r yere deyde seynt martin bisshop one seuerus sulpicius preest gyen wrote seynt martin lyf ful vertues goodnes g • nadius de viris illustribus seyth seuerus elde begyled heretyks pelagyens sory • fore synned speche toke silence vpon hym lyues ende punysshe synne sparyng spech archadius theodociꝰ sone whan fader dede regned fourten yere heelde eest londes broder honorius helde west londes claudianꝰ poete tyme flouryng conatus bisshop epirꝰ spatte dragon mouthe slough hym six • en ox myght vnuethe drawethat dragon place sholde brent shold enfecte eyer countre aboute grete counseyl made thenne cartage ¶marc siricius anastasius pope fyue yere ordeyned man wemmed body sholde receyue none ordres ordeyned euery man sholde stonde gospel redyng beda libro primo capitulo decimo ¶aboute yere pelagius bryton helpe iulianus bisshop campania whiche fore honde put doune bisshopryche ¶ pelagius brought vp heresye sayde mannes wil fredom chois without goddes grace ynowe dis • rue mede blysse heuene also sayde adam synne wē med adam al one none man ¶also sayd child ben born cleene withoute synne adam fo • e er synned sayde nedeth cristen child clense hem synne worshipe hem sacrament adopcion ¶treuisa adopcion makyng child manere yf man take childe maketh hym child noryssheth bryngeth hym vp amitteth hym owne child thenne pelagius wote sayth· child clene oute synne veryly goddes childe ¶ thenne foloweth storye seynt augustyn holy faders trauay • led manly ayenst suche heretyks· myght amende hem sayth prosper rethour versis six fete ¶ r sōme men wolde suppose pelagius abbot famoꝰ abbaye bangor ten myle oute legecestre caerleon ¶men saye abbay somtyme two thousande monkes er kyng northumberland e • hellfrede hadde slayne thyl̄k monkes caerleon ¶after anastasius innocencius ablimensis pope fourten yere ordeyned faste saterday kysse pax masse enoynte seke men hol̄y oyle ¶al̄so condempnedd pel̄agius heretyk fauctours al̄so acursed archadius themperour assentynge puttynge oute one iohan crisostimus themperesse endexia procured puttynge iohan preched ayenste wymmen playde aboute ymage endoxia ¶ aboute yere seynt alexis confessour deyde rome ¶benadius book de viris • lustribus sayth aboute tyme ticonius affrica wrote rule seche fynde oute vnderstondynge holy wryt whiche rule ben yet famous among holy doctours ¶ capitulum 32 honorius whan broder archadiꝰ dede regned broders sone theodociꝰ xv yere mylde whan repreued hym cause slowe hem rebel hymhe answerd seyd ¶god wold myght reise dede men lyue eutropius libro decimo ¶the hoost gothes slayn tuscia leder ragadasius take cam ijc thousande gothes made auowe wold • offre bloode romayn • sacrifice goddes sayth fyghtyng many men take flockes hem sold lytel pry flockes beestes ¶ mene tyme one gothes heete alaricus affryca went ytaly axyd place honorius hym men dwelle graunted gallia ¶and wente thyderward besette somme themperours duke hard batayll fyll vpon vnwar eesterday tok herte strengthe ouercome enemyes soo pursued hem lefte waye hadde bygonne torned agayne rome destroyed alle come yron fyre toke cyte rome sette fyre ¶ netheles lete crye men sholde spare al men fledd • holy place men sholde take prayes spare shedyng bloode ¶ paulus libro vndecimo· ¶ rome brooke taken gothes yere buyldyng therof thousand c lxiiij tyme consulat rome lefte est romayns seceden regne brytayn regned therinne iulius cesars tyme aboute foure honderd lxx yere ¶eutropius ¶the thyrdde day rome take alaricus lefte cyte destroyed prouynce aboute wente cicilia loste many shippes sodenly dede ¶there gothes trauayl prisonners torned ryuer basentus oute chanel buryed kyng grete ryches myddel chanel torned ryuer agayn owne chanel thenne gothes toke one athulfus kynge alaricus lye made hem kynge wente agayn rome destroyed al lefte also tyme lyghtnynge destroyed noble place rome enemyes myght brenne· god despysed al cyte men cryede crist sayde suche myshappes fyll cyte cause holy place goddes forgendryd alterid gothes toke one galla placida theodocius doughter honorius suster maryed owne kynge profytable comynte gothes made pee romayns lefte rome wente • llia ¶ aboute tyme founden bodyes seynt steuen gamalyel • felawes one lucianus preest ierl̄m tyme saynt austyn sente disciple orocius bethleem seynt ierom lorne reson soule thenne made booke comyng forth soule orosius wente abo •• e holy place fyrste broughte relyques seyn • steuen west londes· also thenne honorius made constancius cesar maryed sister gallia placida constancius maryed fore athulphus constancius gate valentinianus afterward helde empyre longe tyme innocencius zozinius pope two yere six monethes ordeyned bonde man sholde clerk ner ghelded man holy taper sholde halowed ester eue zozinius lonefacius pope four yere ordeyned woman shold wasshe ne handle towails auter ne doo ensense censer gaufredus alfr thenne deth maximꝰ tyraunt knyght longed rome knowen also deth constancius knowen sayd enemyes guanius melga come agayne oute irlond scottis norweys brente slowe kyngdome brytayne fro see see therfore briton sente romaynes promysed subget alwaye haue helpe anone honorius sente hem legyon destroyed theyr enemyes taught brytons make wall thwert ouer ylond holde oute theyr enemyes· legyon wente agayne men ylonde vnconnyng grete craft made wall tur • e stone thyng proufytable whiche dured fro penulton vnto cyte ac • ut socour water fayled men sholde defende hem helpe wal enemyes cam water destroyed toke prayes fro yere yere dyde fore thenne romayns sente legyon armed •• chaced enemyes made vp wal stone 〈◊〉 • rytons eyght foote thyck twelue fote hye see see bytwene cyt • e seuerus somtyme made dyche wal tornes romayns bad charged brytons leue theyr cowardyce nycete take armure courage men shold occupyed side myght come fro fer hem grete trauaill iourneyes ¶ thenne made wal stone comyn cost also preuy coste men yaue therto hadde hem strengthe brytons toke hem armure buylded toures clyues thoccean • dyuerse places· men dredde tharryuyng londyng straū ge men enemyes thenne romayns bad brytons fare wel wold neuer come agayn gildas ¶ whan romayns goon thenne scottes pyctes bygan breke oute hooles scottes pyctes discorden maners acorde clothyng feyth couetyse shedynge bloode coue • e • theyr preuy membrys moore heer clothe whan knewe legyons rome retorned destroyed thendes brytayn boldly done fore· b • da ¶ slowe wardeyns walles mē londe· mē loude dryuen hows home yaue hem thefte robberye robbed ec • e socoure paryll honger sawe shold byfalle soo fylle deth vpon deth sorowe vpon sorowe alle kyngdome bare withoute sustenaunce mete bonefaciꝰ celestinus pope ten yere ordeyned psalme iudica deus discerue causam meam shold saide fore thentryng masse atte thentre masse sholde sayde verse et introibo ad altare psalme· grayel offretory sholde sayde fore • acrynge fyrst sente seynt patrik conuerte yrlond paladiꝰ deken rome conuerte scottes ix yere papacye fourth yere helpe theodocius thēperour cirillus bisshop alexandria thyrdde grete synode thre honderd bisshops made ephesus ayenst nestorius heretyk ¶ demed crist one persone two kyndes godheede manhede lady sholde •• lyd theotochos saye lordes moder aboute tyme ierom preest deyde bethleem four score sixten yere old▪ ¶ tyme sente hoost rome spayne ayens • wandels· themperour oute company myghty bonefaciꝰ themperour dyde thynge manly • bonefacius went affryca dyde moche harme thempyre ¶ capitulum 33 yonge theodocius archadius sone regned doughter husbond valentinianus six twenty yere kyngdome frensshemen bygan tyme vnder ferramundus sone martomirus sayde fore honde prouynces fyrst booke capitulo gallia ¶thenne theodosius knewe eme honorius dede toke valentinianus sone aunt galla placida made hym cesar sente hym moder galla placida gouerne eeste londes· two ouercome iohan werryd thempyre merciful aecius noble knyght· wytte sleyght hunes torned purposed warre mithēpire west londes then̄e bonefacius noble knightthat spak fore honde toke hede myght sewrly holde affryca ayenst valentinianus noble knyght aecius therfore prayde wandals alanes occupyed spayne fore honde come affrica kynge giserichus come anone destroyed affrica defowled feyth holy chirche ¶ tyme tempest deyde saynt austyn yere age four score six made soo many bookes metre sothe saith lyeth sayd rad al bookes ¶ r gysericus kyng wandels though mene tyme ouercome spaynardes galles romaynes yet regned aff • ica seuen thyrtty yere seyth eusebius cronyk right thende gisericus sone doughter husbond omericus regned viij yere also closed chirches outlawed thre honderd bisshops therfor goddes rightful doome wambled ful wormes deyde sone ¶ hym gysericus broders sonne guttamundus regned twelue yere ¶in xij yere regne opened chirches reconciled lawed ¶ hym forsayde homericus broder trasamundꝰ regned eyght twenty yere ¶ hym sone hilderycꝰ goten valentinianus doughter regned eyght yere ¶one glomaurus tyraunt werryd irlond britayne put hym oute kyngdome regned hym affryca thre yere soo fro begynnyng persecucion wandales bygan gysiricus tyme vnto goyng oute wandels affryca passed honderd yere ¶after celestinus sixtus pope nyne yere ¶ r 〈◊〉 tyme seynt maximus bisshop teruernensis 〈◊〉 made noble omelyes ¶ geuadius sayth •• de famous omely marires begynneth mane • qui religiosa caritate sanctorum merita miratur soo •• cassiodorus senatour flowris· expowned sawter made cronyk themperours bisshops also tyme orocius spayne floures cam rome seynt austyns deth made seuen bookes ayenst mysbyleued men de ormesta wretchednes world tyme endoxia themperesse theodocius doughter valentinianus wyf come oute ierusalem brought • er cheynes seynt peter bounden prisonne hem feste lammasse day ¶ solempnyte cesars vyctorye holden vpon daye fro octauianus tyme vnto tyme ¶ aboute tyme deuil appered iewes lykenes moyses ylond creta promysed hem wolde lede hem drye fotem londe byheste thēne many hem drowned torned feyth crist ¶ sixtus leo pope one twenty yere· holyest al men sayde masse fyue sythes sō tyme ofter one day ¶ esterday woman kissed honde pope felte grete temptacion wreche therof cut owne right hond thenne peple grutchyd ayēst hym songe masse wonte doo made prayer put hym al oure lady besoughte helpe grace ¶ thenne blessyd lady restored hym honde agayne sayde masse doone fore told oute myracle fore al peple ¶ pope tyme vnder marcianus prynce made ungeneral counseyl caladonia sex honderd bisshops thyrty ayenst one entices abbot constantinople ayenst one dyoscorus bisshop ahexandria denyed cryst flesshe denyed also resurection atte day dome pope leo made letter right feyth sende coū ceyl leyde letter vpon seynt peter auter fasted fourty dayes prayde seynt peter yf ony thynge sholde amended therinne wold amende done another tyme fasted fourty dayes prayd peter gete hym foryeuenes synnes ¶ peter apered hym sayd alle thy synnes ben foryeuen vnwyse handlyng chalenged ¶ pope tyme theodosius last tyme ephesus mount celius seuen slepers awoke aroos feyth resurection moche confermed stabled arysyng decius cesars tyme men fledde hydde caue tescape wodenes persecucion done vpon crysten men slepte two honderd yere woke atte laste vertue god sente seruaunt money cyte bye mete espye stode persecucion old moneye shewed tho vsed knowen foū den slepte aboute two honderd yere soo feyth resurection confermed entices denyed begonne slepe agayne presence theodosius themperour eutropius tyme one athyla kynge hunes gouerned denmarke pannonia ladde hooste two honderd thousand helpe ayenste romaynes nacions made subget passed forth wel nygh al west londe vnto aluerne ¶this man born shame sh • ndship nacions loued werres stronge counseyll valentinianus thenne gouerned west londes sholde fyghte ayenst athyla sente letter gothes wordes ¶ • alleth redynes wysedome conspyre ayēst tyraūt desyreth al seruyse wo • l • · retcheth rightful cause bataylle hym lyketh holdeth lawful byleue heleth couerith pryde worthy 〈◊〉 byhated al men • enemye al • men wrote letter man • ye haue made athyla youre enemye ye haue youre desire thenne come gyders feeldes cathulintes contrynen honderd leghes lengthe lxx brede ther stronge bataylle none old storye speketh batayl • ronge slayne nyne score men dede bodyes born forth streme blood ¶ romayns side slayne kyng burgoyn kyng gothes ¶eutropius libro nono ¶ kyng athyla though ouercome wente agayne pannonia gadre hym gretter hooste r ¶it redde seynt german lyf whyle kyng athyla werred gallia besieged tyme cyte trecasma saynt lupus bisshop tyme thenne seynt lupus wente vpon yates cyte besieged cryed axed soo greued hem ¶ • nd kyng athyla answerd sayde athyla goddes scourge sayd bisshop wolf destroyeth lordes flok haue nede goddes scourge lupus wolf thenne anon yates opened enemyes blente thurgh goddes might wente yate yate sawe n • hurted man athyla kyng hunes chaced gallia noble knyght hete aecius fleyng toward pannonia • stroyed ytaly besieged aquilia thre yere gate tho leo pope fasted prayde thre dayes thre nyghtes seint peter chirche sayde men wole come come goddes name ¶and whan approched kynge athyla kyng lyght doune hors fyl doune pope fete prayd hym axe wolde· anone prayde graunted kynge shold goo oute ytaly delyuer alle prisoners· ¶ afterward whan kynge repreued resoned lord world wa • lyghtly ouercome preest tha • sayd kynge dy • prouffyt me▪ ¶for sawe right fide •• ronge knyghte swerde drawen menaced bu • dyde wolde sholde dede alle myn thenne kynge lefte ytaly wente pannonia deyde sone 〈◊〉 eutropius libro nono capitulo 13 ¶aboute tyme poure releef lefte brytons sente thyrde tyme • ett • r noble knyght aecius patricius maner aecius thryes cōsul shewe greues ••• ton strau nge nacions chacen v see see dry • eth v straunge nacions ag • yne therof cometh two maner careyns ben slayne wepen ellys ben drouned noughtthat wrote aecius tyme occupyed gallia harde warre ayenste kynge athila· gaufredus beda· meane tyme forsaid honger encreced strongly amonge briton compellyd many hem yelde hem theuys enemyes ¶ somme hem come oute hilles laundes ther • mannes helpe fayled trusted god almyghty chaced oute pyctes wele myght thenne tyme enemyes p • tte oute vnto vtterist part ylond made hem place dwelle ynne beyonde deyra southe side northumberlonde slough toke prayes eche ¶ also tyme fyl grete honger constantinople grete pestylence eyer infecte engleymed walles cyte fyl doune seuen fyfty towres dede many thousande • men beestes ¶gaufredus alfredus· ¶ thenne brytons toke auysement counseylle gaytelynus arch • bisshop sayled armorica lytel brytayne one aldroenus fourth regned conanus tharchebisshop declared hym meschyef sorowe brytons brought hym one constantinus kynges broder many thousandes men armes surcetre made hym kyng· ¶ also constantinus hadde thre sone oldest hete constant made monke shorn winchestre seynt amphibalus chirch ¶ tweyn aurelius vter bytoke guydelynus bisshosshop norisshe teche ¶constantinus atte last ten yere kyngdome slayn treason one pictes hadde seruise vortigerus consul iewesses desired kyngdome toke constant oute winchestre made hym kynge dul slowe wytte ¶ anon vortigerus hadde honderd pictes oute albania scotlande made hem wardeins kynges bodye· vortigerus made hem ryche ynowgh ¶and vnderstode vortigerus desired b • 〈◊〉 slough constant kynge brought hede vortigerus cause vortigerus wolde holde giltles culpable dede feyned greete sorowe made byheede al honderd pictes fore lordes lond end crowned kinge whan knowen thenne wardeyns kept two bretheren aurelius vardredde hym fledde child kyng armorica litel britayn ¶ explicit liber quartus incipit libe • quintus ¶capitulum primum marcianus wedded theodocius suster emperour seuen yere· ¶in fyrst tyme coūceyl calcidonense made ayenst entices dioscorus sayd fore hond atte last marcianus slayn constantinople conspyracye owne men hunes wandels destroieden cytres gallia stode vpon ryn tyme vortigerus regned britayne thenne fyl greete plente corne fruyt none suche plente seen none tyme ther fore plente lechery pestilence al euil bigan encrece cruelnesse wrath seculer men· also flock oure lorde herdes gouernours flok lord strong grete euery man torned spere ayenst trewe man ayenste traytours brytayn yaue hem dronkenes fyghtyng staf enuye· thenne sodenly fyl grete pestylence men euil lyuynge lefte lyue myghte v • meth burye dede left lyue sone amended therby therfor gretter vengeaūce cam afterwarde vortigerus coūseyl toke hem rede sente paynyms saxon prayd hem come fro byyond see hem help socour vnknowē goddes oune dede harme shold falle vpon wycked men gaufr alfr vortigerus drad pictes greued fore hond side drad comynge aurelius ambrose herde made redy shippes passe see therfor coueluded sende saxon noble men warre strong batayl beda li·1 thenne saxon strong men armes hauyng place dwelle prayd brytons come thre longe shippes calle obylas brytayn resseyue place dwelle est side therof ylond thanet beside kente fyght contray fyght warre ayenst countrey w de regibus wel nygh al lond lyeth northward ouer see occean britayn called germania bryngeth forth moch folk germania cometh germinare borge bringe forth therfor water bowes ben kutte hewe • tree fatnes erth shold suffise lif dele tre men germania releue londe mode • puttynge oute men ben stronge fyghte leste sholde 〈◊〉 ouercome many child yf shold alle • yde 〈◊〉 couere enuye doyng saye 〈◊〉 sente lotte therfor men londe maketh h • strengthe nede chalenge straunge londes dwelle 〈◊〉 whan ben putte oute owen londes 〈◊〉 somtyme wan affryca longobardes ytaly norman gallia fyrst come twey bretheren oute germania engistus horsus lytel strengthe· woden neuewys cam woden· soo wele nygh kynges lygnage straunge nacious come woden moche saxon helde hym tho god· called fourth day weke woden day worship woden sixth day fryday worship wyf frea thus dyde sacrelegye lestel euermore ¶ beda li primo ¶ ther cam thre strengest peple germania brytayne saxon angle iutes iutes come kentysshe men men yle wyght men dwellen ayenst yle weyght saxon come cest saxon south saxon west saxon ¶ angle come eeste angle myddel angle mercy hadde myddel englonde stretcheth westward toward ryuer dee besyde chestre seuarn besides shrowesbury forth brystow estward toward see southward temse forth london northward humbre torned dounwarde westward ryuer mersea soo forth west see ¶also angle come men northumberlonde horsus engistus beders hem alle ¶ treuisa knowe redyly mere merkes countreyes men sette looke fyrst capitulo 51 henricus libro secundo· men sayled brytayn bete doune enemyes brytayne enemyes come vnto stanford fourty myle onte lyncolum southwarde ¶ whan pyctes scottes vsyd longe shaftes • eres saxon foughte longe swerdes ax ¶ gaufredus soo vortigerus hadde vyctorye helpe saxon yaue engistus londe lyndes • ye buylded castel heete thongcastre graunted moche londe buylde castel thwonge myght beclyppe therfor engystus kutte boole huyde al one thonge clypped therwith al place ¶ beda libro primo thenne tydynges come home goodenes londe britayne feblenes men dwellyd therinne thenne sente gretter naueye make nombre saxon toke warre vppon couenaunte shold fyghte countrey brytons shold fynde mete wage ¶ willelmus de regibus libro primo ¶ thenne atte second tyme saxon come sixten shippes brought hem engistus doughter wonder fayr mayde meruayle kynde wonder sighte men byholde kynge vortigerus behelde ofte bad shold serue hym stede boteler kyng axed wyf egged fader therto though hit ayenste wyll yaue kente stede yefte hym consented engistus shold sende sone ¶ gaufredus alfredus ¶ weddynge made kynge put awaye lawful wyf whiche goten thre noble yonglynges vortimerus catigirnus pascencius ¶ beda libro primo ¶ thenne saxon conspyred pyctes hadde put oute fore honde torned fyght ayenst felawes brytons ano fyrst axed corne yeue hem destroyed contray slouwe bisshops peple ¶ gaufredus alfredus thenne b • ytons sawe ouersette multitude saxon counceyleden kynge forsake saxon cause wolde assente toke sonne vortimerus made hym kynge ¶ willelmus de regibus libro primo ¶ seuenth yere confederacion fought ayenst angle ofte smal bataylles fyue sithes sharply al company henricus gaufred fyrste bataylles vpon ryuer derwont seconde vpon forde epiford ¶ horsus catagirnus wounded eche thyrdde helpe seynt germ • n tho bisshop ¶ bataylle cryed thryes alleluya saxon fledde ¶ fourthe bataylle vpon see brynke saxon fledde ilonde thanet ¶ whan batayls done vortimerus deyde thurgh venym stepdam rowen ¶r william saith whan vortimerus hadde fought twenty yere manly ayenste angle take awaye lotte desteny ¶ ganfredus alfredus ¶ whan vortimerus deede vortigernus efte restored kyngdome thenne hoope pee bothe brytons angle come gyders byside thabbaye ambrius fyrst day maye tre • e pee bytwene engistus vsed newe manere treason sayd knyghtes whan cryed englyssh nymeth sexes· thenne anone shold slee theyr felawes brytons knyues hadde hydde theyr hosen soo done ¶ eldol duke gloucestre caught stake defended hym manly slowgh seuenten saxon ¶ saxon wolde slee vortigerus resseyued raunsonne noble cytees brytayn wente weste countrey wale abode genoren vpon ryuer guania hille cloarcius aurelius ambrose come afterwarde vpon hym brente hym owne tour ¶ • lmus de regibus libro primo meneth otherwyse sayd engystus treasonne fraude prayd doughter husbonde vortigerus f • ste thre honderd men ¶and whan ghestys hadde wele dronken thenne sleyghte made stryue bra • lo toke theyr wepens foughte ¶thenne brytons slayne kynge taken· raunsonned thre prouynces eeste also willelmus libro primo henricus libro secundo tellen vortigerus laye owne doughter hoope kynges sholde come hym gate sonne ¶ therfor acursyd seynt german alle company preestes fledde west syde wale ¶also wreton seynt german fledde poursiewed hym brente toure fyre cam downe fro heuene ¶thenne brytons gadryd hoost aurelius ambrose duc hadde hoost ayenst horsus engystꝰ kente gaufr· brittysshe boke sayth aurelius ambrose come beyōde see brente vortigerus owne toure ¶and thenne passed humbre made engystus byheded conyngisburgh spared sonne octe besyeged yorke brought lowe· ¶ ouercome pascenflus vo •• igerus helper gillomaurus kyng irlond ¶ atte lost h • waxe seke wynchestre saxon • ete •• pa yaue hym venym drynke stede medecyn aurelius deyde one pascencius hadde hyred copa· leche doo dede wreton seynt german legente vortigerus warned seynt german lodgynge herde kept kynges beestes sawe goddes se • uauntes greued lodged seynt german slowe calf sop • r soper seynt german reysed calf agayne deth lyf morow commaundement g • g • rman put doune vortigerus kyngdome toke forsayd herde made hym kynge thenne alle men aston • wonder fro tyme forthon kynges b • ytons come berdes kynde ¶ gildas storye say • h befell kyng powysye • e buly vortigerus sayth bulyes successours come herdes kynde kynges syde wale ¶ thenne sayde vortigerūs ende manere doubte kepe storye hoole furthermore sayd ponde two dragon whyte reede vortigerus buy • dynge merlyns fantastyk getynge pr • phecye derk conteyned bryttyssh book wold put story yf supposed trewe ¶ capitulum 2 valentinianus augustus tyme acounted cours theodocius martinianus ¶ eutcopius dradde fortune aecius patricius made hym slayne cartage fortune west empire fyl doun hym yere valentinianus slayne aecius frendes felde marcius twelue dayes fore aprill daye one max • mu man two consulatus toke empyre rome herde gysericus kynge wandals comynge oute affryca arayde hym flee alto hewed valentinianus seruauntes· throwen lymmele tybre thenne gisericus cam cyte rome· leo pope mette plesed hym • e spared brennynge manslaughter toke prysoners ryches cyte ladde hym affryca amonge whiche prysoners endoxia augusta toke prysonner hadde prayd gysericus doo cursyd dede tornynge agayne toward affryca gysericus destroyed noble cytees campania nola capna ¶ thenne gregory saith libro dyalogorum paulinus bisshop cite nola whan spente al raunsons prisonners wente affrica yaue hym self man straūge nacions bound man raunson wydowes sone lordes gardener dyde soo wel offyce tourned lord crystendome wan gate fredom men nacions ¶ marcianus libro primo ¶in marcianus fyfth yere horsus engystꝰ fought ayenst brytons place heete aglystorp th • r horsus cartigirnus slowe eche other· engystus vyctory ¶beda libro primo capitulo 17 ¶that tyme feyth brytons dyde faste fayle company saxon straunge men mysbyleue also cause pelagius heresye began sprynge amonge therfor sen • e fraūce haue helpe socoure ayenst mysbyleuyd men hem sente germanus altisiodorus lupus trecasinus bisshops ¶in seylyng holy preyers tempest see seecyd destroyed heresy • trouthe loor • techyng shewynge myracles holynes lyf ¶they hel • blynde damysel ten yere old • henn • saynt german went vnto sepulcre seynt albon 〈◊〉 l • f • e holy relyquyes thapostles martires tok • w •• h hym reede erthe oute holy place ¶ th • nne wente forth sauyd place lodgynge al delyuerd hym brennyng whan mēnes thynges brente fyre thenne wente brytons ayenste • e saxon associat vnto pyctes cryed • rye alleluya ouercome thenemyes without shedynge blood soo • e ylond clensed german torned home agayne heresye bygan sprynge • ene german ofte prayd come helpe thenne come lupꝰ disciple seuerus destroyed dyde awey •• torned home agayne prayd valentinianus rauen men armorica lytel brytayne deyde heest themperour born buryed owne chirche marcianus leo regned xvij yere fyrst yere vortimerus vortigerus sonne deyde stronge euy • l engistus sonne osca gadryd strengthe brought togyder knyghtes men armes sparpled departed fought strongly ayenst brytons crekenford hem slayne four duke four thousand mē chaced dele oute kente vnto london neuer tourned afterward kente· broder ho • sus dede categirnus fore hond buryel yet shewed eest side kente· soo kyngdome kente bygan vnder engystus eyghten yere comyng saxon britayne engistus regned kent four twenty yere ¶ heresye acepheles bygan sprynge • ncrecyd agayne sayd counseyll calcydonense acephales ben sayd men withouten heede auctor vnknowen leo hillary pope seuen yere engystꝰ sone osca wyptysflete slowe twelue duke brytons angle slayne one ete wypet hillarye simplicius pope fyften yere· ordeyned noo clerk shold resseyue inuestiture benefyce ne offyce lewd mannes honde ¶ capitulum tercium teno themperour regned leo seuenten yere· tyme deyde childericus fourth kynge frenshem • n sone clodenus lewys regned thyrtty yere fyften yere kyngdom ladde hooste shold fyght ayenst grete nombre almains loked heuen sayd lord ihesu crist wyf worshipeth yf thou gyue daye vyctorye shal crystned thy name almayns fledde two susters thre thousand men crystned esterday seynt remigiꝰ bisshop raynes· crysma lo downe brought hem bylle vyole crysma bisshop enoynted kyng therwith vyole kepte chirch raynes crysma kynges ben enoynted sone king wēt batail ayēst one aladericꝰ warryd guyan ¶ remigius toke flaket ful holywyn promysed hym vyctory sayd goo forth longe wyn dureth thenne kyng drank seruauntes wyn fayled place ¶ thenne occupyed guyan passed ryuer leyr tu • one seynt martin chirche herde verse sauter precinxisti domine virtute ad bellum· lord thou hast byclypped vertue strengthe bataylle ¶therfor kyng gladde al arayde hym passe forde ryuer vincenna water began hugely aryse hynde appiered sodenly passed water fore kyng shewde hym forde thenne kyng made kyngdom fraunce stretche vnto hye hilles aragon ben called monte pireni ¶ therfore themperour anastasius herde name sente hym crowne gold rychely besette precious stone kyrtell gyrdel· fro tyme assigned consul augustus comyn prouffyt thempyre ¶and clothed consul gowne ¶and tyme empyre rome somtyme translated constantinople bygan waxe lasse lasse daye daye· kyngdom fraunce bygan sprede wexe ¶whan gisericus kynge wandels dede elder sonne homericus regned affryca eyght yere sleyght straunge nacions began first doo myldly crysten men ende commaunded putte fyry plate brestes holy maydens cause sholde knowleche bisshops clerkes leyn also put grete multitude cristen men strayt pryson shold lete falle vryne foul ordure eche vpon semed stenche therof passed al paine aboute tyme seynt medarde seynt gyldard bisshops roen confessours floures bretheren one wombe bothe born one day • sacred bisshops one day bothe dede one day ¶henr libro secundo ¶elle thre sone cymen plettynger cyssa come brytayne thre shippes yere fyrst comyng angle xxx slowe many brytons cun • ueshore chaced many vnto wode andresleger soo occupyed south • x ¶henr li • iunto ¶andrysleger grete wode south side kent • bysides hauen lymme conteyneth fourty myle lengthe thyrtty brede ¶after simplicius felix pope eyght yere seynt banabas body founden caue· disciple iohan hyd gospel mathew th • wryte owne style ¶barnabe p • echyd fyrst crist rome fyrst bisshop made • lan willelmus de regibus ¶ yere deyde engystus kent xxxij yere comyng englond drof forth tyme dyde dedes moche fraude strengthe hym leuer cruelly lawfully hym sone kyng osca four twenty yere· defended kyngdome made mor • held payd faders kyngdom passed nowhere faders boundes eutropius libro quarto ¶also zeno themperours tyme aurelius ambrose vsed purpure brytayne ¶after fyghtynge saxon lefte alyue moo romayns ouercome saxon vyctours fro tyme forth one nowe hadde maystrye vyctory • vnto tyme saxon maystrye wan alle ylond tyme seynt manmertus bisshop vyen ordeyned solempne letanyes ben callyd rogacions ageyne erthe quakynge tempeste weder parelle wylde beestes greued peple tyme called lasse l • tanye difference letanye seynt gregory ordeyned sayde seynt markes day paulus libro primo ¶ aboute tyme agrimundus fyrste kynge longobardes er • e cam pannonia fonde seuen child leyde besydes ponde comyn woman born one burth •• cast hem shold haue ben slayne kynge passed forth wold wyte torned spere bare honde toward children· one hem helde sp • wi • h ho • de therby kyng tolde childe sholde grete lete take hym ponde dyde norysshe hym vp besyly agelmundus deth nobley chosen king rewled longobardes right wel long tyme ¶and take ronde named hym lamissio· pond called lama theyr langage hym sayde whan •• asoues werned longobardes passe one owne ryuers lamiss • swymm • ng ryuer fought strengeste woman amasones slough ryght th • soo couenaunt ordeyned passage men yere zeno emperour sente theodericus fyghte ayenst • one oda • cer werred ytaly fourten yere theodericus kynges sone gothes delyuerd zeno pledge whan couenaunt pee made thenne whan theodericus eyghten yere olde passed bulgaria pannonia fedde hym lese aquylya ¶ thenne odaacer mette hym alle power ytaly ouer come hym therfor torned agayne rome put romaynes wente rauen besieged thre yere slaine right ¶ thenne theodericus come rome gladly resseyued wedded andel • lede doughter clodoneus kynge fraunce maryed doughters susters kynges dwellyd aboute soo wel nygh al ytaly ioyned hym suche affynyte ¶ capitulum quartum anastasius emperour seuen twenty yere ¶in first yere seynt patrik deyde fyrste bisshop irlond yere owne age six score tweyne aurelius ambrose tyme thenne kynge brytayne ¶gir top tyme abbot columba hete kolunkillus also seynt bryde seynt patrik veyled professyd ouerlyued hym sixty yere ¶these thre buryed vlster cyte dymeus denne thre chambre ¶ bodyes founden fyrst yere comyng sir iohan seconde kynge haryes sone irlond vpon tombes verse ben wreton hic iacent duno qui tumulo tumulantur vno brigida patricius atque columba pius saye duno thre ben buryed right al one tombe bryde patrik also columba mylde ¶r men saye fyrst patrik among wōderful werkes dedes dyde thre grete thynges· one droof staf al venemous beestes oute irlend second prayde graunted hym god almyghty none irissh̄ man shold abyde comyng antecrist ¶the thyrde wonder radde purgatorye acompted lasse patrik abbot bisshop· flowres aboute yere lord eyght honderd fyfty • tilogye speketh hym fonde fyrst rebell peple therfore wente oute irlond deyde thabbay glastenb • ry seynt bartilmew thappostlis daye ¶after felix gelasius pope fyue yere ordeined thordres sholde youen four tymes yere made comyn pre • tha • song masse tyme▪vere dignum et iustum est forth vnto dy nostros also hys tyme denne shewed seynt mychaels mont monte gargano yere lord four honderd four score twelue bygan kyngdome eest angle vnder vffa hym est angle ben callyd vffynges calle hem fycanes fykeys also ¶ beda libro • capitulo decimo sexto also yere grete slaughter saxon siege badon hille duc brytons aurerelius ambrose four fourty yere comyng angle henr libro secundo yere two duke saxon cerdicus sone kynricus fyue shippes come lond cerdishore called yarnemouth ¶seynt leonard born kyng clodoneus godfader toke hym oute cold water ¶whan gelasius dede anastasius pope two yere· ordeyned clerk shold wrathe leue seruise vnsayd holy chirche masse also pope cursed anastasius themperour anastasius symachus pope fyften yere hym ordeyned another pope hete laurencius stryf many manslaughter cyte· cam dome theodericus rauenne kyng demed • e fyrst ordeyned shold • ope hadde partye chesers election dome symachus pope loued clergye halpe pour men therfor paschasius cardynal deke •• deth payne purgatorye sette serue bathe fauoured laurence partye vnto deth· tellith gregorius libro dyalogorum also pope ordeyned euery sondaye fe • stes martres gloria excelsis shold sayd masse r therfore somme men wold suppose made foloweth ympne· men wene seynt hillarye made al foloweth ympne yere deyde remigius doctour frensshmen bisshop raynes heremyte w • rned remygius moder byrthe maner byrthe· heremyte loste eyen syght blynde ofte wepynge vsed beedes· prayd moder whan child shold wened child myght wasshe heremytes eyen moders mylk soo sholde haue sight agayne ¶ thenne remigins childhode dwellyd closet til two twenty yere old ¶after made bisshop raynes mylde wilde sparowes wold take met • hond henr ¶that yere one porth two sone come londe por • esmouth southse •• slowe noble yonge man brytons many hym lotharius kyng • raunce fader clodon • u regned one fyfty yerein tyme aurelius ambrose deyde brytayn broder vter pen • ragon reg • ed ¶ r vter pendragon helpe merlyn prophete brought corium gigantum stonehenge oute irlond stonhenge playne salesbury bryngynge stonhenge irlond speketh bryttyssh story· yf shold lawfully trowed also v • er pendragon slough gyllomaurus vortigerꝰ sone gyllomaurus kynge irlonde ¶ also vter slowe osca engistus sonne cosyn osa gorolus duc corne wayle wedded duke wyf iugerna • ate noble arthur ¶ atte last poysoned venym deyde buryed broder aureliꝰ corium gigantum stonhenge ¶ symachus hormysda pope eyght yere· reconciled grekes ordeyned clergye rewle • dre lefte seynt peter chirche beme syluer thousand pound sixty ¶ also sente lettres anastasius themperour fauoured entices errour commaunded themperour shold amende hym self wyl commaunde seyd themperour commaū ded ¶therfor afterward besette enemyes smyten lyghtnyng soo deyde ¶whan osca engystus sone dede sone octa regned hym two twenty yere kyngdome counterbury kyngd • •• nte marrianus libro secundo ¶ tyme iordanus bisshop floures made cronyk ¶ capitulum quintum beda sayth· iustinus elder emperour eyght yere telle emperour ten yere atte instaunce hormysda pope iustinus reconciled bysshops anastasius exyled fryth holy chirche german bisshop capna pope messager iustinus tyme henricus libro secundo ¶ yere comynge angle lxxj ¶this yere bygan yere westsaxons vnder c • rdicus sone kyn • icu helpe specially owne ne • ewe stuffer wyghtgar londed thre shippes • cerdychesore fought • rongly slough many brytons whiche neuewes • ylonde wyght treuisa ¶ loke kynge westsaxons fyrste booke capitulo decimo quinto ¶ thenne folowoth story ¶af •• r horsmisda fyrst iohan pope thre yere theodecicus augustus emperour ytalye hel • e arrius heresyeand sente pope iohan men dignyte consul iustinus emperour constantinople bade hym shold leue suffre arrians pee wold flee th • crysten men ytaly whan herde telle messagers worshipfully receyued whan come agayn • rauenna toke pope iohan symachus pat • iciꝰ boe • e senatour slough hem hard prisonne ¶ boece hadde defended mayntened auctoryte senatours rome good skyles resons· therfore exyled hym rome put hym papy • · bo • cins •• fyue bookes de consolacione philesophye atte last l • te sle hym contreye melan • ¶r bo • ce passyng man werkes dedes famous withoute repreef lerned fyrst langage latyn grue rome th • nne athene ler • ed hem • e ful withoute bookes made declared seuen ar •• s· made fyfty songes endyted comice • short verse • ong whiche song • best begynneth • maner· amor deus deitas thou loue god godhede wyf elpes kynges doughter scicilia made ympn • praysyng thappostles pet • r paule begynneth manere felix per omnes festum mundi cardines ¶that saye thou feste art hooly gracious euery countre wyde world made writing grau • n tombe made hit metre manere elpes • name soo cecily brou • ht • forth· fer oute londe husbondes loue ladde boly place nowe reste straūge londe queth trone iugge neuer hath ende theodericus tyraūt escaped payne deyde sodenly rauenne four score ten dayes fulfylled tyrauntrye holy man boece ¶ one solutarius sawe hym boyle sethe vulcanus crokce ilonde luparis beside scicilia boyleth caudrone ¶ yere seynt bryde mayde deyde irlond iohan fourth felix pope four yere seint gregoryes fader grauntsir ordeyned seke men sholde enoynted holy oyle • r passed oute lyf· cursed patriarke constantinople ¶also yere abbot dyonisius exiguus began make compot rome· fyrste ther moo toke hede defautes compot ¶and afterward marianus monke closed magoncia touchyd begynnynge fyrst booke thyrd prefas ¶ capitulum sextum ivstinianus iustinus neuewe suster goten regned eyght thy • • yere gadred lawes romayns wryten wel nygh two thousand bookes thre honderd thousand verse longe wrytynge vnprofytable gadred hem volume twelue bookes callyd volume iustinianus code also made pendactas dygest departed thre volume ¶also dyde many bataylls hym self bilisiarchus duc netheles exyting theodora augusta dyde many cruel dedes exyled pope felix bonefacius pope two yere somwhat dayes ordeyned clerkes lewd men shold departed whyle masse syngynge ¶ bonefacius second iohan pope two yere four monethes ¶ second iohan fyrst agapytus pope xj yere ordeyned procession shold made sonday wente constantinople iustinianus deyde born rome cerdicus fyrst kynge westsaxons deyde whan regned seuen • n yere ¶ agapitus siluerius pope one yere fyue mon • thes exyled slayne exyled made thempresse theodora augusta wold restore agayne anthemius patriark constantinople fore hond condempned heresye yere seynt dauy born hete dewy also· bisshop meuenia whiche callyd seynt dauy wale ¶after seuerius virgilius pope nyne yere ordeyned masse shold sayd toward eest ende chirche atte laste predecessour poursiewed thempresse cause anthemius patriark restored al day drawe haled scorned buffeted constantinople atte laste deyde exyled tyme bellisarius patricius delyuerd rome takynge gothes ¶also tyme byfyl • rad theofolus tharchedeken though virgilius entred euyl maner papacye cause procoured thexyling predecessour siluerius for▪ wolde pope hym self repentaunt veryly exyled fayth deyde exyled atte laste ¶henricus libro secundo ¶ tenth yere c • rdicus kynge westsaxon yere arthur warriour bygan taryse eyghten yere old faught twelue sithes ayenst saxon hadde vyctorye· fyrst vpon ryuer gleuy efte four sythes vppon ryuer douglas countrey iewes ¶r ryuer callyd dongglys englyssh ryuer renneth vnder cyte wygan ten myle ryuer mersee lancasshyre· henricus ¶the sixth batayll vpon ryuer bassa seuenth besides lyncolum wod • hete celidon bryttissh hete caercayt celydon callyd lyncolum· ix batayl atte cyte caerleon xij badonhille ¶willelmus de regibus libro primo ¶ arthur whome brytons gone oute waye tellen many ydle tale prayseth sothe storyes false worthy praysed· mayntened contrary dounward comforted mennes hertes fyghte courageously bataylle atte last slough nyne honderd enemyes siege badenhill ¶r ¶ men red • somme cronykes cerdicus fought oft arthur· yf one ouercome aroose vp efte strenger fyghte atte laste six twenty yere cerdicus comynge arthur wery noyeful hym yaue hym hampshyre somersete called countrey westsex· made fayth swore hym ¶also rad cronicis anglorum mordredus arthurus neuewe desyred regne 〈◊〉 • radde cerdi •• yaue townes fit •• ou • e hym cerdicus assented therto restored prouynce cou • treyes new saxons· crowned wynchestre maner misbileuyd mē london mordredus crowned kynge briton yle wyght lefte withgaras neuew cerdicusbut storye brytons telleth • arthur fought afterward mordredus slough hym slayne buryed vale aualon besides glasting bury· afterward body body wyf gwenner founden seconde harryes tyme translated chirche aboute yere lord enleuen honderd four score seyth giraldus distinctione prima capitulo decimo octauo tho lyue handled arthur boone furthermore arthur among wryters cronykes gaufredus allone prayseth hym soo moche men wondre myght sothe told fo • yf arthur goten thyrtty kyngdoms gaufredus celleth yf made kynge fraunce subgette yf slayne lucius ytaly procuratour thempyre· comyntewhy lefte alle wryters storyes romayns frenssh men saxonsand speke soo grete dedes soo grete vyctour syth tolde soo moche soo many lasse men lasse dedes· yet herto gaufredus sayth slough lucius hiberius procuratour thempire al storyes rome knowen none lucius procuratour thempyre eyther comynte tyme ¶ also none arthur regned ne born •• themperours tyme· iustinianus tyme fyfth leo also gaufredus sayth hym wondreth gyldas beda alle bookes speke arthur holde wonder gaufredus prayseth moche one alle old famous soth writer storyes make wel nygh mē cion sothe maner euery nacion ouer preyse somme one nacion gre • e preisen alysaundre romaynes theyr octauianus englysshmen theyr rychard frensshmen theyr charles briton theyr arthur happeth ofte iosephus sayth fayrenes thistorye lykynge redars eyther prey • theyr owne bloode cause th • write soo ¶ austyn de ciuitate dei libro decimo •• eth 〈◊〉 doynges men athene ben gretter fame dede ther wryters clere wytte hadden ioye lykynge tourne wytte tonge grete hyhe huge praysyng thenne gaufredus bryttissh booke sayth arthur whan sholde deye graunted dyademe kyngdom cosyn constantyn sonne cador duke cornewayle fought oftymes mordredus sonnes slough hem • te laste soo four yere regned deyde hym aurelius conanus helde kyngdome thre yere ¶and hym vortiporius four yere· hym malgo regned somwhat yeres fayre stronge large free yef • e infect vyce sodomye ¶after hym careticus regned somwhat tyme vnlykynge god brytons loned stryf destruction ryghtful lyuynge mankynde saxon waar vnstedfastnes· senten kynge affrycanus gurmundus made hym subgett prayd hym come oute yrlond ¶and gurmundus saxon ioyned oned gyder· cha • ed creticus cyte cyte besyeged hym atte laste sissetre· droof hym afterward brytons wale ouer seuarn destroyed lo • gria englond yron fyre tyme warde brytons lost hoole kyngdome brytayne ¶chilpiricus seuenth kynge fraunce regned fader lotharius xxiiij yere yere comynge thangles four score eyghten yere bygan kyngdome northumberlond vnder one ida sone • oppa twellyfth woden come al blood kynges northumberlonde yda regned twelue yere brenicia many sone treuisa brenicia northsyde northumberlonde stretcheth scottysshe see· loke ther • fyrst book capitulo 51 thou may finde mere markes brenicia· thenne foloweth storye· iustinianus themperours tyme befel gregorius libro dyalogorum telleth th • • isshops spake atte beste whan tonges kytte aff • ica fayth holy chirche one hem pryued myrache lecherye fylle ynne somtyme ¶ aboute tyme cyte scicilia archedeken heete theofilusand bare hym soo nobly vnder bisshop whan bisshop dede alle men cryeden worthy bisshop ¶ helde hym payed archedekenry hadde leuer another bisshop he· afterward made bisshop putte hym wrongefully oute archedekenry ¶ fylle soo greete meschyef hyred hebrewe whitche forsooke criste moder vppon condicion shold come worshippe hadde loste ¶ also dyde deuyl hommage wrote hym chartre bloode soo hadde archedekenry morowe bythoughte hym atte laste sorowfull dede prayde oure lady helpe socoure· soo helpe oure lady hadde chartre agayne foryefnes synnes ¶ thenne knowleched trespaas maner doynge openly fore bisshop alle people· thenne alle people wondred worshipped thanked cryste oure lady· theofile deyde thre dayes place oure lady brought hym chartre agayne ¶ vigilius fyrste pelagius pope enleuen yere ¶ yere totila kynge gothes wer • yd ytalye· thenne passed campania seynt benettes abbaye besieged rome strongly toke atte laste nyght entryd atte yate highte porta hosti • nsis ¶ romaynes sholde somdele voyde cruelnes made trompes blowen ¶ also totila wolde essaye yf seynt benette hadde spyryte prophecye· cl • th • one knyghtes kynge sente hym seynt b • net though kynge self comen holy man thenne seynt benet sayd hym sone doo thou berest thyn ¶afterwarde totila hym self fyl doune grounde fore hooly man wolde aryse till hooly man toke hym vp owne honde sayde moche harine thou hast done nowe reste thou shalt entre rome passe see thou shalt regne nyne yere daye lasse cruel atte laste narses patricius sente augustus ouercome hym batayll tho cassiodorus flowres somtyme kynge theodorus chaunceler consul thenne senatour monke atte rome atte laste· ¶ amonge grete trauaylls expowned clerely sawter· henricus kynge westsaxons deyde sonne ceaulinus kynge hym thre thyrt • yere droof brytons oute cytees gloucetre surcetre bathe hilles montaines wildernes wale willelmus de regibus li • 1 atte last hated angle brytons hoost bete adoune hym self chaced exyled deyde exyled ¶also fyrste yere elle yffus sonne twellif • h woden bygan regne regned neygh thyrtty yere prouynce deyra ¶ tyme seynt gregory sawe englysshe child selle rome acorded sayd alleluya must songe fro whens child come ¶r grace bylene cam kynge elle sone kynge edwynus ¶ mene tyme ida eldest sonne adda regned seuen yere brenicia claspa fyue yere theodwolfus one yere freodulp • u seuen yere yet elle alyue sonne edwinus childe thre yere old chaced eth • lricus ida sonne regned fyue yere bothe prouynces deyra brenicia ¶ paulus libro p • imo fine aboute tyme kynge audoenus regned vpon longobardes dwellyd pannonia stronge batayle bytwene gespydes longobardes ¶ bataylle albumus andoenus sonne slough kynges sonne gespydes gespydes sparpled departed therfore longobardes prayde kynge andoenus make solempne grete feste sonne albuinus ¶ kynge answerde sayde maner amonge hem kynges sonne shold sytte atte feste euen fader kynge yf hadde fore honde take armure kynge straunge nacion ¶ albuynus herde toke hym fourty yonglynges chosen wente boldly kynge gespydes who sonne hadde slayne bataylle axed armure goodly resseyued sette mete kyng kynges sone place hadde slayne kynge behelde man place syghed ful soore sayde place lef person • sytteth therinne greuous see ¶ thenne kynges sonne yet alyue byganne terre angre longobardes dispytouse wordes sayde lyke • mare whyte legges vp thyes tyme longobardes v • ed • raples brode lace doune sparlyme ¶ ne one longobardis sayde hym soo scorned hem· goo felde thy broder slayne ¶and thou myghte assaye howe strongly thyse mare conne kyke ¶thenne gespydes arayd hem wepen longobardes sette hond hiltes owen swerdes kyng lepe ouer lorde sessyd stryf sayde honnest vyctorye slee grest hostelrye yaue sone armure slayn hym slayn hym sente pee fader agayn wil dere li primo ethelbertus ermericus sone whiche ermericus ueueuewe engistussonne ¶ ethelbertus regned ouer kentysshmen fyue fyfty yere sayth beda another cronyke sayth thre fyfty yere yongthe scorn bysmer kynges dwellyd nygh hym ouercome double bataille saued vnneth oune boūdes whan older brought alle kynges nygh hym vnder yok take kynges northumberlond thenne wedded frenssh woman hete berta ensample one letardus bisshop come berta· moche exyted leue forsake wylde maners atte laste herde seynt austyn preche loore holy faders forsoke cursyd lawes made good lawes langage lond whiche lawes promysed mede good men peynes euyl men wycked ¶and deyde yere receyued feyth boly chirche one twenty martinus pelagius thirde iohan pope thyrten yere· tyme prescianus gramaryen cesarea floures constantinople made noble bookes gramer also descryued al worlde book called cosmagraphia sayde hugucio capitulo edo edes ¶telleth become apostata forsooke feyth loue disciple iulianus ¶ also tyme one arator subdedene rome wonder poete made book actus apostolorum alle versis six fete ¶ seynt brendan abbot irlonde floures tyme hym ben many wondres radde specially purgatorye west side • lond ¶also tyme seynte steuens boone brought rome leyde seynt laurence place therof speken cronyckes rome legendes hooly sayntes telle whanne seynt steuens boone brought thyder seynt laurence boone tourned syde hadde leyn vp right alwaye fore hond· thēne torned yeue place stede felawe seynt stephen ¶ capitulum septimum iustinianus second iustinus regned enleuen yere man despysed poure men spoylled senatours yaue hym couetyse soo made cofres yron put tresour ¶ fyl atte last pelagius heresye loste reson good mynde· ordeyned one tiberius mylde man gouerne thempyre beda libro tercio capitulo tercio prynces fyrste yere one columba preeste abbot come oute yrlond preche north pictes departed southe hye hilles downes southe pyctes conuerted fore honde ninianus bisshop nacion brytons sente thyder therfore firste taught right wel rome· see candida casa whyte hows lyeth resteth thenne see perteyned men brenicia marianus libro secundo badiꝰ myghty kyng regned amonge tho beda vbi supra columba come north pictes receyued hem ylond hij fyue meynes bylde abbay heede alle thabbayes bylded ylond vseth alwaye haue hym abbot preeste rule gouerne hem· soo alle ppouynce bisshopes also ben subgette abbote preeste manere ordre vsed elleswhere· ensample fyrste doctor columba bisshop preeste monke comynge two thyrtty yere deyde buryed lefte hym noble disciple doute eester terme folowed cycle honderd yere fyfty vnto yere grace seuen honderd fyften thenne cam one egbertus preest af englysshe nacion hadde ben longe exyled yrlonde· ¶ noo wonder decretes synodes holdynge eester tyde come yet hem· sette f • r oute ouer roundenes world paulus libro secundo narses patricius sente iustinus italye slough totila kyng gothes restored state thempire romayns hadde grete enuye hym soo sente iustinus sayde better romayns serue grekes gothes narses patricius emperour therfor thempecaur meued put prefect longinus narses patricius stede empresse sophia augusta sente narses dispytous scorn sholde retorne constantinople sholde wenchis wymens wytte fynde coste wollen thredes sayth answerd therto sayd wold warpe suche webbe empresse neuer sholde haue lyues ende thenne wente naples campania sente longobardes worde sholde leue poure feldes pannonia come ryche londes ytaly soo dyde longobardes cam ytaly morowe eester day yere lord fyue honderd lxviij thenne kyngdome ytaly vnyoked delyuerd yock constantinople· romaynes afterward rewled patrycies r albuinus kyng longobardes assayled ytaly fyry hoostes seen heuen cast onte mannes bloode lyghtnynge therfore gregory speketh omelye also ligurgia wonder tokenes seen house dores clothes ony man wold wesshe hem away· seen yer mennes chanels nether ende sprange akehornes cam brennynge feuer slough men space thre dayes· therfore men fledde lefte home hoūdes· noo tylyer londe lefte feldes ne vyneyerdes place pasture turned buryels sepulcres daye nyght men herde thayer trompes grutchyng hoost passed stappes nether forowes none
