seen paulꝰ li 5 longobardes haue name longe berdes· vse shaue theyr heer heede fro molde nolle fore locke hangynge doun mouthe· vsed large clothes long specially lynen clothes englysshe saxon wonte vse brode lace wouen dyuerse colour vsed hye shoon vp kne slit fore lacede thwonges· hosen tylled hamme teyd layners al aboute ¶ fyrste yere comynge kynge albuinus besyeged cyte papye thre yere toke atte laste occupyed al italye reseruyd rome paulus libro secundo whan kyng albuinus roode atte est yate cyte papye hors sate fylle doune vnder hym myddel yate· myghte reysed though prycked spore vnto tyme kynge reuoked releced harde· auowe made hadde made auow al people wold yelde hem shold slayne swerdes thenne albuinus regned ytaly thre yere six monethes deyde atte laste treson wyf maner ¶this albuinus dwellyd pannonia somtyme ouercome gespydes· also theyr kyng made cuppe kynges skulle drynke maner cuppe called scala amonge hem pathera latyn also wedded rosamunda kynges doughter sleyn atte cyte verona ytaly grete feste made wyf rosamunda drynke cuppe whether wold noo· prayd drynke fader· hadde grete indignacion therof awayted tyme whan kyng oute layd self pryuely bed damoysel duke kynges loued specially duc came bedde supposed hadde ben damysel ▪ laye ¶ thenne spak duc sayde wost thou thou hast done sekerly thou hast doo suche dede nowe thou shalt slee husbonde albuinus kynge thou shalt slayne swerde soo slowe king rosamunda vnder tyde bonde fast kynges swerde tho slepte· myght drawen oute scaberde cause kynge shold mowe helpe hym self whan cam slee hym thenne whan king slayne sleer fledde went quene rauenna dwellyd whyle rosamunda sawe right fayre yonge man prefecte cyte· loued hym wit cause therof yaue husbond venym drynke anone duke felte strengthe venym drough oute swerd made wyf drynke dele soo deyde both· somme men telle whan rosamunda slayne one parideus wyst first treson come oute rauēna constantinople slough leon presence themperour comyn spectacle· men stode byholde pleyes ne thynges· sholde caste ayenste cyte emperoure made putte oute bothe eyen sone toke two knyues pryuely sleues feyned secrete coūceyll telle themperour emperour sente hym two pat • ricies preuy hym forsayde perydeus slough hem bothe one stroke second yere iustinus ethelbertus kynge kente yaue bataylle ceaulinus kynge westsaxon broder cutha chaced hym slowe two duke wyl • aldoun· fyrst batayll bytwene saxon ¶ yere cutwulf kynge ceaulinus broder fought strongly ayenst brytons bedford toke fro four cytees lygauburgh eglesburgh besington euesham deide yere tyme deyde seynt german bysshop paris noble man ful myracles ¶ whan bygan waxe • ke sawe wal ayenste bedde thus wreton foure dayes fore maye· therby knewe shold dye day dyde buryed medowes bysyde paris chilperitꝰ seuenth kynge fraunce deyde al tyme hym sone lotharius regned four fyfty yere· ¶ poete fortunatus ytalye cleer man wytte sharp connyng softe swete speche wrote seynt martyns lyf iiij bookes metre versis six fete afterward bisshop turon ¶ iustinus seuenth yere fulfylled grete cycle eester tyme conteyneth fyue honderde yere two thyrtty crystes passion sayth marianꝰ 560 fro beginnyng worlde fyue thousand lxv yere somme men suppose ¶ capitulum octauum tiberius constantinus emperour seuen yere myldest alle men yaue tresour palays pour men therfor wyf blamed hym ofte men saye answerd maner truste oure lord money shal faile v nede put tresour heuē thenne passed day besydes themperours palays constā tinople sawe crosse grauen pauiment marbelstone semed worthy trede vpon fete specially vpon shold prynted forhedes mankynde toke vp stone sawe another graue wyse· thenne sawe thyrdde wise grau • toke vp foūde ther vnder tresour withoute ende pope iohan deyde tombe wreton metre man bynam worshipe thoughte word iohan besyly thoughte wylle plese god alle thynge hath wroughte hym fyrst benet pope four yere brought many thousandes mesures whete shippes oute egypte delyuerd cyte rome fro meschyef honger king albuynus besieged cyte therfor wrote tombe metre maner fader benet thou benet thou liuest greten mynde title vertues fayrenes gretene sorowe marianus ¶ yere ceaulinus kynge westsaxons ouercome brytons toke hem famous cyte gloucetre su • cetre· bathan cestre also yere seynt maurus deyde yere age lxxij bare maystres seynt benettes stole necke long lyf lasted benet pelagius pope ten yere ¶ capitulum nonum mauricius emperour one twenty yere good crysten man byleue ouercam perses armenyes· atte last discorded fro seynt gregory soo spak moche euyl hym founded hym deth thenne seen man rome clothed monkes wede swerde drawe honde cryede al cyte manere mauricius shal slayne emperour herde amended hym euyl dedes prayde god wold withdrawe dome lord shewed self mauricius sleepe sayde wylt thou spare eyther lyf lord sayde thou louest wretch ben meschyef yelde thy wyll ¶thenne whan mauricius eest londes founded forbede knyghtes thefte robberye yaue hem wage wont doo therfore knyghtes moeuyd made one foca emperour ayenst hym foca slaugh mauricius thre sone while fledde ylond ¶marianus libro secundo ¶ yere ceaulinus sonne cutha foughte ayenste brytous fechaulege cutha slayne ceaulinus byctorye beda libro primo ¶ elle kynge deyra deyde one thyrtty yere regne ida sone ethelbertus regned fyne yere deyra brenicia ¶ yere born fraunce thre bretheren ado bado dado dado heete audoenus also afterward forsoke chyualrye· made bisshop roan paulus libro quarto aboute tyme gū tranus kynge fraunce wente huntyng wode men disperpled hyther thyder euery syde kynge wexe wonderly slepy leyde hym self slepe slepte one lappe moost preuy hym thenne crepte oute kynges mouth lytel beest wold haue passed lytel lake ther fast by· secretarye • lap king slept sawe drow swerd leyde ouer lake lytel beest passed therupon side wēt caue hille abode whyle came agayn way vpon swerd kynges mouthe kynge awoke told secretarye hadde mette wonder sweuen· tolde mette passed yron brydge· fonde grete tresour hille thenne secretarye tolde hym hadde seen done thenne tweine wente gyder digged greete tresour caue hille ¶ somme tresour kynge made grete couerynge shryne caste sende ierusalem· lette purpose dyde hit ouer body seynt marcel marter cite cabyllona ¶beda libro primo holy fader columbanus seynt gallus noble disciple come oute irlond burgoyn bylded abbay luxonium leue theodericus kynge dryuen thennes brunmylda quene come almayn builded many abbayes yet ben famous resseyne yrysshe men monkes columbanus lefte gallus came ytalye buylde abbay bonum yere fyll grete rayne tyber wesshe walles ol rome cast vp grete multitude serpentes one grete dragon· stenche hem slewe many men cyte also ther come pestilence euyl chanels men atte neder ende pestylence slowe pelagius pope pestylence wood slowe men weye mete playeng talkynge ofte slowe men gal • ynge snesynge therof cometh men vse saye whan fnese god helpe whan gapeth make crosse fore mouthe pestylence seynt gregory tharchedeken rome ordeyned seuen maner letanyes sayd seynt marcus daye set fyrst clergy· second abbotes mōkes third abbess theyr menchons fourth childrē fyfthe lewdmen· sixthe wydowes seuenth wyues beda libro primo capitulo visesimo tercio ¶ gregory pope thyrten yere six monethes ten dayes made many noble beokes therof quadraginta due omelie omelie suꝑ euā gelia dominicalia moralia suꝑ iob omelye super principiū et finem ezechielis registrum pastorale dyalogorum buylded abbaye owne hows also al chirches rome ordeyned fastyng euery day lente foryefnes synnes ¶also mae alle heedes lynmes maumettes cut canon masse putto dy que nostros tua pace disponas forth ¶also fyrst alle pope called hym self wrote bulles· seruus seruorum dei seruaunt seruauntes god▪ also ordeyned synode counceyll rome mynystres auter sbolde take heede prechyng syngyng sayde axith swete wy holy seruyse couenable lyf sette part syngar maners pricketh peple though plese hem voys though seynt gregorye moost holy yet bachiters enemyes wold haue brente bookes deth deken pers sworn vpon booke perylle sowle wytnes owen deth bookes endyted inspiracion holy goste ¶ yere ceaulinus kynge westlaxon oryda slayn hym calfritus sone broder cuthulphꝰ regned strongly fyu • yere hym broder colwulfus regned xiiij yere beda li • ca 5 ethelfridꝰ ethelricus sone ethelricus ydas sonne ¶this ethelfridus bygan regne ouer northumbres regned nobly four twenty yere right stronge desyred grete worshipe destroyed brytons alle angle prince made hem tributaryes wyf acta kyng elles doughter seuen sonnes one doughter hete ebba ¶ tweyne sonnes highte oswaldns oswyns beda libro tercio capitulo tercio columba deyde tyme abbot buyred abbaye ylonde hij ¶ beda libro quinto ca 9 hadde name made acella columba callyd colunkillus ¶beda libro primo capitulo visesimo tercio ¶also yere grete gregory sente austyn monke preche word god englysshmen austyn aferd drad wey torned agayne seynt gregory gregory comforted hym sente hym lettres bisshop latensis shold helpe austyn hym neded· tenoure thylke lettres lettres sente kynge kente also answer seynt gregore gafe austyns question ben wreton registro gregorij beda paulus libro quinto also yere longobardes nyght assayled seint benettes abbay mount cassinus monkes fledde rome toke hem book holy rule weyght brede iourneye mesure wyn euinia· meschyef benette warued hem byfore honde prayde god graunted vnnethe men place sholde sauf riuer nylus atte ylonde delta hoost rome sawe mermyns lykenes men wymen seen morow vnto euentyde ¶ yere austyn cam londe eest side kente ylond • thanet ¶sōme men calle ylond den • e ther cam lond fourty felaws somme men interpretours hem oute londe fraunce counseyll gregory· ¶ seynt austyn sente interpretours kyn ge ethelbertus yere kyngdom six thyrtty sayde come oute rome hele sauacion kynge royamme kynge herd herd fore honde crysten feyth· hadde wyf crysten quene frenssh woman hadde resseyued fader moder vpon condicion shold vse kepe crysten feyth ¶ thenne somwhat dayes kynge come ylondbut spake hem withoute hows vnder welken doynge vsed mysbyleue mysbyleuyd men comyng areysed vp baner crosse crucifixe peynted table songe letanye prechyd wrod lyf thenne kynge spak hem sayde fayre ye promyse moche newe may yet assente cause ye ben come fro ferre sake shal spare yow fynde suche thynges shal nedeful lyflode shal graunte l • ne also tourne oure men feith many ye may whan herde this· went procession cyte songe alleluya sayde lord praye al thy mercy thy wrath take fro cyte soo wente cyte dorobernia caunterbury ¶and ladde theyr lyf holy faders dyde begynnynge hooly chirche fastyng wakynge bede byddyng ande prechynge goddes worde songe mass crystned eest syde cyte tholde chirch seynt martyn vnto tyme kynge conuerted grete dele peple kynge conuerted yaue doctour place bisshops see atte crystes chirche many possession buylded thabbay seynt peter paule eeste side cyte austyn successours also kynges kente wont buryed beda li 26 ca 2 ¶in mene tyme austyn wente tharchebisshop arelatensis sacred archebisshop hym seynt grego • e certefyed therof sente austyn moo helper mellitus iustus paulinus bookes relyquyes hooly sayntes answer saynt austyns question suche thā swers chirche rome vseth al goodes fall̄e tho goodes sholde deled four partyes one bisshoppe meyne fynde hem herbegerye suche nede seconde clergye thyrdde pour men· fourthe amendement chirches ¶to hem lyuen comyn alle thynge comyn ther leueth shal spended dedes mercy • second axyd feyth al one ben ther many diuerse vsages chirches herto answerde maner thou knowest· mooste plesynge god almyghty gadre thou gyders make vsed chirches englonde· thynges ben loued place place ben louyd good thynges ¶colwulfus sonne cutha ceaulinus broder reigned westsaxon fourtene yere ¶that tyme subarbis constantinople come forth gree •• meruaylles wondres one child bore foure foot another two nolles moldes yere seynt iue bisshoy born perce deyde englond ¶ beda libro primo yere austin commaundement gregorie made two archebisshops one london another york mene tyme helpe ethelbertus gadred hisshops doctours brytons gyder place called anstyns oc austyns strengthe place marche wiccies west saxon ¶and charged hem sholde preche goddes worde angle hym also shold amende somme errours amonge hem self specially thusage eester tyme withsayd openly til shewed open token whiche partye shold holden thenne blynde man brought forth nacion angle heled hadde syght prayer austyn· brytons fayled dede whan brytons sawe blynd man hadde syght knowleched seynt austyns waye trewe ¶but sayde myght forsake theyr old vsages without assente hem vsed thenne gadred synode therto cam seuen bisshops briton wysest men famous abbaye bangor fyrste counseyll heremyte shold assente austyn yf fonde hem meke mylde crystes disciple sholde myght knowe yf austyn wold aryse ayenst hem whan come synode· austyn satte stylle bisshops chayer roose therfore forsoke hym grete wrath ¶thenne seynt austyn seyde assente specially thre thynges yf ye wole assente assente holde eester daye dewe tyme yeue ye crystendome maner chirche rome preche ye goddes worde angle dele suffre amende anonge self wold therof thenne seynt austyn inspiracion warned hem sayde wolde resseyue pee bretheren shold res • yue hem warre wreche afterward atte goddes owne dome hit fulfylled ethelfridus kynge northumberlond whan people monkes bangor slayne chestre ¶ capitulum decimum mauricius slayne focas regned eyght yere· ethelfridus kynge northumberlond foughte ayenste edan kyng scottes dexsastan hadde solempne victorie theobaldus kynges broder slain hooste alle ladde beda libro secundo also yere holy fader seynt austyn mydwynter daye whan hadde cristned ten thousand englysshmen weste ryuer called swale besydes yorke knewe shold deye ordeyned hym successour one laurence alyue hym self state holy chirche englond· yet rude boystous dyde ensample seynt peter made clement helper successour also ordeyned mellitus bisshop estsaxons ryuer thamyse departeth bytwene hem kente chyef cyte london whiche ethelbertus kynge kente buylded seynt paulus chirche cathedrall chirche bisshops see r ¶ another cronyke seyth sebertus kynge eest angle made paulus chirche lond • n made iustus bisshop kente atte cyte dornbres nowe called rochestre fyrst name one rufe bywest dorobernia caunterbury thre twenty myle cyte rochestre kynge ethelbertus lete bylde chirch seynt andrew also grete gregory deyde yere hym gaminianus pope two yere ordeyned houres day shold rongen chi • ches· sp • k euil gregory· made grete cost poure men therfore seynt gregory app • ered hym thryes blamed hym· • tte fourth tyme cause wolde amende smote hym hede thenne woke yelded vp goost ¶also yere wale seynt dauyd deyde hete dewy also· bisshop mene • ia called seynt dauyes ¶aboute yere deyde seynt iohan amener patriarke alexandria one hym praiers appiered fairest maide might crowned olyue called self mercy promised hym shold spede wele yf wolde take spouse fro day forward iohan merciable alle poure men called lordes ¶therfor seynt iohans hospitalers calle poure men lordes ¶ also iohan hadde al poure mennes na • e cyte wryten booke also vsed twyes weke sytte alle day fore chirche dore • orde men stryf· tyme hadde seten al day sawe man pleyne thenne groned saide wretche da • worthy noo good dede yes sayde dekene day thou sholdest gladde make grete ioye nowe men ben made right angel without strif ¶also tyme gospell reding peple wente oute chirche talke telle tale wente oute also sate among hem sayde shepe herde shal thenne goo ye chirche shal goo yf ye abyde shal abyde ¶and taughte hem stonde chirche masse tyme • ¶ iohan prayer ofte herde spekynge god almyghty saynge lord ihesu· thou yeuest largely dele forth loke shal haue maystrye saminianus thyrdde bonefacius pope eyght monethes eyght twenty dayes ordeyned clothes sholde leyd vppn auter white clothes thyrdde boneface fourth boneface pope seuen yere· purchaced themperour augustus focas seynt peter chirche rome shold heede al chirches worlde· chirche constantinople called self fyrste ¶also purchaced pantheon myght halowed worshipe alle halowen pantheon chirche somtyme halowed worship goddesse cybele neptunus fendes slewe oft crysten men therfore euery yere two dayes fore nouembre pope syngeth peple houseled also treted lynynge bisshop noman sholde treate newe election successour thre dayes bisshops deth· also demed monkes myght vse office prechynge crystenynge assoyllynge ¶aboute tyme tunica domini inconsutulis oure lordes kyrtell· cote withoute ony seme founden vale iosephat cofre marble gregory bisshop antiochia broughte ierusalem r ¶ yf sothe semeth may stonde radde fore honde • erius cesars tyme radde pilatus stode demed fore tiberius cesar myght dampned hadde kyrtel withoute semes tunica xpristi inconsutilis· yf pilatus kyrtell hym rome semeth afterwarde take thennes brought vale iosephat also yf tyme kyrtel founden vale iosephat semeth pilatus kyrtel hym rome treuisa ¶it noo maystrye brynge kyrtel fro rome vale iosephat brynge fro ierusalem rome may wel stonde pilatus hadde kyrtel rome· kyrtell founden afterward vale iosephat beda libro secundo also yere ethelfridus kyng northumberlond destroyed th • brytons legecestre cyte legyons brytons callen coerlegyons chestre slough ther two thousand two honderd monkes thabbaye bangor comen praye knyghtes slough hem fast cyte • leder bruciuayl escaped oute hoost fledd ¶the nombre monkes dwellyd abbay two thousand honderd seuen sythes thre honderd alle lyueden trauaylle theyr owne hondes perses aroos ayenst thempyre toke ierusalem way baner crosse byname romayns many prouynces thenne baraclyan rector affryca slough foca themperour made owne sone heraclius emperour ¶ capitulum 11 heraclius emperour xxvij yere iij yere cosdras kyng perce sette ierl̄m afyre holy place toke zacharye patriark p • isoner moche peple part crosse helene lefte perse xij yere heraclius slough cosdras prisoner delyuerd cross • brought agayne ierl̄m pride boost yate closed ayenst doyng god almighty king meked yede barfote thenne yate opened agayn syth tyme holy chirche hath ordeined feest exaltacion holy crosse· wil de li colwulfus kynge westsaxon deyde hym two sone broder colricus regned gyder one hete kyng • l • u quichelinus dyden many grete dedes ayenst briton specially hampton byside ox • nford also ayenste penda kyng mercia wolde haue taken fro kyngdome cyte surcetre atte last kyngilsus crystned seint birinus quichelinus voyded wolde resseyue sacrament crystendom til warned feblenesse body thenne crystned deyde yere kyngilsus regned al brother brother two thyrtty yere ¶ noted auctours varye willelmus sayth quichelinus kyngylsus brother marianus beda sayen kyngylsus sonne bonefacius one deus dedit hete theodorus also pope four yere ¶that tyme atte exytynge kynge ethelbertus cytezeyn london buylded chirche seynt peter westside london place tho hete thorney saye ylond thornes called westmonestre beda li 2 capitulo quinto yere ethelbertus kynge kente deyde wente heuene regned worl̄d lvj yere yere receyued feyth ·xxj hym sone edbal̄dus regned xxv yere· apostata laye stepdame therfor ofte wode tyme whan sebertus kynge westsaxons dede thre sone eyre tourned ydol̄atrye prayd mellitus bisshop place yeue whyte breede somtyme yeue theyr fader· wolde yf wol̄d receyue crystendome therfor put hym oute bisshopryche wente bisshops kent· thenne mellitus iustus one assente wēt oute englonde ffraunce hem leuer serue god pee bisshops amonge straunce nacions withoute fruyt sone afterward mysbyleuyd kynges sl̄ayn kyng gywesses ¶beda libro capitulo nono also bisshops· laurence tharchibisshop purposed forsake countreyand nyght prayer peter appiered hym bl̄amed wolde forsake peple onl̄y bl̄amed hym bete hym also ful soore morow bisshop shewed hys woundes kynge edbaldus thenne kyng forsoke ydol̄atrye mysbyleue vnl̄awfull wif torned right fe • th sente bisshops fledde brought hem agayn theyr bisshopryches londoner wolde resseiue ageyne theyr bisshop mellitus leuer serue ydolatrye kynge stronge fader chast • se thenne laurence deyde mellitus archebisshop hym though podagre body gl̄ad herte hel̄ed seke men prayer saued cyte brē nyng· paulus li· 5 aboute tyme cacanus kyng anes ben hunes come ytal̄y bete doun longobardes slowe duk gysulfus besieged cyte aquilia romilda wyf duke sl̄ayne sawe hym wal̄ke aboute siege sawe fayr louely loued gretely sente word anone yf wold take wyf wolde delyuere hem cyte al therinne kynge graunted cyte taken brente men take prysoners lad awey kyng toke romylda ho promysed scorne laye one nyght another nyghte made twelue hunes lye despyte eche ¶afterward pyght sharp pole myddel felde· pight thurgh oute body ouer ende pole lete sayde· soo cruel harlatt suche husbond semeth haue· doughters romilda chast drewe hoerdome moder maydens toke rawe fflesshe chykens coltes leyde bytwene theyr brestes flessh shold stinke whan hunes come sholde wene maydens stonke cause hunes lefte come nyghe hem afterward maydens sold wedded gentilmen· beda li 2 ca 9 edwinus fledde persecucion ethelfridus hyd hym redwaldus kyng eestangles assenting edwinus deth manace yeftes ethelfredus one edwinus frendes war therof warned edwinus peryll promysed wold brynge hym syker place yf wolde go hym· withseyde though wold fyrst sholde breke trewes acorde made bytwene kyng thenne sate al one grete thought one come hym knewe axyd hym sate al one sorowful sayde wote thou art thou art sory thy drede thēne yf ony man slowe thin enemyes brought thy kyngdom also yf shewde best counseyll sauacion better ony thy forfaders euer herde woldest thou assente doo rede counseyl yes truly sayd yromyse leyd honde edwinus heede sayde whanne token cometh haue mynde tyme speche doo thou promysed· whanne sayd vanysshed awaye ¶ forsayd frende come hym warned hym kynges wylle torned hym gadred hooste atte laste· mette ethelfridus countreyes mercia eeste water idle slough hym ryght ¶ made edwinus kynge bothe kyngdomes northumberlonde· deyra brenicia edwinus regned xvij yere whan ethelfridus sone oswald twelue yere old oswyns four yere old sleyght theyr wardeyns lad scotland pope hete deus dedit ·v boneface pope fyue yere ¶seynt anastasius monke marter born perce childhode lerned fader wytchecrafte nygromancye resseyued feyth cryst crysten men prysoners forsoke perce passed calcidonia iherapolis come ierusalem· crystned· four myle oute cyte abbay callyd seynt anastasius abbay· lyued rule seuen yere cam cesarea palestina bydde bede take prisoner ano lad perce long boū den beten sente cosdra kynge perce putte deth one vexed fende deliuerd vertue kyrtel whan clothed alle heraclius cesar ouercome perses brought anastasius body rome· leyde seint paules mynystre ad aquas· laurence archebisshop caunterbury deyde mellitus bisshop london archebisshop fyue yere thenne ced seynt chaddes broder bisshop london· bonefacius honorius pope xij yere yere raclius ouercome perces slowe cosdras brought ageyn crosse connynge astronomer knewe sterres circumcided men shold destroye royamme sente kyng ffraunce shold driue alle iewes royamme make hem resseyue baptemme soo done· afterward bigonne grete warre batayl bytwene romaynes saracenes heraclius brought holy crosse oute ierusalem constantinople grete dele crosse sent lowys kynge ffraunce yere lord thousand two honderd seuen fourty dagobertus nynth kynge ffraunce regned fader lotharius thre thyrtty yere whan mellitus archebisshoppe caunterbury deede· thenne iustus bisshop rochestre archebisshop made one romanus bisshop rochestre hym stede ffor iustus sent paulinus thyrdde bisshop rochestre men northumber lond bisshop york wedde edelberga edbaldes suster kynge edwinus conuerte peple ¶ henricus libro secundo w • de libro primo ¶ capitulum duodecimum yere penda paganus tenth woden sone wybba bygan regne whan fyfty yere olde regned mercia xxx yere r som cronykes saye cryda kyn woldes sonne tenth woden fyrst regned mercia regned ten yere hym sone wibba regned twenty yere wybba kennisman ceorlus regned ten yere pen • wibbas sonne regned thyrtty yere slough two kynges n • oth • ̄berlond edwyn oswald thre kynges eest angle sigebertus egritus anna also quene wyf bare hym fyue sone wedda wulferus etheldredus merwaldus merce • linus two doughters seynt kyneburgh seynt kyneswyd beda libro 2 capitulo 9 yere esterday cam ryal cy •• besyde water dorwēt one eumerus swerd man swerd venymed sente fro quichelinus kynge westsaxon slee kyng edwinus one lylla kynges trusty seruaūt none sheld· put owne body ayenst stroke smyten thurgh body kyng woūded stroke swerde man smeton thurgh swerdes euery syde slowe another knyght cursed swerde also ester nyght quene doughter hete enfleda kyng gaf god made paulinus halowe token couenaunt wold fulfylle • este crysten man yf vyctorye kyng weste saxon thenne whitesonday mayde crystned th • kyng tho fyrst vnneth hole wounde gadryd hoost ouercome kynge westsaxons though kynge edwinus forsoke mawmetrye wold gladly paulinus yet auysed hym long tyme counseil best maner doyng also tyme resseyued lettres pope bonefacius sente hym comforted hym feyth resseyued sherte som therof wroughte gold another letter tenour sente quene mirrour siluer combe yuorye somdele ouergylt ¶ paulinus sawe kynge harde conuerte made prayer god lerned inspiracion tokene somtyme shewed kynge· whyle exyled redwaldu • thenne day paulinus leyde hond vpon kynges hede axyd yf knewe token token knowen paulinus sayde lo thou hast ouercome thyn enemy • wonne thy kyngdom thenne doo thou hast promysed trewe hym hath holpen the· thenne kyn • e toke counseyll lordes crystned yorke many yere regne enleuē • thēne caysy fyrst bisshops soke maumetrye ayenst vsage theyr fals holynes armed h • leepe noble hors destroyed templ • maumettes leeful bisshop mysbyleuyd men armed ne ryde mar • tyme forward vnto sleyn • kynge • dwynus paulinus baptised c • ntinuelly • x yere prouynces deyra brenicia ryuers gleny swala· prech • prouynce lyndeseye bylded chirche stone lyndecoln lyncoln afterward ch • rche whan iustus tharchebisshop dede paulinus sacred honorius archbisshop dorobernia caunt • rbury stede suche auctorite pope honorius· yf tharc • bisshop caunterbury yorke dede alyue h • th power sacre another bisshop stede dede· beda libro secundo ca ·16· thenne ther grete pee edwinus kyngd • woman might go one toun • ther without ony gr • ef anoyng· also fo • refresshyng weyg • e • clere well • hye weyes kyng made arere postes honge theron shelles cuppes br • s· noman durste take thylke cuppes vse fyrst man wan ylond eubon • man r • dwaldus • e corpwaldus kynge est angle comfort edwynus receyu • fey • h holy chirch mē slam long one rigbertus mysbyleuid man beda li 2 ca 17 yere pope honorius sent p • l honorius archebisshop caun •• rbury l • • re enformed manere ordeyn • nge arch • bisshops brytayne also sente lettres scottes holdynge esterday charged sholde trowe fewe thende worlde sholde connynge c • ysten men ben nowe old tyme ¶ beda libro secundo capitulo visesimo yere penda kynge mercia cedwalla kynge brytons slough kynge edwynus feld hattefelde two kynges penda cedwalla cruel prouynce spared neyther man ne woman ne yonge ne olde neyther relygion yet vnto tyme brytons acounte feyth relygion angle nought tyme myschyef paulinus archibisshop york toke quene doughter canfleda went water way kent chirch rochestre tho voyde deth romanus bisshop tho adreint paulinus made bysshop rochestre bisshop xix yere· de • lefte pal ¶willelmus de pont libro primo soo chirche men northumberlond withoute bisshoprich paulinus deth xxx· yere withoute vse pal vj score yere v beda li·3· ca· 1 whan edwinus ded osiricus kynge deira· osiricus elfricus sone elfricus edwinus came ethelfridus caufricus sone king brenicia anon kynges tourned manmetrie cedwalla slowe hem one yere one goddes rightful wreche· therfor plesed hem acompted tyme drawe mynde mysbylened kynges thilk vngracioꝰ yere shold acompted vnto regne oswald regned afterward· sleynge broder caufridus litel hoost slough forsayd cedwalla come ayenst wonder huge hooste place hete denisseburn called denisus lake also place oswald kneled rered crosse praide god sauacion men fore batayl place hete heuen felde place grete worship w de ro li • ¶ place northside famous wal legyon rome bilded thwert ouer ylonde f • r fro chirche bagustald beda li 3 ca 1 spones crosse many vertues wondres fore tyme chirch auter brenicia til kyng oswaldus reysed crosse batail ther bilded chirch beda li 3 capitulo 2 king oswald axed scottes graūted bisshop aidanus sholde come teche people thenne kynge yaue hym place bisshops see ylond lyndefar men myght see wonder· bisshop prechid scottisshe kynge told forth englyssh people saye meene· thenne al daye cam scottissh monkes preche angle oute aydanus abbaye ylond hij beda li 3 capitulo quarto aidanus mirrour abstinence fasted euery daye vnto none lyued none wise taughte al yeuen hym yaf gladly poure men yede fete rode none horse· prechyd walkyng vp doune spared • lle defautes ryche men reuerence ne drede yaf mony mete· yf bad wold yeue raunsoned prisonners oute prison made hem disciple ful ofte occasiō coming englond fore honde sente sterne man englond atte prayer kynge oswald teche peple dyde lytel prouffyt torned home ayene owne trauayled yole thenne scottes treted amonge sende another man englond men saye hym soo comen ageyne scotland aidanus spak manere brother semeth thou harder thou sholdest men ben rude vnconnynge· thou yaf begynnyng mylke good loore thappostle techeth whan ben esely brought lytel lytel thēne ben able vnderstande parfyght loore thēne whan herd aidanus sente discrete man wyse word ensample oswald hope kyngd • heuen also greter erthely kyngedome alle nacions brytayne deled four langages brytons p • ctes scottes angle toke hym theyr lord kyng ¶also sayd esterday aydanus sate hym mete grete multitude poure men come kynges gate axyd haue kynges almes kynge elles atte honde yeue hem· toke messe sette fore hym dysshe siluer brake al pyeces sente pour men bisshop sawe toke kynge ryght honde sayde pray god hond wex neuer old soo happed ffor afterward whan oswald slayne arme cut bodye dured hoole sound atte ryal cyte bebbanburgh beda libro tercio capitulo 8 ¶ sayd vsed ofte bydde bede make prayer thanke god almyghty alwey euer sate wolde stretche hondes holde hem gyders leue knee therfore yet bysawe god haue mercy soules sayd oswaldus fyll grounde· ¶ also yere ordeyned bisshops audoenus rotomagis • ligius abbott gallus disciple columbanus thenne floures almayne ¶ capitulum 13 seynt birinus confessour sente honorius pope preche englysshmen birinus sayled see brytayne bythought restellys foryete hauen yede vpon see fette restellys beda libro tercio capitulo sexto birinus conuerted kyngilsus kynge westsaxons cristned atte cyte dortyk dorchestre kynge oswald presente kyngilsus godfader wedded doughter afterward bothe kynges gaf cyte ordeyne bisshops see ther birinus deyde fourtenth yere b • sshoprich buryed there· atte laste hedda bisshop wynchestre birinus translated wynchestre chirche seynt peter paule ¶r chanons dorchestre saye naye saye another body seynt birinus body translated ¶therfor byere wonder werck yet seen dorchestre aboue place fyrst graue cyte dortyk dorkynga callyd dorchestre seuen myle south oxenford sette bytwene twey ryuers tame temse also founden cronykis kynge kyngilsus assigned al londe seuen myle aboute make bisshopis see wynchestre sustenaunce ministres kynge let • e deth euil myght fulfil hit swore sone kenwalcus shold fulfylle afterward ¶willelmus de pon libro secundo ¶this cyte dorchestre longed bisshops mercia fro tyme vnto comynge norman wiliam conquerours tyme bisshops see chaunged lyncolyn ¶willelmus de pon libro primo ¶ yere felyx n • cion burgoyn ben ho • ely sigebertus kynge • st angle exyled fraunce come hym englond made bisshop f •• st wyck· bisshop xv • yere ¶beda libro tercio capitulo 17 ¶this sigebertus hadde kyngdome broder corpwaldus ordeyned scoles lettrure kyngdom hadde seen fraunce assigned petagoges maystres child maner caunterbury men atte last bytoke kyngdome neuewe egritus shore monke abbaye hym self bylded ¶ afterward kynge penda paganus warryd kyngdome sigebertus drawe oute abbay strength knyghtes soo slayne • mplenes bare rodde honde al hoost neigh slayne regned anna enus sonne penda slough hym segebertus regned holy man hete fur • u come oute yrlond prouynce eest angle way conuerted many men made hem stedfaste feyth tyme seke warned vision angel shold besyly hadde bygonne besyly wake make praiers thenne helpe kynge bylded abbaye see castel hete cimbrisburgh wexe seke agayne rauyshed oute body spirituelly vnto syght holy angeles herd sowne verse sawter holy mē shal goo forth fro vertue vertue god goddes shal • en syon also spyryte cam body agayn take away agayn thyrdde day sawe greete ioye holy seyntes also grettest stryf euil spyrites whiche purposed lette holy men thenne lefte hye sawe vnder hym four fyres ayer angel ladde hym expowned hym fyres manere sayde fyres shall destroye world· fyrst fyre fyre lesynge men doo promysed theyr baptemme second fire couetise whan ryches loued god almyghty thyrdde fyre discorde stryf whan men greuen neyghbours withoute cause· fourth fire wyckednes whan gretter myghtyer dredeth vndoo destroye lasse • febler fyres semed gadred al one ¶thenne furseus soore agast cryed angel sayd hym thou hast sette fyre shall brenne shall examine serche mennes dedes· thenne furseus cam yate open fendes threwe man termented fyre therwith furseus sholder cheke brente anone furseus knewe man knewe hadde resseyued cloth whan deyde angel lad furseus threwe cloth fyre fende sayde throwe away whiche thou hast fore hond approuyd thou hast receiued goodes synful men thou shalt partener theyr paynes naye sayd angel receyued couetyse sauacion soule thenne fyre ceced angel sayde furseus thou hast sette fyre hath brente thēne furseus brought body agayn marke tokene felt soule bare alwey seen sholder cheke afterward ofte furseus tolde tale though right thynne clothed myddel colde wynter shold swete drede ¶atte laste furseus lefte abbaye broder fullanus wente another broder vulcanꝰ lyued heremytes lyf al one yere thenne prouynce anone destroyed rennyng reyses straungers sayled fraunce deyde many grete dedes vertue buryed perma ¶after honorius seuerinus pope one yere· tyme iewes conuertyd torned crysten feyth ¶heraclius themperour noble vyctoryes erryd oute feyth coūseil cirus patriarke allexandria sergius patriarke constantinople eraclius deyde droposye shende heresye iacobytes mysunderstode seynt iame thappostle ¶capitulum 14 aboute tyme lyued machamet fals prophete duke leder sarasyns turkes· story brought maner steuen caunterbury girald cambria helpen moche mater somtyme thempyre rome grete myght strengthe crystendome nyghe wydder thempyre rome grete myght wonder crystendom soo encreced conteyned europa many prouynces asia wel nygh al affryca within merkes boundes atte laste • scorde stryf crysten men bytwene hem self agarenes wexe stronge agarenes haue thre name ben called agarenes ismalytes saracenes empyre prophecyed methodius martir sayde crysten relygyon shold • aue lytell withoute thendes europa ¶ also errour sarasyns infecte al affryca hit defouled also grete dele spayne goddes grace mercy holpen wolde haue infecte shente al ffraunce spayne ¶thenne grete gregoryes tyme empyre rome stretched somtyme th • ccean brytayne vnto endes perse soo destroyed tyrauntrye ciuile bataylles power defende self ayenst enemyes thenne cruel paynym hoost perce bygan occupye many prouynces lordship rome men crysten feyth est landes thenne th • grete flye foloweth trace malshawe soo oth • r woo cometh pestylence ismalytes greuous destroyed neygh crysten men lefte eest londes ledyng prince machomete heraclius themperours tyme thenne fyfth bonefas tyme heraclius regnede aboute yere lord six honderd twenty machamete fals prophete witche begyled ysmalytes agarenes maner famous clerk atte court rome myght spede atte wylle p • ssed see plesed many men hem assente amonge whiche promysed machomete wold make hym prynce h • peple yf wolde doo sayde thenne clerke fedde vp douue made hym fe • che mete machome • ere put co • ne douue sholde ete douue wold ofte fede hym self thenne day clerke gadred peple geder promysed wold make hym theyr prynce holy goost wold shewe lykenes douue lete anone douue flee douue wonte sate vpon machomets sholderes put bylle machamets ere therfore machamet chosen prynce leder peple sayd comyn tale· foloweth alowed approu • d· monke hete sergius put oute company monkes amonge falle nestorius errour· cam arabia put hym self machomete enformed hym though radde sergius archedeken antiochia patriarke ierusalem· thenne machomet faderles moderles emes kepynge childhode worshiped maumetrye somwhat tyme countrey men arabia yaue self specially worshipe venus therfore yet saraseyns holden fryday holy iewes saterday sonday ¶ machomet come age sharpe wytte wente many londes cause marchandyse ofte company iewes crysten men lerned maners· vsages custommes lawes crysten men iewes couth wytchecraft nygromancy wonder felle man fer castynge noble faconde fayr speche th • nne come lady prouynte corozonia lady hete cadygan somme spyces brought wytchecraft fayr wordes made lady madde nyse worshiped grettest prophete god almyghty· messias thāt iewes abyden desyred hym husbond vsage prouynce ruled also womē thenne wedded wedewe quene soo made lord prouynce thenne drewe hym arabes occupyed est empyre vnto allexandria ayenst heraclius themperour thenne toke maner spekynge trewe prophetes though god spoke hym spake maner bookes made oure lord spak prophete sayde bookes feyned gylefully shold byleuyd though made auctoryte god almyghty thenne owne men also men fer londes fylle hym bowed euery syde hadde grete lykynge haue gretter lordship brynge men good maner lyuyng commaundement god almyghty assoylled nacions dwellyd nygh hym dyde craft gyle myght doo dedes armes ¶therfor whan egypte libia arabia siria subgett cause wold seme holy· drewe peple subget fals lawe made hem forsake vsages lawes theyr fornfaders forbadde paynems maumetrye graunted circumsicion iewes vsed· feyned owne self somme newe lawes alleged wytnes eyther testament sarasyns calle lawe lawe yet vnto tyme ¶and bade sarasyns circumcide hem iewes forbad hem wolde folowe hym etyng swynyssh flessh machomet wold telle cause forbade swynyssh flessh sayde swyne come camel dirt no flood therfor clene men shold eschewe mete vnclene ¶and acorde crysten men manere crystnynge ordeyned ofte wasshing lymmes water clensing synnes brynge people soo begyled faster snarle knewe mooste playsanut mannes lykyng ordeyned lawe ordeyned man shold haue many wyues concubynes myght sustene catel also man myght haue wyues oun kynrede vnto nombre four man myght four sithes forsake wyf take agayne also myghte haue many concubynes wolde wymmen bought prisoners· also myght selle hem yf brought ony hem childeand ordeyned hem vse sobrenes mete drynk forbad hym drynkyng wyn certayne solempne dayes yere· wolde somdele varye fro iewes worshiped god westward fro crysten men worshiped god eestward taughte peple worshipe god south warde ofte knelynges· south plente light ordeyned hem worshipe goddesse venus holde day therof solempne • holy friday bade worshipe one almyghty god creatour maker alle thynges sayde moyses iohan prophetes cryst gretter grettest prophetes born mayde marie vertu god withoute mannes seede sayth booke hete alkaron netheles medled somme fals sawes soth sawes sayde criste afterwarde born vp heuen slayne· sayth iudas traytour sought cryste denne chaunged lykenes cryst soo take nayled cro stede crist ¶also bade men lawe sholde euery yere yf myght goo goddes hows matha bydde bede whan comen thyder sholde ben clothed one maner clothynge sholde throwe oute stone thurgh hooles walles· stone deuyl sayde abraham made hows childeren ismaelytes sholde bydde theyr bede also machomets lawe • e take woman spousebreche sholde stoned deth yf dede fornicacion sengle woman sholde haue four score lasshes theef fyrste tyme seconde tyme sholde beete· thyrdde tyme sholde lese hondes fou • th tyme shold lese foot seyth holdeth al heestes lawe god almyghty promysed paradys orcharde plesyre lykynge distemprure ne payne ony maner gryef al maner welthe lykynge lykyng mete ete clothes maydens tembrace fayre shal serue angel ben grete soo huge one eye space day iourneye· holde ne kepe lawe· promyseth hem fyre payne helle withoute ende also booke called alcoranum prayseth alle faders tholde testament specially moyses iohan baptist· cryste machomete also ther preyseth alle byleue god doo rightwysenes red ryght feyth ne men ben ryght byleue ne men ben mysbyleue also wreton fyue bookes come fro heuen informacion mankynde sawter moyses bookes bookes prophetes machometes alcaron alcoron wreton god almyghty wolde rule lede mankynde way sauacion· abraham yaue childeren israel lawe whiche lawe shold knowe god worshipe hym ¶ told lawe god gaf gospel men also mysused lawe arabes cam abraham ysmael mo men gretter peple iewes come abraham isaac arabes lefte lefte withoute lawe therfore oute consistorye goddes rightwysenes come decree prophete owne peple sholde sente ysmaelytes lawe prophete lawe sarasyns shold folowe iewes folowed moyses· crysten men cryst therfore sarasyns holde self better iewes crysten men holde holy theyr lawe iewes crysten men ofte trespacen ayenst theyr owne lawe bringe aboute machomet norysshed fedde fayr camel pryue place camel mete honde machomet wayted tyme henge cursed book alcaron aboute camel necke book forsayd lawes wreton machomet lete go forsayd camel feldes book aboute fore day lyght thenne camell wonder bygan lepe sterte made grete ioye large fled euery man wold come nyghe mannes hondespeche wonder sprange feldes townes peple gadred thyder oute euery syde whan machomete comen beest sawe hym fer yaf hym alweye mete ran hym anon right· bowed hym lykked hondes taught thenne peple cryed sayde dede shewed holynes goddes prophete prayde wolde vndoo booke holy hondes whan book opened lo sayth machomet lawe wreton mannes ynke angel hondes sente fro heuen bolden euer withoute ony ende book ye ben taught ye shal worshipe god greete mede ye shal hope resseyue hym kepynge lawe daye euery yere made solempne hooly called fest camel faste moneth fore feste maner euery day moneth fro fyrst lyght day whan men maye knowe bitwene whyte blac vnto goyng doū sonne fast ete ne drynke ne delen theyr wyues ben alwey prayer goynge doune sonne vnto dawynge agayne ete drynke lye theyr wyues seke men feble ben holden faste machomet displesyd ofte wyf hadde fallynge euyll euyll fyll ofte grounde plesyd r • sseyued lawe maner sayd fyll groūd wordes seint mychel tharchangel spak hym ofte flesshliman sayde may suffre angel wordes yf falle hated wyn dronkenes rybawdrye harlottrye cause heete countrey wolde haue spared· nyght dronke fylle doune streete· swyn ete reputed vnclene beestes therfor holde lawes spare wyn swynes flessh fyrst poynt semeth folowe iewes seconde poynt semeth folowe philosophye theyr mayster also deth machomet cursed secte encreced faste caused myghty men perce drawe cursed lawe arabes ¶ also secte hath infecte vnto tyme al affrica grete dele spain gernarde tharchebisshop turpinus tellith machometes ymage latone made owne hondes stondeth see stronde hath face toward south ¶in ymage machometus wytchecraft closed legyon fendes crystē man cometh lyghtly perysshed sarasyn goth alwey hoole sound byrde cometh dyeth anone ymage holdeth mace right honde mace shal fyrst fallen whan kynge shal born gallia shal renewe al spayne crysten lawes whan mace shal falle thē ne sarasyns shall flee ānd leue theyr tresorye famous norye cursed secte saladinus duc turkes stronge hamer crysten men yere lord enleuen honderd four score ten herde crysten men vsed many mess mete one mele sayde cristen men worthy haue holy londe also felle slyhe prayse owne secte· blame despyse lawe knowen ensample ¶on tyme two whyte monkes brought fore theues turkes take knewe straunge clothynge philosophres crysten men axyd one knewe langages hem condicion profession sayde monkes theyr profession seynt benettes rule thenne axyd besyly many poyntes rule specially amonge axed yf sholde rule ete flessh drynke wyn thenne answerd sayde hadde al tyme somwhat wyn drynke flessh shold none ete sekenes grete nede thē ne tyraunt badde shold haue large kepynge haue two yong fayr wymmen serue hem badde shold ete flessh drynke water ete flesshe dronke water· toke ensample seynt iob made couenaunt theyr eyen wold thynke fylthe synne alwey besy theyr prayer thenne saladynus waar therof toke hem flesshe water bad hem serue fysshe wyn badde doo entent salamon moeueth sayth yeue ye wyn hem ben grete sorow may drynke foryete theyr sorowe nede whan thus done caste begyle symplenes two monkes wold yf myghte ther bysette chalenge blame vpon relygion thenne monkes dronke wyn wexe mery glad forgate sholde haue mynde fylle laye wommen ¶ thennne morowe whanne wyn defyed· thoughte theyr trespaas gan wepe ful soore tiraunt sawe hem wepe sayde ye soory ye wonte haue sinned greuously sayde ouercome wyn· thenne sayde ye ete flesshe dranke water ye helde forth purpose redyly ynowgh whan ye ouercome wyn without flessh ye brake rule purpose therfore knowen benett auctour rule vnwyse forbede etyng flesshe distourbled mannes wytte graunted drynke wyn roteth vp strengthe reson ye haue assayed newe assaye thenne made lawe machomet forbad v wyne distourbeth mannes wytte graū ted v vse flessh wyser benet· remedyes clensyng synne nowe ye haue broken rule purpose penaunce seyd satisfaction ordenaunce • elder fader thenne sayd mowe ye clensed amonge v goo ye youre owne clensed owne maner wyse soo lete hem go man ful olde pestylence sleyght wyles wyly shrewe myghte haue saueour in· gan despyse wolde blame hooly man seynt benet whiche seynt benet grete gregory sayth wrote rule monkes ful wytte wysedome open clere wordes wyse dede withdrawe fro hem go holy chyualrye lykynge mete withdraweth soule holynes dedes thoughtes thappostles lore graunted hem lytel wyn strengthe somwhat feblenesse flessh graunted hem lytel sholde greue sharpnes soule ¶ capitulum 15 heraclonas heraclius sone regned two yere senatour rome put wif martina kingdom moders nose tong cut al aft er ·iiij iohn theodorꝰ pope vj yere time ysodre bisshop yspalencis floures somtyme grete gregory disciple ysid left hym many good bokes made bookes ethimologiarū de sūmo bono de ordine creaturarū simonia many bokes· edwaldus kyng kente deyde left sone eyre ercombertus bygoten emma woman fraūce ercombertus r • gned four xx yere kente· destroyed temple maumetrye ordeyned fastynge lente shold holden englond wyf sexburga doughter ānna kynge eest angle gate doughter eukengoda made menchone thabbay bryggense gallia aunt etherberga seruyd god abbaye ethel berga ben edwinus wyf ¶ also ther afterward eyther hem abbesse▪ tyme though ther many abbayes englond yet englysshmen vsed goo abbayes fraunce bycause conuersacion maner lyuynge specially brydges calays andilegium tyme andomarus bisshop bertinus thabbot floures countrey toreuence gallia fraunce ¶ paulus libro quinto thyrdde constantinus heraclius sonne heraclius broder regned eyght twenty yere begyled paulus grauntsir sergius therfore exiled pope martin spoylled rome ¶willelmus de regibus libro quarto vnconerd chirche roo • e steples coueryd slattes bra toke away tho slattes lost hem siracusa scicilia slain bath sarasyns ladde awey partye alexandria beda libro tercio ca sexto yere kygylsus kynge westsaxons dede sonne kyn walcus regned hym one thyrity yere· elder broder quichelinus regned fore fader lefte sone cuthredus crystned also byrinus r ¶here take heede beda william varyen beda sayth quychelinus kyngilsus sonne· wiliam seyth kingilsus broder beda v su kinwalcus begynnyng kingdom wolde resseyue feyth crystendom therfor rightfully lost kingdō dyde awey wyf kyng pendaes suster wedded another ther penda v yere kyngdom chaced hym drof hym away· w de pon li 2 hidde self iij yere annā king eestangles therfor afterward penda slough anna· mene tyme exylynge kenwalcus baptised felix bisshop anna recoueryd kyngdom helpe anna made one agilbertus bisshop prouynce ffcensshe man come oute irlond bisshop wynchestre westsaxon fyften yere kynge straunge tonge agreued noyeful somme cause wroth note brought another bisshop langage tonge callyd wyn name ordeyned fraunce bytoke prouynce deled two parysshes sett chyef bisshops see therfore agilbertus wrothe wente fraunce afterwarde bisshop parys· longe wyn two yere prelacye putte oute kynge boughte see london kynge mercia wolferus helde alyne soo prouynce westsaxons four yere bisshoples ¶ atte last kyng ken walcus ofte • arde bysette enemyes sente agilbertus putte oute wolde myght come sente neuewe lentherius st • de whiche confermed archebisshop theodorus bisshop seuen yere ¶ willelmus de regibus libro primo ¶ kinwalcus ouercome brytons twyes fyrst wyght gosneburgh efte atte hille pente wreche faders persecucion bynam wolferus pendas sonne grete dele kingdom beda libro tercio capitulo secundo ¶ yere kynge oswald kyng northumberlond slayne paynym kynge penda place height meserfeld god ofte sheweth myracles wondres penda bad honge armes hede stockes willelmus de pontificibus libro primo one yere broder oswy kynge hym come thyder buryed hede chirche yerd lyndeff ar sayd heede durham bytwene seynt cutbertes armes putte oswaldes armes cite bebanburgh ostryda quene mercia oswyes doughter etheldredus wyf brought body dele boo ne abbaye bardeny myght receyued er pyler lyght shyne vpon thylke relyquyes al nyght many yere men straunge nacion dane werred londe· elfleda lady mercia brought thylke bone gloucetre achirche chanons willelmus de pon libro quarto ¶ seynt oswaldes arme thabbaye petreburgh hoole sounde flesshe synewes men seyn hit theefly stolen oute olde restyng place brought thyder shryne precious riche bileue herof somdele doubtable men aspye see therof· say doubte haue holynes seynt for· keepe hastely afferme whether place paulus libro quinto aboute tyme cesara kynges wyf perce come fewe crysten men constantinople crystned husbonde herde therof sente messagers constantinople axe wyf themperour· cesara answerd sayde telle ye lord kynge yf wyll resseyue feyth byleue god shal neuer haue wyf▪ kynge herde therof come wth sixty thousand men pee themperour crystned al grete worship many grete yeftes toke wyf wente home ageyne beda libro tercio capitulo 13 ¶ whan oswald slayn hym broder oswy kyng northumberlond regned nobly deyra ¶ oswinus osricus sonne edwinus bloode stedfast man holy meke mylde fayr spech kyng oswy made hym slayn erle hunbaldus hous oswynus fledde erle hunbaldus helpe socoure oswy hadde felawe kyngdome deyra od • lwaldus oswaldes sone theodorus fyrste martin pope six yere ¶ aswerde man climpus wolde haue slayne hym awter songe mosse began smyte anone worde blynde· ¶ emperour constantinople exyled pope dampned paulus patriarke constantinople falsely name beda li· tercio ca· 13 yere deyde paulinus thenne bisshop rouchestre somtyme archebisshop york hym thamar bisshop also felyx deyde fyrste bisshop eest angle thomas bisshop hym beda li 3 ca 12 aboute tyme eest saxon toke feyth fore honde cast away forsake oswinus kyng northumberlonde made hem resseyue take feyth king sigebertus was· crystned finanus bisshop northumberlond fast long wal departed somtyme bytwene brytons scottes thenne toke one cedde preest broder chad oute prouynce mercia preche men eeste ¶and whanne hadde done dede tourned ayen forsayd finianus made bisshop hym wen • e agayne preche eest angle place hete straūchestre brynk water pent also toun tilleburgh fast temse· befel tyme coū trey forsayde bisshop ced cursed erle· excomyned helde woman vnlauful wedlok kynge sygebertus despysed bisshopes heste cam erles prayer ete erle hows whan kynge wente fro mete bisshop ced mette kynge touchyd hym rodde bare honde· seyde kynge maner thou woldest heest withdrawe holde lost cursed mannes hows hous thou shalt deye befell erle broder slough kyng hows· afterward whan men axed hem hadde doo cursed dede answerde ellys sayde kynge esy enemyes wold lyghtly foryeue wronges trespaces ¶ treuisa soth cursed men hate good men good dedes soo cursed erle slowe kynge gracious good ¶ thenne foloweth story also yere kynge oswy hade slee kynge oswynus erle hunbaldus hows oswinus • adde lefte hoost fledde grete truste erle hunbaldus wereto abyde better tyme fyghte· sayd oswinus somtyme yeuen beste hors aydanus bisshop vsed goo afote ryde horsbak soone afterward poure man prayde bisshop almesse bysshop yaue hors hadde nought ellys honde· whan tolde kynge kynge anone wroth sayde aydanus sate hym mete hast thou sere bisshop hadde nothyng lasse pry myghte suffyce almes dede spekest thou lord sere kynge seyd bisshop shal ā mare sone leuer v marye sonne anone kynge fylle doune bisshops feete prayde hym mercy foryefnes promysed hym truly wolde neuer tyme speke euill dede thenne kynge bisshops bothe wel plesed sate gyder atte mete bisshop bygan sodenly wepe many teres· thenne axyd hym cause wepyng answerde sayd kynge shal longe v alyue· vnnethe haue seen ony kynge meke fore tyme euyl̄ people worthy haue suche kynge longe tyme ¶ thenne happed soone kynge slayne sayd ¶and bisshoppe aydanus lyued twelue dayes seynt cuthbert sawe angeles bere soule heuen r ¶ also yere deyde birinus fyrst bisshop dorchestre fourtenth yere comyng bisshopriche beda sayth hedda bisshop wynchestre translated birinus body oute dorchestre wynchestre· loke therof fyrst book de pontificibus west saxon beda libro tercio ca 23 ¶after martin eugenius pope thre yere yere kynge deyra odyle waldus oswaldes sone yaue ced bisshop eest cam ofte north place high hilles hete lestyngay bylde abbay· ced er wolde foūde abbay faste al lente euery day sauf sonday al day til▪ eu • ̄ thenne wolde ete lytel brede one hen egge lytel mylk medled water aydanus disciple vsid lerned taugh • broder chimbillus gouerned place buryed pestylence tyme cedda ruled place ¶ capitulum 16 eugenius vitalianus pope fourten yere sent chirches englonde archebisshops theodorus monke tarseus beda li 3 ca 19 yere merces myddel englond receyued cristēdom vnder prince weda pendas sone· weda consente fader wedded elfleda kyng oswyes doughter vpon condicion shold crysten man dyde better wyll elfridus oswyes sonne wedded oswyes suster kyneburga ther fore weda brought hym four preestes oute northumberlond preche hys peple men prestes ced adda becti duina kyng penda forbad conuerte cristen feyth wold also yere deyde honorius archibisshop caūterbury one yere· one deus dedit bisshop ix yere comfermed ithamar bisshop rouchestre w de pou li 3 ¶ yere benet bisshop abbot norysshed beda preest kynge oswyes seruaunt forsooke hows home cosyns alle kyn cristes loue toke weye rome come efte agayne fyne sythes wente rome broughte bookes relyquyes holy sayntes home abbayes brynk ryuer wyre fyrst brought glasyers crafte coūtrey buylded two abbayes peter paule vpon brynkes ryuer wyre one one syde another syde forn ayenst abbot bothe toke noble noryebeda childe seuen yere olde taught hym alyue willelmus de regibus libro primo ¶ beda wondr • th pacyence wytte wytte brought many bookes craftes men englond· ¶and pylgrym wel nygh al lyf tyme hym loue countrey lykynge fayrenes ouercome strong trauayls· wondryd pacyence made abbot kynge kente possession thabbay seynt austyn caunterbury comynge adryan lefte good wyll lete adryan abbot also thabbayes wyre made hem another abbot absente suffred good wylle dyde obedyence newe abbot whan come home worshipe men dyde· also atte last smyten pal • sye made thyrdde abbot therto ¶ also yere penda kynge mercia slough anna kynge • est angle bataylle hadde fauoured kyng kenwalkus ayenst hym ¶ also yere botulphus bylded abbaye eest lyncol̄n place hete icanno ¶beda libro tercio capitulo quarto ¶that yere deyde penda kynge mercia slayne thyrtty capytayns come countrey northumberlonde slee kynge oswy slayne broder oswald somtyme spared lye affynyte bytwene theyr sonnes doughters netheles kyng oswy prefered hym many grete yeftes restorne oute londe wolde ther ¶thenne oswy sayde yf paynym resseyue yeftes· thenne shal profere offre hym thenne kynge oswy made auowe yf hadde vyctory bataylle wold offre doughter elfleda god heuen also possession bylde twelue abbayes thenne bataylle made countrey lede fer york faste ryuer wynwed· thēne hugely arysen ouerflowed grete deele countrey batayll penda slayne thyrtty duke leders yet thryes soo many hoost escaped swerd drowned ryuer thenne alfridus hadde fader· egfridus holden hostage pendas wif thenne odyle wald oswaldes sonne penda stode syde see ende batayl sholde haue whan vyctory kynge oswy bytoke doughter thre yere old loore hilda thabbesse hertesye hertes ylond afterward abbesse stremshalt bosome lappe corne nowe callyd whitby thyrtty myle york elfleda abbesse afterward thenne oswy yaf possession buylde abbayes hadde promysed six prouynce deyra six prouynce brenicia· yaue weda wedded doughter kyngdom southmercia conteyneth sayd fyue thousandes housholdes meynees departed fro north mercia water trent weda thre yere kyngdom soone lost treason owne wif whan weda dede mercyes wexe rebelle ayenst kynge oswy toke wolferus pendas sonne hadde secretely kepte made hem theyr kyng fyrst cristen man al kinges mercia wedded • rmenylda ercombes doughter kyng caunterbury gate keneredus wereburga ouercome nobly ken walcus kinge westsaxons wan ile wighte yaue afterward kinge ceste angle cristen man godfader whan cristned atte last seuententh yere kingdome buryed lychefeld ¶ clodonens fader dagobertus regned fraū ce sixten yere entysyng deuil made cutte seint denis arme ¶also yere deide seint wandregesilus thabbot· ¶ aboute tyme grimaldus kynge longobardes espyed knight bertaricus fledde cacanus kynge anares sente kyng cacanus word saide shold leue bertaricus shold haue noo pee longobardes bertaricus herde therof wente ytaly agayne helpe frende hunulphus reconciled made one kynge somme wicked men sawe bertaricus hadde good semblaunt many men made suggestion kynge saide yf soo bertaricus slain kinge sholde lese kingdome kinge herde sette knightes men bisette bertaricus hows sholde escape· hunulphus aspied ded burthen bedclothes bertaricus necke bete fiste shufte put hym forth thurgh myddel cyte walles lefte hym bertaricus fled fraunce· whan men axyd hunulphus dyde soo answerd sayde cause seruaunt wolde haue bedded dronken bertaricus bedchambre whiche plesyd not· therfore haue made hym bere clothes agayne myn hows knyghtes begyled fonde nothynge bertaricus chambre toke bertaricus seruaunt wyste escapynge assentynge therto drough hym oute heer brought hym kyng seruaunt dampned deth yet kyng praysed hym hunulphus gretely cause stydfast trusty· yaue hem choys whether hem leuer abyde hym courte euermore wende theyr lyef frende bertaricus thenne wente fraunce bertaricus al hadde also yere egf • ydus kyng oswyes sonne spoused feynt etheldreda fore honde wedded erle todbar kyssyng clyppynge flesshely lykyng yet preserued clene vyrgyne departed egfrydus wente abbaye ely made abbesse dyde many fayr myracles grete ¶aboute tyme hunarus prince sarasyns siria buylded newe temple ierusalem sarasyns worshipe god make theyr prayer beda libro quarto capitulo primo ercombertus kynge caunterbury deyde sonne egbertus kynge hym nyne yere· also yere deyd tharchebisshop hete deus dedit thenne kynge kente kynge northumberlonde one assente sente wychardus pope vitalianus archibisshop caunterbury· almooste al company deyde grete pestylence soo stronge alle englond pope ordeined one theodorus monke gouernour chirches englond beda libro tercio capitulo visesimo primo ¶also yere fylle grete pestylence al brytayne byganne south contreyes pestylence byfyll rad egbertus monke wexe seke tyme man felt seke wente priuely oute bed matyn tyme contryte sorowful herte praid god besyly shold deye tyme er ful clensed synnes doo fore honde made auowe yf might escape pestilence wold deye pylgremage aboue ful seruice wolde saye euery daye sawter yf sekenes body letted hym· euery weeke wolde faste one daye nyght therto whan done wente priuely bedde ageyne somme maner rustlynge made lyyng doune· felawe awoke spak hym sayde egbert hast thou doone hoped tweyne sholde haue gone gyder reste thou hast prayd graunted thenne felawe deyde thus egbertus lengthed owne lyf yere four score ten· dyde fyrste auowe fasted yere thryes fourty dayes continuelly brede thynne mylk fourty dayes aduente· fourty dayes lente fourty dayes fore wytsontyde al creme fatnes mylke hadde brede sholde ouerblowe take away ¶ beda libro sexto capitulo visesimo quinto ¶ capitulum 17 aboute tyme deyde aydanus finanus bisshops northumberlonde colmannus scot come hem bisshop thre yere ¶ tyme come agilbertus bisshop westsaxons countreyes northumberlond ordeyned wylfrydus tho abbotte rypon made hym preest atte prayer kynge oswyns ¶ tyme greete question made meuyd eesterdaye tyme holden lawfully scottes brytons suffryd reuerēce colūba aidanus fimanus holy faders therfor counseyl made thabbay hilda one syde cam colmannus bisshop hylda thabbesse· alleggyd predecessours worthy men holy helde eester tyde fourtenth day mone vnto xx day mone· specially seint iohn euangelyst helde soo cestirtyde asia otherside ayenste hem cam egylbertus bisshoppe westsaxons iames somtyme paulinus preest archibisshop yorke wilfridus abbot rypon alfridus kinges sonne wilfridus disputed hem aledged hem maner vsage al hooly chirche grekes ytaly rome gallia fraunce shold sett fore maner customme vsage corner world knewe decree synodes wonder· namely seynt iohan euangelyst begynnyng holy chirche tho yong tendre helde thordenaunce moyses lawe many thynges folowed tho iewes wreton poule circumcided thymothe offred oostes temple share heede aqnyla priscilla corynthy profytable nothyng put sklaū dre iewes also seynt iohan vsage lawe byganne holde eester tyde fourtenth day first moneth rought whether fil saterday another day weke peter thappostle primate holy chirche hadde power bynde vnbynde abode four tēth day mone whan mone full seynt iohn dyde bygan holde eester tyde eue next sonday ful mone euenes day nyghte helde tyde one twenty day mone yf fourtenthday fyll sonday helde eester day sonday rather yere newe yere shold tho begynne kynge oswy herde sayde • ith ye telle many grete pryueleges power graunted seynt peter dar withsaye soo grete vssher porter lest close heuene yate ayenst whan sholde come heuene whan sayde multitude assented ced bisshop eeste presente helde hym corrected tyme forward colmannus tho bisshop northumberlond tho wroth wente thennes coūtrey scottes fynde eester tyme withoute fayle ther ben rewles ynowe ordynal kalendre nedeful sette errour holy chirche suffreth kalender vse encreced styntyng sonne euenes day night thentryng sonne signes ben passed backward twelue dayes kalender aboute yere lord thousand iij c twenty therfore kalender vse amended withdrawing dayes ben put lepe yere certayne tyme somme maner wyse yf tyme grace dure eyghten thousand yere· eesterday shall falle aboute shortest day al yere kalender yf sixthe age world dure two soo longe· feeste byrthe seynt iohan baptist shal falle shortest daye yere feeste byrthe lord lengest day yere ¶ cause errour declared tholomeus book almagestis tholomei treuisa ¶here take heede twyes yere falleth styntyng sonne soo doth euenees daye nyght callyd latyn equinoxium stynting winter sōne whan day shortest eke somer whan daye lengest euennes daye nyght one lente ageyne haruest tyme whan daye nyght ben lyche longe speke sonnes entringe signes ye shal vnderstande euery moneth one sonne passed oute one signe another speke moneth mone moneth mone chaunge chaunge pryme pryme also fyrst moneth mone heere callyd tyme mone whan ful whan day nyght ben lyche longe marche next suche tyme world fyrst made ¶willelmus de pontificibus libro tercio thenne colmannus bisshop northumberlond conuycte wylfridus mysholdynge esterday wroth wente scottes afore sayde wilfridus chosen archebisshop yorke procurynge alfridus kynges sonne sente fraunce sacred deus dedit tharchebisshop caunterbury dede sholde haue sacred hym englonde tyme kenwalcus kynge westsaxons deled prouynce two bisshopryches ¶ therfore egilbertus wroth wente ageyne fraūce born thinges sayd book· capitulo 15 paulus libro 6 aboute tyme constantyn themperour wolde delyuer ytalye hondes longobardes cam tarent ytalye axed holy man solytarie whether mighte ouercome longobardes noo answerde myght yet doo cause abbaye founded ytalye worship seynt iohan baptist seynt iohan prayeth alweye longobardes time shal come whan oratory shal despysed vnworthy persones shal dwelle therinne thenne longobardes shal fyrst perisshedthemperour rought therof wente forth ayenst longobardes spedde ¶ le spoylled rome withstondynge vitalianus pope prayd hym leue emperour dyde many grete tyrantryes scicilia atte last penaunce bathe wilfridus sayd chosen archebisshop york yonde see agilbertus abydynge confirmacion thenne counseyl quartadecimannes ben helde eester daye fourtenthe daye mone kyng oswy toke cedde abbot lestyngay made archibisshop yorke ayenst thordenaunce holy lawes willelmus libro tercio capitulo visesimo septimo sente hym kent sacred bisshop thachebisshop deus dedit ded cedda torned wina bisshop westsaxons ordeyned hym toke hym two bisshops briton company hym sacrynge thenne wilfridus come oute fraunce sawe cedda made bisshop stede thenne wilfridus abode kente thre yere vnto comyng theodorus made ther ordres halowed chirches made one putta connyng man songe bisshop rouchestre ¶also yere benet bisshop wente agayn rome comyng homwarde shorne thabbaye lirnence two yere ¶ thennes wente rome thyrdde tyme come agayne englond theodorus bisshop adrianus thabbott atte commaundement vitalianus pope cissa kyng kynge iues fader made abbaye abendon ¶ yere seynt leodegarins suffred deth fraunce vnder one ebroinus grettest man kynges hows ¶constāntinus themperour slayne owen men bath scicilia ¶after vitalianus holy pope deo datus pope four yere tyme seynt benettes body translated bodye suster scolastica· augustus monke floria translated hem thabbay floria besyde orleaunce fro mount cassin prouynce boneuent ¶ capitulum 18 fourth constantyn forsayd constantins sonne emperour seuenten yere grimiwaldus kynge longobardes nynthe daye bledyng arme shotte douue veyne brake· lech leyd therto venemoꝰ thynges soo dede ¶beda libro quarto capitulo secundo yere theodorus tharchebisshop come kente fyue dayes fore iuyn second yere consecracion bisshop one twenty yere four monethis man monke born thars scicilia connynge hooly letture seculer letture· grue latyn whan six sixty yere olde vitalianus pope sente bisshop englond sente adrian thabbot helpe hym sholde brynge nothyng ayenst feyth hooly chirche englonde grekes dyde· anone comen wente aboute alle ylonde taught ordre right byleue right lyuyng· lawful holdynge eesterday taughte disciple craft syngynge calculyng astronomye bothe latyn grue help adrian ordeyned bisshops certayne place bisshops lawfully ordeyned put hem away ordeyned hem bisshops place among whiche cedda lawfully ordeyned bisshop york knowleched mekely oune defaute theodorus put hym away fro see york restored wilfridus ordeyned cedda confermed atte last bisshop mercia prayer king wulferus badde hym ryde horsbak beda libro tercio capitulo visesimo sexto tyme doctours ful besy serue g • world herte wombe therfor habite relygyon thenne greete worship soo monke clerk shold gladly receyued men wente way prayd haue blyssynge wente none cause weyes stretes preche teche cris • enyng sauacion mannes soule wold resseyue none possession bylde abbayes profered hem dryuen resseyue strengthe lordes beda libro quarto capitulo quinto ¶also yere deyde oswy kynge northumberlond sonne egfridus kynge fiften yere ¶ item capitulo decimo octauo ¶this ethelfreda tonbertus wyf prince south girwyes whan egfridus wyf twelue yere myght haue leue dele prayer ne yeftes thenne hadde leue kyng made menchone one yere colud vnder aebba kyng egfridus aunte made abbesse ely ete one daye neuer vsed lynen clothes nyghtis collacion awoke vnto day deyde abbesse seuen yere lay hoole founde xvj yere beda libro quarto capitulo quinto yere made synode bisshops vnder theodorꝰ tetford synode ordeyned statute right holdyng eestertyde second bisshop sholde assoyle another mannes bisshopryche thyrde bisshops sholde distourbe abbayes ¶ fourth clerkes monkes shold chaunge benefyces withoute leue souerayns fyfthe prouynce synode shold gadred one yere ¶ egbertus kyng kente deyde broder lotharius reg • ed enleuen yere ¶marcus libro secundo also yere agilbertus bisshop westsaxons wente waye wrothly kenwalcus kyng departed bisshoprich tweyne· lentherius made bisshop stede confermed theodorus kynges wylle bisshop seuen yere yere grete slaughter fowles faught gyd • r ¶ • enwalchus kyng westsaxons deyde xxx yere kyngdō r wyf sexburga regned one yere beda sayth vnderkynges smal kynges deled kyngdom bytwene hem ten yere ¶beda libro quarto capitulo sexto yere seynt chedda deyde lychefelde thyrde yere bisshopryche theodorus made wynfryde cheddes dekene bisshop stede put hym donne longe vnobedydyent made sexwulfus abbott medampstede bisshop stede ¶r medampstede named peterburgh somtyme kyngdom girwies ¶ wynfridus putte doune fourth yere consecracion wente barowe deo datus pope bonus pope yere six monethes beda vbi supra deth wyna erkenwolde thirde bisshop london made two abbaies one self suthery ylond cereot named chirchecye fiften myle london westward another suster ethelberga eest london prouince cessex abba • e hete berkyng ther abbesse grete holynes ¶to seint aldelme brought book maiden hede ¶willelmus de pon libro secundo ¶it supposed holy maiden prayer place neuer yet destroied abbaye cherche seye destroyed dane kinge edgar bilded ageyne yere oswinus bigan regne ouer westsaxōs regned thre yere fought ayenst wulferus kynge mercia wydanheaf also yere deyd wulferus kynge mercia broder etheldredus regned hym thyrten yere wulferus sone kynredꝰ myght regne yong wulferus wyf ermenylda whan husbonde dede made mynchon ely doughter werburga vnder etheldreda marianus ¶ eme etheldredus made werburga menchon somme abbeyes maydens trykyngham wedunām hamburgam deyde fyrst abbey buryed thyrd promysed alyue· laye hoole sounde aboute thre honderd yere vnto comyng dane r ¶atte last whan dane laye rypyndon dryuen away kyng mercia cyteseyns hamburga drad toke bere conteyned body maide tho fyrst torned powder fled therwith legecestria chestre moost syker place ayenste peryll meschyef alyens straunge enemyes ¶ cyte chestre seculer chanons kynge ethelstones tyme comynge norman ofte possession yeuen ther thenne monkes relygyouse dwellyd worship mayde mar li 2 thenne kynge wulferus hadde thre bretheren fore sayd weda etheldredus merwaldus kyng west mercia quene ermenberga ermenredus doughter kyng kente· bare hym thre holy doughters mylburga myldreda mylguyda one sonne meresyn man grete • oolynes ¶ quene ermenberga ermenredus doughter ¶ willelmus de pontificibus libro quarto ¶ also wulferus two holy susters kynedda kyne swyda menchons bothe buryed medehampstede nowe peterburgh ¶there seynt ethelwoldus bylded abbay afterwarde kyneswyda conuerted kynge offa forsake hym husbonde· wente rome kinredus egwinus bisshop wiccyes bycam monke ¶agatho pope thre yere second yere made sixth synode constantinople two honderd bisshops four score synode seyd cryste ben two wylles two kyndes wylles kyndes godheed manhede ¶ capitulum 19 theodorus kyng fraunce regned fader clotarius eyghten yere beda li 4 ca· 18 yere etheld •• dus kyng mercia destroyed kent· pucta bisshop rouchestre went fro rouchestre sexwulfus receyued chirche herforde toke hede melodye hooly chirche amende owne bisshopryche also yere benett bisshop toke hym colfridus monke went fourth tyme rome brought hym iohan archechaunter ¶beda li 4 ca 18 ¶also yere grete batayll bytwene egfridus kynge northumberlonde etheldredus kynge mercia syde ryuer trente kyng egfridus broder slayne heete elswinus leef kyngdoms deth moche money gyuen atte instā ce theodorus tharchebisshop soo made acorde fyghtynge one ethelfridus knyghtes greuously wounded etheldredus men toke wold haue rysen ofte boundes enemyes one frison boughte hym boundes brake ofte broder preeste songe masse fore hym dede man· houre· dured alwey· till raunson payd cam broder ageyne· ¶ also yere seen sterre hete stella comata thre monethes heruest tyme tyme kyng egfridus exytyng wyf putte wylfridus oute bisshopryche northumberlond ¶ treuisa stella cometa sterre lyght blasynge creest aboue· euer bytokeneth pestylence· deth warre somme hard auentures w de li 1 theodorus tharchebisshop halp put wil fridus bisshopryche folowe kynges wil whan wylfrydus put oute ordeyned bosa bisshop york stede eata lyndeffar chirche tunbertus hagustald chirche trunwinus candida cassa whyte hows londe pictes ¶ marianus libro secundo putte eadhedus chirche rypon eadhedus comen lyndeseye· etheldredus kynge mercia hadde recouerd prouynce ayenst egfrydus ¶ ther myght seen sorowfully meuyd wrecchedenes mankynde though haue greete holynesse yet putteth atte ful maners reblenes ¶ ferforth caste· theodorus putte oute wylfrydus wrongfully· beda libro quinto capitulo 19 ¶thenne wilfridꝰ put oute wente rome cause saylynge see wynde dryue frisia fyrste alle conuerted many men· wyllibrordus fulfylled afterward atte laste come rome cam fore pope agatho herde alowed synode honderd bysshops fyue twenty disputed ayenst errour hem wolde teche cryst one wyll one kynde willelmꝰ de pon folowed owne cause sobrely greued theodorus sente court rome put none greuous accusation ayenst hym maintened owne ryghtw • sene suffrid bowe spake pope sayd sire theodericus alyue hath ordeyned see thre bisshops owne auctoryte withoute myn assente sente court rome accuse hym though wylfridus alowed dede • made kynges frowardnes theodorus assente beda libro quarto capitulo ·12 ¶ therfor wylfridus torned hym southsaxons bylded abbay sylyseye prechyd xō yere vnto egfridus deth conuerted peple also thre yere fore comynge noo reyn fyrste day crystnyng hit bygan reyne erthe wexe grene berbes began sprynge gadred ele nettes taught men countrey fysshe oswinus kyng westsaxons deyde kentw • nu regned hym nyne yere ¶that yere deide lentherius bisshop prouynce· theodorus ordeyned hedda bisshop bisshop wynchestre thyrtty yere ¶seynt • doenus bisshop roan deyde yere childe beda borne agatho second leo pope thre yere papacye cessed one yere beda libro quarto capitulo visesimo seynt etheldreda abbesse ely deyde mari li 2 ¶ suster sexburga abbesse somtyme wyf ercombertus kynge caunterbury ¶ beda vbi supra yere deyde hilda abbesse whythy seke six yere fourten dayes fore december yere age six sixty· kynge edwynus nece holy woman wyse redy wel lettred oute abbaye come fyue bisshops bosa eata offor iohan wylfrydus ¶ abbaye broder hete cedmon taughte inspiracion god make songes dytee countrey langage· sholde meane men deuocion manere doyng noman myght pere self couth nothyng doo mater· mater deuocion cam therto maner· wente tyme fro feste ful soore ashamed prayd syng harpe couth synge thenne sory fylle slepe· one cam hym slepe charged hym synge quod therfor flee· sayd singe boldly made al thynges man awoke· made wonder poysyes· al storyes holy wrytte henricus libro tercio ¶that yere theodorus made counseyll bisshops doctours hatfeld wolde wete knowe byleue alle men pope agatho hadde boden archechaunter iohan presente synode tyme prouince mercia sexwulfus rewled allone departed fiue bisshopryches one chestre another worcetre· thyrd atte lychefeld fourth sedenia lyndeseye fyfth dorchestre pucta lefte berford sexwulfus putte hym somtyme ¶ paulus libro septimo ¶ cunebertus kynge longobardes stode vnder chambre wyndow counseylled one secretaryes myghte slee knyght aldo ¶thenne greete flye fonded haue slayn • flye cutte flyes fote knyf meane tyme aldo knowynge kynges entente· cam towarde kynges court mette haltman went staf sayd aldo maner beware aldo yf thou comest kynges courte thou shalt slayn kynges honde whanne aldo herde fledde seynt romaynes chirche kynge axyd hym dyde soo answerd sayde cause haltman hadde warned hym deth anone kynge vnderstode halted soo wycked spyryte hadde cut foote lykenes flye· hadde soo wrayed counseyll prevyte hadde alsoo exyted aldoes deth ¶ kynge resseyued aldo grace ¶ leo seconde benet pope fyue yere • osricus vnderkyng mercia buylded abbaye gloucetre made suster kyneburgh abbesse ¶ yere kynge kentwi • u chaced weste brytons vnto see benett bisshoppe bylded abbaye seynt poule girnum brynke ryuer wyre fore hond byld another abbaye seynt peter brynke ryuer helpe kynge egfridus made colfridus abbot yere beda childe seuen yere old taken benet bisshops loore v tyme rome bytoke beda colfridus· beda libro quarto capitulo 12 yere gadred synode vnder kyng egfridus byside ryuer alue place hete twyford· odorus tundbertus put doune bisshopriche hagustald cuthberd made bisshop stede loued chirche lyndeffarn thyder wente and· ea • made bisshop hagustald stede beda· libro quarto capitulo visesimo tercio cutberd fyrst made monke abbaye mailros thenne preest atte last lyued ankers lyf ylond farn also yere kyng egfridus destroyed wrechidly men scotland alweye moost frendes englysshmen prayd helpe god feyned hem flee begyled egfridus· withstondynge prayer frendes wold doo tolled drough strayte place bytwene hilles montaynes slough grete dele hooste· tyme forward strengthe angle bygan falle awey pictes scottes many brytons receyued londes fredome ageyne cedwalla stronge yonglyng kynges kynde gewisses ben westsaxons regned ouer westsaxons kentwinus deth w •• de regibus kenbrightus sonne kenbrightus ceddaes sone ceadda cutas sone cuta craulinus broder c • aulinus kynricus sonne kynricus cerdicus sonne anone slough athelwold kynge southsex· made prouynce thral destroyed kente· toke yle wyght • yaf fourth dele therof seynt wylfridus loue god partye yle acounted thre honderd meynees housholdes ¶ yere northumberlond egfridus slayn broder alfridus nothus bastard regned eyghten yere ¶ yere sarasyns come egipte affryca toke cartage destroyed constantin constantinople ¶ capitulum 20 seconde iustinianus fader constantyn emperour ten yere benet fyfth iohan pope one yere zeno pope tow yere beda li 4 ca 23 lotharius kyng caunterbury deyde wounde taken fyghtynge southsaxons ayenst ceadwalla ¶after hym edricus egbertus sonne regned one yere half ¶after kyngdome longe vnstedfast vnder certayne kynges til wightred lawful sonne comforted regned kyngdō mul kyng ceadwal •• broder xij knightes besieged brēte kente therfor ceadwalla wroth destroyed kente eftsones wilfridus receyued bisshoprych hagustald atte prayer kynge alfridus seint iohan beuerley went york whan bosa dede zeno sergius pope thyrten yere ordeyned agnus dei shold thryes songe masse shewyng god fonde grete dele holy crosse seynt peter sacrarye gir p ca 17 ¶the fyrst pipinus hete vetulus breuis also sone ansegisilus sone seint arnulphꝰ made grettest kynges hows amonge frensshmen receyued principate eest partye fraunce prince seuen twenty yere fought fyrst ayenst theodericus kyng fraunce chaced vnto paris wan kyngdom saued kynges lyf name paulus libro septimo tyme fraunce kynges torned fro wytte strengthe kinges wonte haue semed grettest kynges hows rewled kyngdom god ordeyned kingdom shold torne bloode hem yere deyde seynt cuthbert ylond farn loued alwey body born ylond lyndeffarn· bisshopryche ruled wylfridꝰ one ye •• til put kynge yere ceadwalla kyng westsaxons whan nobly ruled peple thre yere forsoke
