thempyre wente pylgremage rome· crystned pope sergius named peter· yet sette whyte sekenes deyde fully thyrtty yere old thyrten dayes fore maye buryed seynt peter chirche· ¶ worthy haue suche famous wrytinge tombe ¶ lordshippe ryches child plente ryches welthe· clothes ryche arraye prayer hows castellis wallyd townes fader wonne strengthe cedwal mighty man armes lefte forsoke loue almyghty god ¶ gir de· p capitulo 17 take hede cadwaladrus last kynge brytons callyd cedwalla storyes romayns longobardes beda storye also corruptly knewe langage brytons therfor sōme place last verse tombe wreton maner kynge cadwaldrus lefte loue god sayd crystned sergius vnderstande confermed enoynting holy crysme thenne propre name chaunged happeth confermacion child though brytons callyd kyng • westsaxons kynge hem also ioyned walsshmen walshe men saye shal haue kynges ageyne whan cadwaldrꝰ bone ben brought rome holde fable doo storye gaufridus thende cedwalla regned iue lygnage kynges sonne kynredus sonne ceolwold sone cutha sonne cuthwyn sonne ceaulinus soo forthe iue regned seuen thyrtty yere thenne wente rome pope gregoryes tyme dyde many tyme also yere deyde benet bisshop xij daye ianiuer· colfridus abbot hym eyther abbaye brynk ryuer wyre ¶also theodorus tharchebisshop deyde yere age four score seuen bisshopryche two twenty hym abbot brightwold archebisshop vnto tyme tharchebisshops rome sith tyme tharchebisshops englond seynt wilfridus efte accused kynge alfrydus fore many bisshops put oute bisshopriche ¶therfore appeled courte rome defended soo cause fore pope iohan· hadde lettres pope kynges englonde restitucion redynge synode tho reherced grete helpe cause wilfridus synode pope agathoes tyme lettres redde sente hym kyng aluredus kyng wold yet receyue therfor torned kynge mercia receyued bisshoprich legecestria· chestre helde alfridus deth ¶ beda libro quinto capitulo nono ¶ aboute tyme egbertus monke spake tofore hond escaped moreyn prayer auowes sayled brytayn cast conuerte men germania dedes warnynge heuen letted hym shippe ordeyned iourney broke sodein tempest weder tho one bretheren warned vision spak egbertus sayde must whether wold retorne seynt columbaes abbaye ageyne plowes yede right therfor sente wyllebrordus xij felawes countreyes germania· torned moche folke feythe helpe older pupinus duk frensshe men wonne hyther fryselond atte last auctorite pope gregory made bisshop vtrecht ruled bisshopryche wel nobly wel fourty yere ¶ offorus deyde bisshop wiccies men bisshoprich wircestre egwinus bisshop hym sone afterward bylded abbaye euesham assente etheldredus whan theodericus kynge fraunce dede whome pupinus vetulus myldly suffrid regne made sonne clodoneus kyng pupinus vetulus hete pupinus breuis also yere men caunterbury made pee iue kynge westsaxons yaf thre thousand pound deth mul cedwalles broder iustinianus cesar priued ioye kyngdome gylt mysbyleue wente exyled pontus leo patricius refte nose tonge exyled cersona ¶ capitulum 21 seconde leo emperour thre yere tyme clodoneus kynge fraunce deyde pupinus made broder childebertus kyng men northumberlond slowghe ostryda etheldredus wyf kynge oswyes doughter willelmus de pontificibus libro quarto ¶ yere cuthlacus confessour forsoke armes boost pompe world wente abbaye rypendon vnder abbesse alfrida toke tonsure habyte clerk xxiiij yere age thenne thyrdde yere wente yle crowland bygan lyue ankers lyf dyde many myracles power ouer vnclene spyrites grete comyn tale made hem buylde many places· closed 〈◊〉 sethyng erthen pot hody lyeth buylded • •• baye· neuer destroyed amonge alle stryues chaungynge tymes resteth confessour neotus somtyme disciple erkenwald bisshop london though noman may come place croulond ship boote yet neuer well nygh without •• stes beda yere bifell brytayn myracle ought remēbryd thelthe sowle· one hete brightwoldus dede somwhat long tyme aroos ageyne lyue tolde many thynges many men departed catell thre· yaue wyf one dele child another kepte self thyrd deled poure men ended lif thabbay mailros iij tiberiꝰ emperour seuen • aroos ageinst leo assoylled kyngdome helde h • warde longe regned tyme iustinianus exyled cersona made openly booste shold recouer empire therfor peple meuyd loue tiberius fonded slee iustinianus therfor fledde prince turkes spoused suster recoueryd themppre atte laste helpe bulgares ¶ slowe leo tiberius assoylled thempire ofte wyped drope corrupcion nose somtyme cut ofte made sle somme one enemyes fyfth general synode holden aquilia sergius tyme ¶ sergius thyrdde leo pope two yere acompted ordre bisshops cause wrongfully putte patricius beda libro quinto capitulo 1 • aboute th tyme arnulphus bisshop galles come britayne wente ierusalem visite hooly place yede aboute al londe byheste came damaske constantinople alexandria many ylondes see sayled homeward countrey ageyne cast strengthe tempest west clyues brytayne fonde goddes seruaunt adaminanus abbot ylond hij tolde wondres holy places· made anone booke therof hadde herde wondres sente kynge alfridus rede r ¶it semeth beda toke booke afterward suche wrote holy place ¶ leo sixth iohan pope thre yere ¶that tyme etheldredus kynge mercia forsoke worldly kyngdom shorn monke bardeny regned leuredus v yere sone broder wylferus· seuenth iohan pope thre yere tyme deyde hedda bisshop wynchestre ¶after hym bisshoprych departed tweyne brythelynus tharchebisshop put danyel wynchestre seint aldelme shirborne ¶ seynt aldelme fore honde abbot maltby malmesburye ¶willelmus de pontificibus libro quarto also yere deyde sexwulfus bisshop mercia hedda helde lychefeld wylfrydus chestre· two yere alfridus kyng northumberlond deyde wilfridus torned ageyne bisshopryche hagustald bisshop afterward foure yere tho hedda helde bisshopriches lychefeld chestre ¶ capitulum 22· second iustinianꝰ regned agein sone tiberiꝰ vj yere priued thempyre leo recouerd thempyre yere therfor storye maketh efte mynde thenne iustinianus restored helde right feyth worshiped constantin pope destroyed cersona place exylynge slough alle dwellyd rinne oute take child efte whan wold slee child men prouynce made hem capitayne one philipicus exyled dwellyd anone wente constantinople slough iustinianus yere deyde alfridus kyng driffelde hym sone osredus childe viij yere regned enleuen yere ¶ ssinmus pope twenty dayes fyrst constantyn pope seuen yere denounced philipicus heretyk· put ymages holy sayntes chirches beda libro quinto capitulo 19 ¶that yere kenredus kynge mercia lefte kyngdome colredus sone cāme etheldredus wente rome offa· kynges sonne westsaxons egwinus bisshop wiccies ¶ treuisa ¶the see wyke torned worcetre yet ¶ thenne foloweth storye colredus kynge mercia translated fyrst body seynt wesburgh mayde therthe atte abbay hamburgh leyn nyne yere hoole sounde dured soo hoole sounde vnto comyng dane rypendon· aldelme bysshop shirburn deyde· hym buryed egwinus aldelm kyng iues broder sone kenten called aldelm olde elmeor olde helme moost connyng lettres grue latyn vsed instrumētes musike pipe strenges maner gleo· fyrste monke thenne made preest abbot malmesbury toke vpon martirdome whan temptyd flesshe wolde holde hym fayr maide bed longe saing sauter fro begynnyng thende· treuisa saue reuerence seynt aldelm semeth none holynes ner wysedom pure foly bothe self perylle drede temptacion woman may preuyd auctoryte reason thenne foloweth storye seuenth day weke whan chapman come prechyd hem besyly worde god atte last grete fame exyted sergius holy man pope sende hym lettres pystles thēne cam rome hadde desired longe see cyte vestementes synge alwey masse songe masse fore pope seynt iohns chirch latran day masse supposed haue take chesible one seruauntes behynd hym seruauntes chesible fyll sonne beme sonne beeme bare hit long tyme seruauntes faylleden chesible yet thabbay malmesbury ¶ also tyme holy pope deffamed hadde goten bastard childe whan childe nyne dayes olde brought crystnyng seynt aldelme seynt aldelme coniured childe nyne dayes olde sholde telle yf sergius pope bygote hym childe answerd sayd pope gyltles dede atte laste aldelm many pryueleges wente home ageyne abbeye wrote noble bookes de virginitate de termino postali de veteris ac noui testamenti floribus· de caritate de sensibilium rerum natura· de regulis pedum metricorum de methaplasmo de metrico dyalogo abbot malmesbury fourty yere bisshop foure yere ¶ tyme bretheren made hem another abbot buryed hym whan dede egwinus bisshop cam buryeng supposed warnyng god almyghty ¶ afterwarde hooly bisshopdunston worshipped gretely place highted shrine yaf therto organ belle holy relykes ornamentes cause men shold take hem awey vnskylfully cursed therfor wrote maner bisshop dunstan yeueth seynt aldelm organs· taketh hem awey lose kyngdome heuen ¶also water st • ne wreton maner archebisshop dunstan heete iute stene shold holy temple serue seynt aldelm also belle fraytour wreton maner hie halle heuen come neuer stelyth belle oute seynt aldelms seete ¶aboute yere deyd seynt wylfridus ¶in tombe ben wreton suche verse ¶ wylfridus holy mynde worthy name greued peryls wel many long tyme thre sithe fyften yere· bisshop lyue passyd ioye blys heuene beda libro quinto capitulo 19 ¶this child sharp wytte wente fourtenthe yere age thabbay lyndeffare lerned many thynges loore relygyon knewe thenne somme thynges rightfully holden scottes wente rome lerne parfyght loore lerned four gospel boneface tharchedeken compot eester nedefull thinges vse holy chirche comyng ageyne dwellyd alfinus bisshop lugdunensis till slayne quene batild ¶thenne wylfridus wente ageyne brytayne resseyued londe kyng wyns make abbay rypoun· made preest agilbertus ¶ whan stryf ended eester terme chosen bisshop yorke sayd fore honde whan dede preest acta bisshop hagustal̄d chirche beda libro quinto capitulo secundo yere deyde adrianus abbot seynt peter helper theodorus tharchebisshop· disciple successour albynus wreton innermore ¶ item capitulo duodecimo tyme nactanus kynge pictes sente messagers col̄fridus abbot bedaes abbay thabbaye gerwyk enformed hol̄dynge ester tyde man tonsure hoolly chirche emong thingis wrote hym holde right eester terme thre rule ben nedeful̄ knowe tweyne hem ben conteyned moyses lawe thyrd gospell thordenaunce thappostlis soo sente hym true maner reulis holde eesterday like hol̄de ¶ second ius • inianus sent hoost take philipicus hadde lefte pontus cersona hoost torned philipicus syde slough iustinianus second philipicus hete dardanicus also emperour one yere six monethes fled scicilia hoost rome· cause heretik commaunded scrape al payntynge chirches therfor romayns threwe awaye al maner money ymage graue ynne second anastasius emperour thre yere slayne philipicus ¶in tyme dagobertus kynge fraunce fader childebertus regned enleuen yere suffraunce pypinus vetalus yet ruled kynges hows constantinus second gregory pope sixten yere ¶ yere seynt cuthlacus anker deyde crowlond • e kyng westsaxons colredus kyng mercia foughten wodenesburgh sharply either hem bare hym self vngraciously knowen whether hadde worse spedde ¶ thyrde theodosius emperour one yere goodly benygne ouercome predecessour anastasius made hym preest one yere theodosius putt downe made clerk successour thyrdde leo stronge ¶ tyme come many sarasyns besyeged constantinople thre yere semeth iohan damascenus tyme flowres brought perce lettres wreton enemyes throwen forth founde openly redde whiche lettres conteyned conspyracye ayenste prince thenne right honde smyten sholde neuer ward wryte prayd fast lady seruyd bysyly honde restored hym ageyn ¶r suppose iohan iohan theremyte sette book faders soone hillarion warned theodosius emperour vyctoryes ¶it another iohan thyrdde theodosius tyme grece afterward perce made many noble bookes bothe philosophye ¶that iohan theremyte long tyme fore grete gregory· iohan damascenus long tyme grete gregorye ¶that knowen that· iohan damascenus bookes diuynyte aledgeth grete gregoryes noble grete myracle drlyueraunce traianus· may vnderstande gregory nazauzenus· aboute constantinople aboute pontus vnnethe come euer rome mynde myracle delyueraunce traianus atte sepulcre thappostles cyte rome grete gregory pope holden euery yere holy chirche maketh mynde tretynge dedes helpeth hem ben dede iohan damascene alledgeth myracle ¶capitulum 23 thyrdde leo sone constantyn emperour fyue twenty yere fyrst yere deyde pipinus vetulus hadde gouerned kynges hows eyght twenty yere ¶after hym come charles bygoten concubyne heete tutides marcellus also hadde suche name sledge hamers whiche smythes beten temperen grete gaddes yron tudes malleus latyn sledge hamer englysshe charles fought nobly ayenst sarasyns come oute affrica made hem flee one batayll peytow· another batayll narbon chaced hem spayne· whiche bataylls slayne four hondred thousand fyue sixty thousand sarasyns also fought ayenst saxon ayenst bauar • e also ayenst hendo duc guyen ayenst raufredus duc angeo also charles besynes warres bataylles fill vpon hym bytoke goodes holy chirche lewdmen therfore eucherius bisshop orleyans laye bede sawe charles body soule tormented helle angel shewyd syght bisshop sayde bycause toke goodes holy chirch poure men thenne warnynge bisshop abbot seynt denys pipinus preest wente charles graue torned stone sawe greete dragon flee oute graue ther body founde ¶ paulus libro septimo yere rome ryuer tiber wex • grete soo huge watres fylle mette ioyned geders fro port seynt peter port iuilinum dured seuen dayes til cyteseyns made letany yere deyde kynge etheldredus hadde kynge mercia thyrty yere monk e bardony thyrten yere buryed lycheselde cosyn ethelbaldus regned pendaes neuewe sone broder side soo sone sone alwy pendaes broder· ethelbaldus regned fourty yere cuthlacus confessour hadde sayd ethelbaldus eyghtenthe yere kyngdome bysiegid somerton wanne spoylled northumberlond ouercome walsshmen xxxvij yere kyngdom ouercome cuthredus kyng westsaxons laste yere kyngdome owne men slowe hym secandon also yere colfrydus abbot girwey deyde hugon pilgremage willelmus de pon libro quarto yere deyd seint egwinus thyrdde bisshop wyccies ¶ bisshopryche nowe callyd wyrcetre tyme egwinus bythought hym synnes yongthe gyuyd self threwe keyes gyues ryuer auene· wente gyued openly rome· sayd shol syker foryeuenes synnes whan gyues vnshyt vnloken vertue god ellys keyes· wente soo gyued rome· sayd belle cyte bygonne rynge hem self comynge come ageyne priuelege chirche whyle saylede see brytayne grete fysshe leepe shippe gutte fysshe founden keye vnlokked gyues beda libro 5 capitulo sexto seynt iohan bisshop york deyde deyrwode beuerle yere bisshopryche thre thyrtty buryed porche minstre fyrst yeres specially lente dwellyd seynt mychels chappel hastugald chirche f • r fro tyne northe hylle place hete hernyshowe englyssh englysshe vsed hit hete erne hille deyde atte last atte beuerley four twenty myle oute yorke estward place called beuerley also brokkesly many brockes wonte somtyme come thyder oute hilles ben nygh seynt iohan builde chirche seint nicholas another seint iohan baptist hille refresshing feding bretheren fredome priueleges place encreced grete prouffit worship ther receyued bataille stryf bitwene tweyne accused shal purge self owne honde • em beda vbi supra iohan preest wilfridus bisshop thirtty yere r¶ hete yonger wilfridus ouerpassed bedaes tyme ther thre famous wilfrydes fyrste wylfrydns went thryes rome haue spoken fore honde yōger wylfrydus bisshop yorke seynt iohan beuer • ey· thyrdde bisshop wyccyes egwin • e ¶willelmus de pontificibꝰ libro secundo kyng iue bylded abbaye glastenbury aldelm counseylled hym somtyme ¶ abbay endured nobly vnto tyme dane afterward help dunstan vnder kynge edmond kynge edgar abbay nobly amended arayd comynge norman tyme note mysshappes alweye sette wycked trauaylles· ¶also abbottes place greete rychesses ben proude bycome tyrauntes swellen pryde outward wroth ben cruel ward prouffytable specially knowen abbot thurstinus tyme ¶r thider translated boone seynt hilda thabbesse colfrydus thabbott gyrwye somme bone bisshop aydan bone king edmond brought hym whan iourney ayenst scottes ¶there resteth second patriark irlond abbot confessour mar • iloge redde seynt bartilmeus day sayth wold conuerte yrysshe men myghte ther fore forsoke yrlonde cam glastyngbury deyd seynt bartilmeus daye ¶ capitulum 24 leo themperour lefte thenemyes thempyre warryd ayeynste fygnres ymages sayntes pope gregorye germanus constantinople withstode manly olde vse customme wolde alowed approued holy chirche sayde worthy medefull doo hem affection worship worshipe hem god oft fyght suche ymages men worshipe god holy saintes god • one shal principally worshiped hym creature shal worshiped worship beda libro quinto capitulo visesimo quarto ¶ yere deyde wyhtredus kyng caunterbury thobias bisshop rouchestre couth la • yn grue wel owne langag • paulus libro 7 yere sarasyns come vnto constantinople besyeged thre yere toke then moche good catell wyght brandus kynge longobardes herd therof raunsonned relyques seynt austyn doctour whiche relyques somtyme trā slated sardina fere straunge enemyes made hem borne cyte gene then papye hete somtyme titinum ¶ willelmus de regibus libro primo kynge iue bytoke kyngdome westsaxons cosyn ethelardus wente rome hit sayd fyrst kynges graunted seynt peter euery hows kyngedome peny long tyme englysshemen callyd rome skott latyn called petres peny kynges wyf ethelburga yaue occasiō take pylgremage man ofte coūceyled husbond forsake ryches world specially last yeres lyf sped therfor atte laste fonded ouercome hym gyle tyme whanne leye gyder ryal cyte departed then thenne thre dayes gouernour cyte defowled palays al fylthe myght fynde dunge fylth beestes mukhilles kynge leyn slepte leyde sowe pigges late farwed alle dyde assente commaū dement quene thenne quene prayd husbond flaterynge desyred come place kynge graunted cam thyder sawe place somtyme lyke sardanapalus plesure lust thenne disarayd defowled whanne sawe occasion spak kynge sayde pray lord ben nowe curteyns alle ryche arraye halle chambres nowe plesaunt seruyse wonte flatre lykynge plesaunt seruyse glotonye lecherye al passyd ¶ soo lorde shal oure flesshe passe falle aweye norysshed golde ryche araye husbond ouercome noble bataylles vyctoryes grete prayes taken bytoke kyngdome neuewe wente rome cam openly thedyr syghte kynge share heed clothed hym poure man wexe olde amonge beggar ¶ quene ethelburga wente abbay berkynge suster abbesse afterward made abbesse maydens made blessyd ende passed reste beda li 5 ca 29 osricus kynge northumberlond deyde nynth yere kingdome hym colwulfus regned nyne yere hym beda wrote storye callyd historia anglycana beda vbi supra yere seen two grisely sterres blasyng crestes aboute sonne dured two wekes one hem passed erly fore sonne cam sonne eue sterres blased caste brenning brondes toward northside boded grete deth manslaughter thenne cam greuous meschyef sarafyns bete doune gallia fraunce beda li 5 ca 25 yere deyde bryghtwoldus archebisshop doroberma caunterbury ¶ tadwynus archebisshoy sacred bisshops london wynchestre rouchestre yere south prouynces vnto marche ryuer humbre subget ethelbaldus kynge mercia pyctes scottes hadden pee angle somme brytons owne lawe somme seruyd angle seconde gregory thyrdde gregory pope enleuen yere confermed worshipyng holy ymages counceyl made rome thousand bisshops cursed dredefully alle done ayenste statute worshipyng holy ymages also yere one petronax bryxianus wente hylle mount cassyn restored place couenably godes catel monkes comfort commaundement pope gregory tadwinus tharchebisshop caunterbury deyde nothelinus bisshop london archebisshop hym also yere deyde alwynus wor bisshop lychefeld wytta bisshop lychefeld whan dede totta bisshop legecestria chestre eata dured yet dorchestre ¶ r ¶ yere deyde worthy man beda preest willelmus de regibus libro 5 seuenth yere age bytake nourysshynge loore benet bisshop girwye ¶ deth colfrydus abbot place nyntenth yere made deken iohan bisshop yorke preest thyrtty yere yere bygan wryte spente al lyf tyme abbay made hym besy studye expowne holy wrytte among besynes euery day seruyse relygyon syngynge chirche hadde grete swetenes lykynge lerne teche wryte wrote lxxviij bookes acompteth bookes historia anglicana lacketh fayleth connynge speche wondre atte ful man soo without vse scole made many noble volume sobre wordes soo lytel space lyf tyme al conclude come neuer rome though̄ som men wold wene went rome ther presente shewe bookes acordyng loore hooly chirche yf acordyng amende hem atte pope commaūdement wente blynde aboute preche ladde fraude man preche stone answerd said amen wente thryes rome fonde thre r thre f wryten expowned sygnefyed fynde thynges wreton bookes auctoryte somme men 〈◊〉 suche wrytynge founden r r r f f f exposicion regna ruent rome ferro flamma fame que say kyngdoms rome shal falle iron fyre honger ¶ willelmus de regibus libro primo pope sergius pystle sent abbot colfrydus knowen beda sente prayd come rome tassoylle question meuyd take heede worthy court rome helde hym soo noble court nede haue hym declare assoylle question meuyd also worthy shal holde hym maner lyuynge techynge myghte vycious spent soo wytte thoughte expownynge hooly wrytte clennesse seen moche laste ende seuen wekes continuelly stomak indignacion mete drynke soo vnnethe myght reteyne ony mete strayt short brethed al spared trauaylle letture bookes euery daye amonge de • ty trauaylle seruyse psalmes taught disciple lesson question tourned seint iohans gospell englysshe sayde lerne ye smal childeren lyue wote longe shal yow abyde euer amonge sayd sawe ambrose haue lyued amonge shameth lyue nether dredeth deye haue good lorde ¶ nyghte whanne hadde noman • eche trauaylled besyly bede byddynge thankyng god al tuesday fore thascencion deth neyhed foot bygonne swelle houseled enoynted kyssed bretheren prayd hem alle haue mynde yaue many seruauntes thynges kepte pryuyte ascencion daye clothe heer spred leyd doune prayd grace holy goost sayd king blysse· lord vertues hast pry art day styed vp aboue al heuenes leue thou v faderles· send thou v byheest fader goost sothnes whanne ended yelded vp last breth wel grete suetenes smeland thenne buryed comyn fame tellith durham seynt cuthbert buryed wel nygh knowleche vnto conquest dedes englond neygh alle connyng lettres tyme lewde came lewd shamely verse wreton tombe bere grete wytnes vnconnyng tho versus vnworthy wryten worthy mā ne tombe ben verse beda preest resteth buried flesshe· cryste graunte soule glad heuen foreuer graunte drynke welle wysedome hath desired besily alwey right loue grete ¶ aboute tyme ricoldus duc frysons tourned prechyng seynt wulfranus bisshop wold crystned put one foote fontestone withdrew axyd hem stode aboute whether ther moo predecessours paradys helle answerd moo helle herde drough fote oute water sayde esyer folowe moo lesse begyled fende· deyde thyrdde day ¶willelmus de pontificibus libro quarto aboute tyme deyde seynt frydeswyde mayde borne ox • nford doughter duc dydamus kynge algarus lecherous man folowed cyte oxenford whanne mayde entryd cyte yates closeden shytt hem self kynge werde blynde poursued prayer mayde kyng syght ageyne syth tyme kynges englond drede come ynne cyte drede myshappes myght hem byfalle ¶ colwulfus kynge northumberlond eyghte yere kyngdome lefte kyngdome cosyn egbertus sone faders broder becam • monke beda abbaye egbertus regned nynten yere· ¶ r willelmus de regibus sayth shore lyndeffa • churche atte last buryed besyde seynt cuthbert nothelinus archebiss •• p caunterbury deyde cuthbert bisshop herford archebisshop hym ¶ capitulum 25 fyfth constantinus fader leo emperour thre thyrtty yere fader vsed toke ymages oute chirche euery place sette hem fyre etheldredus kynge westsaxons deyde fourtenth yere kyngdome cosyn cuthbert kynge hym· werryd oftymes ayenst ethelwaldus kynge mercia regned sixten yere cosyn sygebertus regned hym two yere proude happes predecessour gouerned subgettis hard euyl· torned lawes owne wylle slough noble erle cumbranus euyl wyckedly spoke hym euyl berynge dedes atte laste wold amended put oute kyngdome thenne wente wode· hidde self swyneherd therles slayn fonde hym slough hym ¶aboute tyme deyde charles marcellus hym two sonnes second pipinus charlemayne come pryncipate kynges hows ¶ charlemayne fourth yere pryncipate lefte pryncipate counceyl broder· toke wey rome· shore monk pope zacharyas tyme made abbeye hylle mount sarapte lyued somdele long tyme atte laste cause frensshmen come thyderto ofte hym theyr lorde dyde somtyme· wente thennes mount cassyn prayd hym thāt wold sende lettres kynge fraunce restore ageyne seynt benet body mount cassyn pope dyde prayd kynge fraunce bad monkes floriacio delyuer seynt benettes body thenne monkes bygan wepe faste prayd god besyly body must abyde hem god herd prayer smote messagers sente made hem starke blynde soo fayled theyr purpoys wente ytaly ageyne thenne second pipinus prefecte palays gouerned kyngis hows fraunce vnder hildericus sone theodericus· vnprofytable man esy resseyued nothyng kyngdome name kyngedome liuelode pipinus axyd pope zacharyas yf shold kyng helde apaid name king yaue slouthe dyde none good pope wrote ageyn sayde shold haue name kyng rewleth wel comynte frensshemen gladde answer closed hildericus abbay made pipinus kynge eyghtenth yere made emperour decre zacharyas pope thenne compellyd astulphus kynge ytaly inpugned right rome restore take made hym delyuere yeue plegges gregory zacharias pope twelue yere wente tyme toward rauenna right myddel iuyn couerd al daye clowde god sente shold brente grete hete sonne· al nyghte cloude abode beside tente aroos ageyne morowe· also fyry ostes wente fore holy man cloudes ordre eester distourbled theyonger wylfrydus bisshop york deyde hym egbertus kynge egbertus broder bisshop xxxvj yere willelmus de regibus libro primo de pontificibus libro quarto ¶ wytte sleyghte broder kynges money reparayled see amended hit two state man grete herte grete wytte toke strongly hede grete pryde coueyte desire ought rightful soo grete lewdnes wrechedines forgendre detty ryghtful therfore tharchibisshops pal fyrst paulinus put strengthe enemyes hadde lefte rouchestre· many predecessours hadde forgendryd gate ageyne grete instaunce money made atte court rome ¶ also ordeyned york noble lyberarye ¶ noble doctour englisshmen alcuinns sente kynge charles pea englysshmen pystle sente holy chirche englond lybrarye maketh noble mynde· ¶ also wryteth kynge charles manere yeue bookes loore suche countrey englonde wytte mayster egbertus· shal sende somme child shal take therof nedefull brynge fraunce floures brytayne alone orchard closed shal york turoyn spryngynge paradys yere deyde seynt danyel bisshop wynchestre hym cam humfrious· zacharyas steuen pope fyue yere enoynted pipinus two sonnes made hem emperours charleman grete charles syth tyme thempire rome passyd fro grekes frensshmen thenne german kenulphus cerdicus kynde fyfth degree pendas neuew goten kenwalcus grete man vertues passyd fame helpe westsaxons put sygebertus oute kyngdome gretenes euil dedes regned stede thyrtty yere graūted hym prouynce hampton til slayne duc cumbranus thenne putte awaye hid wode slayne duke swynherd· ethelwoldus kynge mercia slayne sygeswold beoruredes tyraunt buryed rypindon long afterwarde offa ethelwaldus neuewe slough beoruredus regned stede xxxix yere mercia ouercome batayll northumbres westsaxons kentysshmen soo • e tourned tharchebisshops see oute caunterbury lychefeld prouince mercia also translated seynt albons bone abbaye bylded yaf pope peter v • ca • rent yere euery hous kyngdom made al grete dyche euer seen departe bytwene wale kyngdome mercia whiche dyche yet named offedyche thou shalt fynde herof fyrst book capitulo de platris regalibus ¶ w de r li 1 offa fonded gete frend ship • kynges maryed doughter ethelburga bryghtrycus kynge westsaxons sente alcuinus doctour englysshmen charles kynge fraunce procoure pees· ther soo grete discorde stryf bytwene kyngdoms passage marchauntes forbode eyther syde organ come fyrst fraunce sente fro constantyn emperour kyng gre • e pipinus kyng fraunce egbertus· kynge northumberlond shorn monke sone ofwulphus regned hym slayn thende fyrst yere northumbres ¶ hym mol • called ethelwold also regned seuen yer mar ¶ stephen paul pope ten yere mylde man alle thynges tyme gengulphus floures burgoyn tyme bought welle fraunce prayd god graunted thylke welle myght sprynge oute burgoyn man lefte wyf broken spouseed slayne clerk lay wyf whan dede god shewde many myracles wyf spake euyl myracles sayde whā gengulphꝰ myn husbond doth myracles myn arse shal synge ofte spak afterward ar • wold synge w • th fowle noyse mull kynge northumberlond lefte kyngdome aluredus regned hym nyne yere aluredus two sone ofredus thyrd regned hym stede seynt alcum • dus slayn afterward whan halp men mercia ayenst west sax • u ¶ paul pope deyde constantyn lewd man made pope maystrye strengthe pope one yere dyde sklaunder al holy chirche chierte cristen men put chirche eyen put oute yere deyde pipinus kyng fraunce euyll bytwene fell flessh regned eyght twenty yere ¶ capitulum 26 pipinus dede frensshemen departed kingdome bytwene two sonnes charles charleman charleman deyde two yere thenne charles hadde al kyngdome gouerned nobly tyme six fourty yere ¶ thenne charlemans wyf child fledde desiderius kynge longobardes prayd helpe socoure ony nede noman compelled hem therto charles first ouercome duc hunald wangyen made subget te prayer pope adryan bysieged desiderius kynge ytaly cyte papye rebell ayenst chirche rome broder astulphus ben charles toke hym cyte papye exyled hym made owne sone pipinus kyng ytaly stede batayl deyde amicus amelius crystes knightes· herty frendes· hem ben red wonderfull dedes atte laste charles chastysed saxon sclaues toke many hem sent hem dyuerse place fraū ce saxon forsoke theyr mawmetrye made one peple saxon frensshmen· charles wente spayn wanne dale londes countreyes hilles monte pireni· assoylled wey busshementis gascoyns soo slough vtterde • le hoost olyuer chyef sewer kynges bord· rouland erle palays slayne many peres fraū ce· de libro turpini day whanne trewes graunted eyther side aigolandus stronge prynce spayne cam charles crystned sawe alle b • rde rially clothed delyciously fedde· sawe fer thyrten 〈◊〉 men sytte grounde haue broken mete simple oute ony borde axyd answerd hym thyrten ben goddes messagers praye v brynge mynde nombre crystes disciple see said aigolandus lawe nought rightful suffreth goddes messagers thus euyl seruyd· seruith euil lord soo resseyued seruauntes soo lewdly offended despysed crystendom wente home ageyne charles worshiped afterward poure men treuisa aigolandus lewd gost lewdely meuid deuyl hym taught blynded hym couth knowe men shold seruyd state axyd ¶ gir de p ca 17 charles wanne gallia narbonensis made subget capnanes • neuentanes dane sueues confedered hem dyde al one iourney kynges brytons angle perte scottes grece worshipeden hym yeftes turpyn tharchebisshop telleth charles fayr welfaryng body sterne face· body eyght fote lengthe face span half· berde fote longe· cleef two swerde knyghte armed one stroke wolde esyly hondes folde bende four horse shone ones· wolde heue stondyng knyght armed grounde one honde wolde ete hare alle hoole tweyne hennes goo one mele wolde drynke litell wyn watred soo scarse drynke seelde wolde drynke thries soper ¶this charles gracious mylde poure men chirches ouer ryn magounce made brydge fyue honderd paas· frensshmen ne myght youthe taught sone ryde hunte doo dedes armes lerne scyences scole ordeyned doughters werche▪ wolle werke spyudle dystaf ordeyned hem vse suche werkes shold wexe slowe ydlenes helde hym payd countrey speche couthe better vnderstāde langage g • ue speke loore gramer peter pyse mayster science clergie alcuinus albinꝰ englysshman mayster charles fonded wryte lettres therfor bare payr table • wryte ynne profyteth right lytell trauaylle bygonne late· wolde chirche erly late houres sayd nyght ordeygned assigned grete almes poure men f • r londes egypt affrica hadde alweye reda • mete grete delyte seynt austyns bookes specially bookes de ciuitate dei ¶in somer tyme mete vndertyde wolde take somwhat apple drynke one therto doo clothes goo bedde nyght slepe two houres· nyght wolde four sythes fyue awake aryse lye doun slepe thryes cam rome alyght ho • myle half cyte yede afote alle cyte kyssed alle pylers chirches· delyuerd hooly londe come ageyne constantinople forsoke alle precious grete yeftes constantin themperour profered reserued relyques holy sayntes receiuyd grete party lordes crosse partye crowne thornes syghte byganne blosme· bere floures one crystes nailes lady smok seynt symeons arme brought relyquyes hym seynt marye chirche aquisgranum founded lyeth buryed fonded many abbayes ben lettres b c euery thylke abbayes th • ordre fondacion therof sette pyghte letter gold weight honderd pond tournoys man charle • wonder wolde vnnethe marye ony doughters lyue oute take oldest dought • r whiche maried kynge grece hete constantin charles sayde myght withoute company doughters therfor though gracious dedes poynt ayenst fortune blame though ther grete speche therof among peple made though knewe not· none suspection foly dede therfor somme men wene synne wold neuer shryue mouthe· vnnethe atte laste wryting seynt gyles also charles deyde deled catel thre partyes one partye assigned poure men another chirches· yet thyrd departed four partyes· one ther kept holde myndeday euery dayes vse thyrdde sone neuewes fourth seruauntes houshold sate one meete mayster alcuinus sat fore thenne axyd mayster grete difference space bytwene scot sot brede metebord sayd mayster r ¶for brynge storyes acorde semeth oute acord spekynge thempyre kyngdome charles take heede charles yonge enoynted kyng second pope steuen yere lord seuen honderd liiij fader pipinus lyue regned fader vnder xv yere vnto faders deth thenne faders deth deyde yere oure lord seuen honderd eyght sixty yere regned broder charleman two yere broder deyde yere lord seuen honderd lxx charles helde kyngdome al hool fourten yere yere oure lord seuen honderd four score four yere wente fyrst rome crouned emperour adrian pope emperour sixten yere yere lord eyght honderd whan fourth pope leo confermed charles ageyne emperour emperour fourten yere deyde yere age two seuenty yere oure lord eyght honderd xiiij thenne somme men telle storyes regned al six fourty yere shal vnderstonden fadres deth owne deth wole see charles lyf must loke bookes mayster alcuinus turpyn tharchebisshops bookes ¶that day charles deyde vyan fraunce turpyn bede sawe company blac knyghtes wende toward akon take charles soule· coniured last hem shold come ageyn whan telle hem dyde spedde thenne fende wente come ageyne turpyn axyd haue quod fende weyed charles sowle thylke iames spayne byheded leyde soo many stone teres weight balaunce charles good dedes maystrye weyed euyl dedes haue right nought brought v ageyne· charles sayd fende vsed bylde many chirches worship seint iame constantyn assoylled poperych take strengthe putte oute pope stephen pope fouryere anone gadred synode reuoked al predecessour oute take crystenynge crysme ordeyned sauacion deyen ¶ capitulum 27 steuen fyrst adryan pope four twenty yere first gadryd second counceyl constantinople thre honderd faders fyfty made another counceyll cyte rome thre honderd fyfty faders kynge charles presente thenne graunted right election pope ordeynyng pope see northumbres putt oute theyr kynge aluredus toke ethelbertus hete etheldredus also sonne mollus· made hym theyr kyng regned ouer hem fyue yere fourth leo sonne fyfth constantyn regned grece four yere brente thurste grete couetyse· toke chirche crowne ryally sette carbuncle stone sette heede take sodayne feuer deyde yere offa kyng mercia spoylled lamberd archebisshop caū terbury dygnyte prymate brought dygnyte lychefeld helde lyue assente pope adryan sixth constantin sonne fourthe leo regned grece moder iren ten yere last yere fylle discorde stryf bytwene sonne moder moder toke sonne put hym prison regned alone fyue yere atte laste sonne helpe counseyl armenyes cam oute prysonne poursued cruelly moder helper thenne afterward sonne grete cruel • e take commaundement strengthe moder eyen put oute euyl • ner deyde sone afterward soo iren regned ageyne fyue yere nichoforus patricius grete worship iren roos ageynste toke crowne ayenst peples wylle toke tresour thempyre oth made harmeles· exiled soo exyled deyde fyrst yere constantin dede mannes graue constantinople founde plate gold plate wreton maner cryst shal borne mayde marye byleue· vnder constantyn iren sone efte thou shalt see mari li secundo yere kenulphus kyng westsaxons offa kyng mercia fought strongly cyte besyngton offa vyctory cyte ¶ yere northumbres put oute kyng ethelbertus heete etheldredus also made aswolf kynge regned enleuen yere yere second synode made nicene thre honderd fyfty bisshops adryans tyme synode ayenst thoppinion grekes sayd hooly gost cometh fader sone willelmus de pontificibus libro quarto kenulphus kyng westsaxons cast put kinehard oute kyngdome broder predecessour sigebertus cam nyght woman hows merton lemman clyto cam four score felawes bysette kynge al aboute· whanne kynge awaked defended manly hym self slayne laste erly morow knowen kyng dede· • cu kynges capitayne cam felawes place slough clyto felawes euerychone toke kynges body buryed wynchestre· ¶after kenulphus brightricus cerdicus bloode kynge westsaxons fyften yere • anone helpe kynge offa who doughter wedded putte oute egbertus sonne alemundus vnder kynge sone offa cam bloode gengulsus iue anone put doune wente fraunce· vsed scole chiuailrye whan bryghtricus dede cam ageyne regned taught scole chyualrye lerned fraunce lull archebisshop caunterbury deyde rychulfus archebisshop hym eyght twenty yere bygan buylde seynt albons grete chirche fundamēt wonder werke brente tyle brought nobly ende ¶willelmus de pontificibus libro quarto yere kyng offa maryed doughter ethelburga brightricus kynge westsaxons sayd laboured besyly might venym sle al houshold men husbonde thenne tyme yaue venym yonglyng homly kyng slough kynge yonglynge thenne wente kynge fraunce grete tresour ryches tyme kynge sone stode chambre kynge yaue choy • whether wold haue husbond fader sonne chees sonne haddest thou chose quod kynge thou sholdest haue sonne thou hast forsake thou shalt haue nermy sonne thou muste leue pryde world goo abbay lewd mā laye put oute deyde pouerte tyme therof cam vsed amonge angle kynges wyf sholde callyd quene ner sitte kyng kynges sete ¶henricus libro quarto ¶ yere seen wonder signe crosse englysshe men clothes blood fylle doune fro heuen erthe knowen whether befyll token mocion ierusalem fyll thre honderd yere afterward wiliam reedes tyme ellys tamende englysshmen shold drede wreche come vpon hem dane god wil soo mote yere dane cam fyrst englonde kynges styward westsaxons wēte ayenst hem vnwysely fewe men slayne hem ¶ seynt oswold kynge northumberlond slayne owne men neuew osredus sonne aluredus broder alcmundus regned hym sone put slayne hym etheldredus somtyme put oute kyngdome regned ageyne sone afterward slayne therfor colwulphus bisshop lyndeffar fo • soke bothe lefte see kyngdome oswaldus regned fewe dayes adulphus regned one yere lxxvj yere kynges regneden last hem osbryght elle dane slough hem atte cyte yorkland al flour men yere lord eyyht honderd lxxvij tyme dane regned northumberlonde two fyfty yere vnto ethelstans tyme ¶pipinus sonne charles conspyred ayenst fader counceyl wried shore monke closed abbaye felawes somme byheded somme hanged throte seynt ethelbertꝰ kynge • estangles pryued bothe kyngdome lyf heest kynge offa exytynge counceyll owne wyf kyneswyda ¶capitulum 28 offa deyde kynge mercia sonne egsercus regned hym one yere hym mylde man kenulphus cutbertus sone kyng gate wyf quene alfritha quen drida burgenilda seynt kenelme ¶ willelmus de regibus libro primo fine kenulfus pendaes neuew fyfthe degree greete man vertues passyd fame home deuoute mylde bataylle stronge ofte vyctorye ¶ offa toke wrath ayenst kentysshmen werryd strongly londe toke theyr kynge egbert hete pren surname lad hym hym bounde mercia sone mylded mercy manheede buyldynge chirche wynchecombe buylded atte auter yaue kyng fredom prisoner presente thyrten bisshops ten duke dede al chirche sowned ioye strete cryde grutched made noyse startynge aboute also restored ageyn dygnyte prymate athelardus bisshop caunterbury deyde atte laste yere fyrste regne four twenty buryed wynchecombe left kenelme hym heyr tyme constantinople sonne withdrewe lyghte seuenten dayes seen soo many men supposed byfalle blendynge puttyng oute kyng constantyns eyen alfredus also yere tenth yere bryghtrycus fyry dragon seen englonde fleyng ayer sygne cam two pestylences stronge honger warre dane assaylled fyrst northumberlond thenne lyndeseye tyme dane ouercome fled shippes ¶ adryanus fourth leo pope twenty yere ¶in tyme wente seynt peter seynt marcus daye letany take eyen put tonge kyt god myracle restored hym syght hi • speche soo spake withoute tonge afterward wente charles fraunce come ageyne hym rome thenne wreche take pope enemyes pope purgid hym men bare honde thenne efte crouned charles confermed fore crowned nychoforus patricius exyled irene themperyce grece· assaylled toke thempyre wyles strengthe regned yeght yere tyme eeste empyre fayled al oute body seynt wythburgh mayde founden hoole sounde toune durham buryed lv yere wythburgh doughter kynge anna suster sexburga yere charles crowned emperour leo pope syth tyme thempyre passyd fro grekes frensshemen german ben almayns giraldus de p capitulo septimo ¶ passinge thempire grekes though fayle hem self stryue venym vertue crafte strengthe batayl mar callyd god batayll yet haue soo grete enuye latyns haue withdrawe hem oute subiection obedyence chirche rome therfor whan pope rome charged hem ofte obedyent come ageyne vnyte hooly chirche vsed wryte ageyne maner ye haue withdrawen v withdrawe v fro willelmus de regibus libro primo et de pontificibus libro tercio ¶ bryghtrycus kynge westsaxons deyde poysoned venym wyf ¶after hym egbertus sonne alcmundus vnder kynge sone offa iuees bloode kynde regned seuen thyrtty yere· ¶ somtyme chaced bryghtrycus fled fraunce cam ageyn taught hadde lerned chyualry subgettis al peple bonde fre ordeyned knyghtes delyuere men stronge swyper made wepen born tyme pee tyme bernulphus kynge mercia scorned doynge ydle ful reste meued bataylle vsid dedes armes bad sternly sholde doo homage thenne bytwene hem bataille somer tyme elyndon prouince hampton ther vnlike nombre araye knightes ayenst honderd egbertus knightes paal lene cam thousand rody fatte soner stuffed swote bloode whan batayle done egbertus oned kyngdoms mercia kente northumberlond kyngdome toke chestre vpon brytons brytons helde chestre vnto tyme thēne called lordes gyder wynchestre crowned kyng al brytayne ordeyned cō maunded al saxon iutes shold callyd angle fro day forward brytayne shold callyd anglia brytayne conteyneth englond wale scotland r yere kynge bryghtrycus deyde marianus sayth ethelmundus kynge mercia wente oute owne londe vnto forde chymerforde fought ayenst weoftan duc wylton bataylle duke slayne eyther syde wylton men victorye seynt alcmundus martir sonne kynge aluredus northumberlond come ethelmundus syde slayne body fyrst buryed atte white ābbay afterward derby north chirch buylded name god sheweth hym many tokēs myraales northumbres comen hym ofte pylgremage willelmus de 2 li 1 yere albinus englisshman hete alcuinus also connyng man clergye passyd ouer see fraunce enlumyned lond lyght techyng ordeyned orysons offyce masse feryal dayes brought parys studye grekes somtyme chaunged rome beda aldelm wysest man al englysshemen haue redde take left specially kynge charles whether clennes londe manhede kynge taughte hym logyke sophystrye rethoryk astronomye kyng bytoke hym seynt martyns abbay turone gouerne thabbots right monkes ther fallē grete outrage therfor mōk saw two aūgels come dortour slew mōkes place take saw sight last alcuinus restid seynt paule cormarik ther euery day almes • led soule four monkes mete tyme seint gylys thabbott nacion grekes floures come ouer fraunce warnyng god lyued fyrst ankers lyf riuer roone also tyme paule deken rome floures discriued longobardes come thabbay moūt cassyn fraunce loue kynge charles ¶ amonge grekes mychel mylde man made emperour thyrd yere sonne fayled sonne rysyng sone ther themperour sho • ne monke grete pestylence ruther • n destroyed wel nygh al europa namely brytayne grete charles seke four yere feuers deyde fourth day fore feuerer aron buryed marianus libro secundo laste yere treen brydge fyue honderd paas made cost trauaylle ten yere ouer ryn maguncia soo brente thre houres ther spoon therof seen flete vpon water many men suppose happe fylle atte prayer ryculfus bisshop manslaughter robberye ofte nyght vpon brydge men suppose fyll somme auenture none otherwyse ¶ capitulum 29 lowys mylde charles oldest sonne emperour fader six twenty yere xj monethes tyme bisshops clerkys dyde awey barred gyrdels gaye blasynge clothes giraldus de pontificibus capitulo 17 lowys fyrst wif hirmēgard gate thre sonnes lotharius one hem crouned pope paschal ester day fader made hym kyng ytaly felowe thempyre made lowys seconde regne germania pipinus thyrd guyan gaskoyn seconde wyf iudyth doughter duc bauaria gate charles balled yaue hym burgoyn gouerne rewle wil de r li 2 fader loued moost balled charles kyssyd hym oft sight bretherē lothariꝰ wroth indignaciō therof therfor pursued ofte fader put hym prison gi • vbi su also lowys mild oft diseased owne men til dyde wysely rew • lyd royame sternly sayth happed hym wyf iudytha nygh kyn w de p li 1 therfor whan kynge auaunced one fredericus bisshopriche vtrecht fryselonde sate hym meete fyrste daye ordenaunce right honde chargyd bysshoppe amonge thynges sholde haue mynde yonge bisshop folowe stablenesse antecessours shold purpose sothe withoute accep •• persones punysshe mysdoers bisshop answerd sayde syr thou dost ryghfully comfortest •• ndernes profession hooly counseyll loore b • praye greue youre mageste though 〈◊〉 openly hath long tyme walowed herte whe •••• honeste atame fysshe sette fyrst 〈…〉 atte tayll kynge wyst fast greued 〈◊〉 self answerde hastely sayde atte hede fysshe shal 〈◊〉 fyrst attamed soo lord emperour quod b • sshop 〈◊〉 fayth may fyrst make seece thyne errours 〈…〉 hardy forsake see suffre take 〈◊〉 forsake thou vnlawful wedlok thou hast made 〈◊〉 thylke iudytha worde heuy kynge 〈…〉 toke aworth worde sprang wel wyde gladed men • holy chirche herde therof counseyl made therof dede wedlok vndo kynge 〈◊〉 doune self woman closed abbaye atte last myldenes court rome ordeyned better counseyl dome penaunce shold sett sholde tyme vse lawful wedlok emperour forpa •• gladly alle wronges lete sentence passe womā hyred two knyghtes slough forsayd bisshop f • ymentis songe masse gir de p capitulo 〈◊〉 atte last lowys yaf sone charles balled· goten iudytha almayne rethyca therfor othe • thre bretheren indignacion wroth forsoke lowys helpe galles made tholdest sone lotharius kyng prisoned fader lowys assente fourth pope gregory exiled faders wyf iudyth • put sone charles bassed castel prynge sone afterward prynces fraū ce delyuerden kynge acorded hym sone counseyll pipinus fals men acused falsely quene iudyth made menchon yere kyng quene ageyne helpe pope bernard purgyd hym lawfully spousebreche hym born honde soo none hem accused hym hardy ayenst hym stryue ¶ leo fourth steuen pope thre yere ¶ hym paschal pope seuen yere crouned lotharius made gaderynge monkes grece rome chirch praxede willelmus de regibus libro primo et de pontificibus libro quarto kenulphus kynge mercia deyde sone kenelme childe seuen yere old regned fewe monethes entysyng suster quendreda kenel slayne one heskebertus thyk wode founden pyler light stode vp body heuene scrowe wreton englyssh golden lettres culuer brought beyde vp seynt peter auter redde englisshman present ¶kenelms deth place deth knowen rome r ¶ scrowe wreton maner clente co • bache kenelm kynebern lyeth vnder thorn heued weued englysshe vsed saye cleut couuale vnder thorn kenelm lyeth hedeles slayne fraude thenne whanne kenelms bodye born graueward fro place deyde ynne gylty deth herde men synge putte oute heede wyndowe seece gladnes syngars sayde psalme deus laudem bacward note wytchecrafte • shrewdnes wolde meene loste bothe eyen rennyng dropes bloode bloode yet seen mynde goddes wreche sauter book held thenne honde ¶ capitulum 30 kenelm eme faders syde colwulfꝰ regned mercia two yere beornulphus tyraunt put hym regned stede two yere tyme ouer come elyndon egbertus kyng westsaxons sayd fore honde meuyd iourney ayenst est angle holpen egbertus slayn hem successour neigh kynnesman ludecan wold aueng deth fought ayenst eest angle slayn hem also thre duke hym neyh kynnesman wyglanns regned xiij yere egbertus distourbed •• ng tyme pascal fourth eugenius pope four yere sente seynt sebastyans boone hildewynus abbot seynt denys eugenius valentinus pore four yere ¶ tyme childe swy thyne borne wynchestre dyde myracles hemstans deth valentinus fourth gregroy pope thyrten yere ¶ giral p ca 17 pope tyme theodulphus floures fyrst abbot floryace thenne bisshop orleans exyled cyte angeo assente kynge lowys whanne enemyes falsely accused hym thenne happed palmsondaye kynge passyd therforth made songe verse bygynneth maner gloria laus tibi sit soo forth dyte note vers kynge meuyd delyuerd brought hym rather grace tyme rabanus floures monk abbot meldens germania grete poete grete clerke dyuynyte yere dane spoylled ylonde shepeye besyde kente therfore kyng egbertus fought ayenst hem carrum chaced tolouse damoysel twelue yere old resseyued lordes body esterday fasted afterward six monethes contiunelly brede water absteyned ther thre yere maner mete drynke tourned ag • yn atte last comyn lyuyng also tyme somme mysdoers romayns sente soudan babylon shold come lord ytaly thenne come grete multitude strengthe spoylled rome made stable seynt peter chirche ond destroyed tuscia secilia atte last atte prayer requyrynge pope gregory gy mercia longobardys lowys gālles chaced hem oute tho londes countreyes sayled toward affryca drowned wel nygh euery chone yere deyde helmstan bisshop wynchestre seynt swythyn bisshop hym ¶ dane grete nauye londed place called cural amonge westbritons made confederacyon brytons wente gyder assaylled kynge egbertus londes w de r li 2 egbertus kyng west saxon deyde sone athulphus hete ethelwulfus regned xxij yere somtyme take norysshing helmstan bisshop wynchestre made hym subdeken atte last graūt leo pope made kynge wif osburgā owne botelers dought gate thre noble sone regned fader eueryche tyme toke hym yongest sone aluredꝰ went rome dwellyd one yere repayred nobly scole saxon sayd first ordeined kynge offa brente last yere fore hond also sawe outla lawes men dyde open penaunce doo theyr penaunce yren bounde thenne purchaced pope englysshmen shold neuer tyme countrey doo penaunce bondes sayd therfor graunted euery hows royame euery yere peny seynt peter tyme sente euery yere c marc rome c seint peter chirch c seynt paulus lyght honderd pope also delyuerd quytte chirches royamme al maner kynges trybute offred god tenth dele catel comyng ageyn fro rome twenty yere kyngdome spoused iudytha doughter charles balled brought hym englond sett trone bysyde hym ayenst maner kyngdome westsaxons oldest sone aroos ayenst many lordes grete dele kyngdom take oldest sone yet vnnethe stryf ceced amonge hem vsed quene shold haue suche worship wrath ethelburga kynge offas doughter hadde poysoned husbonde bryghtrycus ¶r also sone aluredus hadd euyl incurable sente yrlond heeled seint modwenna dwellyd therfor whanne chirch modwenna destroyed yrlond cam englond kynge yaf londe buylde two abbayes maydens one ardern pollyswortham yet dureth osytha athea maydens dwellyd seynt edyth kyng athulphus suster ¶ modwenna dwellyd somwhat tyme abbaye streueshale thennes wente thrryes rome deyde atte last ylond andreseye besides burton closed seuen yere ¶ yere dane slough many men lyndesaye eest englond kente ¶that yere deyde wyglaf kynge mercia yere regne thyrten buryed repyndon hadde goten wygmū dus wygmundus goten wistan martir w • glaf bertulphus kynge ouer mercia twelue yere sone bertsericus slough seynt wystan cruelly ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ sequitur capitulum 31 whan lowys dede oldest sonne lotharius emperour fyften yere fader lyue fader xviij yere party ytaly next alpes hete lotharingia name lotharius kingedome roos ayenst two bretheren lowes charles balled kyngdome guyan broder pipinus hold somtyme gir p ¶ fought fo • tanet lotharyus fled chaced soo grete slaughter eyther syde myght lenger withstonde enemyes sarasyns affryca spayne herde therof arayde hem tassaylle kyngdome romayns sone lowys myddel broder deyde charles balled helde thempyre somwhat tyme alone yere seynt bertilmeus body translated beneuentan ¶ gregory second sergius pope nyne yere hete fyrst o porci swynes mouth therfor tyme alle pope chaunged name thre skylles one whan cryst chees apostle chaunged name another chaunge name shold chaunge lyuynge thyrdde chosen excellent astate shal defowled fowle name· yere body seynt helene constantins moder buryed rome brought dyocise remēce fraunce yere norman cam fyrst fraunce water seyne ¶ yere bertulphus wytsontyde slough wyckedly seynt wystan body buryed rypyndon graue grauntsir wyglaf place slayne stode vp thyrtty dayes cleer pyler lyght sergius fyfthe le • pope fyue yere amended chirches paynyms destroyed cyte rome also men naples thāt fought see ayenst sarasyns made oryson den cuius dextera beatum petrum soo forth amended seynt peter chirche sayd oryson deus qui beato petro collatis clambus forth also made aluredus sone adoptiuus sone ethewulfus kynge westsaxons enoynted aluredus assent fader kynge afterward yere deyde bertulfus kynge mercia burdredus kynge hym wedded anone ethelwytha kyng athulphus doughter helpe adulfus made subget brytons middel lond bytwene mercia west see also burdredꝰ xxij yer regne put oute dane wente thenne rome lyued ful longe tyme atte scole saxon buryed seynt mary chirche also dane hadde spoylled london kente chaced king bertulphus ou er comen beten doune suthrey oclea kynge ethelwulfus yere lotharius themperour forsoke world shorn monk thabbay prunye deyde sowle grete stryf bytwene angle fendes stode sawe bodye haled hyther thyder monkes prayde fendes dryuen aweye ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ lotharius hadde ermengarda houwes doughter thre sone lefte hem hym one hete lowys hym bytoke kyngdome romayns ytaly hete lotharius hym bytoke royame fraunce thyrdde hete charles hym bytoke prouynce charles sone dede lowys lotharius deled royamme prouynce bytwene hem ¶ capitulum 32 second lowys somme men telle regned fyften yere marcus tellyth regned two twenty yere crowned sergius pope two sone lowis kyng norykes ben norman charles yonger heete grossus akso charles tormented fende thre dayes presence fader knowleched tormented conspyred ayenst fader willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ lowys tyme iohan scot come fraunce translated denys bookes grue latyn atte prayer kynge charles made boke perefision book departyng kynde kynge aluredus sente hym shold come englond soo dyde taught child malmesbury whiche childeren stykked hym deth poyntels yere seynt edmunde bygan regne ouer eeste angle slayne fourtenth yere ethelwulfus kyng west saxon deyde thyrtenth day ianiuer buryed wynchestre hym oldest sonne ethelwaldus regned one yere· wonder whan fader dede wedded oune stepmoder ayēst lawe vsage holy chirche buryed shirburn ¶ marianus pope leo iohan englyssh pope two yere fyue monethes hit sayd iohan englysshe woman yongthe ladde lemman mannes clothynge atthene lerned dyuerse scyences soo ther cam rome hadde grete men scolers redde ther thre yere thenne chosen fauour al men lemman brought childe knewe time whan sholde haue child wente seynt peter chirche seynt iohan lateran byganne trauaylle childe childe bytwene collosen seynt clements ¶ treuisa collosen place ymages prouinces londes sayd fyrst book capitulo 24 thenne foloweth story buryed pope torned oute weye men suppose hate wonder myshappe pope rekened booke pope woman ought pope born magounce almayn vpon ryn aboute tyme kynge bulgares men tourned crystes feyth byleue parfyt bytoke royamme oldest sonne bytoke hym self thabyt monk whanne sonne torned maumetrye torned chyualry ageyn pursued sonne toke hym putte oute bothe eyen leyde prisonne closed made yonger sonne kynge toke holy habyte ageyn ¶after ethelwaldus broder ethelbertus kyng west saxon fyue yere tyme grete hooste dane destroyed wynchestre slayne kynges duke er might retorne theyr shippes ¶ iohan thyrdde benet pope four yere ¶ seynt swythyn bisshop wynchestre deyde dunbertus bisshop hym hem tweyn ben wondres redde ¶after benet fyrst nychol pope viij yere lykened grete gregory tyme cyrillus thappostle sclaues brought seynt clements bodye oute cersona rome leyd seynt clements chirche deyde ther dyde many myracles ¶ yere lowys kynge fraunce wolde leue rightful wyf lemman waldrada moche louyd yongthe faders hows ¶ thenne pope nychol atte instaunce quenes bretheren pleyned hym dede sente tresorer arsenius fraunce made counceyl bisshops compellid kyng take wyf ageyne made swe •• vp booke sholde neuer take woman whan legate rome goo kinge putte awey quene toke ageyne waldrada therfor playne consistory pope cursyd waldrada al comende r marianus tellyth lotharius lowys etheldredus thyrdde broder byrthe kynge westsaxons two bretheren eyght yere fyrst yere grete nauy dane londed eest englond laye yorke compellyd defende hem self whanne northumbres awey kyng osbrucus deuyl hem radde made tyraunt kynge hete ella atte laste drede enemyes somdele ceeced wente wyth theyr eyther kynge fyght ayenst dane compellyd hem fle cyte yorke ful wel walled thēne northumbres disarayd hem self werryd vnwysely beten doune somme one place somme another kynges slayne myght escape made pee dane soo fayled kynges northumberlond yere dane lefte northumberlond come kyngdome mercia dwellyd al yere snotyngham nowe callyd nothyngham burdredus kynge mercia kynge westsaxons cam ayenst hem dane within strengthe tour wolde yeue bataylle englyssh men myght spede breke wal thenne pee made kynges torned home ayene dane wente ayen yorke dwellyd al yere ¶after nychol second adryan pope two yere hym second lowys kynge fraunce somtyme acursyd pope nychol wrote lettres prayd hym wolde resseyue hym grace pope wrote hym maner ageyne yf thou knowe thy self gyltles come rome yf thou knowe thy self gylty make redy doo worthy penaunce thenne kynge come pope axyd yf holden oth pope nycholas heestes kynge fautours sayd yes al atte ful thenne quod pope ye must come v ye vnyed cristes lymes whiche ye kyt departed whan masse doo hou • cled h • saide yf ye gyltles comyng remission foryeuenes ellys damp nacion thenne happed none hem alle lyued ouer yere kyng anone taken sekenes deyde cyte placencia fyll grete pestylence peple yere dane destroyed cyte aclint wente oute northumberlond ecstenglond laye al yere tetford ¶that yere hungar hubba two dane slough seynt edmond kynge eglyston willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶seynt edmondes heede laye hyd amonge busshes spak hem sought countrey langage seide ther wolf founden beclypped kynges heede folowed mekely men cam theder willelmus de regibus et de pontificibus libro secundo sleynge kynge broder • edwoldus hated lykynge world hard fortune toke hym broder lyued heremytes lyf breede water atte abbaye cern dorsete clere welle seynt austyn prayer made sprynge somtyme cristen peple tourned crysten byleue hit falleth ful ofte gentil herte warned hard happes meschyef world tourneth besyly god begyle begyled abbaye bylde afterward ryche ynough yf shold gouerne hit deled goddes seruauntes glotons tyme couetyse pryde hath chaunged al thynge englond thynges yeue abbayes old tyme ben wasted glotonye outrage owner sustenaunce helpe nedy men ghestes certaynly yeuers shal lese mede wylle entente weyed goddes balaunce ¶ capitulum 33 thyrdde lowys regned fraunce fader secunde lowys four yere ¶willelmus de regibus libro secunde ¶ yere hooste dane lefte este englond come theyr duke hungar hubba towarde redynge westsaxons thyrd day coming two duke dane wente take prayes slayne engelfeld fourth daye two bretheren kynges westsaxons mette gyder made grete slaughter dane atte laste dane brake oute tour slough ethelwulfus duc barrokshyre compellyd thenglysshmē wende bak shame englysshmen meuyd arayed batayll fourth daye ther vppon asshdoun aluredus dryue grete nede come bataylle fore broder kynge herde masse tyme whiche kynges prayer god daye moche worth though dane taken hyther place hille crysten men come foote hylle vpward ayenste hem slough osryk kyng dane fyue duke many thousandes enemyes chaced al day vnto redynge fourtenth day basynge dane yaf batayll ageyne two monethes ther merton vyctorye mene tyme kynges mercia northumberlond eest angle wylle suffre lordship westsaxons therfor hem leuer susteyne enemyes fauoure hem syege helpe owne countrey men trauayled londe therfore enemyes encrecyd maystrye men lond ouer come bare doune made doole sorowe nexte yere ther many batayls etheldredus kynge westsaxons deydr eyght dayes fore maye buryed wynburn ¶ adryan eygth iohan pope twelue yere ¶in tyme dwellyd lowys balbus kynge fraunce al yere prysoned romayns wolde fauoure charles also pope yaue ansegysus bisshop senons grete gregoryes heede pope leo armefor doo hem chirche tyme pope fyfthe synode constantinople made thre honderd lxxiij bisshops also tyme sarasyns pryked ytaly destroyed seynt benet abbay mount cassyn thenne seconde tyme ¶ explicit liber quintus ¶ incipit liber sextus ¶ capitulum primum aluredus fourth brother byrthe euer holden behynde whyle bretheren regned hem hoole kyngedome westsaxons nyne twenty yere ruled nobly grete trauail take heede begynnynge forth goynge last ende aluredus fayre shappe loued fader moder bretheren dwellyd faders courte yere age twelue yet lettred yet chylde lerned ryght wele helde saxon poesy • mynde passed men crafte huntynge subtyll maister buildynge werkes gadred psalmes orysons gyder lytel book called book manuel hand booke hadde book alwey symple gramaryon tyme one techer gramer al kyngdom therfor counseyl neotus abbott whome vysyted ryght ofte fyrste ordeyned comyn scole oxenford dyuers artes seyences procured fredome pryueleges many article cyte suffred noman take degre ordre maner dygnyte holy chirche wel lettred tourned beste lawes englyssh tong atte last auentred translate sawter englysshe translated vnneth fyrste part byfore deth whanne come age wolde stable hert thought goddes heestes lechery flessh greuyd hym lette hym • e tyme therfor putte awey temptacion flesshely lykynge wente vysyted oft temple hooly sayntes erly late cokkes crowyng prayd god wolde chastyse flessh suche sekenesse sholde vnprofytable worldly dedes myght frely serue god almyghty goddes ordenaunce many yere euyl called fycus ¶atte lastehe hoope heeled wente cornewayle seynt suerons chirche seynt neotus resteth owther ceese owther chaunge ¶ r somme men saye seynt modwenna yrysshe mayde heled hym euyll atte last whanne wyll wors euyll toke hym wedded tyme greued hym wel twenty yere fyue fourty yere quene ethelswyda bare hym ij sonnes edward elder egelward thre doughters elfleda lady mercia ethelgota menchon elf • yda made hem alle lerne gramer fre artes scyences aluredus yeuer almes herer mass sought besyly loore arte craftees knewe sent seynt gyrmbald monk connyng man letture song prayde hym come hym oute fraunce englond also sente iohan monke seynt dauid abbaye meuenia come hym oute wale teche hym clergye exyted comforted lordes lond lerne letture ānd clergye shold sette theyr child scole yf childer shold graūte bonde men fredome sette hem scole yf good wytte able lerne enquyred • spyed besyly doynge dedes offycers seruauntes namely iugges domesmen yf myght vnderstande erryd dyde amysse whether vnconnynge couetise put oute offyce ¶ also made werfredus bisshop worsetre translate saxon speche gregoryes bookes dyalogus de regibus libro primo departed thre alle myght spende yet departed fyrst part thre twey partyes kynges ministres home ordeyne homly thynges thyrdde moneth euery partye companye howsholde shuld serue byfore hym assygned second part fyrst part dyuers werkmen gadred oute euery syde thyrd pa • te deled comer straungers second chyef parte myght spende departed foure fyrst part therof yaue poure men nedy second • foundynge abbayes thyrd scolers oxenford gadred shuld gadred fourth parte amendyng chirches wolde weye owne lif right departed thre four twenty howres day nyght spende eyght therof wrytynge redynge byddyng bede eyght aboute bodyly nedes eyght nedes kyngdome departe thes howres redyly h • sette candel chapel four twenty partyes shold warned ordeyned therfore ofte ony thylke four twenty spente moneth kyngdome fought dane wyl̄ton grete harme hoostes englissmen destroyed eyght batayllis one yere moche febled therfore engli • shm • n made yere pee dane coneuaunt shold wende hem dyde yere dwellid london nexte yere lindesaye merces made pee dane also tyme thirde yere dane brake pee wente oute lind • seye r • • yndon charles elder third lowes broder toke weye rome whanne broder dede crowned emperour pope iohan regned two yere whyles ordeyned papye comune prouffyt empyre herde comynge charlemayne owne broders sonne herte byganne falle drede wente towarde fraunce deide amonge grete hilles called alpes hym sonne lowys balbus regned two yere charles yonger called grossus grete sone thirde lowys regned ten yere yere dane lef • e lindeseye cam rependon putte oute burdredus kynge mercia bitoke kyngdom one colwulfus burdredus seruaunt vpon suche condicion sholde haue kingdome ayene whanne wolde thre yere departed somme kyngdome bitwene hem somme lefte colwulfus colwulfus last kyng mercia ¶after deth aluredus ioyned london first colwulfus part owne kyngdome also yere dane cam ofte rependon men hamburgh fyue myle fro rependon wonder soore aferd toke body seynt werburgh mayde hadde long tyme ley buryed alwey hool soūde vnto tyme translated chestre seker place ¶also yere kynge aluredus made pee dane slough kynges horsmen al one nyght ¶therfore kynge meoued chaced hem vnto chestre dane delyuerd yaue efte pledge dwellyd yere ¶ henricus libro quinto yere rollo dane cam fyrst normandye regned fourty yere ¶willelmus de regibus libro 2 first one hastynges rollo noricus dane countrey owne heste kynge • xyted mysdo •• coneyted mennes goddes catayls brought hem grete hoope grete wynnyng led hem warryd lond see brittyssh occean vnto see called mare tirenum see stretcheth ytaly thenne come carnotum cy • eseyns trust walles nowther strength toke lady smocke charles balled brought relyques constantinople sette smocke vpon pynacle baner enemyes scorned smock ands hotten ther smyten blyndenes roll escaped occupyed rothomage yere oure lorde eyght honderd lxxvij one yere byfore deth charles balled sonne lowys ouercome norman put hem oute· charles simplex otherwyse callyd grossus lowys broder neuew charles balled oft ouersette batayllis rollo toke counseyl atte laste acorded rollo· soo sholde cristened knowlege helde n • omādye armorica lytel britayne kynge fraunce chyef lorde whanne doo men stode counseylled rollo sholde kysse kynges feete yafe hym suche yefte hadde indignacion prowde falle downe knee toke vp kynges foote mouth soo threwe kynge vpright hap norman beganne laugh frensshmen waxe right wroth rollo excusyd hym boystous dede alledged manere vsage countreye thanne rollo wente ayene rotomage ordeyned catell thynges deyde sone therafter ¶ capitulum secundum lowys balbus regned fraunce two yere first yere dane sailed warham towarde • xcestre lost •• x score shippes tempeste see somme dane occupyed royal cyte chypenham countreye chaced awey many englysshemen owther made subgette meschyef tyme king aluredus fewe men ledde vncertayne vnnesy lyf wode countreyes somersete right nought lyue myghte wynne prayes owther huntyng owther fyss • yng • ¶ tyme whyle felawes fysshynge comforted vncertayn vnstidfast lyf comfort • okes ¶ pylgrym cam hym axed almes goddes name kynge lyft vp handes heuen sayde thank god vysyted pore man daye pore mā wol vouchsauf day axe hath yeuen restore ageyne encreace axeth anone kynge called seruaunt hadde one looff lytel wyne hadde hym yeue half therof pore man pore man thanked hym vanysshed sodenly awaye noo steppe seen goynge nesshe ¶ also alle yeuen hym founden hoole • sounde ffysshynge brought grete plentye ffysshe ¶ thenne whanne kynge slepynge one appered hym bisshops wede charged hym shold loue god kepe ryghtwysenesse merciable ayenst pore men worship • preestes sayd moore myne aluredus cryst knoweth thy conscyence thy wyll putteth ende thy sorowe care morow stronge helper shal helpe hem thou shalt ouercome thyne enemyes art thou sayde kynge cutberth sayde thy pylgrym yisterdaye whome thou yaue breede wyn besy thyne haue mynde herof whanne wele made mynde pylgrym fredom possession chirche durham sene willelmus de regibus libro 2 ¶than aluredus cam oute prysonne putte hym peryll grete fraude gyle wente kynge dane pauylons tentes myustralles weede espyed wolde come ageyne ethelynge declared felawe slewthe enemyes ¶ thenne fylle sodenly enemyes slough moo hem wolde trowe daye cam hym men wyl • shir merse • te hampshyre ¶ helpe hem buylde tour ethlynge saye englysshe vsed ylelande noble men oute tour • e • eesed ofte enemyes ouercome hem namely besyde • selwode grete wode englysshe vsed receyued hostage pledgis best wold • ch • ese guttrun kynge dane crysten • twenty grettest hym ¶the whiche kynge alfredus receyued colde water yaue hym name callyd hym adelstan therfor kynge guttrun calle gurmundus yeuen prouynces eest angle northumberlonde dwelle ynne blewe man chaungeth lyghtly skynne guttrun destroyed landes tyrannye pryde enleuen yere dyede twellyfth yere ¶ danys wolde crysten wente fraūce place hete ethlyng ethelyngeseye ilelande see standeth water marreys moore soo maye come ther shippe owther boote ¶ place conteyneth vnnethe space twey dayes iourney erthe breede yet ben wylde beestes veneson ¶ charles yonger otherwyse callyd grossus grete thyrdde lowys sonne regned fraunce came lowys balbus ten yere wente oute almayne occupyed ytaly fyue dayes cam rome sacred emperour pope iahan tyme byganne erldomme flaundrys tyme flaundrys grete name ruled kynges forsters fraunce also charles putte fro hym wyf semed pryue bisshop versell ¶therfore kyng fraunce knowleched openly hymself hadde neuer leyne flessbely gladde maydenhode wente abbaye whanne forsaken atte laste tenthe yere kyngdome charles wente oute fraunce ytaly poysoned iewe callyd sedechias dyed atte hilles alpes ¶ranulphus ¶ semeth charles maryed doughter gilla hadde rather wyf duc rollo graunted hir ducheryes normandye lytel brytayne ¶ willelmus de pontificibus libro secundo also yere dyede du • bertus bisshop wynchestre kynge aluredus made dunewolfus bisshop stede founde woode hydynge tyme kepyng • beestes whanne knewe good wylle g • e • • age putte hym scole lerne lettrure clergye yere kyng aluredus amended cyte septon shaftesbury greete stone wytnessyth chapytre hows nonnes lyeth aboue erthe ¶ iohan martyn pope one yere relessyd scole saxon al maner trybute atte prayer kynge aluredus ¶ also sen • te aluredus grete parte hooly crosse marty • agapitus pope one yere yere dane cam ou •• fraunce besyeged rochestre buylde tour ayenst • yates cyt • cyteseyns defended cyte til • aluredus come toke alle horse dane compellyd hem flee thenne dane wente fraunce ayene kyng sente nauy full men armes oute kente eest englond toke sixten shippes dane comyng ageyne kynges nauye ouercome • ¶treuisa ¶ eeste engelonde conteyneth northfolke southfolke looke herof fyrste booke capitulo iji ¶ foloweth storye yere dane rowed water seyne besyeged parys yere hoole yere aluredus reparayled london bytoke k • pynge etheldredus erle mercia ¶ englysshmen disparpled yaf hem self kyng aluredus ¶ tyme kynge sente almes rome inde buylde twey abbayes one men ethelyngesley another woman shaftesbury made doughte • etholgof abbe agapytus thyrdde adryan • pope one yere hym basilius one yere hym stephen six yere ¶ capitulum 3 charles grossus poysonned iewe sayd bifore wexed strongly seke therfor arnulphus sonne brother charleman chosen kynge whanne charles deede ordeyned fyue kynges empyre leste arnulphus crowned atte laste formosus pope bete downe normās dane werrid fraūce xl yere aatte last hard holden stronge sekenesse myght heled ne saued maner medycyne destroyed eten lyse ryght deth franco archebisshop rothomage crystened rollo kynge guttrun deede ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ res norman dane seynt • tyus body translate turon seynt germayns chirche altissiodor many myracles done monkes turon altissiodore pleted thofferyng saynt sholde deme whether hem hadde ryght thofferyng brought forth leper heled one syde bodye warde seynt martyn parte bodye lefte foule heled ¶ sholde wene happyly byfalle tourned foule syde toward saynt martyn anone heled also monkes turon hadde offerynge till werre seeced hadde owne saynt hoome ageyne owne hows ¶ befel maner power seynt germayne spared dide gheste reuerence owne hows ¶henricus libro quinto yere cam four hoostes dane ayenst aluredus one northūmberlonde another eestenglonde conteyneth norffolk southfolk thyrdde excestre fourth chestre chestre dane soo besyeged ete horse honger ¶thre scottysmen dusblay mahbon malmmyn desired lede pylgryms lyf toke hem lyueloode one weke toke akarabum • oote made twey huydes half wente therinne wonderly withoute sayle withoute rother oore al maner tacle shipcraft cam londe cornewayle seuen dayes come kyng aluredus ¶ steuen fo rmosus pope fyue yere somtyme drede pope iohan lefte bisshopryche portune whan callyd wolde come ageyn cursyd atte last come pope iohan degraded vnto state lewd man also made swere sholde neuer tourne ayene hi • bisshopryche nowther come cyte rome atte last restored ageyne pope martyn pope iohannis successour ¶plegmundus archebisshop caunterbury noble man clergye receyued palle formosus pope ordeyned seuen bisshops chirches englond one day ¶ yere kyng aluredus chaced dane furste oute kente excestre chichestre henricus libro quinto ¶ dane chestre besyeged thre dayes compellyd honger leue cyte spoylled northwales wente soo northumberlonde eest englonde wyues theyr shippes entryd ryuer luys buylde castel fast londoner helpe kynge destroyed castel departed ryuer thre chanels stremes soo dane myghte brynge oute theyr shippes dwellyd atte brydge vpon seua • n faste wale buylde stronge castel soo thre yere englond harde bysette thre manere sorowe warre dane moreyue men pestylence beestes ¶ formosus bonefas pope fyften dayes ¶after hym sixth steuen one yere thre monethes ther lefte papacye made monke somtyme made bisshop angum pope formosus afterwarde whanne pope pursued soo formosus withsayde doyng dedes also lette take vp formosus whanne deede oute erthe made men brynge hym playne consistorye clothed pope made men vnclothe hym take hym manere clothynge clothe hym lewde man kytte twey fyngars ryght honde caste hym tyber ¶ steuen romanus pope foure monethes lowys arnulphus sonne regned fraunce twelue yere hadde neuer crowne empyre hym ende empyre▪ towchynge charles ofsprynge tyme fyue pope theodorus iohan benette leo crystofor hem theodorus seconde though pope one monethe yet aroos ayenst pope steuens doyng wi • hsayd dedes confermed dedes pope fromosus nynth iohan pope twoo yere made counseyll rauenna dampned pope steuenes dedes fought ayenst romayns willelmus de libro secundo yere deyd kyng aluredus fyrst buryed cathedral chirch wynchestre madnesse rauynge chanons sayde spyryts kynges taken careyn walke aboute nyght hows hows sonne edwarde toke faders bodye dyde newe abbaye suche lewde tale englysshmen holden mysbyleue hath full longe dured borowed mysbyleuyd men ¶ trowe mannes deth bodye walketh goth aboute menyng fende ¶ therof spekyth vyrgyl sayd whanne deth cometh semyng shappes fleeth aboute ranulphus ¶ praysynge kynge henricus libro primo wryteth versus maner kyndly noblesse goodnesse yeueth worshipe goodnesse trauayle myghty werryour aluredus trauayle name withoute ony ende ioye woo medled hadde euery tyme alweye thyne hoope medled greete drede though nowe downe arayd bataylle morowe yf vyctor dradde bataylle morowe trauaylle lyf regnynge bothe veray reste cryste withoute ende ¶ marianus libro secundo ¶ capitulum 4 edward elder surname regned fader four twenty yere lower fader worshiy lettrure hygher wordly ioye worshippe buylde newe cytees repayred citees apayred spradde endes kyngdome wydder dyde fader made kynges scottes cumbres walsshmen yelde hem hym wanne essex northumberlonde mercia strengthe oute handes dane hadde al mercia deth suster elfleda ¶ fyrst wyf egwyna gate oldest soune edelstan quene edgyna gate edredus edwynus seuen doughters maryed one hem otho emperour another charles kynge weste fraunce thyrdde sythyrycus duc northumberlond ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo thyrd wyf ethelswyda bygate edmonde edrede eyther hem regned broder ethelstan bygate also two doughters seynt edburgh sacred· god restyth wynchestre ¶ edgyna fayr maryed lowys kynge guyan ¶ also made sonnes lerne lettrure made hys doughters fyrste lerne lettrure made hem vse nylde dystaf willelmus de pontificibus libro secundo mayde edburga redde whan thre yere olde hir fader wolde wytte essay whether wolde tourne god owther worlde leyde one syde chambre many • ay • • wels dyuers greete ryches syde chalyce gospel another place p • tt besauntes broches rynges thanne noryce brought forth chyld childe boden chese take wolde crepte honde foote toke gospel fader kyssed childe sayd goo thyder god clepe •• sewe hym gracious foote ledeth soo ther made nonne kynges bloode neuer made torne aweywarde wolde take shoe sustres pryuely bx nyghte wasshe hem smere hem brynge hem pryuely ageyne sygnefyed mekenes iohan fourthe benette pope thre yere also yere seynt gyrmbald confessour kyng aluredus techer dyed wynchestre ¶ yere plegmundus archebisshop cyte dorob • rnia caunterbury ordeyned seuen bisshops chirches englonde fyue lande guyseyes westsaxons one wynchestre one cornewayle one shirburn one welles one kyrton also amonge southsaxons one mercia one dorkyngam dorchestre besydes oxenford formosus pope hadde yeuen cours kynge edward englysshmen cause scarsete bisshops londe hadde bisshoples seuen yere geder yere breede fayled irlonde wormes twey tothed lyke wontes fylle doune fro heuene ete breede corne wormes done aweye prayenge fastynge ¶ clyto ethelwoldus kynge edwardes • ames sonne roo • rebellyd ayenst kyng occupyed cyte wynburn besides bath sayd wolde haue maystrye owther dye rauesshyd toke hym nonne thabbaye wynburn wente then dane northumberlond prayde hem helpe kynge pursued hym soo strongly forsoke englond fled fraunce kynge brought hym nonne ageyn restored abbay ¶ yere ethelwulfus come ageyne shippes grete aray toke hym dane dwellyd eeste englond assayled destroyed al myght fynde vnto crekanford cryklade thenne passed temse spoylled robbed londe bradenestok soo wente ayene eestenglond conteyneth northfolk southfolk sayd byfore ofte tyme kyng folowed destroyed spoylled londe enemyes ryuer ous boundes seynt edmundes lande badde men none hem sholde abyde behynde kentysshmen forgendryd
