kynges heest abode slayne nygh dane many slayne eyther syde ¶ clyto ethelwoldus slayn amonge enemyes dane sawe kynge edward myght ouercome made pee hym bene • hee fyfthe leo pope twey monethes prest crystofor prysonned hym toke papasye maystry cast oute fourth moneth fourth sergius putt oute crystofor pope ther seuen yere somtyme deken cardynal reprouyd formosus pope wente frensshmen helpe hem prisoned crystofer gate th • poperyche helde strengthe hym self occupyed poperyche wreche puttyng made men take vp formosus pope oute graue smyte heede threw body tyber atte laste fysshers founde body brought seynt peter chirche ymages hooly sayntes dyd body grete reuerence worship comyng yere cyte caerleon legec • stria callid chestre destroyed dane restored ageyne helpe etheldredus duc mercia wyf e • fleda cyte closed aboute newe walles made nyghe suche two byfore ¶ soo castel somtyme water withoute walles toun within walles ranulphus kyng edward buyld castel herford tyme thabbay cluny founded wyliam mylde prynce burgoyn fyrste abbot place seynt odo second mayclus wi de p li 4 seyth fyrste monkes place ryche world clere relygyon god tyme etheldredus duc mercia wyf elfleda translated • bone seynt oswald kynge bardeny gloucestre buyld abbay worship seynt peter ¶ capitulum quintum conradus lowys made prynce amonge almayns emperour ytaly rekened among emperours ne enhaunced sacryng blessynges regned seuen yere yere bygan thempyre passe frensshmen almayns lowys predecessour myght defende romaynes ayenste longobardes thempyre passyd frensshmen soo twey emperours one almayne another ytaly vnto fyrst otho emperour bothe yere prouynce stafford toten hale englysshmen ouercome dane afterward wodenysfelde kyng edward slough dane twey kynges twey erles many thousandes dane northumberlond etheldredus duc leder vnder kyng mercia deyde wyf elfleda kyng edwardes suster regn • nobly longe tyme al mercia oute take london ox • nford whiche kynge helde hym selfward buylde many cytees townes amended many one brymmesbury bridge vpon seuarn thomworth besydes lychefelde stafford warwyk sheresbury watrisbury edysbury forest besyde chestre al destroyed also bylde cyte castel north endes mercia vpon ryuer merce named runcofan called runcorn willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ strong vyrago elfleda fauour cyteseyn • drede enemyes halpe moche kyng hir broder yeuyng counseyl buyldyng cytees whanne one assayed wo sorowe one childe bare hated enbracyng man euermore toke wytnesse god sayde semely kynges doughter vse flesshely lykynge suche sorowe shold come • er theues dane wente oute englond fraunce aboute nynten yere byfore come ageyne englond sayled aboute cornewayle come seuarn see toke prayes teke bryttyssh bisshop irchenfelde whiche bisshop kynge edward raunsoned fourty pound chaced enemyes yrlond made castel atte mouth water auene castels bokyngham eyther syde ryuer ouse made subget dane dwellyd betford northhampton kynge turketillus anastasius pope two yere hym lando pope fyne monethes ¶that yere hungaryes ryuer danubins destroyed ytaly tenth iohan pope fourten yere pope sergius sonne bisshop rauen helpe albericus markys put sauasyns oute ytalye atte laste fyl stryf discorde bytwene hem pope put markys oute cyte therfor wroth brought hungaryes destroyed ytalye therfore markys • slayn pope straungled markys knyghtes yere deyde rollo fyrst duc normandye fourtenth yere duchery sone wiliam longa spata duc hym fiue twenty yere elfleda quene mercia toke prayes londe brytons brechnok toke kynges wif wale ren • wed legecestre chestre kynge edward bylde cytees toucetre wygmore destroyed castel dane made temesforde elfleda toke cyte derby vpon dan • hir four mynystres slayn harry sone duc otho saxō regned eyght • n yere ouer almayns ytaly therfor acōpted amonge emperours ouercome hungaryes torned feyth duc normandy wiliam longa spata longa spata longe swerde englysshe ¶will de regibus libro secundo yere deyde elfleda eygten dayes byfore iulij fyue yere byfore deth broder kyng edward buryed gloucestre saynt peter chirche hir husbōd bylde vpon kynge oswaldes boone brought thyder bardeny dane destroyed chirche aldredus bisshop yorke worcestre reparayled another chyef abbay cyte kynge edward toke power mercia elswyna doughter elfleda ledde hir hym westsaxon r ¶in praysyng elfleda henricu • libro quinto elflede myghty mayde mennes drede vyctryce kynde wele worthy name mā wele bryghter kynde hath made mayde go • dnes hath mayde haue name man kynde techeth chaunge nothynge name myghty kynge quene victoryes arraye cesars tryumphes soo moche worthy nobler cesar mayde vyrago fare wele whan kynge edward herde deth suster made subget hym thom worth snotyngham nothyngham byld newe cyte south syde right ayenst olde cyte sette brygge vpon trente bytwene twey cyte • ther yere twey kynges yelde hem frely hym· kynges scotlonde dane wale yere kynge edwarde buyld cyte thylwal north endes mers • water mersee sette kepynge knightes passed water mersee restored cyte manchestre south endes northumberlond kynge edward dyed faryndon twelue myle west oxenford buryed wynchestre newe abbay ¶ capitulum sextum edelstan kynge edwardes oldest sonne made kynge kyngeston besydes london southrey • e regned sixten yere fyrst yere noble childe dunstan borne coutreye glastenbury al lyf endynge daye shone vertues myracles alfredus kynge edelstan maryed sus • er sithricus kynge dane northumberlonde sythrycus dyed sone kynge put oute sythrycus sonne ioyned kyngdome owne bataylle made subgett ho • lu kyng brytons constantyn kynge • scottes receyued h • whan yolden kyng ethelstan made constantyn kynge scotlond constantyn sayde worship make kynge kynge ¶willelmus de regibus libro secundo also kynge ethelstan maryed suster otho emperour receyuyd horse precious stone maner vessel stone callyd onychynus clere bryght letted passynge lyght nowther syghte made subtylly grauynge crafte semed veryly corn growynge therynne waued hyder thyder longe corne doth feldes vynes bourgened ymages men meoued also receyued grete constantynes swerde swerde owner name redde lettres gold hylte therof grete plate golde stykked four yron nayles cryst nayled roode receyued hym grete charles spere euer whan charles shoke spere hadde maystrye sayth spere opened crystes owne syde seynt moris baner baner charles vsed ayenst sarasyns also receyued parte holy crosse somme thorned crowne kyng ethelstan ordeyned somme relyques abbay malmesbury mar sixth leo pope four yere vij monethes odo made bisshop wylton willelmus de pontificibus libro secundo frystan bisshop wynchestre deyde birstan bisshop hym byrstan redde sange euery day crysten sowles wente nyght aboute chirche yerde sayd salmes al crysten sowles whan al sayde sayde requiescant pace herde voys grete hoost answer oute graues sayd amen odo bisshop wynchestre made archebisshop dorobernia caunterbury steuen pope seuen yere odo bisshop wynchestre deede hym elphegus balled bisshop wynchestre man prophete nygh seynt dunstans kyn willel de pontificibus libro secundo asshe wonesdaye maner putte hem sholde doo open penaunce oute chirche charged men shold thylke dayes fast chast spare lykynge theyr wyues amonge hem al one spake sayde syr may tyme leue bothe feste wyf wyf haue putte awey tyme shall sone take ageyn wretche sayd bisshop thou makest soory thou knowest ordeyned ayēst morewe morn founden deed bedde also tyme ethelphegus made thre monkes preestes dunstan ethelwold ethelstan whanne seruyce done spak hem sayde day byfore god haue sette myne hande vpon thre men tweyne hem shal bisshops thirde shall make wretchid ende ethelstan homely cause kynrade spake sayd shal bisshop thou shalt haue part ordre sayd elphegus nowther thou shal bere longe clothynge ¶for constantyn kynge scottes hadde broken couenaunt kynge ethelstan arayd hym toward scotland inthe wey went pylgremage saint iohan beuerley leyd knyf wedde vpon seynt iohans auter sayd yf come ageyne vyctory shold raunsonne knyf worthy pry vyctory whanne come ageyne prayd god wolde thurgh prayer seint iohan beuerley shewe som open tokē token shal maye knowe scottes right shold subget englisshmen thanne kynge swerde smote grete stone faste castel dunbar stone yet day seen stroke chynne elne long kyng cam ageyn raunsonned kynf worthy doynge enleuenth iohan pope one yere hym seuenth leo pope thre yere six monethes lowys sone charles symple kynge edwardes doughter regned fraunce fader westfraunce nynten yere ¶ willelmus de r libro secundo ¶ tyme pursued one isenbardus axed helpe lordes londe yaf hym none answer hughe symple knyght erle robberts mount desyre toke wylfully bataylle lord slough hym withynne lystes wolde nedes fyght therfor sone ater whanne kyng feble made hugh heyr soo ceesed ofsprynge charles owther wyf barayne owther lyuede shorte tyme hugh wedded kynge edwardes doughter fyrst otho sonne fyrst harry fyrste emperour duchemen regned seuen tthyrty yere eester tyme made grete feste prynces lordes er seruyd prynces sonne toke messe bord childe shuld kynges sewer smote child staf childes mayster sawe slough sewer anone emperour wold haue dampned hym withoute audyence threwe downe emperour erth straungeled hym al moost emperour vnnethe delyuerd oute chyldes maystres handes whan bade saue chlides maysters lyf cryed sayd hym self blame hadde spared hym grete feste yere anlaf paynym kynge irlond many ylondes syhtricus sonne exytynge wyues fader constantyn kyng scotlande anlaf entred mouth ryuer humbre stronge nanye kynge edelstan brother edmond mette hym brymford willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶whan hoostes gadryd anlaf bythought hym queyn • gyle toke harpe hande cam ethelstanes tenth harper arraye ther atte mete tyme espyed wolde hadde money harpynge money ayenst hert buryed pryuely vnder hym erthe espyed one hadde somtyme soudyour anlaf warned ethelstan whan anlaf goo kynge blamed hym warned hym noo rather answerde sayd kynge feyth owe yaf anlaf somtyme therfor yf broken feyth hym thou woldest wene wolde doo another tyme take heede counseylle remeoue thy tent fro place whanne cometh vnwysely may fayle purpos thou may ouercome hym grete sobrenes doo anlaf cam hastely nyght wey slough bisshop remeoued tente meyny passed forth fylle kynges tente kynge waked soo grete noyse swerd fylle forth skaberd cryed god seynt aldelm atte prayer odo archebisshop kynge kynge fonde swerd fallen scaberd ayene swerde yet kepte kynges tresorye swerde keruyng one side reyceueth place neyther gold ne siluer yefte god kynge thenne holpen chaced enemyes al dawynge al daye morow kynge constantyn slayne fyue smal kynges twelue duke wele nygh al gadrynge straunge nacions chaced north brytons herford soo shuld pay hym euery yere twenty pound gold thre honderd pound syluer fyue twenty honderd heede neete thān toke subiection cornugallia amended excetre ¶ praysynge hym one made dyte ¶ kynges bloode brought forth full noble knyght bryght precious stone tho byshone derk bryght grete ethelstanus hight lande path ryght noble worthynes sothe forsake ne myght leo thyrd martyn pope thre yere six monethes also yere ethelstan dyed gloucet • e hadde chylde buryed madulf ¶ marianus capitulum 7 athelstan brother edmundus biganne regne twenty yere age regned aboute seuen yere bygate quene elgina twey sonnes edwyn edgar pesyble ¶willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ edwyns tyme northumbres rebellyd sente anlaf oute irlond kynge edmund ouercome hym reynold gurmundus sonne outlawed hem toke northumberbond owne lordship bete doune combreland rebell yaf malcolyn kyng scotlande soo shulde helpe hym euery place ¶r • semeth iourneye kynge edmond toke hym boone colfrydus abbot hylda thabbesse brought hem glastenbury ¶ alfrydus sayth marianus also kynge seuenth yere kyngdome wolde delyuer sewer oute enemyes handes slayne hem right pulkerchirche ¶but willelmus de regibus libro secundo sayth kynge feste pulker churche seynt austyns day sawe one leof theef hadde exyled trespas sitte mete amonge men kynge lepte ouer borde toke theef hee • threwe hym grounde theef gloton knyf rente oute kynges bowel theef bytwene handes hem made noyse crye wounded slough many men alto bakked knyghtes men ¶ martyn seconde agapitus pope six yere yere lowys kynge fraūce sonne charles made william longa spa • slayn gylefully second duc normandye sonne rollo therfor lordes normandy▪ wroth toke kyng helde hym rothomage till promysed sworne sholde yelde normandy rychard duc wili • m sonne • uer tyme euery speche whanne kynge duc spak gyder duc sholde gyrde swerde kynge shold neyther • ere swerde ne knyf ducwyliams yonge sonne rychard duc yet whyle rychard yonge callyd richard olde withoute drede dradde neuer duc normandye two fyfty yere come duchery harde trauaylle grete wyf gunnora dane bygate fyue sonnes twey doughters fyrste callyd emma flour normandy hir fader maryed hyr etheldredus kynge englonde duc rychard vsed bydde bede euery chirche come namely withoute yf myght come chirche nyght cam chirche allone foūde corp ly • ther • bere man therwith hade bede laid gloues deske forgate hem wente weye thenne dede man aroos grete noyse spr • armes chirche dore ayenste duc duc made signe crosse forheede thombe coniured dede man shold reste al nought wolde duc swerde smote corp twey thought hym whan oute hadde forgeten gloues torned ayene fett gloues afterward ordeyned al lande aboute dede corp sholde watche al nyght longe ¶ happeth monke saynt ando • nu rothomage wolde nyght go lemman fyll downe brydge water drowned soule stryf bytwene aungel fende eyther hem put cause vppon duc rycharde • dome yaue suche dome soule sholde restored ayene body bodye sholde sette brydge whiche hadde fallen· yf wente doo synne sholde dampned ellys sholde saued whanne doo monke fledde chirche duc wente morowe chirche fonde monkes clothes yet al wete tolde thabbot place dede bifalle whanne duc gunnora hadde longe lyued dishonest • lyf peple spak moche therof· duc counseyll peple wedded hir atte laste fyrst nyght weddynge whanne come bedde whether game ernest gunnora torned hir bakke hir buttoks toward duc neuer byfore done axyd hir dyde soo fyrst sayd may doo lyketh also duc waxe seke vpon tyme made hym grete chyste fylled ful whete deled poure men energy fryday lyues ende henr edmond kyng englond toke wan oute dane handes paynyms fyue noble cytees lyncoln notingham derby stafford legecestre toke fro hem cytees paynyms caused cytees ryght byleue receyued anlaf cold water anlaf cristened strength preching goddes worde also ordeyned made ordenaunces amended shold amended counseyll dunstan made abbay glastenbury noble cataylle monkes r sayd byfore atte last dyed pulkerchirche buryed glastenbury ¶ marianus libro secundo ¶ capitulum octauum edredus euoynted kyngeston odo tharchebisshop regned broder edmond ten yere edmondes sone edwyn edgar yet yong age yong regne edredus fyrst yere kyngdom beet doun strōgly northumbres rebelles therfore scottes dradde hym yelde hym agapitus xij iohn pope viij yere fader alberycus myghty cyte rome made noble men cyte swere shold make sonne octauianus pope whan agapytus deed dyd chaunged name named hym iohan hū ter lecherous man soo helde wymen openly therfor cardynals wrote otho ēperour saxon prayd hym wolde come rome help aweye sklaunder holy chirche pope war therof kytt nose counseyllour hande wryter wrote lett oft warned thēperour clergye shold amende self wold deposed leo made pope stede whan thēperour gone benett made pope therfor thēperour cam ageyne besyeged rome till yelde benet hym restored leo ageyn lowys kyng westfraunce deed sone charles simple hym sone lotharius kyng xxxvij yere dyed without child pursued rychard duc normandye fader pursued wiliam fader mar last edredus vntruth northumbres destroyed lande brent thabbay rypon fyre whan kyng wente then home ward hoost brake york dyde grete harme last partye kinges hoost therfor king wroth thought destroy al northūberlond northumbres dyd awey hircus theyr kynge plesyd kyng yefces kyng edredus bygan soore seke sente goostly fader dunstan cam greete spede cam weye voys spak hym clerely sayd restyth kyng edredus pee voys hors dunstan sate fylle downe dyed withoute hurtynge hym sate aboue dunstan byryed kyng wynchestre old abbay kyng dyed without yssue edwynus kyng edmundus oldest sone enoynted kyng englond royal town kyngeston side london odo tharchebisshop fyrst day sacrynge fyll vnlawfull lechery therfor dunstan myssayed hym blamed hym therfor therfor exiled dunstan many monkes toke fro hem hadde putt oute monkes malmesbury yaue abbaye clerkes atte laste merces northumbres put edwyn oute kyngedom euyl lyuyng made broder edgar kyng whan sixten yere old edgards begynnyng seynt dunstan herde angel synge maner pee lond englysshmen childes tyme born dunstans tyme made ryuer temse departed twey kynges londes edwyn regned four yere dyed last buryed wynchestre soule delyuerd helle prayer seynt dūstan translated soules penaūce wey sauaciō treuisa take hede cristē mē vnderstādyng wordes perillously set therfor haue minde twey maner helles one adā abrahā isaac iacob holy forfaders dyed byfore cryst helle crist descēded aft er passion brought then holy faders ther helle place shalbe dāpned eumore· cometh helle shal neu er aft er sauid ne come fro peyne seyth comune speeche thef delyuerd frō hangyng galowes though come yf delyuerd power wolde lede hym galows hange hym thrrupon somme maner vnderstandyng delyuerd oute fendes power wold bring helle delyuerd helle though come meaneth prophete sawter seith thou hast delyuerd soule oute lower helle willelmus de li 2 lande beryth euyl herbes good netylle somtyme groweth next▪ rose mylde edmond come edwyn worst edgar best ¶ capitulum nonum edgar yong sixtene yere old made kynge regned broder sixten yere twellifth yere athāmannes cyte bathe fyftenthe day may wytsonday enoynted kyng hooly bysshops dunstan oswald anone reconcyled dunston made hym thabbot glastenbury bisshop wyrcetre connexyd kyngdomes denyded made therof one kyngdome bare downe wykked men chastysed rebel loued wel good men sobre repayred amended chirches many place dyd awey clerkes lyued outrage putte monkes treuisa saue reuerence edgar lewdly meoued clerkes thāt lyued wel ynowe foloweth story byld fourty abbayes among whiche made ryche glastenbury abyndon burgh thorney ramesey wylton wynchestre wynchestre new abbay callyd hyda hap ther bifel fyrst put monkes stede clerkes clerkes fled trauayle quere spende catail holy chirche place wyll vycars stede ful lytle lyue whan wold amended kyng edgar nowther bisshop ethelwold nouther tharchebisshop dūstan kyng yaf prouēdes clerkes forseid vicar vicar wors rather whan made persōs liued outrage thā rather kyng aggreued thassēt xiij pope iohn put clerkes put monkes w vbi su tyme theef taken open ne pryuy ne hadde payne also kynge cast destroy wyld beestes desyre bloode therfore made ludwallus kynge wale bere certeyn yere trybute thre honderd wolues whan payed thre yere gyder fourth yere myghte neuer wolf founden item w though edgar smal lytel stature wold ouercome euery man neuer strong wold hym fyght tyme feste iouglers shewed hem self moost sayth kynadus kynge scottes seyd game semed wonder many prouynces landes subgette lytel man edgar mynstral herde worde told kyng told men aroos feste kynadus hadde kynadus hym grete counseylle • ad hym ferre wode toke hym one twey swerdes brought hym spak kynadꝰ sayde thou hast leue kythe thy strengthe essay whether v tweyne shal subget alone foule thyng kyng • angle moch atte fest fyght batayll kynadus abasshyd fyll downe edgards feete prayd hym foryeuenesse symple worde sayd game euery somer wold gader shippes geder departe hem foure sette four partes englond thenne west nauey wold sayle north countrey north nauey wold sayle eest countrey wyth eest nauey wold seylle south countrey southe naueye weste countrey doynge mylde espye theues shold greue water ne lande wynter tyme wolde ryde lande enquyre espye dome dedes mynystres wolde take cruell wreche hem trespassed ayenste lawe ¶ al tyme prouffytable counseyllour • omonte fauoured dane vnwysely theyr axynge vnnethe ther one strete englonde dane dwellyd therin englysshmen suffryd good herte therof come ryght greuous ende dane grete drynkers kynde lefte englysshmen one doynge knowen dureth alwey soo doynge englysshmen doth pryiudyce al world emptynge cuppes therfor kyng edgar made styke nayles cuppes marked cuppes shold drynk mesure vnto nailes w de r et de p li 2 edgar wyf egelfleda whyte hyr bygate oldest sonne edward afterward edward kynge martir alfritha duke doughter deuē shyre gate edmond dyed bifore fader egelredꝰ regned seynt edward seynt wylfrytha bigate seynt edyth mayde wylfrytha verely menchon comune sawe madly meaneth deede kynge edgar desired vnlaufully toke nonnes clothynge soo brought kynges bed kyng lay woman holden semed nonne blamed seint dunstan dyde penaunce seuen yere also whanne hadde childe forsoke flesshely lykyng mannes companye lyued relygyously holden seynt abbay wylton seyd also hir doughter edyth sayde whyle menchon wylton vsed ofte gayer clothes hyr profession axed therfor blamed seynt ethelwold answerd nowther vncouenably ne ful cu • tously goddes dome sayd may fayle plesed conscience therfore trowe clene soule maye vnder clothes arrayed gold vnder thy slyt forour skynnes tyme dunstan halowed chirche sawe mayde croyse ofte owne forheede hyr ryght thombe dunstan gladde therof sayd praye god thombe maye neuer rotte anone masse dunstan bygan wepe sayd anone six wekes fay •• rose shal wel wydre befelle whanne hyr bodye taken vp erthe founden al roten torned pouder oute take thombe hyr wombe pryuy chose bynethe dunstan hadde therof greete wonder thought moche therynne myght ¶ thenne appered hym tolde hym cause sayd wonder though hoole sounde nether partes bodye neuer gylty outrage mete drynk nowther flesshely lykynge also hooly maide red whyle kynge cauntus loued lytel sayntes englōd one whitsontyde wilton feste made open mowes scorned seynt edyth seid wold neuer trowe edgards childre lecherous grete tyraunt sholde saynt ednotus tharchebisshop withsaid tho present opened anon graue mayde thēne arrered self vp girdel stede semed though wold haue resed rebel king dede kyng astonyed fil groūde though swoun drough breth atte last ashamed glad saued entended doo worthy penaunce ¶ capitulum 10 aboute tyme dyed odo tharchebisshop caunterbury nacion dane dyde alweye wildenes last seruid kyng edward elder chiualry long toke tōsur clerk made bisshop wynchestre made kyng ethelstā frēde coming swerde loste scaubert ageyne soo made archebisshop caunterbury wold take dignite holily al predecessours mōkes passed see toke monkes wede floriacio beside aurelian treuisa odo lewdly meoued therfor make monk cryst ne none al apostle neuer monck ne frere foloweth story odo come ageyne nyghe kynge wente atte last kynge edredus northumberlond brouht hym caunterbury holy ax saynt wylfryde bisshop therof yet contynuel stryf bitwene york caunterbury whether hath wilfrides bone buryed chirche rypon forsaid bone owther bone lasse wylfride seynt iohns prest successour see york also odo suspended kynge edwynus crystendome feruente lecherye oute al good fame therfore edwynus toke wreche al monkes englond englond man hym durst wythstande oute take odo dunstan seneca sayth cok moost myghty dung hylle ¶ also tyme od • e temple vnheebed alle tyme heelynge makynge temple heelynge heeled soo bede fylle noo drop rayne alle place aboute yet tyme soo grete tempeste rayne water semed al world shuld go giders also another tyme whan sacred seynt dūstan bisshop wyrcetre thordre seruyce though sacred tharchebisshop caunterbury whan clerkys blamed therfor wote sone said odo holy goost worchith true byfore bodyng lakked sobre feyth· though elsinus bisshop wynchestre euer among founded haue see whan odo dede elsinus ordeyned aduocates groped handes gate slyly maūdement kynge put caūterbury fyrst day spared caste wodenes long kepte hert put foot seynt odoes tombe despysed soule spake hym manere thou worste old man thy soule goo late ynow thou hast made place bett thou haue long desired haue maugre thy teth therfor ful euyl thank tyme whan day goo blower wodenes brought bedde sawe shap seynt odo blame hym despyse hym manace shulde dye wende scorned fleynge fantesye spared therfor wente toward rome receyue palle pope passed hylles alpes fro • en cold snowe hors bowel opened haue somme hete wrapped foot whiche spurned seynt odoes tombe dyed soo ¶ hym bryghtlynus bisshop wynchestre archebisshop caunterbury suffisaunt grete charge went ageyne wynchestre comaundemēt kyng dunstan bisshop london wyrcetre made archebisshop caunterbury wente rome receyued palle pope iohan come ageyne gate kynge oswalde odoes broder sonne shold bisshop worcetre ¶ willelmus de pontificibus libro primo dunstan fyrste abbott glastenbury alwey full vertues made hym besy torne kynge edgards hert dedes sauacion make kynges lyuynge myrroure ensample subgettis yf kynge trespassed studyed hym fast amende soo made hym doo penaunce seuen yere vnlawful lyggyng menchon ensample chastysed comonte made knyghtes doo shold fered • e refreyned hem thordre monkes thryfty tyme hadde relygyous ruler clere scyence clergye soo bytwene thacorde good lyuyng kyng archebisshop clerkes choys whether wolde amen • e lyf byd benefyce fare wele leue wonynge place better soo sholde noo moore discorde bytwene fayrenesse hous lyuynge hem dwellyd theryn foldes answerde tiller plente corne fruyte euery grone shone hurton tree tree ful fruyte elementys clere lykynge vnnethe ther ony dystemperance weder pestylences enemyes bothe fer tyme ¶aboute tyme gaskoyne woman departed deuyded nauel vpwarde hadde twey hedes twey breestes soo somtyme one slepte owther ete whanne dyde nowther lyued soo gydre longe tyme dyed bothe one ¶ twellyfthe iohan fyfth benet pope thre monethes ¶ nychoforus kynge grece old man drad lest owne sonnes wold put hym oute kyngdome demed sonnes shuld ghelded quene coūseylled one iohan shold slee kynge regne soo done benet eyghtenth leo pope yere four monethes malyce romaynes made hem self vnlawfully pope ordeyned pope sholde ordeyned without assent emperour ¶after hym thyrtenth iohan pope eyght yere atte laste taken prefecte cyte exyled emperour restored ageyne slough enemyes iohan sixth benet pope one yere six monethes ¶ hym eyght bone face pope thre yere myght abide rome spoil led saynt peter chirche went constantinople come ayene rome wyth grete pompe booste whanne myght haue purpoos toke cardynal iohan putte oute bothe eyen dyed sone ¶ willelmus de pont libro secundo ¶ whanne askatyllus archebisshop yorke dede saynt oswald bisshop wyrcitre receyued archebisshoprych gouerned bisshoprich wyrtetre besydes cathedrale chirche seynt peter wircetre buylde another chirche lady myght ther homely monkes grete loue people clerkes nexte chirche whan sawe leuer monkes soo despysed forsaken whanne oswald stalled york brought lettred men countrey countraye shold defrauded withoute suche goodnesse withoute whiche goodnesse goodnesse semeth vanyte ¶ albo monke floriacio one thylk lettred men withoute moche f • uyte clergye brought englond descryued wrote lyf saynt edmunde kynge martir atte prayer saynt dunstan albo torned home afterward made abbot ¶ tyme celle gascoyne callyd alereul longed abbay wolde haue vsed strengthe relygyon eruelte gascoyns wolde suffre kytte throte soo dyed oswald lyued fyue yere kneled downe tyme wessh pore mennes fete sayde gloria patri dyed ryght soo ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ kynge edgar twellyfthe yere kyngdome enoynted kynge sacred bathe sayled aboute north brytayne come land legyon nowe callyd chestre eyght vnder kynges come ayenste hym whiche kynges wente boote day ryuer dee toke helme hande steres man kynges sette rowe oores soo come rowynge seynt iohans chirche come rowynge grete pompe boost owne palays sayth sayde thennethat ony successours myght ioyeful gladde whanne grete pompe worship ¶ capitulum 11 edgar emperour floure fayrenesse englonde dyed fyftenth day iuyll yere lyf seuen thirty kyngdom brother one twē ty buryed glastenbury noo lesse worthy mynde englysshmen cyrus perses outher romulus romayns owther alysaunder grekes owther charles frensshmen ¶ willelmus vbi supra ¶ glastenbury yere • lord thousande two fyfty whanne abbot aylward dygged vnworshipfully edgards graue bodye founden hoole sounde soo full flessh myght entre newe cheste also fressh blood seen drop oute fressh body body put shryn hadde yeuen chirche sette vpon auter seynt apolynarys heede relykes seynt vyncente kynge hadde brought grete pry yeuen hows nyce abbot waxe woode wente oute chirche brake neck dy •• ¶ ranulphus ¶ bryttyssh storye tellyth seynt eltutus lyf whanne kynge edgar destroyed countrey glomm • rgan rebelnesse peple saynt eltutus belle taken awey hanged aboute hors neck therfor vndertyde kynge edgar lay bed rest one appered smote brest spere whan kyng waken bade restore ayene al taken kynge dyed nyne dayes praysynge hym one sayd maner henricus libro 5 helper punyssher tresp • yeuer worship kynge edgar ago kyngdom heuē salamon lawes fader wey pee noble batayls noble temple good monkes monke temple yaue feldes al wrong put awey soo yafe place right ¶willelmus de regibus libro secundo somme men founden putte venym ioye goodnesse edgar tellen cruel begynnynge cyteseyns lecheroꝰ maydens maner one ethelwold erle priue hym tyme charged erle shold goo elfrytha orgarus doughter erle deuenshyre wonder fayr mayde counseyle hir brynge hir wedded kynge yf soo fayrenesse hir acordynge loo fame ¶ erle wente wey toke mayde owne vse come āgeyne kyng ālledged hym syde trowed wolde helpe sayde wenche comune fayrenesse shap suche sayth al day couenable kyngys wyf tyme tale teller warned kyng gylefully ethelwolde hadde seruyd hym kynge droof oute one nayle another toke wreche gyle wyle made good face therle semblaunt sette hym day game whanne wolde visyte woman dredefull game therle comf • rtles nygh dede feare ranne home byfore prayed wyf wolde helpe saue hym muche myght shold make hir self foule vnsemely kynges syght clothynge foule aray durste dyde countrary toke myrrour kembed hyr arayed hyr bodye hyr heede gay fayre couth lefte thyng shold make fayr lykynge mannes syghte thenne whanne kynge sawe woman began brenne loue made though̄ wrothe erle hym hunte woode werwelley callyd hoote woode kynge smote hym thurgh shafte kyng ax • therles baste sone hym lyked suche huntynge sayth answerd sayde lord kyng plesyd shal dysplese worde meked soo kynges herte swollen wrath thynge leuer afterward kynge sonne therle slayne afterward clensynge dede elfrytha buylde abbay nonnes warwell ¶ranulphus verely sl • ynge hir stepsone edward made slayne hir owne sonne egelredus sholde regne ¶willelmus vbi supra ensample cruelnes telle another lecherye saye toke mayde sacred god oute abbay laye hir ¶also tym • nyght andeuer fer wynchestre badde brynge bedde duke doughter wel fayr mayde mode • mayde wolde doughter shold soo defowled hadde bounde seruaunt fayre mayde smothe lykynge sente kynges bedde morowe whanne dawynge byganne sprynge woman byganne ryse thenne axed hyed doo werke sayd wonte euery day nyghtes iourneye axed fredome mede assentynge kynges lykyng sholde vnder boundage cruel lordes anone kyng byganne laugh made boundewoman lady lordes euer suche dedes sothe clensyd hym suche dedes veray penaunce boneface seuenth seuenth benet pope viij yere six monethes seconde otho sonne fyrste • tho regned fader among duchemen ten yere six monethes seuenth yere kyngdome crowned rome pope benet whanne ytalyens brake pee made grete feste lordes ytaly grees chirche rome whyle mete made men armes byclyppe hem pryuely aboute meoued pleynte atte laste brekyng pee bade hem take hym name wryten hem gylty made hem byheded right euerychone made ete mete pee ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ capitulum 12 yong edward help dunstān bisshops made kynge ayenste wylle somme lordes specially ayenste wylle stepdame elfrytha fonded make hir owne sone egelredus kynge childe seuen yere old myght soo regne vnder childes name edward regned four yere ¶ ther āfter waned grace kyngdome fyrmamente seen stella cometa sterre bryght shynynge creest bodeth alwey pestilence prouynce owther chaungynge kyngdome long therafter fell bareynesse feldes honger men deth beestes alferus prynce mercia fauoured elfritha quene al myght put oute monkes edgar ordeyned brought ynne clerkes concubynes dunstan erle eeste englonde withstode hem manly clerkes somtyme put oute rered stryf ageyn sayd wretchyd shame new comyng shold put old landesman place plesing god graunted place old woner nowther good man aloweth may drede wolde doo hym self seeth doth herfor solempne counseyle made wynchestre ymage rode spak oute wall sayd dunstans wey good true yet cesed hertes vnskylfull men therfor made counseylle atte ryal strete calue kyng absente yet tendre age sate hygh hows senatours englonde dunstan strongly despysed chydde thenne gystes beames sober al brake soler fylle downe somme dede somme hurt maymed euermore wree dede owther hurt ful soore oute take dunstan alone escaped graciously wysely myracle brought forth sylence hem entended afterward haue mayntened qua • ele yong edward cam huntyng wery thurst stepdame yaue hym drynke meane tyme stykked swerde· thenne byganne prykke hors myght thennes flee thenne one fote slode oute styrope drawe foote al aboute feldes thwert ouer weyes al bloded cornisgate yaue sygnes token deth buryed vnworthly thre yere warham god wrought hym • ny myracles grete grete lyght come downe fro heuen haltman receyued goyng aryght dembe man receyued spoche deef herynge blynde syght manere seke men toke state helthe rumour slough hym meoued cam rydyng beeste myght come nyghe place noo betynge ne noo cryeng beeste ofte chaunged al nought therfor myght done owne persone dyd another mynyster elferus hadde somtyme putte oute monkes mercia brought clerkes stede toke edwardes body buryed solempny septon shaftesbury ¶ r tyme afterwarde somme bodye translated leof monaster besydes herforde somme abyndon place shaftesbury longes yet qnaue alle fressh sounde callyd edwardestow w vbi supra slaughter elfrytha buylde twey abbayes woman fro salesbury one ambrysbury another werwel dyde awey pompe world dyde long tyme hard penaūce warwell vsed alwey heer fasting chastysed hir bodye full fayre somtyme ande alway myght croysed forheede brest lyeth buryed forsayd elferus escaped maner wreche eten wyth lyse one yere buryng forsayde martir aboute tyme fulbertus prosperyte bisshop carnot excellente man lady loue among noble werkes made praysyng oure lady response styrps yesse solem iusticie ym • ne chorus noue ierusalem tyme seke atte yate deth lady appered hym axyd hym wherof dradde lady sayd trust thy mercy drede full soore thyne owne sonnes dome drede nothynge sayd make seker herafter shal make al hoole anone toke brest oute bosomme dropped face thre droppes precious lycour mylke went forth hir wey hoole forthwith dyde swete lycour heuen vessel siluer hadde kepe▪ mynde ¶willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ capitulum 13 egelredus edgards sonne bygoten seconde wyf elfrytha made kynge elder broder edward kyngeston fayr knyght louely eyght thyrty yere besyeged kyngdome verely ruled cours lyf cruel vngracious begynnyng wretched myddel foule ende whyle seynt dunstan baptysed hym defowled fontston fruyte wombe therfor dunstan sayd god moderthys shal vnkynde day crownynge told • prophecye thou come kyngdome deth thy broder· who deth englysshmen conspyred wykked woman thy moder shal withoute bloode swerde er ther come peple vnknowen tonge ond bryng hem last thraldom trespaas shal clensed withoute long vengeaunce whanne egelredus chylde ten yere olde herde telle broder edward soo slayne meoued wode moder wepyng yellyng bete hym almost deth taper shad nought ellys hand therfor hated taper al lyf tyme also ethelgyna erle egbertus doughter bygate edmund ir • nsyde hi • surname edwyn ethelstan one doughter callyd edgyna afterward emma normandy bygate alfredꝰ edward half nyght cloude seen al englond blody fyry chaunged dyuers colour beames wente awey dawnynge yere southhāpton yle tanet besydes kente saynt petrocus abbaye cornewayle prouynce chestre destroyed theues dane cyte london brente fire cyte seynt ethelwold bisshop wynchestre deed born wynchestre norysshed vp vnder dūstan glastenbury made monke made abbot abyngdon kynge edredus tyme made bisshop wynchestre edgar tyme made abbaye nonnes translated seynt swythynes body oute erth ¶ hym seynt alphegus abbot bathe bisshop afterward archebisshop caunterbury slayne dane hym inner shal speke thyrdde otho seconde othoes sonne regned amonge duchemen fader eyghten yere wonder surname callyd otho wondres world mirabilia mundi crowned rome fyfthe pope gregory though thre othones emperours arewe kynde herytage yet afterward ordeyned emperour sholde chosen thoffycers empyre tho offycers seuen hem ben versus made maguntmensis treuerensis coloniensis qu • l • b • imperij fit cellarius horum eciam palatinus dapyfer dnx portitorensis marchio prepositus camere pyncerna boemns hij statuunt dominum per secula summum meane bisshop meynse magunce treuer colonia thes thre euerychone made ryght chaunceler thempyre erle palatinus sewer duc oustryche beryth swerd marquys chamberleyn· butiler kynge beame chosen men alle lord hyest euer thyrdde otho hadde wyf wolde haue husbond man lygge hir man wold assent anon trye thretend heede sholde smytē withoute ony dome er dyed bad wyf shold dethe proue hym gyltles doyng ho • r brennyng yren day cam whanne emperour sayd wold ryght faderles moderles childer wydues wyduc cam brought hyr husbandes heede axed deth worthy slayne man wrongfully worthy leese heede sayd themperour thou art man sayd wydue shal proue anone dome fyre brennyng yren whan dome done thēperour yaue hym self woman sholde punysshe hym wold atte prayeng bisshops fyrst ten dayes groū ted eyght seuen atte laste sixe whiche dayes emperour examyned cause atte full brente owne wyf raunsonne yaue wydue four castel townes bysshopryche brynensis yet haue name cleped first dayes ten eight seuen six fourtenthe iohan pope eyght monethes ¶after hym fyftenth iohan four monethes hym sixtenth iohan pope ten yere willelmus vbi supra ¶kyng egelredus stryf bytwene hym bisshop rouchestre besyeged cyte rouchestre dunstan sende hym sholde leue wodenesse ānd shold offende seynt andrew patrone place kyng rought bare wordes dunstan hight arayed heest fair money ānd sente hym honderd pounde shold breke siege moneye receyued dunstan wondred mannes couetyse sente hym worde messagers manere thou hast putte gold byfore god syluer byfore apostle couetyse byfore ryght sone euyll happes shal come vpon whyle alyue· two yere came dane whanne dunstan deede yere twey pestylences vnknowen byfore fylle englond men hadde feuers beestes flyxe ¶seynt dunstan ended lyf ful vertues wondres descryued osbertus monk caunterbury tellith seynt dunstans lyf seynt dunstan hyghted ymages appostles martirs stole preeste harpe henge vpon walle herde make swetely melodye withoute mannes hande melodye note anteme martres gaudent celis anime sanctorum saye hooly mennes soules make ioye heuen also tellyth thkt dunstan couth many craftes wrought handes made tyme chalis gold smythes craft celle fast glastenbury fende cam lykenes woman tempted hym fantasyes dyuers lykynge dunstan spyryte war therof caught hym nose fyre hote tong dede knowen neyghbours aboute cryeng • yellynge fende also tyme dunstan slepy herde angel synge full swetely kyryeleyson xprysteleyson melodye note armonye yet famous among englysshe men vsed kyrye kyrye rex splendens whan dūstā dede dane come euery hauen englond wist myght met hem therfor mē myght put hem away yren put hem awey syluer payd hem fyrst yere ten thousand pound counseylle syrycus archebisshop nexte dunstan ¶ seconde yere sixten thousande pound thyrdde yere twenty thousand l̄i iiij yere xxiiij l̄i v yere xxx l̄ atte last xl l̄i till money fayled dane bygan ayene robbe reue yet herto one elfricus māyster kynges shippis fledde enemyes vyle flemed harlot nyght bifore batayle warned hem whome sholde take heed bewar dede men toke sonne algarus put oute eyen yet elfricus come ayene fayled ayene thenne dane spoylled robbed al northumberlond besieged london made kynge pay trybute strengthe mene tyme elphegus bisshop wynchestre yaue pledgis brought anlaf kyng dane kyng • gelredus kyng egelredus receyued hym cold water bisshop confermed hym therafter wente dyd harme yet cesed harme hedes idra whan somme enemyes awey come vp enemyes destroyed countraye ¶ capytayns presence moche worth knowen werre bataylle soo hardynesse vse loore dedes armes fayled tyme among englysshmen yf hoost ony tyme gadryd yf shippes made noo thyng spedde ryght men chasted yaue thefte robbery comforted wold lyghtly flee shippes destroyed grete tempest ¶ one wylnotus kynge hadde exyled occupyed shippes lefte drenched hem owther brente hem lordes come counseyll ony tyme one assent treated discorde stryfe among hem self comune profyt yf ony good counseyll profytable yeuen anone theyr enemyes shold wytte withoute forsaide elfrycus one edrycus kynge hadde made lorde mercia ryght fals traytour slye couth wel feyne hym self true frende though fals espyed kynges counsayle true trusty warned enemyes therof fals gybeful traytour mene tyme mescheue hunger encreaced fast ¶ enemyes myght go frely fyfty myle take prayes lede shippis thenne payd trybute dane kyng suche condicion wold lyghtly dyssheryte englysshmen feyne trespaas haue money good froward wyf emma selde come bedde walowed lechery strompettis comune wymmen ¶ capitulum 14 lotharius lowys sonne kynge westfraunce dyed withoute childer hym grete charles ofspryng loste kyngdom somme men say lotharius childre regned hym helpe rychard duc normandye somtyme gretely greuyd lotharius ¶lotharius sonnes taken grete hugh capette made kynge fraunce regned nyne yere hugh capett sone duc hugh who suster duc rychard spoused ¶ seynt oswald archebisshop yorke worcetre also dyed buryed wyrcetre v gregorius pope thre yere byfore called brunus othoes themperours kynnesman instaunce chosen pope afterward whan themperour absente one crescenciꝰ prefecte cyte toke one placentinus ryche man moneye putte hym poperyche callyd hym seuenth iohan emperour came ageyne putte oute iohan putte ynne seconde syluester ¶ yere bisshops see somtyme callyd lyndeffarn chaunged durham ¶ seynt cuthbertus bodye translated thyder whiche bodye ardulphus ledde aboute hym somtyme fyrste rychard thyrd duc normandy dede ¶ hym sonne seconde rychard duc xxviij yere grete goodnesse callyd good rychard deuoute goddes seruyce wyse redy worlde warde curtoys large yeftes fyrste wyf bygate thre sonnes rychard robert wiliam thre doughters seconde wyf gate wyliam robert archebisshop rothomage one thes second rychardes knyghtes stale spone leyd wedde among thynges duc espyed none man lete quyte oute al knyghtes weddes knyght espyed spone espyed soo ashamed fled pryuely awey kynge wente knyght fledde brought hym ayene made hym ryche loued hym afterward ryght wele one mayster bernard herde duke loo wold knowen bythought hym euery syde myght beste doo come therto come atte last bowe arowe wyndowe castel duc wonte stande walked hyder thyder though wold haue shotte duc duc war therof espyed cause loued hym ryght wel seuenth iohan put oute second syluester pope four yere twey monethes w v su hete fyrst gerebertus name naciō frensshmen shorn monk floriacio besyde aurelyans whanne come pyctagoras double wey caught noye ordre couetyse worship left habyte nyght fled hyspals syuyl le grannt cyto spayne lerne subtyle curyous artes scyences crysten men haue tolet sarasyns haue hyspals ther gerebertus lerned passed tholomeus astronomye alcā drius space bytwene sterres iulius fermicus desteny lerned sygnefyed song flyghte foules curyosite kynde may take carsong leue drank therof passed fyrst toke agabus sarasyns yaue rule therynnne maye vnnethe vnderstanden connyngest men crafte whiche craftes men ben cleped abacyste gerebertus one moost connynge philosophre boūde promyses yeftes gerebertus hadde wryton copyed al philosophres bookes excepte one conteyned pryuyte crafte booke myght geete noo maner sleyght philosophre otherwhyle dronken· soo gerebertus wayted tyme toke booke vnder philosophres heede fledde aweye therwyth thenne awoke pursued gerebertus crafte stere • whiche crafte parfyht ynowe crafte fledde ware perylle dressyd hym vnder treen brydge nexte henge ther armes soo touched neyther erth ne water soo crafte begyled sought hym right besyly withdrough hym torned home ayene thenne gerebertus cam see called forth fende behete hym homage yf wold bere hym ouer see saue fro hym pursued hym soo done come agey • fraunce helde open scole hym constantin thabbot saynt mayimin besydes aurelyans hym made yaue rule abacus also told skylle reson dyameter aboue macrobius treuisa dyameter fygure owther shap lengest euen lyne deuyded therynne take may foloweth storye gerebertus hadde • olers robert sonne hugh capette kyng fraunce otho otho emperours sonne robert afterward kyng fraunce made gerebertus archebisshop remensis yet chirche mynde lore ther orloge made crafte honde water organ sowneth eyr water strengthe hoot • water wynde brekyth oute fylleth holownes organ thenne shaply draughtes brasen pypes sende oute swete crye noyse melodye therafter otho emperour made gerebertus bisshop rauenna sone ther pope ¶ marianus ¶ happe vers made scandit ad r gerebertus ab r post papa vygens r gerebertus passyth vp r oute r therafter pope floures r ¶r passed oute remence rauenna thyrde tyme rome ¶ willelmus de regibus fauour fende droof forth fortune help fende crafte nygromancye fonde tresour hyd olde tyme felde callyd campus marcius besydes rome ymage tyme helde streight oute ¶ fynger right hande fynger som men calle lyk pot fynger nexte thombe ymages heede wreton smyte men olde tyme wend trowed tresour ther fynde brake sōwhat ymage many hard stroke gerebertꝰ blamed hem therfor euē midday whā sōne highest toke hede wher shadow finger fil groūd pight ther stake night toke chāberlayn alone bare light opened erth stake pyght went sawe • e kynges hows gold knyghtes gold playng dy gold kyng quene metal sitting atte borde serued mete sette borde seruauntes standyng byfore hem cuppes grete wyght pryce ynner place ho • carboncle stone shoone clerely dyd awey al derknesse nyght syde stode yonglynge bowe bente amonge al thynge myght touched though myght seen yf ony man wente ner handle ony thynge h • r semed al ymages wold rese gerebertus war therof absteyned hym withstode couetyse desyre chamberlayn absteyned atte full toke knyf lay boorde anon taken knyf ymages bygan grutche aryse child lowsed shotte hytte carboncle stone reode made alle hows full derknesse soo yf hadd leyd downe knyf lord bade hym bothe sholde haue payed peyne redde ioseph dalf fader moche tresour erthe ¶ hircanus toke vp thre thousand talentes kyng dauids graue breke vp syege ierusalem also comune faine gerebertus certayne crafte sterres dyde ghete hede spak whan axyd hym seyd nought soth hede warned gerebertus shold pope shold neuer dye er • ad songe masse ierl̄m ware rome chirche hete ierl̄m ther pope singith masse thre sondayes yere stacion tyme chirche arayd hym masse one sondayes taken strength sekenesse lay seke bedde counseylled ymage knewe begyl̄ed war oundeth sente cardyuals knowleched euyl dedes wepte ful soore woode man sorow synnes made men kytte self lymmele· throwe lymmes sayd lete hym haue thoffyce lymmes axyd homage hem lete spyryte go god made nought mar bade doo stoke bodye vpon cart burye beestes wolde abyde • done beestes steynte seynt iohans l • ran buryed token synnes foryeuen graue bodethe warneth yf pope shal sone dye sterynge rustlyng bone therynne swetynge tombe yet wreton lettres latyn ¶ capitulum 15 hvgh capett kyng west fraunce dyed regned ix yere sone robert kyng hym bygoten elder edwardes doughter kyng englond robert regned aboute thyrtty yere tyme • elygyous pylgrym cam oute ierl̄m scicilia lerued one closed dede mē • e soules dyus synnes trespaces tormented vulcanus crokke closed tolde herd ofte voys grysbytyng thylke soules delyuerd prayer almesdedes crysten men namely monkes cluny therfor odyl • abbot cluny whan war therof ordeyned haue mynde memorye hem ben dede morow al halowe day maner vsage doynge passed afterward al world also robert connyng man scyence wold high̄ festes sayntes somme abbay kyngdom syng owther bere coope rule quere ¶ one aurelyans seynt anians day lefte hoost aboute castel beseged bare coope quere sange thryes agnus dei knelyng grounde thenne tyme walles castel besyeged fylle sodenly grounde robert made sequence sancti spiritus assit nobis gracia grace hooly goost v also made response mydwynter euen iudea ierl̄m nolite timere iewry ierl̄m haue ye drede saith drede ryght nought also yere deuelyng cyte archebisshops see irlond destroyed scottes naueye denmarch̄ wente normandye kynge egelredus destroyed combrelande ylande mon hete anglesya north wale seynt iuo bisshops body founde w de p libro quarto iuo nacion perses forsoke likynge world passed many landes churles wede thre felawes moo ended lyf yle ramsey name graue long tyme vnknowen mē countrey iuo appered symple man enformed name degre charged hym sholde goo thabbot ramesey shold go yfere take vp body oute erthe whan done heeleful welle al maner sekenes sprang oute graue yet vnneth al englond ony seynt wold lyghtlyer mannes bone helpe hym dede yere kyng egelredus wedded emma flour normandy doughter fyrst rychard duc normandy proude therfor sent lettres cytees englond commaunded hete sle al dane one nyght done seynt bricius nyght also yere abbay founded burton vpon trent grete man callyd wulrycus spoite thyrdde otho first henry cleped mylde emperour xvij yere crouned tharchebisshop magonce take heede mo •• nryes kynges emperours therfore whan redyth fyrst henry seconde owther thyrde cause lykenes saide name fyrst • ther secōd thēpire shal vnderstanden conrades othones emperours hete fyrst henry lyued clene mayde wyf xv • ij iohn pope six monethes suanus kyng dane herde • dane pryuely slayn cytees englond come grete nauye landed corne wayle treson norman erle hugh quene emma made lord deuenshire suanus toke excetre destroyed walles westsaxons come manely ayenst hym ofte hoostes neyhed geder capitayn englyssmen edricus fals traitour feyned spue sayd seke therfor englysshemen discomforted kyng swanus robbed wylton shirburn wente shippes ageyne come wyche nexte yrre destroyed countray set te • ford fyre whanne duc vsketel war therof sente men countrey sholde brenne shippes theyr enemyes made rought owther durst thenne duc come alle myghte yaue dane wel harde sharpe bataylle yere stronge honger englonde kynge suanus tourned ageyne denmarche come nexte yere englonde ageyne nyntenthe iohn pope fyue yere ¶ yere elphegus bisshop wynchestre made archebisshop caunterbury whan wulrycus tharchebisshop dede ¶ monethe iuyll naueye dane landed sandwyche spoylled robbed kente southsex trauayled hoost englond many maner deceites wile spoyllynge robbyng tornyng home ageyn thre felawes folowed hem alwey robbyng sleyng brennyng kyng egelredus woned shro • sbury myght anō putte dane er hadde destroyed barokshire therfore egelredus counseylle lordes payed dane trybute thyrtty thousande pounde haue pee ¶ yere made edricus traytour duc mercia edrycus lowe kyn ryche tonge fals deceyuable wytte softe fayr speche vntrusty fals thought ¶the thyrdde sergius pope thre yere henricus li 6 ¶ turkyllus erle dane come lande kente caunterbury men yane hym thousande pounde haue pee dane wente yle wyght toke prayes ¶ ofte kyng wente forth fyght ayenst erle edrycus counseyled shold yeue hem noo bataylle ¶ therfor yere dane made full ryche destroyed almoost half englond northampton yle wyght ¶ capitulum 16 aboute saynt matheus feste dane beseged caunterbery twenty daye syege cyte taken sette fyre tresonne almarus deken saynt elphegus byfore saued dethe thabbot seynt austyns suffred go wey crystes flocke tythed ix slayne x kepte hem slayne somme slayne yren throwen hygh place somme hanged pryuy membrys som drawen heere amonge whiche elphegus bisshop taken bounde seuen monethes greued despysed many maner paynes therfor goddes wrath felle vppon peple slough soo men sorow bowel slough destroyed hem x xx grete nombre dane warned crysten men shold bisshops gre dyfferted abide therwith ester euē gaf bisshop chois whether wold pay thre thousād pond owther leese lyf forsoke profre prayde mekely crysten men forbade hyghly none hem sholde pay raunsome therfor dane wroth kene next saterday dane wyne dronken ledd oute bisshop slough hym stone rotheren bone saterdaye felle twelue dayes byfore maij whan bisshop dede buryed til morn whan drye tree touched drope blode wax grene ageyn nexte daye bodye brought london buryed worshipfully seynt paulus chirche afterward graunte kanutus kyng dane brought hoole bodye owne chirche ¶ w de r li 2 alphegus taken monkes habyte dirhust lyued anker bathe gadred monkes afterward fallyth ofte agreete college monkes drough hem alle euyll maner doynge vnwyttyng fader somme hem made festes nyghte outrage drynkynge daye lyght banyour euyll doynge fyl dede wreche god myddel hows drank fader war therof noys herde come wyndow sawe twey fendes bete body wretche axed helpe nay sayde fendes thou obedyent god shal obedyēte tyme saynt andrew appered dunstan coūseyle seynt andrew alphegus made bisshop wynchestre ete neuer flessh seeke nyghte • e wolde begyle wardeyns stonde water gyrdel stede worship god pray hym day lyght whanne bisshop wynchestre two twenty yere made archebisshop caunterbury ayenst wylle went rome palle robbed strete al hadde therfore god toke wreche streete soo strete waxe fyre men streete knowheched trespaas restored ageyne al sawe fyre quenched atte prayer saynt elphegus ¶ marianus ¶ sergyus eyghtenth benet pope twelue yere hym peter damianus sayth bisshop sawe hym sitte blac hors greuously tormented therfor prayd bisshop saw syght shold go successour xx iohan praye hym doo almes dede hym money suche cheste al deled hym byfore stode hym stede thefte robberye soo bisshop wente abbay yere twey dayes byfore october see ouerflowed passed clyues •• ynt many men townes henricus libro sexto suanus kynge dane sayled aboute eestenglond conteyneth northfolk southfolk come nauey humbre passed forth ryuer trente geynil burgh· men dwellyd north watlyng streete swar fewte hym bytoke hym pledgys bitoke nauey pledgys sone canutus whyle wente destroye south mercia slough men kepte woman flesshely lykynge hym men toke oxenford wynchestre went toward london sought brydge lost many men ryuer temse presence kynge egelredus put london wente wanne westsaxon londoner wente sawe sente hym pledge kynge abasshed sente wyf emma hir broder second rychard duc normandy sente hir twey sone bisshop l • ndon meane tyme hyder thyder wyght helde mydwynter tyde atte laste withoute cataylle comforte sayled normandy kyng suanus proude eche owne dampnacion chalenged greete trybute seynt edmunds martirs cyte menaced trybute payd wold slee men sette cyte fyre also despysed scorned saynt edmond couth whanne euen come stykked saynt edmondes swerde myddel owne knyghtes atte toune geynisburgh ānd cryed departyng day nyght dyed thirde day februar sone canutus sawe dyd myldly seynt edmond made dyche aboute saynt edmundes land graūted hym fredom discharged place maner seruyce buylde chirche ouer martirs body ordeyned monkes yaue hem money landes rente therafter vsed kynges englonde sente crounes seynt edmond yf wolde vse hem afterward sholde pay therfor moche money haue hem ayene ¶ collectours trybute ful cruel place englonde mylde easy softe pl • tynges half saynt edmondes dyche capitulum 17 whan suanus dede dane made sone canutus kyng englysshmen sente normandy kynge egelredus promysed yf wold goodly hem wonte hem leuer put aweye canutus take hym kyng assented profre sente son • edward stable pee therafter lente tyme kyng come grete spede droof canutus oute lyndesey thenne canutus toke hym rede fo flee sandwyche kente made kytte handes nose alle englysshe pledgys delyuerd fader somtyme falled ayene deumarche come ayene next yere ¶ yere canutus sayled aboute eestenglond toke prayes southe countrey noble knyght edmund yrensyde cam manly ayenst hym edmond withdrough hym whan ware edricus treason edrycus yaue hym canutus westsaxons sawe delyuerd hym pledgys dyde kynge egelredus dyed london eyght dayes bifore maij buryed paules chirche deth bisshops abbotes lordes lande forsooke yssue progenye knouleched southampton canutus sholde kynge sware wolde hem true lord god warde worlde ¶but londoner many lordes made kynge edmund yrensyde anone made westsaxons subgette somme drede somme owne good wylle mene tyme canutus bysieged london putte ther fought edmonde dorsette besydes gyllyngham ouercomen therafter myddel somer edmond greete hoost fought sharply canutus prouynce wiccyes prouynce wircetre ther fought strongly eyther hooste withdrough hem pure werynesse alfred marianus morowe edmond ouercome dane ne fals edrycus shewed knyghtes hede moost lyke kyng edmōd edrycus shewed heede sayde flee englysshmen loo heede edmond kyng whan edmonde ware therof leyde one sharply faster fought vnto nyght ¶ nyght canutus wente london warde edmonde folowed saued cyte passed temse thyrd tyme ouercome dane brentford duc edrycus swar fewte kynge edmond yet fyfthe tyme whan dane robbed reued toke prayes edmond ouercome hem okeford kente chaced hem vnto yland shepeheye thenne edward torned westsaxon canutus toke prayes mercia therfore edmōd mette hym vpon asshdon ther strong fyghtynge eyther syde duc edrycus sawe dane downeward fledde traytour sholde soo many noble men slayn edmondes syde ther slayne bisshop lincoln abbot ramesey come praye knyght counseyll edrycus pee made bytwene kynges pledgys taken eyther syde ¶at durhurst vpon brynk seuarn pee made thys maner one knyghtes stode vp myddel hoost sayd alwey dye man hath vyctorye edmond maye ouercome grece strengthe canutus may ouercome fauoure fortune shal fruyte contynuel stryf whan knyghtes slayne eyther syde duke compellyd nede shal acord· owther certeynly shal fyghte withoute knyghtes alone eyther doo one tweyne acord kyngdome suffycient hem tweyne somtyme ynowe fyue couetyse lordship soo grete eyther hath indygnacion take haue part owther vnder late hem fyghte alone wol lordes alone lest yf al men fyght al men slayne soo shold leue knyghtes vnder heestes duke nowther defende kyng ayenste straunge alyenes thenne duke hoostes come geder atte yland olneye besydes gloucestre alle men cryed owther sholde acorde fyght • one kynges come geder middel ylād peple stode behelde eyther syde kynges fought first hors fote canutus espyed edmonde myght ouercome acorded partyner kyngdom threw awey wepens kyssed eyther thenne al men wondred ioyeful therof whanne done traytour edrycus desyred make hym self leeue canutus oxenford whanne edmonde pryny clense wombe nede kynde axeth edrycus pryuely hydde vnder place stykked kynge vpwarde sate sege edrycus wente canutus sayd hayle kyng aloone whanne kyng knewe stode sayd edrycus thou trowest plese suche manere seruyce hast slayne best body world shal arerethyn hede aboue lordes englond anone edrycus heede smyten sette aboue highest yate london ¶ r somme storyes say specially marianus edmond dyed manere acorde made stabled bytwene kynges kyngd • deled bytwene hem tweyn edmond dyed london aboute seynt andrew tyde buryed glastēbury grauntsir edgar semeth soth comune cronykes tellen edmundus deth canutus yaue mercia fals edrycus exyled edmundes broder counseylle dyde many dedes myght stande yf beheded edrycus byfore ¶ capitulum 18 canutus dane made kyng alone whanne edmond dede regned nynten yere deled kyng englond four assygned westsaxon hym self eeste englond conteyneth northfolk southfolk therle turkyllus mercia fals edricus northumberlond hyricius made counseylle london axed lordes yf ony mencion made thacord bytwene hym edmond edmundes bretheren owther childer shold kynges deth answerde ful falsly flateryngly saide nay also swar wold al wyse putte edmondes kynne trowed therby greete kynge afterword therfor somme slayn goddes rightful dome somme banysshed exyled putte oute lande counseylle edrycus kynge exyled edmondes broder cleped kyng churles afterwarde gylefully reconcyled slayne tresonne oun men kyng canutus drad ashamed sle edmōds sonnes edmond edward counseyll edrycus sente hem kynge swanus shold slee hem drad god sente hem forther salamon kynge hongary saue lyf edmond wedded kynges doughter dyed sone withoute child edward wedded agath henry emperours doughter bygate hyr margarete afterwarde quene sco • lande crystyne nonne edgar adelyng henricus libro sexto name adelyng made twey saxon wordes ade • noble lyng ymage adelynge noble ymage therfor westsaxons haue prouerbe grete despyte vnderlyng put oute honeste owther ymage goth bakwarde hooly kyng edwarde afterwarde purpo • make edgar heyr englond dradde goodwynes sone shrewdnes owne men made wiliam norman sone adoptinus willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ moneth iuyll kyng canutus wedded emma quene wold sure englonde bygate sonne called hardeknutus london fals edrycus despysed benefyce hym yeuen kynge bade slee hym ryght owne palays bade throwe body besydes walles temse ¶in war edrycus shold bytraye hym fraude treasonne exyled somme lordes loued erle leofrycus alwey afterwarde ¶ this· made parlement oxenforde englysshmen dane acorded holde kyng edgar lawes henricus libro sexto yere canutus wente denmarck hadde hym englysshmen ayenst wandales werred vpon hym nyght byfore batayll duc goodwyn englysshmen come vnwar vpon enemyes dysparpled hem chaced hem vnwyttyng kyng therfor kyng dyde englissh men grete worship tyme forwarde come ayene yere englonde ¶ yere alduinus bisshop lyndeffarn dede see wyde aboute thre yere made synode election bisshop come edmonde preest sayde game chese ye som toke game game ordeygned faste thre dayes cause wolde wytte saynt cuthbertus wylle thenne whanne preest atte masse voys sowned twyes oute seynt cuthberts tombe sayd edmond shold bisshop ¶also yere fell wonder saxon saynt magnꝰ martirs chirche fyften men thre woman ledde daunce chircheyerde crystemas nyghte preest chirche wroth prayd wreche sayd maner god graūte prayer seynt magne martir ye soo dyseaced lede maner daunce alle yere longe done whanne yere passed cristemasse twellyf moneth ledde daunce snowe vp sydes hadde nowther ete ne dronke nowther slepte till delyuerd prayer seynt cuthbert bysshop colon whanne drawen vp erthe leyde hem self byfore aulter thēne somme hem dyed anone somme kepte alyue shewed self grete dedes god one thilk woman preestes doughter prayd wreche hir oune brother wold haue drawē oute daūce brayde hym hir arme led forth daunce neuer latter yere ¶ willelmus pontificibus libro primo ¶aboute tyme bryghtwold monk glastenbury afterwarde fyrst bisshop wylton co • templacion thoughte kynges lygnage englyssh men lygnage nygh̄ al destroyed soo monke fyll slepe sawe saynt peter apostle helde hande edwarde egelredus sonne normandye thenne exyled oute englond sawe petre sacre edward made hym kyng shewed atte ful hooly edwarde shold shold regne thre twenty yere also monke axyd made question edwardes ofsprynge sholde kynges afterward peter answerde saide kyngdome englysshmen goddes kyngdome god shal ordeyne puruey henricus libro sexto ¶ aboute tyme hooly man warned englysshmen lorde thought sholde come oute fraunce gbrine hem ryght lowe tolde thynges sayde ende fyrst book ¶ willelmus de libro secundo yere egelnotus archebisshop caunterbury plesed kyng canutus goodnesse auctoryte hoolynesse f • red hym excesse brought seynt elphegus body oute london hys owne chirche ¶ cam rome papye bought seynt anstyns doctours arme cl̄i syluer talente golde sente arme couentre loue leof • ycus yere dyed fyrst henry emperour almayne hym fyrst conradus regned xv yere ordeyned euer brake lawe lande sholde leese heede thenne fyrst trespa • ed ayenst thordena ū ce erle lupoldus thenne • adde ful soore fledde wyldernesse wyf tyme conradus come thyder hunte herde slepynge bed wy spake hym twyes sayde erle heremytes childe born newly shal wedde thy doughter shall thyne heyr therfore indignacion commaunded brynge childes herte messagers dradde god threwe childe lyue woode brought kynge herte hare sone happed one duc harry passed therforth herde childe wepe sente hym norysshynge owne wyf bareyn named hym harry name whan chykde come age conradus kynge behelde hym ofte tyme bythoughte hym full ofte warned somtyme kepte chylde hym holden childes fader withsayde alwey themperour hym self bythought hym full ofte myght destroye childe therfor sente chylde themperyce lettres wreton maner whanne lettres redde childe sholde dye day childe lodged nyght preest redde childes lettres whanne childe slepe word sholde dye preest wrote shold wedde douhter done though themperour euyl apaid therfor bythought hym child gentil erles sone toke lyghtlyer buylde abbaye place wyldernesse childe borne abbaye called vrsania ¶ capitulum 19 also yere dyed seconde rycharde fourth duc normandy ¶ hym sone thyrde rychard duc normandy· one yere ducherye yonger broder robert slough hym venym duk hym vij yere duchery sory broders deth went pilgremage barfote ierusalem dyed bithinia hym seyde mighti polytique batayle large free yeftes mete drynke ¶on tyme happed grete fest knyghtes offred masse one hem offred duc trowed therfor myght offre bad yeue hym c pound leyd hem holy vpon aulter axed hym dyd soo hit yeuen offre seyd knyght duc herd yaf hym nother hundred pound owne vse ¶ nother tyme duc pleyed atte chesse hym yeuen golden iust wonderly feyre arayed perles precious stone yaf hit anon clerk pleyed hym atte chesse clerk dyed anon phiscians tolde cause seyd right hert closeth grete sorow cause deth hert soner opened ¶ also grete ioye hert openeth cause deth soner closed ¶ also tyme one brought duc robert twey wel fayre knyues anon badde yeue hym hondred pounde ¶and told mony tweye gentill horse yeuen duc ¶the duc yaf hem anon hym yaf hym knyues whan receyued thys sped hym fast way lest som lette myght haue fallen mene tyme duc yeuē acup seluer • essel bere fruyte ¶ sought brought knyues myght founden ¶ duc made grete moone sayd receyued symple reward broughte hym knyues ¶ seyde thys robert alle yafe hym hit suche yefte shold eten wold yeue hym yafe hym fyrst worshipfull yefte day willelmus de libro 2 robert tyme passed phalesya cyte normandye sawe • den called arlett hir name skynners doughter daūce among hir bed nyght helde hir somdele long tyme stede wyf bygat hir wiliā conquerour sweuē moder met signefyed grete shold met hir bowel sprad al englōd normādy also whan child born happed touched groūd toke handes ful powder pamēt cō streyned • andes helde fast powder therfor mydwyf told child shold kyng first night mayd • arlett brought duke bed rente hir owen smok fro chynne foot duc axed whi dyd neyther skyll ne curtesye said hemme smok hath byclipped foot shold torned toward lordes mouth duc robert went ierl̄m geder lordes londe fiseanum made hem swere feuty sonne william tho vij yere olde ordeyned erl • gilbert childes tutor ordeyned tutor maynteyned kyng fraunce held obeysance child til duc robert deed whan herd duc robertus deth euery theym toke hede hym self rought child atte last gilbert slayne one rauf chyldes vnkle ther fightyng man slaughter countrey foule faren strif men amonge hem self william yong armes one guye bourgyon cause maker alle strif treson whyche gye williams kynnesman second richardes doughter william toke hym hym deth ¶ odo kynges broder fraunce come ayenst willyam willyam maystrye chased odo made hym fle • henry kyng fraunce herd therof cam grete multitude despitously fouly chased ¶but mediatours went bitwene made pea kynges men fraunce delyuered taken prisoner ¶ take grete hede wylliam faught ofte kyng fraunce neuer sodenly men doo dayes ¶but day batayle shold sette euer victorye whan kyng fraunce ded toke manly londes normandy thaugh londes wer long tyme absolute counte canouic litil bretayn kyng charles yeuen rollo doughter gilla will̄m wan manly harold english̄ man batayle asit shal sayd duc whert went ierl̄m passed borgoyne ther went yate porter smot hym staf anon thanked god forbad men charged none hem shold tak wreche dede sayd wel worthy haue harm loue sayd stroke al rothomage cam take crosse pope noble palle aboute ymage grete constantyne scorned romayns wold namely one yere yeue theyr lord clothe also made shooe mule gold rode forbade al men shold take vp shoe whan fallen also cam themperour constantinople whyle spak themperour sawe benche al hous sate hym vpon owne pall maner oune countrey· knyghtes duc bad lefte theyr pallys whan arysen sayd shold take awey bench duc prayd emperour take money cost wey answerd sayd wold pylgremage lyue owne whan cam ageyne wolde doo emperours wylle kyng forbade man shold selle fewel sethe mete therwith duc bought note sethed mete kynge wondred duke manhede made bench court afterwarde stede forsayd palles herafter duc eueled soo weye myght neyther goo ne ryde therfor hyred pour sarasyns sholde bere hym daye litere shulders charged norman wente agayne normandye norman wold axe tidynges duc shold tell sene fendes bere duc heuen ward called sarsynes fendes holye lande heuen hit vsed crysten man shold come within holy cyte wyth oute grete hyre ¶ many men herd duke comyng came hym prayed hym helpe sware herte hys wombe whyle one peny wold laste shuld entre noble sarsyn lord cyte herde therof also herd duke manly dedes forbad anon nothyng shuld taken hym nowther ony man come companye charged comaunded also yeue duc alle offryng day receyued offryng yaf hit anon pore men dyed sone bithinia sayd ¶ capitulum 20 benet xx iohn pope ix yere al • thys tyme maryanus scotte born laboure cronyk muche enhaunced maryanus norganes sey men norewey forsoke eft theyr holy kyng olauus symplenesse toke canutus stede cursidly slayne fourth yere ¶ robert kynge fraunce dede sonne hugh kynge hym ¶ also yere canutus wente oute denmark rome yaue large gyftes seynt peter made scole saxon free al maner trybute yaf large almes grete comynge ageyne toward englond payed grete raunsonne passage pylgryms many place purchaced weyes opened closed procured pope relece pryce payment prymates kyngdome wonte yeue pay haue palle dedes sente letter lordes englonde charged hem shold byfore comyng amende trespaces defautes · iohan nynth benette pope eyght yere benet putte oute poperyche another callyd syluestre putte stede siluester putte oute benet restored ageyne yet benet efte put oute ageyn iohan arche pretour seynt iohns place callid ante portam latinam made pope inner iohan callyd sixt gregory benet boystous lettrure whanne hadde poperyche ordeyned another pope thoffy • e holy chirche maner doyng dysplesyd many men therfore thyrd brought ynne shold thoffyce hem soo one stroofe ayenst tweyne tweyne ayenste one poperyche thenne henry themperour hadde wedded conradus doughter successour put oute pope brought strengthe bisshop ramberge callyd seconde clement ¶ hym henry crowned also henry compellyd romaynes swere shold neuer ch • se pope without assent benet deth appered man lykenesse wō der shape • beeste asse tayle beeres heede seid apeyred right whyle alyue yere dyed robert duc normādy pylgremage hym yong sone wiliam duc whiche wiliam sayd •• fore mar yere canutus lytel byfore dyed one suan •• kynge ouer norganes suanus holden sone canutus elgyna hampton ¶ somme men sayd elgyna myght conceyue noo childe kyng therfore toke suanus whanne newe borne preestes wyf leyde hir self downe childebedde childe hir begyled kyng canutus broughte hym wytte sothe ¶ canutus made sonne emme sone hardeknutus kynge ouer dane kynge canutus dyed septon shaftesbury buryed wynchestre old abbay ¶ henricus libro sexto spekyth thre grete dedes dyd fyrst maryed doughter themperour conradus seconde wente nobly rome come ageyne brought hym greete dele oure lordes crosse thyrd sette seet see stronde whyle see flowyng commaunded charged see shold comme vpon lande see sholde wete lordes clothes ¶ see cam vp wonte owne kynde wette kynges thyes kynge starte awey sayde al men shal wyte knowe power myght kynges vayne vanyte none worthy haue name kyng hath al thynge subgette lawes kynge canutus neuer bare crowne vpon heede tyme sette crowne vpon crucifyx heede wynchestre whanne canutus dede made grete stryf oxenford sholde kynge successour leofrycus consul chestre lordes northsyde temse londoner also toke harold harefote holden sonne canutus elgyna hampton made hym kynge though goodwyn made hym besy canutus marianus somme men sayen harolt souters sonne falsly anone born brought bedde elgyna leyde hir thouh born hym brought hym forth ryght suanus leyd hir somtyme herald made kynge toke fro emma al kynges ryches put hir oute englond erle flaundres receyuyd hir worshipfully dyde hir grete fauour ethelnotus archebisshop caunterbury dyed seuen dayes dyed ethelricus bisshop winchestre besily praid god yt self shold lōg liue ethelnotꝰ edsius heraldes chapelayn made archebisshop caunterbury stygandus heraldes preest made bisshop wynchestre therafter toke see caūterbury wrongfully edsius herald dyed london fourth yere kyngdome buryed wynchestre whan dede lordes londe sente hardeknutus kynge denmark dwellyd flaundres moder ¶ capitulum xij hardecnutus come englonde regned thre yere dyde right nought worthy praised fore anon sente alfrycus archebisshop york goodwyn london made take vp kynge heraldes body oute erthe wreche wronges herald done moder made smyte heraldes hede dede byfore throw body temse afterward fysshers founde bodye buryed couenably also hardecuntus made pay euery rower nauey eyght marc syluer tribute thempyre englonde putte al rule gouernaunce kyngdome vpon wytte counseyll goodwyn owne moder whan kyng putte themperial trybute vpon englysshe men tweyne kynges mynystres assē tynge dede slayne wyrcetre therfore cyte destroyed sette fyre ¶ willelmus de li 2 also kynge maryed fayrest syster gunnylda harry themperour gunnylda doughter canutus emma byfore wowed many greete wowers hir faders tyme ¶whanne hadde longe tyme husband accused spouse brekynge hir nory hadde brought hyr oute englonde putte hym fyghte quarele hym tolde fals tale though tale teller grete geaunt fought gyder gun nyldas nory carf fals pelours hamme hym down· vertu god maystrye gunnylda beganne hep daunce ioye forsoke hir husband euer wolde neuer come bedde mannes prayer toke hooly veyle bycam nonne hen li 6 mar heraldes tyme elfrede edward sone kyng egelredꝰ emma aft er long dwellid normādye toke hem many knyghtes normandy come speke moder wynchestre goodwyn caste mary doughter edward sympler yonger tweyn supposed elder broder wolde despyse suche maryage goodwyn warned lordes englond sayde seker ony man shold brynge lande many mē straūge gileful nacion therfor comin must pay peyne norman brought forth slough alwey ix kepte tenthe yet hym thought tythyng many lefte· tythed efte tythynge • maner fastned endes guttes stake arered pyght grounde ledde lodyes aboute stake till last endes guttes come oute elfreduc sente ely blyndynesse fewe dayes whan emma herde sente sone edward hastyly normandy ther goodwyn blamed hardecuntꝰ kyng lordes dedes ¶ thenne sware dyde neuer suche dedes compellyd strengthe kyng harald whan conradus first dede seconde harry wedded doughter emperour hym hym wondres redde byfore book· regned xvij yere put al mynstrals oute court yaue pore men al wonte yeue mynstrals byfore w de li 2 also syster nonne loued hir moch myght suffre hir companye tyme clerk court layne hir al nyght vnto morow tyde erthe heled al snow toke hem rede clerke made hir bere hym hir bakk oute court kyng aroos pysse sawe doynge helde pee till bisshopryche voyde thenne yaue clerk bisshopryche sayd loke thou neuer ride vpon woman rydge therafter voyded abbaye menchons yaue syster sayd take looke thou neu er bere clerk ridyng thy bak thus espyed absteyned afterwarde also tyme emperour wēt vpon sonday callid quinquagesima pryuatly bere masse chapel besydes forest· seruyd ryght fowle preest therfor kynge bythought wondred herte god fayr wold suffre soo foule creature come nyghe handle sacramentis whan verse tracte songen • itote quoniā dominꝰ ipse est deus wyte ye lord god preest loked themperour bla • mynge defaute clerc sayd ipse fecit no et non ipsi no made v self emperour meoued sawe made preest bisshop sone preest made place gree honeste good maner lyuyng ryche man lad awey nōne departed hyr restored nonne hyr abbay ageyne afterward ryche man fylle synne cursed hym come company thenne dwellyd owne orcharde last sekenesse thēne prayde bisshop wold hym assoylle bisshop answerde sayd yf cursyd man wol leue cursed woman shal assoyled yf wol day twelue moneth hour whanne shal dye shal dye answer dedes byfore hyghest god done dyed bothe daye twellyf moneth kyng chappel clerk grete connynge scrypture fayre wy clerke lecherous emperour bade hym day rede gospel wold defouled self strompette nyght fore thenne emperour sayde owther rede gospel owther forsake lande anone trussed fardel arayd hym goo emperour hadde charged seruauntes sholde go hym priuately yf wolde goo sholde brynge hym ageyne whanne done kynge sayde hym gladde thy goodnesse thou draddest god losynge thyne owne countrey wrath heuen manace therfore forsake woode loue thou vsyst shall make bisshop also whyle harry yonge conradus hows toke one pype syluer suche child vse playe promysed clerke bisshopryche pype whan emperour atte laste emperour clerk axyd promysed hym sone themperour smyten greuous sekenesse soo thre dayes felte noo thynge nowther tasted mete ne drynke atte laste prayer goode men stode aboute hym caught breth sente clerke auaū ced deposed hym dome counseylle knouleched al tho thre dayes tormented fendes cast hym wonder hoote brennyng lye thurgh pype ¶ comparyson lye oure fyre temperatly warme ther come yonglyng golden chalis ful water quenched heete spryngyng water sayd saynt laurence yonglyng seynt laurences chirche al falle elde feblenesse defawte helpe emperour amended chirche yeuen therto chalys mar henryes tyme grete stryf chirche rome thre men chosen pope one preest callyd gracianus yaue money poperyche harry cam rome cesse stryf gracianus profered hym crowne gold al conuycte symony deposed another made pope also emperours tyme pallas bodye geaunt founden rome hole sound withoute rotyng wyth chyn woūdeof four fote longe half bodye lengthe passed heyght walles rome ¶at heede lanterne brennynge myght quenchyd blast neyther moysture er eyer cā lytle hole made vnder leite tōbe two versus wretō pallas euandres sonne spere turnus knyght dyde deth wyse lyeth ¶ willelmus de regibus libro 1 trowe versus made latyn whanne geaunt buryed though cārmentus euandres moder hadde founde byfore lettres latyn trowe rather afterward made ennio owther somme poete tyme bodye bysprongen water roted bodyes doo senewes fallen skynne also ¶ capitulum 22 benet sixte gregory pope aboute four yere callyd gracianus byfore willelmus de regibus ¶ man grete relygyon sternesse hadde batayll somtyme henry themperour also founde state papacye rome soo falle vnnethe ought hym self· cardynals lyue fewe townes nyghe cyte offryng crysten men ¶ remenaunt taken awey owther occupyed theues soo ferforth offrynges taken awey aulters vnder naked swerdes
