outher robbed high stretes weyes therfor prouynces left toke wey rome bycause theues wey theues saynt peter chirche gregory sawe treated fyrst softe fayr speche whan sawe helpyd cursyd alle dyde soo departed hem body hooly chirche assentynge soo dyde whanne pope sawe halp brought hym self peryll dethe wrote themperour shold helpe hooly chirche poynte falle themperour excused hym warre wandalia prayd pope wold stede cost put hande therfor pope yaue dome yren cuttynge must vsid gat armour horsmē euery side drofe awey fyrst owther slough theues robbed offrynges saynt peter chirche pope gate ageyne lande loste longe tyme thenne quyrytes wonte lyue thefte robberye cleped pope ablodsheder man sleer sayde worthy doo thoffyce aulter ¶ soo many cardynals assentynge meouynge demed pope shold buryed hooly chirche laste sekenesse ware therof callyd cardynals byfore hym spak hem man bretheren wondreth gretely ye deme bisshop rabbyshly haue lyued haue spēte youre prouffyte delyueraunce haue forgendryd rouht fame worlde therfore yf men make suche tale ye shold stylle thoppynyons fooles better manere meanynge theues hadde taken aweye youre lyflode myght suffre therfore werryd theues therfore syth euery mannes dede shal demed thentente doth dede gospel sayth· thyne eye symple yf thyne entente ryghtfull body shal bryght clere gaderyng thy werkes somtyme yafe almes poure men shewed benefeite thef robber therfore robbed slayn shal blamed ydue almes pylgryme thurgh whiche hadde deth god forbede couetyse theef dyd cursed dede large fredome also lawe blamed punysshed praysed dyuers entēt thef sleeth hydels punisshed knyghte preysed sleeth enemye bataylle fyrst sleeth man couetyse second sauacion countrey also fyrst pope adryan somtyme preysed graū ted charles inuestiture prelate nowe bisshopes preysed doo contrary taken fro prynces maner power thenne somme manere cause resonably graunted nowe resonably warned denyed charles soule enfecte couetyse court rome fer ellysers prynce nyghe fastby wolde ryght nought doo couetyce couetyce prynces hath shente al maner maye cause taken toward eyther syde apeyred owther holpen ye sey bisshops offyce shede bloode nowther make shedde graunte netheles fallyth hym yf sue innocente peryle helpe socoure hym tonge hande ezechyel accused preestes wythstode ne made walle goddes hows twey persones ordeyned destroye vyces goddes chirche one whetteth speche another bereth swerde take wytnesse god armed tonge ayenst thenemyes hooly chirche longe myghte profyt hym whome befalleth worche swerde prayede thryes messagers lettres wolde come chastyse suche maner theues wrote ageyne occupyed warre wandalia prayd wolde trauayle coste dystourbe theues shold doo whan hadde put offyce vpon sawe sleynge cyteseyns domage pylgryms meschyef th • pope cardynals spareth theef yeueth cause occasion ryghtful man innocent slayne one caas ye sey falleth preest shede mannes blode graūt yf defowle hym self bereth downe wykl̄ed man saueth man innocente ryghtful blessyd kepe ryghtfull dome ryghtwysenes phynees mathathyas praysed stykked hem thurgh trespast shal lesse suffre oure veray hooly thynges defowled mystery shadow comparison oures zachary bisshop put kyng osias oute wold cense withoute drede wold haue kyld hym nadd hadde goon weye dyd hym good whiche semed slough lenger wycked man lyueth deseruyth blame peyne therfore shorteth lyf suche one lassyth blame peyne soo doth hym yeueth hym benefyce treuisa ware deuyls argument gyle man neuer euyl yet may amende lyue soo dyde paul mary magdalene many soo cryst meaneth gospel ensample whete cockle somme men calle darnel· foloweth storye thenne pope sayd wther ye begyled doynge take bodye whanne dede sette byfore chirche dores oute doo dores fast loken barres yf dores ope goddes grace vertue doo body ye wol whanne done pope desired ther cam whyrl wynde brake vp dores barres shufte body anone inner wal chirche whanne miracle seen cardynals people buryed hym seynt peter chirche ¶ also yere fest spousayle lambehyth besydes london whyle kyng hardecnutus hool gladde mury stode drank fylle sodenly downe wexe dombe dyed eyght day iunij buryed fader wynchestre ¶ henricus libro sexto seith soo large soo free hert wold make araye kynges mess four sythes day ffor hym leuer ghestes shold leue releef axe mete willelmus de sent normandy edward sholde come crowned kyng pledgys yeuen shold brynge hym fewe norman thenne helped edwardes syde leofrycus erle chestre goodwyn duc westsaxons lyuyngus bisshop wyrcetre ¶ r marianus sayth kynge hardecnutus hadde sente byfore brother edward made hym abide hym owne courte ¶ willelmus de marianus ¶ capitulum 23 edward come englond crowned kyng westmynstre edsius archebisshop caunterbury regned aboute four twenty yere kyng wedded godytha goodwyns doughter ladde hir suche crafte soo put hir bedde nowther lay hir flesshely whether dyde hate hir meyny owther loue chastyte knowe certayne solempne doyng told hym lyued alwey withoute gylt woman kynge worshiped owne moder atte full wther shamed hir openly counseyll goodwyn toke precious thynges iewels hadde owther harde hym somtyme owther wolde yeue hym ryght nought also hadde hym oute normandy somme hym famylyer sholde rewarded among toke one robert gemeticus mōk made hym fyrst bisshop london archebisshop caunterbury kyng symple dyde moche robertes counsayle awaited tyme outlawed wyues fader goodwyn sonnes also toke fro oune moder al closed hyr thabbaye werwel suspection homely bisshop wynchestre prysonned bisshop alwyn emma easyly kepte somdele hyr large wrote bisshops englonde whiche hadde trust frendship sayd hit greued hyr despyte bisshop hyr owne shame sayd redy goddes owne dome thassay fyre hoote yron bisshop wrongefully defamed thenne bisshops come geder kyng shold haue kyng al prayed ne hadde robert tharchebisshop caunterbury spake ayenst hem bretheren bisshops said robert dar ye defende hir wilde beest woman hath defamed hir owne sonne kyng nempned hir lecherous lemman goddes owne crist woman wold purge bisshop shal purge woman accused assentyng deth hir sonne egelredus procured venym poysenynge edward auctoryte power vpon condicion proprete kynde male owther female yet yf wold goo barfote self four steppe bisshop fyue steppe continuelly vpon nyne solow share brennyng fyre hoote thenne yf escape harmeles ouer steppe shal quytte assoyled chalenge anone day thassay purgacion appoynted till day come kyng lordes take robert one nyght day purgacōn woman prayer wynchester seynt swythytes tombe comforted morowe hir eyen hidde passed fyre hote solowe share escaped harmeles ¶ kyng began grone axed mercy disciplyned eyther bisshop moder also restored moder taken fro hir thenne quene emma yaf saynt swithyne ix maners bisshop yafe ix bicause ix solow share emma ouer passed robert bisshop caunterburye fledde normandye marianus elfword bisshop london somtyme abbot euessham wax vnsuffisaunt elde feblenes sekenesse gouerne rule grete bisshopriche wold haue abbot euesham ayene brether place wold assente toke hym bokes thynges owther successours yeuen abbey euesham went hym thabbey ramesay ther dyed sone buryed ¶ hym came robert • em marianus kyng edward gadred strong nauey hauen sandewiche ayenste harolde harfager kyng noreganes arrayed hym com werr englonde betaylle suanus kyng dane yafe hym purpos lette sayth nother tyme kyng edward lough messe wonte present wondred axed hit noreganes dane sayd kyng accorded come werre englond whan arrayed forto sayle one profred hem bolle meede drynke prayed hem dispitous name yf wold drynke cam bolle bolle dronkenesse torned ianglyng ianglyng stryf strif fyghtyng departed shufte twynne hope tyme shall non alien werre londe grego x benet pope aboute two yere bought poperiche therfor harry themperour put hym oute brought second clement dyed one year poppo pope hym two monethes poppo cleped second damasius whan dede ix leo pope v yere forsayd harrold kyng noreganes sent olauus hys broder moder syde chased swanus kyng denmarche made denmarche subgiet hym self kyng swanus put axed helpe kyng englond ¶ erle godwyn assentyng lordes counselled nay kyng har • old dyed suanus recouered denmarche agayn yere lyuyngus bisshop wirceter dyed aldredus bisshop hym ¶ aldredus first monke wynchester abbot tauestok grete snowe fille west contreyes englond hit brake grete tree woodes dured first day ianuar seynt patriques day fell grete pestilence men deth beestes lightnyng forscalded cornes yere bateyle bitwene henri kyng fraunce lordes normandy wold receyue william duc whan wer ouercom duc william outlawed som hem heng som hem throtes aboute tyme erlewynus knyght normandy forsoke worldly cheualrye byld abbey beccum normandy yet called becherlewyn ¶ hym shamed nought abbot ruler bere ston morter werke bake brede doo werkes clennes honeste god sent hym twey lantern worlde helpe counseyl lanfranke ancelme twey men grete clergy lettrure eyther hem pryour place one another afterward archebisshop caunterbury marianus yere pope leo swanus kyng danes· went harry themperour ayenst baldwyn erle flaundres ¶ edward kyng englond kepte see nauey til themperour wylle ¶ also ix pope leo wemme conscyence emperour made hym pope somdele mastrye therfor resygned poperiche laufully chosen pope agayne also yere theues irland cam seuarn see helpe griffyn kyng wale toke many prayes aboute riuer vaga meane tyme swanus godwynes eldest sone somtyme leyne edgyna abbesse leofmonaster cast wedde hir forsoke wyf therfore cam englond yf myght haue grace make pea kyng comyng slough erle beornus cosyn aboute make pea wyth kyng fled flaundres til reconcyled helpe aldredus archebisshop york worcetre marianus ¶ capitulum 24 kyng edward dyscharged englysshmen greuous tribute fader egelredus made pay soudyours denmarck tho dured fourty yere yere dyed edsius archebisshop caunterbury kyng edward yafe archebisshopryche famylyer robert made bisshop london moneth september eustacius erle boloyn come lande douer hadd wedded goda kynge edwardes syster· knyghtes sought innes vnwysely slough one cyteseyns cyteseyns slough one knyghtes ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo marianus atte laste strong fyghtynge soo cyteseyns slough twenty men erles company wounded many couth telle many woū ded erle escaped vnnethe one felawe cam kynge gloucestre meoued kyng greuously ayenst englysshmen goodwyn erle kent sompned courte charged sholde hooste take wreche wrong done therle saw alyenes alowed kynge wolde helpe saue cyteseyns countrey men answerde sayd reason wardeyns castel douer sholde sompned yf couthe excuse self sholde harmeles el doo therles plesure bodyes catel kynge semed goodwyn sett lytel heste therfore lordes lande called geder gloucetre specially leofrycus erle mercia syward erle northumberlond withstonde goodwyn erle kente eldest sonne suanus harold also goodwyn gadred grete hoost beuerstō countees kente southrey westsaxon suanus •• untees barokshire oxenford shire gloucestre shire harold countees eestsex eeste englond huntyngton shyre goodwyn enpeched gadred grete hoost answerde sayd doo cesse walsshmen walsshmen made blame tourne ayenste owne hede lytell accorde euer procured ther assygned counsayll london dede soo goodwyn harold shuld come courte vnarmed twelue men mo shulde bytake kynge knyghtes seruyce dewe hem englond ¶ sayde myght withoute weddes pledgys come counsayle trechours gyleful men myght wythoute perylle shame passe weye fewe naked men vnarmed mene tyme goodwyns knyghtes withdrewe somme somme drede kynges hooste thenne openly cryed kynges cryours goodwyn shold come court maner sayd owther wide oute englond within fyue dayes therfore goodwyn thre sone swanus tosty gurth sayled ilande thorney flaundres therle baldwyn suanus hadde spoused doughter iudytha harold leofwynus sayled oute brystow irlond algarus leofrycus sonne toke haraldes counte ruled nobley delyuerd vp harald good wyll whan herald comen ageyne axyd ageyne whan harold tourned faders countees therfor kyng edward playn parlemente outlawed goodwyn thre sonnes putte owne wyf godytha quene abbay warwe • le withoute worshipe one mayde moo soo fader sonnes outlawed two yere fulle toke prayes march englond gadred grete strength purposed slyly fyghte kynge lordes wente bytwene soo pea made two yere quene broughte ageyne soo wylnotus goodwyns sonne hacun swanus sonne pledgys leyde wedde surete pee anone kynge edward sente hem kepyng wylliam duc normandye durynge outelawynge duc wylliam normandye come grete multitude englonde hadde many greete yeftes wente ageyne normandy quene emma kynges moder dyed buryed wynchestre also marianus scot yere age fyue twenty forsoke world wente pylgremage shoren monke coloyn cyte almayn abbay scottes ¶ willelmus de pon li 1 marianus yere godwyn al sone acorded kyng edward oute take eldest sonne swanus sory deth cosyne berinus wente flaundres barfoote ierusalem went ierusalem licia dyed cold taken norman kynges coūseyllours yeuen hym euyl counsayle exyled specially robert archebisshop caunterbury ludder blowen trompe ayenst goodwyn englisshmen cause robert dradde wold beware perylle ▪ wente rome cam ageyne lettres pope dyed abbay called gemmeticum hym stygandus archebisshop hadde lefte bysshopryche shyrborn toke strengthe bisshoprich wynchestre man vsed feyres hooly chirche thynges lewed man nygh al bisshops englonde tyme myghty man money flateryng therfor neuer worthy haue palle fro rome though ther grete sale doth many maystries w de p li 2 openly songe weyes worthy bisshopryche coude vse brag boost world vse wodenesse· courage glotony araye clothynge fare knyghtes gaderynge horsmen thynk ryght lytel profyt soules told hem bysshop shuld alowed holynesse clergye couetyce moneye wold answer metre nunc aliud tempus alij pro tempore more tyme maners vsed tyme planed sharpnesse doyng lyghtnesse answer marianus ¶that tyme irlande clerk barbosus man grete wonder relygyon soo helde grete scole clerkes lewdmen wench forshaar wench secte maner scolers putte oute irlond willelmus de pontificibus libro secundo ¶aboute tyme dyed seynt alfwold laste bisshop shirborn first monk wynchestre thenne made bisshop vsed breede water amonge alle greete festes made englonde comynge dane man deuoute alle poyntes oure lady seynt cuthbert ¶ deth noo man myght greue see punysshed shulde fered blac ymages slepe shold starte also tyme stryf bytwene hym goodwyn erle myght alayed atte day acorde sette bisshop wroth sayd goynge awey saynt mary lady shal fare ryght euyl hour goodwyn neuer rest gnawyng bowel till hadd bisshops blessyng tyme bisshop went durham dyde dede semed grete hardynesse tourned awey helyng bodye spake seynt cuthbert owne frende leyd yefte loue wente forth wey ¶ capitulum 25 leo seconde vyctor pope two yere six monethes made synode florence ytalye sette downe many bisshops symonye fornycacion ¶marianus ¶this yere syward noble duc northumberlond commaundement kyng edward bare downe scotland wyth hoost horsmen grete gadrynge chaced kynge toke malcolyn kyng combres sone made hym kynge scotland bataylle sywardes sonne slayne whanne fader wyste dede wounde hadde receyued byfore bodye behynde though fader sory sone deth yet gladde sonne herty soo hardy yere dyed wulsius bisshop lychefeld leofwynus abbot couentre bisshop hym ¶ also yere wyndsor morowe eester daye erle goodwyn sate atte kynges borde happed one childer seruyd kyng cam kynges cuppe stombled one fote kepte hym self shed nought drynke ¶ goodwyn sawe lough sayde nowe one brother hath holpen anone kynge answerde therto sayde soo brother aluredus wold haue holpen ner goodwyn erle vnderstode ther spoken ynough vnderstode kynge meaned bytraynge broder sayd kynge sir see told shold aboute slee thy brother bytraye mot sauely swolowe morsel holde hande gyliles suche dedes choked anone atte kyngys comaundement harold drough hym fro vnder bord buryed wynchestre r marianus saith godwyn sate te mete kyng wynchestre sodenly take sekenesse eester monday dyed thursday eester weke godwyns erldome yeuen harold haraldes erldome algarus sonne erle leofrycus yere kyng edward sent aldredus bysshop wircetre second henry themperour prayeng wold sende lettres hungary sende then englonde cosynne edward sone edmond irensyde ¶ kynge hadde ordeyned make hym heyr englond thyrdde yere come englonde dyede london long tyme rather kynge edward fader margaret quene scotland edgar adelyng margret malcolyn dauyd kynge scotlande molde quene englond ¶ marianus ¶this yere kyng edward outlawed algarus sonne leofrycus withouten gylte anon prayed associate gryffyn kyng wale destroyed prouynce herford toke herford▪ sette mynster fyre slough seuen chanons erle harald pursued hem fledde restored herford ageyne walled aboute made pee outlawed kyng item mar also yere syward noble duc northumberlond dyed york flyx buryed mynster galmaicho buylde er dyed made arme hym sate vpryght sayd thus semeth knyght dye lyggynge faynt oxe sonne waltyf yonge lay cradel erldome yeuen tosty heraldes broder theraboute ten yere item mar w also yere herman flaundres somtyme kynge edwardes preest bisshop wylton ramesbury dysease defaute catayll prayd kyng almost graunted ordeyne see abbay malmesbury lordes londe wolde assente therfor herman wroth lefte bisshopryche went ouer see toke monkes habytes seynt bertines lyued thre yere aldredus bisshop wyrcetre ruled hermās bisshoprich men • tyme fallyth ofte take relygyon hasty sodayne reeses haue stydfast wyl deuocion withdraweth slaketh atte laste ¶ thre yere herman come englond ageyne ¶ man wonte al lyf tyme haue • ykyng seruyce plesynge wyll thought ful heuy elenge leue age also come ere goodwyn dede hym hadde wythstande also bisshop shirborn dede hadde longe tyme thought oone ioyne bisshopryche owne old promysses quene held longe tyme bysshopryc • e soo ioyned thre countrees longed therto vnto nynth yere wyliam conquerour whan passed shyrborn salesbury willelmus de regibus also yere kyng feste harold tosty pleyed byfore hym harold drough broder heeres harder game wold threwe hym ground weryed hym handes ne rather delyuerd oute clawes whanne kynge sawe sayd grete stryf sholde bytwene tho twey bretheren one hem shold slee ¶ erle goodwyns fyrst wyf kyng canutus syster hir goodwyn gate sone rode hors vnwysely spurred hym hors threwe hym temse soo dreynt moder smyten lyghtnynge dyed wonder • e toke fayr wench sette hem hoerdom wold gadre ryches deth goodwyn wedded another wyf bygate hyr syx sonnes suanns harold tostius wilynotus surth loofrycus spedde wret • n byfore cronyk ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo aboute tyme woman barcley vsed euyll craftes fest day crowe hadde lykyngly fedde norysshed creked ludder wonte wom n herde knyf fyll downe hyr hande hyr face wex al pale byganne te sygh grone sayd day solow comen last sorow whanne sayd cam messagyer sayd woman sonne dede al hyr meyny leyde fallen dede also woman laye seke anone sente hyr chylder lyue monke nonne whanne monke nonne comen spak hem maner womā haue vsed euyl crafte euyl lyuyng veyne hoped saued bede prayer pray ye wol releue tormentes paynes soule dome yeuen caas ye may kepe body yf sewed hertes leder lay trowh stone heled lydde leed faste bounde barred yren byndeth fast thre yren cheynes make ye fourty syng psalmes nyght many mass dayes yf lye soo thre nyghtes fourth daye burye body erthe al nought twey fyrst nyghtes psalmes syngyng fendes brake vp doores twey vttermest cheynes wonder lyghtly ¶ thyrd nyght aboute cockes crowyng place al shoke one grysely face hyghe stature brake vp dores heete bodye sholde aryse may sayd body strong bandes thou shalt vnbounde sayd thyne owne harme anone al letted broken toke hir oute chirche sette hyr vpon blac hors neyhed byfore dores soo wente awey lowde cryes herde four myle thennes ¶ though wonderful hath redde fourth booke af gregoryes dyalog shal deme myght trowed ¶ therfore wreton fendes caste oute wycked man buryed chirche ferd charles marcellus sayd 〈◊〉 ¶ capitulum 26 thyrdde henry second henryes sonne regned amōg duche men aboute fyfty yere somtyme dystourbed holy chyrche ayenste pope hyllebrande wold yf myght haue putte another pope ceesed wente hooly lande duke godefr • de beamund shal sayd inner ¶ victor nynth stephen abbot mount cassyn pope eyghte monethes cam strengthe resygned papacye afterwarde ¶ agelrycus bisshop durham lefte owne bisshopryche owne good wylle wente thabbaye bourgh norysshed lyued xij yere pea quyete broder agelwyn bisshop hym mar also yere noble erle leofrycus sonne leoswynus duc mercia dyed owne towne bromley last day nouembre buryed couentre thabbay bylde somtyme counseyl god owne wyf god gyna worshiped moche lady amended made ryche thabbayes leonen besydes herford wenlok wyrcetre euesham twey chirches chestre one seynt iohan another saynt werburgh lyue wytte redynes stode greete stede lande englysshmen r ¶ also abusy prayer wyf made town couentre fre al maner tolle oute take tolle horse haue fredome graunted wyf godgyna countesse rode naked thurgh myddel towne mornyng keueryd deth leofrycus sonne algarus therldome mercia yere conuycte treason outlawed gryffyn kyng wale receyued ben byfore reconcyled w de yong cyteseyn rome lucianus name ryche man cataylle gold man grete kynne wedded wyf eugenya bycause therof made grete feest wente felde mete men dyscharge stomak newe wedded man wold play atte balle dyde spousyng rynge fynger ymage fast whanne playd hoote drough hym fyrst oute game wente fette ageyn ryng founde ymages rynge • lyght palme hande thenne bygan wrynge wrast long tyme couth wreste ryng nowther wreth ne breke nowther ryght vp fynger wente stylly aweye felawes shold wytte therof lest wold scorne hym whyle owther take awey rynge whanne thennes ¶thenne cam thyder seruauntes whan derk nyght founde fynger euen strayght ryng awey grete wonder whanne tyme araid hym bedde wyf felt dym thyng sadde walowe bytwene hym hys wyf ¶ spake hym sayde lye dele me▪ thou hast spoused daye goddesse venus ¶thenne soore afered woke alle nyghte soo ferde wer • euery nyght thenne wyf pleyned charged hym shold warne fader moder soo dyde thenne fader moder warned pal • mbus preest suburbes grettest nygromancer tyme lyue receyued greete mede yaue yong man letter shold take met laste nyght comyng ayenst hym chaar metyng twey weyes yonge man stode metyng twey weyes nyghte sawe woman sytte mule arayed strompet hyr heer abrode chaplet gold hyr hede rodde gold hir hande thenne toke letter hym cam last rydyng whanne letter redde principale fende hafe vp bothe handes heuen sayd almyghty god long shal wickednesse palumbes preest dure anone knyghtes come venus haue rynge wrenched blenched stroof long tyme atte last knyghtes wrest ryng toke yong man ayene soo wylle ioye loue hadde long desyred palumbus herde fende crye hym heuen kytte owne lymmes knowleched al tres • aa pope presence heryng peple marianꝰ ¶ aldredus bisshop wyrcetre made saynt wulstan pryour wyrceter leue kyng yaue bisshopryche wylton herman comen ayene beyonde see aldredus wente ouer see forth hungary pylgremage ierl̄m ¶me redyth bisshop englond soo dyde byfore tyme coloyn almayne twey abbeyes scottes brente theyr owne fyre ¶ one patronus monk closed warned hem brennyng longe tyme byfore whanne fyre comen wolde oute noo maner wyse brente loue martirdome treuisa ¶in doyng patronus monke semed lewde goost couth knowe cause circumstance veray martirdō veray martirdome mayntenynge trouth owther feyth wythstandyng wrong synne god graunte yf wylle patronus dampned blynde deuocion ¶than foloweth thystorye ¶aboute tyme prouynce apulea founde ymage marble heede brasse hadde garland whiche garland wryton fyrste daye maij atte sonne rysyng shal haue heede gold sarasyn duc longobardes taken prysonner vnderstode meaned come fyrst day maij toke hede shadow ymage lengthe brede founde vnder shadowe wonder greete tresoure payed raunsonne ¶ willelmus de regibus ¶ capitulum 27 whan benet putt oute second nycolaus pope aboute two yere tyme hooly chirche fraunce gretely destroyed berengarius archedeken toreyn sayde ooste aulter veray crystes bodye fygure therof ayenste pope made counseylle versel ytaly honderd bisshops thirtene counsayll berengarius withsayde erroure sayd decree de consecracione diui 2· ego berengarius pope deth heresy byganne ef • e sprynge hyltebrandus pope determyned yaue dome ayenst fauctours errours answerd lanfrank· pryour becceus booke called liber sintillarum specially wymund monke normandye afterward bysshop auersan apulya tho moost proufyte berengarius amended lyf atte laste soo somme men helde hym holy saynt expowned apocalyps vsed mekenes almes dede voyded syghte woman vsed symple mete cloth thappostles loore hyldebertus bysshop cenonia versus praysed hym moost maner hym wondrynge shal wondre world euermore berengarius dyed shal dye thus deth hym lyf byd euen reste noo better lot praye lot loo may see noble bisshop passyd maner praysyng rethoryke fayr speche brekyth oute oftyme manere therfore poete sayth ryche speche shedyth oute ofte wel fayr reede floures among al take heede though berengarius amended sentence yet myght amende al apeyred loore dyuers landes suche peyr men word owther euyl ensample whanne owne synne awey yet noyeth greueth mennes synnes sayth noble bisshop carnotens fulbertus spak ther latter sekenesse whanne sawe berengarius come hym among men doth hym awey sayd bisshop see fende folowe hym apeyreth eyer aboute also berengarius whan dyed twellifth daye mynde many wretch apeyred euyl loore whanne yonge man sayd daye hope cryste wol shewe day owne shewynge outher penaunce towarde blysse owther haue apeyred myn euyl loore toward peyne aboute tyme mananus scot closed abbay fuldence ten yere whan kynsius archebisshop york dede aldredus bisshop wyrcetre archebisshop hym wente • rome tostius erle northumberlond receyue palle founde blame worthy answer pryued al maner worship wente homeward robbed al hadde therfor tostius therle wente ageyn rome entreated soo pope skylles alledged pope yaue aldredus archebisshopryche tostius sayd nacions fer landes shold sette ryght lytel pope cu • whyle soo scorned theues dwellyd nygh therfore owther aldredus shold haue catayll restored owther wolde seme robbed fraude pope also kyng englond shal therof withdraw th • tribute saynt peter euyl doo sayd therle aldredus shal goo home worshiples robbed al soo aldredus hadde pall wente englond made wulstan pryour bisshop wyrcetre noo man wold gladly stygandus archebisshop caunterbury receyue yefte bisshopryche nowther wiliam conquerour whanne come wold receyue blessyng hym nycol second alysaunder pope enleuen yere chosen cardynals defended hym manly ayenste one candulus tha • ytalyens chosen pope sayd man shold chosen pope yf paradys ytaly born herald duc westsaxon commaundement kynge edward wente wale fewe horsmen crystemasse sette kyng gryffyns palays fyre ruthlan shippes also gryffyn fledde escaped aboute rogacion tyme wente aboute brystow grete naueye sayled nyghe al aboute wale broder tostius erle northumberland mette hym hooste horsmen destroyed soo countrees wale walsshmen delyuerd pledgys payed trybute wonte outlawed put oute kyng gryffyn slough hym atte last aboute fyfth day august sente heede harold therle kyng edward graunted lande wale gryffyns twey bretheren sware hym feute ¶ henricus libro septimo ¶this yere harold wente toward normandy speke broder wylynotus broders sonne hacun pledge duc wyliam· dryuen tempeste prouynce ponntyf duc land toke hym sente hym duc wiliam sayth harold er myght escape sware wold wedde duc wiliams doughter shold kepe hym englond whan kyng edward dede soo hadde neuewe hym cam englond ageyn r broder wylynotus left duc wyliams warde alwey yet regned ¶ henricus vbi supra ¶also yere kyng edwardes co •• • wyndsor tostius agreued wroth wente then herford harold arayd feste kyng tostius hakked broder seruauntes souced lymmes sente worde kyng yf wold come feste shold haue salt mete ynow northumbres herde therof putte oute duc tostius slough seruauntes also brake tresory made hym flee flaundres ¶willelmus de regibus kynge herde therof sente harold take wreche wronge broder alleyed frely born frely nourysshed myght suffre cruelnes duke also lerned soueraynes mayntene fredome owther ellys take deth also sholde lyghtly ladde esy duc thenne harold semed wysedome fauoure countre take heede syngler prouffyte broder sente hoost shold come ayene wente kyng procured malcherus sholde erle al greued tostius therfore wente flaundres wyf childer vnto kynges deth ¶ capitulum 28 kyng edward sate mete westmynster eesterday men ete besyly fyll thought lough whyle men ete axyd hym chambre mete hym ayled soo laugh seuen slepers sayd mounte selyon besydes ephesum lasse asia slept two honderd yere ryght syde tourned hem lyft syde laughyng tyme shal soo lygge lyft syde thre score yere fourtene tyme shal come amonge mankynde harde sawe cryste menaceth gospel men shal aryse ayenste men soo forth sarasyns shal aryse ayenst crysten men crysten men ayenst sarasyns also kyng tolde seuen slepers arayed soo tellyth none storye anone kynges mynystres sente nycete themperour constantinople espye soth sawe receyued goodly sente forther bisshop ephesye shold shewe araye seuen slepers messagers englonde soo founde kyng sayd sone sarasyns turkes arysen occupyed siria lasse asia ierusalem thyrdde henry themperour dyed sone henry kynge fraunce poysoned dyed seuen dayes byfore maij sterre bryght blasyng crest seen al world wyde seen seuen dayes continuelly olyuer monk malmesbury grett sterre spak therto maner thow arte comen thou art come doole sorow wel many moders long syth see see dredeful grysely thou menacest destroyenge countrey olyuer tho c • nnynge man lettrure man greete age yongthe grete hardynes foūded fl • e byrd whynges maner crafte fethred fete handes wold flee dedalus wyse soo toke fable stede sothe sawe soo stode hye toure toke wynde flough space furlonge aferd grete strengthe wynde whyrle wynde caas foly dede fyll lame thyes terme lyf also yere whanne childermas daye halowed westmynstre kyng edward began seke laste sekenesse sawe syghte told hem stode aboute hym twey men relygyon sayd kyng come knewe somtyme normā dy sayden god hem sente warne herof rather duke bisshops abbotes englond goddes seruauntes deuyls god hath taken kyngdom enemyes hande twelue monethes daye fendes shal walke hurle aboute al land prayd sought must warnyng penaunce delyuerd ensample men nynyue naye sayd nowther shal men shal doo worthy penaunce nowther god shal haue mercy hem sayde whan maye hope truste foryeuenes answerd sayde whan grene tree hewen downe partye therof kytte stok leyde thre teme length fro stok ther stode tho stygandus archebisshop sayde olde man raued doted olde men doo oute wytte spak foly vanyte afterward englonde felte soth trouthe prophecye whan subiection destroyed alyens men straunge landes kyng edwarde dyed westmestre twellyfth euen whanne hadde regned thre twenty yere seuen monethes buryed westmynstre r aluredus ryual deseryued clerely kynge edwardes lyf sente laurence abbot westmynster sente lyf soo descryued forth second henry ¶willelmus de regibus vbi supra anone harold occupyed kyngdom helde aboute nyne monethes somme entended make edgar adelyng kyng edgar adelynge sonne edward whiche edward sonne edmond irensyde childe insuffysaunt soo grete charge erle harold feller wytte rycher purs strenger knyghtes occupyed kyngdome vngracious happe r ¶but marianus sayth kynge edward ordeyned byfore deth harold shold kynge hym lordes made hym kyng anone ¶ item marianus ¶ sacred aldredus archebisshop yorke byganne destroye euyl lawes make good lawes ryghtfull defende hooly chirche worshipe good men punysshe euyll doer saue defende londe broder tostius herde therof kynge cam syxty shippes oute flaundres toke paymentis trybute yle wyght toke prayes kente see costes dradde arraye broder harold wente see lyndeseye brente townes slough men til dryuen then edwyn morkar duke mercia northumberlonde wente malcolyn kyng scotland hym al somer tyme ¶ mene tyme kyng norganes harold harfage olauus broder cam thre honderd shippes mouth ryuer tyne thenne tostius cam hym strengthe acorded byfore kyng harold warned therof ordeyned thyder grete strength er comē twey bretheren spake rather edwyn morkar stalworthly foughten ouercome atte laste ther delyuerd pl • dgys eyther syde honderd fyfty fyfth day kyng harold cam stemesford brydge stronge batayll hard fyghtyng slough kyng norganes owne broder tostius made olauus kynges broder norganes paul duc ilondes orcades swere hym toke pledgys hem lette hem goo hoome ageyne one norganes bare hym soo worthy haue name euermore stode al one vpon brydge stemesford slough moo fourty englysshmen owne axe lette passage alle englysshe hooste till none day till englissh man toke boote cam vnder brydge stykked norgan thur • h hoole spere happe harold prowde wolde part knyghtes prayes taken therfor many lordes comonte wroth greued forsoke hym whanne wente batayll hastyng ayenst wylliam ¶ willelmus de regibus libro secundo ¶ capitulum 29 whanne harold sette vp kyngdome thought couenauntes made bytwene hym wylliam helde hym self dyscharged oth wylliams doughter spoused dede within age wedlok also wylliam occupyed werres ilandes nyghe hym william warned hym couenaunt broken medled menace prayer harold sayde nyce foly couenaunt shold holden namly byhest mennes kyngdome withoute comune assente senatours lewd oth sholde broke namely syth compellyd sworen nede nedeful tyme meane tyme wylliam arayed al neded iourney gate assente lordes land purchaced fauoure alysaunder pope baner hym sente cause duc william axed chalenged englonde ayenst harald deth aluredus cosyn sone emma aluredus procured deth seconde e • ylyng robert archebisshop caunterbury· thyrdde cause kyng edward promysed duc wiliam shuld kynge hym yf dyed withoute childer harold sworn fulfyll commaundement henricus libro sexto lordes normandye counseyled among hem self best doo iourneye wylliam duke sewer sonne osbert counsayled leue forsake iourney scarcete fyghtyng men strengthe hardynesse stiernesse cruelte enemyes lordes gladde herof put answer wordes vpon wylliams mouth wold say whanne come byfore duc sayde redy iourneye lordes myght lordes withdrawe hem shame ¶ willelmus de regibus libro tercio whanne duc william men long taryed saynt waleryes hauene· wynde ayenst hem peple grutched sayd wod • ne chalenge strengthe mennes lande namely god stroof ayenst hem god must graunt hem good wynde yf shuld seyle duc william made brynge seynt waleryus hooly bodye sette hym oute haue wynde anon lykyng wynde fylled seyles duc william cam toward englond mychelmasse day landed hastynge place called peuenesey goynge oute shippe slode one foote styked sande knyght next cryed hym anone sayd nowe syr erle thou holdest englonde thou shalt ryght newely kyng charged sholde take noo prayes sayd must spare thynges shuld owne lefte soo fyften dayes harald cam werre norganes herd tydynges herof hyed wel fast fewe knight • aboute hym loste many stalworth men rather bataylle sente help though hadde men wroth ond wold haue withdrawe hem shuld haue noo prayes atte batayll norganes harold sente forth espyes awayte see nombre strengthe enemyes duc wylliam toke espyes ledde hem aboute tentes pauylons fedde hem ryally sente hem harold ageyne told harold tydynges said al duc williams hoost preestes chekes bothe lyppes shauen englysshmen vsed tyme heer ouerlyppes shedde shore nay sayd harald preestes strong knyghtes said gurth heraldes yongest brother wolt thou vnwar fight soo many orped men sware hym neuer none oth better thou art sworn hym withdrawe tyme lette v sworn fyght countray yf haue maystrye wele yf ouercome cause querele sauf yet duc william sente monke harold profered hym thre weyes owther shuld leue kingdō wther hold kingdō duc williā regne vnder owther tweyne sholde fyght eyther quarele syghte hoostes namely whyle kynge edward dede hadde graunted hym englonde yf dyed without heyr coūseylle assente stygandus tharchebisshop therles goodwyn syward token therof goodwyns sonne neuewe sente duc william harolde wolde assente monkes message sayde cause shulde dereyned dynte swerde prayde god onely shulde deme bytwene tweyne hoostes eyther syde cam place bataylle saynt calyxt pope fourtenth day october saterday place wher thabbaye bataylle buylde enformed nyghte byfore bataylle englysshemen yafe hem song drynk waked al nyght erly morow foote men ax made greete strengthe sheldes sette hem geder maystrye ne norman feyned flee kynge harold stode fete baner twey bretheren baner afterward sente pope norman nyght bataylle shrofe hem theyr synnes houseld erly mornyng fote men archer sette bataylle knyghtes wynges eyther syde duc william comforted men batayll waare haberion torned oute amended hap • e bourde sayd strength erldome shal tourne kyngdom er shiltrons come geders one norman callyd taylefer caste swerd play • byfore hoostes slough banyour englysshmen cam ayenst dyd efte another also slough thyrdd slayne hym self thenne anone shyltrons smote geders roulandes songe bygonne norman syde bataylle endured vndern daye euensong tyme neyther partye wold wythdrawe duke archer theyr forth duc made token men shold feyne flee wyle engl • sshmen begyled dysarayed hem pursue reese enemyes whanne englysshmen aray norman arayed hem efte torned ageyne vp • englysshe men aray chaced hem euery syde atte laste harold smyten arowe loste one eye hurt brayne fyll downe place one knyghtes smote thyghe whyle laye therfor wylliam put knyght oute cheualrye done vnconnyng dede day lost wylliā thre best horse stykked vnder hym bare hym soo bloode cam oute body whanne vyctorye done wylliam buryed men slayne graunted enemyes doo wold sente haraldes bodye haraldes moder withoute ony mede prayd buryed hym waltham thabbay chanons harold founded r gyraldus cambrensis boke called itinerarius wold mene harold many woundes lost lyft eye stroke arowe ouercome escaped countray chestre· lyued hoolyly troweth ankers lyf saynt iames selle faste saynt iohns chirche made gracious ende knowen laste confession commune fame acordeth cyte sawe also aluredus ryuallensys saynt edwardes lyf ca 26 ende sayth harold eyther dyed wretchedly owther escaped preserued doo worthy penaunce r thanwhan kyng haraldes deth knowen therles northumberlonde mercia edwyn marcarus withdrawen hem self harold streytnesse place owther verely wrath prayes deled atte bataylle norganes come london toke syster agytha haraldes wyf sente hyr chestre aldredus tharchebisshop york londoner promysed wold make edgar adelyng kyng fyght hym drede wylliam encreaced withdrew hem fulfylled promised al noble mē come wylliam yafe hym pledgys sware hym fewte dyd hym surete ¶ explicit liber sextus ¶incipit liber septimus ¶ capitulum primum whan william cam london crowned westmynstre aldredus archebisshop york wyded stygandus archebisshop caunterbury crowned mydwynter day fil • ere monday w de pon next lente therafter • e wente normandy lefte broder bisshop bayon kepe englond hym· gentilmen namely erles edwyn markarus edgard adelyng moost specially stygandus tharchebisshop though wythstode al myght ladde hym hym doo hym worship mening specially treson sholde done absence englond auctoryte stygandus amonge harde telle greete worship dyde stygandus wolde aryse come ayenst procession grete boost aray closed hyd doyng come afterward clere ynough whan pope legat come englond made counseyll thassēt kyng stygandus deposed set doun prayed besyly kyng grace kyng excused hym self fayre wordes couthe wel ynough sayde myght doo ayenste pope heste soo helde stygandus boondes wynchestre terme lyf alfr herafter ayenst wynter kyng will̄iam cam englond putte trybute vpon englysshe men gretter myghte bere be • eged excetre rebelle ayenst hym brake cyte ¶gytha countesse somtyme goodwyns wyf forsoke cite sailed flaūdres w li 3 syege toune wall fylle doun none enemyes come one cyteseyns stode vpon walle dyde doun breche defowled eyer fowle noyse neyther ende also yere lordes northūberlond drad cruelnes william toke theym edgar adelyng moder agath twey systres margret crystiā sayled malcolyn kyng scotlād r sommē wol mene edgar sygh thynges englysshmē distourbed euy side toke ship cast sayle moder twey systres countrey bore come grete tempest drofe hym scotland ¶ occasion therof malcolyn kyng scotland wedde edgar syster margret gate hyr sixe sonnes twey doughtes thre sonnes kynges fader edgar alysaunder dauid mold malcolyns doughter maryed fyrst henry kyng englonde hym come mold themperyce doughter mary maryed eustas erle • oloyne hyr come mold maryed kynge steuen also yere kyng william made strong castel snotyngham called notynghā another lyncoln tweyne york also yere mold quene cam oute normandy englond crowned aldredus harald canutus sone suanus kinge denmarche come lande mouth humber two honderd shippes edgar adelyng yaf hym self hem aldredus archebisshop soory comyng deyde sorowe xj day september eyght day therafter norman kepte castels dradde leste house subarbes shuld helpe dane fylle dyches therfor sette hem fyre lyght aroos hye brente cyte yorke mynster saynt peter er fyre done cam strength dane slough assente cyteseyns thre thousande norman kynge wylliam wroth destroyde soo prouynce grete honger men ete horse flessh hoūdes flessh cattes flessh mannes flesshe also lond lyeth bytwene york durham nyne yere without tylyer wonyer take saynt ioones lond beuley ther fyll wreche vpō one kynges knightes hors neck broke face torned bacword also tyme brent saynt beda abbay girmū vpō brynk ryuer wyre yere malcolyn destroyed northūberlond slew old mē feble made strong boonde reuerence soo vnneth ony hows scotlande without englysshe boonde man woman kynge william counsayll som mē made serche abbayes englond toke al money owne tresour w p li 1 sone ther vtas ester made counseyll wynchestre as • nt second pope alysander ther twey cardynals present counseyll stygandus tharchebisshop degraded thre skylles first cause holden wrōgfully bisshopriche wynchestre archebisshopriche caunterbury whyle robert archebisshoppe lyue vsed pal lefte withoute leue court rome receyued pal pope benette acursyd chirche rome though stygandus sought besyly frēdshippe kynge kyng excused hym self swetely well couthe pope commaundemente caste stygandus bondes wynchestre lyues ende yaue hym euery day lytel enchetes lyue stygandus kyndely hard wolde take ryght nought owne swore halowen hadde peny oth preued vntrewe lytel key henge aboute neck whan deede keye founde grete ryches many place vnder erthe also counseyll sette doune many bisshops abbotes namely procurynge kynge wylliam wold brynge norman theyr stede somme men trowyd dyd soo wold seker kyngdome also counseyl saynt wulstan bisshop wyrcetre axyd besyly somme possession bisshopryche holde aldredus archebisshop yorke falle kynges hondes aldredus deth chirche york dombe tyme see voide demed cause shuld stylle touched tyme herafter wyndsor whitsonday kynge william yaf tharchebisshoprich yorke vnto thomas chanon baiocens wd p li 1 herafter kyng lanfrank abbot cadomenence normandy lanfrank nacion ytaly connyng holy wryt syngler lettrure moost redy gouernyng thynges lady day assumpcion king made archebisshop caunterbury ¶r thewes noble dedes wreton innermo • e deth tyme w p li 1 ¶thomas chose archebisshop york· cam lanfrank sacred vsage wold lanfrank axyd hym othe profession wryte obedyence thomas answerd sayde wold neuer yf herd ther auctoryte wryte skylful reason byndyng· knowe shold withoute ony preiudyce chirch saide lewdnes wyt rebelnes pryde hert new man begyled flateryng wordes knewe custome vsages englond lanfrank declared preued resonably axynge resonable ryghtful yet thomas wold assente wthsayde hit wente weye vnsacred kyng herde therof wrothe trowyd lanfrank wolde haue grete thynges wrongfully trusted connynge good feyth reason answerd therto presence kyng esed kyngys hert therfor commaundemente kyng thomas compellyd come ageyne cam ageyne wrote profession obedyence rad profession byhete withoute ony condicion shulde obedyente al longeth worship god crysten feyth soo sacred wente forth weye longe therafter lanfrank axyd toke profession alle bisshops englond sacred men bifore hond ¶ capitulum secundum erles mercia northumberlonde edwyn markar wente pryuely oute courte kynge william hadde cast put hem bondes rebell somwhat tyme stode hem lytel stede edwyn wente toward kyng scotland slayne wey men markar egylwyn bisshop durham wente yle ely kyng stopped oute goyng eest syde made brydge twey myle west syde aferd closed withynne yelde hem kinge kyng sente bisshop abbay abyndon warde bisshop deyde honger wolde ete sorow willelmus de pontificibus libro tercio ¶ walkerus lotharynge bisshop hym edytha kyng edwardes wyf sawe hym brought wynchestre sacred saide haue fayr martir coniecturynge cruel men northumberlonde meoued telle shuld afterward byfall sawe hym whytely heer rody face huge body stature w de p li 4 yere deyde walter bisshop herforde hym said lou ed hugely mysshappe shipster cyte wyst therof caas thowh wyst wold haue sette lytel therby mene tyme yet bisshop thought nothyng vngracioꝰ louyng old mā withstode myght reuerence owne state tyme fraude deuyl came bisshops chambre caas shape chamberleyns lynnen clothes seruauntes knewe wyst bisshops pryu • te wente oute none ¶ atte last ethe bisshop vnsyttyng wordes wolde haue take woman strengthe ¶ woman styked bisshop bynethe pryuy membrys wyth sheres hadde honde soo bisshop dyed robert lotharyngus bisshop ther connyng al maner artes scyences specially conth skylle aba •• table make dyuerse fygures shappes • e knewe cours mone sterres planetes tyme marianus scott monk closed magounce almayne long solytarye beyng serched cronykes storyees waar fyrst alone denys exyguus dyscord ayenst sothnesse gospel acountyng cycle yeres marianus acounted al yeres begynning world put two twenty yere lakked forsayd cycle yeres made grete booke cronykes whiche booke robert defloured solempnly take oute beste soo semeth defloracion worthy grete volume longe ¶wyllelmus de pon tificibus libro primo also lanfrank archebisshop caunterbury thomas archebisshop york wente rome fere haue pal lanfrank receyued palles one worship anthoer loue lanfrank suche grace pope alexander felawes come hym rome thomas york remigyus dorchestre right fully pryued croyses rynges restored hem offyce ageyne fyrste preestes sonne whyle seconde monk ffyscam halpe duk wyllyam many thynges wendyng englonde soo duc byhete hym couenaunt bisshopryche yf hadde vyctorye preued vpon hym byfore pope therfor sette doun presence pope thomas york meoued cause chalenge prymate dorobernia caunterbury subiection shulde longe hym thre bisshopryches lyncolne wyrcetre lychefeld ¶ sayde see caunterbury yorke ferre atwene nother hym gregoryes constitucion shulde subgette one • worthy elder • tyme thenne lamfrank declared skylfully constitucion gregory maketh noo mencion caunterbury york londō pope demede cause shulde termyned fore kynge bisshops englond though lanfrank held thomas bounde professyon thomas hadde made byfore hym byforehonde yet hym leuer trauayll successours lete chalenge abyde hym stryue therfor afterwarde ¶ yere yere lord thousande thre score twelue wyndsore byfore kynge wylliam clergye cause treated beda story shewde therby shewed fyrst austyns tyme beda last tyme aboute honderd yere fourty archebisshopryche caunterbury prymacye ouer alle londe brytayne irlonde also also hadd holde coūsayls fast york cleped therto bisshops york made bisshops punysshed somme bisshops york trespaas sette downe many putte hem oute dygnyte herto rehersed pryueleges graunted vpon maner doynge ayenst al thomas aleyde pystle whiche pope gregory demed chirches york london shold euen peres neyther subget lamfrank answerd sayde bisshop london nowther question meoued chirche london thenne thomas many fauctours moche folke gadred hym answerd sayde gregory graunted austyn al one haue vnder hym bisshops englond bisshops london york shold good frendes loue wel eyther fyrst ordeyned sholde fyrste worshiped though austyn chaunged archebisshops see london kente yef gregory wolde austyns successours shuld aboue bisshops yorke wolde lyghtly haue sette epystle suche maner wordes graunte austyn thyn successours wold shold stretche austyns successours therfore made noo mencion successours ¶ lanfrank answerde herto sayde yf auctoryte graunted austyn alone successours symple yefte pope yaue austyn pryue hym namely whyle austyn ordeyned noo archebisshop york whyle lyue also bisshop york shold ordeyned austyn also pryuelege pope confermeth dygnyte austyns successours caunterbury demed skyle ryght alle chirches englonde sholde take loore lyuynge place welle place hadde leeme byleue thou sayst gregory myghte yf wolde haue confermed worde austyns successours graunted seynt austyn soth doth preiudyce see caunterbury whanne cryst sayde peter shal yeue keyes kyngdome heuene myght also haue sayd yf wold graunte power thy success • ur though sayde soo yet bynymeth peter successours nothynge reuerence nother autoryte hadde lawfully dispensacion offyce hooly chirche maketh vertu god spryngeth cryst peter successours also yf thou kanst knowe bytwene fals soth· hath strengthe al hath strengthe partye strengthe hath strengthe lasse chirche rome al alle chirches chirches partyes therof take hede one maner wyse man kynde syngulers euery syngler man kynde al mankynde soo take heede somme maner wyse chirche see rome kynde conteyneth al comparyson chirches yet euery chirche regneth ful holynesse crysten feyth chirche rome grettest al chirches hath strengthe chirche shal haue strength lasse chirches soo euery chirche power fyrste shal sprynge al successours ought namely specially oute take therfore criste sayde al bisshops rome sayde peter soo gregory sayde alle austyns successours sayde austyn herof foloweth caunterbury subget rome taketh feyth rome soo shal york subgette caunterbury sente thyder prechours preche hem feyth thou sayst gregory wold austyn shold haue see london hit maye stonde wolde trowe soo noble disciple austyn wolde wythstonde nd ayenst maystres wille soo noble maystre doo ayenste hooly decree though soo austyn thou sayst passed london bisshop london therfor yef stryf ceesed pee made tyme yef thou desyrest plede shal dome shal defende myn offyce ryght reason thomas ouercome graunted gladly yonder brynke humber shold begynnyng dyocesy also demed afterward thynges longeth worship god feyth hooly chirche archebisshop york shold subget archebisshop caunterbury soo yf tharchebisshop caunterbury wolde make counseyl ony place englond archebisshop yorke shulde bisshops prouynce shal obedyente lawful heestes ¶ yf archebisshop caunterbury deede archebisshop yorke shal come caunterbury bisshops forsayd chirche sacre primate chosen yf tharchebisshop york dede successour shal come co archebisshop caunterbury wol assygne englonde sacred hym shal make hym othe profession obedyence lanfranck hopped ioye toke al wreton newe doyng sholde slyde oute mynde successours sholde begyled knowleche therof bare hym soo loste nought nother passed spekynge hated man make hym self curious owne praysynge lanfranck sente pystle pope alysaunder conteyned al doyng profession thomas archebisshop york yere kynge wylliam wente scotland grete nauey hooste horsmen made kynge malcolyn subget kynge malcolyn bycame lyege man swore hym hommage feute sygebertus bisshop magounce wente saynt iames pylgremage comyng ageyne made monk cluny shīpmen wolde haue bought bisshopryche sawe wente ageyne bisshopriche abbot bad hym ¶ yere edgar adelynge wente kyng wylliam normandy acord hym ¶ capitulum tercium hiltebrande seuenth pope gregory somtyme pryour cluny archedeken rome made pope enleuen yere made synode forbede clerkes sacred wyues forbode sholde haue wyues nother dwelle woman suche synode nycena hooly lawes suffryth preestes dispreysed punyschyngis pope badde men sholde preestes masse helde openly comunely concubyne ayenste pope ordenaunce tyme cardynal pope messagyer fraunce made harde processe ayenste prelate made symonye one bisshop sharply defamed symonye chaunge mede wytnesse hym accused legate waare therof sayde byfore alle counseyll mannes doome awey faylyth ofte lete v brynge goddes owne dome faylyth neuer sith grace bisshopryche yeft hooly gooste byeth bisshopryche doth ayenst hooly goost thou bisshop hast doo ayenst holy goost saye openly counsaylle gloria patri et filio et spiritui sancto ioye fader sonne hooly goost byganne essayed ofte myght neuer say hooly goost sayde pleynly whan put oute bisshopryche also whyle pope songe first masse myd wynter nyght saynt marye presepe domini one crescē cius sonne prefecte cyte toke hym put hym prisonne anone romaynes brake tour delyuerd pope also counseylle thre honderd bisshops pope cursed thyrdde henry themperour assoylled al men othe owht hym hommage feute caste many thynges ayenst state holy chirche afterward though emperour stode long tyme barfote vpon snowe yse vnnethe assoylled afterwarde besyeged rome meded cyteseyns prysonned pope toke one wybertus bisshop rauen made hym pope cleped hym clemente robert duc apulea herde therof delyuerd pope roger erle herforde who counsayle kyng william hadde made serche thabbayes englond haue grete tresour erle maryed syster rauf erle eestenglond conteyneth northfolke ayenst kynges heeste made conspyracye ayenst kynge made erle walref assēt therto bygyle· wente anone lanfrank toke penaunce wente thenne normādy kyng warned hym treasonne putte hym wylfully kynges grace kynge cam ageyne englond outlawed som chaced erle rauf prysonned waltef made afterwarde smote heede wyckedly besydes wynchestre tyme cam afterward thordenaunce god body beryed afterwarde abbaye crowlond hym wytnessyth lanfrank repentaunt sinnes saide wel hym yf myght come waltefs reste ende daye ¶in lanfrancus tyme made counseyll london saynt paules chirche doyng long tyme lefte englonde fyrste ordeyned bisshops shold sytte counseyll synode seconde bisshops see shold passe oute smal townes gretter townes soo see selfey passed chychester kyrton excetre welles bathe shirburn sabesbury dorchestre lyncolne lychefeld chestre bisshop peter tyme successour robert passed chestre couentre ¶ willelmus de pontificibus libro 2 ¶this yere deyde hyrmanus fyrst bisshop salesbury whiche wreton fore hond hym kynges chaū celer osmundus bisshop four twenty yere buylded newe chirche brought thyder noble clerkes connyng clergye songe soo bisshop self shoned wryete • ymne bynde bookes also made ordynal seruyce hooly chirche cleped consuetudynarie wel nigh al englond wale yrlond vseth ordynal also endyted saynt adelins lyf ¶ yere robert courthchose kyng williams oldest sonne myht haue normandye fader assigned somtyme therfore helpe kynge fraunce toke prayes normandye dide fader moche woo soo fader woū ded vnhorsed beganne crye robert herde fadere bois alighte doune hors horsed fader ageine· willelmus de pontificibus libro tercio northumbres slewe walkerus bisshop durham william somtyme abbot cariles bisshop william brought firste monkes durham myghty worlde hadde mouth wyll grete trust therinne fauoured afterward partyes somdele ayenst kyng william rede therfore fledde oute englond cam ageyne owne bisshopryche two yere made hym ful besy haue kynges loue ageyne soo folowed kynges wyll ye nay al maner wyse specially stryfe bytwene kyng ancelm hoped therby geete kyngys grace archebisshop ancelm fayled eyther fylle stryf bytwene kynge gloucestre defende cause fyrst dyde pryour durham benefet shulde deen archedeken bisshoprych waryng erle shrowesbury made twey abbayes one subarbes shrowesbury another wenlok worship saynt mylburgh willelmus de regibus ¶ whyle myghty man sate fest myes byset hym sodenly al though brouhgt high see halp hym myes syewed hym see vppon ryndes pome garuat adreynt shipmē nothynge god hath wrought al withoute wytte nother thynge withoute remedy man brought ayene londe myes al haaled hym sayth happe byfyl prynce polonia leopard hadde bete also suche happe told prynce myght noo maner crafte kepe saue hym self fro lyese maner wyse henricus lib sexto yere cursyd stryf bytwene monkes glastenbury vnthriuyng abbot thurstā kyng wylliam brought theder oute abbay cadony made hym abbot glastenbury couth noo maner wytte redynesse among lewdnesse folye despysed gregoryes songe offyce byganne compelle monkes vse songe one william monk fyscamen willelmus de pontificibus li 1 ¶ wasted spended chirches gooddes catailsin lecheryand chalengyd cruelly ordre seruyce monkes withdrewe therwith mete drynk therof cam chiding strif wordes discorde wittes thoughtes lucanus saith fastynge folk noo drede chidynge strif toke wepne abbot men armes fille armed monkes slough tweyne atte hye auter wounded eighten shotte arowes ymages schrines chirche monkes driue nede defended hem self wel might euery side formes stole candelstikkes wounded somme knyghtes cause meoued bifore kyng abbot chaunged torned owne abbaye normandy monkes scatred aboute kynges heest dyuers byisshopryches abbayes kyng wylliās deth thurstan bought abbaye glastenbury kynge william reede fyue honderd pound soo wente somwhat yeres possession abbay deyde fer hym ¶ yere kyng wiliam hadde euery huyde lond sixe scyllynges siluer also pope hyltebrand laye dede bedde cleped hym cardynals loued moost knowleched hadde made wrathe ānd stryf bytwene emperour crysten men therfor vndede boū de peynes sette deyde ¶ capitulum quartum hyltebrand thyrd vyctor pope one yere fyue monethes ¶somtyme hyght desiderius abbot moūt cassin poysoned venym done chalys yere canutꝰ kyng dēmark help wyues fader robert flaundres arayed hym come englond greete nauey· kyng wylliam herde therof gadred grete hoost come englond oute normandy enemyes lette helde court gloucestre ther yaf bisshopryches thre preestes morice yafe bisshopryche london william bisshopryche tedford robert bisshoprych̄ chestre chaunged see couentre ¶ willelmus de pontificibus libro quarto rasede one beme chirch fyue honderd mark syluer fyll kinges honde begyle occupacion pope erle leofrycus hadde made place ryche gold syluer relykes precious stone soo robert robbed owne chirche gylty make good therfore lyf owther cataill deth yf ony man hym wolde accuse also fed monkes place symple mete drink suffryd lerne symple lettrure lest lykynge mete drynke gretter lettrure wolde make monk stoute proude ageynst bisshop netheles lychefelde byganne many greete buyldynges aboute tyme bygan thordre chartrus calabria bisshoprich grannopolytan one bruno bore coloyn nacion duche men chanon reynes champayne fraunce mayster scoles forsoke worlde founded heremytage chartrus aboute saynt ioones fest ruled syx yere atte last cam rome heeste seconde pope vrban hadde somtyme scoler halpe pope gretely dygnyte hooly chirche whanne myght suffre stryf maners court forsoke courte archebisshoprych rysens whiche chose heeste pope wente heremytage called tour calabria ended lyf manere heremytes cleped cellystes also woneth celles lyuen vnder pryour passen nombre twelue clerkes somme worthy persone take leude men anone nombre twenty euery owne celle symple dayes seruyd hym self byddeth bede slepyth etyth eche theym hath one loof brede weke ete neuer flessh ne blode neuer lynen cloth nother stamyn heer next flesshe boue kyrtell wollen pylche haue thryttene celles euery celle departed four set wythin oratory dortour fraytour werk hous doth werkes ioyne alle gyders sondayes hygh dayes come chirche comyn borde etyn fere talken fere goostly tale saye theyr seruyce saynt benet rule apostata breketh ordre take hym neuer ageyne ¶ kyng wylliam made descryue al englond wold wytte knowe moche londe eche baron hadde many knyghtes fee many teme londe many townes men many beestes lond greued many meschyefs happes fyl dede descrypcion wryten al one volume doo kynges lyberarye wynchestre also yere edgar adelyng wente apulea grete strengthe loue kyng wylliam syster crystyne wente abbay romsee vyctor seconde vrban pope thyrtene yere fyrst monk cluny archedeken rome hete odo therafter bisshop hostyence pope atte last another pope hete clemente poperyche wrong dyde vrban moche woo teene ¶ clemente somtyme bisshop rauenna yere englond greet • deth beestes dystemperyng eyer whiche many men deyd feuers honger tyme grysely fyre destroyed pryncipal cytees englond saynt paules chirche grete dele london alfr yere dane chirche slew kyng ca •• tus ¶ willelmus de regibus libro tercio kynge wylliam lay bed roen rothomage laste ende lyf kynge fraunce scorned hym maner kyng williā englond lieth wymmen chyldebed taketh hym sleuthe bourded soo kyng wylliam hadde slaked grete wombe drynke hadde dronke kyng displesyd scorne sayde shal offre hym thousand candels whanne shal goo chirche chylde longe therafter lamesse moneth whanne cornes feldes fruyt tree grape vynes sette fuyr west syde fraunce cyte medant lady chirche chirche brente womā closed trowyd sholde fle suche maner nede hete toke euyl myght heeled ellys whanne hors lepe ouer dyche brake entrayls fatte wombe lech warned hym shold dye ordeyned normandy eldest sonne robert englond wylliam reede moder possession tresour henry clerk made delyuere prisonners boundes erles marcarus rogyer wilnotus haraldes sonne brother odo bisshop bayon deyde yere kyngdome one twenty tenthe moneth yere duchery two fyfty yere lyf nyne fyfty yere lord thousand four score seuen eyght day december buryed thabbay cadony founded myghte see sorowe soo dredeful soo worshipful europa myght buryed withoute chalenge knyght forbede openly beryeng seyde grounde owne take hym strength therfor sonne henry yaf knyght honderd pound ceese ther none kyng williams sonnes eldest sonne robert warred countray william reede sayled englond wynchestre toke faders tresorye yafe moche faders mynde henricus libro quinto william conquerour wyse man gyleful ryche couetouse gloryous loued wel grete loo fayr speker goddes seruaunces sterne hym wold withstonde prouynce hampton newe forest space thyrtty myle threwe doun chirches townes dyde wyld beestes soo toke wylde beest shold lese • ne eye toke woman strengthe shold lese genetoryes· w dere li 3 kynge wylliam skylful stature grete fat bodye sterne face bar forheede grete strengthe brawne armes soo vnnethe ony man myyhte bende bowe wolde hors stretche forth senewys bende easyly ynough vpon one foete skylful strength yaue hym self moch huntyng soo threwe downe chirches town • make wodes made grete feestes reueles high fe ••• te yere helde mydwynter tyde gloucestre eester wynchestre whitsontyde westmynstre whan englond passyd ouerdyde gaderyng money people wythstonde enemyes make hym greete name ceese couetyse is· comyn tale whan william yong distourbed came malgerus archebisshop rotomage bisshopryche forgēdryd goddes seruyce yaue hym self huntyng festes verely bisshop acursid duc william mold wyf cosyn vnlaufully wedded giders trespaas duc william bylded abbaye men mold another wymē cadony r also william bylded twey abbayes englond one bermūdeseye fast london another bataylle southsex hadde foughte hen li 7 whan william kyng vnnethe lord englond englysshman englisshmen made boonde shame despyte cleped englysshman bere doune destroye englysshman god ordeyned cruel sterne suche kynde whanne haue boren downe theyr enemyes bere doune theyr self ¶ capitulum 5 wylliam reede crowned kyng day saynt cosma damian halp wulstan bisshop wyrcetre archebisshop lanfrank hadde hym norysshed made knyght william regned thyrten yere moneth lāsse robert eldest sone tyme almayne hadd gadred grete hoost ayenst fader herde herof cam ageyne normandye leyde half normandy oute take castels wedde broder henry wage hoost ayenst broder william cam last lond hampton kyng sente hym messagers sayd maner thy broder william clepeth self kynge vnderkyng regne vnder helpe art gretter better rather bore yf thy wylle bathnot mystake owne hath take time cause ofthyn absence cause nowe crowned prayeth may regne vnder pay euery yere thre thousand marc ouer leueth shal haue worship robert waggng heede assentyd anon left hoost wente ageyne normandy ryght nought fayr byhestes wel nygh al noble men englond wold haue made robert kyng take lanfrāk wulstan tyme fell cruell grysely tempest englond winter begynnyng spryngyng tyme kyng williams eame odo bisshop bayocens byfore delyuerd onte fyrst kyng williams prysonne cam englond hym yeuen erldom kente sawe yede al deuyse londe dyde somtyme fyrst kyng wylliams tyme wroth therfore forsoke kynge enfected many grutchyng namely bisshop durham erle northū berlond rogyer moūt gomeryk erle shrowesbury odo wasted destroyed kynges rente enchetes lanfrank archebisshops londes counseyll cast fyrst kyng williams boundes fyrst kyng william pleined somtyme broder wold forsake take hym quod lanfrank bynde hym greue saye bisshop erle kente tyme rogyer erle shrowesbury walsshmen destroyed endes englond anon wyrcetre prayer cur seint wulstan soo febled blente men chaced lytel nombre men castels bisshops meyne kyng wylliam sawe norman nygh conspyred ageynst hym plesyd englysshmen hestes bett lawes fre hūting owne wodes maner awelded roger erle shrowsbury anō fil hym hadd forsake occupyed odoes castels kent toke odo made hym forswere englonde besieged toke cyte rochestre ther noble men gadred also yere saint nycolas body brought cyte barrus apulea whan turkes destroyed cyte mirrea four twēty knightes barrus wente thyder brought owne cyte saynt nycolas bone swymmyng oile also yere pope vrban ancelm abbot becko made coūseil cleremoūt gallia fraunce ther ordeygned houres ladye shold saide euery day fulle seruyce saterday kyng william corrūped wardeyns money whan sōme robertes castels normandye lette kynge fraunce shold fauer broder robert normandy longe vnstidfast fauouryng one broder til robert chynon kyng williams som castel saynt nycolas moūt resed vpon either broder vpon one vpon day kyng william went oute tente war fyl many enemyes fewe men hors slayne vnder hym long draw haled fote haberione good saued hym hurt knyght throwe hym downe set hond swerde sle kyng leue foole quoth kyng william kynge englonde alle hoost drad whan herde voys brought kyng another hors axyd threwe doun quoth knyght doo dede wende throw doune kyng knyght per vultum de luca quod kyng thou shalt leuer whan hen • beseged bretherē locked water sente broder robert benigne man sayde euyl dede werne water comyn al men beestes lauful fyght strength knyghtes vyolens elemēs graūted hym water kyng william herde therof scorned dede sayde thou hast lerned robert ouercome thyn enemyes yeue hem drynke thou tellest grete pryce water quod robert tellest thou pryce water broder woldest thou suffre hym deye defaute water shal haue another broder yf leese hym answer kynge vndyde werre bretheren hym englond ¶ capitulum sextum yere dyed lanfrank archebisshop caunterbury fourth day iuyn archebisshop xviij yere see voyde four yere w de p li p lanfrank nacion lombardes noble man lettrure hadde yeue al yought free artes scyences spente elde al hooly bookes connyng therof despysed smokyng schyllyng speche mysbyleuyd men al thabbayes normandy chose becco· capped pouert relygyō place monk vnder abbot herlewing man couth grete werkes gete lyuelode therwith therfor helde open scole arte releue nedy place fredome scolers loo hys praysynge worship sprang among wykked men soo grete enuye good man preestes coūtray meoued william duc normandye comaū ded putte oute lanfrank normandy vnnesynesse w li 2 cause herof duc williams preeste holden man grete scyence byfore comyng lanfrank cam daye lanfrank scole greete bragge boost hys fyrste speche lanfrank waar man couth wel nygh • ryght nought toke hym thyng lettres spede soo ouercome wyldenes man cunnynge ytaly therfor wroth made duc willyā put lanfrank al normandy occasion haue grace duc lanfrank wente duke courte hors halted made duc laugh duc toke hede courtosye lanfrācks answer fayrenesse face made hym pryour becco abbot caen afterward archebisshop caunterbury w de pon li 1 man famous lore pope alysaunder aroos worshipfully ayenst hym whan cam rome sayde dyde archebisshop worship clergye therfore pope axyd syth hadde doo worshipful lāffrāk shold rightful shold falle doun foot saynt peter vyker whan doo soo pope cause hym restored felawes bisshops come hym theyr state croyses rynges bifore preued said bifore also lanfrāk tretid byladde kyng wylliam conquerour hooly crafte grymchydynge somtyme ernest somtyme good myrthe kyng william sterne dradde man ruled temporalyte spiritualyte wyll toke man fro pope lande come plesyd hym suffred counseyll made owne countrey without leue also wold thyng suffre ordeyned suche counseyll wold assente also lord londe shold punysshed owne heest somtyme lanfrank toke money spare trespas subget dyd lyght charge synne gete grace kyng nede doo excused somwhat kynges dede gadryng money grete money one may make pea londe wonne thith dedes armes strengthe though lytel acounted amonge men rauysshe men londe yeue enemyes yet byfore god holde ryght nought thenne kynge wylliams dedes comparyson dedes kinges nowe ben worthy preched ensample free lordely herte sayde trespaas presūpcion lanfrank suffryd ageynste wylle whanne • e sawe tyme wold speke plesauntly warned hym wythsayde hym skylful manere lanfrank hadde fylled wytte alle vertues specially almesse deedes passed menne wordes deedes vsyd ofte worde hooly wrytte yeueth almesse al thynge clene though c • uetyse speciall vyce lombardes put gleymyng fer persone soo spence pore men mete drynk cloth shamed hym gyrde self high fede serue pore men make pore stolers stryue dispute whanne hadde done eyther sholde goo gladde aweye vyctor hadde maystrye ouercome comforte solace shame aduanced namely place monkes clerkis brouht manly • en possession alyened sharpnes wytte dunstās fauour comforted ofte oft thoughtful suche doynges abode sentence saynt dunstā wold come lanfrank whan slepe warne hym al sleyghte aduersaryes teche weyes shold escape also tyme lanfrank seke hym • med dunstan warstled hym delyuerd hym sekenesse made hym al hoole take oute saynt dunstans lyf lanfrank soo mylde soo fayr speche herynge shryfte whanne shryfte doo wold kysse theyr hondes shryue hym saye haue made hooly daye also tyme monkes caunterbury wel nyghe al monkes englond vnlyk seculer men saue lefte theyr chastyte vsyd haukynge huntyng playeng dees grete drynkers also ¶soo thou woldest wene consul rather monkes soo many seruauntes grete arraye lanfrank suffryd theyr outrage space tyme fered hit awey wyth staf couenable sternesse wyse mayster soules knewe wyst wel customme seconde kynde ¶ knewe also sodayne chaungyng maner thewes greueth thoughtes wyttes ther otherwhiles emonge putte awey somwhat suche maner doyngis fayr speche softe whette ruyde soules good whestone vertues forsooke braunches shrewdnesse euyll maners lyuyng desyred kynde cours vertues thewys theyr good wylle therfore yet haue hooly man mynde greete deuocion god fayr speche ghestes charyte among self lanfrank lete neuer mā go fro • lenge sory yf saw ony man discomforted wolde besyly axe wyte cause yeue comfort medicyn wolde frely profre penyes yonge childeren ordeyned monkes theym neded euery syde soo shold lacke neded rule shold blenche tyme sprā ge enuye among bisshops wold put mōkes place bringe seculer clerkes auctor doyng walke linus bisshop winchestre good man dedes though bade brought therto coūseyl bacbitres also cōutid kyng williā entēt lāfrāk herde therof destroyed caste mighty mē destroyeth attercops nestes comen afterward shuld hardy begynne doyng ne none lyke made pope alisander forbode wrytyng restored thabbay rochestre frō nōbre four clerkes nōbre fifty mōkes ynough lyue wytte wyst translated gundulphus monk cadony bisshoprych rochestre trowe election god gundulphus lerned holy wrytte lanfrank cadony mayster toke heede thynges felawe walter thyrde helde honde booke gospel sayde essaye turnynge leues whiche v shal abbott whiche shal bisshop gundulphus fonde place true seruaunt wyse redy lord ordeyneth ouer meyne walter fonde place goddes seruaunt true entre ioye thy lorde thyrde felaw fonde hard word greued hym soore though haue herde foryete gladly gentil herte make noo game scorne mennes woo thenne made ioye happe lanfrank axyd murthe whan knewe stode told theym wythout doubte gundulphus shold bisshop walter abbot thyrdde shold torne slidyng world fylle afterward soth preued gū dulphus bisshop rochester walter abbot euesham thyrd passed veyne whan lanfrank acorded maners kyng wylliam reede lay atte last seke feuer • shryuen houseled dranke medecinale drank yelde vp goost hadde desyred knowleched prayde god myghte deye feuers flux euyls dystourbith mynde nowther letteth speche ¶capitulum 7 yere whan counseyll made cyte turon gallia fraunce pope vrban exyted nygh al west londes socour holy lande therfor thyrd henry emperour reymund erle saynt gyles beamund apulca toke crosse passed see myddel erthe place callyd saynt george arme hem two honderd thousād crystē men holy lond wonne tyme crystes spere founde reuelacion saynt andrew shewed clerke hem wente robert duc normandy therfor made acorde broder kynge william reede leyde hym normandy wedde ten thousande pounde cause therof kyng wylliā toke greuoꝰ trybute englisshmen prelate melted theyr vessel lordes spoylde subgettes malcolyn kyng scotland toke prayes northumberlond therfore kynge william broder robert wente scotlande nauey nygh al adreynt hoost marryd • old honger malcolyn cam ayenst hym adelyng made pee medyacion soo malcolyn sholde obedyente kyng william somtyme fader kyng william shold yeue hym euery yere twelue mark golde sholde yelde hym twelue cytees englond sone ther kyng fayled robert toke hym edgar went ageyne normandy ¶ yere fyfte day october grete strook lyghtnyng smote chirche toure wynchecom thyrled walle threwe crucifyxe hede doune erthe brake ryght thygh threwe downe lady ymage stode roode therafter cam stynkynge smoke fylled chirche dured till monkes hadde goo procession aboute place offyces abbay hooly water relykes hooly sayntes letanye also london whyrle wynde threwe doune six honderd house moo many chirches therto slewe two men seint marye chirche atte bowe lyfte vp sixe reftres chirche stroke theym soo deepe grounde vnnethe sixte part hem seen aboue erth ¶ also whyrlwynde threwe doune heelyng chirche salesbury fyfth day osmundus halowed chirche ¶ willelmus de pon libro quarto ¶ remigius bisshop translated see dorchestre lyncolne cast halowe chirche newely buylde thomas bisshop york wythstode hym sayde place parysshe kyng wylliam money remigius hadde yeuen pryuely commaunded nyghe alle bisshops englonde sholde come dedycacion fyftenth day may twey dayes byfore daye dedycacion remygyus dyed goddes preuy doome robert bisshop herford aloone wolde come halowyng chirche knew certayn syght steres chirche shold halowed remygius tyme remygius semed nygh wonder forbodyng bodye soo lytel ouercome kynde shewed outeward noble hert wytte soo gracious noble vertue come litel body remigius robert bloet bysshop full lecherous man fulfylled ryally halowyng chirche atlast wodestok wēte kyng deyde bowel take oute bodye beryed abbay euesham hadde founded dele buryed lyncolne well knowe wardeyns place ofte dysesed shadowes nyghte till place clensyd hooly prayer dy yere kyng william wente northumberlonde repayred cyte lugubalia called caercol made castell therynne cyte hadde ben destroyed comynge dane two honderd yere ¶and sone therafter gloucestre kynge take grete sekenesse byhete wolde amende lyf counseyll lordes ¶ henricus libro sexto ¶and yaf yere archebisshopryche ancelm myght take therof kyng wold er tribute payd kyng sette also sayde bisshopriche lyncolne longed see york till robert bloet yeue kynge fyue thousand marc ¶also yere deyde rogyer erle shrowesbury whanne lay seke made hym mōk haue somme socoure assente countesse adelysa hadde sente reynald pryour shrowesbury cluny haue saynt hughe abbot kyrtel aboute hym treuisa ¶a wyseman wold mene erle rogyer moche mede monke malkyn maydenhode noo man wolde haue adeel thenne foloweth story rogyer sonne hugh erle ¶ also yere grete reyne flodes soone therafter soo grete fro • one myghte ouer lede carte wayne ouer water ryuers whanne frost byganne thawe melte brake nygh al bridge euery syde rees kyng wale slayne fyghtynge faste brechnok soo ceesed kyngdome wale ¶ malcolin kyng scottes come gloucestre ayenst king williā saynt barnabas daye acorde departed wrath king william wolde malcolin shold demed court euer englond malcolin wolde march bothe kingdom wonte yere vppon saint bricius daye malcolin eldest sonne edward many slaine northumberlond erle robartes knightes margrete quene scottes loued worshiped god myght toke soo grete sorowe fyll seke prayd god deyde thyrde day therafter whanne dede scottes made dunwald malcolyns broder kynge duncan malcolyns sonne helpe kyng wylliam put oute dunwalde toke kyngd • scotland ¶willelmus de pontificibus tolde malc • lyn tyme one lordes londe hadde conspyred brynge deth badde hym stylle tolde hym tale helde preuy hym self tyll traytour comen atte laste traytoure cam kynge awayte tyme doo cursed dede kynge bad erly mornyng hunter shold come houndes ¶ whyle huntynge kynge wente traytoure broode pleyne bysette thykk wode al aboute garland myddel place lytell toote hylle tweyne stode alone toote loo sayd kyng thou ben alone eche wel horsed wepened· eche well arrayed noo man seeth v myght helpe lette yf thou myght yf thou darrest doo thou haddest thought see whan myghte better nother frely done yf thou hast ordeyned venym doyng wymmen knyghtes yf thou desyrest wyf soo may spouse brekers yf thou castest stele vpon 〈◊〉 theues doyng knyghtes therfor 〈◊〉 knyght shold thy tresonne withoute shame cowardyse withoute falsheede may anone fylle doune kynges foot swore tha wolde therafter trewe kyng liues ende promysed hym pledgys whiche wolde cheese soo traytour made trewe wente ageyne felawes whanne sawe tyme also yere ancelm abbot barro cam oute normandy englond atte request hugh erle chestre thre cause one bycause shulde releue abbayes hadde byfore founded englond greuous trybute abbayes payed kyng second visyte erle hugh sore seke tyme thyrdde cause sholde foūde abbaye chestre place assygned preeste rychard fyrste abbot chaunged seculer chanons monkes comyng ageyne thennes made archebisshop caunterbury ¶ capitulum 8 yere englond normandye greued greuous trybute moreyn men soo erth tylyenge ceesed therafter come grete honger walsshe men forsoke yok thraldome subiection toke prayes shyres chestre shrowesbury herford toke castel meuema tyme scottes slewe theyr kynge duncanus made dunwald efte kynge sterres seen 〈◊〉 doune skye fyghtyng geders kyng williā cam oute normandy sente hoost wale loste many horse men kynge sawe walshmen myght ouercome streytnesse dyuerse place thykke wodes therfore kynge made stronge castels place see syde hewed doune grete dele wodes therafter beete doune many walshmen wulstan bisshop wyrcetre deyde eyghtenth daye ianuary willelmus de pon li tercio wulstan hour dyyeng appered wel byloued frende robert bisshop • ford towne cryklade chargyd hym shold araye beryeng efte thyrtenth day therafter appered • ym warned shold amende hym neglygence hym • lf also sayde shold longe chayr sytte soone therafter robert deyde also wulstan wol • de suffre noo man whanne deede take hym ryng fyrst whanne sacred bisshop hadde ofte sa • de whyle lyue wolde neuer leue ryng also sayde ofte egnlysshmen goddes chastysynge ye suffre englysshmen answerd hym sayde normās wors euer englysshmen god almyghty quod vsith wel wykkednesse hem hem vnworthy takyth wreche hem haue
