trespaced gylt god good wylle fende euyll wylle tormentyth euyll men helle tormented theym also ensample may yeuen thou art wroth smytest man staf brekyng staf thou rechest lytel willelmus de pontificibus likro quarto wulstan borne warwyk shyre lerned lettrure offyce hooly chirche abbaye osburgh atte laste made preeste songe longe masse heelde hym apayed offrynge crysten men holden clene mayde dyde outrage drynke flessh ete somtyme f • rsoke etynge flessh cause happe day whanne shold goo plede hym semed sholde fyrst synge masse toke somme mete releue neede thenne goo leyd fyre smelled rosted flessh masse lette deuocion smell flessh strof long tyme myght torne awey thought wyll therfor swore hooly sacramente hond wolde neuer ete suche maner mete tyme sayde masse ete wente forthe ple must atte laste deuocion encreaced auowed chastyte forsooke worlde ensample forfaders hadd auowed chastyte deth tyme abbay wyrcetre fader serued bifore tyme made monke wente vpward al offyces hous euer besy fastyng waking bede wōt laye hede fourme chirche badde beedes slepte laye byfore aulter nyghte bede cam fende mannes lykenesse warstled hym whether wold noo cast thryes grounde therfor hadde afterward grete penaunce euyl called yleos greueth fast reynes fende cam hym seruauntes lykenesse courte ofte wulstan sawe seruaunt afterward wexyd al pale drede wolde lyght doune hors noo brekyng brydges wolde ryde surely ynough vpō hyghe brinkes bridge· though ryght strayte atte last whan forsayde aldredus translated bisshoprych york wulstan chosen bisshop wyrcetre specially procuryng aldredus hoped blynde rebberye symplenesse wulstan helpe vertue lettrure defended manly ryght chirche lewde lettrure holden couth hym neded kunne oute take fable poetes wyly slyȝ sylogismes wolde ca vouche sauf lerne wulstan wolde assente owne election thenne one wulsius hooly man hadde fourty yere closed blamed hym sharply wold assente also warned god shold assente election consecracion two legate court rome though made profession stygandus archebisshop toke consecracion sacryng aldredus archebisshop york auoyde chalenges myghte falle afterward aldredus made protestacion chalengyd ryght subiection wulstā tyme though hadde monk byfore tyme wulstan made bisshop spared mete drynke halle alle houres mete vsage englisshmen wold sytte hym frote palmes feyne drynke tyme come comforted hym wolde drynke dyd vsage countraye ony lykynge therynne lefte boost norman knyghtes aboute hym wold wēde sayde masse euery day sauter also memoryes myndes famous sayntes departed seuene seuene houres day ofte wyrcetre wolde syng hye masse sayde wolde leue offyce resygne bisshopriche wold collaciō monkes made general confession yaue beneson goo chambre whan rode hors wold say sawter beneson englissh men makyth cuppe spared atte kynges borde yf nede droof hym plede ony maner tyme wolde bydde crstes cur al euyl arbytrours moyens alle good wold bydde crystes blessynge vsed furres symple pryce rought lytel wh • maner skynnes vsid skynnes lambe beestes yf one hadde counseyled hym somtyme sholde vse skynnes cattes answerd game sayde herde synge chirche goddes lambe goddes catte therfor loue better heete lambe doo beete catte tyme monkes wente chirche hadde buylded sawe old chirche destroyed saynt oswald hadde bylded wepte ful soore teres fayr maner wythsayd dede sayd vnto hym shold rather gladde chirche hadde grete worship tyme also house moo monkes answerd sayd mene al wyse ye wreches destroye werkes hooly sayntes gete v grete name praysyng men tyme vsed buylde hostful buyldynges vsed offre self god vnder roof euer ewre drawe theyr subgettis theyr owne ensamples doo contrary gader stone hepe retche soules tyme made sermon pee peple many men tourne loue pee one ther wolde acorded noo wyse nother reasonne nother skyll nother prayeng bisshop stode byfore bisshop bisshop sayd hym wryt • n men pee ben blessyd ben men pee wr • tches deuyls child till thou amende betake hym hath owne chylde anone made enemyes manciple byganne lygge fome grysbyte grynde teth caste hys hede wulstan heeled hym ageyne wold pea fende hadde hym efte thyrd tyme till foryeuen maner trespaas ¶ tyme lanfrank putte ageynst wulstan lettrure archebisshop york aldredus chalengyd hym lawful subiection wente oute palays sayde houre none behynde cam ageyne boldely answerd mastrye ¶ one alwyn leuyd anker maluerne hylles grete wylle take weye hooly londe tolde counseyll bisshop wulstān bisshop answerd nay sayde leue alwyn thy good wylle trowe thou thow woldest haue grete wonder yf thou wyst god thynketh dyde rede wente thennes· gadred thyrtty monkes place shipman hight sewulphus shroof hym wulstā ofte synnes bisshop sayde see wel ese maketh theef therfore counseyll thou monk wold hard lyf go quoth bisshop whether thou wolt noo thou shalt monk soo happed afterward ¶in tyme wulstan groped heede one nycol owne nory byganne wexe balled ryght yongthe wulstan sayd hym trowe sonne thou shalt balled short tyme sayd fader kepyst thou make abyde sone quod bisshop trowe thou dele thy shal abyde whyle alyue happed weke bisshop deyde nycols heede fyll awey lofte heede bare skyn wulstans deth whanne al chirche fyer ther fell neyther ysel spark nother soote vpon wulstans graue soo ferde matte vnder hym whanne badde bede hym sayd kynge william conquerour wolde haue pryued vnsuffysaunt lettrure also couth frenssh cast maner brynge somme man stede thenne wulstan toke crosse pyghte harde stone saynt edward kynges feete lay graue pyght soo crosse noo man myght take oute stone er toke hym self kynges heeste pyght crosse sayde kyng william better man thou art betoke take hym ageyne take awey yf thou myght ¶ capitulum 9 yere goyng ierusalem iourney beamund robert duc normandy cause iourneye robert leyde normandy wedde broder william ten thousand pound syluer therafter twelue dayes byfore iuyl crysten men toke cyte acon moneth october stella cometa sterre bryghte blasyng creest seen fyften dayes many men sawe sygne crosse brennyng heuen tyme saynt steuens heede brought cadony normandy many grete myracles amonge hyght odo brought thyder hooly heede henricus libro septimo fyll stryf bytwene kyng william ancelm archebisshop ancelm make synodes nother correcte trespaas also kyng chalengyd inuestiture prelate pylled shaued peple trybute specially spende aboute toure london aboute grete hall westmynstre also kynges meyne greued peple ouer wente willelmus de regibus libro quarto yet herto rote norysshyng couetyse ranulph somtyme fyrste kynge williams preest chapellayne made thus procuratour euery place yf ranulph sholde gadre kynges trybute wolde take suche two reasonn wolde pylled ryche bare doune pore dysperagid herytages toke hem kynges honde therfore kynge bourded tyme sayd man alone couth soo torne wytte rought noo mannes wreche whyle myght plese • orde atte ful doyng hooly dignytees sold sone therafter bought bisshopryche durham thousande pounde tyme vsed strowtyng locke longe blasyng clothes gay sporres sharp tho men yede tryppyng shewyng side ancelm wold amende al noo help suffragan therfor wente englond heste kyng goyng hauen kēt pylled robbed faren theef male serched bouges trussyng coffer thenne ancelm wente pope vrban grete coū seyll barus apulea declared clerly ayenst thoppynyon grekes tellyn hooly gooste cometh fader sonne ¶ willelmus de pontificibus libro secundo ¶ tyme raf bisshop chichestre spared kynge nother bisshops holde ageynste ancelm spak ancelm wythsayde kyng owne face dradde ryght nought shewed forth crosse rynge cesed neuer nether slaked grete doyng wytte er ancelm goyng hadde brought cause good ende also wold assente kyng shold take tribute prestes vsyd fornycacion al dyocesy seruyce hooly chirche suspendyd chirche dores stopped thornes kyng awelded grymnesse dede soo graunted hym aloone trybute preestes also aleyde chirche destroyed brente shold pylled robbed trybutes sholde releued holpen fre yeftes kyng hadde take al chirches yaue gladly raufes chirche many grete yeftes rauf spared blame mysdoers synnes yf blamyng halp lytel wolde destroye synne wyttyly game wyth myrth· wolde go aboute dyocyse thryes yere pylled subgettis myghte maystry wold frely yeue toke good wyll herof wold speke tyme nether shold acounted myracle oure age fynde bisshop besinesse prechyng resonable receiuyng willelmus de li 4 de regibus libro quarto tyme whan kyng william went huntyng cam messager sayde cenemonia besyeged· anone kyng torned hors heede toke wey streyght see lordes counseylled hym gader hoost shal see quoth wyll folowe wente see wel nyghe alone weder derke wynde ageynst hym wold nedes sayle ouer shipmen coū seylled hym abyde wynde weder herde neu er kynge said adreynde take vp ankers aray sayle ye shal see elemētes make hem redy seruyce soo passed see besyeged cenomania herde comyng brake syege helyas mayster treson take brought byfore kyng kyng spak gamely hym sayde mayster haue yet happe quoth thou hast take wote wolde myght one escape kyng wroth sayde go thy wey flee graunte doo thou mayst yf thou ouercomest shal acorde kyng dyde suche dedes yf myght stonde feyth holy chirche ye wold wene iulius cesars soule passed comē kyng trowe somtyme euforbins soule passed pyctagoras hen li 4 yere fynchamstede barrockshyre welle see welle blode fyften dayes al nyght heuen seen brennyng fyre also yere hugh hughe erles shrowesbury chestre toke ylande mon hight anglesye also slewe walsshmen therin many cutte theyr genetoryes putte oute eyen among whiche toke preest hyght kynredus drewe hym chirche put oute one eye kytte genetoryes tonge myracle god hadde speche afterward thyrde day tyme grete kyng norganes sonne olanus toke hym harald somtyme kyng haraldes sonne toke ylandes orcades menanies thennes mon twey forsayde erles erle shrowesbury wente ageynst hym smyte arow right eye deyde eyght daye kydde wodenesse forsayd preeste beryed shrowesbury w de p li 2 aboute tyme robert losang somtyme abbot ramsey thenne bisshop tedford grete nory symony bought bisshopryche kyng afterward sory bywepte vnskylful rest yongth toke wey rome come home agayne chaūged tornyd see tedford norwiche founded solempnel abbaye owne catell catel bisshopryche tedford ordeyned monkes cluny ryche world clere relygion god ward soo herbart amended double sawe warnynge one predecessour herfast barabas owne frende wherto art thou come herde wepte sayde come euyl maner goddes grace shal goo oute good manere ofte mynde worde ierom sayde erryde yongth amende v elde henricus libro quarto ¶ kyng william cam oute normandy whanne sawe fyrst grete halle westmynstre sayde lytel halfe therfore cast ordeyne chambre ¶ capitulum 10 aboute tyme beganne thordre whyte monkes burgoyne dyocyse cabyloneus ordre cleped ordre cystersiensis latyn bygan maner w de r li 2 one steuen hardyng nacion englond monk shyrburn childholde wente scotland afterward fraū ce lerned lyberal scyences toke pryckes loue god wente rome last one scole feres noo greef myght departe tweyne noo thyng letted nold euery day say sauter sprange wytte cam forth afterward cam burgoyne molys grete newe abbaye threwe awey toke lyghtly poyntes rule seen byfore whanne sawe put forth holden kepte hadde neuer seen nother herde seynt benet rule enquyred skylle reason therof soberly monk sholde said higher worcher made al thyng reson gouneth al thyng made reason reson elementis haue theyr beyng sterres also meoueth reason kepyn theyr cours reson shold kynde stonde reson falleth reson sleuthe vnconnyng cleped ageyn law reson also saynt benet rule whiche rule somwhat conteyned whiche power conceyue reasonne yet holde resonne assente auctoryte auctorytees holy scripture ben alone though seme somtyme discorde god doth nothyng withoute reasonne shal trowe hooly fader folowyd cast ordeyned ought withoute reasonne though shold yeue feyth all̄ one auctoryte nought reson ye doo shewe sōme auctoryte reason sheweth ensample seynt benet rule yf ye mow al ydel ye make profession noble despyse folowe lore therof sentence speche passed one meoued many lest hadde ronne veyn shold renne veyn demed suꝑfluyte rule shold take awey marouh shold holde thabbot made hym besy make assente harde wreche vp thoughtes roted long tyme eyghten mōkes abbot hardyng left abbay saide clennes rule myght holden place ryches gadred ther plente mete deynk stoffed soule wyt sholde withstande wente cisterus place fore hond ful wode lādes ther famoꝰ abbay abbay hugely aduaūced help bisshop yvē aft er ward help pepe· r theraft yere lord m· c xxxv one walt espek brouȝt ordre whyte monkes englond made ryual abbay thordre cysteraus thordre whyte monkes w de regibus li quarto ben obseruauntes semyn hard ordre shal maner furres nother lynen cloth nother wollen smal softe stamyn nother breche wey one hem shal haue twey curtels coule though wynter yf wol may haue lesse somme maner tyme slepe clothed gyrde aft er mateyns go neu er bed ageyn· dispose houre tyme laudes day lyght begynneth sprynge anon aft er laudes sing prime go hādwork day make ende therof withoute candel light none hem shal houres nother frō cōplyn yf seke aft er complin ye selerer ye hosteler go stilly serue ghestes thabbot doth hym self nygh graunteth monkes oueral present flok mete cause ghestes thēne serued twey mess none hem eteth blode nother flessh yf seke frō thyrtenth day september eester tyde ete one day take sonday go neuer theyr cloystre cause hondwerk speke noo place theyr pryour abbot putte gybletes houres goddes seruice take placebo dirige deede vse ambros offyce haue charge ghestes seke men fyrst abbot molyce helde streytely ordenaunces compellyd holde hem also tyme come afterward man thought • hadde lykyngly nourysshed somme monke • knewe wel lust lykyng procoured lettres pope reuokyng whiche lettres abbot brought ageyne fyrst abbay al monkes hym oute take eyght made alberyk abbot hardyng pryour therafter steuen hardyng abbot bylded sixten abbayes byganne seuententh ordre encreced tyme monkes cysteꝰ espyed al monkes myrour hem goodly besy repreef chastyng sleuth clepyd ostrum slowe oostrū hight tanu frensshe ¶ capitulum 11 vrbā second pascalis pope eyghtene yere fyue monethes thyrtenth yere prysonned cardynals also fourth henry emperour assaylled rome pope myght delyuerd er sworn fewte henry emperour byhight hym inuestiture prelate cro ryng also sholde neuer curse themperour herof wrote pryuelege maner enbrace take al hooly wrytte olde testamente newe lawe prophetys gospel hooly pystels alle general counsayle decree bisshopes rome helde holde dampne dampne also namely pryuelege veryly pryuelege euyl lawe somtyme graunted henry dampne withoute ende w de p li 3 whan william bisshop durham dede kyng yaf bisshopryche one walter elder williams preest chapellayn kyng yaf bisshopryche thousand pound euyl doer fledde saynt cuthberts chirche drewe hem oute chirche made monkes sytte hym specially halle atte mete seruyd hem mete forbode ordeyned wymmen serue hem heere sprad byhynde semed wowyng gyglotes clothyng face sē blaunt ther vnnethe escaped ony vndertake yf turned awey eye clepyd ypocryte yf assentyng accordyng myrthe cleped nyse man foole worthy gretely preysed procuryng saynt cuthberts body take onte graue clothed newe clothynge kynge waldes • eede founden bytwene armes osmund bisshop salesbury deyed also yere see floode sprange vp temse drowned many townes deuyl seen spak many mē kyngys malyce hasty deth willelmus de regibus libro quarto kyng warned therof sette lytel therby also yere hugh abbot cluny sygh suenene kyng william brought byfore god almyghty dampned hugh abbot • lde ancelm • xyled also met lette blode bledde blode dymmed sunne therfore cryed ofte saynt mary saynt mary· awoke sleepe badde brynge lyght commaunded chamberlayus shold hym abyde thyrdde daye august yere oure lorde enl • uen honderd kyngdome thyrtene age foure fourty newe forest shotte one walter tyrel owne meyneal wolde haue shotte herte soo kynge deyd fewe men wepte sorowe walter tyrel escaped noo man hym pursued kyng layde hors bere ladde wynchestre blode dropped doune weye ladde buryed within toure bisshopryche toure fyl doune withynne yere therafter man toke vppon grete dedes caste doo wel gretter yf destyne lyf scaped make therof good ende nexte daye deth one axyd wolde holde myd wynters tyde peyters quoth erle place arayeth wende ierusalem wolde borow money laye londe wedde wold suffre counseylle bisshops shold made solde dygnytees hooly chirche dyuers maner wyse helde somme owne honde day deth helde thre bisshopryches handes caunterbury wynchester salesbury twelue abbayes also somme lete ferme also· desyred euery mannes heyre werned trybute rome stryf chirche rome bytwene pope vrban wybert antypope ¶ henricuslibro septimo though lyght dedes stable stydfaste werkes soo yf byhyght ony man good euyl myght full syker hadde hyght though moost coueytous money yet dyde one dede worthy kepte mynde tyme abbot deed englond twey monkes gadryd grete somme money wente kynge eyther supplante geete abbot offyce thyrdde wente hem entente bryng hym home mekely sholde abbot tweyne stode kynge one behyghte thyrdde stode stylle spak neuer worde ¶ kynge axyd hym wolde yeue nothynge sayd wol neyther yeue neyther promysse come nere quoth kynge thou art worthy none take soo hooly charge dedes longeth kynge williams lyf loke hem within ancelms lyf capitulo 14 ¶ capitulum 12 kyng wylliā rede vsed lēmans alwey deyde without child yonger broder henry kyng hym waschose wynchestre fyfthe daye august crowned • westmynstre morys bisshop london ancelm gete wedlok thyrdde yere faders kyngdome spente fyrst yougthe lyberal artes scyences ¶ broder wylliam hadde greued hym tyme fader conforted maner sonne wepe thou thou shalt kynge laste yere faders kyngdō xix yere age made kniȝt owne fader wente owne fader normandy faders dyeng sone therafter sayd fore bretheren goon euery syde happed hym tyme therfore faders blessyng moders herytage tresoure drad pryde br • theren lytel bowyd hym alweye brother robert fo • myldenesse hert robert groned alwey trowyd lyghtly tale tellers· also robert spente knyghtes soudyou •• thre thousand pounde byquethe henry fad ••• testamente thenne henry made kynge moost helpe henry erle warwyk byfore meyneal made hooly chirche free helde forestes owne hand helde edwardes lawe amendyng therof yaue greuous pencions put oute court men vsed wimmens maner restored ageyn court candel lyght night lefte faders tyme closed ranulph bisshop durham toure london reconcyled ancelm archebisshop caunterbury exiled chasted fals mesures marchauntes brought forth length owne arme wold fyght gladly counseyl swerd wolde ete staunche honger gloteny wolde neuer drynke thurste self meyne alweye hated outrage mete drynke grete stryf bytwene hym ancelm archebisshop resigned god saynt peter inuestiture prelate •• ne seculer honde atte last made counseyl bisshops london strompettes put awey remeoued wedded mold doughter malcolyn kynge scotland ancelm crowned quene vpon saynt martyns day willelmus de p li tercio yere deyd thomas archebisshop york gyralde archebisshop lecherous man wytche euyl doer fame tellyth vnder pyle whan deyde erber founde book curyous craftes booke hight iulius frumeus booke radde pryuely vnder tydes therfor vnnethe clerkes chirche wold suffre buryed vnder heuene without hooly chirche willelmus de li 5 mene tyme erle robert kynges broder herde deth kynge william reede cam ageyne oute hooly londe apulea thennes normandy arayed hym wende englond knowen many lordes fayned somme smale occasion withdrew hem priuely openly kyng henry clepyd hym godryche godfader sente pryuely erle robert herto rauf bisshop durham ben byfore prysonned gate roope escaped oute toure london wente normandy encouraged duc robert ayenste kyng henry de regibus libro quarto ¶this robert kyng william conquerours eldest sonne lytel man bodye fatte wombe fyrst knyghthode vsyd faders maners afterward heete yong blode coūseyll fooles prycked hym founded haue normandy fader alyue whanne fader warned hym wente awey wreche made ofte restes vpon countray fyrst fader scorned hym afterward swore resurection cryst sayde robert schort boot sonne shal noble man ellys robert shuld blamed curtoys fayre face shap speche myghty strength sad counseyl laste fader wroth hym pryued hym herytage englond lefte hym vnnethe ther • dom normandy dyde many grete dedes hooly londe wonderful euery place myght neuer vnhorsed crysten man nother paynym ¶also ierusalem ester euen stoode amonge men abode fyere wonte come heuene tende somme mannes taper taper tende doyng vertu god therfor al men chose hym kynge ierusalem· whanne herde deth broder william kyng englond refused kyngdome ierusalem cause reuerence drede trauaylle couetyse kyngdome englonde therfore hym happed neuer wel therafter batayll also comyng ageyne ierusalem wedded doughter william de auersana apulea fayre woman shap loste hyr euyl fewe yeres yet sayd begyled coū seyll mydwyf kytte brestes grete plente mylk ranne brestes whanne hadde childe hadde sone tha thight william noble mā wit robert toke grete money maryage wasted sone therafter gadryd grete hooste euery syde cam englond reue broder henry kyngdome londed portesmouth mene wysest men kyngdome pee made vppon condicion robert shold haue euery yere thre thousand marc whether hem lyued longest shold others heyr yf deyde withoute heyr male nexte yere robert cam englond atte request molde quene forya • pension thre thousande marc thenne robert wente ageyne lytel told amonge norman soo norman prayed kynge henry come ageynst robert kyng c • bynam hym al normandy lytel lytel rone cane faleys whiche cytees robert wente burethely vp doun therfor ca • e wroth prayd kyng henry come closed theyr yates ayenst robert thenne robert fledde rone one squyer alone prayd help kynge fraunce erle flaundres robert helpeles theym founded yeue broder batayll ouercome taken kepte warde seuen yere lyues ende deyd castel cardef buryed gloucestre ¶ capitulum 13 yere robert de bolysme roos ayenst kyng henry robert grettest sonnes rogyer de mount gomeryk erle shrowesbury robert strengthed castels shrowesbury brugges arundel tykenhyl encouraged many walsshmen ayenst kyng wythin fourty dayes kyng wan toke al strengthes ouercome walsshmen yeftes fayr byheestes compellyd erle robert forswere englonde sayled normandy sone therafter williā erle mortom normandy cornewayle englond sayled robert normandy kyng warned hym erldome kente tweyne fautours werryd dyde grete harme normā dy kyng henry herde therof bynam erle mortom alle englond sayled therafter normandy made subgette wythoute shedyng bloode prysoned twey forsayd erles theyr lyues ende men full gyle stryf wyles kynge henry left • grete pee normandy cam ageyne englond made sharp lawes ayenste fals men theues whiche lawes conteyned loste lesyng eyen pryny stone fustes hondes made subgette scottes walsshmen briton beyonde see lowys kyng fraunce kynge henry lay normandy pope calyxtus cam nygh normandy amōg cause haue king henry sharply answer prysonnement broder robert pylgrym ierusalem hadde semely answer ceesed cause al maner arguynge may bonde toward syde facunde pleder whiche facunde presentes specially lyghted pompe boost shold fayle kyng made yong sonnes erle mellent appose cardynals tho present embryge hym smar • e hym • tyl sophyms therfore cardynals shamed knowleche wytte cunnyng clergy west londes herde speke ¶ hugh erle chestre kyng wylliam conquerours neuewe systres syde deyde sonne rychard childe seuen yere old erle hym ancelm made coūseyll london put doune many abbotes forbade setting dygnytees ferme demed sodomytes sholde acursyd euery sondaye afte • ward vndide doynge pupplycacion vyce norysshynge hardynes wycked hert • doo suche dedes also forbede preestes wyues strif fyll bytwene kyng ancelm cause wold sacre prelate take inuestiture lewde mennes handes namely bicause pope forbode hit vppon peyne cursynge giralde archebisshop york sacred suche prelate therfore ancelm meoued went pope countray flaundris destroyed castyng vp grauel see therfore flemynges yede aboute long tyme place dwelle therfore prayd graunted kyng henry place dwelle fast twede eest syde englond enleuenth yere tourned west wale mysbyleue somme prelate seynt cuthberts body founden hoole soūde yere beri • ng cccc xiiij yere bytwene armes saynt oswaldes heede founden al hoole sounde seuenthe day iuyn seen foure whyte cercles aboute sonne yere first weke lenten fryday euen vncouthe sterre seen schyne bytwene souche west schoone euery day houre fyue twenty dayes also grete beame seen come ayenst sterre oute eest syde therafter cene thoursday somme mē clopyn chere thoursdaye seen twey ful mones lytel byfore day one eest another west yere gasely stryf bytwene fader henry emperour owne sonne henry soo sonne prysonned fader yere kyng henry cam becco ancelm acorded hym sente thennes englond ¶ capitulum 14 yere fourth henry sonne thyrdde henry beganne emperour among duche men regned nyntē yere cast owne fader boundes fader de • also toke prysonned pope paschal cardynals sayd byfore therfor men trowyd deyde withoute childrē though hadde wedded mold whan fyue yere old henryes doughter kyng englond last reputed resygned vp ryghtes hooly chirche frely pope calyx • sothe oppynyon tellyth • e exyled hym self owne fre wylle vnwyttyng wyf deyd chestre ancelm made counseylle london ordeygned assente kynge neuer tyme kynge shold nother lewd persone make inuestiture croos ryng tyme gyrald archebisshop york put hondes bytwene hondes ancelm archebisshop caunterbury dyde hym obedyence tenth day august london ancelm sacred fyue bisshops one day bisshop wynchestre salesbury excetre herford glamorgan happed plegyndus tyme yere kyng henry ordeyned theues shold hanged fals money fals seel maker shold l • se theyr eyen pryuy stone penyes half penyes shold rounde philip kyng fraunce deyed sonne lowys kyng hym girald archebisshop york deyd thomas neuewe elder thomas archebisshop hym seuen yere kynge henry made bisshops see ely ordeyned henry bisshop bangor doyng hee toke grete dele bisshopryche lyncoln gaf cambryggeshire see ely therfore yaf bisshop lyncoln owne ryal towne spaldyng yere dyed saynt hugh abbot cluny eester weke oure lady saint peter saynt hillarye apeyred hym ¶ willelmus de pontificibus libro primo yere dyed ancelm archebisshop caunterbury next day fyll cene thoursday enoynt bawme god sente downe heuene beryed see caunterbury voyde ful fyue yere mene tyme holy chirche good spente kynges vse ¶ whanne kynge meoued helpe chirche soo hedles wydowe wold putte meke answer say fader broder hadde made archebisshops best men coude fynde wold goo oute kynde wold make archebisshop best man myght fynde suche answer semed ful lawe ryght grete sōme money ar • red archebisshoprych • plesyd kyngis herte· though emerus monk caunterbury wryte descryued saynt ancelms lyf full yet help william malmesbury somwhat mot sayde soo noble man ancelm born cyte august fast hilles hight alpes lettred chaste childehode fader • wrethe myght plese hym maner wyse wherfor fledde awey fer fader cam becco normandy fauoured vnder lāfrāk priour becco made monke six twenty yere thre yere lanfrank pryour becco translated abbaye cadony ancelm made pryour vnder abbotte herlewyn thenne ancelm yaf hym penaunce fastyng techyng child namely fyften yere wold say ful oft hym leuer helle without synne heuen synne made many bokes clergy oure byleue men make hem besy wynne aucterite strengthed reason argumentes maye assoylled soo passyd werkes byfore him· also gadred werkes al one hepe also ly witte pacyence ouercome malyce enemyes fyftenthe yere priory herlewin abbot becco deide ancelm made abbot stede helde hym fyue yere oute englonde though comynge nedeful many maner cause lest shold demed conuerted archebisshopryche caunterbury wided tho lanfranks deth atte last thre maner cause compellyd come englond sayd byfore tyme • nglonde robberye vnder kyng william reed pr • scripcions exylynges takyng kynges honde esyer waill empyre one man alone vnder newe lordes comen one amonge al grete sylence amonge bisshops ryghtful dome choked within conscience hem might durst spek • drede one man prouffyt hit speke thou shalt arere wreth wynne noo proufyt thenne hope escape al meschyef yf banyonr ancelm fyrst comyn childe made archebisshop kyng william put al wel said swellyng wreth myrthe curtosye speche suffryd doo noo bede hym nother state hooly chirche sayde praye ye ye wol shal lyketh ¶at last take grete sekenesse sent ancelm assent bisshops ordeyned sholde archebisshop wythsayde alayde hym maner yf yonge shepe ancelm shal coupled yocked wylde boole william reede drawe al lyke solouh hooly chirche shal goo ryght ancelm toke inuestiture sacred recouered sekenesse wors frendes coūseylled hym good vsed answere saye per vultum de luca god shal neuer haue good harme doth also kyng rauenour gadryng grete waster spendyng fered despytously euery man proferyd hym ought yefte grete acordyng owne hert tyme seynt ancelm profered kyng fyue honderd pounde wold take ancelm deled pore men dyuers wondres seen al englond shrowesbury grete erth shakyng • notyngham erly morow tyde vnder daye ryuer trente fordryed men myght goo therouer drye foote stella cometa sterre bright bemyng creste seen thre hoole wekes moneth iuyn hard wynter strong honger deth men pestylence beestes fyghtyng foules fought geders kyng henry buylded abbay hyde withoute walles wynchestre byfore within cyte yere fourth henry emperour almayne wedded molde kyng henryes doughter magounce syxth day ianuar ¶ capitulum 15 fyftenthe day october fylle grete defaute watre englond hors men myght wade bytwene temse brydge toure london dureth day nyghte ¶ willelmus de pontificibus libro tercio ¶ yere counseyl wyndesore kyng ordeyned faricius abbotte abyndon see caunterbury charge deede come examynynge bisshops putte byfore hym raaf bisshop rochestre also yere one thurstan chose archebisshop york kyng charged hym ofte shold lawful subiection rauf archebisshop caūterbury hym leuer leue dignyte obedyente archebisshop caunterbury whaune pryued seruyce wonte agreued thought dede ful soore folowyd kyng ouer see procurynge thurstynes clerkes pope pascal sente letter kyng restore thurstan ageyn whanne efte come see york yet hadde scorn doo lawful obedyence archebisshop caunterbury old stryf renewed ageyn fyrst pope promysed kyng englond raaf archebisshop caunterbury wold nothyng ordeyne ageynst dygnyte hooly chirche caunterbury ¶ willelmus libro secundo semed graunted pryuelege maner ¶ autentyk grauntes chirche hath graunted predecessours wol nothyng wythdrawe stande kepte withoute ony wemme yf pope hath sayde chirche hath dygnytees assoylled plee stryf leueth stryf al vnassoylled soo gyleful speke romaynes torne hym self walles pleders hym lyketh wolde suspende veyn leue hit doubte spareth net cost trauayll men whyle casteth owne prouffyte auauntage therfor whan kynges messagers goo pope bowyd fauour yeftes gylefully soo grete man sholde forsoke rule olde tyme sacred thurstan yaf hym pal willelmus de pontifici • u libro tercio ¶ kyng henry grete indignacion therof forbede thurstan lond aferd pope lettres whiche conteyned kynge shold take thurstan owther acursyd suspended dygnyte offyce caunterbury· willelmus de pontificibus libro primo kyng henryes fyrst wyf dede wedded duke doughter lotharyngia day weddyng raaf archebisshop caunterbury wrethful acombred palesey sygh bisshop salesbury reuested doo solempnyte weddyng made hym leue deede ordeyned bisshop wynchestre doo offyce next day therafter sawe kyng henry crowned ageynst conscyence wente sayde thou art vnryghtfully crouned therfor thou shalt leue thy croune shal leue masse fader quoth kynge amende thou mysdoo raaf spared vnnethe prayer lordes smyten doune crowne kyngis heede stedfast man good lyuyng lettrure fayre speche withoute suspection ony trespaas knowen vsyd laughyng playeng semed state age nygh cleped iaper wynter harde many brydges englond broke thawynge yse ¶ moneth may cam many flyes flyed aboute londe ierusalem ete destroyed vynes tree corn whanne hadde doo iourney day somme flye somme yede fete herbe row euen ytaly erth shakyng dured fourty dayes many house throwen doune grete towne meoued heue fer oute one place another pope pascal deyd iohan gaytanus pope hym rather pope chaunceler cleped seconde gelasius pope yere half henry emperour herde pryuelege inuestiture prelate cleped wente rome take greuous wreche pope paschal herde pope paschalis deth ▪ putte one morys burdyn poperyche morys bisshop bache • emperour cleped moris seuenth gregory drede emperour pope gelasius lefte rome sayled geue wente then foot cluny deyd cardynals toke gy archebisshop vyen made hym pope cleped hym second kalyxte r also yere dyed florencius monk wyrcetre studye trauayll story gretely hight grete stryf bytwene kynges englond fraunce henry kyng englond ouercome kyng fraunce ryally batayll ¶ willelmus de p • libro quinto ¶ kyng henry maryed eldest sone william ful • oes doughter duke angeo pee made bytwene kynges william helde normandy kyng fraunce dyde hym homage londe graunte fader kyng henry kyng grete wold doo homage kyng fraunce normandy kyng henry made fre men englond normandy doo homage sonne william men hoped therby kyng edwardes profecye shold fulfylled william prophecye sayde whan tree kytte cometh stok ageyne spryngeth shal hope remedye blende chaungyng happe mankynde kyng dwellyd thre yere normandy william adreynt also tyme erle fulco wente ierusalem bytoke erldom angeo kyng englond kepe prouffyte sonne lawe yf come ageyne ¶ capitulum 16 second calyxt pope fyue yere fyue monethes • e gadred strengthe euery syde toke prysonned morys forsayd antipope made fyrst sette hym vpon camel turne face toward camel tayle soo rode helde tayle honde stede brydel roode pope willelmus de regibus libro quinto ¶ • aboute th • tyme beganne thordre premostracensis ordre whyte chanons bygan dyocesy laudunensy· vnder fader nothbert nacion coloyn aboute tyme deyd mold quene englond fyrst lerned lettrure nourysshed among menchons wynchestre putte vnworthy maryage fader profered ofte tyme bare veyle hooly auowe therfor kyng henry wold haue wyf doyng fylle grete desputyson ancelm wythstode maryage till preued lawful wytnesse toke veyl put wowers none cause twey child one byrthen sonne doughter cessed child beryng dwellyd westmynstre founde quene kynges wyll heer vnder ryal araye yede barfote chirche lente tyme squaymes wesshe seke mēnes fete grope soore botch hondes kysse seke men sette hem mete borde serue hem also loued moche goddes seruyse therfor spente moche clerkes couth wel singe therfor famoꝰ men scole come versus songe oute al londes ¶ also spente largely comer cam euery syde desyre praysynge kyndely pyghte mennes hertes vnnethe ony man though good conscyence holde hym apayd fruyt good werkes yet hath lykynge peple knowe good dedes cause suche dedes pyled plowe men may wyst counseylle hyr mynystres ¶ willelmus de regibus libro quinto syxthe day byfore december harfleet normandy vp goo ankers kyng sayled graciously englond sonne william wolde sayle hym adreynte many noble men fer londe ¶ kynges sonne rychard bastard among hem nota contesse percy rychard erle chestre wyf kynges neece archedeken herford nombre honderd fourty hem alle escaped none one chorle bochour swamme al nyghte vppon broken maste cam clyue morowe tyde told alle geste byfalle ¶ alle wente nyghte newe ship dronken shipmen fylle anone vppon rock fer lande ship cleef william kynges sone bote might haue saued wel ynough whan cam clyf herde syster wepe crye torned ageyn toke bote men starte boote ouerlode drowned bote al therynne oute take forsayd chorle wonder grete tresoure founden fast clyues morowe none dede bodyes founde al eten ffysshes see henr libro septimo sayde nygh al sodomytes ¶ william also william kynges eldest sonne manaced englyssh men yf euer lord ouer hem wold make hem draw ox plowe ¶ r also rychard erle chestre manaced whanne •• oute normandy wold destroye monkes chestre fader ordeyned w de li 5 ¶ herafter fulco erle angeo whoos doughter william drowned hadde wedded come oute holy land maryed doughter robert short hooses sonne yaf erldome cenomannia kynge henry withhelde dower englond herafter ¶ henry maryed doughter mold fourth henry emperour almayne ¶ yere kyng henry made greete parke wodestode whanne rychard erle chestre drowned fyrst ranulph de mescheues sone fyrst hughe erle eyght yere hym raaf archebisshop caunterbury dyed william canonicus archebisshop hym ¶ aboute tyme beganne ordre templers gadred releef hospytalers ordeygned hem place porche temple ierusalem therfor cleped knyghtes temple susteyned releefe hospytalers bothe mete armure waxe soo ryche semed doughter passed wyryed moder atte laste vyle apostasye despysyng cryst destroyed fyfth pope clements tyme· yere oure lord thousand thre honderd twelue ¶ henricus libro septimo ¶ iohan cardynal rome cam englond made greuous processe ageynst preestes concubynes said foul • synne grete aryse strompettes syde sacre crystes body day songe masse taken strompet euen thynge openly knowe myghte forsake hit moste nedes knowen yf dysplesyth ony man reede hym holde pea stylle lest wold demed folowe iohan wordes dedes kalixt second honorius pope fyue yere fourth henry emperour almayn dede som men tellyn buryed spyre forfaders wrytynge tombe lyeth sonne fader grauntsyr faders grauntsyre r semeth gyrald booke itinerario wallie hath soth vnderstandyng sayth henry emprysoned flesshely fader goostly fader pope cardynals also hym repented atte last wente awey vnwytyng wyf mold englond exyled hym self good wylle lyued chestre ten yere heremyte cause wold knowen whyle alyue cleped self godestal goddes clepyng whanne emperour soo pryuely goone mold emperyce cam ageyne fader kyng henry normandy soone maryed geffroy plantagenet erle angeo hadd hym second henry hym kyng englonde ¶ capitulum 17 whanne fourthe henry goo lotharius duke saxon made emperour london made counseylle graunted kyng henry shold doo ryght preestes fornycaryes concubynes dyde ellys toke money euery syde· yere presence kyng lordes englonde swore wold kepe kyngdom doughter molde emperyce yf lyued daye yf deyde withoute child ¶ saynt mathys apostle body founden cyte treuer whiche bodye agricius archebisshop hadde broughte thyder oute constantinople elder constantynes tyme hadde body yefte helene quene ¶ honorius seconde innocencius pope thyrtene yere seuene monethes ¶ peter leonis hight anacletus also assaylled poperyche soo fylle greete stryfe hooly chirche ¶this anacletus chosen lasse deele partye chaced innocencius oute cyte spoyled chirches rome meded romayns money chirches innocencius cardynals woned kyng fraunce made counseyll rome comyng ageyne crowned lotharius duc saxon sacred hym emperour ¶by helpe chaced rogyer duck sycilya apul • rebell innocencius pope whanne fyrste ranulph erle chestre deed sonne second ranulph gercious surname erle hym fyue twenty yere erle flaundres deyd henry kynge englond assent kynge fraunce hadde erldome hym ryght bloode kynrede mold emperyce soone forsake husbond geffroy wente fader normandy kyng sawe thre wondre syghtes fyrsts sawe sleepe many clerkes assaylle hym tole axe hym dette efte sawe route men armes wolde refe hym al maner wepen thyrde tyme sawe grete company prelate manace hym theyr croyses euery tyme kyng start vp bed caught swerde cryed help though wold slee somme men myght noo man fynde ¶ also phisician grymbald name sawe alle syghtes told hem kynge erly morow danyel somtyme chargyd nabugodonosor soo chargyd kyng shold doo almesse dedes remedye synnes thenne kyng wente englond sore trobled tempest see made auowe wold relece dane trybute seuen yere wold vysyte saynt edmund doo vse ryghtwysenesse ¶ fraunce soo grete drought ryuers welles fordryed ¶ also fyere come chynes erth myght quenched nother wete nother cold nother doyng crafte ¶ yere kerdef dyed kynges broder robert somtyme erle normandy beryed gloucetre byfore hye auter ¶ william sonne nychellus founded pryorye norton prouynce chestre ¶also thabbay cumbremer founded prouynce ¶ henry short mantel born sonne emperyce kynge henry deyd normandy hym one moeued metre maner kyng henry deyd fayrenesse somtyme deol world goddes wepyn god dede marcurius lasse speche hert strong appollo iupiter hest mar strength greueth englond childhode kyngdome ryght godde high shynyng derk falleth doune lond kyng normand duke wel awey londe nouryssheth child lesyth man henr li 8 whan kyng henry dede men demed hym spake frely wold doo men whan deede somme sayde passed men thre thynges wytte spech fortune batayl sayde ouercome thre vyces couetyse cruelnesse luste lecherye also kynges bowel drawe oute bodye brayne taken oute heede body salted moch salt auoide stenche infecte many men last closed boole skyn yet myghte noyful odour lette toke oute brayne heed deyd stenche hadde eten lamprey whyle old feble loued alwey though greued hym euermore kynges body brought englōd beryed abbaye redynge founded oute grounde henricus libro septimo kynges tyme one symon sonne robert bisshop lyncolne floures deen chirche sharpe wytte clere speche fayre face shap gracious yong age wyse redy olde man spytted vyce pryde hym pryde sprang enuye enuye wreth wreth stryf bakbytynge spake tyme hym self sayde sette among mē court salt amōg quyck elys toke heede one proprete sawe war al salt among eles greueth ful sore· soo greued men court bacbytyng euyl speche last whan salt destroyed moysture el • hate men last kynges wrethe prysonned escaped aweye gonge flemed deyde exyled whan fyrst kyng henry dede steuen erle boloyn kynge hym steuen erle blesens sonne kynge henryes neuewe susters syde regned seuentene yere noble man hardy ageynst oth made emperyce crouned london saynt steuens day william archebisshop caunterbury swore emperyce also therfor william leued ouer one yere also al grete sworen steuen made wrechyd ende also men sayde day crownement sacrament crystes body brought kyng vanysshed awey sodeynly kyng steuen crowned swore byfore lordes oxenford wold holde honde prelacyes voyded also wold foryeue dane gylt wold emplede man owne wodes also drad comyng emperyce graunted euery lord leue bylde castel strength vpon owne grounde sone therafter toke acorde dauid kyng scottes gyle taken castel caerlel castel vppon tyne yaue hym huntyng englond hommage sente emperyce kyng steuen toke excetre william archebisshop caunterbury deyd theobald abbot becco archebisshop hym lotharius emperour almayne deyd conradus emperour hym fyftene yere almayns romayns though toke beneson pope yet atte prechyng abbot bernard toke holy lande pope eugenius tyme dyde many grete dedes gir p ca 19 tyme theobald mylde erle campania floures wolde myldely vysyte poure men lepres one praysed hym metre passyngly maner felowe erle mylde man theobaldus heuen maketh ioye hym hath sorowful worlde hym leueth may calle hym man hym dar clepe god deth preueth hym man owne lyf hym preueth goode aboue man vnder god man lasse god maner thynge bytwene weyne dauid kyng scotland cam thyrdde tyme englond destroyed lond anone ryuer theyse mouth prouynce york brende slewe slytte wymmen childe thurstan archebisshop cam pryuely ageynst hym kynges knyghtes chaced hym slewe x men toke many prayes gret • kyng steuen toke castel bedford ageynste hym herafter wente scotland dyde fewe dedes owne wyll cam home ageyn comyng homeward toke alysaunder bisshop lyncolne putte hym boundes til yeue hym castel newerk ¶ also • e chaced nygellus bisshop hely roger bisshop salesbury hadde doo hym moche good toke hym put hym pryson helde hym till yeue hym two castels vyse shirburn roger greete bylder house castels bycam seke deyd sorowe lefte castels moneye fourty thousande marc spente kynges vse god seruyce moneye kyng bought sone eustace constaunce kynges syster fraunce thurstan archebisshop york grete foundour abbayes hagustald founteynes eyght toke habyte monk pountfret deyd good elde two yere bodye founden hoole sounde smellyng ful swete ¶ tyme kyng toke castels gloucestre herford webbely brystow dudely shrowesbury ¶ robert erle gloucestre kyng henryes bastard sonne herde therof sente syster molde emperyce dwellyd angeo prayd come englond byhyght helpe ageynst kyng steuen ¶ henricus libro 9 ¶ moneth iuyll robert mold cam fyrst portesmouth thennes bristow dyde men countray grete harme dommage kyng besyeged castel wallyngford herde herof lefte syege wente ageynste besyeged lyncolne soone tyme ¶ aboute candelmasse ranulph erle chestre robert erle gloucestre cam many walsshmen breke kynges syege whan vnnethe passyd reedy mareys arrayed sheltrons erle chestre spake men maner sayd thanke praye besyly cause youre perylle mot fyrst shal entre peryl ¶ erle robert answerde hym sayde· vnworthy thou axyst dygnyte fyrst stroke noblesse bloode vertu strength whiche thou passyst men kynges fals • wodenesse meoueth men warre fyght may torne ageyne wey come must haue maystry ouercome hath none socour muste nedes flee bolde dedes armes manhode strength take hede ageynst hem maner mē ye must feyght robert erle mellent stondyth ageynst crafty fraude gyle hath wyckednes herte treason gyle mouthe sleuthe dedes cometh also erle albemarl deuoute bachus knowē mar smellyth wyn vsyth noo warre ¶ treuisa po • te feyneth god wyn clepyn hym bachus another batayl clepyn hym mar forth speke good drynker deuoute bachus worth batayll vnknowen mar tellyth forth tale story maner stondeth symon hampton dedes ben wordes yefte hest whan worde sayd hath done dede whanne hath behyght hath yeuen yeftes grete heete kynge steuē herd alysaunder bisshops masse tayre kynge offred brake bisshops hande cheyne brake box fyl god body token kynges fayllyng kyng wente forth baldwyn erle wordes comfort men fyght spake men maner men must fyght must knowe thre thynges ryghtfulnes cause lest men shold falle peryll soule quantite company boren doun many enemyes effecte myght strength lest men lene vpon feble helpe falle grounde touchyng thre poyntes trowe spedde take heede ferthermore maner enemyes haue loo robert coūseyll vsyth grete menace doth lytel deede mouth lyon herte haar clere speche derke vncunnyng also stondeth therle chestre man vnresonable hardynesse redy prest conspyracy vnstydfast fulfyll dede hasty herte vnware peryls casteth ful grete dedes essayeth dedes maye awelde begynneth fresshely forsaketh • feyntly woman vnhappy vngracious euery place alwey ouercome chaced hath hym flemed men sculkers walsshe men euer ben hem wors ben fyghtynge er made ende wordes come crye enemyes noyse trompes gruntng horse sheltrons smytyn geders forth goon tharowes king take brought emperyce kepte boūdes brystow candelmasse holy rode day heruest therfor emperyce wexeth swyth proude occupyed surcetre wynchester cam ageynst procession alowyd pope legate wente wylton oxenford redyng saynt albon euery place men toke good wyll oute take kentyssh men alone theobaldus archebisshop cam specially ageynste cam london trete state lande quene englond kyng steuens wyf prayd emperyce kyng myght delyuerd oute bondes vppon condicion kyng shold yelde vp kingdom emperyce somwher become monke pylgrym lyues ende emperyce wold bone also cyteseyns london prayd hyr myght vse saynt edwardes lawes lawes hyr fader kyng henry ful harde wold assente therfor peple meoued ordeyned take ware therof lefte al store houshold fledde oxenford abode knyghtes al shed dyuyded thenne toke hir owne came dauid kyng scotland strength knyghtes went wynchestre besyeged strongly bisshops toure kynges broder last cam quene william prens emperyce aferd born gloucestre hors bere dede body broder erle robert take putte pryson mene tyme quene one syde besy kyng emperyce syde owne broder suche delyueraunce procured ordeyned kyng shold restored ageyne kyngdome erle lordship bothe shulde make pee kyngdome dystourbed erle wold assente al yere lande robbyng reuyng manslaughter sellyng ryche men aboute hooly rode day heruest kyng delyuerd besyeged emperyce cyte oxenford mychelmesse mydwynter destroyed alle without atte last fyll grete honger emperyce couerd whyte byspronge snowe escaped ouer temse froren hylled snow cam walingford therfor men syege begyled blend blasyng snowe soo cyte oxenford yolden kyng aboute tyme one mayster arnold prechyd rome ageynst ryche men ageynste superfluyte men vsen therfore many men pursued hym last taken hangyd wreth clerkes also tyme deyd iohannes de temporibus lyued thre honderd yere thre score one squyer grete charles ¶ capitulum 19 second innocencius seconde celestynꝰ pope fyue monethes hym lucius enleuen monethes thyrdde eugenius pope eyght yere fyue monethes fyrst saynt bernardes disciple afterward abbotte saynt anastasy besydes rome cam vnware saynt cesarius chirche chocen cardynals drede senatours sacred withoute cyte sygned lowys kyng fraunce cro made counseyll reme fraunce ¶ also hym saynt bernard abbot wrote bookes de considere ¶ henricus libro nono ¶ ranulph consul chestre cam walyngford many knyghtes acorded kyng soone therafter gylefully taken parlement northampton myght delyuerd er yolden vp castel lyncolne ¶ tyme walsshmen destroyed prouynce chestre wycumalbā kylde soone therafter kyng steuen crowned lyncolne soo happed noo kyng byfore also yere conradus emperour lowys kyng fraunce erle flaundres many hadde take cro hooly londe chesed lond weye water weye passed hongary bytrayd fraude emperour constā tinople many tasted mele medlyd lyme deyde many deed swerde honger robbyng reuyng lechery giraldus de p capitulo 18 ¶ loys kyng fraunce come homeward hooly londe wexed seke long continence defaute woman lech sayde lech prelate counsayled hym take wenche· cause fer quene leuer deye sayd chaste lyue spousebrekyng soo putte goddes hande hoole anone tyme clerke cam hym brought hym ā pryuelege pope sholde euery cathedral chirche reme haue fyrst benefyce voyded fruyte prouffytes mene tyme anone threwe lettres fyre sayde hym leuer brenne suche lettres haue soule tormented helle prynce fasted euery frydaye brede water men counseylled hym fede honderd poure men fryday leue fastyng wold gladly fede many poure men fastyng breke al withoute prouffyte doth soule hit profyteth moche body also euery weke soo moche many superfluytees body purgacion reste one daye helpyth moche putte superfluyte also make sharper appetyte whan lowys dede vercifyour wrote tombe short style wrytyng hight faire spech rethorik torned speche sone phelip shewed hym fader lay beryed sayde nunc super tu qui superes successorum honoris degener e si degeneris laude prioris saye thou ouerlyuest art aboue successour worship thou art vnkynde yf thou goost oute kynde praysyng thy forfader aboute tyme deyd mayster hughe de saynt vyctor monk pryour saynt vyctor besydes paris parfyght man lettrure relygyon hym sayde whanne seke deth euyl myght holde mete nother drynke axyd besyly prayed yeue god body bretheren wold ceese cryeng brought oubleye sacred knewe hit spyryte sayde god foryeue bretheren wol ye begyle lord anone brought obley sacred sawe myght hold hened vp handes sayde praye sonne goo vp fader spyrite god made hym nought yelde vp goost lordes body vanysshed oute syght r somme men wol mene hughe myght holde castyng aweye therfor bretheren wolde brynge hym veray sacrament prayd hem specially wold sette sacrament vpon syde whanne hadde soo done seke mannes syde opened sacrament went hit self made many good bookes de sacramentis de archa noe de institucione nouiciorum de arra anime de studio sapiencie dydascalycon de laude crucis made booke also fr • st yse soo stronge horse myght passe ouer temse yere mayster gracianus de tuscia monk bononia borne compyled gadred book decree sayth hugh 296 forma broder germayne mayster peres lombard bisshop parys compyled made foure bookes sentence· gloosed sauter poules pystles also ¶ capitulum 20 conradus fyrst frederyk emperour almayns romayns seuen thyrtty yere pope adryans deth hym crowned greuous enemy pope alysau ndre preiudyce hym helde four fals pope eche ¶ also cause pope fledde kyng fraunce fought ageynste kyng fraunce grete strength boemes dane put help rychard kyng englond yere lord enleuen honderd thre score tweyne cam mylan hyghest walled ony toune destroyed downe grounde last pope many greues drad rebelnesse lombardes prayd foryeuenesse pope toke crosse flessh holy land amendemente synnes drowned lytel ryuer besydes armenye beryed tyrus sonne noble yonglyng deyde siege tholomayda aron nygh al̄l noble cristen men deyde tyme eugenius anastasius pope two yere ¶ yere deyd saynt bernard abbot cleruaulx borne burgoyne castel founteyns noble knyghtes sonne fyrst fedde owne moders mylk afterward norysshed greter mete yere oure lord enleuen honderd twelue begynnynge ordre cistersiensis ordre whyte monkes fyftene owne age two twenty entred thyrtty felawes cystercy fyfte yere conuersacion ordeyned abbot clereuaus vsed wakynge passyng vsage mankynde sayde lost tyme whanne slepte lykened slepe deth vnnethe myghte suffre hym routed aferde foule slepe wente mete tormente grete abstynence vsed hadde loste taste sauour mete drynke soo wold take oyle stede wyn blode stede botter wold say hyin sauoured water hit keled mouth iowes al lerned scrypture dranke hit wodes feldes medytacions beedes knowleched none maystres hadde butokes beches clothyng pouert without ony fylth sayde clothynge iuge wytnesse herte thought negligence pryde veyne glorye prouerbe oft mouth alwey herte al men wō dryth hym doth none doth • ouyce sholde come relygyon wolde saye yf ye hye within leueth without bodyes ye broughte world spyryte shal entre flesshe doth prouffyte ofte men prayd hym bisshop sayde owne ordeyned seruyce men alwey founde byddynge redyng wrytyng medytacions prechyng techyng bretheren yere oure lord enleuen honderd thre fyfty whanne deth neyghed bytoke bretheren thre poyntes kepe sayde kepte hem wyse al lyf tyme· sayde wold noo man sklaundre yf ony sklaunder aryse ceesed myghte trowe myn owne wyt lasse mēnes dome yf greued axed wreche hym greued bernard wrote many noble bookes specially incarnacion cryst dyde many myracles buylded thre score abbayes passed oute world oure lord heuene also yere deyd second ranulph hight gercious surname fourth erle chestre conquest sonne second hughe lord hym ducherye nyne twenty dyde many grete dedes ¶ also yere deyd kyng steuen kente abbaye feuersham buylded vp grounde steuens tyme knyght hight owen wente purgatory second patryk abbot bisshop cam ageyne dwellyd nedes abbaye ludene whyte monkes irlond told ioye paynes seen sayd byfore fyrst capitulo 34 wondres irlond ¶ capitulum 21 whanne steuen dede second henry kyng henry fyrste henryes neuewe eldeste sonne doughter emperyce geffroy plantegeneti erle angeo maners dedes vertues vyces gyrald cambrensis dystinctions descryueth saith maner dredeful allegge ageynst hym may put londe descryue hym many wordes may exyle man worde gracioꝰ thyng passyng oure wytte strength telle oute soth dedes offende prynces hert noo maner poynte ¶ henry somwhat redyssh large face brest yelowe eyen dym voys flesshy body toke scarcely mete drynke alledge fatnesse trauaylled body besynesse hunting stondyng wandryng mene stature renable speche wel lettred noble orped knygthode wyse counseyll batayll drad doutful desteny manly curtoys knyght whanne dede whanne alyue shewyd sorow men whanne dede loue alyue noo man goodly meschyef whan hadde efte seurte noo man sterne cruel theym chasted somtyme mylde subgettis harde famylers free herted straungers large yeftes outward skars pryuyte whome hated loued one vnnethe wolde tourne contrary wold wylfully passe owne word slowe al maner answere loued wel pee quyete bare doune gentilmen sold taryed ryghtwysenesse vnstydfast feyth chaungeable gyleful word open spousebreker hamer holy chirche alwey vnkynde god norysshed strif amonge sonnes al besynesse hoped haue pea alone stryf child yf men axyd al grete dedes world shold rather faile shold make ende laudes may ceese bold herte vyctoryes ceesse tryumphes praysyng shal fayle mater wynnyng worship may fayle pereles passyng chyualry werre lechery pesed myghtly landes herytages wanne irlond myghtly strength toke william kyng scotland ioyned kyngdome scotland southe occean north ilandes orcades closed al londes vnder one principate spradde nobly empyre made ful wyde iulius cesar men rede noman soo happed yonde see withoute normandy gyan angeo chynon toureyne fil hym ryght fader also peytow gascoyne anone moūtes pyrene hylles spayne fyll hym maryage made subget lordship aluerne londes vsyd saye alle worlde lytel ynough man stronge myghty kynges spayne ceesse stryf put querel vppon kynges dome many dedes al ageynst pee brought ende owne wylle warnyng gracious • ur chosen worcher fortune many thynges happyd hym vngraciously owne mekenesse yf wold repentaunt ellys sholde tormented owne flessh cruell bochour fyrste toke wrongfully elyanor quene lorde lowys kynge fraunce wedded dede though myght lawe owne fader geffroy forbad sayd shold touche lay hyr self whyle kynges steward fraunce netheles henry gate hyr thre doughters syx noble sonnes fyrst doughter mold maryed duk saxon second elyanor kyng spayne thyrdde iohan william kynge scicil also twey sonnes hastely take hym worthyly distourbed greued four lyues ende regned nygh fiue thyrtty yere thyrtty yere yeue hym wordly blesse lykyng suffraunce conuersacion assay deuocion yeres ouer thyrtty yere yeuen hym greef wreche euyl man vnkynde second yere fyue yere strength vanysshed aweye ordeyned aboute sendyng sonne iohan irlond thyrde lost neuer thyng loste aluerne ageynst kyng fraunce fourth yere lost bytu rycam fyfth yere cytees cenomānea turon many castels therto self also kyng vsed haue speche tr • iys relygyous bisshops lad hem hym beyonde see dedes armes dyde counseylle hem counseyll knyghtes dyde twey skylles fyrst court sholde seme ryal noble messagers legate come therto seconde skylle alweye assayed rather pee wepen armour therfor made suche medyatours puttyng money also somtyme yeuen dygnytees hooly chirche vnworthy persones wynne fame ageyne made baldwyn whyte monke archebisshop caunterbury hugh pryour chartherous bisshop lyncolne tweyne alwey conseyl euery man redyth booke sholde haue lasse wondre vngracious yssue ende kyng sone men shal take heede kynges begynnynge wherof come fader moder syde also condicion lif whome gate sonnes geffroey plantagenet come child countesse angeo spoused fayrenesse body wold selde come chirche vnneth wold abyde secreet masse erle husbond toke heede waar doyng ordeyned four knyghtes holde chirche threwe awey mantel holden lefte hyr twey sonnes vnder ryght side mantel twey sone vnder lifte side mantel fleuh atte chirche wyndow sight men neuer seen tyme afterward richard king englond tolde ofte tale saide wonder though come suche kynde grened euery come deuel shulde goo deuyl ¶ also tyme kinge henry sente clerke sonne gaufred erle britaine reforme make full pee sonne answerd clerk manere art thou come dysheryte kynde byrthe knowest thow longed v proprely kynde pyghte v kynde fornforfaders none v shold loue trauayll thou ydel put awey kynde also kyng henryes moder wedded geffrey lyuynge hyr rather husbonde pylgrym lyued heremyte kyng henry come hem tweyne latter maryage also henry whyle childe nourysshed kynges court fraunce saynt bernard abbot prophecyed sayd presence kyng deuyl come deuyl shal moeued therby tyrauntrye fader geffrey gelded bisshop sagre owne cruelnesse slew saynt thomas caunterbury yet fader geffrey laye elyanor sonne henry wedded afterward also elyanors fader erle peytowe rauysshed owne shyrreues wyf wedded hyr lyuyng· husbond tyme hooly man blamed hym dede auailed good mā prayed neuer childe come hym shold bryng forth gracious fruyt happed tyme wynchestre kyng henryes chābre dyuersly peinted one place lefte vnpaynted kynges beeste kyng badde afterward peynte egle four byrdes thre birdes cratched torent fader billes clawes fourth byrde besyed hym strongly cratche oute faders eyen men axyd hym sholde meene four byrdes quoth kyng foure sonnes wol ceesse poursue vnto deth namely last iohan loue shal moost sharply awayte cast deth ¶ capitulum 22 anastasius fourth adryan man englysshe nacion pope foure yere comyn fame tellyth abbot bonde man saynt albon englonde prayed somtyme myght monk abbay putte forsake yaf hym clergye good thewes made bisshop alban • s tyme made legate wormacia conuerted prouynce ryght byleue ¶ atte laste was· māde pope woundynge one cardynal enterdyted al cyte rome cursed william kyng scicile compellyd hym submytte hym grace ¶this fyrst pope dwellyd cardynals old cyte ¶ kyng scotland dyed neyghe alle lordes englonde· moneth october sygne crosse seen mone ¶ saynt iames apostle hond brought abbay redyng yere kynge henry ladde fyrst hoost wale made stronge castel rutland founded abbaye basyng werk adryan thyrdde alysaunder pope two twenty yere ouercome four fals pope frederyck emperour sette vp also acorded frederyk emanuel constantinople kyng scicile socured thomas caunterbury whanne exyled ¶henry kynges eldest sonne wedded kynges doughter fraunce ¶ gloucestre iewes nayled child roode ¶ theobald archebisshop dyed thomas london kynges chaū celer sacred archebisshop second daye iuyn thyrdde yere therafter wente oute englond cam ageyne seuenth yere exꝑlyng martred foure famous men descryued lyf dedes writen lyf aboute yere abbot ioachyn floures calabria wrote exposicion vpon apocalypsis vpon bookes prophetes ¶ also warned frederyk emperour kynges wente hooly londe sholde profyte lytel tyme tyme delyueraunce yet come men seyn also ioachyn descryued prophecye maners dedes nombre al pope shold hooly chirche wrote ageynst maystre sentence opynyon repreued wryten begynnyng decretals nynth gregory twellifth day byfore october aboute prime seen thre cercles heuen twey sonnes yere aroos stryf bytwene kyng thomas tyme mayster pyers comestor floures fraunce wrote storye eyther testamente hight historia scolastica wrote allegorias vppon eyther testamente book goostly vnderstandynge ¶ also made noble boke sermon made afterward allegorias booke • cleped booke auroica ¶ raaf bisshop coloyn brought bodyes thre kynges coloyne oute melan destroyed frederyk bodyes fyrst brought perse constantinople pope sergius brought melan yere thomas caunterbury martred hym one sayth manere anno milleno centeno septuageno anglorum prima corruit ense thomas menynge yere lord enleuen honderd seuenty thomas deyde swerde prymate englysshe men ¶ another sayth maner quis moritur presul cur pro grege qualiter ense quando natali quo loco ara dei englysshe dyeth bisshop flock swerde whan mydwynter place goddes aulter ¶ another sayth maner pro crysti sponsa crysti sub tempope crysti templo crysti verus amator obijt menynge crystes spouse crystes tyme crystes temple crystes trewe louer dyeth ¶ giraldus ¶ deth kynges fortune beganne withdrawe yere kynge wente irlond myghtely wonne made counseyls many place pope wylle namely cassil primate arnach febelnesse body prymate ladde hym whyte cowe alwey aboute susteyned mylke whyte cowe reformed al yland myght specially thre poyntes rulynge thoffyce hooly chirche trewe payeng tethyng hooly chirche lawful vsage wedlok ordeyned men dyed shold make theyr testamente presence theyr neyghbours· yf man dyeth hath wyf child shold fyrst cast oweth dettys mē seruauntes theyr hyre deele meobles shold deled thre one partye sholde ordeyned child partye wyf thyrdde brynge hym erthe doo soule yf bee withoute wyf withoute child catell shold deled tweyne ¶ whanne kynge come oute irlond byganne haue reuelacions specially cause shold amende lyf fyrst castel cardef wale sonday next eester day whan kyng herd masse wente hors stonde pale man rounde tonsour lene long barfoote whyte kyrtel spak kyng duche speche maner sayde good old kynge told forth tale maner cryst greteth moder myld iohan baptist peter commandeth hyghly chepynges holden nother seruyle werkes doon sonday londes thy lordshipe oute take doynge nedith vsage dyghtynge meete yf thou dost telle alle thou begynnest thou shalt brynge gracious ende· kynge spake frensshe knyght helde brydel sayde axe chorle yf hath dremed al tellyth expowned englysshe thenne man spake forsayde tonge sayde whether haue mette tale noo take thou heede day daye yf thou doo telle amende thy lyf thou shalt suche tydynges within yere thou shalt soory therfore thy lyues ende· man vanysshed whanne sayde within thre yeres kynges sone henry gaufred rychard torned kyng fraunce ageynst theyr owne fader ¶ kynge scotlande erle chestre erle leycetre reysed ageynst kynge kynge many warnynges sette lytel therby second tyme irysshe man warned hym told hym tokenes moste pryuy thyrdde tyme knyght lyndeseye phelyp chestreby passed frensshe see come kynge normandye expowned hym seuen artycles sholde amende yf dyde shold regne worshipfully seuen yere shold wynne holy crosse enemyes ellys shold shamely dye fourth yere ¶ thre fyrste artycles hadde swore crownynge shold hold one mayntenyng hooly chirch ryghtful lawes thyrdde shold man dampne withoute dome fourthe shold restore ageyne herytages hadde byn • fyfthe sholde doo ryght withoute meede syxthe sholde paye wage seruauntes seuenth shold doo iewes oute englond leue hem som moneye wende oute lande ¶ kynge amended therfore aroos ageynste hym thre stronge men myghty owne thre sonnes kynge fraunce whanne kynge henry hadde vysyted mekely thomas martiris tombe william kyng scotlande twey erles chestre lyncoln taken alnewyk ¶ meschyef dured two yere vnnethe ceessed acounted ce • ssyng therof owne strengthe goddes mercy hadde prysonned wyf elyanor quene pryuely spouche breker lyued openly spousebrekyng ashamed mysuse wenche rosamund fayre wenche kyng made wodestoke chambre wonder crafte slyly made dedalus werke leste quene sholde fynde take rosamund wenche dyed soone beryed chapyter hows godestow besydes oxenford suche wryting vpon tombe hic iacet tumba r • samundi non rosa munda· non redolet sed olet que redele • e sole • saye lyeth tombe rose world clene rose smellyth swete stynkyth wōt smelle ful sweete wenche lytel coffre scarsely twey fote longe made wonder crafte yet seen therin semyth geauntes fyghtyn beestes startlyn foules fleyn fysshes leepe withoute ony mannes moeuynge ¶ capitulum 23 also yere yorke twellyfth daye byfore september william kyng scotland assente lordes prelate lande dyde hommage henry kyng englond also kynge william seyth lettres patente successours men scotland shold doo hommage legeance fewte kynges englonde ofte therto requyred token subgettion kynge scotlande offred hat sadel vpon saynt peter aulter chirche york yet kepte vnto day yet herto lordes scotland swore yf kynge scotlande wold withdrawe hym ony tyme feyth wolde ryse ageynste hym ageynst hym alweye till torned ageyne ¶ pope gregory dyuers wrytynges sente kynges englond scotland charged heyhely composicion sholde bee stydfastly holde declaracion subgection kynge scotland prelate come northampton kyng henryes parlement therafter cam kyng henry normandy also yere assente kyng couent caunterbury cheese rychard pryour douer archebisshop enleuenth yere bisshopryche lord appered hym sayde thou hast wasted goodes chirche shal rote oute erth thenne aferd deyd eyght day therafter charge trauayl takynge crosse henry kyn • e hadde take somtyme beyonde see swore afterward • yfore two cardynals wold poursue thre yere whanne thre yere passed sent rome haue lenger delaye ydel gyleful doynge suche feyned colour shold make thre abbayes englōd soo dyde maner seculer chanons waltham made chanons reguler dyde awey menchons ambresbury brought thyder menchons beyonde see restored symply chartrous wythā besydes salesbury also hadde taken somtyme kepynge kynges doughter fraunce shold mary hyr sonne rychard peytow deth rosamund laye mayde therfor sonne rychard refused maryage therfor kynge caste wedde wenche therfor prayd huguncio cardynal come make dyuorse bytwene hym elyanor quene hoped haue helpe fauour frensshe men dyssheryte owne sonnes afterward fyll warre bytwene hym kynge fraunce castel raph· kyng henry axyd wenche wedde hyr sonne iohan axyd erldoms peytow angeo kyng fraunce assentid axynge sente lettres rychard cause sholde hem see therfore aroos grisely wreth bytwene fader owne sonne grysly thundryng herd mydwynter nyght andeuer hamptshyre preeste smyten deth lyghtnynge myddel people none man touched swyne seen amonge hem renne vp doune tempest hayel slewe foules beestes men • deleyn nyght gir 16 tyme tyme kyng arthures body foū den acoūted fantastyk brought fer ende fable brytons feyned shold eft • come kyng glast • nbury bytwene two pylers arered stone somtyme hooly chirche hygh wonder tokenes warnynges arthures body foūde beryed marked holow oke depe erthe take vp translated worshypfully chirche l • yde honestly tombe marbelstone founden croys leede stone therupon lettres wryte within crosse tourned toward stone whiche lettres radde handled maner fourme hic iacet sepultus inclitus rex arthurus cum wennenera vxor sua secunda insula aualona lyeth beryed noble kyng arthur second wyf wennener aualon bone leyd graue soo • hat twey deles graue toward heede conteyned mannes bone thyrdde dele toward feete conteyned woman boone yelow tress woman heere founden hoole sounde fresshe colour hewe • somtyme monk touched coueytously han • e anone fyll pouder ¶ kynge hen • hadde herde somtyme bryton knewe storyes synger gestes kynge arthures bodye sholde founden 〈◊〉 holow oke aboute fyftene fote depe erthe beryed soo deepe lest lyghtly founde saxon enemyes therfore lett •• wryten grauen within toward stone iuge wytnesse sothnesse truthe also haue mynde arthures schyn bone thenne shewed l • nger thre ynches legge knee lengest man founde also space forheede bytwene twey eyeen spanne brode also heede seen wemmes ten woūdes semed come al one wemme oute ta • e wemme one wounde ¶ ierusalem take destroyed sarasyns ¶ alysaunder thyrdde lucins pope yere four monethes ¶ yere dyed hughe erle chestre l •• k sonne thyrdde ranulph erle hym fyfty yere also yere deyde henry kynges eldest sone hym one sayde maner omnis honoris honor decor et decus vrbis orbis worship worship fayrenesse worshipe cyte world wyde milicia splendor gloria lumen apex shynynge blysse lyghte heede chyualrye iulius ingenio virtutibus hector achylles viribas augustus moribus ore parys iulius wytte hector vertues •• achilles strengthe augustus thewes parys mouthe ¶ capitulum 24 yere whanne rychard archebisshop caunterbury dede baldwyn bisshop wyrcetre archebisshop assente kyng alle bisshops mō kes caunterbur • withsayde myght hym sayd ete neuer flesshe fyrste daye made • hyte monke lyues ende tyme wey old lene womman met hym axyd yf sothe ete maner flessh sothe quoth fals sayde thou hast ete flesshe vn bone one cowe sustened thy deenes haue bynome cowe answerd sayde truly grace god thou shalt haue good cowe four •• yere bisshopryche fyl stryf bytwene hym conu •• caunterbury newe house chirches buyld fast monkes walles chirche ordeyned seculer clerkes ordeyned hem prouendres monkes chirches compellyd take awey byldyng translated lambhythe fast london byfore westmynstre yere lord enleuen honderd four score eyghte thi • baudwyn offyce legacy cro wente wale songe euery cathedral chirche wale masse pontificalibus neuer seen byfore tyme lucius thyrd vrban pope two yere deyd sorowe ierusalem take sarasyns tyme cam heraclius patriarke ierusalem englond kyng henry prayd hym help ageynst saraseyns name crysten men eest londes profered keyes hooly cyte • lordes graue kynges baner lettres lucius pope coūseylyd chargyd hym shold take iourney made mynde othe made kyng put ouer answer till cam london prechyng patryark baldwyn archebisshop many toke crosse hooly lande henry answerd sayde myght forsake leue landes withoute warde kepyng nother sette hym pray robberye frensshmen wold yeue largely theym wold thyder wende kyng sayth patriark nought thou dost seke axe prynce money neygh euery londe world sendyth v moneye man sendeth v prynce axe man nedeth money money nedyth man patriarck • wente wey hope lost kyng folowid vn see wolde fayr wordes wel couthe plese patriark greued patriark spake kynge sayde hederto thou hast regned gloryously herafter wold forsake thou • ast forsake thynke haue mynde lord hath yeuen thou hast yolden hym ageyne thou fals kynge fraunce slowe saynt thomas thou forsakest defence protection crysten men kynge wroth thyse wordes patriark sawe profered hym heede nek sayde doo ryght thou dydest saynt thomas· leef slayne englond sarasyns siria thou art wors ony sarasyn though men said kyng one body spake one mouth durste speke suche wordes noo wonder sayd patriarke loue thyn peple folowyth pray man kyng sayde may wende landes myne owne sonnes wold aryse ageynst whanne absente wonder seyd patryark deuyl come deuyl shal yere kyng sente sone iohan irlonde dyde lytel prouffyt come home ageyne yere fyrste day may sarasyns toke ierusalem bare awey hooly crosse slew mayster chyualrye temple many noble men whanne wyst amonge crysten men many toke crosse hooly lande al world wyde among whiche rychard peytow kyng henryes sone toke crosse also cause baldwyn archebisshop wente wale touchid hande company girald cambrensis archedeken landaf descryued maners walsshe men booke called itinerarius descryued state maners irisshe men booke highte topographia whanne sente iohan kyng henryes sonne irlond ¶after vrban eyght gregory pope four monethes sente many lettres pystles socour hooly land hym thyrdde clemente pope thre yere ¶ yere dunstaple englonde many men sawe lord ihesu cryst eyr honge crosse also yere •• ng henry made ranulph erle chestre knight yaf hym 〈◊〉 wyf constance contesse brytayne wydowe sone gaufred al lytel brytayne erldome rychemond kynges englond fraunce rychard erle peytow many noble men nombre honderd thousand four score thousand toke crosse on· saynt gregoryes daye yere frederyk emperour wente acursed hooly land ladde hooste constantinople grete hete bathed hym ryuer armenye called gula sathane sathanas throte frederik drowned men tellyn hors stombled fel water soo drowned beryed tyrus eldest sonne dede iourneye sonne fyfthe henry emperour almayne hym regned eyght yere wanne apulea scicilia acursed pope celestinus rychard kynge englond take whanne come hooly lande holden emperours prysonne myghte delyuerd without grete somme money emperour dyed cursyng myght beryed without assente kynge rychard also yere fyll stryf bytwene twey kynges englond fraunce alle moneye wasted arered dymes iourneye goyng ierusalem atte cyte cenomanna kyng fraunce rychard erle peytow come ageynst kyng englond kyng henry made sette subarbes fuyer cautel cause enemyes sholde haue noo socour therin strengthe wynde droof layte fyer cyte brente vp cyte· compellyd kyng henry goo oute cyte kyng goyng cyte spake suche wordes sayde thou hast bynome day cyte moost loue worlde shal quyte tyme shal benyme thyng sholde moost plese myn herte atte last turon take feuer desyred haue pee kynge fraunce suche manere wold gladly put hym self kyng fraunce grace sauyng owne worship crowne royamme nought myght geete pee yf wold withoute ony condicion putte hym kynges grace well worthy graunted thomas worde sauynge worship god dygnyte ordee fredom hooly chirche kyng henry deyd castel cynon • u alle aboute hym yaue hem soo robberye brybrye kynges body lay naked long tyme til childe coueryd nether partyes body short cloke hit semed surname fulfylled hadde childhode henry short cloke hight short mātel beyonde see fyrste brought shorte clookes oute angeo englond also dede told al whyle sonne stode faders body faders nosetherles bledde dropes blode eyght dayes byfore kynges deth fysshes leepe ponde normandy fought strongly gyders soo greete noyse men contraye aboute come thyder oute euery syde see wonder founde vnnethe ony fysshe alyue ¶ capitulum 24 kynge henry dede fontreuerard sonne rychard kyng hym regned ten yere steuen caunterbury descryued clerely maners dedes cause storye shold mysse noble dedes soo grete duke haue studyed take floures steuens booke kynge ordeyned redyly thynges beyonde see cam englond crowned comynge prisones opened crowned london baldwyn archebisshop caūterbury thyrde day september whiche daye acounted euyl daye veyne byleue vsage mysbyleuyd men clepyd kalender dy egypciaca dy mala euyl daye day bodynge euyl happes iewes iewes englond euyl happe daye many iewes cam solempnyte leste welthe hadde vnder olde kynge sholde withdrawe newe kynges tyme kyng heet commaunded • wes shulde come chirche crowned nowther palays whyle mete kyng mete somme iewes pressed amōg come within palays gate one hem smyten mannes fyste rabyssh peple wende kyng soo commaunded vp staues battes stone layde iewes made flee herof sprang lykyng thynges al cyte though kynge commaund • dystroye iewes peple resxny cryeng brake vp house iewes fledde drede brente spoylled toke myght wolde leue kynges sendyng outrage of▪ soo grete wodenesse yf suffred shold passe many cruel dedes blemysshed moche kynges begynnyng grete multitude hem gylty must lete passe myght nought take ful wreche ¶ atte last iewes pee graū ted anone kyng • eueth dygnytees auoydeth withoute broder iohan hadde faders yefte irlond normandy yaf hym prouynces cornewail deuenshyre notyngham lancastre also yafe hym erles doughter gloucestre wyf cosyn thyrde degree faders lordship lordship fourth dele yeuen hym made vnkynde vntrewe desyre hoole kyngdome kyng commytted gouernaunce royame bisshop durham shold skylfully semely occupye hym self goddes seruyce kynges seruyce gospel sayth noo man may serue twey lordes ful shold though bysshop wold dele hym self plese eyther kyng heuen erthe certaynly kyng ef heuen aloweth seruice deled wolde seruid might soule yf bisshop half yeuen goddes seruyce doth office shold ordeined vnworthye recheles persones steede wold serue ho • ily palais feire courte none half man makith god atte full acountes erthely prince ¶ also king haue large spence toward ierusalem resigned castels berwick rokesburgh kinge fo scotland ten thousand pounde ¶also begiled olde man ryche bisshop durham made hym bye owne prouynce greete somme moneye therfor kynge sayde ofte game wonder crafty man haue made newe erle old bisshop suche maner wyle speche empted many mannes purse bagges solde dygnytees lordshipes longed kynge though thought neuer come ageyne tyme frendes homely hym blamed hym therfore answerd sayde wolde selle london myghte fynde chapman myght wel paye many men bought better wylle trowed kyng wold neuer come ageyne take power pope myghte byneme crosse whome wolde therby gate many thousande pounde kyng semed betoke rechelesly gouernyng kyngdom chaunceler bisshop hely sayl̄ed normandy byfore mydwynter tyde tyme dunstaple sygne crosse seen heuene soone therafter sh • p crosse seen forsake baner passe somwhat space therfrom telle wyll myght mene haue lerned telle wonder descryue hit shold mene kynges englond fraunce made suerte bytwene hem tweyne dwellyd turon fraunce abyde somer wende wey holy land hooly entente cause feyth desyre owne welthe hope grete happe fortune ryghtwysenesse god aloweth suche maner doyng semely god ordeineth outrageoꝰ pryde mysbyleuyd men shold alayd maner also withoute meschyef iewes suffryd body catel lyncolne lynne yet york long siege grete meschyef woo raby mayster iewes forkytte veynes four honderd iewes owne veynes also veynes throte also staūford iewes beten slayne pylled one iohne mooste hardy crysten men come northampton many grete prayes hostiler slowe hym pryuely nyght couetyse moneye hadde brought threw body nyght withoute cyte fled aweye theef sholde old wiues mette seen wonder fals sightes fals tokenes sely men bare honde holinesse man
