helde martir worshiped sepulcre dede man solempne watch yeftes wyse men lough hem scorne clerkes place wel apayd therwith prouffyte therby told bisshop anone forbad doyng symple men vppon payne cursyng grete boost coueytōs mē hir fals martir mene tyme whyle kyng rychard absent williā bisshop hely kynges chaūceler procuratour reme pope legate englonde made money helde lowe clergye spake kynges power bare doune comyn people shewyd auctoryte pope rome roode thousand horse greued abbayes paymentes gyftes made allyes grettest lond eyther prymates see helde lowe ynough owne wyll baldwyn tharchebisshop caunterbuy dyed troy byfore comyng kyng fro holy londe kynges broder geffrey electe york lette ten yere sacred also geffrey landed douer bynam cateyt drewe hym oute saynt martyns abbaye put hym kynges toure made counseyll westmynstre kynges procuratour pope legate fautour hughe nouaunt bisshop chestre put forth playnt monkes couentre shadde bloode right byfore hygh aulter therfore william bisshop hely demed monkes shold put awey couentre clerkes shold brought thyder lyueth prouendes occasiō hughe gyleful wytte shameles hardy euyl dedes cunnynge lettrure faire speche alweye made debate strif bitwene priour couent couentre nowe strengthe men armes putte oute monkes passing euil doer gilty hughes tr • spaas sente anone court rome men answere ful enformed lettres bisshops witnessyng monkes forsake cristes chiualrye falle wordly liking therfor prayed pope free ordenaunce abbay • pope abode six monethes sentence abide ony man wold come speke monkes defaute spences lette monkes made bisshop al wille monkes come vnnethe laste whanne longe wepte wrong violent puttinge bisshops might power hadde maistrye moneye sleight many yeres monkes disparpled ordeyned prouendes clerkes lyued porely▪ gate theyr lyflode myght therfor whanne bisshop hughe seke becco normandy good fryday myght noman fynde wolde sette hym penaunce sayde ¶ sayde deme self lye peyne purgatorye myn euyll dedes vn day dome ¶ capitulum 26▪ clement thyrdde celestinus pope syxe yer • eyght monethes seconde day consecracion crowned fyfth henry emperour frederycks sonne maner fyrst byfore grees chirche rome toke • n oth henry shold defende mayntene holy chirch ryghtes hooly chirches yf ought bynome • saynt peter londes shold restore ageyne al myg • thenne saate chayr helde emperours crowne feete emperour bowyd doune heede pope leete falle crowne vppon emperours heede smote ageyne emperours heede anone feete token pope hath power make emperour sette hym doune yf worthy cardynals stoode toke vp crowne sette vpon emperours heede ageyne whyle kyng absent forsayd wylliam de longchamp bisshop hely pryued hugh bisshop durham manere worship greuyd bisshop wynchestre wrethyd neygh alle mene tyme many arayd passe see haue axe remedye kynge helpe ageynste comyn tyraunte waare th • rof come al wyll come ageyne er men come kyng men lettres also suche wold one hem bisshop lyncolne cam ageyne pursued william bisshop hely vn lyncolne sette daye answere castel tykhylle whanne bisshop durham come william spake hym sayde take bisshop bisshop chaunceler take castellan till thou yeue pledge yelde vp kynges castels fame euyl man william fulfylled al englond soo grete grutchyd ageynst hym smale cursed wel fast kynges broder iohan wroth takyng broder geffrey erle york gadred grete strengthe owne prouynce walsshemen many bisshops chaced william wyndesore toure london thennes douer william dradd left shold freely passe see toke woman cloth aboue owne clothyng coueryd hede moost part face kercheues wymples walked clyf bare lift arme webbe lynnē cloth sellyng bare mete yerde ryght hande wold slyly escape passe crafte espyed cause couth selle vndo cloth woman shold take pryuy mē bris despytously espyed last passed see bisshop rothomage reulyng royamme cō maundemente kyng scicilia also bisshop bathe choce archebisshop sone deed yet william bisshop hely purchaced wel stronge maundement celestinus pope auctoryte power rather amendemence kyngdome englond wythstōde iohan wold byneme broder kyngdom whyle absent al begyled conspyred assentynge iohan yeftes fayr byhestes yet al nought though shewed douer grete waraūt legacye yet quene elyanor archebisshops rothomage yorke many compellyd hym sayle ageyne thenne abyde spryngynge tyme turon kynges frannce englond wente one water land come scicilia kyng fraunce lete passe trespaas men vnpunysshed cleped lambe kyng englond l • te trespaas vnpunysshed therfor cleped lyon also kynge rychard fought griffon calabria scicilia maystrye made castel tree bee ladde aboute rered castel ageynst cyte messā cleped castel mategryffons castel afterward toke cyte acre also moder brought hym fayre mayde speche shap berengaria kynges doughter nauarn kyng rychard wedded wyf kyng fraūce wēt forth siria kyng englond abode somwhat w • goon abydyng ydel· sente forth vytayls made engyns went oute scicile come cypre bythouht hym tweyne kynges shippes broke tempest see spoylled men cypre therfor kyng rychard chaced kyng londe wold doo amendes cyte cyte till kynge yelded hym kyng rychard kyng yelde hym self vpon couenaunt shold put boundes yren kynge rychard graunted hym putte hym boundes syluer dwellyd twey monethes lande wyll wente acre toke see one soudan greete shippes lade greete ryches bulgyd thyrled nether syde whanne come akres fyl stryf bytwene hym kynge fraū ce maner couenaunt made bytwene turon kynge fraunce chalengyd half wonne cypre kynge rychard ayene sayde sayde couenaūt made wynnyng hooly lond ageynst sarasyns also ther another cause stryf kyng wolde lene nothyng therle champayn ful nedy grete meschyefs wold laye champayne kyng wedde erle sayde haue doone shold herafter shal doo nedyth myn owne lorde takyth myne therfor shal goo hym redy yeue take cam kyng rychard ryche nough also kyng rychard fauoured guy kynge ierusalem ageynste conradus markys kyng tyrus kyng fraūce fauoured syde cam si • ge acre besyeged two yere al theyr trauayll lost engyns broughte ageynst cyte brent grekysshe fyer noo water myght quenche nother element ¶also crysten hoost waxed lasse lasse somdele sekenes somdele defautes meschyefs also deled partyes stryf bytwene guy markys also somme grete syde hadde receyued money mede soudan ¶ capitulum 27 yere lord enleuen honderd foure score ten enleuenth day iuyl thyrtenth day comyng kyng richard cyte thelomayda take called acre takyng duk austrych folowyd kynge rychard wold caas chalenge part prayes take telle whether hap kynges wyll duk austryche baner troden feen therfor duk wroth torned home ageyne take afterwarde gretter wreche kynge rychard al wonne departed bytwene kynges englond fraunce kyng fraunce sold prysoners kyng englond henge prysonners herfor suche deedes kyng fraunce byganne stryue grete enuye name kyng rychard sayde eyer dystempered wente home ageyne swore wold damage kyng rychard comyng oute hooly lande good wynde sayled ytaly cam pope prayed assoylled oth made ageynst wyll pope wold assēt conradus markys slayne twey theues owne cyte tyrus kyng fraunce founded put cursed dede vpon kyng rychard made counseyll paris ther sayde wold wroken vpon kyng rychard wisest men coūseyled leue purpos take none hasty wreche sayde though soth bore kyng richard hand yet men shold hastly vnskylfully worche men shold abyde cause honeste till come home ageyn knowen pylgremage crystes sake also yf wold whan come home purge hym men bare hym honde make good trespaas shal wel ynough ellys ryghtful axe wreche skylfull tyme yf counseyl plese axe coūseyl pope kyng ceessed tyme cast cruel doyng blody kyngdome englond kynge fraunce sent messagers haue wyf kynges suster denmarke vpon suche couenaunt shold haue graūted alle ryght dane somtyme englond nauey strengthe one yere helpe wynne right condicyon denyed wandales ageynst hym syde kyng wenche ten thousand marc syluer fyrste nyght weddyng kyng forsoke hyr put awey vnsemely cause breth stank fonde mayde tyme eeste landes greete defaulte spence also kyng rychard wyckedly defamed vntrewe kyng fraunce doone hym wrong also hyred theues slee conradus markys conspyred soudan bytraye hooly lond therfor kyng rychard wold go take hooly cyte therfore kynge rychard arayed hym hom ward also dele crystē host destroyed swerde sekenesse honger hard trauayll doynge take hede hygh wysedom god ret ••• th lytel semeth wordly heel sauacion seruaū te whyle maketh hem come wysely meschyefs sorow fulfyll cyte heuē tell passed ther sped graciously come home ageyn foule maner liuyng old tyme soo cryst kyng vseth wel euil dedes mankynde whyle takyth erthly ierusalem handes enemyes synne hem dwellyd th • rynne bryngyth forth wysely large wynnyng hygh ierusalem heuen defaulte shame oure tyme hooly cyte mot defouled mysbyleuyd men vn tyme god knowyth alone without ony doubte whan tyme cometh holy land shal cast oute euyll mē dwelle therin dyd somtyme caas wel lasse strength goddes owē strēgthe shold knowen man dede amōg machabeys one sayde lytel maystrye god almyghty ouercome many men myght strengthe fewe men shewed declared whanne one pursued thousand tweyne chaced ten thousand gedeon dyde aweye greete multitude hadde vyctorye greete multitude thre honderd men laped water theyr owne mouthes crysten men shal assaye god start forth rabbyschly vnwisely fewe ageynst many enemyes saith haue good lorde myghty god wo • seruauntes truste hym recheles neglygēt worche wysely ¶ capitulum 28 trewes take thre yere bytwene kyng richard soudan hubert bisshop salesbury yede sepulcre hym self kyng offred hooly oyst cam thennes sayled kynge cypre thennes kynge sente forth scicile twey quenes wyf suster neygh al̄ meyne myght wel endure softe see sayled strong wynde toward countray hystria fewe men dryuen til cam bytwene aquila venyse ther houed bleynt hider thyder hyd hym somwhat tyme men made grete purueaunce vytayls hym aspyed take duke men austryche whan knowen kyng fraūce made iohan kyng rychardes broder torne lyghtly ageynst kyng rychard ānd exyted also themperour almayn ageynst kyng rychard themperour made couenaunt duk austryche haue thyrdde part prouffyte wynnyng come kyng rychard kyng rychard owne warde yet whyle kyng rychard bare crosse sygne lord emperour putte hyin place called tryuallis arystotle seith good mā sle owne fader palmsonday themperour brought forth kyng rychard yeue answer many lordes emperours land cam forth glad chere answerd alle thynge putte ageynst hym emperour bowed mercy also doo hym grete reuerence worship cam kyng holden william bisshop hely put oute englond grete extorciōs outrage cam king espye wil kyng hym ward whanne myght begyle king gyle blynde flateryng euyl trust hym self torned ageyne fraunce hoope grace hubert bisshop salesbury come oute scicile kynge sente englond gouernyng royame also spede kynges raunsone whan comen englōd chosen archebisshop assente monkes caunterbury bisshops noo wonder toke pal stalled toke anone habyte chanon marton greuous monkes caunterbury sharpnesse baldwyn somwhat vnwysely greued theym byfore though baldwyn good man holy dedes yet founded torne ryght prerogatyf election archebisshop monkes caunterbury cause therof fast monkes chirche fauour kyng byganne bylde place grete housyng withoute shedyng bloode haue prouendes seculer chanons bisshops suffrygans sholde come thyder trete therwith clerkes election archebisshop awey monkes oth • r side monkes appellyd pope compellyd ceesse werke begonne baldwyns deth threwe downe streight grounde doyng wonder soo greete man fyrst archedeken whyte monke abbot bisshop wyrcetre archebisshop • e wolde brynge men wnparfyghte lyf seculer chanons stede men parfyht lyf somtyme holy prynces bisshops englond wold haue many suche maner clerkes yeue theym choyse whether wold leue theyr benefyce chaunge theyr lyf goo relygyon ¶ treuisa semeth baldwyn wel aduysed cryst hede hooly chirche apostle heyghe bisshops none neuer monk nother freer soo myght seme knew wel clerkes parfyht eu monke freer sayd clerk • •• choys whether wold leue theyr benefice go relygion choys myght seme grete wonder semyth therby shold leue theyr benefyce euer yf yede relygyon shold leue theyr benefyce yf yede relygyon must leue benefyce rule relygyon speke wyse relygyō al men comyn spech • wol mene semeth wonder wōder menynge men wold wonder baldwyn mōk wold flater mōkes helde clerkes holy mōkes syth knew degre eu eyther folowith story aft er wo tene kyng rychard prison almayn yere thre monethes delyuerd moneth ianuar c thousād poūd siluer lefte themperour pledge bisshop rothomage bathe somme money yet payd pay somme money al woll whyte monkes chanōs take also rynges prelate vessel croyses chalyces take gold seuentene shrynes shaue molten noo pryuelege persone nother hooly chirche nother fredom spared kyng dwellyd two monethes ful swynne fl̄aundres abyde wynde araye hym neded emperours men almost take hym eftsones emperour thought thāt hadde latte goo kyng phaaro forthought somtyme lete go child israel moneth marche kyng cam lande sandwyche dwellyd whyle london wente toke strengest castel broder iohan hadde castels nothyngham tykkehylle putte wardeyns therof prysonne counseyl̄ dome l̄ordes pryned broder iohn al maner worship helde hym vntrewe vnkynde heelde eester hampton wynchester whan meschyef takyng wyped newely crowned newe kynge fyfthe yere kyngdome solempnite crownyng kynge axyd ageyne al byfore lygh • ty yeuen greuously sol̄de acounted sorte fruyte take meane tyme spared couenaunt nother charter nother dede nother instrumente soo dwellyd whyle sayled fraunce werre ageynst king fraunce kynges fought eyther sped dyuersly trewes graunted one yere prouffytable kynge rychard gader ryches strengthe though hit wolde stonde reason honeste iohan kynge rychardes broder torned kyng fraunce ageynst owne broder hadde ryght nought myght ryght nought therfor forsake kynge fraunce helpe moder elyanor cam mekely ageyn kyng richarde aft er ward trew knyght vse ong knyghtes make hym al fyghte batayl tyme tornementes lefte longe tyme made vsed ageyne withstondyng pope forbedyng ¶ capitulum 29 aboute tyme one steuen procurator angeo wysely bore hym seconde kyng henryes tyme kyng richardes tyme also supposed thāt kyng tendre body shold ou er come long wey perylle shold neuer come ageyne yf come ageyne shold vnnethe therfore bygan rabbysshly passe warraunt absence kynge one homely hym conseylled hym axe nygromancer whether kynge rychard shold come ageyne nygromancer ladde steuen priuy place shewed hym brasen heede whiche spyrite closed axe thou wolt quoth nygromancer fewe shortly answerd grete ianglyng shal euer see kynge rycharde quoth steuen naye quoth spyryte longe shal myn offyce dure quoth steuen thy lyues ende quoth spyryte wher shal dye quoth steuen pluma quoth spyryte myght axe wente prophete forbad men badde theym sholde brynge noo fetheres nyghe hym noo maner wyse cause fether pluma latyn ¶ therafter byganne worche boldly greued subgettis full soore namely noble man fledde somtyme owne castel cause steuen pursued hym ¶ man aspyed whanne steuen recheles syege toke hym al hakked hym ¶ castel called pluma cautel gyleful spyryt knowen felle gerebertus fals pope sayd byfore ranulphus bef • one alberycus erle north thumberlond myghty man heelde hyin apayd owne state counseyled fende told hym shold haue grecia grece therfore wente eftward cam grece whan grekes herde telle shold regne ouer toke hem al bad put hym oute theyr londe afterwarde somwhat yeres wery trauaylle woo cam kyng henry normandy hym noble wydowe wyf whanne preeste shold wedde theym axyd woman sayde dame grecia hast thou wyll man· thenne albericus knewe gyle fraude fals spyryt arered owne coueytous herte veyne hope whan kyng rychard made redy pay duc austryche twenty thousand ponde behynde raunson pledge kynge rychard left hym come sodenly tolde tyraunt ouertorned wreche goddes dome lande byfore deth greued many grete meschyefs cytees sodenly brente ryuer dannbyus passed brynkes dyde grete harme fer aboute sedes sowē fordryed erthe also duke acursyd pope takyng kyng rychard scorned cursyng also saynt steuens day roode feeldes hurte foote moost kytte withoute hope lyf sawe muste dye presence lordes lond prayd assoylled sentence bounden clergy answerd sayd myght wold swere stonde holy chirches ordenaunce touchyng wrong done kyng richard duc swore delyuerd kyng rychardes pledge anone othe kyng amended lyf also another warnyng amende lyf man cenomania wente saynt iames grete deuocion cam home ageyne sauf sound therafter greete deuocion wende wente hooly land see oure lordes graue wente wey vpon caas aloone sawe one dredeful face aferd ful soore blessyd hym self welfast sygne crosse euery side despysyng signe crosse seid thou miȝt defende maner thou shalt myne yf thou wolt falle doun grounde worshipe shall make ryche quoth man semeth thou art cō trarye syde take thou thyn owne crystes owne yefte ynough worship hym aloone wolt thou nylt quoth thou moost haue somwhat myne threwe anon vpon mannes heede thynne mantel brente heede made skyn hede al black man soore aferd cryed saynt iames saynt iame came anone arouted fende axed wherof serued fende quoth greue mankynde letted crysten kynges iourneye eest landes toke kyng rychard prysoner seruaunt duc austrich aft er king richard deliud beset al namely chambre tresour gadred besyly whanne wordes sayde fende vanisshed awey man comforted lefte weye mente torned home ageyne cenomannea told kyng rychard seen herde shewed hym heede swelled scalded kyng amended owne lyf maners aboute tyme hubert archebisshop caunterbury lieutenant • pope kyng englonde archebisshop yorke deede hubert made greete counseyll york ¶ capitulum 30 aboute tyme tweyn foūded kynges prouffyte al one entente dyners cause doyng abbot cadonencis warned kynge fraude offycers therfore wolde theyr outrage shold chasted men contrayes myght lyue pee william long berd warned kyng outrage ryche men spared theyr owne rychesse pylled pore men thenne abbot warraūt cam london moneth februar made somme come byfore hym offycers countrayes prouynces yelde ful ac • untes deth hym lette soo sawe eesterdaye ¶men sayn william borne london 〈…〉 longe berde vsed cleped william long berde vsed longe berde bycause wolde seme worthy semely speche gaderyng many mē sharp wytte somwhat lettred ouer mesure grete speker maner kyndly rabbysshnesse wyt thewes wolde geete hym grete name caste hym doo newe dedes byganne grete doyng dedes also wreched shamely deedes ageynste owne broder sygne token wodenesse dedes accused owne broder treson kyng yaf hym large spence solace cost wont broder bourgeys london founde hym scole scorned prynce deede yet fauoure somme men hadde place among grete london also amonge people blamed venymously pryue deedes outrage ryche men mysferde poure men soo excited hugely· mene men loue desyre fredome oute mesure soo socyed many hym though bywytched ryght wytchecraft hadde tendaunt heestes fyue honderd thousand two thousand men london comyn puruyour al whanne many fautours wolde stonde pore people kynges prouffyt wold euery gaderyng counseyll stonde gentylmen say fraude kynge lost many grete enchetes grutchyd ageynst hym therfor sayled kyng sayde hym ryche men dyde hym greete wrong cause trewe hym thenne cam ageyne byganne worche fraude wont besyly trustly comforted fautours fauour kyng noyse tydynges conspyracy sprā ge oute hubert archebisshop caunterbury hadde rule royamme herde therof sente peple rehersed tolde put euyl suspection prayd wel fayre axed pledge peple plesyd fayr speche yaf delyuerd hym pledgys william helde forth hadde bygonne moch folke hym went grete boost aray made openly conuentycles counseyls gadrynge • n cleped hym self sauyour poore men made grete boost bragge sayde frowardnesse outrage myghty men sholde alayd short tyme toke teme hooly wrytte byganne preche maner haurietis aqua gaudio de fontibus saluatoris drawe vp water ioye welles sau eour said saueour pore men ye pore men haue essayed harde handes ryche men drawe ye laue vp water heelefull lore vp welles ioye tyme vysytacion come shal quoth departe dyuyde watres watres people water shal dyuyde departe people trewe meeke peple fal • proude shal departe good men euyl men lyghte derknesse counceyll lordes hubert sente williā shold stande answere • n shold putte ageynst hym come tyme somned soo moch peple aboute hym sent hym aferd softer doyng putte • dome tyme afterward oportunyte aspyed two burgeys london whanne myghte founde aloone withoute peple aboute hym men armes sente take hym william axe slewe one bourgeys espyed hym anone william fewe men concubyne wolde neuer hym wente chirche fast saynt mary chirch bowe ther wold defende chirche castel strengthe hoped veyn peple wold come delyuer hym people soory peryll inne wonder cause pledgys yeuen hym drede knyghtes sawe armed cam delyueraunce william boden come oute wolde compellyd fyer smoke come oute maugre teeth whanne cam oute bourgeys sonne slayne forkytte wombe knyf • court whanne taken fyrst drawē horse hanged nyne felawes wolde neuer leue hym fautours defamed archebisshop mansle • r alfo wype awey shame owne conspyracye preue dampned william wycked men euyl doer crafte fraude gyle fonded make william haue name worship martir ¶ also men seyn preest williams kyn leyde cheyne william bounden vnder mannes hede seke feuers preched openly man hool anone ryght sprang oute amōg people peple cam pryuely nyght toke aweye gybet pared awey lytel lytel erth bled bloode made grete dyche kepte erth holy relyques hele seke men name tydynges herof sprang wel̄ wyde grete company slye men fooles cam place woke nyght alwey cam theder greete multitude lewdmen fooles moche worship dyde dede man soo moche vylonye put vppon hym hym hadde dampned errour soo forth whanne bygon wold haue witched wyse mē redy nad redyly take h • ede doyng knew williās dedes slewe mā lytel byfore takyng ynough wise man knowe sholde worshiped martir yet last confession made whanne shold dye shold sham • al worshiped hym martir many counseylled hym shreuen mekely sinnes worship god shroof hym though laate knowleched defouled saynt mary chirche lay woman whyle therynne also cause men come wylle delyuere hym forsoke mary sone called deuyl help prayd wold delyuer williams fautours denyed al sayde falsly feyned also vanyte tale fyll doun sone dured whyle alayde stryf sothnesse stedfast str ē ger long tyme falsenesse feyned vanysshed awey short tyme ¶ hubert archebisshop ruler royamme cursed preest sette men armes kepe place cause men shold c • thyder pylgremage soo sleyght feynyd fyll awey short tyme thoppynyon peple byganne reste ¶ capitulum 31 tyme one fulco holy preest gallia cam kyng rychard sayde kyng saye name god almyghty thou marye soone thyn thre euyl doughters· leste somme worse happe befall thou lyest ypocryte quoth kyng doughter haue none yes sayd thou hast pryde couetyse lechery kynge lordes geders sayde ye • e pryde templers hospytalers couetyse whyte monkes lechery prelate hooly chirche sawe fulco toke putte hym boundes myghte bounden yere deyd rees prynce wale hym one sayde maner blysse batayll child chyualrye defence contraye worship armes arme strenght hand largenesse eye reson bryghtnesse honeste beryng brest hector prowesse achilles scharpnesse nestor sobrenesse tydeus hardynesse sampsons strength hector worthynesse eurialius swyftnesse vlyxes fayre speche salamons wysedome aiax hardynesse clothynge naked hungryes mete fulfyllyng al mennes bone hym wold ought bydde fayre speche felawe seruyce honneste dede sobre worde glad semblaunt loue face goodly euery man ryghtfull noble dyademe fairenes wale fallen rees dede al wale groneth rees dede name lost blysse passeth blisse wale passeth rees dede worship world goth awey re al praysynge slakyth wale lyueth gronyng rees dede rees awey enemye heere rees nowe wale helpyth self rees dede take awey noble name dede alwey newe world wyde place holdyth grete worshipe yf byrth byholde yf men axe ende asshes pouder hyd vnhylled nam • dureth euermore suffreth noble duc hyd speche prowesse passed maners wytte passed prowesse fayre speche passed wytte good thewes passed feyr speche celestinus thyrd innocent callyd lot • arius also pope eyght yere fyue monethes· lettred man made bookes de miseria humane condicionis speculum misse many constitucions dampned abbot ioachyms booke made ageynste pyers lombard mayster sentence dampned also amary carnotensis heretyk loore ¶also yere whan emperour dede prynces almayn discorded somme chose otho somme phelip fifth henryes brother phelip traytourly slayne otho crowned pope innocent fraū ce fought anone romaynes cause hym noo worship byname frederyk kyngdome apulea ageynste pope wylle therfor acursed pope fourth yere regne prynces almayne made frederyk emperour worshipfully victory otho last yere kyng richard one wydomarus vycecounte lemonke brytayne lasse kyng ofenglondes owne man fonde greete tresoure gold syluer owne grounde sente greete dele tresour kynge rychard refused sayde sholde haue alle ryght lordship withsayd hym kynge besyeged vycecountes castel called calux trowed tresour therin mynystres castel come oute kyng profered hym castel al therin sauynge theyr lyf lyme armour kyng wold theym goo ageyne defende theym self al strength couth myght thenne day kyng duc brabant wente aboute espye feblenesse castel one bertrand guedon al balastrer hyt kyng arme dart therfor king hadde castel sholde take al wyse al men therinne shold hanged oute take hym hym woū ded soo done shafte take oute yron abode withynne veynes senewes forkytte nynthe daye whanne kyng shold dye sente hym hym wounded spake hym sayde dyd euer thou haste wounded deth thou slewe quoth fader twey bretheren thou woldest haue slayne also therfor plesyth peyne euer suffre thou deede kynge commaunded shold goo free yaf hym honderd schyllynges sterlyng kynges deth duck brabant made hym hee flayn al quyk hanged kyng rychard dyed syxth day apryl body deled thre beryed thre place therfor one sayde metre maner vyscera carleolum corpus fons seruat ebardy et cor rothomagum magne rycarde tuum terra diuiditur vnus quia plus fuit vno non superest vno gracia tanta viro thy bowel ben carl • el thy bodye font ebrard thyn hert roon thou grete rychard departed thre one grete grace one man alyue another metriour sayd maner cryste tui calicis predo fit preda calucis ere breui denis qui tulit era crucis hic richarde iaces sed mors si cederet armis victa timore tui cederet armis tuis cryst theef chalys caluxes praye short metal thou throwyst doune toke metal croys thou lyest rychard yf deth wold spare wepē ou er come drede wolde voyde thy wepen treuisa kyng rychard cleped caluxes pray slayne castel callyd calux ¶ capitulum 32 kyng rychard deyd withoute child brother iohan withoute lond kyng hym anone occupyed kynge rychardes tresour chynon sente hubert archebisshop ordeyne thynges englond thomas thorney bytoke angeo artur duk brytayne sonne elder broder geffrey come geders lordes angeo cenomannia chynon tureyn helde artur maner londe elder broder sonne shal eyer yf eldest sonne dyeth withoute sonne constans geffr • y loue countesse brytayne betoke warde sonne arthur herytage kynge fraunce iohan ouertourned soone cenomannea helde arthur eester roen iohan gyrd swerde ducherye brytayne hooly thursday westmynstre crowned kyng englond hubert archebisshop caunterbury daye iohan made hubert owne chauncel • r hubert proude offyce· afterward one spake hym said syre thou sholdest proude yok thraldome • e haue herde archebisshop made chaunceler neuer chaunceler made archebisshop herafter aboute saynt iohns feste natyuyte kynge iohan sayled normandy trew • take bytwene kynges englond fraunce assured oth wrytyng whether hem brake fyrst pee men sholde assoylled hommage fewte torne kyng afterward kyng iohan wold slee owne neuewe arthur· thenne kynge fraunce occupyed many londes beyonde see ¶ also yere erle flaundres bycam kyng iohns lege man kynge fraunce made arthur knyght toke hym hommage landes angeo cenomannea peytow toreyn lytel britayne normandy also yere made dyuorse solēpnly bytwene kyng iohn wyf erles doughter gloucetre cause kynred thyrdde degree counseyl kyng fraunce kyng iohan wedded isabel doughter engolosym gate hir henry rychard duk cornewayle thre doughters toke anone tribute euery teme lond englond thre schyllynges wente ageyne normandy tyme thyrd ranulph erle chestre caas ensample kyng lefte wyf constance countesse brytayne hadde w • dded somtyme counseylle henry wedded one clemencia rauffes doughter feneger therfor dyed withoute childeren somme men wenen men trowyn yere bygan lordship tartres thise • n dwellyd vnder hylles inde preter iohns sone wente robbyng reuing toke prayes nacion • also yere frensshe men toke constantinople made emperour baldwyn erle flaundres men countrey aboute long tyme therafter myghte vnnethe leue cyte take old prophecye sayde cyte myght take angel enemyes entred cyte place wal angell peynted soo men contraye knewe atte last begyled double entendment angel second frederyk emperour thre thyrty yere crowned pope honorius fyrst fauoured hooly chirche owne moder afterward spoylled hooly chirche stepdame therfor pope honoriꝰ cursed hym assoylled men fey feute nynthe pope gregory renewed sentence frederyk toke sonne henry kyng almayne slewe hym pryson also prelate nynth gregory sente c • general counseyll made theym take whyle acursed wente hooly lond lefte desolacion discomforte consolacion comfort atte laste sette doune fourth pope innocent whyle syeged cyte ytalye loste tresour pope legate chaced hym apulea eueled dyed ¶ aboute yere fyll grete reyn thonder hayl hay • stone fill doune heuen grete egges medled reyn destroyed vynes cornes men shende foules seyn flee eyer bere fuyer cole theyr bylles sette house fyer ¶ also yere london dyed saynt hugh bisshop lyncolne beryed lyncolne beryeng cam pope legate thre archebisshops caunterbury deuelyn ragne thyrten bisshops twey kynges englond scotland soo comen thyder swere feute vpon hubert archebisshops crosse • hommage kyng iohan day woman syght seuen yere blynde purskeruer kyttyng purse lame handes till delyuerd prayeng clergye peple hughe nacion beyonde see made pryour chartrous wycham besydes salesbury thenne made bisshop lyncolne whanne stalled lyncolne archedeken men axyd hors cowe stallyng sayd leuer forsake bisshoprich yeue ony maner thinges doynge wilde foules wolde fetche mete hond yere eustace abbot flaye cam englond preche goddes worde dyde many myracles amonge myracles blessyd welle wy bysydes caunterbury seke men dronk therof theyr heele woman fende within drank therof cast vp twey black todes turned anone houndes thenne grete ass flyed vp eye lefte foule foores hem eustace prechyng made many man leue vserye chepynge feyres sondaye made lyght sholde brenne alweye chirches byfore goddes bodye lordes borde sholde haue almesse dysshes last somme prelate enuye eustace sayde thou hast noo leue sette thyn hooke mennes rype moche corne quoth fewe werkmen soo wente normandye also yere prouynce york moneth december seen fyue mones heuene one eeste another west thyrdde south fourth north fyfthe myddel heuene yede syxe sythes aboute mones houre vanysshed awey atte laste ¶ capitulum 33 lammesse castel myrabel kyng iohan toke slew neuew arthur prysonned syster elyanor brystowe lyues ende therfor felonye kyng fraunce occupyed normandy brytayn peytow angeo cenomannea yere syxth yere thyrdde innocencius began thordre frere prechours countray tholons vnder duc dominik myht confermed fyrste yere honorius fylle sharp wynter grysly dured ieres daye annunciacion also kynge iohan maryed baast doughter lewelyn prynce wale yaf castel lordship ellesmer marche wale yere whan hubert archebisshop caunterbury dede fyll grete stryf ehirche caunterbury chose suppryour somme bisshop norwyche kynges heeste innocencius pope vndyd eyther election sacred steuen langton houndes maistynes ben slayne al forestes englond gir southe wale morgons land knyght appered one mayster moris sleepe wonte playe hym make versus eyther begynnyng eft endyng eyther shold ende others verse apperyng knyht spake maystre morys sayde mayster morys wole thou ende verse destruet hoc reguum rex regum ende thou quoth morys thou hast almoost made ful verse see quoth knyght thou art old slowe therfore ende maner destruet hoc regnū rex regum duplici plaga kyng kynges shal destroye royamme double meschyefs also yere henry borne kyng iohns oldest sone gete ysabel gate hyr henry rychard erle cornewayle thre doughters isabel emperyce elyanor fyrste maryed william marchal erle penbroke afte • ward symon de montford erle leycetre gate hyr six child ¶ also thyrd iane maryed kyng scotland ¶ yere bygan enterdytyng englond dured seuen yere contynuelly kynge iohan refused wold noo wyse take steuen langton archebisshop caunterbury confermed pope· also kynge iohan chased monkes caūterbury toke goodes owne honde therfor pope assoylled kyng iohans men hommage fewte wrote kynges next iohan shold arryse ageynst iohn heretiks hight albygensis come englond brent alyue sarasyns cam oute affryca thre thousand men armes al without lx lauendres occupyed grete dele spayne therfor innocencius pope sente messagers dyuerse nacions helpe socour holy landes sarasyns bylded strengthes hylle mount tabor werre ageynste acre also yere saynt fraunceys bygan ordre frere menours bysides assyse kyng fraunce grete hoost occupyed clyues normandy ageynst kyng iohan pope legate pandulphus cam englond spake kyng iohan chargyd hyghely shold buxom obedyente chirche rome kynge sawe peryll euery syde kynge fraunce also lordes owne landes wrytyng torned hem self kyng fraunce kyng oblegyd al kyngdom englond irlond also hym heyers pope innocencius lauful successours euer tyme heyres sholde feodaryes chirche rome pay euery yere seuen honderd mark englond two honderd mark irlond soo yf ony heyres fayled condicion payemente shold falle ryght kyngdome herafter pandulphus wente forth compellyd kyng fraunce wende oute normandye steuen tharchebisshop exyled hym cam englonde assoylled kyng fautours chirche wynchestre made hem swere shold restore al wrongfully taken tyme kyng iohn caused hange drawe holy man hight pyers ponfret warned hym many myshappes shold fal cruelnes fornycacion also warned hym shold regne xiiij yere regned almoost xviij yere knewe doyng regned frely xiiij yere regned thre yere frely thylke thr • yere trybutary pope cryst appered twyes pyers yorke one ponntfret taught hym many thynges tolde afterwarde bisshops peple euyll lyf also tyme lay thre dayes thre nyghtes swonyng rauysshed sawe ioyes peynes good men euyl saint andrew euen kyng iohn toke castel rouchestre many gentilmen conspyred ageynste hym also lowys kynges broder fraunce cam englond atte prayer lordes hadde hommage fewte frensshe men englysshe kynge scotland london pope legate gna •• englond cursed lowys fautours nethe lesse lowy • toke wynchestre besyeged douer wyndesore· pope innocencius deyd thyrdde honorius pope hym ten yere eyght monethes fyrst yere confermed ordre frere prechours thyrd innocencius loth conferme ordre kyng iohn deyd newerk flux saynt calyxtes day pope seuententh yere kyngdom syxth moneth • oweld abbaye whyte chanons croghton beryed wyrcetre middel quere monkes r comyn fame tellyth swore meete loof worth half peny shold worth twelue pen within yere yf myght lyue monke hous herde made hym drynke venym shroof hym houseled drank kyng tastour soo kynge deyd attones ¶ capitulum 34 anon vpon saynt symons day iude kyng iohns sone henry child ix yere old made kyng holpen strength wyt pope legate bisshop wynchestre therles penbroke chestre ranulph erle chestre take lyncoln ageynst lowy • slayn ther many frenssh men lowis saw party febled toke money yelded vp strengthes holde assoilled pope legate went ageyne fraunce lewyd men helde lowys disheryted clerkes trespas wa • grete pryued benefyces sente court rome assoylled ranulph erle chestre went ierl̄m acorded lewelyn prync • wale damyeta taken crysten men yere fyrst abbotes blac ordre come geders oxenford tr • te thordre kyng henry began newe werk westmestre ranulph erle chestre cam oute hooly lande bylded castels charteley beston thabbay delacresse whyte ordre costes castels toke tollage lād also yere seint thomas caunterbury martir translated steuen archebisshop duryng solempnyte fond hey prouende al men wold axe hit wey bytwene lōdon caunterbury ¶also day translacion made wyn renne pypes contynuelly dyuers place cyte cost steuen made thi • solempnite fourth successour bonefacius payed vnnethe alysander kyng scotlād wedded ione kynge henryes syster saynt luk euāgelystes day cam wynde oute north syde brake doune house orchardes wodes belhous belfrayes also fyry dragōs euyl spirites seen fle aboute whyrlwynde ox • ford counseyl bisshops one taken hadde body woundes oure lord cryst nayled crosse sayde ihesus dome holy chirche take punysshed abburbury nayled crosse dauid erle scotland sonne iohan wedded lewelins doughter prince wale final acorde bytwene lewelyn eme ranulph erle chestre iohan kyng ierusalem cam engl̄and socour hooly land lordes englonde graunted kyng henry • wardes heyres • andes begynnyng moche harme englond sone therafter kyng henry toke fyftenth peny al englond yere fyrst come frere menours englond two yere byfore saynt fraunceys deth honorius nynthe gregory pope fourten yere strengthed sentence cursyng ayenst frederyk emperour therfore emperour toke many prelate two cardynals • counseyle pope made broder raymund compyl • fyue bookes decretales gadred many constituciōs pystles decretales also tyme pope besyeged emperour cyte rome saw romayns takē mede thēperour toke hādes hedes thappostles petir paul̄ made processiō frō seint iohns chirch lat er seint pet er chirch awelded hertes romamayns therfor thēperour aferd wēt then ferre wey steuen tharchebisshop deyd quoted bible paris marked capytres endited kyng rychardes lif left aft er many good bokes made grete deen lōdon maist richard wethershed archebisshop aft er also thi • yere deid williā alune lettred mā first chaūceler bisshop paris lefte many bokes made de sacramentis cur deus homo de fide et de legibus de vniuso corporali spū ali gregory toke dyme • f holy chirche bisshop • london sayde masse saynt paules chirche fyl grete thycknesse cloudes derknesse sonne thundryng lyghtnyng stenche man myght suffre peple wēt oute chirche lefte bisshop seruaunte • aloone yere kynge henry graunted englysshmen many fredoms toke hem fyftenth dele goodes catail wynne landes beyonde see kyng fraunce occupyed kyng henryes tyme sayled ouer see gret • strength dyd • lytel prouffyte william de brewes blamed lewillyns wyf prynce wale prysoned hanged therfor fyl grete stryf bitwene kyng lew • lyn ranulph erle chestre lyncoln huntyngdon deyd walyngford beryed chestre chapytre monkes faders sistres sonne iohan scot erle hym ranulph dyed withoute child four sustres eldeste hem mold maryed dauyd erle scotland hym cā iohn scot second sister mablye maryed therle arū del thyrdde agnes therle derby william de ferraus fourth hawys maryed therle wynchestre robert quynycy kyng henry made hospytal saynt iohan withoute eest yate oxenford layd fyrst stone whan rychard archebisshop caunterbury dede saynt edmond abendon archebisshop hym tyme tresorer salesbury dyed beyonde see eyghtenth yere bisshoprych bury • poūtney burgoyn seuenth yere therafter translated fauour fourth innocent pope ¶ capitulum 35 frederik themperour wedded ysabel kyng henryes sust yere iewes brought bifore kyng westmestre hyd child al yere norwich aft er circumcyded hym cast naile hym crosse kyng henry wedded erles doughter prouynce iohn scot erle chestre huntyngdon deyd without child derēhal • seuēth day iuyn beryed chestre bycause lādes prerogatyues realte erldō fyll kynges hond systres eyre lādes therfor cōpē sacion cause feyr lordship shold deled bytwene dystanes woman iohan four systres one hem margaret wedded aleyn galwey bore mayde deuergoyl mayde wedded iohn bayllol bare iohn baillol kyng scotlād syster isabel maryed robert de bruys third sister wold dyed without childrē fourth sister alda maryed henry de hastyngys also yere octobonus legate cam englond ordeyned many good ordenaūces prouffyte hooly chirche whyle passed thurgh oxenford grete fyghtyng bytwene scolers som meyne one men slayne hym • self octobonus besyeged belfray osenay till euensonge tyme myght vnneth delyuerd many kynges mynystres cam thider abyndon brought walyngford cursed mysdoers suspended studie oxenford til abbot chanons osenay maystres regentes oxenford cam barfote bare legged vngird thurgh london legate foryeuenes vnneth yere fals clerk feyned hym self mad espyed pryuyte kynges court cam wyndowe kynges chambre wodstock slee kyng crye holy woman taken drawen couentre edward kyng henryes eldest sonne borne westmynstre hym cristned octoban legate confermed edmond archebisshop yere kynges tartres whan th • ouercome eest landes departed hem twey companyes one party therof destroyed hūgary pannonia men coūtray ete flessh childrē many scrapyd pouder hyll ete mele af • er nynth gregory fourth celestinus pope one moneth see voyde one yere fourth innocent pope enleuen yere syx monethes oure saueours crowne thornes wa • brought fraunce octobonus went oute englond take see emperours men chestre kyng henry entred wale dauid prince cam ruthlād yere dyed seint edmōd pōteny bonefas archebisshop aft er edmōd born abendon besides oxē ford holy fader moder faders name edward rych̄ surname assēt wif lad relygyous lyf eueshā moders name mablye vsed heer haberion fought flesshe ageynst fflesshe edmond born cleene al wem childhode saynt edmondes daye kyng martir lay al day morow tyde euen though swowne wold haue buryed hym yf moder withsayd hym cleped edmond gracyous clene borne saynt edmondes daye also whyle moder childe hym wente pylgremage badde bede saynt edmondes tombe first ware childe alyue ¶ fyrste childhode vsed wytte studye goodnesse occupacion goostly lyuynge good vsage customme shold afterward haue maystrye voyde al wycked dedes though shynyng al floures vertues yet chose clennes makyth man next god token therof made auowe oure ladye moders counseyl vsed heer fasted euery fryday brede water vsed euery sonday holy day saye al sauter er wold dyne childhode lerned gramer soo dysesed hede ache hope spede afterward lore moder spak hym sayd sone trowe lewd vnsemely tonsour thou vsest cause thy woo afterward vsed tonsoure clerk hool al woo tyme walked hym self meede besydes oxenford fayr childe appered hym sayde hayl leef wonder thou knowest namely whyle alwey thy syde scole place therfor thou seest forheede wryten prente euery nyght thyne owne forhede wrytinge ihesus nazarenus rex iudeorum ihus nazareth kyng • iewes therafter lerned alwey haue oure lordes passion mynde one besynes lesson muste rede forgate ¶ thenne whan day byganne sprynge old enemy bond fast hondes cause shold blesse hym self prayd herte enemy fyl doune hym bytwene bedde wal coniuryd hym shedyng goddes bloode shold telle wherwith myght moost chasted thou hast nempned quoth fende another tyme foryete saye oryson beata et intemerata saynt iohan ewangelyst appered hym slepe manaced smite pawmer hooly wrytt sayth rectheth smale fallyth awey lytel litel wold euery day shryue clense venyal synnes entysyng old enemy hoostes doughter sygnes bekkes also wordes auentred tempte saynt edmond amysse wold cesse er cam hooly man chambre strypte scourged soo putt utchyng whan enemy myght spede wenche auentred wyf assaylle hym edmōd wold take yeftes withoute leue husbond put soo ashamed though infra sacros mayster art vsed masse saye houres euery day er wolde rede prouffytable scolers taught hem masse also whanne toke moneye scolers leyde wyndowe seyd powder pouder asshes asshes money ofte take awey felaws game el pryuel̄y theeues whanne radde arithmetryk moder deede appered hym sleepe axyd hym sayde fygures thou studiest yune answerred suche suche peynted thre cerkles hyr ryght honde though wold mene fader sonne hooly goost sayde sonne studye thou fygures tyme selde sate chirche bad bede standyng knelyng noble precheour sharp arguer mylde lyster auysed toke heede falace waare wyse assoylynge question grete prouffyte redyng ¶ greete abstynence heer fyll aweye berde heede soo lyppes semed cloue vsed alwey grete mete lefte flesshe mondaye wonesdaye also septuagesima al lente tyme alleluya closed wold taste noo flesshe daye wold singe masse soo ofte happed ete noo flesshe moneth al hoole ete selde twyes daye rought lectuaryes medecyns grete knelyng knee harde sooles feete euery daye said thre paire matyns houres daye ladye hooly goost placebo dirige night firste sleepe wolde aduise saye certeyne prayer psalmes yf ony enuious worde come place wolde pledynge cause wold haue men 〈◊〉 • culer court hym mete wold wynne hem 〈…〉 blesse heuene wold vysyte house offyce 〈◊〉 heere acomptes mynystres spente alwey • han hadde chalengyd seruanntes clennesse body couenaunte wryten soo yf ony hem fyll lecherye shold take hyer take leeue goo wey tethynges offrynges redempcion̄ synnes spente mylde v byfore hym paynted ymage oure lady al aboute hym passion lord soo lesson come booke byfore ymage hedes eyther come grete deuocion tyme etyng slepyng redyng whanne myght studye tolde hit al lost ofte opened bible wold worship crosse whanne legacy crosse commytted hym toke noo procuratoryes hym graunted ayenste vsages suche legate trauaylled owne coste prechyd oxenford gloucestre wyrcetre reyn fyll people made turne ageyne prayers· happed slepte studye candel fyll doune byble brente whanne awoke sawe noo brennynge seen also hys penne made thre cross kybe hadde vanysshed awey heeris wered throwen fyer whan old myght brenne here wered myght vnnethe ony worme founde somtyme messagers sent caūterbury salesbury edmond tresorer place shol̄de come archebisshop caunterbury deen salesbury spake hem sayde ye welcom euel come ye welcome ye worship oure chirche ye euyl come ye take oure tresoure tresorer hym shamed drawe owne hosen shone euery man met wey wolde shryuen hym· wolde lyght doune hors shryfte spare let comyng ynne nother wynde nother reyne ne weder ferde olif tree holdith yt self bytternesse rynde heldeth oute toother swetnesse oyle soo harde hym self easy goodly men beete brest ofte honde knee ageynst grounde soo clerkes lay seler • vnder hym myght vnneth slepe worship oure lady worshiped al wymmen therby neuer wemmed tyme one blamed hym hoomely hym fayr wyf wold ofte speke answerde sayde sawe thow fayr know •• che hath ofte sette neuer temp • ed wal yet th • ugh haue trespaced maner synne wryten forhede shol̄de ashamed hated taker yeftes sayde frensshe entreprendre prender one lettre aloone last exytyng deuyl kyng henry chapytre hous caunterbury rebel ageynst hym hurlyng made though knewe kyssed hem preserued hym dyde hem al homely dedes whanne frendes sayde mylde yafe ensample men aryse wyse answerd sayd swellyng see mylk shal souke ete wylde hony wyldernesse world iohan baptist forgoer lord power takyng wreche moote withholde goddes hande wol mennes defautes gete loenge vnprouffytable c • st trauayll prelate geders axyd might releue hooly chirche made subgette thral counseyled kyng men rebell shold warned yf wolde amende wreche c • nsures hooly chirche sholde sl • pe hooly man assenteth goth kyng kyng axith auysement abideth al nought therfor kyng spared aloone rebell denounsed acursed therby wolde euel doer amended hym leuer suffre malyce tyme kyth myght plee stryf toke heede though hadde doone al myght hit myghte happe pope legate englond wolde vndoo al sentence dedes comforte kyng wors dedes yf archebisshop presente corrected trespas errours hit myght seme wolde alowe dedes maner feyned suffraunce therfore hym leuer absente tyme shewe ther sorowe herte soore agreued malyce last sekenesse byganne waxe greuous strong wēt oute poyntney soysy byhyght hem wold come ageyne saynt edmondes day whanne sacramente auter brought hym sayde thou art lord haue loued haue trowed haue prechyd haue sought none men tellyn goth wombe telle goth soule thought wesche woundes ymage crucyfyx kyssed hem full swete sayde ye shal drawe vp water ioye oure saueours welles ¶ capitulum 36 celestinus fourth innocencius pope enleuē yere six monethes put honest noble persones cardynals see voyde made cardynal frere hughe ordre prechours expowned byble made grete concordaunces vpon byble pope made coū seyl lugnum fraunce canonysed saynt edmond archebisshop seuenth yere deth demed rebel emperour frederyk shold deposed sette doune tholet spayne iewe dygged orchard make vyneyerde found stone hool sound euery syde myddel stone founde booke grete sauter treenleues wrytten grue ebrue latyn spake thre worldes adam antecryst declared proprete men sette begynnyng thirdde world cryst maner thyrdde world goddes sone shal borne mayde marye shal suffre deth sauacion mankynde iewe radde crystned anone englond grete derth busshel corne solde twelue schyllynges yere seynt edmond tranlasted frederyk emperour dyed acursyd hym sone manifred assaylled kyngdom tresour scicile till charles kynges broder fraunce pryued hym bothe kyngdome lyf whanne frederik dede innocencius pope procured chesers thempyre chese many chosen duk turing erle holande dyed soone cheese kynges brother englonde rychard duk eornewayle stryf dured wel many yeres wel grete coste ver • yfiour • uyded sillables name fredericꝰ maner fre fremit mundo de deprimit alta profundo re rimatur cu cuspyte cuncta minatur ¶ yere london made solempnel procession towarde crystes bloode patryark ierusalem sente kyng henry thyrtenthe day october lowys kyng fraunce wente hooly land toke damyeta yere take soudan batayll felde william longa spata dede longa spata long swerde honderd thousand fyfty thousand huerdes marked sygne hooly crosse come paris destroyed hughely vnyuersyte slewe many clerkes kyng henry yaf eldest sonne edward gascoyn • lond wale chestreshyre ¶ yere grete hete erth drye bare noo fruyte ende heruest fyl grete rayne erth myght swolowe therof cam many meschyefs ¶ also yere deyd saynt robert grosthed bisshop lyncoln nynth day october connyng lyberal artes specially expowned many thynges logyk etyks astrologye sente fourth pope innocent pystle sharp ynough begynneth maner lord ihesus cryste sente pystle cause pope greued chirches englonde tax payementis vndue vncustumable also yeuen lytel neuewe chanonrye fyrste voyded chirche lyncolne robert wold receyue childe wrote pope sayde nother wold shold receyue suche cure soule couth rule hym self therfor robert somned court acursyd thenne innocent courte appellyd crystes owne trone robertus deth happed nyght pope lay bedde reste bisshop appered hym arayd bisshop spak pope sayde aryse wretche come dome smote hym crosse lyft syde right h • rte morow pope bed founden blody pope dede herfor though robert noble man oft myracles court suffryd hym canonysed ¶ innocencius fourth alysaunder pope seuen yere four monethes pee reformed bytwene kyng henry l • welyn prynce wale mont gomeryk forme lewelyn successours tyme shold doo hommage kynges englond kyng henry toke hym thre thousand marck herupon henry made chartre confermed auctoryte pope sone therafter fyl grete honger busshel corn solde syxtene schyllynges tyme kynge henry made four half bretheren ryche despysed lordes therfor come geders oxenford fest trynyte symon de montford erle leycetre rychard de clare erle gloucetre lordes chose twelue peres counseyll hem chaungyd kynges mynystres put kynges foure half bretheren oute l̄and dede cause baron werre kyng henry sayl • fraunce made shamely acorde kynge fraunce foryafe hym normandy landes beyonde see soo hym shold leue hoole lond gascoyn alysaunder fourth vrban pope neygh four yere fyrst patriark ierusalem helpe hem hadde take signe crosse chas • hooste rome manyfredus putte saynt peter lande also pope yaf kyngdome scicile charles kynges broder fraunce yf put then manyfredus soo hit done aboute tyme teukesbury iewe fylle gonge saterday wold suffre noo man drawe hym vp reuerence hooly daye rychard clare erle gloucetre wold suffre noo man drawe hym vp morow sonday reuerence hooly day soo iewe deyd ¶ capitulum 37 yere fylle stryf bytwene kynge lordes englond kynge wolde holde ordenaunces ordeyned parleament • xenford aboute saynt iohns f • ste natyuyte lordes helde warde bisshop herford pryour wenlok prelate alyenes next kyng chased oute englond occupyed theyr goodes catayll therfore henry putte vniuersyte oute oxenford last kynge baron put hem self touchyng article ordenaunce kyng fraunce repreued articules euerychone lordes englond forsoke vnskylfull dome stode forth bigōne lordes maintened ordenaūces cam geders lewys southsex xiiij day may yaf batayle toke kyng henry broder rychard duck cornewayle edward kyng henryes eldest sonne many grete soo compellyd kyng holde ordedenaūces made helde edward eyght monethes herford warde tyme prouynce chestre yeuen symon montford erle leycetre trynyte euen kynges sonne edward herford escaped oute warde help syr rogyer mortymer leue cause solace prycke courser escaped vnto hylle dūnemore sawe rogyer mortymers baner displayd herafter aboute lammasse hard bataylle euesham bytwene kynge baron gyleful withdrawyng erle gloucestre helde symon byfore rightful symon dede many noble personnes grete fame tellith dyde many myracles shewed drede kynge thenne symons knyghtes helde castel kenelworth half yere ageynst hoost englonde vrban fourth clement pope four yere hym pope see voyded thre yere twey monethes clement fyrst wyf child afterwarde aduocate cheef counseyls kynge fraunce whanne wyf dede made bisshop pue archebisshop narbon bisshop sabyn cardynal legate sente englond whyle absente chosen pope therafter men trowyd mylde lyuynge hooly bede aqueynt many trybulacions hooly chirche also whanne conradynus wente scicile werre ageynst charles pope told openly sermon cōradinꝰ dede shold come nought yere aboute halowē tyde octobon legate cam englond ordeyned many thynges prouffyte hooly chirche counseylle kynge henry graunted must raunsonne landes dysheryted arisyng ayenst kyng oute take erle derby robert de ferrer semed hadde moost greued kyng ¶ next yere therafter greued kyng taken diherited till heyres somme hym myghte pay daye l pounde london octobon legate denounsed londoner portnens acursyd sayde acursyd pope clements counseyll enterdyted hem forbode hem conpany crysten men thenne suspended bisshops london chycestre offyce till assoylled pope therfore londonners besyeged octobon toure london till many bisshops armed hym aweye octobon toke dymes hooly chirche thre yere whyle englond wente hi • weye deken cardinal made pope yere soudan babylon destroyed ermonye toke antyo • slewe men dwellid therinne destroyed noble cyte kyng henry laye hoost withoute london stratford til pee made bytwene hym baron octobon wē te oute englond huge tresour edward kynges sonne many toke sygne crosse pope clemēt deyd saynt edward kyng confessour translated fourthe daye october kynge henryes tyme kyng henry twentyest peny lewd mennes catayl dymes holy chirche thre yere assente pope yere edward kynges eldest sonne wyf wente hooly land clement tenthe gregory pope four yere thyrd yere poperyche made counseyl lugdnum profyte hooly lande caste wende theder owne person counseyll messagers tartres grekes grekes promysed wolde come ageyne vnyte hooly chirche syx honderd bisshops thousand prelate therfor one sayde gregorius denus congregat omne genus wolde versus mene tenthe gregory gadered al manere men ordeyned noble statute neuer herde afore alle personnes cure sholde preestes tyme tyme noo man sholde haue leue assigne tethynges dyd byfore owne wylle al tethynge sholde payed moder chirche ¶also gregory charged hooly chirche dymes six yere dampned pluralyte benefyces cure also approued somme state ordres beggers prechours menours somme suffryd carmes austyns somme reproued sacfreres callyd de penitencia de valle viridi suche ¶ also yere deyd henry kyng englond saynt edmondes day pontenay men trowyd skylfully ended lyf day trauayled hym wrōgfully whyle alyue regned fyue • fyfty yere also yere dyed bonefas archebishop caunterbury pryour caunterbury chosen archebisshop pope forbadde election made archebisshop frere robert kylwerby ordre prechours mayster dyuynyte ¶among noble wrytynges made noble wrytynge vpon precian vpon logyk sone herafter lowys kyng fraunce twey sone kynge nauern many prelate wente efte hooly lond greete sekenesse euyll • stronge see costes land crysten hoost two honderd thousand disparpled shed pope legate ruler pylgryms hooly lande dyed kyng fraunce also kyng laye seke prayd besyly maner lord pray thou make v despyse welth world drede none meschyefs peple prayd maner thou lord thyn peple ha • ower wardeyn putte ende shal entre thyn hows shall pray thyne hooly temple ¶ capitulum 38 edward kynge henryes sonne cam oute holy londe englond second day august crowned kynge threttenth day byfore december morow coronacion toke openly hommage fewte alysaunder kyng scotl̄and ¶ thenne second yere made lawes tenth gregory fyfte innocent pope fyue monethes ¶this hyght byfore tarentasius ordre prechours doctor dyuynyte ¶ hym fyfthe adryan pope twey monethes somtyme sente pope clement englond alledge stryf bytwene kynge baron hym xxj iohn pope eyght monethes hight byfore peter famous many dyuerse scyences h • pope doted semed hym lacked grete dele kyndly wyt netheles auaū sed clerkes ofte presence many men byhyght hym self lōg lif fyl doun sodenly new chābre byld • vit • rbe deyd syxth daye fallynge iohn thyrdde nychol pope thre yere ¶ yere lewelyn prynce wale wold come kynges parlemente englond kynge edward wente wale foūded castel flynte strengthed cāstel ruthland lewelyn submytted hym kyng yaf hym fyfty thousand poūd trespaas yland mon thousande mare yere ¶ pope nychol made f • rere robert culwarbye archebisshop caunterbury cardynal made frere iohan pecham archebisshop stede kyng edward punysshed iewes assentours clyppyng moneye euyl chaunges made iewes taken • day somme henge put awey kyng edward lordes made statute ageynst maynmort soo tyme man shold yeue nother selle nother byquethe nother chaunge nother tytle assygne landes tenemētes nother rente man relygyon withoute kynges l • ne ¶ kynge made smyte co • n newe moneye halfpeny ferdynges al rounde theron semeth marlyns prophecye fulfylled sayth haluendele shal round nychol fourth honorius pope seuen yere fourth yere chaunged cope frere carmes cleene whyte fore ray barred bemed fals walshe dauyd ro • ageynst kyng edward palmsonday dyde englysshe men grete harme damage kyng edward cam aboute saynt iohans feste wanne wale yaf tounes landes myddel wale lordes land helde hym self castels see syde doynge cam grete pee reste tyme herafter aboute saynt luke feste lewelyns heede smyten brought kyng sente london sone therafter lewelyns broder dauid take exyter wo grete parlement shrowsbury first dāpned draw horse hanged throte quartred deled dyuerse place englond lewelyn twey men relygyon wrote versus metre walshmen manere hic iacet anglorum tortor tutor venedorū princeps wallorū lewelinus regula morū gēma coeuorū flos regū pret er itorū forma futurorū dux laus lex lux ppl̄o rum lyeth tormētour englissh men wardeyn tutor walsshemen prynce wallsshmen lewelyn ruler gode thewes cheef precious stone hem time floure kynges byfore ensample hem shall tyme leder praysynge lawe lyght peple englysshmen sayde thys maner hic iacet errox prynceps predo virorum proditor anglorum fax liuid • secta reorum numen wallorum trux dux homicida piorū f • x troianorum stirp • mendax causa malorum lyeth prynce errours theef robber men traytour englisshmen dym brond set euyll doer god walsshmen cruel duk slee • good men drastes troianes fals rote cause euyll de • e kyng edward made englisshe lawes holden 〈…〉 sette shirreues ¶ kynge edward hath sonne borne carnaruan wale tuesdaye ¶ fourth honorius fourth nycol ordre menors • ope 〈◊〉 syx yere ¶ yere iohan peccham archebisshop cam chestre wale reforme state holy chirch • yere grete drouth hete men dyed 〈◊〉 also yere marchādyse brente saynt botulphs 〈◊〉 deuels child sette fyer dyuers place • une wolde frely robbe reue place 〈◊〉 sayde vnnethe alle moneye englond sholde restore • e harme done stremes golde syluer metal molten ranne vnto see yere bushel whete sold four pen saynt margrets 〈◊〉 fil tempest reyn thundryng lyghtnyng • n 〈◊〉 herde none suche byfore tyme bete doune drowned corne gras stode grounde· corne wexed der • rer derrer london busshel sold twey • yllynges afore sold thre pen derth corne •• red fourty yere vnto deth kyng edward second conquest tyme london bushel sold fo • x shyllynges aboute yere heeste pope nychol chirches englond taxed value syth voyded taxacion norwiche made fourth innocencius iewes put englond cam neuer ageyn fourth nychol fifth celestinꝰ takē ankers lyf pope fewe yeres thre yere somdele stryfe • court somdele counseyll successour bonefas meued resygned vp poperyche toke ageyn rather maner lyuyng ¶ also yere dyed alysander kynge scotland ther grete stryf bytwene scottes shold kyng hym ¶ capitulum 39 deth alysaunder kynge scotlānd dyed withoute child grete stryf moeued shold kyng scotland hym many chalengyd kyngdome cause nygh kynred bloode myght determyned al full withoute presence cheef lord founde wrytyng autentyk old kyng englond cheef lorde scotland shuld knowe deme suche maner caas shuld knowen tyme yere kyng edward made serche thabbayes englond scotland wale wytte knowe ryght maner dede cronykes maryan scotte william malmesbury rogyer huntyngdon raph le bruys hit founde yere oure lord nyne honderd ten kyng edward elder made subgette kynges scotland cumbres also cronykes founde yere lord nyne c one twenty forsayd men scottes cumbres chese forsayd edward elder lord patrone also founde yere lord nyne honderd syx twenty adelstan kyng englond ouercome constantyn kyng scotland suffryd hym eft regne vnder also adelstans broder edredus kyng englond ouercome scottes northumbres submytted hem self hem swore hym feute also found edward kyng englond ou er come alpinꝰ sone kynadius kyng scottes swore hym feute also foūd canutus kyng englōd denmarche yere kyngdom xvj ouercome malcolin kyng scotland therafter kyng four kyngdoms englond scotland denmarche norwey also founde saynt edward yaf kyngdom scotland malcolyn kynges sone cumbres holde also williā bastard syxt yere kyngdom ouercome malcolyn kyng scotland toke hym oth homage feute also williā rede wise fader • lcolyn kyng • sco • land mal • olyns twey sonnes regned • also alysander brother successor edgar royam scotland assente kyng henry fyrst also dauyd kyng scotland dyd homage kyng steuen also william kyng scotland dyd homage thyrdde henry second henryes sone coronacion also henry fader twentyest yere kyngdome wryten couenaunte wryten bytwene hem tweyne also rogyer hūtyngdon sayth william kyng scoland cam lord kyng henry normandy dyd homage also kyng rychard kyng iohn lyncolne also saynt albōs cronykes foūde alisander kyng scotland wedded margaret kyng henryes doughter york dyd hym homage yere kyng henry xxxv foūde kynges chartr • scotlād also pope bulles sent scotlād foūd kinges scotlād acursid wold buxom obedient lordes kinges englond cam geders norham thendes englond toward scotlande kyng englond wise men kyng scotland redyest men worthyest kyng englōd axed fyrst scottes shold pesybly assente 〈◊〉 ordenaū ce touchyng kyng scotlād namely longed cause cheef lordship scottes sayde knewe none suche soueraynte longed kyng englond saide myght answer thinges without hede king longeth tretynges yt shold yeue none answer tyme oth made eche kyng alysanders deth whiche oth must bolde vpon peyn cursynge kyng edward toke aduisement made lettres patēt scottes knowleched coming scottes englond half water twede shold eftsones preiudice comyng eft englond • eraft • r grettest scotlond englond chalengid right succession kyngdome scotland knowleched graūted theyr lettres patent wold good wyll receyue right byfore kyng cheef lord wold holde ferme stable al wold ordeyne forsaid dede semed wise men tyme king edward myght yeue right succession kyngdom man yf erst right possession kyngdome scotlande therfore kynges syde englond surete made scottes kyngdome sholde restored within twey monethes hym ryght therto vpon peyn honderd thousand pound sterlyngis shold payd rome helpe hooly lond also vpon peyne cursyng enterdytyng kynge royamme englond yf wold restore kyngedom sayd scottes chartres yafe bytoke kyng edward kyngdome scotlond castels ryght custommes vsages sette wardeynes sholde saue hym ryght al auaūtage profite land mene tyme whan long ple disputacion eyther syde hem chalengyd kyngdom kyng englond toke heede strength resons euydences eyther syde yaf dome iohan de baillol iohn knowleched king englond cheef lorde scotland· dyde hym hommage swore hym fewte yere deyd frere iohan pecham archebisshop caunterbury ¶ mayster robert wynchestre archebysshop hym • yere madoc walshman rered warre wale mychelmesse day therfor kynge edward cam chestre aboute saynt nycolās feste toke yle mon callyd anglesia latyn bylded newe cyte castel de beel mary tyme wodes wale hewen doune grete socour men contray hyde hem self warre tyme strong castels made dyuers place see syde sone herafter madoc taken brought london tyme werre cessed wale walsshmen lyued englysshe men gadred tresour dredde lost catayl tyme kynge edward made serche alle abbayes englond bryng london all̄ money founde also made arrest wulles felles therafter fyll grete derthe corne wyn ¶ capitulum 40 fyfth celestinus eyght bonefas pope enleuen yere pope fyrst yere yere grace yere graūted large grete pardō pilgrim wolde come rome vysyte apostle peter paule made syxth boke decretales therin determyned many grete doutes encorpored many grete constitucions extrauagāt constitucion honorius adrian innocencius clement pope dyde awey al wrongful constitucion put cours lawe cleped cō stitucion extrauagant begyled predecessour celestinus made hym resygne vp poperyche torne eft ankers lyf men seyn therfor celestinꝰ prophecyed hym maner thou come vp fox thou shalt regne lyon dye hound made pope celestinus make cōstituciō euery pope myghte frely resygne vp poperyche whan pope reuoked constitucion ¶ ruled strongly sette doune somme cardynals som gentilmen de columpna withstode kyng fraunce many poyntes h • founded myghte set doune kyng fraunce therfor stuward fraunce william de longaret wyse man f • r castynge forsayd bretheren de columpna conspyred geders· toke pope bonefas se • hym vpon wylde hors withoute brydel torned face toward tayl made hym prycke aboute last brethe slewe hym pryckynge honger iohn de baylloll made kyng scotland aroos ageynst kyng englond ageynst owne othe counseyll somme men scotl • nd namely abbot menros iohan take dissheryted ¶ thenne yere williā waleys nacion scottes arrayd werre ageynst kyng edward chaced second yere ¶ kyng edward slew lx scottes fouchirch mary maudelyn day scottes wexed stronger stronger xxx yere geders vnto kyng edwardes tyme thyrd conquest beete doune englysshemen oft englysshe place nygh march somme sayde myshappe fylle softenesse englyssh men somme sayde goddes owne wrech prophecye sayde englysshe men shold destroyed dane frensshe men scottes touched ende fyrst book kyng made seyse hond al temporalyte clerkes put hem oute protection wold reward catail yere aiēst scottes assēt clergy robert tharchebisshop purchaced inhibiciō pope clerke shold rewarde kyng holy chirche goodes many clerkes purchaced drede kynges protection withoute counseyl lordes kyng edward lytel serengthe englysshe men walsshmen sayled flaū dres ageynst kyng fraunce comyn sawe kyng edward loued blaūche kynges doughter fraunce wold gladly yelde vp gascoyn kynge fraunce doughter blaunche edward olde blaunche wās yonge wenche kyng edward wedded margaret kynges syster fraunce gate hir twey sonnes thomas edmonde kynge edward dampned sodanly fals money slyghtly brought vp men clepin moneye pollardes crokardes rosoryes putte forthe lytel lytel pryuely stede shyllynges fyrst made one hem worth halfpeny forbad hem aboute also yere edmond erle cornewayle deyd without child edmond sonne rychard erle cornewayle kyng almayne soo erldome fyll ageyne crowne yere yere grace whiche wēt many pylgryms rome kyng edward yaf sonne edward pryncypate wale erldome chestre london william waleys leeder scottes honged drawen heede smyten sette vpon brydge london al men beholde wolde passe· body quartred sente dyuerse place englond yere kyng edwarde sente pope bonefas lettres declare ryght lordship englonde hath ouer royamme kynges scotlande robert le bruys pleyned pope kynge edward greued wrongfully royamme scotland therfor pope wrote kyng englond sholde leue suche greuynge myght shewe clerly ryght eyght bonefas enleuenth benette ordre prechours pope fully one yere hym one sayde maner nomen habe benedic benefac benedicite aut rem peruerte maledic malefac maledicite haue thy name thy dede say wel doo wel blessyd torne dede say euyl euyl acursyd sayth thus benet benedictus latyn blessyd englysshe benet fyfte clement pope twelue yere trauayled aboute byldynge castels gaderyng tresour dampned thordre templers ordeyned seuenthe booke decretales hyghte clementynes soone therafter counseyl made vyen reuoked booke successour two twentyest pope iohn renewed efte boke publysshed putte cours lawe canon ¶ clement fyrst chaungyd pope see rome auinion men wondren dede whether done goddes ordenaunce mannes foule hardynesse ¶ also yere kyng edward made hard inquisicion ageynst euy • doer ageynst hem trespassed ageynst crowne maner inquisicion hight traylbaston robert de bruys toke wronfully kyngdome scotlande aboute eester slowe iohan le comyn dunfre chirche frere menours wold assēt hym trayson kyng englond cam chasid robert benge sleers iohan ¶ yere kyng edwarde deyd carleel made pier ganeston pryuy sonne forswere londe englond ¶ capitulum 41 kynge edward deyd saynt thomas day translacion side carleel burgh vpon sond yere kyngedome fyue thyrtty ¶ robert archebisshop caunterbury exyled sawe deth slepe rome fyrst edward sonne kyng second edward conquest anone home ageyne leef pyers ganeston yaf ducherye cornewayle made hym wardeyn englond whyle aboute owne maryage yonde see boloyn wedded ysabel doughter phelyp kynge fraunce cam then ageyne crowned kyng westmynstre sondaye quinquagesima day fourtenyght alleluya closed crowned bisshop wynchestre auctoryte pope clemente robert archebisshop caunterbury tyme rome exyled oute englond edward fayre body grete strengthe vnstydfast maners thewes yf men shal trowe comyn tale forsoke company lordes drewe hym harlottes syngars gestours carter deluers dykers rower bote men ship men craftes yaf hym grete drynkyng wolde lyghtly telle oute pryuy counseyll smyte men aboute hym wel lyght trespaas dyde mennes counseyll owne large yeftes solempnel makyng festes redy speke varyaunt deedes vnhappy ageynste enemyes cruel meyne loued strongly one whistrers dyde hym grete reuerence worship made hym grete ryche doyng fyll vylony louyer euyll speche bakbytyng leef sklaundre peple harme dammage royamme auaunced state hooly chirche hem vnable vnworthy afterward stake eye spere syde tyme soo grete derth whete continual moreyn beestes none suche seen byfore tyme dymes alwey gadred contribucions payed spirituale temporale alwey pylled suffraunce pope coloure wythstonde scottes moche good fyll kynges encheytes kynges outrage wasted spente ydel one poynt kyng happed wel wale neuer rebell ageynst hym sydes hym myshapped alwey begynnyng loued pier ganeston bifore forswore company faders heeste sente hym ageyne beyonde see cause hym recheles ysabel quene rought lordes lande therfore lordes indignacion putte oute pier ouer see yrlond kynges tresoure rabbyshly wasted spente yet hope pee pyers brought ageyne kynges tresour wasted spente byfore lordes aroos putte pyers kyng toke horse ii tresour northumberlond chacyd pyers besyeged hym castel scardburgh toke hym smote heede gaueressyche side warwyck whanne pyers dede yet kynge vsyd old maners drewe men therfor robert archebisshop caunterbury made solemynel counseyll prouynce ordeyned many noble statute helpe royamme kynge sworne holde ordenaunces robert archebisshop yaf blessynge al wolde hem holde curse wolde hem breke alweye kyng drewe fautours dyde promysed therfor grete speche among comyns grutchyng emong grete ayenst kyng ¶ hem nygh kynge ¶ specially robert archebisshop thomas erle lancastre confort robert fonded hym many yere wythstonde kynges nycete till yelde vp brethe stryf last ende • ordes ageynst kynges wyl pyers ganeston exyled irlond yere aboute natyuyte oure lady 〈◊〉 sente ageyne kyng came ageynst ch •• tre aboute midwinter pyers exiled flaundres aboute candelmasse sente ageyne ageinst hir wille kyng lefte castel scardburgh lordes besyeged toke brought dadynton slewe besides warwick ¶pyers heeded • gan • ressiche vpon daye saynt gernacius prothacius yere saint brices daye kinges eldest sonne thyrd edward conquest borne windesore tharchebisshop winchestre deide mayster thomas cob •• chosen awel noble clerke instaunce kyng put translated wyrceire waltre reynald kynges tresorer made archebisshop ¶ sone therafter kyng wente scotland grete boost grete aray 〈…〉 shamely ouercome saynt io • an day gentilmen slayn taken tresour lost somme threw awey wepen toke socour flyght herafter twelue yere contynuelly whyle kyng regned north countreys englond destroyed scottes edward le bruys robert le bruys brother wente irlonde wynne londe· fourth yere therafter slayne saynt calyxtes day ¶ also yere aboute mychelmasse knyght lancastreshyre moeued werre ageynst owne lorde thomas erle lancastre aboute martynmesse • ken beded ¶capitulum 42 fourth clement two twentyest iohan pope aboute eyghtene yere renewyd seuen bokes decretales auaunced clerkes ordeyned general studyes lore thre langages hebrue grue· latyn fyrst bycause hit shold seme hated takyng yeftes dampned pluralyte benefyces soo euery creatuure sholde hold hym appayd one benefyce cure pope shold haue fruytes benefyces voyded long tyme yeres ¶ also reserued hym self fyrst benefyce voyded deth resygnacion translacion soo personne institute shold chese whether wold haue taxe benefyce ouerpluys cautel come huge tresour pope hande ¶ duc bauaria clepyd hym self emperour werryd ofte ageynst hym bare hym doune alwey ¶ also yere greete deth men beestes greete fallyng reyne somer heruest therof cam grete derth corn • quarter whete sold fourty shillyngys ¶ wryter hyghte iohn catte homely hym aboute pentecost oxenford iohn sayde openly heyr englond therfor northampton byfore kyng lordes preued fals hanged drawen ¶ yere twey cardynals come englond cursyd robert le bruys fautours enterdyted scotland kynge edward fauoured twey spenser hugh fader hugh sonne ageynste wyll lordes therfor thomas erle lancastre many withdrewe soo kynges strengthe soo made hem colour assent kyng exyled spenser threwe doune castels wale ladde awey beestes gadred tresour occupyed gloucestre wynter tyme sone therafter withoute counseyll men king sente ageyne eyther hughe wreth stryf encreaced day day among al twey lordes de mortimer toke hastely cytees marche er erle lancastre myghte redy pursued kynges knyghtes till kyng come aboute shrowesbury vppon hem grete multitude fote men defaute money cause therle lancastre long behynde knyghtes wente awey two mortyners must nedes yelde hem soo dyde prysoned london kyng wente gloucestre hym then eyther spenser wente lyche feld aboute saynt chedde day take erles lancastre fautours tutbury burton kyng passed waterr toun afoorde erle lancastre men fled oute toune burton cyte burghbrydge cam andrew herkeley kynges syde slewe erle herford ryght vpon brydge syxtenth day byfore apryll toke erle lancastre many noble men dele hem dyuers place hanged throte erle byheded castel poūfret tenth day byfore apryl· erle dedes ofte grete stryfe among comyn people whether shold acounced amonge sayntes noo somme sayde yes dyde many almes dedes worshiped men relygyon mayntened trewe quarel semed lyues ende also enemyes dured afterward whyle deyde shameful deth seyn contrary tellyn husbond man rought wyf defouled grete multitude gentil wymmen wēches yf ony man offended hym lytel lete hym sle anon apostatas euill doer fauoured strongly sholde punisshed lawe· also wolde commytte alle doynges one secretaryes doo wolde ¶ also fled shamely tyme fightyng right vnto deth suche one sholde acounted saynt namely whyle le take slayne maugre trethe offrynges likynes myracles ben done place •• • yssue shal take shall knowen tyme tyme syx • h yere fortune spencer beganne encreace condicion quene drough̄ toward seruage till kyng fraunce pursued hugely kyng englond hommage gascoyne done ¶ ascencion oure lord kyng helde parlemente yorke made hugh spenser elder erle wynchestre andrewe harkley erle carleell yere aboute lammasse kyng wente scotlond though none withstandyng yet loste many men sekenesse honger ¶ aboute natyuyte oure lady kyng cam homewarde ageyne scottes come hym toke castell norham· afterward aboute saynt luke tyde abbay bella lauda vpon blakhammor hadde nyghe take kyng mete yf fledde toke erle rychemond kynges tresour lost th • yere morow saynt chaddes day andrew harkeley taken carleel traytour hanged drawen heded bowel brente quartred heede set • e vppon london brygge ¶ lammasse rogyer mortimer yonger prisonne escaped oute toure london slepyng drynke wardeynes hadde dronke aboute mydlente make pee quene englond sente brother kyng fraunce assaylled grete dele gaskoyn ¶ aboute natyuyte lady kyng sente sonne edward fraunce kynge fraunce homage ducherye guyan yeuen hym kyng fraunce made hym abyde moder coūte pontyeu moder sone dwellyd soo yonde see wold come ageyne durst drede spenser ¶ thenne kyng englond counseil twey spenser outlawed banysshed wyf sonne openly london cheepe traytours royamme ¶ capitulum 43 yere aboute mychelmasse quene englond sonne edward rogyer mortymer escaped oute tour london cam englond lytel strengthe henewers londed estsex wente toward london kyng tyme wonder lond still aboute withoute noyse shedyng blood kyng fledde oute london west wale folowyd hym easyly foote pa tyme morow saynt calyxtes daye counseylle bourgeys london kynges tresorer bisshop excetre heded withoute north dore saynt poules chirche morowe toure london take bourgeys london helpe quene hyr sonne sone therafter saynt symons euen iude quene men toke castel brystow hugh spenser elder hanged drawen heede sente wynchestre yere saynt hughes day erle arundell take in· countray shrowesbury heded herford weke kynge englond take castel neth west wale putte warde castel kenelworth ¶ hugh spencer yonger take kynge drawen herford byheded quartred hede sent london bridge also yere octaues twelue day made parlement london comyn ordenaunce solempne messagers sente kyng prysonne thre bisshops thre erles twey baron twey abbottes twey iustyces resygne kynge warde hommage made hym somtyme wolde lenger haue hym theyr lord one hem syre william trussel knyght procuratour alle parlemente spake kyng name sayde wordes ¶ william trussel name men lond englond alle parlement procuratour resygne edwarde homage made somtyme tyme forthward dyffye pryue ryall power shal neuer tendaunt kynge tyme also openly cryed london yere candelmasse euen edward kynges sonne made knyght ¶ capitulum 44 edwardes sone thyrd edward conquest yōg childe fyftene yere old vnderward yet lyuynge fader crowned kyng
