westmynstre candelmasse daye ¶ begynnyng come forth gracious happes fortune ¶ thenne erthe toke plente eyer temprure see quyete pe • hooly chirche fredome· thyrdde daye apryl old kynge brought oute castel kenelworth castel barkley ther many mē conspyred helpe delyueraunce deyd feste saynt mathew ewangelyste lyuyng dedes yet stryf among peple somtyme thomas lancastre whether shold acounted among sayntes noo nother prysonement nother persecucion greues preueth man saynt holynesse rather lyf acorde therto suche ben indiffrent good euyl euer synful man fayr grace suche peynes contricion done awey synnes lassen peynes purgatorye though make hym flee anone heuene withoute ony payne purgatory presumpcion pryde euyll men synfull trusteth hopeth ydel suche sholde haue payne purgatory also lykyng wylle wyues haue wende aboute make tydynges sprynge sprede hugely suche worshipynge till byldyng vpon suche vnsyker groū de begynne slyde parlemente wynchestre edmond wodestok heded conspyred ageynste kynge sayd ¶ forsayd edmond kynges eme erle kent syxtenth day byfore iuyn thyrd kyng edward conquest eldest sonne edward borne wyf quene erles doughter henaud ¶ also yere morow saynt luke daye rogyer mortimer made men clepe hym erle marche taken notyngham sente london dome af parlemente hanged drawen saynt andrew euen ¶ lammasse edward de bayllol somtyme kyng scotland entred scotland recouer kyngdome lytel strengthe englysshe men vnnethe two thousand slewe syxty thousand scottes gledesmore kynge englond • ome hel̄pe kyng scotland besyeged barwyck twellyfth day iuyll ¶william de reth scottiss • e knyght promysed th • kynge wolde certayne day brynge hoost scottes fyght hym remeue syege yf soo dyde wolde yelde kynge cyte berwyk mene tyme scottes brente northumberlond traytours shold besyeged castel banburgh ther laye quene englond yf myght wyse br • ke syege barwyk ¶ thenne day sette seuententh day byfore lammasse anon full see scottes cam ageynste englysshmen thre bataylles foote vngyrd place fast barwyk called bothhull besydes halydon ¶englysshe archer bete doune scottes horsmen pursued hem chaced hem till nyghte soo dede scottes eyght erles thousand thre honhonderd horsmen men fyue thyrtty thousand whanne seen barwyk yolden vp kyng englond ¶and wonder telle none deede englysshe mennes sydes knyght squyer twelue foote men feeste geruasius prothasius edward le bayllol verry kynge scotland dyde homage royamme scotland edward kyng englond castel vppon tyne presence thre bisshops erles baron grete multitude peple soone therafter scottes rebell ¶ therfore cold wynter kyng englonde wente galweye destroyed countraye vnto scottisshe see repayred castel rokesburgh socoured hym men alle wynter tyme two twentyest pope iohan deyd aduente lorde anone weke twelueste benet made pope fyrse monk thenne abbot whyte monkes thenne bisshop owne dyosyce cardynal att last pope ¶ anone made constitucions relygyous men dyuerse ordres touchynge rule ordres ¶ aboute saynt gregoryes day lente kynge edward ful parl̄emente london made ducherye erldome cornewayle yafe eldest sonne edward erldome chestre yet therto ¶also ordeyned fyue erles one derby another northampton thyrdde huntyngdon fourth salesbury fyfthe gloucestre ¶ grete stryf fyll bytwene kynges englond fraunce kynge fraunce bad wrongfully gaskoyne many londes tounes therfore kynge englond profered kyng fraunce many fayre proferes meke wolde haue londes ageyne al nought kynge gadred money euery syde arayde hym passe see aboute saynt margarets daye kyng edward passed flaundres went then coloyn socyed hym emperour benarrus brabans flemyngys coūseil hem medled armes fraunce among owne armes brente destroyed north coūtrayes fraūce vn tournay candelmasse kyng edward cam englond ageyn wif childeren gete syde lefte hem andwerp braband surete comyng ageyn made parlement lōdon ordeined nedes chargid englisshmē tribute fyfthe parte good catayll men wolle nynthe scheef euery glebe englond ordeygned owne iourneyes made lordes nexte townes aboute answere hym prouffyte come therof also yere soo grete scarsyte moneye plente thynges men solde quarter whete london twey schyllynges fatte oxe half mark kynge edward tokē see toward flaundres two honderd shippes saynt iohans baptiste euen coost flaundres mette grete nauey fraunce strongly arayd therfor day auysed hym men beste rede morowe hym cam helpe noble knyght robert moreleye north nauey englond stronge bataylle see suche bataylle neuer sene costes englond goddes helpe fauour frensshe men norman sharpely shoten sōme slayne stroke somme drowned owne good wyll somme take shippes also oute take fewe fledde awey fast myghte ¶ thenne kyng englond cam flaundres grete hoost destroyed northsyde fraunce besyeged strong cyte tourneye somwhat tyme atte last defaulte moneye slowe procuratours sente hym oute englonde trewes take bytwene kynges eyther syde soo eyther wente wey kyng edward naueye wente lytel brytayne loste many men vnholsomme meete drynke ¶ twey cardynals sente pope made true take bytwene kynges thre yere whiche tyme ryght kynge englonde chalengyd royamme fraunce myght declared atte full comyng ageyne oute brytayne kyng edward grete dysese tempest see ¶and men sayde kynge fraunces reygromancers hadde made tempest ¶pope benette deyde archebisshop rom pope hym cleped syxt clement man grete clergy grete wastour spender yaf cardinal dignitees holy chirch voided englond fonded put therfor tytles englonde therfor kynge englond wroth yere lord thre honderd four fourty kyng fordyde prouysyons pope graūted bad man shold tyme brynge suche prouisions vppon peyne prisonnemente lesynge heede ¶ feste translacion saynt thomas caunterbury kynge edwarde toke see vnwyttynge men whether wold wende ledynge knyght harecourt somtyme outlawed oute fraunce kyng londed hoggys bysydes ryuer seyn south syde normandy spoylled cadony cytees men made full ryche kynge fraunce broke brydges ryuers euery syde hoostes shold come geders fyght ther kynge edwarde roode normandye toke prayes euery syde ¶ saynt rufus daye martir saynt austyn dectours euen seuen twentyest day lammasse monethe cressy pycardy kynge edward gloryously ouercome kyng fraunce· chaced hym slewe twey kynges boheme mayorck duk lotheryng twey bisshops eyght erles many noble lordes two thousand knyghtes men withoute nombre chaced peple fl • dde awey alyue ¶there phelyp kynge fraunce wounded thyghe throte twyes vnhorsed kynge englond sayd escaped aweye vnnethe ¶ • erafter kyng engl̄ond besyeged caleys twelue monethes cal̄eys somtyme grete enemye englysshe men ¶that yere morow mychelmasse day monte tumba seuententh day octobre englyssh men specially dyosyce york seculeres rugulers bete doune scottes come entycyng kynge fraunce vnto durham dauyd bruys kynge scotland william douglas grete lordes take dede chaced ¶ aboute saynt bartholomeus feste phelyp kyng fraunce arayed hym fyghte namely breke siege caleys fledde awey pryuely dawnyng left tentes greete dele vytayls therin men caleys saw yelded vp cyte kyng edward kyng edward moneth ordeined cal̄eys wente englond ageyne aboute mychelmasse graunted trewes nyne monethes instaunce pope somtyme comyng lytel brytayne tyme greete tempeste see loste therby many noble knyghtes therfore kyng edwarde made wonderfull compleynt sayde good lady saynt marye hit bodeth wendyng fraunce haue wynde weder al thyng wylle comynge ageyne toward englond haue tempest many hard happes yere fylle grete reyne feste natyuyte saynt iohan dured till mydwynter next therafter soo vnnethe passed ony day rayned day nyght tyme fyll grete deth men world wyde bygan landes oute southeest side soo vnnethe lefte half people alyue somme hous relygyon twenty lefte tweyne syxthe pope clement dyed saynt nycholas day anon pope cheef penitancer steuen bisshop hostiensis chose pope cleped sixth innocent also yere byganne grete derth thynges shold solde soo sale thynges double pryce wonte ¶also see lande byganne wex bareyn byfore ¶ yere acorded sworne bytwene kynges englonde fraunce oute take kynges seeles sette indenture wryten acorde kyng englond shold haue alle londes ducherye guyan taken hym byfore kynge fraunce soo kyng englond sholde leue resygne vp kyng fraūce right clayme royamme fraunce vpon doyng solempnel messagers sente kynges half englond ¶ henry noble duk lancastre henry erle arū del mychel northburgh bisshop london guy de bryan sente pope courte haue couenauntes recorded pope bulles sodayne fraude fraunce assente pope couenauntes put vndoo therfore englonde arayeth fyghte rekeuer wynne landes take wrong kyng englond entred fraunce grete strength knyghtes herde telle barwyk take cam ageyne delyuerd barwyk power scottes ¶ yere greete drought geder thre monethes apryl may iuyn vnnethe fyll drope reyne doune erth fryday whi • sonweke twey freres ordre menours brente auinion somme fals oppynyons semed pope cardynals yere natiuite lady king englonds eldest sone edward sailed gascoyn many men armes archer recouer wynne landes ducherye guyan kynge fraū ce long tyme wrongfully withholde edward dwellyd yere withoute ony rees enemyes mene tyme toke bete doune spoylled brente huge cytees rebelle ageynst hym narbon carcason ende yere comynge one twen day moneth septembre whyle duc lancastre besyeged cyte breuens brytayne edward passed brynkes ryuer l • yr ducherye guyan cam kyng fraunce grete hooste fought hym kynges men fraunce slayne chased kyng fraunce take brought burdeaus gascoyne till whitsontyde yere aboute whitsontyde forsayd edward sayled oute gaskoyn englond iohan kyng frensshe men anone pope sente twey cardynals englond trete pee bytwene twey kynges cardynals dwellyd englonde full yere thyrdde cardynal come owne hede comfort kynge fraunce dwellyd cardynals london ¶ also yere yere oure lord thousand thre honderd seuen fyfty aboute al halowen tyde dauyd le bruys kyng scotlond deliuerd hadde long tyme warde enleuen yere castel odyham payed grete raunsonne also yere court rome beganne grete stryf bytwene primate armacan freres beggers also yere grete destruction britayne normandy phelip kynges broder nauerne sire iames pipe robert knolles many englisshe men withoute de withoute warraunt kinge englond yere bo ute assumpcion oure ladye edward kinge englond eldest sonne edwarde prince wale duck lancastre neighe alle lordes englond grete hooste horsmen archer gadred aboute thousand chariottes dwellyd somwhat long time sandwich̄ aboute michelmasse nexte therafter forsaide duk sailed caleys kyng prynce sayled place candelmasse bygnnae anone ryde royam fraunce lay feelde burgoyn chā payne annunciacion lady mene tyme norman landed wynchelsee lytel nauey englond fytenthe day marche assaylled toune slewe men brente somme toune many see theues slayne drowned part see theues fledde theyr shippes wente oute englond compellyd abbot bataylle strength hym ¶ yere aboute saynt dunstans feest edward kyng englond toke true kyng fraunce hope pee cam hoost ageyn englonde lost many men horse charyottes besydes parys xviij day eester storme weder fyll tyme aboute lammasse nexte therafter armacan ordre beggers stryf bytwene hem ceessyd heeste pope also tyme prynce wale duc lancastre many lordes englond kyng fraunce wente caleys reforme pee bytwene englond fraunce pee reformed assured surete oth eyther syde kynges englond fraū ce wente home ageyne owne kyngdoms aboute mychelmasse sone therafter messagers sente auinion pope conferme pee couenauntes eyther syde god thanked al dedes translacion ended thursdaye eyghtenthe daye apryll yere lord thousand thre honderd lvij xxxj yere kyng edward thyrd conquest englond yere lordes age syr thomas lord berkley made make translacion fyue thyrtty thus endeth book named proloconycon made compiled ranulph monk chestre whiche ordeyned latyn atte request ryght worshipful lord thomas lord berkeley translated englisshe one treuisa thenne vycarye paryssh barkley moche syth accomplysshemente sayd booke made sayd ranulph ended yere oure lord ccc lvij many thynges haue fallen whiche ben requysyte added werke cause mennes wyttes tyme ben oblyuyous lyghtly forgeten many thyngys dygne putte memorye also founden dayes fewe wryte theyr regystres suche thynges dayly happen falle· therfore william caxton symple persone haue endeuoyred wryte fyrst ouer sayd book proloconycon som haue chaunged rude old englyssh̄ wete certayn wordes dayes neither vsyd ne vnderstanden furthermore haue put emprynte thende maye mater therin cōprised knowen boke general touchyng shortly many notable mater also auysed make another booke sayd werke whiche shal sett shal haue chapytres table parte dar presume sette booke ne ioyne hit dyuerse cause one moche haue ne gete bokes auctoryte treatyng suche cronykes except lytel boke named fasciculus temporum another callyd aureus de vniuerso whiche bookes fynde ryght lytel mater syth sayde tyme ¶ another cause moche rude symplenesse ignorant makyng ought compared set ne ioyned boke thenne shal grace god set werke parte accomplysshe yeres syth fynysshed book vnto yere lord cccc lx fyrst yere regne kyng edward fourthe whiche amoūte honderd thre yere ¶ incipit liber vltimus thenne folowyng fore wreton booke prolicronycon haue emprysed ordeyne newe booke suffraunce almyghty god contynue sayd werk bryefly sette hystoriall thynges suche haue conne gete tyme lefte yere oure lord thousand thre honderde seuen • yfty vnto yere sayd lord thousand four honderd syxty fyrst yereof regne kynge edward fourth ¶ capitulum primum yere oure lord thousand thre honderd eyght fyfty october robert knolles capytayne greete companye englysshe men helde wonne many forttesses fraunce orleaunce b • ytayne normandye monethe lefte garnysons cam fore parys toke stronge place named amblanullers parys sente men warre ageynste anone ouerthrowen beten toune ageyn dayly assaylled frensshmen vn yates parys helde parys soo strayte atte laste constreyned bye place hym yeue hym large moneye departe destroyed many place champayne marche aft • r toke cyte anserre castel whiche pryse made thre knyghtes saye robert knolles tomelyn fouque another whiche thre capytaynes grete foyson englysshmen pylled toune which̄ ryche sayd hadde moche good iewellys valewyd fyue honderde thousand motons golde raunsonne prysonners synguler personnes ouer grete somme ¶ whan englysshmen seen lordes toune pylled viij dayes said wold brenne toun left dwelling toun agreeed gyue saue fourty thousand motons golde syxty perles valewyd ten thousande motons golde englysshemen sholde bere aweye aboue moche goode wold excepte iewellys chirche saynt germayn whiche shold haue pledge theyr payemente vnto mydsomer wally sholde breke doune brenne gate soo dyde yere oure lorde thousande thre honderd syxty fyue thyrtty yere regne kynge edward thirde pee fynysshed acorded bytwene bothe kynges af fraunce englonde afore sayd al halowen tyde bothe two kynges metten geder caleys bothe theyr counseyls shewyd artycles condicions pee acorde whiche partyes agreed promysed obserue kepe forthwith songe solempne masse thyrdde agnus dei vppon goddes bodye also myssal • bothe kynges sonnes grettest lordes royames beyng tho presente swore holde obserue kepe sayd pee acorde alle couenauntes ordeyned bytwene hem ¶aboute tyme saynt brygytte hooly wydowe royamme swethen many reuelacions bee enformed vnto alle thastate chirche instytued foū ded ordre newe woman men wherof patrones feste kepte two twentyest day iuyll yere grete sodayne tempestes strong lyghtnynge thondrynge whiche howsynge b •• stes tree perysshed deuyl appered maunys lykenesse moche peple dyuerse place spak hem also dyuerse place worlde erthe quaues soo moche basyle cyte fylle doune many castels aboute hit ¶ tyme men dwellyd woodes beestes durste entre cytees ¶ tyme many bataylles pestylence honger many place also dyuerse place erthe caste oute whyte water stynkynge whiche ouerthrewe made falle castels stronge place many place worlde ¶ yere feste conuersion saynt poule kynge edward helde parlamente westmynstre whiche shewyd pee acorde made bytwene two kynges item yere ascencion euen seen eclypse sonne wherupon fyll grete droughte defaute rayn fyll grete derth corne heye ¶ also yere monethe fylle rayne burgoyne almoost lyke blood crosse almoost reede seen ayer also tyme seen fraunce englond many place appyere two castels oute whiche yssued oute two hoostes armed men one clothed whyte black whanne bataylle bygonne bytwene white ouercome black soone black ouercome whyte thenne retourned theyr castels soo vanysshed aweye yere huge pestylence yere deyde syre harry duck lancastre ¶ yere edward prynce wale maryed coūtesse kente syr thomas holandes wyf whiche somtyme dyuorsed fro erle salysbury cause knyght ¶ aboute tyme grete company dyuerse nacions assemblyd theym gyder whome gouernours leders englysshmen whiche dyde moche harme fraunce anone aroos another companye dyuerse nacions callyd whyte companye whiche countrayes lombardy dyde moche harme ¶ yere syre iohan gaunt sone kynge edward thyrdde made duk lancastre hys wyf doughter heyr henry duk lancastre deyde ¶also yere grete wynde ouerthrewe house tree many steple englond ¶ item yere kynge edward made syre leonel sonne duc clarence edmond sonne erle cambrydge yere ordeyned parlament men lāwe shold plete theyr moder tongue ¶in yere cam englond kynges fraunce cypre scotland whiche worshipfully receyued ben long tyme two hem wente theyr countrayes ageyne ¶but kynge fraunce grete sekenesse abode stylle englond ¶sequitur capitulum secundum ¶ capitulum secundum yere huge froste lastyng fro saynt andrew tyde vnto fourtenthe kalendas apryll yere ther scoler whiche slepte contynuelly terme seuen yere lubyke awoke lyued long tyme ¶also yere grete batayll kytwene syre iohan mountford duc brytayne syre charles de bloys vyctorye fylle syre iohan thurgh helpe socoure englysshmen yere deyde maner sauoye kynge iohan fraunce ¶ caryed saynt denys fraūce bury • innocent fyfth vrban pope eyght yere abbot massylyen̄ saynt benettes ordre doctour decree reputed hooly man made preched grete pardon warre ageynst turkes vnto seint brygytta sente cryst confermacion rule ordre atte last poysoned deyde yere seynt katheryn senys floures hooly vyrgyn ordre frere prechours stygmates handes feete side whiche deyde yere lord ccc four score ¶ yere ordeyned peter pen thē • forth sholde payd whiche old tyme graunted contynuynge scole rome yere borne bourdeux rychard prynce edwardys sonne whiche deth fader kyng edward also crowned kyng enleuenthe yere age ryght lygne assent al comunes royame yere fyl grete variaūce spayn grete warre bytwene peter ryghtful kyng spayne henry bastarde broder soo moche kynge peter cam prynce edward bourdeux axe socour helpe hym whome grete compassion pyte lycence kyng edward fader pourueyed ayde helpe ¶ tyme seen thre dayes duryng scottyssh see two egles one comyng south north fought fyersly geder south fyrst scomfyted north egle fled home ageyne costys anon seen many sterrys gadred geder one hepe fyl doun therth leming fire lemes man lightnynges who flame brente men clothes heris walkyng groūd yere prince edward duk lācastre broder gre • e armee wente spayn batayll nazers ageynst syre harry bastard whiche putte doune kynge peter wan bataylle vyctorye put bastard men flyght slayne syx thousand bastardes partye two thousande prysonners taken whome erle dene syre bertram claykyn many lordes prysoners noble prynce edward restored sayd kyng peter royamme ageyne yere seen blasyng sterre named cometa bytwene north south bemes toward fraunce yere sir leonel kynge edwardes sone duc clarence wente melane maryed doughter galoys natyuyte oure lady deyde yere bastard spayne reentryd ageyne slewe kyng peter two twentyest day august ¶ yere frensshmen brake pee rydyng guyan pontiew takynge castels tounes surmysynge englysshe men subtylly vntruly cause brekynge pee ¶ yere deyde duchesse lancastre buryed powlys london ¶ capitulum tercium yere xliiij kynge greete pestylence greete moreyn beestes fylle soo grete water caused greete destruction corne soo moche nexte yere folowyng busshel whete worth thre schyllyngys foure pen laste day may holden parlemente westmynstre brekynge pee frensshmen wronges myght redressyd auē gyd sayd yere thassumpcion oure lady deyde quene phil̄yp buryed westmynstre ¶ mydsomer yere duc lancastre erle herford grete companye men warre wente ouer see toward fraū ce chalkhylle bytwene saynt omers guynes huge hooste frensshmen hoost englysshe men fast whiche hadde long leyn dyuerse englysshe men yaf counseyll fyght frensshmen lordes capitayns wold anone happed therle warwyck come thyderward whanne frensshemen h •• de comynge er cam fully londe th • lefte theyr tentes pauylons theyr vytayl fledde theyr weye whan therle londed hasted toward normandy comyng ageyne toward caleys deyde pestyl • nce yere mydsomer made hooste syre robert knollys made gouernour whanne cam fraunce longe helde hem geder frensshmen durst come neygh atte last enuye couetyse among discorded sundryd dyuerse companyes whiche couraged frensshmen soo moche cam frely englysshmen parte toke slewe hem ¶ yere pope vrban cam fro rome auynyon purposynge haue made fynal pee bytwene englond fraunce er beganne traytye deyde somme saye poysoned ¶ vrban enleuenthe gregory pope eyght yere pope callyd fore petrus de bello forte deken cardynol deyde rome goddes pee ¶ hym folowed grete trybulacion chirche whiche god sh • wyd • eu • lacion saynt brygytte synnes men chirche yere prynce edward beynge burdeux thauys counseyl byganne sette inp • sicions tax vp duchye guyan wherfore cyte lymoge reb • llyd fought ageynst hym moo also • rned hym frensshe kynge wherfore toke destroyed cyte slough al therynne ¶sone prynce edward cam englonde leuynge behynde hym gascoyne duck lancastre syre edmond erle cambrydge worthy men armes ¶ parlement westmynstre graunted kynge subsydye fyfty thousand pound payd laye fee thenne hatered men chirche lordes putte oute offyce chaū celer tresorer pryue seal theyr stede putte seculer men ¶ eyght fourtyest yere regne kynge edward duk lancastre erle cambrydge kynges sone cam oute guyan englond maryed two susters doughters heyres kynge peter spayne ¶that yere frensshe men yeged rochel ¶wherfore •• e erle penbroke sente gascoyn greete company men armes er couthe entre hauen rochel ther cam vppon hem stronge nauye spayne whiche scomfyted englysshe men toke erle grete tresour many noble men thenne kynge grete hoost entryd see haue reuē ged siege rochel wynde wold serue hym wherfore taryed longe see cost abydynge good wynde cam soo retourned home ageyne thenne duc lancastre grete hoost wente flaū dees passyd thurgh pycardye parys soo thurgh alle fraunce till cam burdeux withoute ony resystence aboute tyme wenzelaus sone charles kyng boheme fader yet lyuyng electe chosen emperour beyng childe whiche empyre toke none heede ne rought wherfore regned four twenty yere many warnynges deposed lecherous lyf defoul • hys noble wytte ende withoute worshippe neuer crowned dyademe yere sent fro pore two bisshops one rauēne one carpentras treate bytwene two kynges fraūce englond day holden brugys flaūdres ther kyng englond duc lancastre bisshop london many frensshe kynge duc burgoyne broder bisshop amyens many concluded thyng ¶ capitulum quartum fyftyest yere kynge edwardes regne trynyte sondaye yere eyghte daye iuyn deyde noble prynce edward kenyngton brought westmestre wher obsequye fro then caryed caunterburye worshipfully beryed besyde saynt thomas shryne aboute tyme bartholus baldus greete doctours lawe floures deth pope gregory xj began worst scysme euer chirche whiche dured xl yere rome vrban syxthe chosen force strength romaynes dyde cardynals drede ageynste theyr entente wyll therfore fledde cyte fundorum saynge hym pope chose place robertum de gebennis yere whiche named seuenth clement thus beganne scysme fyfthe yere mayre london adam stable dyscharged xxj day marche nicholas brembre chosen vertu lettre cam kyng yere grete parlemente westmynstre whiche kynge axyd grete subsydye commynes answerd myght lenger bere suche charge sayde knewe wel kynge good ynowgh hym self sauyng royame yf royamme well gouerned hadde longe euyl ruled euyl offycers londe myght plentiuous chaffare marchaūdyse ne ryches shewyd many complayntes dyusers officer royamme namely lord latemer kynges chā berlayn dame alyce pyers grete wronges mysgouernaunce done theyr counseylle desyrynge sholde remeuyd putte theyr stede suche wyse true wel proued good gouernaunce soo amonge chees syre pyers delamare wyse knyght eloquent speker commynes cause syre pyers tolde publysshed trouthe rehersynge wronges dyuerse personnes kynges hous anone deth good prynce edward putte p • rpetuel prysonne ¶ yere anone candelmasse durynge sayd parlement subsydye graunted kynge bothe clergye temporalyt • saye temporalyte euery persone passynge fourten yere age shold haue four pen except p • ure beggers euery man hooly chirche benefyced promoted twelue pen vnpromoted foure pen excepte four ordres freres ¶ rychard prynce edwardys sonne made prynce wale hym kynge gafe ducherye cornewayle erldome chestre ¶in lij yere kynge edwardes regne xj kalendys iuyn sayd kynge edward deyde maner shene then brought westmynstre buryed worshipfully atte southe syde saynt edwardes shryne whoos soule god haue mercy amen ¶ capitulum 5 kyng edward thyrd regned rychard second noble prynce edwardes sone wale kyng rychard borne bourdeux crouned westmestre enleuenth yere age ¶ second yere regne lord latemer syre rauf ferys stryuyng beyng debate syre robert hawle one shakley • erle dene theyr prysoner cam westmynstre chirch slough atte hye masse tyme sayd hawle shakle arestyd putte toure london sayd done commaundemente duc gloucetre wherfore cam assoylled westmynstre made greete amendes gafe grete gyftes iewellys therfore sayd chirche ¶ aboute tyme fest vysytacion lady bygonne pope vrban enleuenth forme also pardon yeuen feste sacramente whiche feste holden second daye iuyll ¶in tyme grete maystre rhodes entryd turquye grete companye grekes turkes discomfyted taken remenaunt peple deed taken fore castel callid sayette thyrdde yere regne cam certayne galeyes warre oute fraunce dyuerse portis englond robbed brente slue moche peple moche cam grauysende brente grete part toune yere ordeyned parlement westmynstre euery man woman past fourtene yere age shold paye talage four pen wherfor fyl afterward moch meschyef fourth yere regne comons aroos dyuerse partyes englond dyde moche harme callyd hurlyng tyme kente estsex made hem two capytayns callyd iac strawe watte tyler assembled blacheth corpus cristi day cam southwerk lete oute prysoners kynges benche marchal see cam london robbed alle alyens straungers sl • ughe made hauoke morne cam toure london kynge presente tyme toke oute archebisshop caunterbury pryour saynt iohans whyte frere confessour kyng smote theyr hedes atte tour hyll thenne come ageyne london slewe men lawe worthy men dyuerse partyes • une thenne wente duc lancastres place callyd sauoye destroyed doune bare 〈◊〉 goodes might fynde brente place thenne wente westmestre saynt martyns graunt delyuerd oute sayntuarye therynne ony maner grythe thenne cam temple alle innes men lawe despoylled brente theyr bookes thenne came london ageyne toke oute al prysonners felon oute newgate countours destroyed theyr bookes thēne monday kyng rychard sent mayr london william walworth alderman wente speke knowe thentencion thyse rebellous peple ¶ thenne iac strawe lete make oye felde peple shold come nere bere crye wyll thenne lo • de mayer alderman hauyng indignacion presumpcion couetyse mayer seenge dyd noo reuerence kynge starte hym slewe sayd iac straw capytayne rebellys anone hede smyten hede reysed vp myght see hit forthwith incontynēt alle tho rysers mysgouerned peple sledde awey thenne kyng forthwith dubbyd mayer knyght fyue bretheren alderman saye syr william walworth mayer syre nychol brambre syr iohan phylpet syre nychus twyford syre robert laundre syre robert gayton myght take gete thyse rebellys mysgouerned people henge hem vp ten twelue twenty c ¶ fyfth yere grete erth quaue thurgh oute al world one twentyest day maye whiche al maner peple sore aferd ¶ yere quene anne cam englond maryed vnto kyng richard westmynstre ¶ syxth yere syre henry spencer bisshop norwiche wente ouer see croysye flaundres gate townes grauenyng burburgh dunkyrke ther dyde lade one fyfty shippes p • llage goodes whiche sholde haue comen englond bisshop lete brenne shippes alle pyllage hauen grete batayl flemynges dunkyrke slayn huge multitude flemynges bisshop retenue wente besyeged ipre longe tyme couthe gete cause many men deyde flux cam ageyne englond ¶the yere bataylle done within kynges pala • westmynstre certayne poyntes treasonne bytwene syre iohan ansley knyght defendaunt garton squyer app • llaunt defendaunt discomfyted thappellaunt alle tyme dured scysme vrban rome chosen petrus de thomacellys named bonefacius nonu • 13 yere clemens chosen auynyon petrus de luna whiche named benedictus xiij abode p • pe two twenty yere boneface innocencius septimus two yere hym gregorius 129 xij yere hym alexander grecus one yere thēne hym iohannes visesimus tercius thenne counseyll constance chosen martinus quintus soo alle thyse forsayd pope gregorius vndecimus vnto martinus quintus endured scysme space fourty yere knowen vndoubted pope ¶ capitulum sextum eyght yere kyng rychardes regne syr edmond langely erle cambrydge kynges vncle wente portyngale grete companye men armes archer strengthyng helpyng kynge portyngale ageynst kynge spayne kynge portyngale vyctorye done erle cambrydge cam home ageyne armye englond yere kyng rychard helde crystemasse el • ham kyng e • monye tyme fledde oute owne londe • nd cam vnto kynge rychard socour ayde turkys deuoured destroyed moche londe kyng hauyn • grete pyte compassion grete meschyef toke coūseyl 〈◊〉 concluded kynge shold yeue hym good tauenture peple ferre grete ieopardye kyng gaf hym gold syluer many ryche yeftes betaught hym god soo departed oute englond yere kynge rychard grete puissaunt armee wente toward scotland scottys sente kynge desyred made grete laboure haue tryeus soo tryeus taken made thenne kyng retorned york syre iohan holand therle kentis broder slewe therlys sone stafford wherfore kyng sore meued retorned london ¶ nynthe yere regne parlement westmynstre whiche kynge made created two duke fyue erlys marquys syr edmond langely kynges vncle erle cambrydge made duc york ¶syre thomas wodestok vncle erle bokyngham made duc gloucetre syre leonel vere erle oxenford made marquys deuelyn harry bolyngbroke duke sonne lancastre made erle derby ¶ syre edward duke sone york made erle ruthlond syre iohan holond erle kentys broder made erle huntyngdon syr thomas monbray erle notyngham made erle marchal englond ¶ syre mychel de la pole knyght made erle suffolk chaunceler englond ¶ atte parlement therle marche proclamed heyre apparaūte crowne englond kynge rychard sayd erle marche wente ouer see irlond vnto lordship therldome vlster whiche hys enherytaunce lay tyme castel cam vppon hym greete multitude wylde irysshe men cam oute castell fyers • peple fought hem manly slayne ¶ tenth yere erle arondel went see greete nauye mette hoole flete comynge fro rochel laden wyn whiche enemyes goodes whiche flote toke brought dyuerse hauens englond somme vnto london men myght bye tonne rochel wyn twenty schyllynges ¶ enleuenth yere regne tharysyng certayn lordes englond destruction rebellys c saye syre thomas wodestok duk gloucetre syre rychard erle arundele syre richard erle warwyk syre harry bolyngbroke erle derby syre thomas monbray erle marchal fyue lordes vnderstode myschyef gouernaūce kynges counceylle wherfor tyme kynges coūseyll fled londe saye mayster alysaunder neuel archebisshop york syre mychel de la pole erle suffolk chaunceler englond marquys deuelyn syr robert le vere thre lordes cam neuer ageyne englond deyde beyonde see fyue lordes aboue sayd made parlemēt westmestre toke syre robert tresylyon iustyce syre nychol brembre knyght cyteseyne london syr iohan salesbury knyght vske sergeaunt moo whiche iuged deth drawe tyburn hanged also parlemente syre symon beuerley knyght garter syre iohan beauchamp knyght styward kynges hous syr iohan berneis byhedid atte toure hylle ¶ also robert bealknap iohan holte iohan cary william burgh robert fulthorp iohan lokton iustyses exyled irlond ther dwelle lyf tyme ¶in twellifth yere duryng sayd parleme • holden general iustys smythfelde lordes knyghtes squyers maner straungers wolde come holdyng 〈◊〉 housholde hem alle alle kyngys hous one sute thryr cotys theyr army theyr sheld • theyr trappours browdrid whyte hertis crownes gold theyr neckes cheynes gold hangyng theron whiche hertys kynges leuerey yaf lordes ladyes knyghtes squyers knowe houshold peple thenne four twenty ladres comynge iustys ladde four twenty lordes cheynes gold • le sute hertes fore sayd tour horsbak thurgh cyte london smythfeld feste cam many grete lordes straungers oute fraunce henaud holond countreyes whiche feste iustes endured four twenty dayes vppon kynges cost whanne feste ended iustys king thankyng straungers • aue grete yeftes thenne toke loue departed thirtenth yere bataille dene palays westmestre bitwene squyer nauerne kinge squyer callid iohan walssh pointes treasonne nauerne put vppon walssh ende nauerne ouercome disconfyted felde yelded hym anon despoylled armure drawen oute palays vnto tyburne hanged ¶ capitulum septimum fourtenthe yere sir iohan gaunt duk lancastre grete hooste wente spayne clayme chalenge ryght wyues tytle vnto crowne spayne hym duchesse wyf thre doughters therafter grete commynycacion herupon acorded concluded kynge spayne shold marye duck lancastres doughter shold yeue duck lancastre gold syluer whiche casten grete wedgys soo many iewellys moche eyght charyottis myghte carye euery yere durynge lyf duc wyf ten thousand marc gold whiche golde spayne sholde aduenture ieopardye therof brynge yerly vnto bayon duke assygnees surete made ¶ also duc lancastre dyde doo marye another doughters kyng portyngale tyme thenne retourned cam ageyne englond wyf ¶ yere turkes made grete warre ageynste crystendome vnto cyte iene wherfore iene wayes sente kynge fraunce ayde also kynge englond soo ther wente oute fraunce fyften honderd knyghtes duc borbon erle ewe ¶ oute englond wente erle alby valyaunt man certayne archer shipped marcellis wente besyeged thunes barbarye made many skarmuches putte oute ofte sarasyns thende turke fered made trewes seasonne delyuerd alle crysten prysonners payd ten thousand du • atis soo crysten men retorned hoome ageyne ¶ fyftenth yere kynge rychardes regne h • lde crystemas wodestok therle penbroke yonge lorde tendre age wolde lerne iuste knyght called syre iohan saynt iohan rode geder parke erle slayn knyghtes spere cast hym whanne hadde coped ¶this yere iohan hynde beynge tyme mayer london iohan shadeworth henry vanner shereues dysharged theyr offyces byfore saynt iohans day baptyst kyng seased fraunchyse lybertees cyte london ordeyned constitued syr edward dalyngredge wardeyn cyte endured offyce vnto fyrst day iuyll yere xvj ¶and thenne syr bowdwyn radyngton made wardeyue saynt symons daye iude cause ther baker man beryng basket hors brede fletestrete come man bisshop salesburyes toke oute hors loof oute baskette wherfore baker man stroue yoman soo bisshops man brake baker man heede thenne neyghbours come aboute haue rescowed hym haue arestyd bisshops man scope fro hem lordes place constable cam wold haue bad hym withynne place kept myght come thēne come mayer moche peple sayde wold haue hym oute brenne place therin bisshop beynge tresorer englonde archebisshop caunterbu • wente geder wyndesore kynge made grete complaynte kyng coū seylle cyte london kynge sen • e mayer shereues yaf hem grete rebuke thoffence hadde done ageynst hym offycers chambre london deposed mayer shereues māde wa • deyne cyte afore sayd syxtenth yere kyng drewe courtes westmynstre yorke whiche holden kepte fro feste saynt iohan baptyst vnto crystemasse thenne atte requeste goode quene anne bisshop london thēne callyd grauesende kyng graū ted fraunchyse lybertees cyte london london gaf seynt edward shryne table syluer enameled stondyng awter mayer alder men shereuys mette kyng submyttynge humbly hym ought resseyuyng kyng thurgh cyte grete tryumphe brought hym westmynstre morne mayer alderman shreues presentyng sayd table yeftes prayd kynge good speciall grace haue theyr lybertees fraunchyses hadde fore tyme soo kyng graunted alle theyr askynge wente home ageyne ¶ yere duc lancastre sente fraunce demaunde myllion scute whiche due raunson kyng iohan dyuerse place peytowe rochell parte guyan answerd counseylle fraunce men warre englond hadde done harme fraunce aboue trewes somme thre mylions whiche oughte repayred fyrst departed ageyne ¶ seuententhe yere come oute scotlande certayne lorde • englonde gete worship fete armes therle morryf chalengid erle marchal englonde iuste hym hors back sharpe speres soo roode geder certayne course full chalenge scottyssh erle caste bothe hors man two rybbes broken falle soo borne home inne anone caryed homewarde littyer york deide ¶ syre william darel banerer scotlande· syre pyers courtney kynges banerer englond ryden gyder certain course warre hitte assayed scottysshe knyght seyng myght haue beter yafe ouer wold noo chalenge ¶ thenne one cokburn squyer scotland syre nychol hauberk rode fyue coursys euery cours scot caste bothe hors man yere seuententh day iuyn deyde good qu • ne anne kynge rychardes wyf lyeth buryed westmynstre saynt edwardes shryne ¶ capitulum octauum yere 1494 trewes taken bytwene kyng fraunce kynge englonde foure yere also yere aboute crystemasse kynge rychard wente fyrst irlond wenzelaus rupertus alias robertus emperour nyne yere ¶ robertus duk bayer counte palatyn ryn iuste trewe man catholyke crowned nynthe boneface pope entryd ytalye grete armye ageynst duk galyace retorned grete losse ¶ tyme cursyd heresye iohan wyclyf englond iohan hus bohemye ierome praghe heresye enfected moch peple vnder habyte lambe hydynge woluysshe cruelte hadde purposed subuerte alle state chirche sklaunderous scysme whiche euyll tyme grete helpe ¶ also tyme heresyee adamitarum beganne growe boheme putt doune bussytys ouer grosse vnshamefast wente naked indyffrently dyde theyr lecherye wommen ¶ petrus de elyaco iohan gerson disciple doctours dyuynyte parys floures tyme· ¶ yere merueyllous grete wyndes thre monethes contynuelly specially september ouerthrewe greete tree fruyte howses chymeneyes steples ther seen langedok fraunce grete sterre fyue lytell sterres assayllynge grete poursyewed space houre voys cryeng fro heuene· seen man semyng copper holdyng spere bandes greete sterre smote hit seen ¶ place herde noyse harneysed men fyghtynge ¶in nynetenthe yere kyng rychard wente calays maryed quene isabel kynges doughter fraunce· whiche tyme frensshe lordes sworen booke alle couenauntes forwardys composicions ordeyned made sydes shold truly holden kept withoute contradiction dylaye ony maner wyse whanne ryal maryage done fynysshed kynge rychard dame isabel quene cam englond mayer london bretheren grete multitude comons cyte craftys resseyued hem worshipfully atte blacheth brought hem saynt george barre takynge theyr l • ue· kynge quene roode kenyngton ¶and withynne whyle quene cam toure london whoos comyng moche harme done london brydge nyne personnes crowded deth whome pryour typtre one tour wente thurgh cyte london westmynstre crowned ¶ kyng rychard appoyntemente delyuerd toun brest duc brytayne wherof bygon moche trouble sorowe whiche dured vnto deth· ¶in twentyest yere kyng rychard dyde holde grete feste westmynstre whiche feste arryued sowdyours hadde kepte breste sate atte dyner hall dyner duc gloucetre sayd kynge syre haue ye seen tho felawes sate dyner halle kynge demaunded sayd ben youre folk haue seruyd yow ben come breste wote doo haue ben euyl payd thenne kynge sayd shal payed thenne answerd duc gloucetre grete furye syre ye ought fyrste putte youre bodye deuoyre gete toune castel fayt warre vpon enemyes er ye sholde selle delyuer ony townes predecessours kynges englond haue goten conquerd whiche kynge answerd ryght angrely saye ye thenne duk vncle sayd ageyn thenne kynge byganne wexe wrothe sayde wene ye marchaunt foole selle londe saynt iohan baptist nay trouthe cosyn britayne hath rendryd payd v somme predecessours hadde lente vppon sayd toune brest syth hath payed reasonne toune delyuerd hym ageyne thus beganne wrath bytwene kynge vncle afterward arondele counseylle certayne lordes duck gloucetre archebisshop caunterbury erles arondele warwyk marcha • refourme rewle aboute kynge whiche lordes promysed ech • ta byde soo departed anone erle marchal whiche capytayne calays bewrayed lete kynge haue knowleche theyr counseylle wherupon fyue twentyest daye august duke gloucetre arrestyd plasshey estsex brought tour london thenn • sente calays murthred slayne withoute processe lawe iustyce therle arondel erle warwyk syr iohan cobham syre iohn cheyne knyghtes arestyd putte holde saue therle arondel fonde seurte tanswere wente large tyl parlement tyme one twentyest yere kyng rycharde parlement holden westmynstre therle arondel brought fore alle lordes iuged deth sholde goo fote fro westmynstre thurgh cyte london tour hylle haue heede smyten syxe lordes roode hym see execucion sholde doo wi • h grete multitude peple men armes archer dredde leste shold rescowed men london ¶ morne tharchebisshop caunterbury broder banysshed euermore syre thomas mortemer banysshed also syre rychard erle warwyck cam fore parlemente iuged deth cause age releced perpetuel prysonne ¶ mondaye syre iohan cobham syre iohan cheyne iuged drawen hanged instaunce lordes iugement releced vnto perpetuel prysonne done kyng rychard made ryal feste helde open courte whiche feste made fyue duke marqueys fyue erles saye erle derby made duc herford erle ruthlond made duc anmarle crle kente duck surrey erle huntyngdon duck excetre erle marchal duck norfolke erle somersete marqueys doesete lorde spencer erle gloucetre lord neuyll erle westmerlonde syre thomas percy erle worcetre syre william scrope erle wylshyre syre iohan montague erle salysbury thus greete feste al lordes wold come yere fylle greete debate dyssencyon bytwene duck herford erle derby one partye duke norfolke erle marchal partye moche waged bataylle caste doune theyr gloues whiche taken vp byfore kynge ensealed daye place assygned couentre whiche place kynge cam· duk lancastre lordes whanne bothe partyes felde redy fyghte kynge toke matere owne honde forthwyth exyled banysshed duke herford ten yere duke norfolke euer ¶ duc norfolcke deyde venyse two twentyest yere kyng rychard made blank charter whiche ryche men royamme compellyd sette theyr seales noysed thurgh royamme hadde sette englond ferme syre william scrope erle wylshyre sir iohan busshe syre iohan grene sir iohan bagot ordeyned vncle syr edmond langley duk yorcke lyeutenaunt while shold irlond absence yere deyde duc lancastre buryed powlus london ¶ thenne kynge rychard wente irlonde many lordes grete ordenaunce wel resseyued wild • irysshmen cam downe hym theyr capytaynes yelded hym swore true lyege men dyde hym hommage feawte thus conquerd irlond moost part lytel whyle whyles kynge rychard irlond thus occupyed syre harry bolyngbrooke erle derby duc lancastres sonne whome kynge rychard hadde made duk herford exyled hym certayn cause hym tharchebisshop caūterbury also londed rauenspore north contre coloure tytle duchye lancastre reysed assembled people euer wente soo moche hadde greete multitude peple peple soo oppressyd offycers kyng rychard almoost commyns londe redy awayte erle derby hopynge releuyd hym ¶ incontynent tydynges cam kynge rychard beyng irlond landed comons drewe faste hym anone made hym redy cam ouer see englond alle hooste arryued mylford hauen taryed two dayes refresshe hym hooste mene whyle lordes mooste parte peple vnderstode erle derby bycam strenger strenger began murmure grutche ¶ seynge syr thomas percy called geder brake rdode offyce styward badde euery man goo wey vnwetyng kynge nyght euery man wente weye leuynge kynge allone saue two thre lordes fewe men whiche lordes sewerte counseyll styward brought kynge castel flynt taken delyuerd therle derby whiche brought hym london ¶ thenne taken brystowe syre william scrope syr iohan bussh sir harry grene syr iohan bagot syre iohan bagot escaped take byheded thus comyng london warde tydynges cam cyte kynge rycharde comen westmynstre anon peple london furye wodenesse peple maliciously sette ageinst king richard soueraine lorde roose purposed yf myght haue founden haue destroyed hym mayer alderman sadde men toune moche werke tourned hem hoome ageyne london yet toke syre iohan slake dene kynges chapel putte hym ludgate syre iohan bagot escaped bristowe take irlond brought london sette newegate ¶sone kynge rychard broughte tour london thenne ther parlement whiche kynge rychard deposed crowne kynge henry chosen taken kynge whome kynge rychard resygned crowne royamme englond thē ne tour castel lede kente thennes castel pountfret ¶ capitulum 9 thenne duc lancastre erle derby named henry bolyngbroke crowned kyng englond westmynstre saynt edwardes day confessour· thenne made kynge oldest sonne henry prynce wale duke cornewayle erle chestre made syre thomas arondel archechebisshop caunterbury byfore made archebisshop kynge rychard made hym bisshop london made erlis sonne arondel put p • ssession londes fyrst yere regne helde crystemas wyndesore tweluthe euen duk anmarle tolde kyng duc surrey duc excetre erle salesbury therle gloucetre theyr affynyte acorded make mommynge kyng soo slee hym reuelynge ¶ wherfore kyng nyght cam priuely london anon lordes purposed haue made mommery vnderstode theyr counseylle bewrayed anone theyr people wente westward sysseter duke surrey erle salesbury taken biheded heedes sette london brydge oxenforde taken two knyghtes bloūt sir benette sely wyntercele squyer whiche byheded quartred heedes sette london bridge quartres sente good townes prithwell estsex sire iohan holonde duck excetre taken comons countreye heede smyten sente london sette london bridge ¶ also bristowe take lorde spencer made kinge richard erle gloucetre biheded heede sent london sette londonbridge yere sire bernarde brokeis sir iohan selley syr iohan mawdelyn syr william ferby taken sette tour iugemente hanged byheded theyr heedes sette london bridge whanne kyng henry sawe lordes thus hadde rysen assemblyd greete peple haue putte hym deth restore kynge rychard ageyne crowne royamme thoughte • eschue suche peryls anone commaunded sir pyers exton shold goo strayte pountfreyte delyuer worlde kynge rychard soo departed fro kynge wente castel pountfret kynge rychard prysonne whiche sette table dyne anone syre pyers cam chambre kynge eyghte men hym eche man axe hond trouth whan kyng sawe sir pyers felaushippe entre chambre defensably arayed shoof table hym sprange myddes hem caughte axe oute one theyr hondes sette hym self valyauntly defence hym self defendynge slowe foure eyghte whanne sayde syre pyers sawe kynge soo defende hym soore abasshed gretely aferde forthwith sterte vpon place kyng rychard wonte sytte kynge rychard foughte defended hym self goynge bacwarde sayd syre pyers smote hym heede axe fyll grounde thenne cryed kynge rychard god mercy thenne gafe hym yet another stroke heede soo deyde thus thys noble kynge slayne murthred whanne kynge deede knyght hadde thus slayne hym sette hym doune deede bodye kynge rychard byganne wepe saynge ala thynge haue doone haue putte deth hym hath ben oure kynge souerayne lord two twenty yere haue lost myn honour ne shal neuer come place shal reproched haue done ageynste myn honour ¶ tweluest daye marche bodye noble kyng rychard broughte thurgh london powlus whiche corp leyd charyotte coueryd black foure baners wherof tweyne armes saynt george tweyne armes saynt edward honderd men clothed black eche berynge torche cyte londo n badde thyrtty men whyte eche berynge also torche corp leyd open vysage euery man myght see knowe hys body soo deede many men byleuyd thennes caryed frerys langley buryed whoos sowle god haue mercy amen ¶the comyn oppynyon englysshmen kynge rychard deyde maner foresayd deyde oth • r wyse wete whanne • e herde saye brother duc ex ••• te duc surey erle salysbury lordes deede soo angry soo sorowfull • e swore • e wolde neuer eete meete soo abode foure dayes withoute erynge saye whanne kynge henry vnderstode wolde ete sent hym two prelate comforte h • whan come confessyd hym one whiche gaf hym penaunce sholde ete mete whanne supposed haue eten meete myght goo doune ne auale stomake ¶for conduytes bodye w • shronken geder ¶ thenne sayde noble kynge rychard • n • muste nedes deye soo deyde certes whether deyde waye certaynly deyde buryed langley god haue mercy sowle amen ¶ thenne kynge harry peasyly kyng ¶ thenne fonde kynge rychardes tresorye nyne honderde thousande nobl • withoute iewellys vessel whiche moche worth ther founden tresorers kepynge englonde honderde fyfty thousand noble iewels vessell moche thus kynge henry hadde alle goodes item yere kynge harry sente hoome ageyne kynge rychardys wyf quene isabel vnto kynge fraunce fader putte dowayre ¶ capitulum decimum seconde yere kynge harry fourth sire rogyer claryngton knyght two men priour launde eyght frere mynours drawen hanged treasonne yere beganne grete debate walys bytwene lorde gray rethyn ewayn glyndor squyer wale ewayn reysed grete nombre walsshmen kepte countrey strength dyde moche harme destroyed kynges townes lordshippes walys robbyng sleyng kynges peple whiche contynued longe tyme toke lord gray prysoner made hym marye doughter helde hym stylle wyf son • lord gray deyde thenne kynge harry grete power wente wale take destroye sayd ewayn company fledde montayns wher • kyng myght hurte hem montaynes soo kynge retourned cam ageyne englonde losynge men ¶ yere grete scarcete whete englond quarter 〈◊〉 sixten shyllynges wherfor marchandise sente normandy whete thennes cam grete plente also syre william sawtry preest degraded presthode aboute tyme duc orleaunce sente herowde armes lettres vnto kynge harry whiche chalengyd fyght hym withynne lystes bourdeux somme metely place honderd gentylmen withoute reproche ageynste many gentyll men withoute reproche wherto kynge answerd ageyne lettres worshipfully rehersynge suche tyme shold plese hym wolde come suche nombre apperteyneth kynge conquere ryght whiche tyme shold answerd atte full soo mater fynysshed ¶ thyrd • yere kynge henry wedded dame iane duchesse britain maryed wynchestre fro then cam london forth westmynstre crowned quene yere dame blaunche oldest doughter kynge harry wedded coleyn duke sonne bayer grete solempnyte seuenth yere seen sterre called stella comata anone batayl shrerewesbury mary magdalen euen whiche bataylle slayne syre harry percy syr thomas percy taken kept two dayes hanged byheded quartred hys heede sette london brydge thys batayl prynce shotte heede arowe erle stafford slayne vnder kynges baner many lordes knyghtes squyers gentyls put deth sayd bataylle fourth yere cam emperour constantynople many grete lordes knyghtes englond see kynge peple royamme commodytees therof yere lord castel grete multitude brytons norman landed myle plymouthe saynt laurence day none cam toune bakhalf abode al day al nyght till morne ten clock robbed despoylled al toune bare hit awey owne wylle ¶ fyfthe yere grete bataylle see atte blackpole two myle oute dertmouth bytwene englysshmen brytons thanked god englysshemen vyctorye take slayne drowned moo fyue honderd gentyls frensshe men brytons whome lord castel pryncipal leder capitayne whiche taken slayne ¶ also yere william serle whiche one hem murtherd gooed duke gloucetre caleys taken marche scotlande broughte london drawen hanged byheded heede sette london brydge quarter sette vp foure good townes syxthe yere iustys smythfeld bytwene erle morryf scotland syre edmond erle kente vpon chalenge made therle morryf iuste certayne course warre sharp sperys horsbak erle kente felde gate hym grete worship yere syre rychard scrope archebisshop york lorde monbraye erle marchal englond assemblyd grete power ageynst kyng harry th • kyng met hem toke hem smote bothe theyr heedes soone god shewyd wrought many myracles worthy clerke arclebisshop yorke soo putte deth seuenth yere mayer london iohan wodecok comynalte dyde breke vp al weerys bytwene medewey kyngeston cause sette ageynst fraunchyse cyte london eyght yere kyng henry dame lucye duke suster melayn come englonde soo forth london ryally maryed syr edmond holond erle kent pryory saynt marye ouerayes southwerk ¶ yere syr robert knollys knyght grete warryour tyme dyde doo make brydge rochestre chapel atte brydges fote whiche syre robert deyde lyeth buryed whyte freres lond • n wyf dame constaunce ¶ yere syr thomas rampston knyght constable tour london drowned london brydge come fro westmynstre toward tour barge ¶ yere dame phelyp yonger doughter kyng henry maryed kynge denmark yere man callyd walssh clerk appelled knyght callyd syre percyual treasonne fought lystes smythfeld knyght scomfy • ed clerk clerk despoylled armure drawen oute feld tyburn hanged yere syr henry percy erle northumberlond lord bardolf comyng oute scotland geder grete company taken north fought smote theyr heedes brought hem london sette hem london brydge ¶ ix yere syre edmond erle kente made ameral see whiche kepte see worthyly many ryall shippes atte laste londed costes brytayne ile bryak besyeged castel sawted hit quarel slayne neuer theles castel goten thenne meyne come home ageyne therles body whiche buryed hys anncestryes worshipfully ¶ also yere grete frost dured fyftene wekys whiche frost destroyed moost parte alle smal byrdes ¶ capitulum xi yere lowys duc orleauns slayn mescheuously parys atte commaundement duc burgoyne soo duc orleaunce hadde ben vysyte quene retorned inneward certayne personnes ordeyned sayd duc burgoyne laye wayte fyll hym slewe hym cruelly smytynge brayn oute heede one gentylmen slayne hym wherfor morn grete counseyll ya • e parys closed alle grete lordes thenne beyng parys assemblyd among whome sayd duc commysed murdre gyuen strayte commaundemente prouost parys shold make strayte serche knowe hadde cōmised grete murdre soone murdres hadde slayne duk sette hous fyre whyle people cam staūche fyer horse redy soo escaped roode flaundrys nexte daye whanne al lordes reassembled moche axynge serchyng myghte doo murdre thenne sayde duc burgoyne stode vp sayde hym self hadde doo putte hym deth certayne cause whiche wold iustyfye forthwith departed oute counse • l wente lodgyng toke hors pryuy meyney rode strayt l̄yle cam al meyny departed parys wherupon cam duchesse orleaunce wyf duke doughter melan sonnes oldest sone wyf suster kyng whiche ben fore quene englonde kynge rychardys wyf requyred humbly iustyce kynge whiche thenne gode heele sate chayer iustyce whome kynge sayde wold doo iustyce commysed horryble crysme seul broder sholde veryly knowe al hast possible thenne duc bargoyn made requestys myght come fore king counseyll iustyfye deth duc orleaū ce whiche graunted soo cam grete armye parys fore dolphyn al counseylle kynges playn parlemente doctour dyuynyte callyd mayster iohan petyte made iustificacion another daye assygned duchesse orleaunce dide another doctoure diuinite make replicacion mater • enge longe whiche mater occasion infynyte sorowe royamme fraunce ¶aboute tyme counseylle pyse whiche bygonne maner make vnyon chirche • preuayled ¶ tenthe yere cam seneschal henawd wtth many gentil men englond doo armes g • ete honoure worship seneschal chalengyd therle somersete therle delyuerd hym manly chalengys wanne thonoure • felde next day cam felde another man seneschallys partye ageynst hym cam syre rychard rondele knyght henewer better hym brought hym knee ¶ thyrdde day cam another ageyne hym cam syre iohan cornewayle knyght manly quytte hym felde hadde beter aduersarye ¶ fourth day cam feld another henewer ageynste hym cam syre iohan cheynco sonne cast • oune hors man therfor kyng dubbyd hym knyght ¶the fyfthe daye cam another henewer hym cam syre iohan styward knyght whiche quytte hym manly hadde better ¶ syxthe daye cam another henewer hym cam william porter squyer hadde better henewer kynge dubbyd hym knyght ¶the seuenthe day cam another henewer hym cam iohn standysshe squyer hadde better kyng dubbyd hym knyght ¶ day cam another henewer hym cam squyer gascoyne whiche hadde better dubbed knyght ¶ eyght daye cam two henewers hem cam two sowdyours calays bretheren whiche better felde thus ended chalenge moche worship kynge thenne fested straungers ryally theyr departynge yafe hym ryche yeftes soo departed wente home ¶ enleuenth yere batayll done smythfelde bytwene two squyers one callyd gloucetre arthure whiche well manly foughte geder longe tyme ¶and kynge theyr manlynes toke theyr quarel hys honde made hem goo oute felde gyder attones ¶and soo dyuyded theyr bataylle kynge yaf hem grace yere comon • putte vp bylle parlement kynge temporalytres beynge handes spirituelte ther none answer gyuen tyme kyng wold aduysed ¶ rupertus sygismundus electe chosen emperour yere emperour seuen twenty yere ¶this sygysmundus kynge hongary whiche veray crysten meke man also deuoute hooly thoppynyon somme persones worthy canonysed special socour hooly chirche whiche fonde soore afflycte desolate scysme merueyllous wysedome industrye socoured gretely spared hym self ne vnto tyme ther full vnyon chirche ¶ hadde nyne batataylles ageynst turkes whiche al gate tryumphyng shal saye alle lawde hath gyuen constantyn theodosio charles ottone emperours worthy preysed maye surely applyed sygysmunde crowned eugenye ¶ royamme boheme grete pa • te destroyed sygismunde prynces almayne heresye hussytes pope gaf oute croysye ageynst croysye gyuen pope whanne giueth playne indulgence make warre ageynste hethen men turkes heretykes obedyente chirche rome yere iohan badby fals lollar heretyke brente smythfeld whiche byleuyd sacrament goddes bodye ¶ capitulum duodecimum twellyfth yere kyng harry taken squ • er wale hadde ben rebelle supporter owen glyndor iuged deth london drawen hangyd quartred four quartres sette vp four gode townes hede london brydge thyrtenth yere regne deyde sire iohan beauford erle somersete capytayne calays lyeth buryed abbaye tour hylle yere cam ambassatours fraunce duc burgoyne prynce kynge henryes sonne helpe socour ageynst duc orleaunce thenne wente ouer erle arondele erle kyme lord cobham many knyghtes squyers grete retenew ageynst duc orleaunce sayntelo besyde parys fraunce mette vyctory frensshmen armynaks duc rewarded rychely englyssh men come ageyne ¶ longe duc orleaunce sente ambassatours kynge harry haue helpe socour ageynst duc burgoyne whiche tyme kynge made thomas sonne duc clarence iohan sone duc bedford sonne vmfrey duke gloucetre syre thomas beauford erle dorsete duc anmarle made duck york ¶ thenne ordeyned duc clarence erle dorsete syre iohan cornewayle grete retenue passe ouer fraunce helpe strengthe duck orleaunce thenne lordes theyr retenue sayled normandye theyr londynge met • e ageynste hem lorde ham • seuen thousand men armes frensshemen whiche putte flyght taken hem seuen honderd men armes frensshmen toke many prysonners soo rode forth thurgh fraunce takyng castels townes slewe moche peple frensshmē toke many prysonners soo passed forthe tyll come bourdeux restyng whyle sette counray pea reste thenne come hoome ageyne yere coyne lyghted golde siluer weyed lasse syn dyde byfore ¶ xiiij yere regne kynge harry ther made galeys warre kynge purposed haue passed see soo forth vnto ierusalem god vysyted hym grete feruent infyrmytees day brought saynt edward shr • n make offryng take leue beynge becam soo seeke hym supposed shold haue deyd thenne toke bare hym abbot place fayre large chambre leyde hym vppon paylet fore fyre· whanne comen hym self ageyne wyst axyd chamberlayn chambre callyd inne told hym thabbots place chā bre named ierusalem ¶ thenne sayde tyme come prophecyed hym sholde dye ierusalem disposed hym godwarde made hym redy sone deyde chambre whoos soule god haue mercy amen ¶ thenne bodye caryed thennes barge water feuersham thennes caunterbury londe saynt thomas shryne cristys chirche buryed thus ended kyng harry fourth aboute mydlente sondaye yere oure lorde thousand four honderd twelue capitulum xiij kynge harry fourth regned harry sonne borne monmouthe walys harry whiche fyfth harry conquest noble wyse man faders deth whanne hadde take vpon hym kynge chaunged al condicions sodeynly chaū ged lefte al old wyld maners charged alle ben conuersaunt wylde lyuynge shold auoyde presence come therynne man dyde many greete thynges dayes regned fully ten yere tenth yere regne syx thyrtty yere age deyde buryed worshipfully westmynstre fyrst yere anone crowned whiche nynthe day apryll sente frerys langley body kyng rychard second buried lete body take oute therth ageyne dyde bryng westmynstre ryal chare couerd black veluet baners dyuerse armes alle horse chare couerd blac beten dyuerse armes many torche brennyng chaar till cam westmynstre lete make ryall terment buryed hym quene anne wyf desyre aboute whoos sepulcre ther stande foure grete taper contynuelly brennynge one day weke perpetuelly hath dirige nyne lesson morne masse bothe note solempnly whiche day gyuen also wekely pen poure peple enleuen schyllynges viij ordeyned kyng vpon grete payne day annyuersary yerly gyuen twenty pond pen pour peple ¶ also kynge ordeyned lyf founded chartrous shene hous syon saynt brygyttes ordre dyde moche good newerke westmynstre lyeth buryed ordeyned thre mass perpetuelly songen ouer hym dayly also certayne lyghtes dayly brenne atte hye masse euensong twenty pound deled pen yerly annyuersarye al ordeyned lyue besyde warre fraūce greete actes whoos sowle ihesus haue mercy amen ¶also fyrste yere syre iohan olde castell lord cobh • take dampned heretyk al hooly chirche commyted tour· thennes brake prysonne escaped anone complyses conspyreden kynges deth bretheren also destruction hooly chirche· hadde purposed haue assemblyd nyght saynt gyles felde tachyeuyd theyr euyll purpose blessyd god kynge lordes knowleche theyr entente toke felde fore awayted theyr comyng toke many preestes clerkys lewd men theyr secte fro alle partyes englond wenyng haue founden theyr capitayne syre iohan olde castel deceyued ¶ take many nyne thyrtty hanged one daye vppon newe payr galowes new made fast felde hye waye seuen gretteste heretykes brente hangyng galowes anone syre rgoyer acton knyght taken drawe hanged vppon galowes cause ¶ seconde yere regne byganne generall counseylle counstaunce vnyon hooly chirche depose scysmatykes chose one veray heede vndubytate pope also yere iohan claydon skynnar rychard baker lombardstrete brent smythfelde heresye also yere thadnys hys counseyle kynge sente lettres vnto kyng fraunce shold rendre delyuer hym enherytaunce whiche predecessours holden fore hym ellys wolde doo deuoyre grete helpe god subgettys swerde whome answerd kyng ouer yong tendre age vse warre ageynste hem derysyon sente hym tonne full tenyse balles playe • whanne kynge vnderstode answer anone lete doo ca lle counseylle shewed thismater mater ¶ concluded sayd counseylle especiall spiritu •• te h • sholde goo grete normandye wold helpe hym theyr power sayde spyritualte f • red soore yf hadde hadde doo withoute londe wolde haue laboured haue taken fro chirche temporel possession therfor concluded amonge hem self shold stire hym goo make warre ouer see fraunce conquere ryghtful enherytaunce soo concluded acorded kynge lordes al theyr power sholde mete southhampton lammasse next soo eyghtenth day iuyn kyng roode thurgh london hooste ryally toward southhampton beynge redy passe alle lordes assembled taken arestyd hye treasonne syre rychard erle cambrydge brother duc york lord sccope tresorer englond syre thomas gray knyght whiche sholde ymagyne kynges deth whiche cause iuged dampned deth nyne twentyest day iuyll byheded thenne kynge alle lordes theyr armee toke see fyften honderd say •• y arryued kydkaws normandy fro thennes went leyd syege harflete lande water leyd ordenaunce toune twoo twentyest daye september toune· gyuen ouer hym thenne ordeyned capytayne vncl • erle dorsete putte oute frensshmen stuffyd englisshmen ¶ thenne kynge sente englond lete crye euery good towne crafty man wolde come theder dwelle enhabyte toune sholde haue hows houshold hym heyres euermore thenne come theder many craftes men enhabyte ¶the kynge seynge toune wel stuffyd vytaylle men passyd forthe lande towarde calays thenne frensshmen heerynge comyng brake brydges sholde come ouer ryuer somme ¶thenne kynge wente soo fer vpward gate ouer cam pycardye ¶ thenne frensshmen agyncourt rolandcourt blangy wyth alle ryal power fraunce excepte duc burgoyne whiche wolde come theder ne suffre sonne lord charoyles come theder ¶ whanne kynge sawe h • myght passe toke hi • felde suche peple hadde whiche passynge seuen thousand fyghtynge men mooste parte hem seeke flyxe yemanry hadde theyr hosen teruen bounden bynethe knee hauynge longe iackys· euery man good bowe sheef arowys swerd ¶ thenne sette felde sette duc york vauntward ordeyned nyght fore bataylle eche man sholde make stake sharp both̄ thendes pytche slope grounde fore hym soo morne hadde confessour made hem saye general confession gaf general absolucion thenne kynge roode thurgh̄ felde comforted hem promysynge wol̄d rather deye day yelde hym thenne euery man toke good herte courage soo abode comynge frensshmen whome resseyued stakys stomblynge fallynge donne hors man suche wyse men shotte hem soo fought thurgh grace god vyctorye abode kyng frensshmen ouerthrowen slayne enleuen thousande moo many grete lordes gentyls take prysonners whanne kynge hadde thus goten felde tydynges cam ther comynge newe batayll frensshmen towards hym thenne dyde doo crye comaunded euery man shold slee prysonners whanne duc orleaunce herde greete lordes sente worde frensshmen yf cam shold slayne thenne frensshmen sauacion prysonners lyues withdrewe soo kynge hadde kepte felde wanne worshippe bataylle ¶ slayne felde thre duke nyne erlys baron nyghe honderde gentylmen cote armoure xlv c ¶ englyss • e partye duc yorke therle suffolke twenty personnes moo blessyd god duc braban taken lyue whan kynge commaunded euery man shold slee prysoner· slayne who sowle alle god haue mercy amen thus helpe almyghty god kynge englond vij englysshmen wan feld vpon frensshmen whiche nombred moo foure score thousand men ryall lordes fraunce except kynge dolphyn whanne al done kynge demaunded herowdes name next place felde answerde agyncourt thenne sayd wille bataylle callyd named bataylle agyncourt ¶ thenne kynge kepynge felde hoost al nyghte morne departed toward caleys prysonners wete duck orleaunce duck borbon erles ewe vendon burcicaught marchal fraunce many lordes gentill men whome brought alle englonde hym receyued euery place worshipfully alle honoure ioye solempnyte myght foure twentyeste daye nouembre kyng cam london wete euery englisshman ben bataylle gate good prysoners good iewellis frensshmen richely costlew arrayed wherof oure peuple good pyllage ¶ capitulum 14 thyrdde yere regne emperour almayne sygysmund cam englonde receyued worworshipfully douer ky duc gloucetre cyte london mayer alderman alle craftes moost best wise resseyued hym blackheth seuenthe daye maye saynt thomas wateryng kyng self lordys mette welcomed moost goodlyes • wyse toke honde and· roode forthe thurgh cite offrid powlis thenne rode forth vnto westmestre king lodged owne palays abode grete whyle kinges coste thenne come duc holonde englonde whome king resseiued worshipfully lodged bisshop elyes place holburne whanne emperour hadde seen manere londe commodytees therof electe chosen broder garter whiche toke receyued gladly ware euer ¶ thenne kynge brought hym calays theder cam hym duk burgoyne doo hommage themperour coū te alst flaundres whome kynge receyued worshipfully thenne themperour toke leue kynge departed soo eche toke leue kyng retourned ageyne englond emperoure wente zierixsee zeland thenne vnto dordrecht holonde· ¶ fourthe yere duc bedford therle marche certayne lordes theyr retenue foughten see ageynst seuen carryks gene fyfty vessel hulkes barge galeys galyetis whome taken thre grete carryks patron drowned grete hulke callyd black hulk flaundres remenaunt fledde aweye done lady day assumpcion also yere parlement holden westmynstre graū ted kynge hoole fyftenthe dyme mayntene warrys yere kynge sayled al retenewe ouer see normandye ageyne londed lammas daye toke landynge kynge made eyght fourty knyghtes anone kynge wanne toune toke castel withoute strooke made syre iohan kygley capytayne therof thenne kynge sent therle marchal vnto louers whiche sawted anon yolden therle brought keyes kynge kyng delyuerd hym keyes ageyne made hym capytayn louers thenne kyng wente cane besyeged sawte entryd toune gate castel helde capytayne desyred respyte fourten dayes tabyde rescows yf none cam delyuere kynge graunted hym vnder apooyntement cyte bayows townes fortress vnto nombre fourtene vppon hyll fore castel cane kynge pyght alle tentes pauyllons whiche semed toune moche cane ¶ whanne tydynges cam noo rescowes wolde come fourten dayes ende capytayne delyuerd keyes castel vnto kynge lyke wyse bayons fourtene townes delyuerd also whiche townes castels kynge made duk clarence capytayne gouernour cane kyng heelde feste saynt george made fyftene knyghtes bathe ¶ thenne er departed gate valeys sente duc gloucetre chyrburgh geete whiche besyeged lay long thus kyng sente dyuerse townes gate dayly many townes soo moche gate alle tounes castels pyle strengthes abbeyes vnto pount alarche fro then roan aboute tyme yet contynued counseylle constaunce whiche ended scysme fourty yere ther dampned heresyes two heretyks wete iohanhus iherome brente many good thynges institued ordeyned determyned decreed hooly synode counseyll lanfully gadred assembled representyng chirche hath vnyuersal power inmedyatly cryst whome euery astate wel papal astate boū den holde obeye tho thynges toucheth general reformacion chirche wete feyth maners al wel heede membrys item thenne forth sholde alwey general counseyl holden fro ten yere ten yere ¶ counseyll chosen pope martyn whiche martinu quintu pope fourten yere vnyon whiche desyred long defence feyth myghty pope aboue alle ryche· man grete iustyce helde stretes hye weyes sewrly pee destroyed heretyks dyde many goode thynges helpe noble emperour sygysmunde ¶ recouer holy lond gadryd moche tresoure deth cam vpon hym lette lytel fore deth ordeyned general counseyll assemblid basyle fyfth yere regne kynge harry fyfthe syre iohan old castel lord cobham taken conuycte clergye heresye dampned fore temporal iuges tresonne soo drawen hanged saynt gyles felde vpon newe payr galows cheyne yron vnder galewes made grete fyre brente galowes alle ¶ syxthe yere kyng besyeged cyte roan whiche endured half yere atte laste cyte beyng grete famyne putte oute moche peple woman child whiche deyde honger moo thyrtty thousand also seyng noo rescowse cam appoynted kyng gaf ouer toun vnto hym receyued anone roan goten deepe many tounes baa normandye gaf ouer withoute strook syege whanne vnderstode kynge goten roan ¶ capitulum xv aalso yere hadde ben pee made sworne bytwene duc burgoyne dolphyn whiche sworn vpon lordes body shold loue assyste eche ageynst theyr enemyes contrary othe duc iohan burgoyne slayne pytously murthred presence dolphyn wherfore frensshemen gretely deuyded veray necessyte labouryd haue traytye kynge englond kynge englond wanne dayly townes castels fortress also yere quene iane arestyd brought castel ledys kente one frere randolf doctour diuynyte confessour whiche afterward slayne person tour fallynge wordes debate afterward quene iane delyuerd ¶ seuenth yere kynges fraunce englond acorded kyng harry made heyr regente fraunce wedded dame kateryne kynges doughter fraunce atte troyes champayne trynyte sondaye made meene phelyp newely made duke burgoyne whiche sworne kynge harry tanenge faders deth become englysshe thenne kyng newe wyf wē te parys ryally receyuyd then lordes duc burgoyne many lordes fraūce leyd syege dyuerse townes castels holde dolphyns partye wan toune melun helde long therin good defendours viij yere kyng quene cam ouer see londed candelmasse morow douer xiiij day feuerer kyng cam london xxj day moneth quene cam xxiiij day crowned westmestre also yere anon eester kyng helde parlement westmestre whiche parlement ordeyned gold englysshe coyne shold weyed none resseyued weyght anone whitsontyde kynge sayled caleys passyd soo forth fraunce marche two twē tyest daye byfore kynge cam ouer duc clarence slayne fraunce dyuerse lordes taken prysoners erle hūtyngdon erle somersete dyuerse al cause wold take hem archer thought haue doo frensshmen self withoute yet whanne slayn tharchers cam rescowed body duc whiche wold haue caryed god haue mercy soule valyaunt man yere bytwene crystemasse candelmas • e toune melun yolden kynge ¶ nynth yere saynt nycholas day december born harry kynges first begoten sonne wyndesore whoos god faders fou • stone harry bisshop wynchestre iohan duke bedforde duchesse holond godmoder harry chychely archebisshop caūterbury godfader atte confermyng tenth yere cyte mew brye goten whiche ben l̄onge besyeged yere quene shipped hampton sayled ouer kynge fraunce worshipfully receyued kyng also kyng fraunce fader moder thus kyng harry wan faste fraunce helde grete astate sate ardyner grete fest parys crowned quene also whiche hadde ben seen fore alle peple resorted vnto courte kynge fraunce helde none astate ne rule lefte al moost allone ¶ also yere whether cock sette vpon powlus steple london ¶and yere moneth august kynge harry w • xe seke boy de vyncent whanne sawe sholde deye made testament ordeygned many thynges nobly sowle deuoutly resseyued alle ryghtes hooly chirche soo ferforth whanne enoynted sayd seruyse preeste whanne vers psalme miserere mei deus c benigne fac domine bona voluntate tua syon vt edificentur muri ierl̄m sayd bade tarye sayd thus good lord thou knowest mynentent hath ben yet yf myght lyue reedefye wally ierl̄m thenne preest proceded forth made ende anone mooste noble prynce vyctoryous kynge flour tyme crysten chyualrye whome alle world doubted gaf soule handes god deyde made ende naturel lyf atte sayd boy de vyncent besyde parys syx thyrttyest yere age whoos soule god haue mercy amen thenne bodye enbamed cered leyde ryall chare ymage lyke vnto hym leyde vpon corp open dyuers baners horse coueryd rychely tharmes englonde fraunce also olde armes saynt edwardys seynt edmonds grete multitude torchys whome wente kyng scotlande many lordes whiche accompanyed body till cam vnto westmynstre london englonde euery toune waye hadde solempnly dirige atte euen masse morn moche almesse gyuen poure people seuenthe daye nouembre corp brought thurgh london grete reuerence solempnyte vnto monasterye westmynstre nowe resteth whoos tombe ryche ymage lyke hym self syluer gylt dayly remembrid praid fore whoos sowle crysten god haue mercy amen ¶ capitulum xvj noted kynge harry fyfthe moche noble prynce kynge crowned fore yongthe hadde ben wylde recheles spared thyng lustes ne desyres accomplisshid lykynge soone crowned enoynted sacred anone sodaynly chaunged new man set al entente lyue vertuously mayntenyng hooly chirche destroyng heretykes kepynge iustyce defendynge royamme subgettis moche fader hadd deposyd labour good kynge rychard pytously made hym deye thoffence doo hym ageynst lyegeaunce hadde sente rome assoylled therof whiche offence pope oure hooly fader enioyned hym make hym prayd fore perpetuelly lyke done taken hym naturell lyf therfore sholde doo founde four taper brenne perpetuelly aboute body extynction bodyly lyf sowle maye euer remembryd lyue heuen spyrytuel lyf also sholde euery weke daye cometh aboute dethe haue solempne masse requiem euen fore dirige nyne lesson dole pour people alwaye daye enleuen schyllynges eyght pen delyd peny mele one yere annyuersarye terment holden moost honest wyse deled day twenty 〈◊〉 pen pour peple euery monke haue twenty schillynges whiche alle thynges performed noble kyng fader kynge harry fourth fader performed hit duryng lyf whome sayde god touchyd lepre er deyde ¶ also thenne noble prynce l •• te doo calle alle thabbottes pryours saynt benet ordre englond hadd chapytre hous westmynstre reformacion thordre wherynne comynycacian also bisshoppes men spyritualte soo ferforth doubted soore wold haue temporaltees oute handes wherfor thaduis labour procuryng spyrytualte encouraged kynge chalenge normandy ryght hadde fraunce thende sette hym werke sholde seeke occasion entre suche mater soo alle lyf labouryd warrys conquerynge grete parte royamme fraunce thagrement kynge charlys hadde alle gouernaunce royamme fraunce proclamed regent heyr fraunce soo withstandyng alle grete warre yet remembryd soule also mortal muste deye whiche ordeyned lyf place sepulcre buryed euery day thre mass perpetuelly songen fayr chapel ouer sepulcre whiche myddel masse fyrst laste masse shal assygned hym appereth thyse verse folowynge ¶ henrici misse quinti sunt hic tabulate que successiue sunt per monachos celebrate die dm̄ca ¶ prima sit assumpte de festo virginis alme poscit postremam cristus de morte resurgens prima salutate de festo virginis extat feria ij nunciat angelicis laudem postrema choreis esse deum natum de virgine prima fatetur feria 3 comemorat natam sic vltima missa mariam prima celebretur ad honorem neupmatis almi feria 4 vltima conceptam denunciat esse mariam semper prima coli debet de corpore cristi feria 5 vltima sit fata de virgine purificata condecet vt prima celebretur de cruce sanctum feria 6 que salutate fiet postrema marie omnes ad sanctos est prima col • nda supernos sabbato vltima de requie pro defunctis petit esse semper erit medium de proprietate dei yet noble kyng harry fyfthe founded two howses relygion one callyd syon besyde braynford ordre saynt brygytte men wymmen syde ryuer tamyse hows monkes chartrehous whiche two place contynnelly prayd fore nyghte day euer whanne syon rest chartrehous done theyr seruyce lyke wyse whanne chartrous rest goon ryngyng belly eyther place eche knoweth whanne ende theyr seruyse whiche ben nobly endowed done dayely grete almesse dedes chartrehous certayne child ben founde scole syon certayne almesse gyuen dayly yet besyde hath founded recluse whiche shal alwey preeste praye hym sayde chartrehous whiche preest wel sufficiently endowed hym seruaunt loo maye prynces take ensample noble prynce regnynge lytel tyme fully x yere dyd many noble actes wel sowle perpetuelly remembryd prayde fore wordly conquestys beynge moost lusty age despysed eschewyd synne vertuous grete iustyser soo moche alle prynces crystendom dradde hym also hethenes determyned hym self yf god wolde haue sparyd hym wold haue warryd agayne sarasyns knowe ayde prynces passage iourney sent knyght henawd named syr hugh̄ de lanoye vnto ierl̄m er retorned deyd boy du vincēt xxxvj yere age who soule god haue mercy kyng harry syxth regned beynge childe one yere age bataylle vernoyl perche ¶ capitulum 17 kyng harry fyfthe regned harry sonne chil de fully yere old whoos regne began fyrst daye september yere lord thousand four honderd two twenty kynge beyng cradel moche doubted dradde cause grete conquest fader also wysedome guydynge vncles duck bedford duc gloucetre yere xxj day octobre deyde charles kyng fraunce lyeth buryed saynt denys thenne duc bedford made regent fraūce duc gloucetre made protectour defendour englond fyrst day marche syr wylliam tayllour preest
