degraded preesthode morne brente smythfeld heresye ¶ yere syre iames styward kynge scottes maryed dame iane duchesse doughter clarence fyrst husbond therle somersete saynt mary ouerays ¶ also yere seuententh day august bataylle vernayl perche bytwene duc bedford regent fraunce duc alaunson whiche greete bataylle duc bedford hadde syde hym therle salesbury mountagu lord talbotte alle power coude make normandy garnysons kepte also many capytayns moche peple duc burgoyns syde duc alaunson duc turon therle douglas therle bougham many lordes fraunce greete companye scottes armynakes thenne therle douglas callyd duc bedford iohan leden swerde sente hym worde ageyne shold fynde daye swerde stele soo bataylle ioyned bothe sydes fought longe ther wyst man shold haue bet • r grete whyle last god wold vyctory fyll thenglysshe partye ther slayne therle douglas whiche lytel byfore made duc turone therle bowhayn therle almarre erle tonnar therle vauntedore· vysecounte nerbonne whiche one slewe duk iohan burgoyne knelyng fore dolphyn many mo vnto nombre ten thousande moo ther taken prysonner duc alaunson many lordes gentyls fraunce scottys day slayne doune ryght substaunce alle thyrde yere kyng harry syxth duke gloucetre maryed duchesse holond wente ouer see henawde take possession wyues enherytaunce honorably receyuyd taken lord lond soone fayne retorne hoome ageyne lefte wyf tresour brought hym toune callyd mounse henawd whiche promysed trewe hym withstandyng deliuerde lady duc burgoyne whiche sente gaunt then escaped mannes arraye cam zeland toune owne callyd zierixee then wente toune holond called ghowde ther stronge ynough wythstode sayd duc burgoyne sone duc gloucetre sente ouer zeland lord fytzwater certayne men warre archer helpe socour sayd duchesse holond whiche londed place zeland callid brewer hauen lordes coūtre cam doune fought hym conclusion fayne withdrawe hym meyne see ageyne yet slewe hurte diuers lordes moche peple coū treye soo retorned home ageyne preuayled noo thyng also yere therle salysbury therle suffolke lord wylby lord scalys theyr retenue leyd syege cyte mauns whiche cyte yolden shorte tyme many stronge townes castels nombre syx thyrtty ¶ tyme normandye grete parte fraunce vnto orleaūce vnder thobeysaunce kynge englond alle remenaunt fraunce grete trybulacion meschyef ¶capitulum xviij fourth yere nyght mayer london iohan couentre taken charge grete watche london affraye bytwene bisshop wynchestre duc gloucestre protectour mayer peple cyte wold abyde duc gloucetre protectoure royamme labour lordes wente bytwene especial labour prynce portyngale ther appoyntement taken ther harme bataylle vernoyll perche duc bedforde cam ouer englond whitson • aye yere leyceter dubbed kynge harry knyght forthwith sayd harry dubbed alle knyghtes whoos name folowe wete rychard duc york also sone heyr duc norfolk therle af oxenford therle westmerlond sone heyr therle northumberlond sonne heyr therle vrmond lord roe syr iames buteler lord matrauas syr harry gray tankeruyle syr william neuyl lorde fauconbrydge syr george neuyl lord latymer lord wellys lord barkley sonne heyr lord talbot sir rauf gray werk syr robert veer syr rychard gray sir edmond hongerford syr robert wynkefeld syre iohan boteller syr raynold cobham syr iohan passhely syre thomas tunstal syr iohan chydyock syre rauf langford syre william drury syre william apthomas syre rychard carbonel syre rychard wydeuyle sire iohan shyrdelowe syr nychol blonket syre rauf ratteclyf syre edmond trafford syre william cheyne syre william babyngton· syre iohan iune syr gilbert beauchamp ¶ item fyfthe yere duc bedford duchesse wyf wente ouer see calays lytel tofore wente ouer harry bisshop wynchestre lady day annunciacion lady chirche calays bisshop wynchestre whanne songe masse made cardynal knelyng fore hye auter duc bedford sette hatte heede ther bulles redde wel charge reioysyng benefyces spirituel temporel also yere greete habundaunce rayn substance heye corne destroyed rayned almoost euery day ¶this yere goode erle salesbury syre thomas montagu leyd syege vnto orleaunce whiche syege slayne gonne whiche cam oute toune whoos sowle god haue mercy amen syth slayne englisshmen neuer gate ne preuayled fraunce euer beganne lese lytel lytel tyl loste ¶ also yere breton murthred good wydowe bedde withoute algate wedowe fonde hym almesse bare awey al hadde toke gryth hooly chirche seynt george southwerke toke crosse forswore lond wente happened cam place dyde cursyd dede subarbys london woman paryssh cam oute stone canel dunge slewe made ende hym notwithstandynge conestable many men beyng present kepe hym ther many women· noo pyte also yere duck norfolke many gentilmen yomen toke barge eyght day nouembre saynt mary ouerayes haue goon thurgh london brydge thurgh mysguydyng barge ouerthrewe pyle many men drowned duc hym self twoo thre leepe vpon pyle soo saued helpe men aboue brydge whiche cast doune rope whiche saued hem self ¶ yere saynt leonard daye kynge harry beynge seuen yere age crowned westmynstre who coronacion made syx thyrtty knyghtes yere saynt george day passyd ouer see calays toward fraunce aboute tyme afore royamme beynge grete myserye trybulacion· dolphyn partye beganne make warre gete certayne place make destrusses vpon englysshmen mene capytaynes wete la heer poton de sentraylles especial mayde whiche named la pucelle de dieu mayd roode lyke man valyaunt capytayne among toke vpon many grete enterpryses soo moche byleue haue recouerd al theyr loss notwithstā dyng last many grete feates helpe prowesse sir iohan luxemburgh whiche noble capytayne du kes burgoyne many englysshmen pycardys bourgoygnons whiche oure partye byfore toune compyne thre twentyest daye maye sayd pucelle taken felde armed lyke man many capytayns broughte roan putte prysonne iuged lawe brente thenne sayd childe wherby respyted whyle conclusion founde childe thenne brente roan capytaynes putte raunsonne entreated men warre ben acustommed ¶ yere aboute candelmasse rychard hounden wolle packer dampned heretyke brente atte tourhylle aboute midlente syr thomas baggely preeste vycary mauenden estsex besydes walden disgrated ▪ dampned heretyke brente smythfeld ¶ also yere kynge fraunce ther many heretykes lollars hadde purposed haue made rysyng caste bylles many places· blessyd god capytayne hem taken· whoos name william mandeuyle weuar abendon bayly toune whiche named hym self iak sharp wygmoryslonde wale afterwarde byheded abendon whitsonweke tewisdaye ¶ yere seuenth day december kynge harry syxthe crowned kyng fraunce parys chirche oure lady grete solempnyte beyng presēt cardynal englonde duc bedforde many lordes fraū ce englonde coronacion grete feste holden parys kyng retourned then roan soo towārde calays nynthe daye feuerer londed douer whome alle comyns kente mette beramdoun bytwene caunterbury douer alle reede hoodes soo cam forth till cam blackheth mette mayer iohan wellys alle craftys london cladde alle whyte soo brought hym london one twē tyest daye moneth yere restraynt wollys calays made sowdyours cause payed wage wherfor duc bedford regente fraūce thēne capitayn cam cal̄eis tewsday esterweke morne many sowdiours toun arested putte warde weke roode terewyn mene bisshop terewyn wedded therles doughter saint poul cam ageine caleis ¶ enleuenst daye iuin saint bernabes daye four • soudyours calays chyef causers restraynt byheded wete iohan maddeley iohan lu • daye thomas palmer thomas talbot cx banysshed toune tyme byfore banysshed • ixe score soudyours mydsomer euen cam lord regent wyf london ¶ capitulum 19 aboute tyme pope martyn deyde hym eugenye fourth pope pesybly chosen rome cardynals indubytate pope shortly putte expulsed oute rome suche wyse fayne flee naked ¶ tyme counseylle basyle whiche counseylle cyted come bycause cam deposed hym rought ne sette therby gate cyte rome abode stil pope seuentene yere ¶ yere aboute whitsontyde heretyks praghe destroyed two iourneyes destroyed moo twoo twenty thousande capytayns wete procapius saplico lupus presbiter ¶ also ther taken lyue mayster pyers clerk englysshman heretyke also yere grete froste stronge duryng enleuen wekes beganne saynt katheryns euen lasted vnto saynt scolasticais day feuerer tyme vyntage cam bordeux cam ouer shoters hylle yere counseyl ara greete traytye bytwene kyng englonde frensshe kynge assemblyd grete many lordes bothe partyes whiche counseylle offryd kyng englond many grete thynges moyen legate cam rome whiche cardynal saynt crosse whiche offres refused cardynal englond lordes kyng wherfor duke burgoyne whiche ben longe englysshe sworne forsoke oure partye retourned frensshe meene legate made pee frenssh kyng receyuynge kynge recompensynge faders deth counte pontieu lordship macon moche specyfyed sayd trayttye soo oure ambassadours cam hoome ageyne wers • caas wente lost duc burgoyne whiche hadde ben bourgonyons pycardes synguler helpe conquest normandy fraunce yere grete batayll see bytwene ieneweys kyng aragon whiche bataylle ieneweys vyctorye toke kynge aragon kyng nauern greete mayster saynt iames galyse thre honderd knyghtes squyers moche peple saynt domynyks day· yere seen thre sonnes attones anone folowyd threfolde rule gouernaunce chirche wete eugenye counseyle neutralyte also yere 1434 passyng grete wynde whiche steples howses tree ouerthrowen aboute tyme hooly mayde holond callyd lydwith whiche lyued longe myracle etyng ony mete yere duc burgoyne byganne ordre lyle golden flyes· ordeygned certayne knyghtes thordre made statute ordenaunces· moche acordynge vnto thordre garter also yere frensshmen hadde enterprysed haue stolen calays fysshyng tyme many booty fraunce sauf conduytes come calays take beeryng soudyours toune hadde customme come chirche leue theyr stauys stondynge chirche dore whiche stauys frensshmen which̄ arayd lyke fysshers hadde purposed haue taken soo theyr wepen wynne toune one laye comyn woman nyght byfore tolde theyr counseylle morne told lyeutenaunt whiche forthwith commanded euery man shold kepe wepen hond sacryng tyme whanne apperceyued myspoynted sayled strayte depe stale toke toune newyers euen toke harflete thus englysshmen byganne lose lytel lytel normandye ¶ capitulum visesimum yere grete noyse thurgh al englond duck bourgoyne wolde come besyege calays wherfore erle mortayn armye hadde haue goone fraunce countremaunded charged shold go calais whiche tyme wel vitailled manned sire iohan ratclif lyeutenāt kinge toune baron dudeley lyeutenaūt castel nynthe daye iuill duke burgoyne al power flaundres moch peple cam calais sette syege aboute toune euery toune flaundres tentes self syege endured thre wekes mene duc gloucetre beyng protectour englond toke moost parte lordes englond wente ouer see calays rescowe toun fyghte duke hoost yf wolde haue byden tyme london euery good toune englond sente ouer see rescowe certayne peple well arayd best chosen men warre second day august sayd duke gloucetre arryued calays alle armye fyue honderd shippes moo duke alle hoost laye syege sone e espyed sayllys see byfore approched calays hauen sodaynly mornynge departed fro syege leuyng behynde moche stuffe vytaylle fledde flaūdres pycardye lyke wyse dyde syege laye fore guynes guynes toke grete gonne brasse whiche callyd dygeon many grete gonne serpentyns thenne whanne duke gloucetre arryued hoost wente flaundres therynne enleuen dayes dyde lytel harme excepte brente two fayr vyllages poperyng belle howses whiche strengthe soo retourned home ageyne also yere kyng scottys besyeged rokesburgh moche pepl̄e sir rauf gray departed fro castel ordeyned rescows sone kynge vnderstode departyng sodaynly brake syege wente hys weye leuynge moche ordenaunce behynde hym gate noo worship ¶ yere second daye ianyuer quene katheryn whiche kynges moder wyf kynge harry fyfthe deyde departed oute thys worlde brought ryally thurgh london soo westmynstre lyeth buryed worshipfully oure lady chapel also yere fourtenthe daye ianyuer fyl doune gate toure hit london brydge toward southwerk twoo arch stode theron yere grete trayttye holden bytwene grauenyng calays bytwene kyng ducke burgoyne kyng cardynall englond duck norfolke many lordes ducke duchesse hauyng full power lord regent ladye londes taken thaduys bothe partyes abstynence warre certeyne tyme name duchesse duke cause hadde goon oth lygeaunce made kyng harry therfor kynge neuer wolde wrytene appoynte ne haue hym duchesse name ¶ also yere quene iane deyde second daye inyll whiche ben kynge harry fourthys wyf caryed fro bermondesey vnto caunterbury lyeth buryed kynge harry fourth husbond yere deyde alle lyon toure london whiche hadde seen many yeres byfore oute mynde ¶ capitulum 21 xvj yere kyng harry deyde sygysmūd emperour almayne knyght garter who terment kynge kepte pawlys london ryally made ryal herse kynge astate cladd blewe euen dirige morne masse hym elect chosen albert duke ostryche whiche wedded sygysmundus doughter emperour taken resseyued kyng boheme vngary cause hys wyf sigismundus doughter whiche lefte hym none yer albert emperour one yere poysond soo deyde somme saye deyde flyxe vertuouse man pytefulle soo moche alle peple knewe hym sayde worlde worthy haue hys presence yere kynge scottys murthred chambre nyght pytously whiche kynge prysoner xv yere englonde slewe hym taken afterward cruel iustyce yere one owayn squyer wale mā lowe byrthe whiche many day fore secretely weddyd quene katheryn thre sone doughter taken commaunded newgate prysonne lord gloucetre protectour royame yere brake pryson mene preest chappelayn taken ageyne lord bemond brought ageyne newe gate whiche afterward delyuerd large one sone afterward made erle rychemōd another erle penbroke thyrde monk westmynstre whiche monke deyde sone yere also newyersday baynardyscastel fyl̄ doune stak wode sodeynly none slewe thre men mesch yuously foule hurte also bedford shyreday eyghten men murthred withoute stroke fallynge doune steyr cam oute theyr comyn halle many foul̄e hurte eyghtenth yere sir rychard beauchamp good erle warwyck deyde roan beynge tyme lyeutenaunt kynge normandye thennes bodye brought warwyk lyeth worshipfully newe chapel south syde quyre ¶ also yere greete derthe corne al englond busshel whete worth fourty pen many place englond yet men myght haue ynowgh wherfor steuen broun tyme mayer london sente pruse brought london certayne shippes laden rye easyd dyd moche good peple corne soo skarce englond place englond poure peple made hem brede fern rote yere general counseyle basyle deposed pope eugenye chese felyx whiche duc sauoye thenne byganne scysme whiche endured vnto yere lord mcccc xlviij felyx deuoute prynce sawe sone sone lyued deuoute hooly lyf chosen pope counseyllr basyle eugenye deposed soo scysme long tyme felyx moche obedyence bycause neutralyte moost parte wel nygh al cristendom obeyed reputed eugenye veray pope god knoweth veray pope occupyed durynge lyf eugenye yere syr rychard wiche vycary hermettesworth degrated prysthode powlys brente toure hylle heretyk saynt botulphus day well deth deyde good cristen man wherfore dethe moche people cam place hadde brente offryd made heep • stone sette vp crosse tree helde hym saynt till mayer shreues commaundement kynge bisshops destroyed made donghyll also yere shreues london fette oute saynt martyns graūte sayntuarye fyue personnes whiche afterward restored ageyne sayntuarye kynges iustyces alberte thyrde frederyk chosen emperour frederyk duke ostryche longe emperour differyd crowned rome cause scysme vnyon crowned imperyal dyademe grete glorye tryumphe pope nycholas fourth man pesyble quyete synguler pacyence hatyng chirche· wedded kyng portyngales doughter ¶ capitulum 22 yere dame elyanore cobham duchesse gloucetre arestyd certayne poyntes treasonne leyd ageyn wherupon examyned saynt steuens chapel west mynstre byfore tharchebisshop caunterbury ther enioyned open penaunce goo thurgh chepe berynge • aper honde perpetuel prison ile man vnder kepynge sir thomas stanley ¶ also tyme arestyd mayster thomas southwel chanō w • stmynstre mayster iohn hum chappellayn sayd ladyes mayster rogyer bolyngbroke clerk vsynge nygromancye ¶and one margery iurdemayn callyd wytche eye •• syde westmynstre arestyd beyng counseyll sayd duchesse gloucetre mayster thomas south wel deyde toure nyght shold haue reyned morne soo sayd hym self shold dye bedde iustyce ¶ yere twenty mayster iohan hum mayster rogyer bolyngbrooke brought guydhalle london ther byfore mayer lordes chyef iustyce englond rayned dampned drawen hanged quartred mayster iohn hum chartre pardoned kynge mayster rogyer drawen tyburne confessyd yde gyltles neuer trespaced deyd fore notwithstandyng hanged heded quartred who soule god haue mercy margery iurdemayne brente smythfeld ¶ also yere lord talbotte leyde syege dyepe dolphyn rescowed wan bastyle englysshmen made ¶also yere greete effraye fletestrete nyghtes tyme bytwene men courte men london dyuerse men slayne somme hurte one herbotel chyef cause mysgouernaunce effraye ¶ also yere chesyng mayer london comons named robert clopton rawlyn holond taylour alderman toke robert clopton brought hym ryght honde mayer customme thenne certeyne tayllours hande crafty men cryed nay naye man rawlyn holonde wherfor mayer padysley sente tho soo cryed newgate abode grete punysshed ¶ yere dyuerse ambassadours sente guyan maryage kynge erles doughter armynak· whiche concluded mene therle suffolk lette put part sayd erle suffolk wente ouer see fraunce treated maryage bytwene kynge englond margarete kynges doughter secyle ierusalem ¶ next yere concluded fully maryage whiche maryage kynge shold delyuer fader duchye anges erldome mayne whiche keye normandye ¶thenne departed erle suffolke wyf dyuerse lordes knyghtes moost ryal astate myghte oute englonde newe chares palfrayes whiche wente thurgh chepe soo wente ouer see resseyued syth brought lente hampton landed ryally resseyued candelmasse euen byfore greete tempeste thonder lyghtnyng none paulus steple sette fyre myddes shafte tymbre whiche quenchyd force laboure specially laboure morowe masse preeste bowe chepe whiche thought inpossyble sauf grace god ¶this yere erle stafford made create duke bokyngham erle warwyck duk warwyck therle dorsete marquys dorsete erle suffolk made marquys suffolk ¶ capitulum 23 yere kyng harry maryed southweke quene margrete cam london eyghtenth day maye waye alle lordes englonde resseyued worshipfully dyuerse place especial duc gloucetre blackheth mayer alderman alle craftes blewe gownes browdred deuyse crafte myghte byknowen mette wyth reede hoodes brought london dyuerse pagentis countenaunces dyuerse historyes wyd dyuerse place cyte ryally costlewe thyrttyest daye maye sayd quene crowned westmynstre ¶ iustys thre dayes duryng within sayntuarye fore thabbay yere pryour kylmayn appeled therle vrmond treasonne whiche hadde day assygned fyghte smythfeld lystys made feelde dressyd whanne cam poynt kynge commaunded shold fyghte toke quarels owne honde doone instaunce labour certayne prechours doctours london mayster gylbert worthyngton parson saynt andrew holborne ¶ also yere cam grete ambassate englonde onte fraunce haue concluded perpetuel pee conclusion torned vnto tr • ew yere ¶aboute tyme deyde saynt bernardyn gray frere whiche beganne newe reformacion ordre many place moche reformed ben callyd obseruauntes whiche obseruauntes ben encreaced gretely italye almayne ¶ bernadyn canonysed pope nycholas fyfthe yere thousand foure c fyfty iohannes de capestrano disciple whiche prouffyted moche reformacion ordre whome god shewyd many myracles also noted tyme forward kyng harry neuer prouffyted ne wente forward fortune beganne tourne hym sydes well fraunce normandye guyan englonde somme men holde oppynyon kyng harry gaf commyssion plenerly sire edward hulle syre robert roos dene saynt seneryns conclude maryage hym therle armynaks suster whiche promysed sayd concluded afterward broken mene marquys suffolke broken wedded quene margrete fore said whiche dere maryage royamme englonde knowen veryly haue delyuerd duchye angeo erldom mayne keye normandy frensshmen tentre aboue the· sayd marquys suffolke axyd playne parlement fyftenth half fetche oute fraunce lo maryage comparysone maryage armynak ther sholde haue ben delyuerd many castels townes guyan moche good sholde haue ben youē englond shold haue ben therby enryched contrarye wyse fylle wherfore euery greete prynce ought kepe promyse bycause brekyng promyse maryage quene margrete losse hath hadde royamme englond losyng normandye guyan dyuysion royame rebellyng comons ayenst theyr prynce lordes dyuysyon among lordes murdre sleyng feldes foughten made ¶in conclusionthat man man hath lost lyf kyng deposed quene sone fayne flee scotland then fraunce lorayn place cam first fro many men deme brekyng kynges promyse suster therles armynack cause grete losse aduersyte ¶ capitulum 24 yere xxv kynge harry parlement bury callyd saynt edmondes burye aboute whiche commanded alle comyns countre bee theyr moost defensable araye awayte vppon kyng whiche parlement cam duc gloucetre hunfreye kynges vncle whiche hadd ben protectour englonde alle non age kyng anone lodgyng arestyd vysecounte bemonde conestable englonde whome accompanyed duc bokyngham many lordes forthwith alle seruauntes comaunded departe fro hym two thyrtty chyeef hem also arestyd sente dyuerse prysons· v vj dayes sayd arest sayd duke deede whoos sowle god haue mercy deyde manere certaynte knowen somme sayde deyde sorowe somme sayde murthred bytwene two fetherbeddes sayd hote spyt putte fundament deyde god knoweth whome noo thynge hydde thenne whanne soo deed leyd open al man myght see hym lordes knyghtes shyres bourgeyses cam sawe hym lye deede wounde ne token coude perseyue deyde maye men marke world duk noble man grete clerke hadde worshipfully ruled royamme kynges behoef neuer coude founde fawte hym enuye gouernours hadde promysed delyuer duchye angeo erldome mayn caused destruction noble man drad hym wolde haue enpesshyd delyuerance sente body saynt albons certayne lyghtes buryed soo syre geruays clyfton hadde charge conueye corp soo buryed saynt albons thabbay fyue persones houshold sent london ther rayned iuged drawen hanged quartred whome name syre rogyer chamberlayne knyght myddelton squyer herbard squyer arthur squyer rychard nedham whiche fyue personnes drawen tour london thurgh c • epe vnto tiburne hanged lete doune quyck thenne strypt hau e ben heded quartred thenne marquys suffolk shewyd ther kynges pardon vnder grete seal soo pardonned remenaunt execucion theyr lyues soo brought ageyne london frely delyuerd thus beganne trouble englond deth noble duke alle comons royamme beganne murmure content pope eugenye deed nycholas fyfth electe pope ¶this nycholas chosen eugenye yet hauyng scisme notwithstondyng gate obedyence cristen royammes electe ••• red pope certayne lordes fraunce englond weere •• nte sauoye pope felyx entreate hym cesse papacye specyall labour bisshop norwyche lord saynt iohans cessyd second yere nycholas sacred sayd felyx made legate fraunce cardynal sauoye resygned hoole papacye nycholas lyued hooly lyf deyd holy man sayd god shewed myracles hym thre twentyeste scysme bytwene eugenye felyx dured sixtene yere cause generalle counseylle basylle deposed eugenye whiche pope indubytate moche obserued kept decree statute counseylle counstance sayd nether rought gyue obedyence general counseyll wherof roo • e grete alteracion amonge wrytars mater pro contra whiche acorde vnto day one partye seyth counseylle aboue pope party sayth nay pope aboue counseyll god blessyd aboue alle thynges gyue sende pee hooly chirche spouse cryst amen nycholas iene comen lowe byrth doctour dyuynyte ac • yf man reedefyed many place broken ruynous dyde make grete walle aboute palays▪ made walle newe aboute rome drede turkes peple wondred ceesynge resygnynge felyx hym consyderyd man lowe byrthe affynyte alle moost part crystē prynces wherof verse publysshed rome maner lux fulsit mundo cessyd felyx nycholao ¶ capitulum 24 yere kyng harry xxvij beynge trewes bytwene fraunce englond knyght englysshe partye named sir fraunceys aragonoys toke towne normandy named fogyers ageynste trewes whiche takynge byganne moche sorowe losse occasion whiche frensshe men gate normandy yere squyer englōd named chalons dyde armes knyght fraunce named syre lowys de buyel fore frensshe kynge ranne frensshe knyght thurgh spere slewe hym felde ¶ yere xxviij parlement holden westmynstre thennes adiourned black frerys london crystemasse westmynstre ageyne yere robert cane man west contre fewe ship toke hole flote shippes comynge oute baye laden salt whiche shippes pruys flaundrys holand zeland brought hem hampton wherfor marchaunt • englond beynge flaundres arestyd brugys ipre place myght delyuerd ner theyr dettys dyscharged till made poyntement paye amendes hurtes tho shippes payd marchauntes staple euery peny lyke wyse marchauntes godes beyng danske also arestyd made grete amendes yere frensshmen mornynge toke trayne thea toune poūt al arche therynne lord fawconbrydge taken prysonner decembre roan taken lost beyng therynne duc • mersete edmund therle shrewsbury whiche appoyntement left pledgys lost normandye came home duryng sayd parlement duck suffolk arestyd sen • e tour ther monethe kynge dyd doo fetche hym oute whiche cause alle comyns englond grete rumour delyueraunce angeo mayn losynge al normandye especial deth good duke gloucetre soo moche somme place men gadred geders made • em capytaynes blewe berd whiche resysted taken iustyce deyd thenne sayd parlement adiourned leycetre theder kynge brought hym duke suffolke whanne comon hows vnderstode oute tour comen theder desyred haue execucion cause delyueraunce normandy ben cause deth duc gloucetre solde gascoyne guyan whiche named gylty duc suffolk chyef lord saye bisshop saslebury danyel many moo ¶ pea comons duck suffolke exyled oute englond fyue yere soo durynge parlement wente norfolke toke shippyng goo oute royame fraū • e yere sayled see shippe warre cal • yd nycholas towr mette ship fonde hym ther whome toke oute brought hym theyr shippe fore mayster capytayns ther examyned atte last iuged deth putte hym cabon chappellayne shryne hym done brought hym douer roode sette hym boot smote heede brought bodye londe vpon sondes sette heede therby done fyrst day maye loo auayleth hym delyueueraunce normandye ye may see rewarded deth duck gloucetre thus beganne sorowe vppon sorowe deth deth ¶ capitulum 26 yere lord thousand four honderd fyfty grete grace iubilee rome greete pardonne soo moche alle place crystendome grete multitude peple resorted theder ¶this yere syre thomas cryell ouerthrowen fermygny many englysshemen slayne taken prysonners ¶this yere grete assemblyng gaderyng geder comons kente greete nombre made insurrection rebellyd ageynste kynge lawes ordeyned hem capytayne callyd iohan cade irysshe man whiche named hym self mortymer cosyn ducke yorke capytayne helde men geder made ordenaunces among brought hem blackheth made bylle petycions kyng hys counseyll shewyd inyuryes oppression poure comyns suffryd alle vnder coloure come aboue grete multitude peple seuē tenth day iuyn kynge many lordes capytayns men warre wente towarde hym blackheth whan capytayne kente vnderstode comyng kynge grete puyssaūce withdrewe hym peple seuenok lytil vyllage ¶ xxviij daye iuyn beynge drawen goon kynge cam armye sette ordre enbataylled blackheth aduys counseyll sente sir vmfrey stafford knyght william stafford squrer two valyaunt capytains certayne peple fight capytayne take hym ¶ brynge hym accessaryes kynge whiche wente seuenock capytayne felauship mett hem fought ayēst hem conclusion slewe bothe many abode wolde yelde hem flee duryng scarmuche fyll grete varyaunce among lordes men comyn peple beyng blackheth ageynst theyr lordes capytayns sayyng playnly wolde goo capytayne kente assyste helpe hym yf myghte haue execucion traytours beyng aboute kyng wherto kyng sayd nay ¶ sayd playnly lord saye tresorer eng lond bisshop salysbury abbot gloucetre danyel andtreuylyan many moo traytours worthy ded wherfor plese lordes meyne also somme kynges hows lord saye arestyd sente toure london thenne kynge herynge tydynges dethe ouerthrowynge staffords withdrewe hym london fro thennes kyllyng worth kyng ne lordes durste truste theyr owne houshold meyne thenne capytayne hadde vyctory vpon staffordes anone toke sire vmfrayes salade brygantyns smyten ful gylt nayles also gylt spore arayed hym lyke lord capytayne resorted al meyne also mo fore blackheth ageyne whome cam tharchebisshop caunterbury duck bokyngham blacheth spake hym sayde fonde hym wytty talkyng requestys departed thyrdde daye iuyll cam entryd london alle peple dyde make cryes kynges name man shold robbe ne take noo mannes good yf payd cam rydynge thurgh cyte grete pryde smote swerde vpon london stone canwyckstrete beyng cyte sente tour haue lord saye soo fette hym brought hym guyldhalle mayer alderman examyned sayd wold ought iuged peres comons kent toke hym force mayer offycers kepte hym toke hym pryeste shryue hym • r myght half shryuen brought hym standard chepe smote hede whoos soule god haue mercy amen thus deyde lord saye tresorer englond sette heede spere bare aboute cyte day myle ende crowmer byheded day byfore none capytayne certayne mayne wente phelyp malpas hows robbyd hym toke awaye moche goode fro thennes wente saynt margrete patyns one gherstys hows robbyd hym also whiche robbyng dyuerce men london theyr neyghbours toke part robbyng peples hertes fyll hym euery thryfty man aferd seruyd lyke wyse ther many man london awayted wolde feyne haue seen comyn robberye whiche god forbede suppose yf hadde robbed myght haue gon f • r er bee withstonde kynge alle lordes royame departed excepte lord scale kepte toure fyfthe day iuyll dyde smyte man heede southwerke nyght mayre london alderman comons cyte concluded dryue awey capytayne hooste sente lord scale tour mathew gogh̄ capytayne normandye wolde nyghte assaylle capytayne kente dyde cam london brydge southwerke er capytayne ony knowlege therof fought kepte brydge kē tysshmen wente harnoys cam brydge shot fought hem gate brydge made london flee slowe many hem endured nyght fro tyll nyne clock morne atte laste brent drawebrydge· many london drouned nyght sutton alderman slayne rogyer heysaunt mathew gogh̄ many ¶ chaunceler englond sente capytayne pardone general another alle meyne thenne departed southwerke euery man home hows ¶ whanne al departed goone ther proclamaciones made kente southsex place man coude take capytayne quyck deede shold haue thousande marck one alysaunder iden squyer kente toke hym gardyn southsex takynge capytayne iohan cade slayne byheded heede sette london brydge anone thenne kynge cam kente dyde iustyces sytte caunterbury enquyre accessaryes chyef cause insurrection ther eyght men iuged deth one day place moo fro thennes kyng wente southsex weste countre lytell byfore slayne bisshop salysbury yere many iuged deth thre twenty hedes stode london bridge attones ¶ capitulum 27 yere thyrtty duck york cam oute march wale therle deuenshyre lord cobham grete puyssaunce reformacion certayne iniuryes wronges also haue iustyce certayne lordes beynge aboute kyng toke felde brentheth besyde dertford kent whiche stronge felde whiche cause kyng alle lordes lande went vnto blackheth grete multitude peple armed ordeyned warre best wyse whanne musteryd blackheth certayne lordes sente hym treate make appoyntement hym whiche bisshop ely bisshop wynchestre therles salysbury warwyk concluded duck somersete sholde hadde ward answere suche artycles duk york sholde putte hym thenne duc york shold breke felde come kyng whiche promysed kyng soo kyng commaunded duke somersete sholde warde thenne duck york brake vp felde cam kynge whanne come contrary promyse fore made duke somersete presente felde awaytyng chyef aboute kyng made duke york ryde fore prysoner thurgh london wolde haue putte hym holde noyse aroos erle marche sonne comynge ten thousande men london warde wherof kynge counseyl fered thenne concluded duc yorke sholde departe wyl aboute tyme byganne greete dyuysyon spruse bytwene grete mayster knyghtes duche ordre whiche lordes countre comons townes rebellyd ageynste lordes made grete warre last callyd kynge pole theyr lord whiche cam receyuyd layde syege castel maryenburgh whiche chyef castel strength alle lond wanne droofe oute mayster danske alle place lond ben lordes many yeres lost theyr seygnorye possession tho landes yere oure lorde thousand four honderd thre fyfty cyte constantynople themperyal cyte grece taken turke emperour slayne innumerable crysten peple destroyed put captyuyte whiche pryse crysten feyth perysshed grece turke enhaunced gretely pryde ¶ yere lord thousand four honderd thre fyfty saynt edwardes day quene margaret delyuerd fayre prynce whiche named edward day iohan norman chosen mayer london day shold take othe westmynstre wente thyder water alle craftes fore tyme mayer alderman al craftes rode horsback whiche neuer vsyd syn tyme haue euer goone water barge ye haue wel vnderstande fore contrarye promyse kyng also conclusion taken bytwene kynge duke york brentheth duke somersete wente ward abode kyng hadde grete rewle made capytayne calays rewlyd kynge royamme wolde wherfore grete l̄ordes royamme also comons plesyd cause duke york erles warwyck salysbury many knyghtes squyers moch̄ peple cam remeue sayd duke somersete fro kynge kynge herynge theyr comyng thought counseylle haue gone westward mete hem hadde hym duke somersete ducke bokyngham erle stafford therle northumberlond lord clyfford many tyme duk york felawship vnderstode kyng departed sayd lordes london anone chaunged wey costed countrey cam saynt albons thre twentyest day maye ther mette kyng whome kynge sente certayne lordes desyred hem kepe pee departe conclusion while treated one syde therle warwik marche men entrid toune fought ageynst kynge partye soo byganne bataylle fyghtyng whiche endured good whyle conclusion duck york obteyned vyctorye iourneye whiche slayne duke somersete therle northumberlond lord clyfford many knyghtes squyers many mo hurt morne brought kynge grete astate london whiche lodged bisshops palays london anon grete parlament whiche parlement duke york made protectour englond therle warwik capytayne calays therle salysbury chauncel • r englond suche personnes rewle fore aboute kynge sette parte myght rewle dyde fore yere deyde pope nycholas fyfthe hym calyxte thyrdde calyxte cat • lane old man whanne chosen continuelly seke wherfor myghte performe zele desyre ageynste turkes conceyued cause lettynge therof age sekenesse ¶this calyxte institued ordeyned feste transfyguracion lord halowed saint sixtes day august cause grete vyctorye hungary ageynste turkes day chosen pope yere lord thousand four honderd fyue fyfty deyde yere thousand four honderd eyght fifty day ordeyned feste transfyguracion halowed yere fyll grete affraye london ageynst lombardes cause bygan cause yong man toke daggar lombard brake wherfor yong man morn sente come fore mayer alderman offence commytted warde ne mayer departed guyldhalle goo hoome dyner chepe yonge men mercerye parte prentyses helde mayer shreues styll chepe wold suffre hym departe vnto tyme theyr felaw whiche commytted warde delyuerd soo force rescowed theyr felawe prysonne done mayer shreuys departed prysoner delyuerd yf put pryson ben ieopardy lyf thus beganne rumour cyte ageynst lombardes euenyng handcrafty peple toune aroos ranne lombardes howses despoylled robbed dyuerse hem wherfor mayer alderman cam honest people toune droof then sente somme stolen newgate yong man rescowed felaws sawe grete rumour affraye robberye ensiewed fyrst meuyng lombard departed went westmynstre sayntuarye ellys • osted hym lyf anone cam doune one oyer determyne doo iustyce alle soo rebellyd cyte ageynste lombardes satte mayer tyme william marowe duke bokyngham many lordes see execucion done comyns cyte secretely made redy dyde arme theyr howses purpose haue rongen comyn belle whiche named bowe belle lette sad men whiche cam knowleche ducke bokyngham lordes incontynent aroos durste noo lenger abyde doubted hoole cyte wolde haue arysen ageynste yet neuertheles two thre cyte iuged deth robbery hanged tyburne anone kynge quene lordes rode couentre withdrewe hem london thyse cause lytel fore duke yorke sente fore grenewych̄ dyscharged protectourshippe lord salysbury chauncelership sente fore preuy seal come couentre almoost deceyued therle warwyck also shold haue ben destroyed yf seen well c ¶capitulum 28 yere taken four grete fysshes bytwene eerethe london one callyd mors maryne second swerd fysshe tweyne whale yere certayne effrayes done north countre bytwene lord egremond therle salysburyes sone sayd lord egremond whome taken condempned grete somme money sayd erle salysbury therfor commysed prison newgate london whanne hadde ben certayne space brake pryson thre prysoners hym escaped wente way also yere therle warwyk wyf wente calays fayr felawship toke possession hys offyce aboute tyme grete reformacion many monasteryes relygyon dyuerse partyes world whiche reformed fyrst institucion continued many place also tyme crafte enpryntyng fyrst founde magounce almayne whiche crafte multyplyed thurgh world many place bookes ben grete chepe grete nombre cause crafte yere grete batayll march bytwene hongary turkye place callyd septegrade innumerable turkes slayn myracle mannes hond honde god smote seint iohn capestrane presente prouoked cristen peple beyng thenne aferd poursiewe turkes infynyte multitude slayn destroyed turkes sayd grete nombre armed men folowed aferd tourne ageyne holy angel ¶this yere prysonners newgate london brake theyr prysonne wente vpon leedes fought ageynst cyte kept gate long atte last toune gate prysonne put fetherys yrons soore punysshed ensample yere also grete erth quaue naples soo moche ther perysshed fourty thousand peple sanke therth item yere six thyrtty saynt osmond sōtyme bisshop salysbury canonysed rome pope calyxt ¶and sixtenthe daye iuyll translated salysbury archebisshop caunterbury many bisshops ¶and august syre pyers de brese • seneschal normandy capitayne depe many capytaynes men warre wente see grete nauye cam downes nyght· morne erly byfore day londed cam sandwyche lande water toke toune ryfled despoilled toke many prysoners lefte toune al bare whiche ryche place moche good therynne ladde hem many ryche prysoners ¶ yere many place fraunce almayne flaundres holond zelond child gadred grete companyes goo pylgremage saynt mychels mount normandye whiche cam fro fer contreyes wherof peple merueylled many supposyd somme wycked spyryte meuid soo doo endured longe cause longe way also lack vytayll wente ¶ yere raynold pecok bisshop chychestre founden heretyke thyrdde day december abiured lambhyth presence archebisshop caunterbury many bisshops doctours lordes temporall bookes brente poulus crosse ye haue herde fore certayne lordes slayne saynt albons wherfore alwey grutche wrath eyre soo slayne ageynst duke yorke erles warwyck salysbury wherfor kyng thaduys counseylle sente london whiche place duke york cam syx twentyest day ianyuer four honderd men lodgeat baynardys castel owne place fyftenth day ianyuer cam therle salysbury fiue honderd men lodged therber owne place thenne cam duke excetre somersete eyght honderd men lay withoute tempelbarre erle northumberlonde lorde egremond lord clyfford fyftene honderd men lodged withoute toun mayer tyme gefferey boleyn kept grete watche comons cyte rode aboute cyte holburn fletestrete fyue thousand men wel armed arayd kepe pee fourtenth day feuerer therle warwyck cam london calays wel beseen worshipfully six honderd men reede iaquettys browdryd ragged staf behynde afore ¶ lodged atte gray freres seuententhe daye marche kynge cam london quene concorde pee made amonge lordes sette pee ¶and oure lady day xxv day marche thousand four honderd eyght fyfty kyng quene lordes wente procession powlus london anone kynge lordes departed ¶in yere grete affray fletestrete bytwene men court men strete whiche affray quenes attorney slayne capitulum 29 also yere erle warwyck coū seyll westmynstre alle kynges houshold meyny gadred geder haue slayne sayd erle helpe god frendes recoueryd barge escaped theyr euyll enterpryse wel coques cam rennynge oute spyttes pestels ageynst hym day roode toward warwyk sone gate hym commyssion wente ouer see calays sone therle salysbury comyng london encoūtrid bloreheth lord audeley moche peple ordeyned haue destressid hauynge knowleche shold mette accōpanyed twoo sonnes sir thomas sir iohan neuyll greete felawship good men soo mette fough • e geders therle salysbury wanne feld lord audley slayn many gentill men chesshyre moche peple hurte therles twoo sonnes hurte goynge homeward afterward taken chestre quenes meyne ¶ calyxte pius pope chosen yere 1458 callyd fore eneas eloquent man poete laureate ambassa • emperours afore tyme ¶ wrote counseylle basylle noble trayttye thauctoryte also canonysed saynt katheryne senys ¶ pope ordeyned grete indulgencys pardonne wolde go warre ageynst turke wrote epystle grete turke exortynge hym become crysten ¶and ende ordeygned passage ageynste turke ankone whiche moche peple drewe oute partyes crystendome whiche peple sente many hoome ageyne cause suffysed anone deyde sayd place ancone yere oure lord thousand foure honderd liiij xiiij day august ¶ yere eyght thyrtty kyng harry duke yorke erles warwyck salysbury sawe gouernaunce royamme stode moost quene counseylle grete prynces londe callyd counseylle sette parte soo sayd thurgh royame tho sayd lordes sholde destroyed vtterly openly shewed atte bloreheth wold haue slayne erle salesburye thēne sauacion theyr lyues also comyn wele royame thought remedye thyse thynges assemblyd gyder moche peple toke felde west countray whiche erle warwyck cam calays many thold soudyours andrew trollop who wysedomes warre moche trusted whanne thus assemblyd made theyr felde kynge sente oute commissyons preuy sealys vnto alle lordes hys royamme come awayte hym theyr mooste defensable wyse soo euery man cam suche wyse kynge strenger hadde moche peple duc york erles warwyck salysbury noted euery lord englond tyme durst dysobeye quene rewlyd peasybly done kynge whiche good symple innocent man thenne whanne kynge comen place duck yorke felawship made theyr felde strengest wyse hadde purposed veryly abyden haue foughten nyght andrew trollop olde soudyours calays greete felawshippe sodaynly departed oute duke hooste wente strayte vnto kynges felde resseyued ioyously knewe entente lordes also maner theyr feld ¶ thenne duck york lordes seynge deceyued toke counseylle shortly nyghte departed felde leuynge behynde mooste parte theyr people kepe felde till morne ¶ thenne duke yorke seconde sonne departed thurgh walys toward irlond leuynge oldest sone therle marche erles warwyck salesbury whiche geder thre foure personnes roode strayte deuenshyre helpe ayde one denbam squyer whiche gate shippe whiche coste enleuen score noblys shippe sailed fro then garneseye refresshyd thennes sayled te calays receyued castel postern er toune knewe hit duk yorke toke shippynge wale sayled ouer irlond well resseyued ¶ capitulum trisesimum thenne kynge harry beynge hooste felde knowynge sodayne departynge morne fonde none felde sayde lordes sente oute haste men folowe poursiewe take hem mette god wold thenne kyng wente ludlowe dispoylled castel toune sent duchesse york child lady bokyngham suster kepte longe forthwith kynge ordeyned duc somersete capytayne calays lordes soo departed fore sayd proclamed rebellys grete traytours ¶ thenne duke somersete toke hym alle tho soudyours departed fro felde made hym redy alle haste goo calays take possession offyce whanne cam fonde erle warwyck therin capytayne therles marche salysbury also thenne londed scale wente guysnes resseyued ¶ fortuned somme tho shippis cam ouer hym came calays hauen theyr free wylle shipmen ought fauoure erle warwyck duke somersete whiche shippes taken dyuerse men· ienyn fynkhyll iohan felaw ka • lles purser whiche byheded sone calays ¶and dayly cam men ouer see thyse lordes calays byganne wexe strenger strenger· borowed moche good good staple syde duc somersete beyng guysnesgate people hym whiche cam oute scarmusshed calays calays whiche endured many dayes duryng thus dayly scarmuchynge moche people dayly cam ouer vnto thyse lordes thenne tyme thaduys counseylle lordes calays sente ouer mayster denham grete felawship sandwyche whiche toke toune therynne lord ryuers lord scale sonne toke many shippes hauen brought hem alle calays whiche shippes many maronners theyr free wylle cam calays serue erle warwyck ¶ erle warwyk thaduys lordes toke alle shippis mannyd wel sayled self irlond speke duke yorke take aduys sholde entre englond ageyne whanne hadde ben done erandes retourned ageyne toward calays brought hym moder countesse salysbury comyng west countraye vpon see duk excetre admyral englond beyng grace dieu accompanyed many shippes warre met therle warwyck flote fought substaunce peple beynge duke excetre ought better wyll fauour therle warwyck hym soo departed cam calays saefte blessyd god thenne kynges counseylle seynge lordes goten shippes sandwiche taken lord ryuers sonne ordeyned garnyson sandwiche abyde kepe toune made one mountford capytayne toune noo man ne vytaylle ne marchaunt sholde goo flaundres shold goo calays thenne calays seynge made oute mayster denham many goo sandwiche soo dyde assaylled toune water lande gate brought mountford theyr capytayne ouer see rysebank smote heede yet dayly men cam ouer oute partyes englond ¶ capitulum trisesimum primum· sayd erles marche warwyk salysbury cam ouer see douer moche peple landed whome al coūtray drewe cam london armed late lordes kynges counseylle knowe theyr trouth also theyr entente assemblyd told entended harme vnto kynges personne sauf wold putte fro hym suche persones aboute hym ¶and soo departed fro london grete puyssaunce toward norhampton kynge accompanyed many lordes made stronge felde withoute toun partyes mette foughten grete bataylle· batayll slayne duck bokyngham therle shrowesbury vysecounte beamond lorde egremond many knyghtes squyers also kyng hym self taken felde afterward brought london anone afterward parlament westmynstre duryng whiche parlament duck york cam onte irlond therle rutland rydyng grete felawship palays westmestre toke kynges palays ¶ cam parlement chambre toke kynges place claymed croune propre enherytaunce ryght cast forth wrytynge tytle also ryghtful eyer wherfore moche doo conclusion appoynted concluded kynge harry sholde regne kyng durynge naturel lyf moche ben long kyng possessyd deth duke yorke shold kynge eyre kynges hym forthwith shold proclamed eyr apparaunt sholde also protectour regence englonde durynge kynges lyf many thynges ordeyned parlament kyng harry duryng lyf wente appoyntement ony artycle concluded sayd parlement shold deposed duke sholde take crowne kyng whiche thynges enacted thauctorite sayd parlament whiche parlament comons royamme beyng assemblyd comon hows comenynge treatyng vpon tytle sayd duc yorke sodaynly fyll downe crowne whiche henge thenne myddes sayd hows whiche fraytour thabbay westmynstre whiche taken prodyge token regne kyng harry ended also crowne whiche stode byest tour stepel castel douer fyll doun yere ¶ capitulum 32 thenne moche quene prynce northe absented kyng wolde obeye suche thynges concluded parlement hit ordeyned duck york protectour shold go norward brynge quene subdue suche wold obeye whome wente erle salysbury syre thomas neuylle sonne moche peple wakefelde crystemasse weke alle ouerthrowen slayn lordes quenes partye· wete duk york slayn therle rutland syre thomas neuyll many moo therle salysbury taken lyue iohan harow london capytayne foote men hanson hulle brought pountfret byheded theyr hedes sente yorke sette vpon yates thus noble prynce slayne duke yorke whoos sowle alle crysten sowles god haue mercy amen tyme therle marche beyng shrewesbury heeryng deth fader desyred assistence ayde toune auenge faders • th thennes wente walys candelmasse batayl mortemers crosse ageynst therles penbroke wylshyre erle marche vyctorye thenne quene lordes north distressyd slayne duck yorke felauship came southward grete multitude puyssance peple come kynge defete suche conclusion ben taken byfore parlement ageynste whoos comynge duke norfolke erle warwycke moche peple ordenaunce wente vnto saynt albons ladde kyng harry hem encountryd geder suche wyse foughte duke norfolke therle warwyk theyr partye fledde loste iourneye kynge harry taken wente quene prynce sonne whiche tho goten felde ¶ thenne quene partye beynge theyr aboue sente anone london whiche asshwednesday fyrste daye lente vytaylle whiche mayer ordeyned thaduys alderman certayne carte laden vytaylle shold sente saynt albons whanne tho carte cam crepylgate comons cyte kepte gate toke vytaylles carte wold suffre passe ¶ thenne ther certayne alderman comeners appoynted goo barnet speke quenes coūseylle entrete northern men shold sente home ageyne theyr countraye ageyne cyte london dredde soore robbed despoylled yf come thus duryng thys trayttye tydynges cam erle warwyk mett therle marche cotteswold comyng oute wale many wallshmen bothe comyng londonward anone tydynges knowen trayttye broken kyng quene prynce lordes hem departed saynt albons northward alle theyr peple yet er departed byheded lord boneyle syr thomas cryel whiche taken iourneye done shroftewysday thenne duchesse yorke beyng london herynge losse felde saynt albons sente ouer see twoo yonge sonnes george rychard whiche wente vtrecht phelyp malpas ryche marchaūt london thomas vaghan squyer mayster wylliam hatteclyf many feryng comyng quene london toke shippe andwerp haue goone zeland coost taken one colompne frensshman shippe warre toke hem prysoners brought hem fraunce payd grete good theyr raunsonne ther moche good rychesse shippe ¶ capitulum trisesimum tercium thenne whanne erle marche therle warwyk hadde mette geder cottiswold incontynent concluded go london sente worde anone mayer cyte sholde come anone cyte gladde theyr comynge hopynge relyeuyd soo cam london whanne comen hadde spoken lordes astates thenne beyng concluded moche kynge harry gone northward forfayted crowne ought deposed acordyng vnto actes made passed last parlement soo thaduys lordes spirituel temporel thenne beynge ot london· erle marche edward grace god oldest sone rychard duke yorke ryghtful heyr next enherytour fader fourth day marche yere oure lorde lix toke possession royamme englond westmynstre grete halle chirche abbay offryd kynge berynge septre royall alle lordes bothe spirituel temporell dyde hommage obeyssaunce theyr souerayne lyege lawfull lord kynge forthwith proclamed thurgh cyte kyng edward fourthe name anone kyng roode ryall astate norward lordes subdue subgettis tyme beyng north tauenge faders deth palmsonday hadde grete bataylle northe countrey place callyd towton fer fro yorke helpe god gate felde vyctorye· slayne aduersaryes xxx thousand men moo sayd men whiche bataylle slayne erle northumberlond lord clyfford syr iohan n • uyll erle westmerlandes brother andrewe trollop many knyghtes squyers ¶ thenne kynge harry ben kynge beynge quene prynce yorke heerynge losse feld soo moche peple slayn ouerthrowen anone forthwith departed al thre duc somersete lord roos toward scotland next daye kynge edward armye entryd yorke proclamed kyng obeyed ought mayer alderman comyns sworne lyege men whanne hadde taryed north alle countrey tourned retorned southwarde leuynge erle warwyck tho partyes kepe gouerne countrey mydsomer yere oure lord god thousande four honderd syxty fyrste yere regne crowned westmynstre enoynted kynge englond hauynge hoole possession hoole royamme whome praye god saue kepe sende hym thaccomplysshement remenaunt rightfull enherytaunce yonde see may regne playsyre almyghty god herthe sowle honoure worshippe presente lyf wele prouffyte alle subgettis may veray fynal pee al crysten royames infydeles myscreauntes may withstanden destroyed feyth enhaunced whiche thyse dayes sore mynuysshed puyssaunce turkes hethen men presente short lyf maye come euerlastyng lyf blysshe heuen amen make ende lytel werke nygh fynde forme werk fore made ranulph monk chestre ther fawte beseche shal rede correcte yf coude haue founden moo storyes wold haue sette hit moo substaunce fynde knowe haue shortly sette hem book thentente such̄ thynges haue ben done syth deth ende sayd boke polycronycon shold remembraunce putte oblyuyon ne forgetynge prayenge shall see symple werke pardone symple rude wrytynge ¶ ended second day iuyll xxij yere regne kynge edwardthe fourth incarnacion oure lord thousand four honderd foure score tweyne fynysshed per caxton
